A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Theres such a thing as predjudice in this army and racist hatred. That damn wop that lousy Jew or that dirty German - We're all fighting for one thing or a one country so the quicker we learn to cooperate the better off we'll be. United we stand seperate we fall
S64.Q97.Full: Theres such a thing as predjudice in this army and racist hatred. That damn wop that lousy Jew or that dirty German - We're all fighting for one thing or a one country so the quicker we learn to cooperate the better off we'll be. United we stand seperate we fall

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I'll like to go into combat and fight. that all I really want.
S64.Q97.Full: I'll like to go into combat and fight. that all I really want.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I think the army would be a lot better if the officers had more training & so much time wasn't wasted just hanging around. I think just hanging around doing nothing brings about most of the discontentment in the army & I also think most of us soldiers feel that the war is just another way of throwing away money.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the army would be a lot better if the officers had more training & so much time wasn't wasted just hanging around. I think just hanging around doing nothing brings about most of the discontentment in the army & I also think most of us soldiers feel that the war is just another way of throwing away money.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I think some outfits get more breaks than other boys do. and I don't see any reason for it. I think all outfits should get a lot of breaks while in the States because when they go overseas, they all have it pretty tough.
S64.Q97.Full: I think some outfits get more breaks than other boys do. and I don't see any reason for it. I think all outfits should get a lot of breaks while in the States because when they go overseas, they all have it pretty tough.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: In a quarter master outfit I feel like we should get more experience at driving, I have been in the army over 7 months an have only drove a truck about 75 miles, an if I am going to be a good truck driver I need more experience.
S64.Q97.Full: In a quarter master outfit I feel like we should get more experience at driving, I have been in the army over 7 months an have only drove a truck about 75 miles, an if I am going to be a good truck driver I need more experience.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I have been in the army nine months and have not had a furlough but sone of the Sodiers has had then and has ben in the army less then nine months. I think it should go to the one who has ben in the Service the logenst.
S64.Q97.Full: I have been in the army nine months and have not had a furlough but sone of the Sodiers has had then and has ben in the army less then nine months. I think it should go to the one who has ben in the Service the logenst.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I think that when a man is inducted into the Army he should be more clearly studied to see in what line of work he is going to be more capable fit. And also to ask him his opinion on what type of work and outfit he would like to do and to be in. That way a lot more of the men would be far more interested in their work or duty in the Armed forces.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that when a man is inducted into the Army he should be more clearly studied to see in what line of work he is going to be more capable fit. And also to ask him his opinion on what type of work and outfit he would like to do and to be in. That way a lot more of the men would be far more interested in their work or duty in the Armed forces.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: It takes too long to relieve a man when he is on guard. The Marine guard is much more efficient in this respect as each man goes to his own post without being marched around the whole regiment by a corporal of the guard. Some of our N.C.O. are kids who never did a good days work in their lives or had men under them. So they seem to
S64.Q97.C_1: think they are God's chosen children. The biggest part of our soldiers are P.F.C's [private first class] and Pvt's [privates] not our corporals.
S64.Q97.Full: It takes too long to relieve a man when he is on guard. The Marine guard is much more efficient in this respect as each man goes to his own post without being marched around the whole regiment by a corporal of the guard. Some of our N.C.O. are kids who never did a good days work in their lives or had men under them. So they seem to think they are God's chosen children. The biggest part of our soldiers are P.F.C's [private first class] and Pvt's [privates] not our corporals.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: There could be better arrangements made as for time off when not on duty and see no reason why one company if a regiment can give early passes when another will not when they are [insertion] [/insertion] in the same regiment. All in all army life could be a lot worse than it is.
S64.Q97.Full: There could be better arrangements made as for time off when not on duty and see no reason why one company if a regiment can give early passes when another will not when they are [insertion] [/insertion] in the same regiment. All in all army life could be a lot worse than it is.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: This Army is run by Officers who, as long as they get passes and privileges, some give a darn about whether the enlisted man gets the same treatment or not! There is entirely too much politics in the Army and the men should be treated as men, instead of puppets which the Officers can do with as they please. There is also entirely too much favoritism shown to a few men.
S64.Q97.C_1: We are fighting this war because we love our freedom, and our "equal rights" among men, but since I am in the army, I have been bitterly disallusioned [disillusioned] about the way that things are run, and the way the men are treated. [paragraph] I believe in discipline, but I don't believe in any officers making wise remarks, and "slurs" at the enlisted men. We should have equal rights to express ourselves and our opinions.
S64.Q97.Full: This Army is run by Officers who, as long as they get passes and privileges, some give a darn about whether the enlisted man gets the same treatment or not! There is entirely too much politics in the Army and the men should be treated as men, instead of puppets which the Officers can do with as they please. There is also entirely too much favoritism shown to a few men. We are fighting this war because we love our freedom, and our "equal rights" among men, but since I am in the army, I have been bitterly disallusioned [disillusioned] about the way that things are run, and the way the men are treated. [paragraph] I believe in discipline, but I don't believe in any officers making wise remarks, and "slurs" at the enlisted men. We should have equal rights to express ourselves and our opinions.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: The Private should get more than $50 a month because they need as much money as a corporal. And a man shouldn't be changed from his buddies after he's been with them 8 or 9 months in the army without a good reason.
S64.Q97.Full: The Private should get more than $50 a month because they need as much money as a corporal. And a man shouldn't be changed from his buddies after he's been with them 8 or 9 months in the army without a good reason.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think that this outfit that we are in don't get enough training of the kind they should. As a truck outfit we should know trucks, especially the type we will have in combat, inside out. What very little time we do get with the trucks is very insufficient and we always get a different one. A truck is like a brother you have to know it well and let it know you. I feel that my being in the service is making ...
S64.Q97.C_1: life for me and my wife very hard. And I know it is going to be very hard for us to get on our feet again after the war. I don't feel that I should have been drafted when I was, as a married man with a child, especially when I know for a fact that there were still many single fellows and childless married men left in our little city.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that this outfit that we are in don't get enough training of the kind they should. As a truck outfit we should know trucks, especially the type we will have in combat, inside out. What very little time we do get with the trucks is very insufficient and we always get a different one. A truck is like a brother you have to know it well and let it know you. I feel that my being in the service is making ... life for me and my wife very hard. And I know it is going to be very hard for us to get on our feet again after the war. I don't feel that I should have been drafted when I was, as a married man with a child, especially when I know for a fact that there were still many single fellows and childless married men left in our little city.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: We are a Quartermaster Regiment but sometimes we don't drive a truck for two weeks at a time, although most of us drove in civilian life, the army trucks are quite different and it takes practice on any job to do it well. We need more trucking and less drilling.
S64.Q97.Full: We are a Quartermaster Regiment but sometimes we don't drive a truck for two weeks at a time, although most of us drove in civilian life, the army trucks are quite different and it takes practice on any job to do it well. We need more trucking and less drilling.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Officers should have a full basic training before going to O.C.S. [paragraph] A truck outfit should have truck drivers as personell also enough men able to teach others how to repair trucks & drive them. A truck outfit should have gas to run the trucks with. How far does 8 truck go with 120 men.
S64.Q97.C_1: The outfit is not trained for combat driving. Our's has been more for infantry. There is too much class distinction between West & South against the North East States. In getting ratings its not what you know but who you know. Medical care is not what it should be. Where are all the Christian doctors? Religious services are not always alowed to be attended.
S64.Q97.Full: Officers should have a full basic training before going to O.C.S. [paragraph] A truck outfit should have truck drivers as personell also enough men able to teach others how to repair trucks & drive them. A truck outfit should have gas to run the trucks with. How far does 8 truck go with 120 men. The outfit is not trained for combat driving. Our's has been more for infantry. There is too much class distinction between West & South against the North East States. In getting ratings its not what you know but who you know. Medical care is not what it should be. Where are all the Christian doctors? Religious services are not always alowed to be attended.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think our regiment is best suited for the Alcan Highway that is the best training we have had. When this regiment was first activated it was scheduled to go there and we had some good training but since then, it has just been infantry training, which I can't see for a truck regiment. I enlisted in the Air Corps as a mechanic but since I have been in the Army I haven't touched a wrench. I don't think it is fair the way some of the men
S64.Q97.C_1: including myself get the bad breaks just because I said I had driven a truck in Civilian life they put me in a truck regiment the reason that I enlisted and several men in this regiment was to get in the Air Corps ground crew but when we said we had been truck drivers this is where we were sent the government asked for men to be mechanics in the Air Corps but put them where they want then I dont think it is giving the men a fair shake I know I wouldn't enlist again and the rest of the men in this regiment feel the same I don't think that is a very good attitude for the men to take towards the government but there is no other way to look at it if the government is going to do such under handed tricks as soon as you sign your name and take the oath they do as they please with you.
S64.Q97.Full: I think our regiment is best suited for the Alcan Highway that is the best training we have had. When this regiment was first activated it was scheduled to go there and we had some good training but since then, it has just been infantry training, which I can't see for a truck regiment. I enlisted in the Air Corps as a mechanic but since I have been in the Army I haven't touched a wrench. I don't think it is fair the way some of the men including myself get the bad breaks just because I said I had driven a truck in Civilian life they put me in a truck regiment the reason that I enlisted and several men in this regiment was to get in the Air Corps ground crew but when we said we had been truck drivers this is where we were sent the government asked for men to be mechanics in the Air Corps but put them where they want then I dont think it is giving the men a fair shake I know I wouldn't enlist again and the rest of the men in this regiment feel the same I don't think that is a very good attitude for the men to take towards the government but there is no other way to look at it if the government is going to do such under handed tricks as soon as you sign your name and take the oath they do as they please with you.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: We have much more close order drill than convoy driving that we are supposed to do as our job and I think we could use more driving so that the jet we have to do could be done better than we could do at present
S64.Q97.Full: We have much more close order drill than convoy driving that we are supposed to do as our job and I think we could use more driving so that the jet we have to do could be done better than we could do at present

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I think the Army should give the officers more training and more [unclear] rigorous [/unclear] . Also take them from ranks of enlisted men who have had one year or more of service. Officers are incompetent, not as a whole but a large part. More opportunities for transfer into an outfit that you personally prefer, or give an exam to determine if a man is capable in that branch of the service.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the Army should give the officers more training and more [unclear] rigorous [/unclear] . Also take them from ranks of enlisted men who have had one year or more of service. Officers are incompetent, not as a whole but a large part. More opportunities for transfer into an outfit that you personally prefer, or give an exam to determine if a man is capable in that branch of the service.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: When I was inducted my Mother and Father were depending on me for support with my allotment it is not enough for them to get along on, with food prices up and taxes so high.
S64.Q97.Full: When I was inducted my Mother and Father were depending on me for support with my allotment it is not enough for them to get along on, with food prices up and taxes so high.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Officers & non-coms (non-commissioned officers) are very poorly chosen - too little consideration given their mental equipment & descending [condescending] of character & feelings.
S64.Q97.Full: Officers & non-coms (non-commissioned officers) are very poorly chosen - too little consideration given their mental equipment & descending [condescending] of character & feelings.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: [unclear] [/unclear]
S64.Q97.C_1: forward 2 month for my furlough, and just 2 weeks before I was to get my furlough, they were cut out, that's not the first time it happened either. I'm still looking forward to a furlough (I hope). [paragraph] I hope this Q.M. outfit gets more driving than walking , we call ourselves the walking Quarter masters.
S64.Q97.Full: [unclear] [/unclear]  forward 2 month for my furlough, and just 2 weeks before I was to get my furlough, they were cut out, that's not the first time it happened either. I'm still looking forward to a furlough (I hope). [paragraph] I hope this Q.M. outfit gets more driving than walking , we call ourselves the walking Quarter masters.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: In my personal opinion, I don't think the Army knows what they want to do with all the men they are drafting. In my case, our regiment has been leaving the states for duty since last January. We are still here. If we're not going to work or fight, let's go home and save money for the government. We are only wasting it here. That's all!
S64.Q97.Full: In my personal opinion, I don't think the Army knows what they want to do with all the men they are drafting. In my case, our regiment has been leaving the states for duty since last January. We are still here. If we're not going to work or fight, let's go home and save money for the government. We are only wasting it here. That's all!

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I do honestly think that the men could be segregated according to personality, intelligence and character etc. to a better degree than at present, to allow those men who have the ability to learn faster to receive better & more technical training. It builds morale as well as giving the individual a feeling of self confidence and an outlook of doing all that is
S64.Q97.C_1: possible for the war effort. There is also a lot of foolish red tape to the present administration (in the army) that could be done away with. If we want to win this war we must do whatever we undertake, fast, with no faltering due to present complications which invariably confront the every move.
S64.Q97.Full: I do honestly think that the men could be segregated according to personality, intelligence and character etc. to a better degree than at present, to allow those men who have the ability to learn faster to receive better & more technical training. It builds morale as well as giving the individual a feeling of self confidence and an outlook of doing all that is possible for the war effort. There is also a lot of foolish red tape to the present administration (in the army) that could be done away with. If we want to win this war we must do whatever we undertake, fast, with no faltering due to present complications which invariably confront the every move.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I could do better out of the army than in because of raising food for the army and in the way of food staples to keep the country with a little more things. This way the folks are selling out what I need to do at home.
S64.Q97.Full: I could do better out of the army than in because of raising food for the army and in the way of food staples to keep the country with a little more things. This way the folks are selling out what I need to do at home.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: There is to much flexibility in rules and regulations, no two officers see the rules the same way and therefore one outfit will benefit with little priveledges [priveleges] and the other outfit will be denied the same ones. This causes a drop in moral [morale] of some soldiers when they are stationed in the same post. A little more care should be taken in the selection of men for the kitchen [underline] some [/underline] are competent but do not know how to handle many. Others know how to handle men but do no know how to cook or do
S64.Q97.C_1: cover how they cook as they can eat whatever they want and you eat what they did not feel like making or did not care to make.
S64.Q97.Full: There is to much flexibility in rules and regulations, no two officers see the rules the same way and therefore one outfit will benefit with little priveledges [priveleges] and the other outfit will be denied the same ones. This causes a drop in moral [morale] of some soldiers when they are stationed in the same post. A little more care should be taken in the selection of men for the kitchen [underline] some [/underline] are competent but do not know how to handle many. Others know how to handle men but do no know how to cook or do  cover how they cook as they can eat whatever they want and you eat what they did not feel like making or did not care to make.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Have applied for O.C.S. several months ago with a group of other men and none of us have heard anything yet. We passed both mental and physical and all of the men would make good officers. I don't believe the Regiment cares whether we leave or not. They should try to help us to go.
S64.Q97.Full: Have applied for O.C.S. several months ago with a group of other men and none of us have heard anything yet. We passed both mental and physical and all of the men would make good officers. I don't believe the Regiment cares whether we leave or not. They should try to help us to go.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: As a whole I think that officers should be returned from overseas and train men on this side.
S64.Q97.Full: As a whole I think that officers should be returned from overseas and train men on this side.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I would like the Quartermaster Corp. better than any other unit, if it were operated right. Our truck training is very little, not enough driving, schooling, etc; and to much laying around, or drilling.
S64.Q97.Full: I would like the Quartermaster Corp. better than any other unit, if it were operated right. Our truck training is very little, not enough driving, schooling, etc; and to much laying around, or drilling.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I want to say I am proud to be in the army and doing my part. If only I was in a job where I would take more interest in my work. I wanted to get in the airforce ground crew but instead they put me in Q.M. Corps as a Truck Driver. Yes I have driven trucks for 3 years but after all I don't want to be a truck driver.
S64.Q97.C_1: all my life. I think a little bit more should be done to help a man to get placed in a job he would like. That is the chief morale builder. If you like your work you like the army, you don't mind fighting. But otherwise a man gets disgusted. Its just like being in prison. (paragraph) II. I think the food could be better. I've seen some slop I would like to make those bigshots in Washington eat. No fit for pigs. [deletion] [/deletion] If I was on the other side I would understand but I am still in the States, the land of plentiful. Imagine 12 men getting only 2 qts (quarts) of milk at breakfast. It's bad enough the meat is bad but that can be understood. But is there a shortage of cows. I could write a book on gripes I have. I am not saying the whole army is this way. Maybe I have just fallen into the wrong outfit. Someday I hope to write a book then I can satisfy myself even if anyone else,
S64.Q97.Full: I want to say I am proud to be in the army and doing my part. If only I was in a job where I would take more interest in my work. I wanted to get in the airforce ground crew but instead they put me in Q.M. Corps as a Truck Driver. Yes I have driven trucks for 3 years but after all I don't want to be a truck driver. all my life. I think a little bit more should be done to help a man to get placed in a job he would like. That is the chief morale builder. If you like your work you like the army, you don't mind fighting. But otherwise a man gets disgusted. Its just like being in prison. (paragraph) II. I think the food could be better. I've seen some slop I would like to make those bigshots in Washington eat. No fit for pigs. [deletion] [/deletion] If I was on the other side I would understand but I am still in the States, the land of plentiful. Imagine 12 men getting only 2 qts (quarts) of milk at breakfast. It's bad enough the meat is bad but that can be understood. But is there a shortage of cows. I could write a book on gripes I have. I am not saying the whole army is this way. Maybe I have just fallen into the wrong outfit. Someday I hope to write a book then I can satisfy myself even if anyone else,

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I should think every soldier should have a furlough before entering into combat, I have [unclear] five? [/unclear] children [.] I have only seen [unclear] [/unclear] my eight months about 30 hours.
S64.Q97.Full: I should think every soldier should have a furlough before entering into combat, I have [unclear] five? [/unclear] children [.] I have only seen [unclear] [/unclear] my eight months about 30 hours.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Lets get the war over but quick if possible so we can go home
S64.Q97.Full: Lets get the war over but quick if possible so we can go home

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: To [Too] much close order drilling. Not enough convoy driving.
S64.Q97.Full: To [Too] much close order drilling. Not enough convoy driving.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Mother now has to depend on my sister and sister's husband and that is cause for a great deal of unpleasantness in the home. It takes as much for a mother and brother to live on as a wife and son but still the army does not seem to think so. The army does not try to place skilled men where they would do the most good.
S64.Q97.Full: Mother now has to depend on my sister and sister's husband and that is cause for a great deal of unpleasantness in the home. It takes as much for a mother and brother to live on as a wife and son but still the army does not seem to think so. The army does not try to place skilled men where they would do the most good.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: Why dont they let a person get a transfer when he wants to go over seas. I have tried and was refused. They should give more 3 day passes. They should watch the way the mess hall is ran.
S64.Q97.Full: Why dont they let a person get a transfer when he wants to go over seas. I have tried and was refused. They should give more 3 day passes. They should watch the way the mess hall is ran.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: The neat of my company all but 23 of us made a $10 day paycheck and I don't think it is fair that they should not give the rest of us a 10 day freeleave of absence , we are doubting the whole damn thing they are fuckers and are more entitled to a free leave. The officers could treat us a bit better and the food could be better
S64.Q97.Full: The neat of my company all but 23 of us made a $10 day paycheck and I don't think it is fair that they should not give the rest of us a 10 day freeleave of absence , we are doubting the whole damn thing they are fuckers and are more entitled to a free leave. The officers could treat us a bit better and the food could be better

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I can't understand why there is so much talk of not drafting fathers. I had one child and was expecting another when drafted. May wife is unable to pay rent, lights, gas, groceries, and doctor bills out of $72.00 a month. Also, as I understand it, the Oil Industry is considered an essential industry, yet, there is hardly any experienced men left in the oil
S64.Q97.C_1: fields. [paragraph] The general consensus of opinion is that the draft boards should be investigated. I for one, did not come into the Army because I wanted to, and neither am I staying in because I want to. [paragraph] It would [insertion] almost [/insertion] take a dishonorable discharge to get out of the Army. My heart is not in it. I am more concerned with the conditions of my family, than this we are going thru now.
S64.Q97.Full: I can't understand why there is so much talk of not drafting fathers. I had one child and was expecting another when drafted. May wife is unable to pay rent, lights, gas, groceries, and doctor bills out of $72.00 a month. Also, as I understand it, the Oil Industry is considered an essential industry, yet, there is hardly any experienced men left in the oil fields. [paragraph] The general consensus of opinion is that the draft boards should be investigated. I for one, did not come into the Army because I wanted to, and neither am I staying in because I want to. [paragraph] It would [insertion] almost [/insertion] take a dishonorable discharge to get out of the Army. My heart is not in it. I am more concerned with the conditions of my family, than this we are going thru now.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Well the remarks I have to say is that I volunteered for the Navy and got stuck into the Army because[unclear] [/unclear] was full. I feel that I would be better in the Navy than the Army any time because that's the kind of life I'd love to have. I wish I could get transferred into the Navy or the Army Air Corps ground crew if there is no way. I'd like to have it[unclear] [/unclear]
S64.Q97.Full: Well the remarks I have to say is that I volunteered for the Navy and got stuck into the Army because[unclear] [/unclear] was full. I feel that I would be better in the Navy than the Army any time because that's the kind of life I'd love to have. I wish I could get transferred into the Navy or the Army Air Corps ground crew if there is no way. I'd like to have it[unclear] [/unclear]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: The Army could be better if they give us the right trainning (training) and the right food "the food is the same all the time". (paragraph) They shouldn't be selling Bonds to the men in uniform but they make you take a bond. They talk you into it to buy bonds.
S64.Q97.C_1: Well the branch I got now is known of doing everything and the thing we do we shouldn't be doing it.
S64.Q97.Full: The Army could be better if they give us the right trainning (training) and the right food "the food is the same all the time". (paragraph) They shouldn't be selling Bonds to the men in uniform but they make you take a bond. They talk you into it to buy bonds. Well the branch I got now is known of doing everything and the thing we do we shouldn't be doing it.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: There is really only one thing in my outfit that gets me down some times, is when they tell you something they are going to do and don't carry through with it. As far as promotions go I think that most of them are favorites instead of what a man knows.
S64.Q97.Full: There is really only one thing in my outfit that gets me down some times, is when they tell you something they are going to do and don't carry through with it. As far as promotions go I think that most of them are favorites instead of what a man knows.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: When a fellow gets [unclear] Giced [/unclear] they should not take his pass away from him but but let him straiten out the think he got [unclear] Geds [/unclear] for and then give him his Pass. and let him be on his way.
S64.Q97.Full: When a fellow gets [unclear] Giced [/unclear] they should not take his pass away from him but but let him straiten out the think he got [unclear] Geds [/unclear] for and then give him his Pass. and let him be on his way.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I think that the Chinese should be given more guns and supplies. I think India should be given her independence. China would be a logical place to open a front to keep the Japs closer to home and the Chinese given a little more say as regards to the war in the east.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that the Chinese should be given more guns and supplies. I think India should be given her independence. China would be a logical place to open a front to keep the Japs closer to home and the Chinese given a little more say as regards to the war in the east.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: As long as an EM [insertion] at camp [/insertion] is within a reasonable distance from his home he should be allowed to go home as often as possible because eventually he will be transferred to a place where it will be impossible to go home for a long period.
S64.Q97.Full: As long as an EM [insertion] at camp [/insertion] is within a reasonable distance from his home he should be allowed to go home as often as possible because eventually he will be transferred to a place where it will be impossible to go home for a long period.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Well about the Co. I am in the officer do not treat the men right and for the least little thing they do the confined them for about 2 or three week and take all their cloths away. In our outfit if you don't fit with the sargent you get all the shit detail so I don't blame the fellows for going a.w.o.l. if they keep getting picked on
S64.Q97.Full: Well about the Co. I am in the officer do not treat the men right and for the least little thing they do the confined them for about 2 or three week and take all their cloths away. In our outfit if you don't fit with the sargent you get all the shit detail so I don't blame the fellows for going a.w.o.l. if they keep getting picked on

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: One of my main complaints about the Army has been the inefficiency af the non-coms[non commissioned officers] during my basic training. [deletion] [/deletion] Take some af their Field Manuals away and they would be lost.
S64.Q97.Full: One of my main complaints about the Army has been the inefficiency af the non-coms[non commissioned officers] during my basic training. [deletion] [/deletion] Take some af their Field Manuals away and they would be lost.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Why doesn't the army get rid of some of these imitations of officers and get some real men to fill their shoes. Why these officers that are sent out as Cadre Officers don't know as much about the army and its duties than some of the lowest cadre Non. Coms. At least make soldiers out of them before making them officers. Give them longer time at school but for gosh sakes
S64.Q97.C_1: don't disgrace the army by sending them out to train men. Why is it at some camps the food as a whole is of better quality and also in greater abundance then others? If the Army wants specialized men so bad why don't they place the skilled men that are drafted or volunteered in these respective jobs? I volunteered on that basis knowing that I would be culled in due time, only to be put in an entirely different type of outfit. Why don't they make use of those classification centers?
S64.Q97.Full: Why doesn't the army get rid of some of these imitations of officers and get some real men to fill their shoes. Why these officers that are sent out as Cadre Officers don't know as much about the army and its duties than some of the lowest cadre Non. Coms. At least make soldiers out of them before making them officers. Give them longer time at school but for gosh sakes  don't disgrace the army by sending them out to train men. Why is it at some camps the food as a whole is of better quality and also in greater abundance then others? If the Army wants specialized men so bad why don't they place the skilled men that are drafted or volunteered in these respective jobs? I volunteered on that basis knowing that I would be culled in due time, only to be put in an entirely different type of outfit. Why don't they make use of those classification centers?

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think the jobs that we were given in the army in some cases could have been a lot better if we were put in something which we are skilled at. Also I don't see why a whole platoon of men should be confined because one man went A.W.O.L.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the jobs that we were given in the army in some cases could have been a lot better if we were put in something which we are skilled at. Also I don't see why a whole platoon of men should be confined because one man went A.W.O.L.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Well, I don't mind the Army life at all in that I have to work hard. But what gets me discourage is some of the non coms or officers who think they're just about perfect. After all, it wasn't my idea to get into this Army and I know that I have plenty to learn. So if some of these boys would lay off pulling
S64.Q97.C_1: their rank I think I'd get along much better. It gets me some to be ordered around sometimes as though I was just a slave of some sort, and to get barked at when I'm working as hard as I can. Another thing that gets me is when a non-com gets hell for something he takes it out on his men by either threating them with loss of passes or other privilege. After all if he gets gigged on something he does wrong I don't see where he has the right to harp on his men. This only applies to a certain non-coms in my outfit especially as I know other fellows who are swell fellows. On the whole though I get along fairly well in the Army although I will say that I hope I don't have to stay in too long.
S64.Q97.Full: Well, I don't mind the Army life at all in that I have to work hard. But what gets me discourage is some of the non coms or officers who think they're just about perfect. After all, it wasn't my idea to get into this Army and I know that I have plenty to learn. So if some of these boys would lay off pulling their rank I think I'd get along much better. It gets me some to be ordered around sometimes as though I was just a slave of some sort, and to get barked at when I'm working as hard as I can. Another thing that gets me is when a non-com gets hell for something he takes it out on his men by either threating them with loss of passes or other privilege. After all if he gets gigged on something he does wrong I don't see where he has the right to harp on his men. This only applies to a certain non-coms in my outfit especially as I know other fellows who are swell fellows. On the whole though I get along fairly well in the Army although I will say that I hope I don't have to stay in too long.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Sir [paragraph] I have mother and only one [underline] who she [/underline] could depend on me, which I was home. I was staying with her work, and take care of her. and takes care all the bills and all the liavig conditions, now they drafted me in the Army. sure that the local board [deletion] I [/deletion] was they didn't give me a fair deal
S64.Q97.C_1: to explain why my reason were. After all she is so lonsome (lonesome) home and the money goverment (Government) pays her it is enough for her. She is having worst time in her live (life). After all I like to see this (these) remarks I am writting (writing)to check up on me. And call me at present of any officer to explain myself much better. I am not a good writer but I guess if they give me (a) fair chance I will esplain (explain) why I am not interested of (in) the Army life. Its (It's) good if I was age 19-21 and have no dependent. And no family trouble specialy (especially) a mother without anybody with her as I am only one for her. No father, brother or sister, or relative just 1 son in the world. She is away from it, I am not. Sorry I am in the Army. I like it, but I should have more attention home for her how she is doing for herself which she is lonsome (lonesome) whle (while) I am in the Army now,
S64.Q97.Full: Sir [paragraph] I have mother and only one [underline] who she [/underline] could depend on me, which I was home. I was staying with her work, and take care of her. and takes care all the bills and all the liavig conditions, now they drafted me in the Army. sure that the local board [deletion] I [/deletion] was they didn't give me a fair deal to explain why my reason were. After all she is so lonsome (lonesome) home and the money goverment (Government) pays her it is enough for her. She is having worst time in her live (life). After all I like to see this (these) remarks I am writting (writing)to check up on me. And call me at present of any officer to explain myself much better. I am not a good writer but I guess if they give me (a) fair chance I will esplain (explain) why I am not interested of (in) the Army life. Its (It's) good if I was age 19-21 and have no dependent. And no family trouble specialy (especially) a mother without anybody with her as I am only one for her. No father, brother or sister, or relative just 1 son in the world. She is away from it, I am not. Sorry I am in the Army. I like it, but I should have more attention home for her how she is doing for herself which she is lonsome (lonesome) whle (while) I am in the Army now,

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Since I have been in the army, things have gotten worse at home, as my mother is a widow, & it is a hard job trying to support herself, with a very low income, as when I was at home I helped to support her, here as if I was released from the army, I could become a civilian, helping The war effort on the home front & supporting my widowed mother much to her advantage.
S64.Q97.C_1: A release from the army would be very sufficient and most satisfying.
S64.Q97.Full: Since I have been in the army, things have gotten worse at home, as my mother is a widow, & it is a hard job trying to support herself, with a very low income, as when I was at home I helped to support her, here as if I was released from the army, I could become a civilian, helping The war effort on the home front & supporting my widowed mother much to her advantage. A release from the army would be very sufficient and most satisfying.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: In civil life I were an ice dealer for myself, it seems in Pawtucket where I done all of my business, they are very short of ice dealers, and its suppose to be acencial to protect all foods, as they are very hard to get. I had to leave all of my lifes work to come into this man Army after holding on, during ten long years of depression and just about making both ends meet, but as long as I got to be in the Army
S64.Q97.C_1: I said right from the beginning I would be one of the best soldiers in the army, and do all I possibly could to get this war over with, so we can all go back, and live our life the way were [we're] in a habit of living do the things we like and plan our own future, and bring up our youngsters the American way of living, that is [underline] the [/underline] one and only way of living.
S64.Q97.Full: In civil life I were an ice dealer for myself, it seems in Pawtucket where I done all of my business, they are very short of ice dealers, and its suppose to be acencial to protect all foods, as they are very hard to get. I had to leave all of my lifes work to come into this man Army after holding on, during ten long years of depression and just about making both ends meet, but as long as I got to be in the Army I said right from the beginning I would be one of the best soldiers in the army, and do all I possibly could to get this war over with, so we can all go back, and live our life the way were [we're] in a habit of living do the things we like and plan our own future, and bring up our youngsters the American way of living, that is [underline] the [/underline] one and only way of living.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Give the men a chance to get a job. If he doesn't care why usually he would be best fitted for the Army. Some just go to work and think they would never be drafted. All I can say [deletion] if [/deletion] is give them a chance. They have a job to do and it must be done. Things are better than they were.
S64.Q97.Full: Give the men a chance to get a job. If he doesn't care why usually he would be best fitted for the Army. Some just go to work and think they would never be drafted. All I can say [deletion] if [/deletion] is give them a chance. They have a job to do and it must be done. Things are better than they were.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Before I cam in the Army I was practically the sole support of my mother and younger sister, still they only receive forty two ($42) dollars a month which includes the 20 that I put into it. They allow fifteen for my mother and five for my sister. What makes them so generous or maybe they think civilians don't eat. Get on the ball down there
S64.Q97.C_1: in Washington. If I'm willing to give my life, you people ought to willing to put over a little cash for my family. [paragraph] One other thing, there is too damn much favoritism being done in the army. I know cause I myself got screwed out of a T5 which was given to a fellow who didn't know a damn thing about it and all because he did a little brown nosing . I know its useless to write about it but it feels good to shoot off about it to someone. [paragraph] And before you send men to O. C. S. make sure they put at least 6 months to 1 year in the army as an enlisted man so they can see our way once in a while then maybe the officers won't be so [unclear] G. I. [/unclear] [paragraph] And what the hell do you need those damn WACS for. They get the best of equipment and we get the leftovers. Get them the hell out. Most of them are a bunch of pigs and do they take guys for their dough.
S64.Q97.Full: Before I cam in the Army I was practically the sole support of my mother and younger sister, still they only receive forty two ($42) dollars a month which includes the 20 that I put into it. They allow fifteen for my mother and five for my sister. What makes them so generous or maybe they think civilians don't eat. Get on the ball down there in Washington. If I'm willing to give my life, you people ought to willing to put over a little cash for my family. [paragraph] One other thing, there is too damn much favoritism being done in the army. I know cause I myself got screwed out of a T5 which was given to a fellow who didn't know a damn thing about it and all because he did a little brown nosing . I know its useless to write about it but it feels good to shoot off about it to someone. [paragraph] And before you send men to O. C. S. make sure they put at least 6 months to 1 year in the army as an enlisted man so they can see our way once in a while then maybe the officers won't be so [unclear] G. I. [/unclear] [paragraph] And what the hell do you need those damn WACS for. They get the best of equipment and we get the leftovers. Get them the hell out. Most of them are a bunch of pigs and do they take guys for their dough.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Many of the men in our company could be re-classified as to ability and past trade knowledge. Men in general not following trades used prior to enlistment.
S64.Q97.Full: Many of the men in our company could be re-classified as to ability and past trade knowledge. Men in general not following trades used prior to enlistment.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Personally I think I'd be better off in some other outfit such as the Air Force I'd like to be a gunner and I think, in fact I almost know that I'd be worth more to the army than in the Engineers. I'm not very much interested in the Engr [Engineer] and I am in gunnery.
S64.Q97.Full: Personally I think I'd be better off in some other outfit such as the Air Force I'd like to be a gunner and I think, in fact I almost know that I'd be worth more to the army than in the Engineers. I'm not very much interested in the Engr [Engineer] and I am in gunnery.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: This army is O.K. except for these O.C.S. blunders and the so called captains and majors we have in our outfit today. Our major just loves to see us parade in Boston and review us with his silly looking grin. He's getting good money and having a good time here at the expense of the gov. [government] . We have Batt. [Battery] of 792 men all of the ages of 18 and 19 who are smart and cold be made the best fighting
S64.Q97.C_1: team in any army ([underline] if [/underline] ) they had the proper training. Why can't you brass hats in Wash. [Washington] get out and look into the poor and improper training that the army is getting today. Make O.C.S. men that are men. Why these officers in our Co. [company] would be dead if ever we went across with them. Myself I would never want them near me and would never respect their judgement.
S64.Q97.Full: This army is O.K. except for these O.C.S. blunders and the so called captains and majors we have in our outfit today. Our major just loves to see us parade in Boston and review us with his silly looking grin. He's getting good money and having a good time here at the expense of the gov. [government] . We have Batt. [Battery] of 792 men all of the ages of 18 and 19 who are smart and cold be made the best fighting  team in any army ([underline] if [/underline] ) they had the proper training. Why can't you brass hats in Wash. [Washington] get out and look into the poor and improper training that the army is getting today. Make O.C.S. men that are men. Why these officers in our Co. [company] would be dead if ever we went across with them. Myself I would never want them near me and would never respect their judgement.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I don't think I got a very good chance of explaining my troubles to local draft board before coming into the army. I was the only one working and my Father having been sick for about three yrs and my Mother well on in years but because of owning a home which every American likes to do I was put in the army because of that not not mentioning that there were Doctors to
S64.Q97.C_1: pay and also making things worse for my Mother & Father by putting me into the Service whyll [while] some of the other fellows with just a war job get deferments. I also had a war job and a very good one but didn't get deferred for that. I think the Local Draft Borads [Boards] should look in to things a little more closer then just filling their quota.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't think I got a very good chance of explaining my troubles to local draft board before coming into the army. I was the only one working and my Father having been sick for about three yrs and my Mother well on in years but because of owning a home which every American likes to do I was put in the army because of that not not mentioning that there were Doctors to  pay and also making things worse for my Mother & Father by putting me into the Service whyll [while] some of the other fellows with just a war job get deferments. I also had a war job and a very good one but didn't get deferred for that. I think the Local Draft Borads [Boards] should look in to things a little more closer then just filling their quota.

document_type: Other
