S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I'm glad I am in the Army but I will be glad when I get back home. I will be glad to stay till it all over.
S64.Q97.Full: I'm glad I am in the Army but I will be glad when I get back home. I will be glad to stay till it all over.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think we should put all our effort into this thing and get it over with as soon as possible. Some men are not classified into the job they should have been, some men are better at some things than others.
S64.Q97.C_1: I believe I could be of greater help toward winning the war in a ship yard as a sheet metal worker. Then I am in the Army, if I was work on a war job I could be making a living for my family and at the same time be helping to win the war. I relize all can not work in a defince plant. and as we win the war, but as lot are in these defence plants that should be in the army. they would learn a lesson they would never forget.
S64.Q97.Full: I think we should put all our effort into this thing and get it over with as soon as possible. Some men are not classified into the job they should have been, some men are better at some things than others. I believe I could be of greater help toward winning the war in a ship yard as a sheet metal worker. Then I am in the Army, if I was work on a war job I could be making a living for my family and at the same time be helping to win the war. I relize all can not work in a defince plant. and as we win the war, but as lot are in these defence plants that should be in the army. they would learn a lesson they would never forget.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think that a soldier must have 2-15 day furloughs every year, I have known soldiers who were shipped to combat zones who were never issued furloughs from the time they were sworn into the U.S. army, this seems to be my opinion why the U.S. army has so many AWOL, while still in the States. It just doesn't seem right that one should not get a furlough before being shipped overseas. In other words I think a law should be passed to this effect,
S64.Q97.C_1: It seems that the army interviews you to see what branch of service you are best fitted for and then they put you wherever men are needed to fill up a camp. Such was the case with me. I had 2 yrs. experience in the Signal Corps when they interviewed me at my reception center and recommended me for the Infantry, which I claim there was no use in wasting their time interviewing [unclear] [/unclear] was the case with a lot of boys I know who are now in the service. Why not take those fellow who are interviewing in these reception centers and place them in the Army where they could do some good, but maybe the case is they have a little more money than I do, or possibly know someone who can give them a pull. Therefore why not take these 200 or 300 men in each reception center throughout the states and form a division of soldiers and let these boys under 20 yrs of age stay at home until they grow to maturity and learn to think before they act.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that a soldier must have 2-15 day furloughs every year, I have known soldiers who were shipped to combat zones who were never issued furloughs from the time they were sworn into the U.S. army, this seems to be my opinion why the U.S. army has so many AWOL, while still in the States. It just doesn't seem right that one should not get a furlough before being shipped overseas. In other words I think a law should be passed to this effect, It seems that the army interviews you to see what branch of service you are best fitted for and then they put you wherever men are needed to fill up a camp. Such was the case with me. I had 2 yrs. experience in the Signal Corps when they interviewed me at my reception center and recommended me for the Infantry, which I claim there was no use in wasting their time interviewing [unclear] [/unclear] was the case with a lot of boys I know who are now in the service. Why not take those fellow who are interviewing in these reception centers and place them in the Army where they could do some good, but maybe the case is they have a little more money than I do, or possibly know someone who can give them a pull. Therefore why not take these 200 or 300 men in each reception center throughout the states and form a division of soldiers and let these boys under 20 yrs of age stay at home until they grow to maturity and learn to think before they act.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: The army should give a soldier like me a chance where could make the grade with a criple hand.
S64.Q97.Full: The army should give a soldier like me a chance where could make the grade with a criple hand.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: The Army should give the men the branch of the army that the men will be more interested in and then the soldier would be satisfied and would work a lot harder for his unit
S64.Q97.Full: The Army should give the men the branch of the army that the men will be more interested in and then the soldier would be satisfied and would work a lot harder for his unit

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I don't think people are informed why they are transferred from one part of the army to another part. I think there is a lot of promotions made on account of suckation. I think the non-comms [Non-Commissioned Officers] and acting non-comms could give the orders more politely, they should allow a person more than one gig [Unfavorable report] in order not to get a pass.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't think people are informed why they are transferred from one part of the army to another part. I think there is a lot of promotions made on account of suckation. I think the non-comms [Non-Commissioned Officers] and acting non-comms could give the orders more politely, they should allow a person more than one gig [Unfavorable report] in order not to get a pass.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Back over a few pages in the questions about the Japs and Germans, I said they should be wiped off the face of the earth, well I still think so but if they surrendered and gave up all that they have captured and agreed to some very strict peace terms and prepare in some way to hold them to those terms it might be all right to let them surrender.
S64.Q97.Full: Back over a few pages in the questions about the Japs and Germans, I said they should be wiped off the face of the earth, well I still think so but if they surrendered and gave up all that they have captured and agreed to some very strict peace terms and prepare in some way to hold them to those terms it might be all right to let them surrender.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: This test was very difficult for a non-soldiering outfit. I believe it is very difficult to combine Soldiering with police work [paragraph] I have very little to complain about as I'm stationed very near home, and even though passes are scarce when I abtain one I can see my relatives & friends.
S64.Q97.C_1: Being refused entrance into the Cadet Guards disappointed me greatly but if so many others can take it, I can also.
S64.Q97.Full: This test was very difficult for a non-soldiering outfit. I believe it is very difficult to combine Soldiering with police work [paragraph] I have very little to complain about as I'm stationed very near home, and even though passes are scarce when I abtain one I can see my relatives & friends.  Being refused entrance into the Cadet Guards disappointed me greatly but if so many others can take it, I can also.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I would like my outfit a lot better if they would give us a little more time off. I've been working for 9 weeks without a day off, have had 10 day furlough in 2 years. Other outfits get them regularly. Can't see any difference in our outfits. We have plenty of men for the work we do but still when you ask for time off there is the same old answer "can't spare the men".
S64.Q97.Full: I would like my outfit a lot better if they would give us a little more time off. I've been working for 9 weeks without a day off, have had 10 day furlough in 2 years. Other outfits get them regularly. Can't see any difference in our outfits. We have plenty of men for the work we do but still when you ask for time off there is the same old answer "can't spare the men".

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I would like to go over there before it is over. I am 32 and I can stand up and do my part if they give me a chance.
S64.Q97.Full: I would like to go over there before it is over. I am 32 and I can stand up and do my part if they give me a chance.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Wish that we had more chance to choose what we wish to do in the Army. Also that there was not so much "red tape" and politics mixed up with Army Administration and organization
S64.Q97.Full: Wish that we had more chance to choose what we wish to do in the Army. Also that there was not so much "red tape" and politics mixed up with Army Administration and organization

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: It is my frank opinion that I could be of more use in some other outfit besides this one. I just can't get serious over this [unclear] [/unclear] work. It makes you feel like a boy scout. If there was any possible way of transferring with an overseas outfit I would gladly grab it. Let the WAC's pull interior guard and free some men for combat.
S64.Q97.Full: It is my frank opinion that I could be of more use in some other outfit besides this one. I just can't get serious over this [unclear] [/unclear] work. It makes you feel like a boy scout. If there was any possible way of transferring with an overseas outfit I would gladly grab it. Let the WAC's pull interior guard and free some men for combat.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: In this particular outfit - more time should be spent on exercise, hikes, swimming, ball playing etc - Many are out of condition physically. A plan should be made or some sort of schedule as to passes etc. Not just on weekends but during the week for the boys who had weekend duties - inspections should be a bit more strict on personal (personnel) In an outfit such as a M.P. (Military Police) outfit. There should be more physical build up than
S64.Q97.C_1: we are getting now. Also being armed with a 45 cal. [caliber] pistol we should at least fire the gun once a month or oftener.
S64.Q97.Full: In this particular outfit - more time should be spent on exercise, hikes, swimming, ball playing etc - Many are out of condition physically. A plan should be made or some sort of schedule as to passes etc. Not just on weekends but during the week for the boys who had weekend duties - inspections should be a bit more strict on personal (personnel) In an outfit such as a M.P. (Military Police) outfit. There should be more physical build up than we are getting now. Also being armed with a 45 cal. [caliber] pistol we should at least fire the gun once a month or oftener.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: (97) Mother was hurt very bad last Fall. If we had more time off in this outfit we would work together a lot better. If we could get outside and meet people and go to dances we would think in different ways than we do. Its nice to get away from it all for a few days and relax.
S64.Q97.Full: (97) Mother was hurt very bad last Fall. If we had more time off in this outfit we would work together a lot better. If we could get outside and meet people and go to dances we would think in different ways than we do. Its nice to get away from it all for a few days and relax.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I think that the rule about 15% of organization on pass at one time is foolish. AR says (I think) 15% on {underline}furlough{underline} at a time. Pass, even 3-days, is certainly not a furlough. Another outfit in our training center allows, so far as I know, unlimited passes. The personnel of that outfit would be necessary in time of attack, as personnel of our outfit would be partially useless. Yet they get passes where we can't. {paragraph} We are not allowed enough free time in this outfit. We are up at 5:30 or 5:45 every morning yet reveille is not till 6:10. We are barely back from chow when we fall out to police up around
S64.Q97.C_1: the area 7:00. We then get about ten minutes to shave, wash, etc. before drill call at 7:20 (We stand in formation 'till 7:30) At noon we fall out at 12:35 instead of 12:45 as we should. Not getting what difference that ten minutes makes. Every man should be issued 2 suntan overseas caps. We have to send them to cleaners when they get dirty & then have nothing to wear. Also, more woolen socks should be issued, because the laundry takes so long that I have to wear a pair for 5 days. Do they smell! I think that the officers of my outfit are swell, but a lot of the noncoms are nasty at times.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that the rule about 15% of organization on pass at one time is foolish. AR says (I think) 15% on {underline}furlough{underline} at a time. Pass, even 3-days, is certainly not a furlough. Another outfit in our training center allows, so far as I know, unlimited passes. The personnel of that outfit would be necessary in time of attack, as personnel of our outfit would be partially useless. Yet they get passes where we can't. {paragraph} We are not allowed enough free time in this outfit. We are up at 5:30 or 5:45 every morning yet reveille is not till 6:10. We are barely back from chow when we fall out to police up around the area 7:00. We then get about ten minutes to shave, wash, etc. before drill call at 7:20 (We stand in formation 'till 7:30) At noon we fall out at 12:35 instead of 12:45 as we should. Not getting what difference that ten minutes makes. Every man should be issued 2 suntan overseas caps. We have to send them to cleaners when they get dirty & then have nothing to wear. Also, more woolen socks should be issued, because the laundry takes so long that I have to wear a pair for 5 days. Do they smell! I think that the officers of my outfit are swell, but a lot of the noncoms are nasty at times.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I dont think the army or at least this camp gives enough passes as for furloughs. I think they should receive one at least every 6 months and probably more often while they are in the US. Seeing your folks means a lot fo a individual and gives him new ambitions as well as moral - most soldiers like the army pretty well if they can get home once in awhile.
S64.Q97.C_1: Also I think men should be placed more in what they want. Seems like you are placed in just the opposite thing to what you want. Also transfers are too hard to get. If you are placed in one thing and don't like it I think they should be allowed to change to another branch. [paragraph] I also think the agriculture situation is being neglected. Where I come from big farms are standing idle because there is no one to run & work on them. In my own case, Dad had to sell about 2 thousand chickens when I came in the army because he couldn't run them himself & he couldn't hire anybody. A shortage of food would mean disaster & that is what we're headed for. [paragraph] Also we are training all our men as soldiers when China would be glad to furnish her men if we'd supply them with armament. [paragraph] In most respects though the army is run pretty efficiently.
S64.Q97.Full: I dont think the army or at least this camp gives enough passes as for furloughs. I think they should receive one at least every 6 months and probably more often while they are in the US. Seeing your folks means a lot fo a individual and gives him new ambitions as well as moral - most soldiers like the army pretty well if they can get home once in awhile.  Also I think men should be placed more in what they want. Seems like you are placed in just the opposite thing to what you want. Also transfers are too hard to get. If you are placed in one thing and don't like it I think they should be allowed to change to another branch. [paragraph] I also think the agriculture situation is being neglected. Where I come from big farms are standing idle because there is no one to run & work on them. In my own case, Dad had to sell about 2 thousand chickens when I came in the army because he couldn't run them himself & he couldn't hire anybody. A shortage of food would mean disaster & that is what we're headed for. [paragraph] Also we are training all our men as soldiers when China would be glad to furnish her men if we'd supply them with armament. [paragraph] In most respects though the army is run pretty efficiently.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think married men should be allowed to have overnight passes.
S64.Q97.Full: I think married men should be allowed to have overnight passes.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Please try to organize a [underline] large [/underline] peacetime organized reserve. Don't junk the small arms and uniforms after this war, but give them, or make them available for public sale. Make your reserve program compulsory, if necessary. Study Switzerland's peacetime system, and consider its merits. Try to popularize rifle shooting. Make your surplus ammunition available to the public. Do everything to discourage the crack-pot anit-firearms legislations, but use your enlisted reserve and the national
S64.Q97.C_1: Rifle Association to interest the public in carefully supervised rifle shooting. Organize more rifle clubs. The General Public, if familiar with the use of small arms, will prove a valuable asset in all future national emergencies. Interest them in their weapons; not in the military application of them. They will enjoy the recreational use of them, and when an emergency occurs, they will discover that they are able to individually defend themselves.
S64.Q97.Full: Please try to organize a [underline] large [/underline] peacetime organized reserve. Don't junk the small arms and uniforms after this war, but give them, or make them available for public sale. Make your reserve program compulsory, if necessary. Study Switzerland's peacetime system, and consider its merits. Try to popularize rifle shooting. Make your surplus ammunition available to the public. Do everything to discourage the crack-pot anit-firearms legislations, but use your enlisted reserve and the national Rifle Association to interest the public in carefully supervised rifle shooting. Organize more rifle clubs. The General Public, if familiar with the use of small arms, will prove a valuable asset in all future national emergencies. Interest them in their weapons; not in the military application of them. They will enjoy the recreational use of them, and when an emergency occurs, they will discover that they are able to individually defend themselves.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: If I were not going into ASTP, I feel that I would not be as good a soldier as I want to be.
S64.Q97.Full: If I were not going into ASTP, I feel that I would not be as good a soldier as I want to be.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: at this time there is little I can add, for I think this was a very good, exact and complete form.
S64.Q97.Full: at this time there is little I can add, for I think this was a very good, exact and complete form.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: My Mother came here and she thinks this is a hell hole. Non coms shit all over a private. They talked to my Mother like she was some no good for nothing, when I mention it I got 9 days extra detail.
S64.Q97.Full: My Mother came here and she thinks this is a hell hole. Non coms shit all over a private. They talked to my Mother like she was some no good for nothing, when I mention it I got 9 days extra detail.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I am sorry I could not finish my last quarter year at college. The E.R.C.'s was a bad deal to catch men in. I do believe the government or War Dept. could do better by fairness.
S64.Q97.Full: I am sorry I could not finish my last quarter year at college. The E.R.C.'s was a bad deal to catch men in. I do believe the government or War Dept. could do better by fairness.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I don't think officers follow their rules on conducting classes nearly as well as they expect enlisted men to follow their orders.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't think officers follow their rules on conducting classes nearly as well as they expect enlisted men to follow their orders.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Our Army could use Mess Sergeant who can explain a job better -- and just because some Joe has been "hanging" around a camp for years is no reason why he should think he is a general. [paragraph] Goldbricke ought to be given KP three times a week.
S64.Q97.Full: Our Army could use Mess Sergeant who can explain a job better -- and just because some Joe has been "hanging" around a camp for years is no reason why he should think he is a general. [paragraph] Goldbricke ought to be given KP three times a week.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: My folks have 4 boys in the service, and they miss us, but they're doing a swell job at home and seem to make out damn good. [paragraph] Remark on 90. Most of the guys are like me, they don't like the army, love civilian life, but know it isn't what they left.
S64.Q97.C_1: I wish everyone could be put with as swell a bunch of guys as I am with.
S64.Q97.Full: My folks have 4 boys in the service, and they miss us, but they're doing a swell job at home and seem to make out damn good. [paragraph] Remark on 90. Most of the guys are like me, they don't like the army, love civilian life, but know it isn't what they left. I wish everyone could be put with as swell a bunch of guys as I am with.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Too much time is wasted by lack of planning by officers or non-coms.
S64.Q97.Full: Too much time is wasted by lack of planning by officers or non-coms.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: As far as I can notice these questions have fully covered about every phase of the army. Except, perhaps, of the one thing that so many men find discouraging and that is the "channels" of communication for every detail. Known as 'Red Tape'. I think that possibly some of that could be done away with. That is the only remark I have.
S64.Q97.Full: As far as I can notice these questions have fully covered about every phase of the army. Except, perhaps, of the one thing that so many men find discouraging and that is the "channels" of communication for every detail. Known as 'Red Tape'. I think that possibly some of that could be done away with. That is the only remark I have.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I believe a sholdiger [soldier] should not go AWOL he should think of the boy fighting on the fronts and think if they can leave when tired and sore.
S64.Q97.Full: I believe a sholdiger [soldier] should not go AWOL he should think of the boy fighting on the fronts and think if they can leave when tired and sore.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: The rules of discipline are fine and necessary. The petty meanness of a few non coms [Non Commissioned Officers] especially the higher ranking are entirely uncalled for and damage the morale and the conduct of the men to an alarming extent.
S64.Q97.Full: The rules of discipline are fine and necessary. The petty meanness of a few non coms [Non Commissioned Officers] especially the higher ranking are entirely uncalled for and damage the morale and the conduct of the men to an alarming extent.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: In regards to the above question. Wages are much higher but living conditions are not so good. (paragraph) My own personal remark in that I feel that I didn't get a square deal on being drafted. I am the father of 3 children and I know plenty of single fellows who are not being drafted.
S64.Q97.Full: In regards to the above question. Wages are much higher but living conditions are not so good. (paragraph) My own personal remark in that I feel that I didn't get a square deal on being drafted. I am the father of 3 children and I know plenty of single fellows who are not being drafted.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I think more care should be exercised in placement of men. I also think the men can be treated much more like men and less as morons and get better results. Too much time is spent on small worthless points and technical training is definitely lacking. Every soldier should get a furlough
S64.Q97.C_1: before he is shipped overseas
S64.Q97.Full: I think more care should be exercised in placement of men. I also think the men can be treated much more like men and less as morons and get better results. Too much time is spent on small worthless points and technical training is definitely lacking. Every soldier should get a furlough  before he is shipped overseas

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: If men can interest themselves in what ever they're doing and realize the importance of it, there would be fewer awol's and better trained men.
S64.Q97.Full: If men can interest themselves in what ever they're doing and realize the importance of it, there would be fewer awol's and better trained men.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: what gripes me most in the army is this: For some reson [reason] men here are guilty of anything their commanders (commissioned and non com [non-commissioned] wish to charge them with until they are proved innocent. Why should a man be punished, made to do his extra duty before he [deletion] fulfils the Jerk [/deletion] can appeal? Why should I not get a chance to talk back when my weekend pass has been revoked? If there is a reason for everything in the army (as the orientation films claim) why aren't
S64.Q97.C_1: we who are directed involved told of them? It does me no good to be told by a sergeant that the corporal the day before had no right to make me take KP - after I have had a full day of [unclear] druggery [/unclear] . The army is the last place in the country where someone has the power of life and death over you without your [unclear] murmur [/unclear] country. Everybody know that a court marshal is a beautiful farce - if you are called up, you might just as well turn in your chips and quit. The army recognizes no extenuating circumstances and this is nonsense, and mostly laziness I think. Why am I responsible if the train I ride on is many hours late? The officers cannot have so much to do that they cannot examine the details - and if they are so busy, the whole administration is indicted. Everybody recognizes that Jean Valjean was condemned without cause, but this is precisely the sort of thing the army goes for, and in a big way. I do not say there should not be discipline - there must be - but we in the army are not soldiers. We are civilians doing our duties, and we should by all rights be treated as such.
S64.Q97.Full: what gripes me most in the army is this: For some reson [reason] men here are guilty of anything their commanders (commissioned and non com [non-commissioned] wish to charge them with until they are proved innocent. Why should a man be punished, made to do his extra duty before he [deletion] fulfils the Jerk [/deletion] can appeal? Why should I not get a chance to talk back when my weekend pass has been revoked? If there is a reason for everything in the army (as the orientation films claim) why aren't we who are directed involved told of them? It does me no good to be told by a sergeant that the corporal the day before had no right to make me take KP - after I have had a full day of [unclear] druggery [/unclear] . The army is the last place in the country where someone has the power of life and death over you without your [unclear] murmur [/unclear] country. Everybody know that a court marshal is a beautiful farce - if you are called up, you might just as well turn in your chips and quit. The army recognizes no extenuating circumstances and this is nonsense, and mostly laziness I think. Why am I responsible if the train I ride on is many hours late? The officers cannot have so much to do that they cannot examine the details - and if they are so busy, the whole administration is indicted. Everybody recognizes that Jean Valjean was condemned without cause, but this is precisely the sort of thing the army goes for, and in a big way. I do not say there should not be discipline - there must be - but we in the army are not soldiers. We are civilians doing our duties, and we should by all rights be treated as such.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I would like to know about new WD regulations on such subjects as furloughs, ASTP and other subjects. Others know (such as NCO's & officers) why don't we?
S64.Q97.Full: I would like to know about new WD regulations on such subjects as furloughs, ASTP and other subjects. Others know (such as NCO's & officers) why don't we?

S64.Q97.F: When one realizes what a tremendous job it is to run an organization like the army he should realize how very efficient this organization is. On the whole I have very few "kicks" coming.
S64.Q97.Full: When one realizes what a tremendous job it is to run an organization like the army he should realize how very efficient this organization is. On the whole I have very few "kicks" coming.

S64.Q97.F: We aren't given all the food we can eat and it isn't well cooked or seasoned. Some meals we have a lot left over, other meals we don't have enough.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: The army should end or eliminate red tape, inconsistency of rules and a better public information service as to how the Army operates and what the public should expect of the Army.
S64.Q97.Full: The army should end or eliminate red tape, inconsistency of rules and a better public information service as to how the Army operates and what the public should expect of the Army.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: only [unclear] some [/unclear]
S64.Q97.F: Fellows in our outfit are giving their full time to the army! but you won't utilize us. We aren't lazy. Instead of giving 45 hrs. instruction on "inspection before driving", give us mechanical instruction so that we can run a motor in a pinch. [paragraph] The physical program is far too easy - - a tougher physical!
S64.Q97.Full: Fellows in our outfit are giving their full time to the army! but you won't utilize us. We aren't lazy. Instead of giving 45 hrs. instruction on "inspection before driving", give us mechanical instruction so that we can run a motor in a pinch. [paragraph] The physical program is far too easy - - a tougher physical!

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I feel that this survey was very interesting and it made me think I can't understand how one may get any completed information from this. I feel also that its good to have these only so as to make this swell army more complete. We can always add on new things and I believe we are well on our way to victory as a country - so lets improve
S64.Q97.C_1: our mistakes and end this damn war. The sooner the quicker. I like army life but give me those civilian dates and those swell nights back home. More passes might change this, but a furlough would sure be the thing . I have been in six months had one furlough cancelled now they say I won't get any until January 1944. Is that right I ask. Reason for first furlough being cancelled was because I attended a two week Cadre school at Camp Roberts. [paragraph] Well I believe my opinions are closed for now - I enjoyed your quiz.
S64.Q97.Full: I feel that this survey was very interesting and it made me think I can't understand how one may get any completed information from this. I feel also that its good to have these only so as to make this swell army more complete. We can always add on new things and I believe we are well on our way to victory as a country - so lets improve our mistakes and end this damn war. The sooner the quicker. I like army life but give me those civilian dates and those swell nights back home. More passes might change this, but a furlough would sure be the thing . I have been in six months had one furlough cancelled now they say I won't get any until January 1944. Is that right I ask. Reason for first furlough being cancelled was because I attended a two week Cadre school at Camp Roberts. [paragraph] Well I believe my opinions are closed for now - I enjoyed your quiz.

S64.Q97.F: I think the com. officers should get together more about lectures on different army equipment, because one officer will tell you one thing and the next day you get hell because you don't do it the way the last officer wants you to do. I think the officers should have voice training or something when giving orders will marching. I
S64.Q97.C_1: was in college R.O.T.C. (Reserve Officer Training Corps) and the officers their (there could be heard (hard).
S64.Q97.Full: I think the com. officers should get together more about lectures on different army equipment, because one officer will tell you one thing and the next day you get hell because you don't do it the way the last officer wants you to do. I think the officers should have voice training or something when giving orders will marching. I was in college R.O.T.C. (Reserve Officer Training Corps) and the officers their (there could be heard (hard).

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: This army is better than last war's army. No reward is meted out for many virtues. [paragraph] "Suck" can do wonders. [paragraph] The army is riddled with mental midgets. [paragraph] Too often the "superiors" are prone to hurt their inferiors - A natural inescapable phenomena
S64.Q97.Full: This army is better than last war's army. No reward is meted out for many virtues. [paragraph] "Suck" can do wonders. [paragraph] The army is riddled with mental midgets. [paragraph] Too often the "superiors" are prone to hurt their inferiors - A natural inescapable phenomena

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Although the A.U.S. is better than the regular army there is still too much internal politics. All so [also] too much pettishness about rank and authority. A man can be a gentleman without brass on his shoulder. [paragraph] Too much propaganda about the
S64.Q97.C_1: Army classification system -- Actually the method of classification is Parcial. Also why doesn't the army keeps it promises to reserve components the way the navy + marine corps do. Too many Utah men in this training camp. Some of my thoughts here may seem wierd but they are my thoughts of the moments.
S64.Q97.Full: Although the A.U.S. is better than the regular army there is still too much internal politics. All so [also] too much pettishness about rank and authority. A man can be a gentleman without brass on his shoulder. [paragraph] Too much propaganda about the  Army classification system -- Actually the method of classification is Parcial. Also why doesn't the army keeps it promises to reserve components the way the navy + marine corps do. Too many Utah men in this training camp. Some of my thoughts here may seem wierd but they are my thoughts of the moments.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I think this 5 day furlough after basic is a wonderful moral builder and it should be granted to all men when they finish basic, not just to those going to points of embarkation. Things usually seem darkest for a soldier about that time and those few days would give him time to get himself as well as his affairs in a better state thus giving you a better soldier.
S64.Q97.Full: I think this 5 day furlough after basic is a wonderful moral builder and it should be granted to all men when they finish basic, not just to those going to points of embarkation. Things usually seem darkest for a soldier about that time and those few days would give him time to get himself as well as his affairs in a better state thus giving you a better soldier.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: 1. There is too much red tape. 2. Too many noncoms & Lts drilling one platoon. 3. There is a lot of favoratism. 4. We don't gt the things that the folks at home are going with out. 5. Something should be done about the japs that aren't where they should be.
S64.Q97.Full: 1. There is too much red tape. 2. Too many noncoms & Lts drilling one platoon. 3. There is a lot of favoratism. 4. We don't gt the things that the folks at home are going with out. 5. Something should be done about the japs that aren't where they should be.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: The only remark I have is that the Army does not give enough information on future duty. This is impossible in many cases but in some such as ROTC, as ASTP [unclear] [/unclear] could be told what chances they had, where they were likely to go & what they would do.
S64.Q97.Full: The only remark I have is that the Army does not give enough information on future duty. This is impossible in many cases but in some such as ROTC, as ASTP [unclear] [/unclear] could be told what chances they had, where they were likely to go & what they would do.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: dont deserve furloughs yet
S64.Q97.F: My remarks deal with the men in our battery and the non coms leading them. Some men are not cut out to be soldiers and consequently they just don't seem to get the hang of it or the noncoms really give them hell. Also some  men are not physically fit even for limited service.[paragraph]Another thing that I have a few remarks are the fort that a few men, or more
S64.Q97.C_1: are not placed in an outfit that is of their caliber. For some men's education and training I think they are getting a raw deal. I know a lot more of them could be placed in different units and they would function a lot better if the situation was to their ability.
S64.Q97.Full: My remarks deal with the men in our battery and the non coms leading them. Some men are not cut out to be soldiers and consequently they just don't seem to get the hang of it or the noncoms really give them hell. Also some  men are not physically fit even for limited service.[paragraph]Another thing that I have a few remarks are the fort that a few men, or more are not placed in an outfit that is of their caliber. For some men's education and training I think they are getting a raw deal. I know a lot more of them could be placed in different units and they would function a lot better if the situation was to their ability.

S64.Q97.C_1: the army is run pretty well. a few people like to show their authority, but only make me angry, does not [deletion] hurt me [/deletion] deter me in my line of duty and work.

But on a whole the the army is run pretty well. a few people like to show their authority, but only make me angry, does not [deletion] hurt me [/deletion] deter me in my line of duty and work.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I think hair cuts are to high + [&] also the dry cleaning. I think we should have a QM [Quartermaster] dry cleaning outfit.
S64.Q97.Full: I think hair cuts are to high + [&] also the dry cleaning. I think we should have a QM [Quartermaster] dry cleaning outfit.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I don't think our non-coms as a whole, are picked properly for in many cases those who merit stripes are overlooked. A case [unclear] in our btry [battery] where a non-com striked one pvt [private] and gets a medal for doing so. I think THAT ([underline] STINKS. [/underline] )
S64.Q97.Full: I don't think our non-coms as a whole, are picked properly for in many cases those who merit stripes are overlooked. A case [unclear] in our btry [battery] where a non-com striked one pvt [private] and gets a medal for doing so. I think THAT ([underline] STINKS. [/underline] )

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: Food is not as good as people say the army is fed. To much of one thing. {paragraph} Why do they ship a fellow living in the east all the way west & vice versa? {paragraph} We don't have much entertainment. Prices in the P.X. are to high. A haircut thats not finish because the barber isn't allowed to trim with the razor.
S64.Q97.C_1: When the appearance of a soldier counts most. USO's in town leaving nothing free. Transportation to & from town is poorly run. I really think I should be in the Air Corp because my experience as a machinist could be put to more use. Here I'm not using it at all. Traveling time should be given to fellows living 2, 000 or 3,000 miles away from camp. Some camps do get it & some do not. I don't see how this is done one place & not another. Things change to fast. One day its this uniform next its something else. The Medical Doctors should pay a little more attention to fellows going in for care. They think every guy that goes to see them is "goldbricking". A fellow should choose the outfit he's suited for instead of being put n any one.
S64.Q97.Full: Food is not as good as people say the army is fed. To much of one thing. {paragraph} Why do they ship a fellow living in the east all the way west & vice versa? {paragraph} We don't have much entertainment. Prices in the P.X. are to high. A haircut thats not finish because the barber isn't allowed to trim with the razor. When the appearance of a soldier counts most. USO's in town leaving nothing free. Transportation to & from town is poorly run. I really think I should be in the Air Corp because my experience as a machinist could be put to more use. Here I'm not using it at all. Traveling time should be given to fellows living 2, 000 or 3,000 miles away from camp. Some camps do get it & some do not. I don't see how this is done one place & not another. Things change to fast. One day its this uniform next its something else. The Medical Doctors should pay a little more attention to fellows going in for care. They think every guy that goes to see them is "goldbricking". A fellow should choose the outfit he's suited for instead of being put n any one.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: 1. They should at least give a soldier a furlough every six months, If not in combat. [paragraph] 2. When a soldier gets operated on anything such as apendix [appendix] or rupture or has broken legs they should send him home for a few days rest.
S64.Q97.Full: 1. They should at least give a soldier a furlough every six months, If not in combat. [paragraph] 2. When a soldier gets operated on anything such as apendix [appendix] or rupture or has broken legs they should send him home for a few days rest.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: On a whole the training isn't too bad. But I see no reason why [unclear] [/unclear] should be sent from one end of the country to the other for training. I'm married and I'd like to see my wife and family more often, but 3000 miles is a long way to go. I also think that some of the officers are given too much power. A Private has no say. As a civilian no one told me what to do and when, after all
S64.Q97.C_1: We're supposed to e fighting for "Freedom". Why not have some of it now. There is a certain point at which Military discipline ends & becomes Naziism (Nazism). Furthermore prices are too high at Dry Cleaning, Haircuts and Transportation is inadequate. There is very little entertainment to be had in nearby towns.
S64.Q97.Full: On a whole the training isn't too bad. But I see no reason why [unclear] [/unclear] should be sent from one end of the country to the other for training. I'm married and I'd like to see my wife and family more often, but 3000 miles is a long way to go. I also think that some of the officers are given too much power. A Private has no say. As a civilian no one told me what to do and when, after all We're supposed to e fighting for "Freedom". Why not have some of it now. There is a certain point at which Military discipline ends & becomes Naziism (Nazism). Furthermore prices are too high at Dry Cleaning, Haircuts and Transportation is inadequate. There is very little entertainment to be had in nearby towns.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I would like to get out of this camp pretty soon and get a furlough
S64.Q97.Full: I would like to get out of this camp pretty soon and get a furlough

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)

S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: The corples. are not very good because they don't know enough about the work they are suppose to do. There are a lot of pvt. that know more but I don't say it is me. But I know of pvts. that does. The plat. Sargent is a smart good for nothing who thinks he know a lot but don't know nothing.
S64.Q97.Full: The corples. are not very good because they don't know enough about the work they are suppose to do. There are a lot of pvt. that know more but I don't say it is me. But I know of pvts. that does. The plat. Sargent is a smart good for nothing who thinks he know a lot but don't know nothing.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think that of a family with a few boys in the service at least one should be left at home and take care of, and be around his folks. [paragraph] If an enlisted man knows he can do better on another outfit he should be let get a transfer.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that of a family with a few boys in the service at least one should be left at home and take care of, and be around his folks. [paragraph] If an enlisted man knows he can do better on another outfit he should be let get a transfer.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I would like to be back in what I was trained for. I have lots of duties and no chance at a promotion. The officers have picks. [paragraph] The food could be better ad cooked better. Every one could be treated more the same. Each man could be placed where he fit best.
S64.Q97.Full: I would like to be back in what I was trained for. I have lots of duties and no chance at a promotion. The officers have picks. [paragraph] The food could be better ad cooked better. Every one could be treated more the same. Each man could be placed where he fit best.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I think the army takes to many of the boys from the farm & truck gardens that are making over $2,000.00 a year and puts them in the Infantry at $50 a month accomplishing very little and cutting food production down to a shortage. And also letting the farms go to hell and ruin. Them are the boys that worked for a living they dont get a chance at the air corp or some other branch
S64.Q97.Full: I think the army takes to many of the boys from the farm & truck gardens that are making over $2,000.00 a year and puts them in the Infantry at $50 a month accomplishing very little and cutting food production down to a shortage. And also letting the farms go to hell and ruin. Them are the boys that worked for a living they dont get a chance at the air corp or some other branch

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Their is several thing about this eating Rotation They give us mess kit that rust before we get there eating out of them. The food is nothing extry. Palatabe three times a day. The egg we have has so much milk & Flower mixed with them that they are not fit for a dog to eat. When we have any thing in the line of close that is wore out. They say you get 60.00 Dollar go by you some more. They have never give me an y thing since I have ben in her
S64.Q97.C_1: only when he was inducted. From then on out I have been bying socks & underwear & work pants & legons.

The egg we have has so much milk & Flower mixed with them that they are not fit for a dog to eat. When we have any thing in the line of close that is wore out. They say you get 60.00 Dollar go by you some more. They have never give me an y thing since I have ben in her only when he was inducted. From then on out I have been bying socks & underwear & work pants & legons.

There discipline is very poor. Some men are not allowed to [unclear] [/unclear] their own initiative, non com feel like they are after their stripes. Noncoms and officers show
S64.Q97.C_1: parciality [partiality] toward some while the others are whole lots better [paragraph] The classification of men as far as a physical are not strict enough when sent into the Army. M. because the men feel like if they don't know what they are doing how in the hell should they and therefore they don't put out their best effort. [paragraph] To [Too] many 90 day wonders

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: All I have to gripe about, is the way they stick a person into another outfit, when he enlists for something that he wants -- food is just fair but not what it is bragged to be - by a long way.
S64.Q97.Full: All I have to gripe about, is the way they stick a person into another outfit, when he enlists for something that he wants -- food is just fair but not what it is bragged to be - by a long way.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think the food could be a lot better and cleaner than it is And should have more to eat.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the food could be a lot better and cleaner than it is And should have more to eat.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: They should never make non-coms out of men that come into the army the same time has you do. Because you feel that they do not no any more than you do. And that way can't expect them to lead you. [paragraph] And they tell about how much the soldier gets to eat. What they have is good but they don't have all they need. They should find
S64.Q97.C_1: some way to make shore [sure] every one gets all they won't [want] to eat.
S64.Q97.Full: They should never make non-coms out of men that come into the army the same time has you do. Because you feel that they do not no any more than you do. And that way can't expect them to lead you. [paragraph] And they tell about how much the soldier gets to eat. What they have is good but they don't have all they need. They should find  some way to make shore [sure] every one gets all they won't [want] to eat.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M_marginalia: ([underline] living conditions [/underline] ) For my folks it made it worse as they have two sons in service.
S64.Q97.F: Before an enlisted man can be convinced in obeying & following an officer, he has to know he's his superior, and I don't think that some officers know as much as they could, that concerns handling of men etc. Of course, I don't blame anyone who wants to become an officer, more power to him, but that's up to the war dept, as to who they should let become ...
S64.Q97.C_1: An officer, and let those that are qualified become officers and make no exception to the rule, cause that men are going to follow their leaders, not officers that aren't fit for their bars. No reflection on officers that are above the bar status, as most of them are ok.
S64.Q97.Full: Before an enlisted man can be convinced in obeying & following an officer, he has to know he's his superior, and I don't think that some officers know as much as they could, that concerns handling of men etc. Of course, I don't blame anyone who wants to become an officer, more power to him, but that's up to the war dept, as to who they should let become ...  An officer, and let those that are qualified become officers and make no exception to the rule, cause that men are going to follow their leaders, not officers that aren't fit for their bars. No reflection on officers that are above the bar status, as most of them are ok.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I suggest a more proper placement of men in all jobs in the army as they place cooks and clerks in mechanics jobs and vice versa. The old gag about "hurry up and wait " is true and something should be done to make a more efficient use of time instead of lot of running back and forth accomplishing nothing. I suggest dispensing with lots of unnecessary military courtesy and privileges accorded to officers which seems to me too much like dictatorship which causes resentment among men.
S64.Q97.Full: I suggest a more proper placement of men in all jobs in the army as they place cooks and clerks in mechanics jobs and vice versa. The old gag about "hurry up and wait " is true and something should be done to make a more efficient use of time instead of lot of running back and forth accomplishing nothing. I suggest dispensing with lots of unnecessary military courtesy and privileges accorded to officers which seems to me too much like dictatorship which causes resentment among men.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: So much of army training looks better on paper & schedules, than it actually is - Like civilian life officers & men interpret the rules for their own personal good - Most officers have had little or no experience in handling man & no administrative ability. Consequently they they get less work done & make many blunders, this especially true among junior officers - In most cases they are just
S64.Q97.C_1: too young - There are many good, [unclear] level [/unclear] young officers but the percentage isn't with them - having been selected by two boards for OCS [Officer Candidate School] . Myself (in ADiv. that has no quota) I'm inclined to believe that if the case was thoroughly investigated & a more elaborate test given, it would be best to get officers from the ranks -- incapable young officers is one of the outstanding faults of the army - [paragraph] Personally I am contributing less to the war effort than I was as a civilian - I conducted my business & worked nites as a buyer for an aircraft concern, & kept my home intact - Now I am a clerk, doing a menial job, certainly not a mans job - [paragraph] I have had more shooting practice on a hunting trip, than in my 8 months in the army [Paragraph] In short I don't feel that I am helping myself, my country, or any cause by being in the army, as much as I could be at home on a useful job
S64.Q97.Full: So much of army training looks better on paper & schedules, than it actually is - Like civilian life officers & men interpret the rules for their own personal good - Most officers have had little or no experience in handling man & no administrative ability. Consequently they they get less work done & make many blunders, this especially true among junior officers - In most cases they are just  too young - There are many good, [unclear] level [/unclear] young officers but the percentage isn't with them - having been selected by two boards for OCS [Officer Candidate School] . Myself (in ADiv. that has no quota) I'm inclined to believe that if the case was thoroughly investigated & a more elaborate test given, it would be best to get officers from the ranks -- incapable young officers is one of the outstanding faults of the army - [paragraph] Personally I am contributing less to the war effort than I was as a civilian - I conducted my business & worked nites as a buyer for an aircraft concern, & kept my home intact - Now I am a clerk, doing a menial job, certainly not a mans job - [paragraph] I have had more shooting practice on a hunting trip, than in my 8 months in the army [Paragraph] In short I don't feel that I am helping myself, my country, or any cause by being in the army, as much as I could be at home on a useful job

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: All I would like to say is that in my opinion we should take most all our fighting men that are hear in the States, load them up with our best materials and send them where ever the front and fronts are. Send them in masses and we can't help but win and win fast. As we have more men than all our enemys put together who really and truly know what and why they are fighting for.
S64.Q97.Full: All I would like to say is that in my opinion we should take most all our fighting men that are hear in the States, load them up with our best materials and send them where ever the front and fronts are. Send them in masses and we can't help but win and win fast. As we have more men than all our enemys put together who really and truly know what and why they are fighting for.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: When a man is off duty on a week end why not let him go where he please if he can be trusted to come back on time?
S64.Q97.Full: When a man is off duty on a week end why not let him go where he please if he can be trusted to come back on time?

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: The Army is O.K. I like it. What makes me dislike it sometimes is how is run. By favoritism and ass sucking. If you can suck ass you can get stripes no matter how dumb, if you don't you're out of luck. I am in the 105 [unclear] [/unclear] field artillery and do no 1 and gunner. Very good and without mistakes for a long time. And.
S64.Q97.C_1: a fellow who hardly know anything gets the stripes by sucking. I feel I like to earn for mine and work for it than by sucking. Our Lt. don't give you a fair break at all. Just his friends. Things like that discourage a person not to work hard.
S64.Q97.Full: The Army is O.K. I like it. What makes me dislike it sometimes is how is run. By favoritism and ass sucking. If you can suck ass you can get stripes no matter how dumb, if you don't you're out of luck. I am in the 105 [unclear] [/unclear] field artillery and do no 1 and gunner. Very good and without mistakes for a long time. And. a fellow who hardly know anything gets the stripes by sucking. I feel I like to earn for mine and work for it than by sucking. Our Lt. don't give you a fair break at all. Just his friends. Things like that discourage a person not to work hard.

S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: No remarks our army is the best in the world
S64.Q97.Full: No remarks our army is the best in the world

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: The Army officers are to superior feeling to the men and in most cases treat a man's opinion as coming from a very low or inferior person.
S64.Q97.Full: The Army officers are to superior feeling to the men and in most cases treat a man's opinion as coming from a very low or inferior person.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page

S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: The Army makes statements about placing the men where best suited but in most case where most needed. A man with experience in a Count Artillery is sent to a different branch of service altogether [unclear] [/unclear] to him, And if he has a rating and can not come up to par in a certain time is busted to a private when he could been the line he has the best knowledge of but no he
S64.Q97.C_1: pushed around like a bunch of cattle. Or if he is trying for a transfer it is disaproved (disapproved) befor (before) it begins.
