A man with experience in a Count Artillery is sent to a different branch of service altogether [unclear] [/unclear] to him, And if he has a rating and can not come up to par in a certain time is busted to a private when he could been the line he has the best knowledge of but no he  pushed around like a bunch of cattle. Or if he is trying for a transfer it is disaproved (disapproved) befor (before) it begins.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Too many of the things in the Army are too uncertain never know what going on what to happen. No enough information is give out to the men. keep in the dark too much on situations that we should know about.
S64.Q97.Full: Too many of the things in the Army are too uncertain never know what going on what to happen. No enough information is give out to the men. keep in the dark too much on situations that we should know about.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I think the Army could do a lot better in its occupational classification of men. I have seen many instances were men with leg or foot trouble have been put in the infantry where they are practically useless whereas they could be very useful in some other branch. Officers are changed to frequently. More efficient use of training time so as try not to take up so much of the mens time that is supposed to be used for rest or moral support.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the Army could do a lot better in its occupational classification of men. I have seen many instances were men with leg or foot trouble have been put in the infantry where they are practically useless whereas they could be very useful in some other branch. Officers are changed to frequently. More efficient use of training time so as try not to take up so much of the mens time that is supposed to be used for rest or moral support.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Yes, We don't get enough sleep and to many problems at a time. We walk and officers ride the jeeps and we sleep on the damn ground and the officer sleeps in Bed Rolls. The soldier doesn't have a fair chance. If we are to go into battle with them, they should be made sleep on the ground also. If they suppose to teach us the right things, they should do as we are doing. They should be made to carry full field pack as well as us. They are no better
S64.Q97.C_1: than we are. They teach us Stuff that very few men are interested in. Why couldn't we men who aren't interested in anything of the sort be Transfered to something we'd enjoy? No, they keep us here and try to make us learn it but its useless in Some Subjects. The food isn't so hot but we may take a bite of this & that and Walk up to the PX or service Club to finish our Meals. I understand this Army is to Be the Best fed in the world. If its the Best, I'd hate like hell to see the worst. Another thing. Why keep on drafting men. There's plenty in here that shouldn't t be in here, but these Doctors are the Best. I assure you of that. If the soldiers were given a chanced to stay off the post a week or two, it would build up the Morale of the Men. There wouldn't be so many Awol's. They give you a 15 day leave, 8 days is traveling time. Why don't they give 15-20-30-days plus Traveling time.
S64.Q97.Full: Yes, We don't get enough sleep and to many problems at a time. We walk and officers ride the jeeps and we sleep on the damn ground and the officer sleeps in Bed Rolls. The soldier doesn't have a fair chance. If we are to go into battle with them, they should be made sleep on the ground also. If they suppose to teach us the right things, they should do as we are doing. They should be made to carry full field pack as well as us. They are no better than we are. They teach us Stuff that very few men are interested in. Why couldn't we men who aren't interested in anything of the sort be Transfered to something we'd enjoy? No, they keep us here and try to make us learn it but its useless in Some Subjects. The food isn't so hot but we may take a bite of this & that and Walk up to the PX or service Club to finish our Meals. I understand this Army is to Be the Best fed in the world. If its the Best, I'd hate like hell to see the worst. Another thing. Why keep on drafting men. There's plenty in here that shouldn't t be in here, but these Doctors are the Best. I assure you of that. If the soldiers were given a chanced to stay off the post a week or two, it would build up the Morale of the Men. There wouldn't be so many Awol's. They give you a 15 day leave, 8 days is traveling time. Why don't they give 15-20-30-days plus Traveling time.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Things are a lot worse in homes like mine. I was supporting my parents, they are alone and have no one to help them. They aren't able to work, and my allotment will not take care of them.
S64.Q97.Full: Things are a lot worse in homes like mine. I was supporting my parents, they are alone and have no one to help them. They aren't able to work, and my allotment will not take care of them.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: There is but one thing I would like to enlarge on. The picking of noncoms could be greatly improved. If all men were to take competive tests covering all forms of Army life and work and those with the highest average grade taken. Too many know are subject well
S64.Q97.C_1: and know little or nothing about the rest. [paragraph] A General knowledge of all the work, guns and plans of a Unit should be a requirement of all noncoms[non commissioned officer] . [paragraph] More men should be allowed to fill in this blank it would serve to give those higher officers a chance to see what is going on in the smaller units.
S64.Q97.Full: There is but one thing I would like to enlarge on. The picking of noncoms could be greatly improved. If all men were to take competive tests covering all forms of Army life and work and those with the highest average grade taken. Too many know are subject well and know little or nothing about the rest. [paragraph] A General knowledge of all the work, guns and plans of a Unit should be a requirement of all noncoms[non commissioned officer] . [paragraph] More men should be allowed to fill in this blank it would serve to give those higher officers a chance to see what is going on in the smaller units.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Officers I think should carry same as enlisted men instead of being allowed sleeping bags which are carried in jeep trailer. This is suppose to be for weapons. Officers seem to have all rights and privileges in the army while enlisted men seem to be taken as nothing only ornaments to be [unclear] [/unclear]
S64.Q97.C_1: everthing (everything) The food is pretty good but their (there) is (are) lots of problems runned (being run) in the Army. Their is no sense to do marches which are so long. They hinder instead of help building me up.
S64.Q97.Full: Officers I think should carry same as enlisted men instead of being allowed sleeping bags which are carried in jeep trailer. This is suppose to be for weapons. Officers seem to have all rights and privileges in the army while enlisted men seem to be taken as nothing only ornaments to be [unclear] [/unclear]  everthing (everything) The food is pretty good but their (there) is (are) lots of problems runned (being run) in the Army. Their is no sense to do marches which are so long. They hinder instead of help building me up.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Why aren't the officers like enlisted men made carry the same equipment. Why are they allowed to crawl in a jeep half way through the hike and let some noncom bring the boy's up. Also why don't they dig slit trenches like the rest of the men. I bet they'd dig in i n battle wouldn't they.
S64.Q97.Full: Why aren't the officers like enlisted men made carry the same equipment. Why are they allowed to crawl in a jeep half way through the hike and let some noncom bring the boy's up. Also why don't they dig slit trenches like the rest of the men. I bet they'd dig in i n battle wouldn't they.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: The US (U.S.) is letting too many good soldiers out of the army. The doctors are too easily bluffed.
S64.Q97.Full: The US (U.S.) is letting too many good soldiers out of the army. The doctors are too easily bluffed.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Why are there married men with children in the Army when there are single men left out with jobs that the married men could hold. I don't think the draft boards are run wright.
S64.Q97.Full: Why are there married men with children in the Army when there are single men left out with jobs that the married men could hold. I don't think the draft boards are run wright.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: They do not give you the right medical care. If you are sick they make you work just the same. the Doctor don't take any [unclear] interest [/unclear] in the work and I don't think E.M. should work over 10 hours a day during training its different when he goes across, and they should make good non com instead of just any body they should give every man a try at the job.
S64.Q97.Full: They do not give you the right medical care. If you are sick they make you work just the same. the Doctor don't take any [unclear] interest [/unclear] in the work and I don't think E.M. should work over 10 hours a day during training its different when he goes across, and they should make good non com instead of just any body they should give every man a try at the job.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: They should have enough men in The Company to help pack the equipment so that it wouldn't make to hard on the other men. I would be a lot better if they feed us on time instead of feeding at 02:00 or 03:00 in the morning, and two sandwitches for lunch, then wait until
S64.Q97.C_1: 22:00 to 23:00 at night and feed us again. That don't (doesn't) gives (give us) much time to sleep and rest up.
S64.Q97.Full: They should have enough men in The Company to help pack the equipment so that it wouldn't make to hard on the other men. I would be a lot better if they feed us on time instead of feeding at 02:00 or 03:00 in the morning, and two sandwitches for lunch, then wait until 22:00 to 23:00 at night and feed us again. That don't (doesn't) gives (give us) much time to sleep and rest up.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I believe married men over 30 yrs [years] should be doing war work. I am a man 34 and I find it very difficult to stand up in training with the boys ten years younger than myself. I believe they should train the older men together, And the younger men by themselves.
S64.Q97.Full: I believe married men over 30 yrs [years] should be doing war work. I am a man 34 and I find it very difficult to stand up in training with the boys ten years younger than myself. I believe they should train the older men together, And the younger men by themselves.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: There is one thing I would like to discuss on the subject. Do you think such strict Military discipline is as necessary. A soldier still has feelings th same as he did before he came in the army. In civilian life anything he was asked to do was in a half nice way. Now everything he is told is in the roughest way they know how. I think if officers
S64.Q97.C_1: Would first gain the confidence of the men and then be as good to the men as they are to him. Of course there are some men you cant be good to but as a whole most of the men would do much better if a kind word was given once in a while. I think the officers should wear the same amount of equipment as the enlisted men. We fall out with full field pack and they wear only a very light pack and no rifle and half way on the hike they get on a jeep and ride in. I don't think that is hardly fair to the men. I think he should be able to go through everything an enlisted man does. A guy who would leave you now would do the same in Combat. I also [feel] that the Generals expect too much of the men. If he was so well trained he would already be in combat himself so I cant see why he thinks he is so much better than the rest. In my opinion all he want is a big name for himself. ([underline] Thanks a lot. [/underline] )
S64.Q97.Full: There is one thing I would like to discuss on the subject. Do you think such strict Military discipline is as necessary. A soldier still has feelings th same as he did before he came in the army. In civilian life anything he was asked to do was in a half nice way. Now everything he is told is in the roughest way they know how. I think if officers Would first gain the confidence of the men and then be as good to the men as they are to him. Of course there are some men you cant be good to but as a whole most of the men would do much better if a kind word was given once in a while. I think the officers should wear the same amount of equipment as the enlisted men. We fall out with full field pack and they wear only a very light pack and no rifle and half way on the hike they get on a jeep and ride in. I don't think that is hardly fair to the men. I think he should be able to go through everything an enlisted man does. A guy who would leave you now would do the same in Combat. I also [feel] that the Generals expect too much of the men. If he was so well trained he would already be in combat himself so I cant see why he thinks he is so much better than the rest. In my opinion all he want is a big name for himself. ([underline] Thanks a lot. [/underline] )

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)

S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: The medic could do more than what they are doing, if there is something wrong with you no matter what it is, they either give you pills or tell you that there is nothing wrong with you. They don't give you a chance to tell them what is wrong.
S64.Q97.Full: The medic could do more than what they are doing, if there is something wrong with you no matter what it is, they either give you pills or tell you that there is nothing wrong with you. They don't give you a chance to tell them what is wrong.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I have one remark: when the Army get ready to change a company from a large one to a smaller one they should finish makeing [making] the Mon-com [Non-com or Noncommissioned Officer] even if they do have to [too] many because a fellow feel like he's been [unclear] jip [/unclear] [jipped] . If he work hard for seven month and then when he's about to get his stripes there a new order cut canceling [cancelling]
S64.Q97.C_1: his job. That nocks [knocks] him for a loop.
S64.Q97.Full: I have one remark: when the Army get ready to change a company from a large one to a smaller one they should finish makeing [making] the Mon-com [Non-com or Noncommissioned Officer] even if they do have to [too] many because a fellow feel like he's been [unclear] jip [/unclear] [jipped] . If he work hard for seven month and then when he's about to get his stripes there a new order cut canceling [cancelling]  his job. That nocks [knocks] him for a loop.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I think our Officers should be better trained before they are put in command. [paragraph] Instead of taking the [deletion] Reg [/deletion] young men with a college degree give some of the old N.C.O.'s the ratings I think they would know more about training the men
S64.Q97.Full: I think our Officers should be better trained before they are put in command. [paragraph] Instead of taking the [deletion] Reg [/deletion] young men with a college degree give some of the old N.C.O.'s the ratings I think they would know more about training the men

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I don't think the allowance the Army gives for dependency is enough to keep our dependents.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't think the allowance the Army gives for dependency is enough to keep our dependents.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Why take these older men in the service. Why not put the men in that are more fit for instance from the years 20 to 30 years.
S64.Q97.Full: Why take these older men in the service. Why not put the men in that are more fit for instance from the years 20 to 30 years.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I know it is uselss to write this. Our outfit has been in the service for about 3 years. We have [unclear] [/unclear] corps, army Guard Force and other [unclear] [/unclear] . Most of the men wants to go across. [unclear] [/unclear] are getting disgusted and transferring to other branches of service. The morale is getting aful low. The men wants to move some place. We are getting all new equipment but it doesn't look like we are going any place. 2 battalions and brigade [unclear] [/unclear] are going over seas. We made better grades
S64.Q97.C_1: on all of our feet and we are considered a better outfit than they were. We here need two maneuvers and a third one is coming up. They also have camped us in a replacement training center. Most of the men didn't like that either.
S64.Q97.Full: I know it is uselss to write this. Our outfit has been in the service for about 3 years. We have [unclear] [/unclear] corps, army Guard Force and other [unclear] [/unclear] . Most of the men wants to go across. [unclear] [/unclear] are getting disgusted and transferring to other branches of service. The morale is getting aful low. The men wants to move some place. We are getting all new equipment but it doesn't look like we are going any place. 2 battalions and brigade [unclear] [/unclear] are going over seas. We made better grades on all of our feet and we are considered a better outfit than they were. We here need two maneuvers and a third one is coming up. They also have camped us in a replacement training center. Most of the men didn't like that either.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: All the further remarks I have in. i hope this war will soon be over so as i can go home again and settle down to civilian life again. Which is going to be quite complicated to me.
S64.Q97.Full: All the further remarks I have in. i hope this war will soon be over so as i can go home again and settle down to civilian life again. Which is going to be quite complicated to me.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I think that spys should be given the death penalty, and are too easy on them and give prisoners too much freedom. Also we should step on John L Lewis and strikers. They are doing more damage than Germany does in a year. Democracy is the freedom of everything but if workers aren't satisfied with their pay and hours, I wish they'd think of our boys on Guadalcanal fighting for their freedom, suffering and dying for them. Army life is
S64.Q97.C_1: a hard life. Give them a taste of it once. army camps should have more recreation facilitys (facilities) and more dances. Soldiers need feminen (feminine) companionship. At dances theyed (they'd) have the pleasure of meeting the opposite sex and it would bring their moral (morale) up. Theyed (They'd) look forward to entertainment and to a better job in the army
S64.Q97.Full: I think that spys should be given the death penalty, and are too easy on them and give prisoners too much freedom. Also we should step on John L Lewis and strikers. They are doing more damage than Germany does in a year. Democracy is the freedom of everything but if workers aren't satisfied with their pay and hours, I wish they'd think of our boys on Guadalcanal fighting for their freedom, suffering and dying for them. Army life is  a hard life. Give them a taste of it once. army camps should have more recreation facilitys (facilities) and more dances. Soldiers need feminen (feminine) companionship. At dances theyed (they'd) have the pleasure of meeting the opposite sex and it would bring their moral (morale) up. Theyed (They'd) look forward to entertainment and to a better job in the army

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: When they do things I wish they would do it right the first time, so we wouldn't have to do over & over again I mean working on the guns or firing them.
S64.Q97.Full: When they do things I wish they would do it right the first time, so we wouldn't have to do over & over again I mean working on the guns or firing them.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Would suggest that men being inducted into the army be sent closer to home for a period of 30 days and only issued fatigue clothes for that time. Test them out to see if they are physical (physically) fit for [insertion] the [/insertion] army instead of wasting time of cadre training them, also spending too much money on transportation and the like. The waste of all the time, salaries, clothing will cause taxes to be
S64.Q97.C_1: higher for carrying on the war. Would suggest all beer counters to be put in a special place instead of canteens. Some soldiers don't drink so they don't get around to the canteen to get necessary supplies because of so many beer drinkers. More limited service men to do permanent guard duty so that combat soldiers could get in more battle training.
S64.Q97.Full: Would suggest that men being inducted into the army be sent closer to home for a period of 30 days and only issued fatigue clothes for that time. Test them out to see if they are physical (physically) fit for [insertion] the [/insertion] army instead of wasting time of cadre training them, also spending too much money on transportation and the like. The waste of all the time, salaries, clothing will cause taxes to be  higher for carrying on the war. Would suggest all beer counters to be put in a special place instead of canteens. Some soldiers don't drink so they don't get around to the canteen to get necessary supplies because of so many beer drinkers. More limited service men to do permanent guard duty so that combat soldiers could get in more battle training.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Well there's one thing I'd like to say and that is that the army is the filthiest place I've ever seen for talk and the like. The morale standard of army men is very low. A decent - clean cut fellow when entering the army- in time falls prey to this filth. And I think the army almost encourages a lot of this filth cause the officers speak it right in the open. I don't know what our future generation is going to
S64.Q97.C_1: be like Im afraid it'll be awfully weak We are offending against the very thing were fighting for
S64.Q97.Full: Well there's one thing I'd like to say and that is that the army is the filthiest place I've ever seen for talk and the like. The morale standard of army men is very low. A decent - clean cut fellow when entering the army- in time falls prey to this filth. And I think the army almost encourages a lot of this filth cause the officers speak it right in the open. I don't know what our future generation is going to be like Im afraid it'll be awfully weak We are offending against the very thing were fighting for

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I think the army should give more time for athletics because it helps keep us soldiers in good condition, and most of them like it better than some of the things we do for conditioning.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the army should give more time for athletics because it helps keep us soldiers in good condition, and most of them like it better than some of the things we do for conditioning.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: They should have some way a [of] getting rid of Commanders that aren't worth a damn an can't get along with the boys.
S64.Q97.Full: They should have some way a [of] getting rid of Commanders that aren't worth a damn an can't get along with the boys.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: How is a man suppose to raise a family and be a good American father. If while he is in the army can not have his family with him. Why doesn't the government set up some kind of housing program? For service mens families near the camps. Money is being spent otherwise, why not do some good for the service mans part. Maybe if some of the politicians in this country had to go in the army for a few
S64.Q97.C_1: months (as a private) there would be something done about [unclear] [/unclear] nations like this
S64.Q97.Full: How is a man suppose to raise a family and be a good American father. If while he is in the army can not have his family with him. Why doesn't the government set up some kind of housing program? For service mens families near the camps. Money is being spent otherwise, why not do some good for the service mans part. Maybe if some of the politicians in this country had to go in the army for a few months (as a private) there would be something done about [unclear] [/unclear] nations like this

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: No remarks. Doing as good as any body [deletion] [/deletion] could expect under these conditions.
S64.Q97.Full: No remarks. Doing as good as any body [deletion] [/deletion] could expect under these conditions.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: On the subjects of Furloughs. I believe a man has a right to be home for a period of one week out of every six months. As it is now a quite a number of the fellows live better than 3,000 miles from home. By the time they get they can only stay short four or five days. Also transportation is terrible. Some of the fellows have lost as high as 2-3 days & that no good. In most of these Army towns a soldier is
S64.Q97.C_1: treated as dirt under most of these civilians, for the most part they are so stuck on themselves they can't see ahead of their nose. [paragraph] This doesn't help to make one feel any better.
S64.Q97.Full: On the subjects of Furloughs. I believe a man has a right to be home for a period of one week out of every six months. As it is now a quite a number of the fellows live better than 3,000 miles from home. By the time they get they can only stay short four or five days. Also transportation is terrible. Some of the fellows have lost as high as 2-3 days & that no good. In most of these Army towns a soldier is treated as dirt under most of these civilians, for the most part they are so stuck on themselves they can't see ahead of their nose. [paragraph] This doesn't help to make one feel any better.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I think that all soldiers should do the same regardless of their rank. Also I think they should provide homes for the Soldiers wifes [wives] & family & should give all Soldiers tires & gas (all they want) who have cars. I think a Soldier should have any thing [anything] in [within] reason, while he is in the Army..
S64.Q97.Full: I think that all soldiers should do the same regardless of their rank. Also I think they should provide homes for the Soldiers wifes [wives] & family & should give all Soldiers tires & gas (all they want) who have cars. I think a Soldier should have any thing [anything] in [within] reason, while he is in the Army..

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Too many full field inspections which I don't see any sense to. It's alright to have an inspection once a month or so, but every week is going [underline] too [/underline] far. We could be doing a lot of things on Saturday forenoon besides standing by our bunk or standing by our pup tent pout in the field. That's one reason why Rommel when through the
S64.Q97.C_1: forces in Africa they were having a full field at the time. Here's hoping for the time to come when the Army will discontinue full fields.
S64.Q97.Full: Too many full field inspections which I don't see any sense to. It's alright to have an inspection once a month or so, but every week is going [underline] too [/underline] far. We could be doing a lot of things on Saturday forenoon besides standing by our bunk or standing by our pup tent pout in the field. That's one reason why Rommel when through the forces in Africa they were having a full field at the time. Here's hoping for the time to come when the Army will discontinue full fields.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I've often been very disgusted when picking up a new paper, to see the headlines being taken up by some strike and know it's bound to affect the boys over seas much more, to think of what they are risking and giving. Why can one man have so much power to hinder the war effort and still nothing be done to put him in his place.
S64.Q97.Full: I've often been very disgusted when picking up a new paper, to see the headlines being taken up by some strike and know it's bound to affect the boys over seas much more, to think of what they are risking and giving. Why can one man have so much power to hinder the war effort and still nothing be done to put him in his place.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: My remarks won't mean much, but I think the outfits in the East [unclear] [/unclear] Camp Roberts Calif. [California] should have some G.I. truck to take the boys into town on weekend passes. [paragraph] Every weekend you have to wait two or three hours to get a bus, and that not very good when you just have 12 hour pass.
S64.Q97.Full: My remarks won't mean much, but I think the outfits in the East [unclear] [/unclear] Camp Roberts Calif. [California] should have some G.I. truck to take the boys into town on weekend passes. [paragraph] Every weekend you have to wait two or three hours to get a bus, and that not very good when you just have 12 hour pass.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I think we should have an athletics hour each day
S64.Q97.Full: I think we should have an athletics hour each day

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: The only thing I've got against the Army is ' ' They taken me away from my sisters, Brothers, and parents while I was [deletion] [/deletion] paying all bills. Now they can't get by.
S64.Q97.Full: The only thing I've got against the Army is ' ' They taken me away from my sisters, Brothers, and parents while I was [deletion] [/deletion] paying all bills. Now they can't get by.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: They have to [too] many inspections
S64.Q97.Full: They have to [too] many inspections

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I feel that men should be graded different (differently) than they have in our outfit.
S64.Q97.Full: I feel that men should be graded different (differently) than they have in our outfit.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Let's have better chow. [paragraph] Place men where they will do the most good.
S64.Q97.Full: Let's have better chow. [paragraph] Place men where they will do the most good.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I do believe that as long as person isn't in combat area that he should at least get to go home more often an a furlough especially after he has completed his Basic training & then doing the same daily routine over and over again. I had only 24 days at in almost three years, but I guess I haven't anything to grip about when boys in Combat seldom get that.
S64.Q97.Full: I do believe that as long as person isn't in combat area that he should at least get to go home more often an a furlough especially after he has completed his Basic training & then doing the same daily routine over and over again. I had only 24 days at in almost three years, but I guess I haven't anything to grip about when boys in Combat seldom get that.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Lets end this war as soon as possible so we can go home & live like human beings not like a bunch of prisoners in a penal farm. I have a wife & things aren't so good for her living alone with things as high as they are today. So lets go & end this Damn War.
S64.Q97.Full: Lets end this war as soon as possible so we can go home & live like human beings not like a bunch of prisoners in a penal farm. I have a wife & things aren't so good for her living alone with things as high as they are today. So lets go & end this Damn War.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Let's have less of this propaganda put out by various branches of the service There should be a law against "Flag waving" moving pictures Rules should be standardized when one outfit can have 15 day furloughs every six monther and another can only have eight or more days furloughs every year and they are both on the same training program it is bound to creat a lower moral and [deletion] [/deletion] ill feeling
S64.Q97.Full: Let's have less of this propaganda put out by various branches of the service There should be a law against "Flag waving" moving pictures Rules should be standardized when one outfit can have 15 day furloughs every six monther and another can only have eight or more days furloughs every year and they are both on the same training program it is bound to creat a lower moral and [deletion] [/deletion] ill feeling

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Should the axis powers decide to surrender we should be able to lay down our peace terms almost immediately & cut out any more parlys than are actually necessary. There should only be of complete surrender which would alow us to establish Int'l Police throughout the conquered nations. The sooner we start building the world on a safer democracy the better.
S64.Q97.Full: Should the axis powers decide to surrender we should be able to lay down our peace terms almost immediately & cut out any more parlys than are actually necessary. There should only be of complete surrender which would alow us to establish Int'l Police throughout the conquered nations. The sooner we start building the world on a safer democracy the better.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: The main thing wrong with the army is that a great many men are not put in the jobs where they had previous experience, or where they can do the most good. If this condition were somehow remedied it would increase the efficiency of many organizations and probably make a lot of men more contented and consenquesntly better soldiers.
S64.Q97.Full: The main thing wrong with the army is that a great many men are not put in the jobs where they had previous experience, or where they can do the most good. If this condition were somehow remedied it would increase the efficiency of many organizations and probably make a lot of men more contented and consenquesntly better soldiers.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I was chosen for the Field Artillery but as it seems to me I am not suited for this kind of work. My ambition is to be a flying man in the Air Camps or operate a machine-gun on a Flying Fortress.
S64.Q97.Full: I was chosen for the Field Artillery but as it seems to me I am not suited for this kind of work. My ambition is to be a flying man in the Air Camps or operate a machine-gun on a Flying Fortress.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: 45-B will fine it much easier to get jobs with telephone and telegraph companies than they would, had they not have had the training that the Army has given them [paragraph] 59-B men to much for the type of men they will have to fight [paragraph] 92 - B conditions of War.
S64.Q97.Full: 45-B will fine it much easier to get jobs with telephone and telegraph companies than they would, had they not have had the training that the Army has given them [paragraph] 59-B men to much for the type of men they will have to fight [paragraph] 92 - B conditions of War.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I'm in Field Artillery and am interested in the Air Corp. I can prove that I would be of profit to the Gov. and US as a whole if I go [unclear] [/unclear] it. Haven't much interest in the branch I'm in now.
S64.Q97.Full: I'm in Field Artillery and am interested in the Air Corp. I can prove that I would be of profit to the Gov. and US as a whole if I go [unclear] [/unclear] it. Haven't much interest in the branch I'm in now.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: the army lusts my every formalty that is concerned it marked a last of mental cases that could be provided. It causes harrowing deaths of young and old alike bury everyday. [insertion] [/insertion]
S64.Q97.Full: the army lusts my every formalty that is concerned it marked a last of mental cases that could be provided. It causes harrowing deaths of young and old alike bury everyday. [insertion] [/insertion]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Sometimes I feel as I were doing a lot more to win the war when I was at home. I was working in a steel mill and I was working hard so that our soldiers would have plenty of equipment. I feel as if I could still do more if I were back on my old job.
S64.Q97.Full: Sometimes I feel as I were doing a lot more to win the war when I was at home. I was working in a steel mill and I was working hard so that our soldiers would have plenty of equipment. I feel as if I could still do more if I were back on my old job.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: The Army is too conjested with red tape and damned Washington politics. I realize the vast nature of the job of running an army, but it seems to me that these conjested [unclear] strings [/unclear] could be attenuated by some hook or crook. The Army, in a way, is a reflection of our own government in the way it is run. But what can one soldier do about this?
S64.Q97.Full: The Army is too conjested with red tape and damned Washington politics. I realize the vast nature of the job of running an army, but it seems to me that these conjested [unclear] strings [/unclear] could be attenuated by some hook or crook. The Army, in a way, is a reflection of our own government in the way it is run. But what can one soldier do about this?

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I have a wife with no one to live with or share expenses. Living expenses are too hight [high] for her to meet alone since the crew income rates came into effect.
S64.Q97.Full: I have a wife with no one to live with or share expenses. Living expenses are too hight [high] for her to meet alone since the crew income rates came into effect.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Well my people don't have enough help.
S64.Q97.Full: Well my people don't have enough help.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Of course, this is a training center & we get very disgusted doing the same thing over again, but I'll still back up what we said and give good reasons.
S64.Q97.Full: Of course, this is a training center & we get very disgusted doing the same thing over again, but I'll still back up what we said and give good reasons.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Other/No answer

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Other/No answer
S64.Q97.F: I do not believe a man with a wife & established household of over 5 years should serve until all younger and unmarried men are drafted
S64.Q97.Full: I do not believe a man with a wife & established household of over 5 years should serve until all younger and unmarried men are drafted

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Ive been an Electrician at the Ford Motor Company since 1932 and Im experienced at the work 100% and would like something like that in the U.S.A. if I can get it. Im sure Id be more useful than runing up a bill with were if possibale ordinance or ground crew were up these Big Bomber instrument paneles inside of them.
S64.Q97.Full: Ive been an Electrician at the Ford Motor Company since 1932 and Im experienced at the work 100% and would like something like that in the U.S.A. if I can get it. Im sure Id be more useful than runing up a bill with were if possibale ordinance or ground crew were up these Big Bomber instrument paneles inside of them.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I feel that I am better qualified in another field and was not given enough consideration in this particular field. I find this true among other men as well as myself.
S64.Q97.Full: I feel that I am better qualified in another field and was not given enough consideration in this particular field. I find this true among other men as well as myself.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Do not feel that I am doing as much towards the war effort in the army as I was on the outside, therefore cannot see the advisability of keeping a person my age in the Army. Cannot accustom myself to the way of life too easily tho' have tried. I don't care to become a burden on anyone after release, and if this thing lasts much longer, I'll surely become such because of age. There are a great number
S64.Q97.C_1: of men my age & over that feel the same. Younger men, unmarried, and without responsibilities in civilian life, who could acquire the necessary - so - called discipline that is apparantly necessary to make an Army, sending the men 35 & over back to civilian life to do work they are better fitted for & accustomed to -
S64.Q97.Full: Do not feel that I am doing as much towards the war effort in the army as I was on the outside, therefore cannot see the advisability of keeping a person my age in the Army. Cannot accustom myself to the way of life too easily tho' have tried. I don't care to become a burden on anyone after release, and if this thing lasts much longer, I'll surely become such because of age. There are a great number of men my age & over that feel the same. Younger men, unmarried, and without responsibilities in civilian life, who could acquire the necessary - so - called discipline that is apparantly necessary to make an Army, sending the men 35 & over back to civilian life to do work they are better fitted for & accustomed to -

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I would like to see a little more emphasis on selection of officers. Based more on ability rather than schooling or "pull". Too many [underline] poor [/underline] officers have slipped through now. [unclear] [insertion] No [/insertion] [/unclear] [unclear] Take [/unclear] officer material from line outfits and the front lines. [paragraph] When passes are given, make it possible for the right decent fellows to have as much times as possible
S64.Q97.C_1: Give us more sergeants who bear down on military discipline and at the same time seem square about the whole thing. (paragraph) Let us know a little more about what will happen to us before the last minute arrives. (paragraphs) Quit pushing the Air Corp so much and allow some of the rest of us to feel like we are necessary. What would the Air Corp do without the infantry anyway. Give us a few days home before we go overseas.
S64.Q97.Full: I would like to see a little more emphasis on selection of officers. Based more on ability rather than schooling or "pull". Too many [underline] poor [/underline] officers have slipped through now. [unclear] [insertion] No [/insertion] [/unclear] [unclear] Take [/unclear] officer material from line outfits and the front lines. [paragraph] When passes are given, make it possible for the right decent fellows to have as much times as possible Give us more sergeants who bear down on military discipline and at the same time seem square about the whole thing. (paragraph) Let us know a little more about what will happen to us before the last minute arrives. (paragraphs) Quit pushing the Air Corp so much and allow some of the rest of us to feel like we are necessary. What would the Air Corp do without the infantry anyway. Give us a few days home before we go overseas.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: 1. Boys now entering army should have more chances for advancement. 2. Too many channels to go through for you to do something.
S64.Q97.Full: 1. Boys now entering army should have more chances for advancement. 2. Too many channels to go through for you to do something.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Re: Classification While the Army classification is by and large sound, it seems to me that the Army is not utilizing the specialized training of the personnel in all fields. For example, I am a C.P.A. I read all accounting journals that the Fiscal Division Services of Supply, is or has been in need of accountants. Yet I have been attached to a clerk's battery. I do not mean to minimize
S64.Q97.C_1: the work of a clerk, but I believe that I am qualified for work of a [insertion] more [/insertion] complex nature.
S64.Q97.Full: Re: Classification While the Army classification is by and large sound, it seems to me that the Army is not utilizing the specialized training of the personnel in all fields. For example, I am a C.P.A. I read all accounting journals that the Fiscal Division Services of Supply, is or has been in need of accountants. Yet I have been attached to a clerk's battery. I do not mean to minimize the work of a clerk, but I believe that I am qualified for work of a [insertion] more [/insertion] complex nature.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: When a soldier wants to do something, he has to see everybody and his brother. Dispense with a lot of the red tape & a soldier might get an idea of which end is up. [paragraph] Work hard approximately eight hours & then give a soldier a chance to breathe.
S64.Q97.Full: When a soldier wants to do something, he has to see everybody and his brother. Dispense with a lot of the red tape & a soldier might get an idea of which end is up. [paragraph] Work hard approximately eight hours & then give a soldier a chance to breathe.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: In my observation the army is too large to be run efficiently and most effectively. There are important duties on the outside that are getting too little attention and a few army men could be used to advantage here. War job wages are outrageously high while the soldier, generally a better man, who works harder and risks his life is paid much too little especially if he has dependents. Too much graft in army - promotions in many
S64.Q97.C_1: cares, and opportunity to friends of high ranking officers. This is a bad situation, and makes other personnel feel distasteful to army life - Hard on morale. Make all endure hardships of war not just a few. There are a lot of intelligent men with leadership ability taken in recently through ERC. Their opportunities to gain jobs of leadership is nill because too many hasetily choosen officers have been selected in past two yrs. I have noticed that in many cases ERC men are more tactful & have more knowledge about subjects taught then officers.
S64.Q97.Full: In my observation the army is too large to be run efficiently and most effectively. There are important duties on the outside that are getting too little attention and a few army men could be used to advantage here. War job wages are outrageously high while the soldier, generally a better man, who works harder and risks his life is paid much too little especially if he has dependents. Too much graft in army - promotions in many cares, and opportunity to friends of high ranking officers. This is a bad situation, and makes other personnel feel distasteful to army life - Hard on morale. Make all endure hardships of war not just a few. There are a lot of intelligent men with leadership ability taken in recently through ERC. Their opportunities to gain jobs of leadership is nill because too many hasetily choosen officers have been selected in past two yrs. I have noticed that in many cases ERC men are more tactful & have more knowledge about subjects taught then officers.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think if everyone in the land of freedom would do his utmost to win the war and stop quibbling we would win a hell of a lot sooner. Too many people don't know there is war going on!
S64.Q97.Full: I think if everyone in the land of freedom would do his utmost to win the war and stop quibbling we would win a hell of a lot sooner. Too many people don't know there is war going on!

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I just want the war to end so that we can return home & resume a normal life. I'm interested in a home & family of my own, but I want a free country in which to have these. [underline] Ultimate Victory is my desire -- [/underline]
S64.Q97.Full: I just want the war to end so that we can return home & resume a normal life. I'm interested in a home & family of my own, but I want a free country in which to have these. [underline] Ultimate Victory is my desire -- [/underline]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: (Haven't been in long enough to complain)
S64.Q97.F: I think a little more trouble might be taken to fit men to their jobs. I qualified as skilled in radio, yet I am a cannoneer in the Field Artillery. This might be because they expect me to go to A.S.T. {Army Specialized Training Program] , but in case I do not, the army has lost a skilled radio man, for which there is supposed to be a crying need. Too much attention seems to be paid to quotas rather than fitting
S64.Q97.C_1: men to jobs. This may be a little out of the scope of this survey, but I think too many men were called out of colleges, both in the E.R.C. and in the draft. With all the cry about a post war world, a good one will be impossible without college educated men. Even men studying highly technical and nec-essary sciences were called with out regard for standing or progress - only draft status or army status.
S64.Q97.Full: I think a little more trouble might be taken to fit men to their jobs. I qualified as skilled in radio, yet I am a cannoneer in the Field Artillery. This might be because they expect me to go to A.S.T. {Army Specialized Training Program] , but in case I do not, the army has lost a skilled radio man, for which there is supposed to be a crying need. Too much attention seems to be paid to quotas rather than fitting men to jobs. This may be a little out of the scope of this survey, but I think too many men were called out of colleges, both in the E.R.C. and in the draft. With all the cry about a post war world, a good one will be impossible without college educated men. Even men studying highly technical and nec-essary sciences were called with out regard for standing or progress - only draft status or army status.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: The training could be a little longer and carefully planed [planned] out.
S64.Q97.Full: The training could be a little longer and carefully planed [planned] out.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I'm in limited service. What training we've done is not worth a tinkers dam - as far as beating Hitler goes. I did much more as a civilian gunner working at a proving ground & farming - than I'm doing now. If a man can't get in general service, put him in war work and let the ....
S64.Q97.C_1: Waacs[Women's Army Auxiliary Corps] do limited service work. A man can do more at home than in [deletion] [/deletion] [unclear] L. [/unclear] Service division. My complaint back down to [insertion] [underline] this [/underline] [/insertion] That I haven't learned a dam thing I have yet to know if I ever will & I doubt it. Limted service is a farce. We have little chance of getting in the fight - so why teach us to march. Let us get home where we are needed & we can accomplish something that will stop the Axis The Lord knows they need manpower at home & as long as we're doing nothing here - Send us where we can. [paragraph] If you [insertion] do [/insertion] give us a job that is of value in winning the war - I'll apologize - But, not till then!
S64.Q97.Full: I'm in limited service. What training we've done is not worth a tinkers dam - as far as beating Hitler goes. I did much more as a civilian gunner working at a proving ground & farming - than I'm doing now. If a man can't get in general service, put him in war work and let the .... Waacs[Women's Army Auxiliary Corps] do limited service work. A man can do more at home than in [deletion] [/deletion] [unclear] L. [/unclear] Service division. My complaint back down to [insertion] [underline] this [/underline] [/insertion] That I haven't learned a dam thing I have yet to know if I ever will & I doubt it. Limted service is a farce. We have little chance of getting in the fight - so why teach us to march. Let us get home where we are needed & we can accomplish something that will stop the Axis The Lord knows they need manpower at home & as long as we're doing nothing here - Send us where we can. [paragraph] If you [insertion] do [/insertion] give us a job that is of value in winning the war - I'll apologize - But, not till then!

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: About 8 out of 10 2nd Lts! stink. For a man whose supposed to be a man & leader they are awful. R.O.T.C. bookworms are absolutely lousy. They try to take over before they know what the score is, and they just screw up a man's outfit. Another thing I don't like is Army politics. Handshakers get ahead too fast, & officers are suckers for handshakers. I think a man should be promoted on ability & time & experience, and not because he goes out & buys his topkick good whiskey.
S64.Q97.Full: About 8 out of 10 2nd Lts! stink. For a man whose supposed to be a man & leader they are awful. R.O.T.C. bookworms are absolutely lousy. They try to take over before they know what the score is, and they just screw up a man's outfit. Another thing I don't like is Army politics. Handshakers get ahead too fast, & officers are suckers for handshakers. I think a man should be promoted on ability & time & experience, and not because he goes out & buys his topkick good whiskey.

S64.Q95.M_marginalia: I havent had a furlough
S64.Q97.F: [deletion] [/deletion] I have a mother and two brothers and they need me for my father is ded that is all I know

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: In this battery, men who are skillful in a certain job are allowed to do that job all the time while men unskilled at it aren't given a chance to learn. When the officers and non-coms can't find enough things for a soldier to do, I don't think they should punish soldiers for resting at that time. The clothing usually is either too large or too small. We were given 3 suits of suntan and 2 suits
S64.Q97.C_1: of fatigues. We only wear [unclear] suntors [/unclear] about once a week & we wear fatigues every day. Why don't they issue us more fatugues? Another thing I dont like is being so far from home that it takes me 3 months salary to pay for train fare when I get a furlough.
S64.Q97.Full: In this battery, men who are skillful in a certain job are allowed to do that job all the time while men unskilled at it aren't given a chance to learn. When the officers and non-coms can't find enough things for a soldier to do, I don't think they should punish soldiers for resting at that time. The clothing usually is either too large or too small. We were given 3 suits of suntan and 2 suits  of fatigues. We only wear [unclear] suntors [/unclear] about once a week & we wear fatigues every day. Why don't they issue us more fatugues? Another thing I dont like is being so far from home that it takes me 3 months salary to pay for train fare when I get a furlough.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Some noncoms[non commissioned officers] take a natural disliking to a knew private who has not done anything I do not think its fair
S64.Q97.Full: Some noncoms[non commissioned officers] take a natural disliking to a knew private who has not done anything I do not think its fair

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: After talking to all of the fellows in my outfit about various subjects I am deeply worried about the social question. Classes must be segregated or we'll fight another civil war. Why hasn't John L Lewis been shot for treason? The American people do not know what their loves ones are fighting for - why isn't the public
S64.Q97.C_1: informed about atrocities, hardship, etc. In my home town you'd hardly believe a war was being fought. Start planning now for the future - set up probable solutions and don't let politicians change the plans. There's too much politics and favoritism in the Army today.
S64.Q97.Full: After talking to all of the fellows in my outfit about various subjects I am deeply worried about the social question. Classes must be segregated or we'll fight another civil war. Why hasn't John L Lewis been shot for treason? The American people do not know what their loves ones are fighting for - why isn't the public  informed about atrocities, hardship, etc. In my home town you'd hardly believe a war was being fought. Start planning now for the future - set up probable solutions and don't let politicians change the plans. There's too much politics and favoritism in the Army today.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: At present I'm an acting noncom. My platoon commander and noncoms do their utmost to help me and the rest of the men. I am looking toward O.C.S, but my main reason for joining the Army was to get the war over with (with voctory for us) so I could resume living like an American should live and so that the other countries allied with us could at least have a fair chance to carry on as they were before the German-Japan seige. I feelconfident that the U.S. people have the stuff to win and I feel the
S64.Q97.C_1: Army is doing the most they can in the quickest time to speed up peace settlements.
S64.Q97.Full: At present I'm an acting noncom. My platoon commander and noncoms do their utmost to help me and the rest of the men. I am looking toward O.C.S, but my main reason for joining the Army was to get the war over with (with voctory for us) so I could resume living like an American should live and so that the other countries allied with us could at least have a fair chance to carry on as they were before the German-Japan seige. I feelconfident that the U.S. people have the stuff to win and I feel the  Army is doing the most they can in the quickest time to speed up peace settlements.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Other/No answer
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: I have not been in the army long enough.
S64.Q97.F: I feel that the average enlisted man is considered by an officer to be of [insertion] a [/insertion] mental caliber akin to a moron. Whether they (officers) are taught this or not I don't know. But I feel that if officers would prepare their futures etc, in advance and [deletion] tried [/deletion] talk to their men [deletion] [/deletion] as if they were at least somewhat intelligent
S64.Q97.C_1: a more responsive result would be found than is now the case. Preparation of material is I have found a great weakness among the 2nd Lieutenants who have instructed us. Almost no Lieutenant bothers to prepare a lecture in ordnance. As a result, he begins to repeat, to ask absurd questions of his men, and to be sidetracked onto completely irrelevant topics. Thus probably three out of the eight hours of training a day are a complete waste of time even to the most stupid of enlisted men.
S64.Q97.Full: I feel that the average enlisted man is considered by an officer to be of [insertion] a [/insertion] mental caliber akin to a moron. Whether they (officers) are taught this or not I don't know. But I feel that if officers would prepare their futures etc, in advance and [deletion] tried [/deletion] talk to their men [deletion] [/deletion] as if they were at least somewhat intelligent a more responsive result would be found than is now the case. Preparation of material is I have found a great weakness among the 2nd Lieutenants who have instructed us. Almost no Lieutenant bothers to prepare a lecture in ordnance. As a result, he begins to repeat, to ask absurd questions of his men, and to be sidetracked onto completely irrelevant topics. Thus probably three out of the eight hours of training a day are a complete waste of time even to the most stupid of enlisted men.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Well I like the army fine, and its a good place too be. You got plenty to eat, also it sure is a healthy place to be.
S64.Q97.Full: Well I like the army fine, and its a good place too be. You got plenty to eat, also it sure is a healthy place to be.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: A lot of officers don't know how to handle men. That is one of the biggest gripe. They are not human enough. However I still like the army. Too many of them like to show their authority ([underline] especially [/underline] ) "90 day wonders". The food is pretty good but not enough milk. The entertainments are just about sufficient.
S64.Q97.C_1: I think more furloughs are in order however the clothing is very good. [paragraph] The prices at the Camp Roberts posts exchanges are very high though.
S64.Q97.Full: A lot of officers don't know how to handle men. That is one of the biggest gripe. They are not human enough. However I still like the army. Too many of them like to show their authority ([underline] especially [/underline] ) "90 day wonders". The food is pretty good but not enough milk. The entertainments are just about sufficient.  I think more furloughs are in order however the clothing is very good. [paragraph] The prices at the Camp Roberts posts exchanges are very high though.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I don't think they should draft boys 18 years old.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't think they should draft boys 18 years old.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: One thin I have noticed through out (throughout) the army is the inefficiency of organization and finance. This will probably seem more and more reasonable the longer I am in the army but it is abuisus (abuses) that the army would do well to organize specialists to keep a check on such matters - trained efficiency experts perhaps.
S64.Q97.C_1: I also think that our soldiers in a lot of cases need more rigorous tactical experience before going into action.
S64.Q97.Full: One thin I have noticed through out (throughout) the army is the inefficiency of organization and finance. This will probably seem more and more reasonable the longer I am in the army but it is abuisus (abuses) that the army would do well to organize specialists to keep a check on such matters - trained efficiency experts perhaps. I also think that our soldiers in a lot of cases need more rigorous tactical experience before going into action.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think the men should get a furlough when their basic training up [is] over. For when they report back I believe it makes them willing to try that much harder.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the men should get a furlough when their basic training up [is] over. For when they report back I believe it makes them willing to try that much harder.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Dear General -- I was in 3rd year advanced ROTC at university. In Sept. 1942, I was 19, didn't know what to do, what I should do. You said stay in school, join the CAC, take advanced ROTC until you graduate, going to summer school. That way, you said, I'd get a commission -- "the army wants educated officers". So I did just that. Just before I left for school, Stemson said
S64.Q97.C_1: the ERC would be called before the end of the year, but he could stay in school. So much confusion & uncertainty I went to school, made worst grades, learned less than ever before - and I didn't get called until April 19 and I called - activated with beginning of ASTP unit on cpon?? in 10 minute notice. I was told after training corresponding to senior year military study, I'd be sent to OCS, activation was a farce. I'm now in ordinary basic training, learning night ?? & now 3rd year ROTC men are being sent back to school after training which may be extended. I've been confused enough going to school; I'll take care of my own education after the war. I only want the commission you promised me a crack at. I know now I should have enlisted in Sept But I don't care about that. Just don't doublecross me now. Just give me the chance. I'm tired of being the bastard in the army in to nobody knows about.
S64.Q97.Full: Dear General -- I was in 3rd year advanced ROTC at university. In Sept. 1942, I was 19, didn't know what to do, what I should do. You said stay in school, join the CAC, take advanced ROTC until you graduate, going to summer school. That way, you said, I'd get a commission -- "the army wants educated officers". So I did just that. Just before I left for school, Stemson said the ERC would be called before the end of the year, but he could stay in school. So much confusion & uncertainty I went to school, made worst grades, learned less than ever before - and I didn't get called until April 19 and I called - activated with beginning of ASTP unit on cpon?? in 10 minute notice. I was told after training corresponding to senior year military study, I'd be sent to OCS, activation was a farce. I'm now in ordinary basic training, learning night ?? & now 3rd year ROTC men are being sent back to school after training which may be extended. I've been confused enough going to school; I'll take care of my own education after the war. I only want the commission you promised me a crack at. I know now I should have enlisted in Sept But I don't care about that. Just don't doublecross me now. Just give me the chance. I'm tired of being the bastard in the army in to nobody knows about.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: 6 weeks training are enough in the F.A. [Field Artillery] . We should go to Field immediately. College men are coming into the army & they are getting no breaks. Brains are [unclear] [/unclear] count & we have more than the average.
S64.Q97.Full: 6 weeks training are enough in the F.A. [Field Artillery] . We should go to Field immediately. College men are coming into the army & they are getting no breaks. Brains are [unclear] [/unclear] count & we have more than the average.
