document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Other/No answer
S64.Q97.F: Maybe you can't understand why I ansered [answered] some of the questions as I did. I was drafed [drafted] a sick man wich [which] the army knows and have never been able to get treatment in the army so as nature goes the army let me down so why shouldn't I let the Army down all my life I went forward till now but sick men don't go forward when kicked. The Army is swell but the medics is in camp Raferty hell they think everybody is a Goldbrick and that logic will make more Goldbricks than it will cure.
S64.Q97.Full: Maybe you can't understand why I ansered [answered] some of the questions as I did. I was drafed [drafted] a sick man wich [which] the army knows and have never been able to get treatment in the army so as nature goes the army let me down so why shouldn't I let the Army down all my life I went forward till now but sick men don't go forward when kicked. The Army is swell but the medics is in camp Raferty hell they think everybody is a Goldbrick and that logic will make more Goldbricks than it will cure.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think they could have a lot better laundry service in the Army. it takes about three weeks to get our washing back from the laundry and I have not been able to buy any clothes since I got in the Army
S64.Q97.Full: I think they could have a lot better laundry service in the Army. it takes about three weeks to get our washing back from the laundry and I have not been able to buy any clothes since I got in the Army

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think the boys who have to ship overseas should have a furlough before going. It's a damn dirty trick my particular regiment plays on the boys with regards to these furlough. They put them on shipping orders a week before they graduate as they won't have to give them furloughs. I don't know who is responsible but its pretty damn dirty in my estimation. Also when passes are suppose to start at 1200 and they won't issue them till 1400 it
S64.Q97.C_1: takes away 2 precious hours of a 36 hour pass. All the fellows in my outfit have express the same views as mine.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the boys who have to ship overseas should have a furlough before going. It's a damn dirty trick my particular regiment plays on the boys with regards to these furlough. They put them on shipping orders a week before they graduate as they won't have to give them furloughs. I don't know who is responsible but its pretty damn dirty in my estimation. Also when passes are suppose to start at 1200 and they won't issue them till 1400 it takes away 2 precious hours of a 36 hour pass. All the fellows in my outfit have express the same views as mine.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I haven't any remarks. I think that the army treats their soldiers with the Best of care in every thing.
S64.Q97.Full: I haven't any remarks. I think that the army treats their soldiers with the Best of care in every thing.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I think that in our training they give us too much to do and naturally we don't get full benefit of what we do.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that in our training they give us too much to do and naturally we don't get full benefit of what we do.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I believe such ideas as this survey, for example, are excellent & indicate that the Army is progressive & interested in its general improvement - I only hope the Army puts what knowledge it obtains here to practical use. I am overwhelmed at the good job, in general, that the Army is
S64.Q97.C_1: doing - in civilian life I had heard quite the opposite. I believe the army is not only doing its job well but that the army's role is important in that millions of our youth are becoming more conscious of their surroundings, more 'military-minded', and more disciplined as a result of army life. These traits & characteristics will undoubtedly be of great value in the many long, difficult years that be ahead of us, particularly after victory is ours.
S64.Q97.Full: I believe such ideas as this survey, for example, are excellent & indicate that the Army is progressive & interested in its general improvement - I only hope the Army puts what knowledge it obtains here to practical use. I am overwhelmed at the good job, in general, that the Army is doing - in civilian life I had heard quite the opposite. I believe the army is not only doing its job well but that the army's role is important in that millions of our youth are becoming more conscious of their surroundings, more 'military-minded', and more disciplined as a result of army life. These traits & characteristics will undoubtedly be of great value in the many long, difficult years that be ahead of us, particularly after victory is ours.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I don't see why in heck a man has to be tied down as cadre in Camp Roberts. I think L.S. [Logistics Support] should take over and let the men that want to fight get the hell out of here where they can do some good.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't see why in heck a man has to be tied down as cadre in Camp Roberts. I think L.S. [Logistics Support] should take over and let the men that want to fight get the hell out of here where they can do some good.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: The army is OK with me. The only complaint I have is that certain things are done which have no sense to it at all. The EM do all the work in the organization which is alright but the officers should be sure of the orders they give before they give them. I feel that where the CM (non-coms) will have all the work on his hands, he should take part with the officers
S64.Q97.C_1: in planning. Most officers are too afraid of their superiors to take chances for the welfare of their men. If the head of a command is not aggressive in [insertion] an [/insertion] effort to help the men, it will be found that the lower echelons will be the same. Commanding officers should be very practical people[.] I have seen some that are not[.] the war will end but not very soon[.] We should use more of our air power than we are doing right now. No doubt there is a reason for us not doing so . If we could do to all of the German cities what we did to Hamburg, we will surely knock Germany out in a hurry. Japan will take longer but they will also meet wrath of our air forces. We are the greatest war production country in the world. The enemy has learned that
S64.Q97.Full: The army is OK with me. The only complaint I have is that certain things are done which have no sense to it at all. The EM do all the work in the organization which is alright but the officers should be sure of the orders they give before they give them. I feel that where the CM (non-coms) will have all the work on his hands, he should take part with the officers  in planning. Most officers are too afraid of their superiors to take chances for the welfare of their men. If the head of a command is not aggressive in [insertion] an [/insertion] effort to help the men, it will be found that the lower echelons will be the same. Commanding officers should be very practical people[.] I have seen some that are not[.] the war will end but not very soon[.] We should use more of our air power than we are doing right now. No doubt there is a reason for us not doing so . If we could do to all of the German cities what we did to Hamburg, we will surely knock Germany out in a hurry. Japan will take longer but they will also meet wrath of our air forces. We are the greatest war production country in the world. The enemy has learned that

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)

S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I have but one eye. If I get into battle and get the other one injured I am no good. I can do a lot on a farm. I am not afraid to fight. It is unfair to turn some out in my shape and keep me. Please don't think I am trying to take self pity on myself. I am just trying to get fair play same
S64.Q97.C_1: of the soldiers look on me as a [unclear] ? [/unclear] , I know some of them don't want to go over with me. They feel I am a hazard. My life means nothing to me, I just want to take anyone else left because of something I can't help. I was (crossed out) was an [unclear] ? [/unclear] and at last will be.
S64.Q97.Full: I have but one eye. If I get into battle and get the other one injured I am no good. I can do a lot on a farm. I am not afraid to fight. It is unfair to turn some out in my shape and keep me. Please don't think I am trying to take self pity on myself. I am just trying to get fair play same of the soldiers look on me as a [unclear] ? [/unclear] , I know some of them don't want to go over with me. They feel I am a hazard. My life means nothing to me, I just want to take anyone else left because of something I can't help. I was (crossed out) was an [unclear] ? [/unclear] and at last will be.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: If a soldier is in one branch of the Army, and doesn't like it, where as if he was in some other special branch he would like and would be doing just as much toward winning the war, he should be granted a transfer. For instance, myself, I volunteered for the Air Corp; but instead
S64.Q97.C_1: I ge the quartermaster. So naturally I haven't got interest in my work here, like I would have in the Air Corp [Corps] . I always said that you won't ever get any place as far as your job is concerned unless you put some interest in it. [paragraph] I turned down a deferment and volunteered for the Air Corp [Corps] . But instead of getting it, I wind up here - so you can very well see how I feel - [double underline] Thanks [/double underline]
S64.Q97.Full: If a soldier is in one branch of the Army, and doesn't like it, where as if he was in some other special branch he would like and would be doing just as much toward winning the war, he should be granted a transfer. For instance, myself, I volunteered for the Air Corp; but instead I ge the quartermaster. So naturally I haven't got interest in my work here, like I would have in the Air Corp [Corps] . I always said that you won't ever get any place as far as your job is concerned unless you put some interest in it. [paragraph] I turned down a deferment and volunteered for the Air Corp [Corps] . But instead of getting it, I wind up here - so you can very well see how I feel - [double underline] Thanks [/double underline]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I as a privet [private] of the army want to advance and make good and see the war won. But I think I am neglected on the part of making a rating. I see fellows do less and get more. That is before the rating is given out. I think we should be given a chance to see who is best qualified.
S64.Q97.C_1: When I was a civilian I thought all soldiers was given the same chance. That is not counting officers. But it seems that there's a unnecessary granting to one more than another. I am willing to do my part and more if I am given the right and privalidge [privilege] to for [underline] The war must be won. [/underline]
S64.Q97.Full: I as a privet [private] of the army want to advance and make good and see the war won. But I think I am neglected on the part of making a rating. I see fellows do less and get more. That is before the rating is given out. I think we should be given a chance to see who is best qualified. When I was a civilian I thought all soldiers was given the same chance. That is not counting officers. But it seems that there's a unnecessary granting to one more than another. I am willing to do my part and more if I am given the right and privalidge [privilege] to for [underline] The war must be won. [/underline]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)

S64.Q97.F: Food - supplys are good but could be prepared much better. Completed training with the 6/5th GM Btry Co. It had the best officers I've seen yet all the men were tough, would still like to be with them

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: There are many departments & branches of the Army that are probably as near perfection or could be expected. However there are some, one of which I am a member, that absolutely [underline] stink. [/underline} (paragraph) The army as a whole I think is still running and & operating upon the same old principals (principles), ideas & tactcs (tactics), that were used & practiced fifty years ago.
S64.Q97.C_1: I would like to see all the army operated in such a maner [manner] that every young man in the U.S. would jump at the oportunity [opportunity] to become a member of it. And after the war is forgotten in peace-times every citizen in the country, male + female, could proudly say that he or she would be delighted to entertain any soldier in his own home. There certainly is a world of room for improvement. To be perfectly honest + practical in my opinion, however, I don't expect the American people nor the U.S. Army to change the army, but very slightly in the next fifty years. It probably will still remain the U.S. Army.
S64.Q97.Full: There are many departments & branches of the Army that are probably as near perfection or could be expected. However there are some, one of which I am a member, that absolutely [underline] stink. [/underline} (paragraph) The army as a whole I think is still running and & operating upon the same old principals (principles), ideas & tactcs (tactics), that were used & practiced fifty years ago. I would like to see all the army operated in such a maner [manner] that every young man in the U.S. would jump at the oportunity [opportunity] to become a member of it. And after the war is forgotten in peace-times every citizen in the country, male + female, could proudly say that he or she would be delighted to entertain any soldier in his own home. There certainly is a world of room for improvement. To be perfectly honest + practical in my opinion, however, I don't expect the American people nor the U.S. Army to change the army, but very slightly in the next fifty years. It probably will still remain the U.S. Army.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Before I can be a good soldier I must admire and respect the Officers over me, especially the Co. Commander. I can not hardly believe the Army is so badly in need for officers that they would put a man like him in charge of about two hundred men. You would think we were boys of ten
S64.Q97.C_1: Or twelve years of age instead of men, the CO is more like a Boy Scout Camp than it is the army, He cares nothing for his men what so ever, Always "Barking" for [unclear] higer [/unclear] . Nothing in the six months I've been in the CO I have not seen him go out of his way to do anything that might make life a little easier for his men, and may God have mercy on the entire two hundred men if we have to go overseas with him and the other officers at this Co.
S64.Q97.Full: Before I can be a good soldier I must admire and respect the Officers over me, especially the Co. Commander. I can not hardly believe the Army is so badly in need for officers that they would put a man like him in charge of about two hundred men. You would think we were boys of ten Or twelve years of age instead of men, the CO is more like a Boy Scout Camp than it is the army, He cares nothing for his men what so ever, Always "Barking" for [unclear] higer [/unclear] . Nothing in the six months I've been in the CO I have not seen him go out of his way to do anything that might make life a little easier for his men, and may God have mercy on the entire two hundred men if we have to go overseas with him and the other officers at this Co.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I firmly believe that there are a lot of men in the service who are physical unfit. These men should be released for war jobs instead of being left in the service.
S64.Q97.Full: I firmly believe that there are a lot of men in the service who are physical unfit. These men should be released for war jobs instead of being left in the service.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I think that women should be around more with other men and not try to pull there rank all the time. Second _ Have all officers learn how to salute properly and not feel that they are any better than anyone else.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that women should be around more with other men and not try to pull there rank all the time. Second _ Have all officers learn how to salute properly and not feel that they are any better than anyone else.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Food could be better and so could be the cookes that cook it, and should wear clean whites every day
S64.Q97.Full: Food could be better and so could be the cookes that cook it, and should wear clean whites every day

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I would just like to say here, that I would be a lot better in the Army if I was put in a combat outfit. I used to belong in the Field Artillery & liked it. Also had Infantry training, I am supposed to be A.1. now but was put into the medics which I don't like. I have been a outdoors man most all my life.
S64.Q97.Full: I would just like to say here, that I would be a lot better in the Army if I was put in a combat outfit. I used to belong in the Field Artillery & liked it. Also had Infantry training, I am supposed to be A.1. now but was put into the medics which I don't like. I have been a outdoors man most all my life.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: In my outfit furloughs are too short for men living a great distance from camp to get there & come back --. after all that is the only time the can go home & its and then cadn go on weekend pass get about the same as the men living a great distance. [paragraph]The N.C. are picked most by friendship & by knowint the
S64.Q97.C_1: right person with a little pull in its outfit. This has caused a lot of confusing and will continue to do so.
S64.Q97.Full: In my outfit furloughs are too short for men living a great distance from camp to get there & come back --. after all that is the only time the can go home & its and then cadn go on weekend pass get about the same as the men living a great distance. [paragraph]The N.C. are picked most by friendship & by knowint the right person with a little pull in its outfit. This has caused a lot of confusing and will continue to do so.

S64.Q97.Full: Question: If Congress should declare a bonus, would a serviceman be eligible if he were discharged because of physical reasons before hostilities ceased? Would he be entitled to such services as hospitilyation [hospitalization] , etc?

S64.Q97.F: The army has built me up a little physically forever being a father of two children and a 3rd on the way. I feel they need me more than the armed forces. And I could do more on my type of work on a war job than I could in the army.
S64.Q97.Full: The army has built me up a little physically forever being a father of two children and a 3rd on the way. I feel they need me more than the armed forces. And I could do more on my type of work on a war job than I could in the army.

S64.Q97.C_1: could be much better than I'm doing right now.

S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M_marginalia: I think we get to much and should share some of it [deletion] [/deletion] with the home folks.!
S64.Q97.F: I think every one should have basic training. Also to be able to get in the type of outfit that would benefit all concerned. Stop waisting [wasting] so much clothes and food as I have seen in the past and present.
S64.Q97.Full: I think every one should have basic training. Also to be able to get in the type of outfit that would benefit all concerned. Stop waisting [wasting] so much clothes and food as I have seen in the past and present.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: The army in General is swell, but when they put a man in a place where he has no interest, They may as well give him to the Germany army, because that soldier is fighting against you, not for you. Thus leading to poor coroporating + AWOL'S[Absent With Out Leave] , which make a poor army.
S64.Q97.Full: The army in General is swell, but when they put a man in a place where he has no interest, They may as well give him to the Germany army, because that soldier is fighting against you, not for you. Thus leading to poor coroporating + AWOL'S[Absent With Out Leave] , which make a poor army.

S64.Q97.F: I disliked the army the first few months, but after getting [underline] properly [/underline] assigned to my present job, which I fit into, I like the army, aside from usual petty differences, naturally. U.S. is doing a great job & may we win soon, & return to our homes & loved ones.
S64.Q97.Full: I disliked the army the first few months, but after getting [underline] properly [/underline] assigned to my present job, which I fit into, I like the army, aside from usual petty differences, naturally. U.S. is doing a great job & may we win soon, & return to our homes & loved ones.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think a soldier should be able to get something to eat and drink after 12 o'clock at night which we can not do here in this hell hole. We should get food to eat for a change instead of the stuff we get.
S64.Q97.Full: I think a soldier should be able to get something to eat and drink after 12 o'clock at night which we can not do here in this hell hole. We should get food to eat for a change instead of the stuff we get.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page

S64.Q97.C_1: job to be done can never be fulfilled.
S64.Q97.Full: I'm strictly for the army if it is run right, but you have to have men in charge who know their job. Without such men, the  job to be done can never be fulfilled.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I have no reason to gripe at all about my army life. Fortunately I have been placed in a position as work that I had done in civilian life, enjoy doing it and my only hope is that I continue to do the work I'm doing at present.
S64.Q97.Full: I have no reason to gripe at all about my army life. Fortunately I have been placed in a position as work that I had done in civilian life, enjoy doing it and my only hope is that I continue to do the work I'm doing at present.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: At home people are making more money but taxes are higher. So the [they] make about as much. I am much satisfied with my organization. Had no preference when drafted and satisfied with my classification. I think highly of my organization and think it will be a good outfit overseas. Would not want
S64.Q97.C_1: To leave it for the world now.
S64.Q97.Full: At home people are making more money but taxes are higher. So the [they] make about as much. I am much satisfied with my organization. Had no preference when drafted and satisfied with my classification. I think highly of my organization and think it will be a good outfit overseas. Would not want To leave it for the world now.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I've just read about Argentina selling goods to Germany. And how Japanese prisoners got out of hand. Damn it, lets get hard and stopping being so easy with those rats. Men are dying from it. Get tough and stay tough or we won't ever win the peace.
S64.Q97.Full: I've just read about Argentina selling goods to Germany. And how Japanese prisoners got out of hand. Damn it, lets get hard and stopping being so easy with those rats. Men are dying from it. Get tough and stay tough or we won't ever win the peace.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: The army in most cases doesn't give a fellow the job he is best suited for. A lot of men I know personally are better suited for another job. I for one have had 4 years carpentry experience in school. Also 2 years machine experience on automobile motors and precision grinder on airplane motors. Now I am in the Medical Corps. I didn't get placed right
S64.Q97.C_1: and neither did thousands of other fellows
S64.Q97.Full: The army in most cases doesn't give a fellow the job he is best suited for. A lot of men I know personally are better suited for another job. I for one have had 4 years carpentry experience in school. Also 2 years machine experience on automobile motors and precision grinder on airplane motors. Now I am in the Medical Corps. I didn't get placed right  and neither did thousands of other fellows

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Why does the war department keep overtrained soldiers on this side when they can be of much better help on the other side. It seems to me the War Department sends more inexperienced men overseas than well trained men that's something I could never understand.
S64.Q97.Full: Why does the war department keep overtrained soldiers on this side when they can be of much better help on the other side. It seems to me the War Department sends more inexperienced men overseas than well trained men that's something I could never understand.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I would like to go home as soon as possible. I don't think that the Army is any place for a married man with 1 child, and an other child coming. I think that the Army life is alright for a single fellow. I think that all married men should be out of the Army.
S64.Q97.Full: I would like to go home as soon as possible. I don't think that the Army is any place for a married man with 1 child, and an other child coming. I think that the Army life is alright for a single fellow. I think that all married men should be out of the Army.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Medical troops in Gen Hosp and Sta. Hosp can be replaced by W.A.C.s in almost every job - most med. men seem to be of limited physical quality - they are better off in civilian life - doing essential war work. Japan should be completely destroyed as a nation and peace terms - ignored (negotiated).
S64.Q97.C_1: Germany should be so fixed that their reparations and controlled economics and education their "Prussionism" be educated out of them and never again to become strong enough in war materials to even attempt a small sized skirmish. [paragraph] War guilt should be impressed upon every German whether Nazi or fellow traveler. [paragraph] A world court and police system should be set up with teeth in it and a rotating composite allied Army Navy and Air Force ever ready to quiet any disturbance.
S64.Q97.Full: Medical troops in Gen Hosp and Sta. Hosp can be replaced by W.A.C.s in almost every job - most med. men seem to be of limited physical quality - they are better off in civilian life - doing essential war work. Japan should be completely destroyed as a nation and peace terms - ignored (negotiated). Germany should be so fixed that their reparations and controlled economics and education their "Prussionism" be educated out of them and never again to become strong enough in war materials to even attempt a small sized skirmish. [paragraph] War guilt should be impressed upon every German whether Nazi or fellow traveler. [paragraph] A world court and police system should be set up with teeth in it and a rotating composite allied Army Navy and Air Force ever ready to quiet any disturbance.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I am a medical corps man. I took my basic training in the Field artillery. And I think all Medical Corps men should have a certain amount of Combat training with rifles. It make a person feel more like a soldier. A soldier will act more snappy and can be commanded
S64.Q97.C_1: better if he is trained with a rifle. He will take more pride in being a soldier and will do a better job. What ever it may be. He may some day need to know how to shoot a gun.
S64.Q97.Full: I am a medical corps man. I took my basic training in the Field artillery. And I think all Medical Corps men should have a certain amount of Combat training with rifles. It make a person feel more like a soldier. A soldier will act more snappy and can be commanded better if he is trained with a rifle. He will take more pride in being a soldier and will do a better job. What ever it may be. He may some day need to know how to shoot a gun.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I spent 15 months at another post and enjoyed the work and living conditions more so than where I am now situated, and for the better of all concerned, including my Mother, I know [insertion] I [/insertion] was doing more for the War effort than at this new Post. [paragraph] Having 3 other brothers in the service and being so far from home; it made my mother feel bad not seeing
S64.Q97.C_1: any of them. Fortunately I was situated in a place where I was doing more for the War Effort and at the same time able to get home and try to cheer the family up a bit by just seeing one of us come home. The expression on Mother's face alone was enough to cause me to go home every chance I had and I doubt if there was anyone more satisfied in the Army than I was at my other post. It was not too G.I. and I was doing a good job and surprisingly so enjoying it. Very few fellows could say they enjoy their position in any branch of the service, but I can truthfully say I did, but not anymore. [paragraph] Constant scoldings and rough speaking are not necessary - more gentleman tactics should be practical and above all Common Sense.
S64.Q97.Full: I spent 15 months at another post and enjoyed the work and living conditions more so than where I am now situated, and for the better of all concerned, including my Mother, I know [insertion] I [/insertion] was doing more for the War effort than at this new Post. [paragraph] Having 3 other brothers in the service and being so far from home; it made my mother feel bad not seeing  any of them. Fortunately I was situated in a place where I was doing more for the War Effort and at the same time able to get home and try to cheer the family up a bit by just seeing one of us come home. The expression on Mother's face alone was enough to cause me to go home every chance I had and I doubt if there was anyone more satisfied in the Army than I was at my other post. It was not too G.I. and I was doing a good job and surprisingly so enjoying it. Very few fellows could say they enjoy their position in any branch of the service, but I can truthfully say I did, but not anymore. [paragraph] Constant scoldings and rough speaking are not necessary - more gentleman tactics should be practical and above all Common Sense.

If more time and effort were spent in the preparation of these programs, their results would be far more [unclear] farmable [/unclear] .

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Don't like KP for four days in a row. Non-coms should get it to.
S64.Q97.Full: Don't like KP for four days in a row. Non-coms should get it to.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Since we live in a free land with equal opportunities for everyone this fact should hold true in the army too, but this is not only the case. Luck plays an important part. To explain more thoroughly I will give my own case and many others like mine. Our detachment war formed about a year ago and men were shipped in, I would say about 150 men at first. Our detachment war to consist of about 500 men, but instead
S64.Q97.C_1: of waiting until we have had full strength they started to pass out the ratings. Soon we had our full number of men but the men who were shipped into this outfit late had not chance of getting shead shince the TO was all used up. Now a great deal of tese men have better inclinations and better qualifications than most of the non-comms now in charge, but there men will be the galley slaves of the outfit until the non-coms die or get C.D.D. If they had waited until they had a full compliment of men and then start ou to pick men most suited for promotion most of our noon-coms would get to the first base. But just because they had the luck to walk in here a month or so before the rest of us they got the ratings. Also men were shipped into the outfit later on who already shed their ratings and while you were sweating to get a rating. There new fellows were put in charge and put a climax on any idea you even had for a rating.
S64.Q97.Full: Since we live in a free land with equal opportunities for everyone this fact should hold true in the army too, but this is not only the case. Luck plays an important part. To explain more thoroughly I will give my own case and many others like mine. Our detachment war formed about a year ago and men were shipped in, I would say about 150 men at first. Our detachment war to consist of about 500 men, but instead of waiting until we have had full strength they started to pass out the ratings. Soon we had our full number of men but the men who were shipped into this outfit late had not chance of getting shead shince the TO was all used up. Now a great deal of tese men have better inclinations and better qualifications than most of the non-comms now in charge, but there men will be the galley slaves of the outfit until the non-coms die or get C.D.D. If they had waited until they had a full compliment of men and then start ou to pick men most suited for promotion most of our noon-coms would get to the first base. But just because they had the luck to walk in here a month or so before the rest of us they got the ratings. Also men were shipped into the outfit later on who already shed their ratings and while you were sweating to get a rating. There new fellows were put in charge and put a climax on any idea you even had for a rating.

S64.Q97.Full: My remarks are I think I could do the army more good at home because I am on limited service and my feet hurt every step I take and I have stomach truble alll the time and the Army Doc. says they cant do any more for me so I cant see why they keep me when I can't work more than half the time.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)

S64.Q97.F: We have the best god damn army in the world. [unclear] We [/unclear] bar none.
S64.Q97.Full: We have the best god damn army in the world. [unclear] We [/unclear] bar none.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I was sent to Fort Custer for a 2 month course on Military Gov. Upon completion I received no boost in rank & was returned to my initial outfit. The M.P. O.C.S. is for 3 mos. & covered the same type of work we did. Why didn't we get a boost in rank? And why wasn't I sent to an outfit that was suitable to the type of work I learned & want to do very much. I feel my knowledge is far superior.[deletion] [/deletion]
S64.Q97.C_1: & more all around knowledge then any non-com[non commissioned officer] in the outfit, yet I'm still a corporal doing the same type of work that I was doing before I went to school. I went thru 2 months of hard work, tests, cadet system & a parallel to the O.C.S.[Officer Candidate School] classes just to do something I had done before I went thru school I'm filled with book knowledge of M.P.[military police] work in the [unclear] Theater [/unclear] of Operations but I'm wasting my time where I am now. Why isn't a raise in rank given to the men in that school? It'll help the moral which has been very low, & make a man want tot study & learn.
S64.Q97.Full: I was sent to Fort Custer for a 2 month course on Military Gov. Upon completion I received no boost in rank & was returned to my initial outfit. The M.P. O.C.S. is for 3 mos. & covered the same type of work we did. Why didn't we get a boost in rank? And why wasn't I sent to an outfit that was suitable to the type of work I learned & want to do very much. I feel my knowledge is far superior.[deletion] [/deletion]  & more all around knowledge then any non-com[non commissioned officer] in the outfit, yet I'm still a corporal doing the same type of work that I was doing before I went to school. I went thru 2 months of hard work, tests, cadet system & a parallel to the O.C.S.[Officer Candidate School] classes just to do something I had done before I went thru school I'm filled with book knowledge of M.P.[military police] work in the [unclear] Theater [/unclear] of Operations but I'm wasting my time where I am now. Why isn't a raise in rank given to the men in that school? It'll help the moral which has been very low, & make a man want tot study & learn.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Being in a Service Command Unit I find that most of the work and duty falls on about 50% of the [unclear] Bul [/unclear] Personnal. This is due to the Limited Service men, many of whom are excused from Guard, N.P., and drill (drill is unnecessary for most office workers) by the Surgeon. This condition causes shortages of help in office and therefore overstaffing. This unit is equipped 100% with M17 rifles and drills daily with them, altho authorized 10% rifles. Has shotguns for guard. Each ablebodied man has guard or KP once a week or oftener, and they are nearly all office workers. WAC personnel will shortly take over
S64.Q97.C_1: most of the officework and Enlisted Men transferred, so a new guard system must be initiated. Could have been done long ago and raised morale considerably. [paragraph] Limited service men excused by Surgeon should be discharged or put on their own so that ablebodied men will not be compelled to do double duty. Daily drill and other unit duties keep office men away from their work about 10% of their time, [unclear] ---ing [/unclear] man hours. These are men who have received basic training and are doing duty assigned according to SSN [Specification Serial Number] and not as combat duty.
S64.Q97.Full: Being in a Service Command Unit I find that most of the work and duty falls on about 50% of the [unclear] Bul [/unclear] Personnal. This is due to the Limited Service men, many of whom are excused from Guard, N.P., and drill (drill is unnecessary for most office workers) by the Surgeon. This condition causes shortages of help in office and therefore overstaffing. This unit is equipped 100% with M17 rifles and drills daily with them, altho authorized 10% rifles. Has shotguns for guard. Each ablebodied man has guard or KP once a week or oftener, and they are nearly all office workers. WAC personnel will shortly take over most of the officework and Enlisted Men transferred, so a new guard system must be initiated. Could have been done long ago and raised morale considerably. [paragraph] Limited service men excused by Surgeon should be discharged or put on their own so that ablebodied men will not be compelled to do double duty. Daily drill and other unit duties keep office men away from their work about 10% of their time, [unclear] ---ing [/unclear] man hours. These are men who have received basic training and are doing duty assigned according to SSN [Specification Serial Number] and not as combat duty.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I am in Special Services Establishment wash - i put on show to amuse the boys who are taking basic training. I had hoped that my skill and ability could really be utilized in briabling the morale of the men. Just putting on shows does not accomplish that purpose. There is far too little emphasis on what we are fighting for as - and what matters.
S64.Q97.C_1: is presented is not integrated with the other training material. See Lt. Col. Carlson of the Marine Corps (led action on Guadalcanal) for what I mean. His picked "raiders" were men who knew what they were fighting for -- and they seem to have been treated by him and his officers as intelligent human beings -- the more confidence placed in them the better men function. I think it is a shame that L.S. men has so little chance to become officers (since closing Army Administration School). In my particular profession I was equal at least to a Capt. let me say -- (my pay was more than a general and I could function as such in the Army -- yet I will probably never be able to get a commission since I am L.S.
S64.Q97.Full: I am in Special Services Establishment wash - i put on show to amuse the boys who are taking basic training. I had hoped that my skill and ability could really be utilized in briabling the morale of the men. Just putting on shows does not accomplish that purpose. There is far too little emphasis on what we are fighting for as - and what matters. is presented is not integrated with the other training material. See Lt. Col. Carlson of the Marine Corps (led action on Guadalcanal) for what I mean. His picked "raiders" were men who knew what they were fighting for -- and they seem to have been treated by him and his officers as intelligent human beings -- the more confidence placed in them the better men function. I think it is a shame that L.S. men has so little chance to become officers (since closing Army Administration School). In my particular profession I was equal at least to a Capt. let me say -- (my pay was more than a general and I could function as such in the Army -- yet I will probably never be able to get a commission since I am L.S.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: The thing I could never understand is why I was taken off a Defense job & put into the Army as I am the Father of two children & have always lived with my family. Why others are not in service yet I think the Draft laws are not properly carried out. But I am ready & willing to serve the good old U.S. A.
S64.Q97.Full: The thing I could never understand is why I was taken off a Defense job & put into the Army as I am the Father of two children & have always lived with my family. Why others are not in service yet I think the Draft laws are not properly carried out. But I am ready & willing to serve the good old U.S. A.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I would like to know why they don't want us to wear our F. caps and belts. As they want us to look like soldiers.
S64.Q97.Full: I would like to know why they don't want us to wear our F. caps and belts. As they want us to look like soldiers.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Well when I came in the Army I decided to make the best of it, because it would be my home. I got into the very kind of work I am best fitted for and wanted. A lot of things (litle) things I don't like but as a whole I like the Army. The have lots of little thing like can't ware [wear] garrison tags and having to ware [wear] neck ties to shows on post. We like to be well dressed and I think a soldier likes to ware [wear] civilian
S64.Q97.C_1: shoes & garrison caps while on leave. It makes him feel like he is more dressed. Looks nicer too.
S64.Q97.Full: Well when I came in the Army I decided to make the best of it, because it would be my home. I got into the very kind of work I am best fitted for and wanted. A lot of things (litle) things I don't like but as a whole I like the Army. The have lots of little thing like can't ware [wear] garrison tags and having to ware [wear] neck ties to shows on post. We like to be well dressed and I think a soldier likes to ware [wear] civilian  shoes & garrison caps while on leave. It makes him feel like he is more dressed. Looks nicer too.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I am assigned as a general Mech.[mechanic] I have a tool box charged to me. It is a nice set of tools as far as I know. I have had this box a month or better. I have had the box opened once. It was to shine the tools for inspection - I have never had a chance to use them. If I am going to be a mechanic I would like to do Mech. work. If they are not going to let me do Mech. work, let them give my tool box to some one that is.
S64.Q97.Full: I am assigned as a general Mech.[mechanic] I have a tool box charged to me. It is a nice set of tools as far as I know. I have had this box a month or better. I have had the box opened once. It was to shine the tools for inspection - I have never had a chance to use them. If I am going to be a mechanic I would like to do Mech. work. If they are not going to let me do Mech. work, let them give my tool box to some one that is.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think the men in limited service should be placed where they would be of the most value to the army and to themselves. A man in limited service is stuck from the start he can't fight; very rarely can he become an officer; and mainly he is used on the lowest type of jobs. Placed in such a detachment that he cannot exploit his talents or learning. In other words, "he is screwed" from start to finish.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the men in limited service should be placed where they would be of the most value to the army and to themselves. A man in limited service is stuck from the start he can't fight; very rarely can he become an officer; and mainly he is used on the lowest type of jobs. Placed in such a detachment that he cannot exploit his talents or learning. In other words, "he is screwed" from start to finish.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: What I can't see is why they take a limited service man like me, and put him in the branch of service he has the least interest in.
S64.Q97.Full: What I can't see is why they take a limited service man like me, and put him in the branch of service he has the least interest in.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: The army does not give each soldier the same treatment in regards to furloughs. Some get them after & some don't get them at all.
S64.Q97.Full: The army does not give each soldier the same treatment in regards to furloughs. Some get them after & some don't get them at all.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Other/No answer
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: Hell no! Do Something about it ---------
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I was a medical student drafted only pre-medics or liberal arts -- Received B. I. Training due to the fact that I'm L.S. was then put in the Medical Detachment here at at SCU - 1928 - was placed in surgery as a surgical technician -- Hope to be an M.D some day in civilian
S64.Q97.C_1: Life - Consider the work I'm now doing Important and essential to the war effort -- I'm educating myself along this link for the future.
S64.Q97.Full: I was a medical student drafted only pre-medics or liberal arts -- Received B. I. Training due to the fact that I'm L.S. was then put in the Medical Detachment here at at SCU - 1928 - was placed in surgery as a surgical technician -- Hope to be an M.D some day in civilian Life - Consider the work I'm now doing Important and essential to the war effort -- I'm educating myself along this link for the future.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I have at 4 years 7 months of service with a clear record and feel I should have a rating. But as yet no rating for some unknown reason (My pet beef.)
S64.Q97.Full: I have at 4 years 7 months of service with a clear record and feel I should have a rating. But as yet no rating for some unknown reason (My pet beef.)

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: about Passes a solger [soldier] shuld [should] have at list [least] 3 days off of ech [each] month it helps to keep the spirit and not git [get] restless insted [instead] at been in dutty [duty] all the time like a convic [convict] in a prisone [prison] with out any liverty [liberty] at all a guy gits [gets] disgusted finally go over the hill & I dont Blame a lots of solgers [soldiers] to go A.W.O.L.
S64.Q97.Full: about Passes a solger [soldier] shuld [should] have at list [least] 3 days off of ech [each] month it helps to keep the spirit and not git [get] restless insted [instead] at been in dutty [duty] all the time like a convic [convict] in a prisone [prison] with out any liverty [liberty] at all a guy gits [gets] disgusted finally go over the hill & I dont Blame a lots of solgers [soldiers] to go A.W.O.L.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: I was cheated out of my second furlough yesterday.
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: To whom it may concern; "Sirs", I like military training and life. I had previously volunteered and served 3 1/2 years in the ROTC back home. When I was inducted into the army I looked forward to another period of military life with pleasure. But it was the greatest disappointment of my life. I have never been so completely disgusted in my life. My disappointment....
S64.Q97.C_1: lies entirely in my own outfit, and is no opinion towards the army as a whole. I have ascertained from external sources that conditions are much more favourable in most outfits. I'm disgusted. I could sit down and write a book on the subject, but what's the use.
S64.Q97.Full: To whom it may concern; "Sirs", I like military training and life. I had previously volunteered and served 3 1/2 years in the ROTC back home. When I was inducted into the army I looked forward to another period of military life with pleasure. But it was the greatest disappointment of my life. I have never been so completely disgusted in my life. My disappointment.... lies entirely in my own outfit, and is no opinion towards the army as a whole. I have ascertained from external sources that conditions are much more favourable in most outfits. I'm disgusted. I could sit down and write a book on the subject, but what's the use.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: Compulosry training after the war should be inforced. We should train our men at least one year after high school or two months a year during high school course. This way U.S.A. will get a lot of good, eager, willing men in the service as officers and will help emmensely when our country will need them in future years.
S64.Q97.C_1: If this country does not stay more prepared for what we are now fighting for I for one will be a very sorryful [sorrowful] citizen. We let our country get altogether to [too] lost in the fast years. The U S government will be responsible for our future safty. [safety] We wish to be democratic but for heaven sake, lets be prepared.
S64.Q97.Full: Compulosry training after the war should be inforced. We should train our men at least one year after high school or two months a year during high school course. This way U.S.A. will get a lot of good, eager, willing men in the service as officers and will help emmensely when our country will need them in future years. If this country does not stay more prepared for what we are now fighting for I for one will be a very sorryful [sorrowful] citizen. We let our country get altogether to [too] lost in the fast years. The U S government will be responsible for our future safty. [safety] We wish to be democratic but for heaven sake, lets be prepared.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Over two thirds of our Btry. dislike our Btry. commanding officer, also too many men trying to be 1st Sgt. and I feel the wrong men make the promotions of Pvts. I think the men directly over the pvts. should be the ones to recommend promotions, since they should be the ones most likely to know what kind of man he is. I also think we should have more athletics since we don't seem to do much
S64.Q97.C_1: of anybody else and instead of taking exercises in the middle of the afternoon, as we do the men would get much more exercise out of paying ball or some other game and would be much more satisfied. [paragraph] We have plenty of men who are good in sports, and we never have had any too mount too much.
S64.Q97.Full: Over two thirds of our Btry. dislike our Btry. commanding officer, also too many men trying to be 1st Sgt. and I feel the wrong men make the promotions of Pvts. I think the men directly over the pvts. should be the ones to recommend promotions, since they should be the ones most likely to know what kind of man he is. I also think we should have more athletics since we don't seem to do much of anybody else and instead of taking exercises in the middle of the afternoon, as we do the men would get much more exercise out of paying ball or some other game and would be much more satisfied. [paragraph] We have plenty of men who are good in sports, and we never have had any too mount too much.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: What I would like to know is: what kind of a outfit I am really in. I have been in the army over two years and as fact as we make good soldiers and officers, they ship them out to some other outfit. Now we have four or five limited Service Men. What next.
S64.Q97.Full: What I would like to know is: what kind of a outfit I am really in. I have been in the army over two years and as fact as we make good soldiers and officers, they ship them out to some other outfit. Now we have four or five limited Service Men. What next.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Get some officers with some age on them that can think and not some guys around 20 to 25 to tell older men what to go. Each officer should come up through the ranks. He should have to [unclear] years [/unclear] of army life before he goes to OCL. Then he would know what the score is,
S64.Q97.Full: Get some officers with some age on them that can think and not some guys around 20 to 25 to tell older men what to go. Each officer should come up through the ranks. He should have to [unclear] years [/unclear] of army life before he goes to OCL. Then he would know what the score is,

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: I haven't applied for many passes.
S64.Q97.F: In this outfit the chances for getting ahead seem to be kind of slow. There also is some friction between the fellows from the north and south over the outcome of the civil war. Personally I think it should be forgotten. There isn't much entertainment for those who go out on passes.
S64.Q97.Full: In this outfit the chances for getting ahead seem to be kind of slow. There also is some friction between the fellows from the north and south over the outcome of the civil war. Personally I think it should be forgotten. There isn't much entertainment for those who go out on passes.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: Chow could be better & be better prepared. (paragraph) Men who are well-educated & who have made or done well in civilian life should receive more encouragement & help for advancement in (the) Army . (paragraph) A much better application of classification should take place.
S64.Q97.Full: Chow could be better & be better prepared. (paragraph) Men who are well-educated & who have made or done well in civilian life should receive more encouragement & help for advancement in (the) Army . (paragraph) A much better application of classification should take place.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I find in my thoughts that the English people are trying and have succeeded in letting Russia take the duty blows of the Nazi forces. You hardly find the British stepping out and hunting for a battle which could help the war come to an end. They expect
S64.Q97.C_1: the enemy to come to them. But of course that is what a clever enemy appreciates about Britain. While Britain stays at home the enemy builds more destructive weapons to fight with. Now why doesnt the British strike & strike now. Russia is engaging Nazi army in the east, American army are attacking in the South with Canadian troops. England surely could strike thru the north.
S64.Q97.Full: I find in my thoughts that the English people are trying and have succeeded in letting Russia take the duty blows of the Nazi forces. You hardly find the British stepping out and hunting for a battle which could help the war come to an end. They expect  the enemy to come to them. But of course that is what a clever enemy appreciates about Britain. While Britain stays at home the enemy builds more destructive weapons to fight with. Now why doesnt the British strike & strike now. Russia is engaging Nazi army in the east, American army are attacking in the South with Canadian troops. England surely could strike thru the north.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Personally I think that the Army pay schedule is mixed up. They pay a Pvt. too much and others not enough. A Pvt. gets $50.00 a month therefore that's enough for him to live on so why work to better himself. High ranking non-coms in the Air Corps are not paid enough in regards with the responsibility they have. For example a 1st Sgt. only gets $138 a month
S64.Q97.C_1: for the responsibility he has for too to 1000 men. I think a 1st Lt. (lieutenant) should be paid in according (accordance) to the no (number) of men he is responsible for.
S64.Q97.Full: Personally I think that the Army pay schedule is mixed up. They pay a Pvt. too much and others not enough. A Pvt. gets $50.00 a month therefore that's enough for him to live on so why work to better himself. High ranking non-coms in the Air Corps are not paid enough in regards with the responsibility they have. For example a 1st Sgt. only gets $138 a month  for the responsibility he has for too to 1000 men. I think a 1st Lt. (lieutenant) should be paid in according (accordance) to the no (number) of men he is responsible for.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: There are lots of improvements to be made - by officers and non-coms - toward the enlisted personnel. In all the camps I've been in - the morale was terrible. Improvement could be made in living conditions.
S64.Q97.Full: There are lots of improvements to be made - by officers and non-coms - toward the enlisted personnel. In all the camps I've been in - the morale was terrible. Improvement could be made in living conditions.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Until recently I was a Signal Corp man given a tough job. With no previous experience or aptitude for the job I was sent to school for an accelerator course and expected to come out a man able to care for the equipment. I was unable to do this tho I completed the course with credit. If I had been sent to another school and for a different and more applicable time I'd be a far better soldier today.
S64.Q97.Full: Until recently I was a Signal Corp man given a tough job. With no previous experience or aptitude for the job I was sent to school for an accelerator course and expected to come out a man able to care for the equipment. I was unable to do this tho I completed the course with credit. If I had been sent to another school and for a different and more applicable time I'd be a far better soldier today.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M_marginalia: For wife and baby.
S64.Q97.F: When a soldier is inducted in the army he should be give a job that he is skilled at and not put in something that don't interest him. He should have his privilege of going to church without marching to services. A Christian soldier has a hard battle. It's like being in a den of lions.
S64.Q97.Full: When a soldier is inducted in the army he should be give a job that he is skilled at and not put in something that don't interest him. He should have his privilege of going to church without marching to services. A Christian soldier has a hard battle. It's like being in a den of lions.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I seen a lot of Army Camps, bu this Drew Field is about the worst I seen. It just isn't fit place to bring a soldier up right. After about 2 or 3 months here, it just seems like he doesn't care about the government or war or his people back home; It is just like if somebody took the world away from him. And nothing is ever done to improve this.
S64.Q97.C_1: Im about ready to leave here, so as far as Im concerned it doesn't matter to me, if something is done to improve the things here. To make a soldier happy while he is training and [unclear] breaking [/unclear] in to be a real soldier.
S64.Q97.Full: I seen a lot of Army Camps, bu this Drew Field is about the worst I seen. It just isn't fit place to bring a soldier up right. After about 2 or 3 months here, it just seems like he doesn't care about the government or war or his people back home; It is just like if somebody took the world away from him. And nothing is ever done to improve this.  Im about ready to leave here, so as far as Im concerned it doesn't matter to me, if something is done to improve the things here. To make a soldier happy while he is training and [unclear] breaking [/unclear] in to be a real soldier.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I think I would get along okay in the army if it were peacetime, so I am sticking to a duty for which I enlisted. Some things I see disgust me, but wearing the uniform and knowing I'm ready to fight for my own country makes me proud to be here. I enlisted and am proud. [paragraph] Sometimes I see things that aren't up to my standards of army life though
S64.Q97.C_1: the officers who are [unclear] [/unclear] that us boys find, and the O.C.S. (Officers Candidate School) Graduates run us ragged with there (their) rank. Aside from small things like that it is swell. (paragraph) Reckon I should say, this Florida is hell on the soldiers pocketbooks, we get robbed every time we turn around to buy anything. How I'm griping well. We all do if were (we're) soldiers. I'm happy in the army, and get along swell!
S64.Q97.Full: I think I would get along okay in the army if it were peacetime, so I am sticking to a duty for which I enlisted. Some things I see disgust me, but wearing the uniform and knowing I'm ready to fight for my own country makes me proud to be here. I enlisted and am proud. [paragraph] Sometimes I see things that aren't up to my standards of army life though  the officers who are [unclear] [/unclear] that us boys find, and the O.C.S. (Officers Candidate School) Graduates run us ragged with there (their) rank. Aside from small things like that it is swell. (paragraph) Reckon I should say, this Florida is hell on the soldiers pocketbooks, we get robbed every time we turn around to buy anything. How I'm griping well. We all do if were (we're) soldiers. I'm happy in the army, and get along swell!

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: In connection with the Military Police. I believe that this organization can do more to lower a soldier's morale than anything else. I am quite aware of the necessity of the M.P.s (Military Police) and of the good they do in most cases. But there is a certain per cent of those that are down right domineering - as long as a man is doing and acting according to rule (rules) there is no
S64.Q97.C_1: Reason for his being bull dozed and pushed around by men who are inferior in rank, character, and in most cases intelligence. The worst feature is that he is always right and even a chance for explanation is seldom given. That is my one and only gripe.
S64.Q97.Full: In connection with the Military Police. I believe that this organization can do more to lower a soldier's morale than anything else. I am quite aware of the necessity of the M.P.s (Military Police) and of the good they do in most cases. But there is a certain per cent of those that are down right domineering - as long as a man is doing and acting according to rule (rules) there is no Reason for his being bull dozed and pushed around by men who are inferior in rank, character, and in most cases intelligence. The worst feature is that he is always right and even a chance for explanation is seldom given. That is my one and only gripe.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: Last one, 20 months ago.
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q96.M_marginalia: More money but everything is rationed.
S64.Q97.F: The C.O. & 1st Sgt. don't use the Sqdn. right, don't stick up for the men.
S64.Q97.Full: The C.O. & 1st Sgt. don't use the Sqdn. right, don't stick up for the men.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I sincerely think but never would have believed it until now that politics plays a big part in the Army, which makes it bad in my opinion and a great deal of partiality shown, some enlisted men are promoted which should never be.
S64.Q97.Full: I sincerely think but never would have believed it until now that politics plays a big part in the Army, which makes it bad in my opinion and a great deal of partiality shown, some enlisted men are promoted which should never be.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: {underline the words "but not of furloughs]
S64.Q96.M_marginalia: [added to end of the selection: "considering rationing an etc."]
S64.Q97.F: Placement in the Aarmy as to your Service job. I was signed up in he Army as a [underline]motorcycle[/underline] Dispatch Rider" and then they come up with the story that they "don't use thyem any more. But just go to a movie and everytime you see a "News Reel" they say or show something about "Motorcycle Dispatch Riders" and then I burn up about ratings in the army. I have been
S64.Q97.C_1: in the army 17 mo. [months[] and it took 1 yr. [year] and 8 days before getting even a P.F.C. (Private, First Class) and up until just a very few weeks ago I was an instructor in my duty (or Job) and know the subject pretty good but it just so happens I don't know any big shots in the Army. A favorite slogan in the Army is "It isn't what you know its [underline}"who" [/underline] you know." Some fellows came in the Army and are made Cpl's [Corporals] and Sgts. [Sergeants] in the first month and the ones that have a year get nothing. [paragraph] Furlough should be distributed more evenly all the way around. A lot of fellows get 3 to 5 furloughs a year and others just [underline] 5 [/underline] days. Why because it is too much trouble for the Officers and N.C.O. [Non-Commissioned Officer] to make one out. But don't get me wrong. I'm in here [insertion] for [/insertion] [insertion] the [/insertion] same thing as most others to get War over with and get back to normal civilian life again.
S64.Q97.Full: Placement in the Aarmy as to your Service job. I was signed up in he Army as a [underline]motorcycle[/underline] Dispatch Rider" and then they come up with the story that they "don't use thyem any more. But just go to a movie and everytime you see a "News Reel" they say or show something about "Motorcycle Dispatch Riders" and then I burn up about ratings in the army. I have been in the army 17 mo. [months[] and it took 1 yr. [year] and 8 days before getting even a P.F.C. (Private, First Class) and up until just a very few weeks ago I was an instructor in my duty (or Job) and know the subject pretty good but it just so happens I don't know any big shots in the Army. A favorite slogan in the Army is "It isn't what you know its [underline}"who" [/underline] you know." Some fellows came in the Army and are made Cpl's [Corporals] and Sgts. [Sergeants] in the first month and the ones that have a year get nothing. [paragraph] Furlough should be distributed more evenly all the way around. A lot of fellows get 3 to 5 furloughs a year and others just [underline] 5 [/underline] days. Why because it is too much trouble for the Officers and N.C.O. [Non-Commissioned Officer] to make one out. But don't get me wrong. I'm in here [insertion] for [/insertion] [insertion] the [/insertion] same thing as most others to get War over with and get back to normal civilian life again.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: My own knowledge of the scope of army training is limited to a very small circle of personal and friend's experiences, but it does seem that men could be trained and sent into service before losing a good part of their enthusiasm. It seems their should be possible a closer coordination of training facilities, and facilities for placing men in
S64.Q97.C_1: actual combat allowing for necessary reserve quotas, it still seems that many units are left in training centers to chafe under magnified personal distastes, while others seem to be sent into active service almost at once.
S64.Q97.Full: My own knowledge of the scope of army training is limited to a very small circle of personal and friend's experiences, but it does seem that men could be trained and sent into service before losing a good part of their enthusiasm. It seems their should be possible a closer coordination of training facilities, and facilities for placing men in actual combat allowing for necessary reserve quotas, it still seems that many units are left in training centers to chafe under magnified personal distastes, while others seem to be sent into active service almost at once.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: Administration Reports _ too much duplication of the same thing [insertion] information [/insertion] with maybe on a different form. Perhaps this is only a local condition of a divided command where we are under the Air Corp and a Signal Corp commanded on same field. To do away with such duplication would mean a saving in time - manpower effort or hours and money.
S64.Q97.Full: Administration Reports _ too much duplication of the same thing [insertion] information [/insertion] with maybe on a different form. Perhaps this is only a local condition of a divided command where we are under the Air Corp and a Signal Corp commanded on same field. To do away with such duplication would mean a saving in time - manpower effort or hours and money.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I think the mess halls all over the country should have the same quality and quantity of food. Some places the food is like home while other places its not fit to eat. It should also be standard through out the country or at least the camp about fellows living off of the post. To many commanding officers make their own rules. [paragraph] I don't think 2 weeks training
S64.Q97.C_1: in a year would do a fellow much good. Once he was in the army he shouldn't have to go back. I think the Government should make it compulsory for every boy as soon as he leaves high school to have at least a mo. [month] or a year of military training. He doesn't have any special job to perform when he first gets out of school.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the mess halls all over the country should have the same quality and quantity of food. Some places the food is like home while other places its not fit to eat. It should also be standard through out the country or at least the camp about fellows living off of the post. To many commanding officers make their own rules. [paragraph] I don't think 2 weeks training in a year would do a fellow much good. Once he was in the army he shouldn't have to go back. I think the Government should make it compulsory for every boy as soon as he leaves high school to have at least a mo. [month] or a year of military training. He doesn't have any special job to perform when he first gets out of school.

S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: The army has [deletion] a [/deletion] made thing a lot worse at our home. There are 5 of us in Service now. my Mother & Father are all alone. 5 from one family is too much. My Mother & Father worry too much now. They seem to have nothing to live for. The army sure has ruined many a home in this case

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
