S64.Q97.F: That they set up a standardized system of teaching in every camp throughout the country. That they eliminate as much red tape as possible.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Every man should get his full furlough time. It can be done. In my case, I had 11 days furlough in 8 1/2 months. I could have been given the full 15 days. Everyday at home is heaven.
S64.Q97.Full: Every man should get his full furlough time. It can be done. In my case, I had 11 days furlough in 8 1/2 months. I could have been given the full 15 days. Everyday at home is heaven.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)

S64.Q97.F: I think it is unfair that some privates should go without a furlough for as high as a yer or more when some of the higher non-coms (non-commissioned officers) get them more often than they are really allowed.

S64.Q97.F: One thing that I don't like is this sitting around when your company is alerted and ready to go across. It sure gets dam tiresome. When a company ready to go why don't they let them shovel off [insertion] for [/insertion] some other place instead of keep them doing the same old thing all the the time. [deletion] [/deletion]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Our non coms [Non Commissioned Officers] are not afficient and don't know anything about how to be a real soldier. They might be better if our company officer took more of a personal interest [deletion] over [/deletion] in how they trained the men etc. [paragraph] We have the best army but not enough attention is given to carefully picking leaders. ie. theres too much favoritism and also entirely too
S64.Q97.C_1: much [unclear] indefenceness [/unclear] . Too many clerks, interviews, etc. aren't conscientious in their work. I know I want to be in the army doing something that really helps but they classified and put me into something entirely new. I took 3 yrs Civil Engineering and work for a year and a half as an electrical engineering and they put me to pounding a teletype machine and I had never typed in my life. As I said I want to be a soldier and feel that I was really helping as a soldier but the way things are now I was doing more for Natl Defense in my old job than I'll ever do at my present job.
S64.Q97.Full: Our non coms [Non Commissioned Officers] are not afficient and don't know anything about how to be a real soldier. They might be better if our company officer took more of a personal interest [deletion] over [/deletion] in how they trained the men etc. [paragraph] We have the best army but not enough attention is given to carefully picking leaders. ie. theres too much favoritism and also entirely too much [unclear] indefenceness [/unclear] . Too many clerks, interviews, etc. aren't conscientious in their work. I know I want to be in the army doing something that really helps but they classified and put me into something entirely new. I took 3 yrs Civil Engineering and work for a year and a half as an electrical engineering and they put me to pounding a teletype machine and I had never typed in my life. As I said I want to be a soldier and feel that I was really helping as a soldier but the way things are now I was doing more for Natl Defense in my old job than I'll ever do at my present job.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: First of all there is no organization at all in this Aircraft Warning. I know more fellows who have good education, who could be doing more for the war effort in some other branch of the service than what they're doing in this branch. I for one enlisted for the ordnance dept and they put me in the signal corps. I have a good education I believe. Five years of the position I had in civilian life and two years of my Lt school in engineering
S64.Q97.C_1: I haven't done a damn thing since I've been in the army worth calling a job. For the past 9 months I've had basic training. After awhile this gets very boring, maybe an illiterate wouldn't mind it, but a fellow with average intelligence it tears downs. The army I believe will invariably put you in the [deletion] you [/deletion] opposite to what you are best fitted but of course I'm only a T/5. Incidentally I just received it the other day, after 9-1/2 months. The army also [deletion] [/deletion] lets go with too much bull I have yet to hear the truth spoken, In pertaining to the stuff they tell you in school and so on like that. The army is only making a bum out of me, and a liar, learning this from the Lts & so on. I am not proud to be serving in the army and feel I could be doing a better job if I was back in civilian life. Hand me a discharge and I'll be on my way tomorrow.
S64.Q97.Full: First of all there is no organization at all in this Aircraft Warning. I know more fellows who have good education, who could be doing more for the war effort in some other branch of the service than what they're doing in this branch. I for one enlisted for the ordnance dept and they put me in the signal corps. I have a good education I believe. Five years of the position I had in civilian life and two years of my Lt school in engineering I haven't done a damn thing since I've been in the army worth calling a job. For the past 9 months I've had basic training. After awhile this gets very boring, maybe an illiterate wouldn't mind it, but a fellow with average intelligence it tears downs. The army I believe will invariably put you in the [deletion] you [/deletion] opposite to what you are best fitted but of course I'm only a T/5. Incidentally I just received it the other day, after 9-1/2 months. The army also [deletion] [/deletion] lets go with too much bull I have yet to hear the truth spoken, In pertaining to the stuff they tell you in school and so on like that. The army is only making a bum out of me, and a liar, learning this from the Lts & so on. I am not proud to be serving in the army and feel I could be doing a better job if I was back in civilian life. Hand me a discharge and I'll be on my way tomorrow.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I realize this war demands a great army, with plenty of reserves but I firmly believe it is not right to take a young fellow from his high school training to be drafted. that education is priceless and until it seems absolutely necessary I believe those boys should have the opportunity to graduate.
S64.Q97.Full: I realize this war demands a great army, with plenty of reserves but I firmly believe it is not right to take a young fellow from his high school training to be drafted. that education is priceless and until it seems absolutely necessary I believe those boys should have the opportunity to graduate.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: We'd like to have some decent chow while we are here. Some of this stuff shouldn't be set before a pig.
S64.Q97.Full: We'd like to have some decent chow while we are here. Some of this stuff shouldn't be set before a pig.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I don't think ratings are given out right. Sometimes the guys take the first Sargent (Sergeant) on a drinking party and in a few days they get a rating. Then boys doing the same kind of work as I do and can't do it a bit better get a rating and I get nothing. It's just not fair!
S64.Q97.Full: I don't think ratings are given out right. Sometimes the guys take the first Sargent (Sergeant) on a drinking party and in a few days they get a rating. Then boys doing the same kind of work as I do and can't do it a bit better get a rating and I get nothing. It's just not fair!

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I believe the Army's method of classifying men is all wrong. They take a man with civilian training of some kind and instead of placing him where his training could be of some use to the army, he is placed in an entirely different field. Take my particular case, I have held a civilian job as a Traffic Manager for the past ten years. As a fighter I am
S64.Q97.C_1: not built for it. Therefore the logical job for me in the army would be in the Quartermaster Corp since it resembles the working job of Traffic manager. But instead, I am placed in the Signal Corp at a job that any moron could handle. That is only one case and I've heard dozens. Then too, when a man is placed on a job, he should be allowed more freedom of thought so that he is able to concentrate on the work he is doing. Instead, his mind is burdened with a lot of trivial things like being giged [gigged] [given an unfavorable report] for not doing this or that. Being in the army is bad enough and when you have to put up with a lot of foolishness, you find there is very little thought and effort that you care to put into your work. [paragraph] Then too, there are very few men in the army who want to take responsibles [responsibility] and always are passing the buck.
S64.Q97.Full: I believe the Army's method of classifying men is all wrong. They take a man with civilian training of some kind and instead of placing him where his training could be of some use to the army, he is placed in an entirely different field. Take my particular case, I have held a civilian job as a Traffic Manager for the past ten years. As a fighter I am not built for it. Therefore the logical job for me in the army would be in the Quartermaster Corp since it resembles the working job of Traffic manager. But instead, I am placed in the Signal Corp at a job that any moron could handle. That is only one case and I've heard dozens. Then too, when a man is placed on a job, he should be allowed more freedom of thought so that he is able to concentrate on the work he is doing. Instead, his mind is burdened with a lot of trivial things like being giged [gigged] [given an unfavorable report] for not doing this or that. Being in the army is bad enough and when you have to put up with a lot of foolishness, you find there is very little thought and effort that you care to put into your work. [paragraph] Then too, there are very few men in the army who want to take responsibles [responsibility] and always are passing the buck.

S64.Q95.M_marginalia: no furlough
S64.Q97.F: Yes at Drew Field when men of our outfit got sick from triconosis [trichinosis] why the hell do they say it was dirty mess kits. Does 11 men from one company get sick so that they have to be rushed to the hospital because their mess gear was dirty! That is shit. While in the hospital they were recorded as having a slight case of heat exhaustion. [paragraph] I dont know if this will do any good. I doubt if any one reads this, but I hope to hell they could have [unclear] [/unclear]
S64.Q97.C_1: Get a little better grade of cooks and food. Christmas I am always hungry and to eat in the P.X. I go broke. [paragraph] That is the only kick I have about the Army. [paragraph] So long.

While in the hospital they were recorded as having a slight case of heat exhaustion. [paragraph] I dont know if this will do any good. I doubt if any one reads this, but I hope to hell they could have [unclear] [/unclear]  Get a little better grade of cooks and food. Christmas I am always hungry and to eat in the P.X. I go broke. [paragraph] That is the only kick I have about the Army. [paragraph] So long.

S64.Q97.C_1: disentions among the press & if that happens this war will never be won, but will be lost - and I figure a matter such as that should be by all means looked into.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I think the army should take more consideration in placing a man as to his abilities!!! And keep them out of Mississippi.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the army should take more consideration in placing a man as to his abilities!!! And keep them out of Mississippi.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: The only thing I cant understand is why the government puts up with strikes in essential war industries. Should our soldiers do likewise he is court martialed, yet John L. Lewis is not touched in any way and being directly responsible for the strikes. I think he should be tried for treson the same as any member of the armed forces and punished to the nth degree. Also
S64.Q97.C_1: those who participate in the strikes should be dealt with accordingly. [paragraph] I also think furlough should be limited to not less than ten days and give those who live quite a distance from their camps ample time to visit with their friends & relatives, and not have to rush to do so in just four or five days time. [paragraph] I think transportation should be favored to the soldiers and the civilians only when necessary. Priorities should be given a soldier because it is very important to him and his family when he is able to go home. [paragraph] I also think promotions should be given soldiers who really earn them and not to a favored few. Any soldier who finishes a tech school should have a T/4 or better. It takes hard work to go through. When some who have not gone through and have a better rating than the one who has isn't quite fair.
S64.Q97.Full: The only thing I cant understand is why the government puts up with strikes in essential war industries. Should our soldiers do likewise he is court martialed, yet John L. Lewis is not touched in any way and being directly responsible for the strikes. I think he should be tried for treson the same as any member of the armed forces and punished to the nth degree. Also those who participate in the strikes should be dealt with accordingly. [paragraph] I also think furlough should be limited to not less than ten days and give those who live quite a distance from their camps ample time to visit with their friends & relatives, and not have to rush to do so in just four or five days time. [paragraph] I think transportation should be favored to the soldiers and the civilians only when necessary. Priorities should be given a soldier because it is very important to him and his family when he is able to go home. [paragraph] I also think promotions should be given soldiers who really earn them and not to a favored few. Any soldier who finishes a tech school should have a T/4 or better. It takes hard work to go through. When some who have not gone through and have a better rating than the one who has isn't quite fair.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I'd like to see an international army after the war to see that these aggressors haven't got another chance to rise. Don't reconstruct their cities. Let them rebuild them. That should keep them busy for quite some time. Don't take over their industries ([underline] but see [/underline] ) that they don't make anything that even slightly resembles a war weapon. Let the countries vote to see that they belong to the country which the majority desires. Don't divide the islands and give one half to one country and the other half to another. Abolish all free cities such as Danzig etc. Try to send soldiers to camp near home. Improve living conditions in these camps.
S64.Q97.Full: I'd like to see an international army after the war to see that these aggressors haven't got another chance to rise. Don't reconstruct their cities. Let them rebuild them. That should keep them busy for quite some time. Don't take over their industries ([underline] but see [/underline] ) that they don't make anything that even slightly resembles a war weapon. Let the countries vote to see that they belong to the country which the majority desires. Don't divide the islands and give one half to one country and the other half to another. Abolish all free cities such as Danzig etc. Try to send soldiers to camp near home. Improve living conditions in these camps.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M_marginalia: [7 arrows pointing to answer]
S64.Q97.F: Send us more BEER [underline] . We all miss it very much. Make Mississippi a WET STATE [underline] and take the mud with you.
S64.Q97.Full: Send us more BEER [underline] . We all miss it very much. Make Mississippi a WET STATE [underline] and take the mud with you.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Take Camp McCain and give it back to the rebels. It sure is a hell hole.
S64.Q97.Full: Take Camp McCain and give it back to the rebels. It sure is a hell hole.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I think that officers coming from O.C.S. [officer candidate school] schools are not satisfactorily trained to step into active positions in training & administrative affairs. [paragraph] Why not send graduates into combat units for advanced training then bring them back to train the men Experience & not theory should be the motto
S64.Q97.C_1: Lack of entertainment, Inability to purchase refreshments & food in camps situated near small towns.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that officers coming from O.C.S. [officer candidate school] schools are not satisfactorily trained to step into active positions in training & administrative affairs. [paragraph] Why not send graduates into combat units for advanced training then bring them back to train the men Experience & not theory should be the motto Lack of entertainment, Inability to purchase refreshments & food in camps situated near small towns.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Why pick a hole away from ([unclear] McCain [/unclear] ) civilization for a camp that when a soldier goes to town he can't even find a place to eat. [paragraph] No recreation of any sort. [paragraph] This doesn't make a very good [unclear] [/unclear] builder. [paragraph] More beer.
S64.Q97.Full: Why pick a hole away from ([unclear] McCain [/unclear] ) civilization for a camp that when a soldier goes to town he can't even find a place to eat. [paragraph] No recreation of any sort. [paragraph] This doesn't make a very good [unclear] [/unclear] builder. [paragraph] More beer.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: The only thing worse about conditions is getting some food, shoes, etc., but most people don't mind giving up these things for us soldiers.
S64.Q97.Full: The only thing worse about conditions is getting some food, shoes, etc., but most people don't mind giving up these things for us soldiers.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I am too old to start learning all the new tricks in this army after being a sailor for 8 yrs[years] . Am no good here. Should be firing a boat somewhere. There is by far too much waste in teh army itself, while the govt[government] stresses salvage outside. Also I worry about what a man of my age is going to do after it is over 3 or 6 mos [months] pay isn't going to do me any good.
S64.Q97.Full: I am too old to start learning all the new tricks in this army after being a sailor for 8 yrs[years] . Am no good here. Should be firing a boat somewhere. There is by far too much waste in teh army itself, while the govt[government] stresses salvage outside. Also I worry about what a man of my age is going to do after it is over 3 or 6 mos [months] pay isn't going to do me any good.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think that better provisions should be made for dependents immediately. [paragraph] I also think that the government should have some sort of punishment established for any company, corporation, group of people, that call strikes during wartime. [paragraph] Soldiers on the whole are receiving very poor treatment from the civilians
S64.Q97.C_1: in the southern section of the United States. A post war organization should be established that will place or assure each and every soldier a job upon his return. The government should give free rent or make provisions for same, for a soldier's dependents.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that better provisions should be made for dependents immediately. [paragraph] I also think that the government should have some sort of punishment established for any company, corporation, group of people, that call strikes during wartime. [paragraph] Soldiers on the whole are receiving very poor treatment from the civilians  in the southern section of the United States. A post war organization should be established that will place or assure each and every soldier a job upon his return. The government should give free rent or make provisions for same, for a soldier's dependents.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I personally will never get used to the routine of Army life. It is a job which has to be done - it is not pleasant. [paragraph] I long to be home with my girl, and my family - When one's mind is home and he is away - He isnt very happy.
S64.Q97.Full: I personally will never get used to the routine of Army life. It is a job which has to be done - it is not pleasant. [paragraph] I long to be home with my girl, and my family - When one's mind is home and he is away - He isnt very happy.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: in as much as others.
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: one thing is I don't think the army should take a man that has only his Mother left. I dont think the army should take a man away from his boy that his mother left when he was 3 yrs old and have some single men home laughing at the boys in service. I personal believe war is the wrong thing to have but some people dont care who they hurt.
S64.Q97.C_1: For my part I would rather be home working in war plants & taken care of my boy. for my father is sick & under doctor care & my mother has heart trouble & don't know how much longer she will last, also under Doctor Care. My boy is 6 years & lives with my Mother & Father & I was hurt in Auto wrecks & had my head knock around & my back hurt. But if this is the place for me & if I can help out. May the Lord Bless us & watch over us Day & night [underline] Untill We Meet Again our love one Some Sunny Day.[underline]
S64.Q97.Full: one thing is I don't think the army should take a man that has only his Mother left. I dont think the army should take a man away from his boy that his mother left when he was 3 yrs old and have some single men home laughing at the boys in service. I personal believe war is the wrong thing to have but some people dont care who they hurt. For my part I would rather be home working in war plants & taken care of my boy. for my father is sick & under doctor care & my mother has heart trouble & don't know how much longer she will last, also under Doctor Care. My boy is 6 years & lives with my Mother & Father & I was hurt in Auto wrecks & had my head knock around & my back hurt. But if this is the place for me & if I can help out. May the Lord Bless us & watch over us Day & night [underline] Untill We Meet Again our love one Some Sunny Day.[underline]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page, A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: There are too many draft dodgers that draw large pay and strike for more. We work for $50.00 a month and don't gripe. There is a lot of political pull with local draft boards. This is a good camp but we have no recreation and the morale is low as hell.
S64.Q97.C_1: We can't even get 3.2 beer and people on the outside get all they want. We too like beer. {paragraph} These people on the outside should show more respect toward us.
S64.Q97.C_2: There is too many strikes. Too many civilians working in the Army Camp. The Draft boards should pick up a lot of these slackers. Get some decent recreation in the Army Camps. Get the Service Clubs straightened up so we can buy a decent meal for a decent price. We can't even get 3.2 beer and the civilians get all the good beer. Do away with some of these Hell Hole Camps.
S64.Q97.Full: There are too many draft dodgers that draw large pay and strike for more. We work for $50.00 a month and don't gripe. There is a lot of political pull with local draft boards. This is a good camp but we have no recreation and the morale is low as hell. We can't even get 3.2 beer and people on the outside get all they want. We too like beer. {paragraph} These people on the outside should show more respect toward us. There is too many strikes. Too many civilians working in the Army Camp. The Draft boards should pick up a lot of these slackers. Get some decent recreation in the Army Camps. Get the Service Clubs straightened up so we can buy a decent meal for a decent price. We can't even get 3.2 beer and the civilians get all the good beer. Do away with some of these Hell Hole Camps.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)

S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: My mother & sister is at home alone with only 7.00 per month to live on, it is lots worse on them they are being punished not I.
S64.Q97.Full: My mother & sister is at home alone with only 7.00 per month to live on, it is lots worse on them they are being punished not I.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: Well if I was a 1 A soldier in the Air Corp like I would like to be I wouldn't be writing this. But I am limited service an I feel that I could be doing my country more good in a war job paying more taxes an doing good work than I am doing here. An I sure don't think its a soldiers job to walk guard 8 hrs every nite an have to punch a timeclock every 15 minutes.
S64.Q97.Full: Well if I was a 1 A soldier in the Air Corp like I would like to be I wouldn't be writing this. But I am limited service an I feel that I could be doing my country more good in a war job paying more taxes an doing good work than I am doing here. An I sure don't think its a soldiers job to walk guard 8 hrs every nite an have to punch a timeclock every 15 minutes.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Personally I think furloughs ever four months would help the morale of a soldier more than anything and wouldn't be so many that would go A.W.O.L.
S64.Q97.Full: Personally I think furloughs ever four months would help the morale of a soldier more than anything and wouldn't be so many that would go A.W.O.L.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: I haven't asked for any passes except for a [unclear] [/unclear]
S64.Q97.F: I feel that I am doing more for the army now than before I was transferred because I am doing the work I did in civilian life but had a hard time to get into it.
S64.Q97.Full: I feel that I am doing more for the army now than before I was transferred because I am doing the work I did in civilian life but had a hard time to get into it.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: To my further actnolage [acknowledge] I think the boys that are in the Army today, are willing to fight and to serve their country with their most ability to what their duties are and regulations. But for their recreation, pass, furloughs, also the way the army cooks handle food is pretty lousy. One thing can expect everything on a silver plater. But it would take consideration on common [deletion] [/deletion] thoughts minds.
S64.Q97.C_1: Yes there are boys that would make it hard on others to get what is granted to them, but I say why take on to those who did not do anything wrong or might have made a shit (slight) mistake. Make the punishment acordinly (accordingly), how the mistak (mistake) was [deletion] was [/deletion] made by the soldier. That's All/
S64.Q97.Full: To my further actnolage [acknowledge] I think the boys that are in the Army today, are willing to fight and to serve their country with their most ability to what their duties are and regulations. But for their recreation, pass, furloughs, also the way the army cooks handle food is pretty lousy. One thing can expect everything on a silver plater. But it would take consideration on common [deletion] [/deletion] thoughts minds.  Yes there are boys that would make it hard on others to get what is granted to them, but I say why take on to those who did not do anything wrong or might have made a shit (slight) mistake. Make the punishment acordinly (accordingly), how the mistak (mistake) was [deletion] was [/deletion] made by the soldier. That's All/

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I don't think a man unphysically fit for the army should be in service.
S64.Q97.C_1: I am in LS not supposed to be fit for combat so in that case I would be better off in some defense plant helping win the war that way while here I walk post 8 hrs on & 6 off. They could put Regmential guards & let me go & work in some defence plant. The WACS are taking place of Combat soldiers so that will relieve some LS soldiers. My opion [opinion] is the LS men could do more outside in defence plants then what most of them are doing here in the Army.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't think a man unphysically fit for the army should be in service.  I am in LS not supposed to be fit for combat so in that case I would be better off in some defense plant helping win the war that way while here I walk post 8 hrs on & 6 off. They could put Regmential guards & let me go & work in some defence plant. The WACS are taking place of Combat soldiers so that will relieve some LS soldiers. My opion [opinion] is the LS men could do more outside in defence plants then what most of them are doing here in the Army.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Army life is OK if you don't weaken. Who in the hell wants to be strong?
S64.Q97.Full: Army life is OK if you don't weaken. Who in the hell wants to be strong?

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I think the Army is alright for a man that is able but for a man that is not able to do the training and work I think he is better off on a farm or in a Defence plant.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the Army is alright for a man that is able but for a man that is not able to do the training and work I think he is better off on a farm or in a Defence plant.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I left my wife in Sept. before I got in the army. My wifes lawyers pushed me in the army for not going back to her 15 I'd like to be an airplane mechanic 25 It don't make no difference what kind of outfit. 34 I'll become a airplane mech. 47 I will if I get what I want. 48 Iot depends on how the war turns out in the end. 56 - Its not the people its these rules. 63 If its fighting against Japs yes. 72 There is one company thats not so hot.
S64.Q97.C_1: [unclear] [/unclear]
S64.Q97.Full: I left my wife in Sept. before I got in the army. My wifes lawyers pushed me in the army for not going back to her 15 I'd like to be an airplane mechanic 25 It don't make no difference what kind of outfit. 34 I'll become a airplane mech. 47 I will if I get what I want. 48 Iot depends on how the war turns out in the end. 56 - Its not the people its these rules. 63 If its fighting against Japs yes. 72 There is one company thats not so hot.  [unclear] [/unclear]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: No, I have not had my fair share of [deletion]either[/deletion] furloughs [deletion] [/deletion].
S64.Q97.F: We'd like to have a swimming pool & other - sporting stuf where we can exercise.
S64.Q97.Full: We'd like to have a swimming pool & other - sporting stuf where we can exercise.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think military courtesy is too severe. Also a lot of officers like to show their power on men willing to do their part. Also I think the army could select better officers as a whole. [paragraph] There is too much partiality shown in our outfit. It's not what you do
S64.Q97.C_1: but who you know that counts in this army.
S64.Q97.Full: I think military courtesy is too severe. Also a lot of officers like to show their power on men willing to do their part. Also I think the army could select better officers as a whole. [paragraph] There is too much partiality shown in our outfit. It's not what you do  but who you know that counts in this army.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think that if a person is interested is some kind of work and show ability in it he should be given a chance at it. It seems that the army puts a man in just about the opposite of what he wants. Too many big [deletion] married [/deletion] people get good possitions in the army while a unknown person who is better fitted doesn't get a chance.
S64.Q97.C_1: I don't see why one our time off we cant have a pass that is worth while The reason I dont go on more passes is because [deletion] [/deletion] they are too short and you have to come back before you get time to do anything hard I wont go AWOL
S64.Q97.Full: I think that if a person is interested is some kind of work and show ability in it he should be given a chance at it. It seems that the army puts a man in just about the opposite of what he wants. Too many big [deletion] married [/deletion] people get good possitions in the army while a unknown person who is better fitted doesn't get a chance. I don't see why one our time off we cant have a pass that is worth while The reason I dont go on more passes is because [deletion] [/deletion] they are too short and you have to come back before you get time to do anything hard I wont go AWOL

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think there should be an inspector for companies with an inspection or investigation every four months or so to find out how things are for the soldier and if they could be better. There should be a new system for furloughs and so many soldiers wouldn't be dissatisfied.
S64.Q97.Full: I think there should be an inspector for companies with an inspection or investigation every four months or so to find out how things are for the soldier and if they could be better. There should be a new system for furloughs and so many soldiers wouldn't be dissatisfied.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: but all men not enough
S64.Q97.F: When you come in - they should put men in the kind of work they are use to - It has not been done as most people believe. More passes & furloughs should be given but make them shorter. Transportation is poor, if anything can be done it would help & please the soldier immensely. Men should have more of a chance to get in the kind of an outfit they
S64.Q97.C_1: want in for it stands to reason that they will do better in such an outfit.
S64.Q97.Full: When you come in - they should put men in the kind of work they are use to - It has not been done as most people believe. More passes & furloughs should be given but make them shorter. Transportation is poor, if anything can be done it would help & please the soldier immensely. Men should have more of a chance to get in the kind of an outfit they want in for it stands to reason that they will do better in such an outfit.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I don't mind the army so much. If I was in a better outfit and could get home once in a while it would be better.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't mind the army so much. If I was in a better outfit and could get home once in a while it would be better.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I don't mind being in the army, but I do mind being away from my wife, she in home all alone, no relatives around or anything. It is hard on her, furloughs should
S64.Q97.C_1: be given after basic training [paragrap] is finished, and about every [paragraph] four months thereafter.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't mind being in the army, but I do mind being away from my wife, she in home all alone, no relatives around or anything. It is hard on her, furloughs should be given after basic training [paragrap] is finished, and about every [paragraph] four months thereafter.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I think the food when on field rations is terrible, no variety and very little of what we do get.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the food when on field rations is terrible, no variety and very little of what we do get.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: We have [deletion] been [/deletion] not had any milk for four days at our mess hall and I thought the Army got stuff for the soldier to each [eat] and drink. The buses don't come out to our place unless it has a passenger from the main post to bring. There are only 5 boys leaving on furloughs ever 10 days and the companys has 130 men in it.
S64.Q97.C_1: We should have class A passes. We have to guard prisoners of war with clubs and I think everbody (everybody) should have guns. The town by our camp should be looked into about the way they charge our wives to live. We should be able to get more beer for the boys at the PX (post exchange). It helps out a lots (lot) at nights (night).
S64.Q97.Full: We have [deletion] been [/deletion] not had any milk for four days at our mess hall and I thought the Army got stuff for the soldier to each [eat] and drink. The buses don't come out to our place unless it has a passenger from the main post to bring. There are only 5 boys leaving on furloughs ever 10 days and the companys has 130 men in it. We should have class A passes. We have to guard prisoners of war with clubs and I think everbody (everybody) should have guns. The town by our camp should be looked into about the way they charge our wives to live. We should be able to get more beer for the boys at the PX (post exchange). It helps out a lots (lot) at nights (night).

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I don't like the company I am in. M P E G Companies are all right except this one and it all screwed up.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't like the company I am in. M P E G Companies are all right except this one and it all screwed up.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: The food is terrible, the German prisoners eat a hell of a lot better than we do & get treated better to. Do not let you have long enough furlough's when you only get one a year. We only get 10 day's + supposed to get 30 day a year.
S64.Q97.C_1: Take to big chance having us guard those dam prisoners with any Lt. stripes. [underline] Company is run like hell. [/underline] Have too many limited service men in the Army that are not fit for duty. Could do more to win the war in defense factory. Noncoms have too much sucktion with first Sgt. They get furloughs before privates and had furloughs before our 3 to 4 months when private hasn't had furlough in 6 to 8 months.
S64.Q97.Full: The food is terrible, the German prisoners eat a hell of a lot better than we do & get treated better to. Do not let you have long enough furlough's when you only get one a year. We only get 10 day's + supposed to get 30 day a year. Take to big chance having us guard those dam prisoners with any Lt. stripes. [underline] Company is run like hell. [/underline] Have too many limited service men in the Army that are not fit for duty. Could do more to win the war in defense factory. Noncoms have too much sucktion with first Sgt. They get furloughs before privates and had furloughs before our 3 to 4 months when private hasn't had furlough in 6 to 8 months.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I don't feel that our C.O. is playing fair with us. He gives promises to get us to do something & then he backs down on his word. There are a swell bunch of fellows in my company & they will do anything if they are only met half way. Our C.O. has been in the army 28 yrs. & can't seem to realize that men can't make a change from civilian life to army life over night.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't feel that our C.O. is playing fair with us. He gives promises to get us to do something & then he backs down on his word. There are a swell bunch of fellows in my company & they will do anything if they are only met half way. Our C.O. has been in the army 28 yrs. & can't seem to realize that men can't make a change from civilian life to army life over night.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I could never be satisfied in an MPEG company guarding prisoners. In comparison to other MPEG companies we have the worst commanding officer without which things would be better. In this line of work we are too isolated to enjoy it and should have more passes to better the moral. There is no reason why we should be kept in camp when off duty so all our training is over
S64.Q97.C_1: All I want is a chance to prove my worth in a good outfit which is not possible here.
S64.Q97.Full: I could never be satisfied in an MPEG company guarding prisoners. In comparison to other MPEG companies we have the worst commanding officer without which things would be better. In this line of work we are too isolated to enjoy it and should have more passes to better the moral. There is no reason why we should be kept in camp when off duty so all our training is over All I want is a chance to prove my worth in a good outfit which is not possible here.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I feel that I and in fact most of the men in our company were put in the wrong kind of outfit. There seems to be an acute shortage of skilled men such as mechanics, machinists and our company is made up of about 80% of this type. If this is the type of placement that takes place in the whole
S64.Q97.C_1: army, then things must be pretty sad because if the morale of other outfits who have been misplaced is like ours, then look out. Furloughs are given out at the rate of 15 a month. At that rate, men will have been in over a year before they have received a furlough and a 3 day pass is practically an impossibility. We have no recreational facilities and it seems that we won't get any [deletion] more [/deletion] either. Chances of transfer are discouraged by the company officer. We think our company officer [insertion] commander [/insertion] is sincere in what he is doing but we can also see that he is handicapped by a fear of "torpedoes" & for that reason he i, whether "consciously or unconsciously" depriving his men of a lot of privaleges [privileges] that is in his power to give them.
S64.Q97.Full: I feel that I and in fact most of the men in our company were put in the wrong kind of outfit. There seems to be an acute shortage of skilled men such as mechanics, machinists and our company is made up of about 80% of this type. If this is the type of placement that takes place in the whole army, then things must be pretty sad because if the morale of other outfits who have been misplaced is like ours, then look out. Furloughs are given out at the rate of 15 a month. At that rate, men will have been in over a year before they have received a furlough and a 3 day pass is practically an impossibility. We have no recreational facilities and it seems that we won't get any [deletion] more [/deletion] either. Chances of transfer are discouraged by the company officer. We think our company officer [insertion] commander [/insertion] is sincere in what he is doing but we can also see that he is handicapped by a fear of "torpedoes" & for that reason he i, whether "consciously or unconsciously" depriving his men of a lot of privaleges [privileges] that is in his power to give them.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Being a 1st Sgt [Sergeant] I know what the men want - heres [here's] a list [paragraph] 1. * Furloughs [paragraph] 2. Passes [paragraph] 3. Beer [paragraph] 4. Girls of a [deletion] fem [/deletion] womanly nature not High School U. S. O. dancers [paragraph] 5. Good Hard work
S64.Q97.Full: Being a 1st Sgt [Sergeant] I know what the men want - heres [here's] a list [paragraph] 1. * Furloughs [paragraph] 2. Passes [paragraph] 3. Beer [paragraph] 4. Girls of a [deletion] fem [/deletion] womanly nature not High School U. S. O. dancers [paragraph] 5. Good Hard work

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Have more passes issued to the men when they are off guard duty. Also get some men in camp to guard prisoners so about 20 men can take a furlough at 1 (one) time. Some men won't be able to go home until 1945. Also get us a new company comandor (commander). He is always hollering about something. Also get our company into something little exciting instead of guarding prisoners. Have a quart of milk a day instead of a half a pint.
S64.Q97.Full: Have more passes issued to the men when they are off guard duty. Also get some men in camp to guard prisoners so about 20 men can take a furlough at 1 (one) time. Some men won't be able to go home until 1945. Also get us a new company comandor (commander). He is always hollering about something. Also get our company into something little exciting instead of guarding prisoners. Have a quart of milk a day instead of a half a pint.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: In reference to change in Army jobs the reason for my choice of Air Corps Band is that I think I could be of more service to the Armed forces as a musician, than as an M.P.E.G. [Military Police Escort Guard] man because that is how I learned my living for 24 years as a civilian.
S64.Q97.Full: In reference to change in Army jobs the reason for my choice of Air Corps Band is that I think I could be of more service to the Armed forces as a musician, than as an M.P.E.G. [Military Police Escort Guard] man because that is how I learned my living for 24 years as a civilian.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: My wife is frozen to a job where she is making only 16 to 20 dollars per week. Her living standards are much lower than before I entered the army. She has had chances to earn more but cannot get released from her present job.
S64.Q97.Full: My wife is frozen to a job where she is making only 16 to 20 dollars per week. Her living standards are much lower than before I entered the army. She has had chances to earn more but cannot get released from her present job.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I don't think the chaplain takes enough interest in his spiritual work. There are not enough spiritual services.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't think the chaplain takes enough interest in his spiritual work. There are not enough spiritual services.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Suggest increased number of ratings for MPEG Companies -- As follows -- [unclear] Man [/unclear] & Supp. sgts. = Tech. Agts. Sect. Sgts. = Staff Agts. Sect. Guides = Agts.
S64.Q97.Full: Suggest increased number of ratings for MPEG Companies -- As follows -- [unclear] Man [/unclear] & Supp. sgts. = Tech. Agts. Sect. Sgts. = Staff Agts. Sect. Guides = Agts.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I believe that the general run of opinion of the men is that they all feel dissatisfied remaining in the states for the [unclear] duration [/unclear] . They don't feel like they are doing their part. [paragraph] In some outfits furloughs are granted when due. In
S64.Q97.C_1: our outfit, there is quite a bit of grumbling in the orderly room when furloughs are mentioned. We never get a 3 day pass & our hours and weeks are long. [paragraph] Our officers very seldom, if ever, talk to the men or show any interests in their chow, entertainment or the problems in general.
S64.Q97.Full: I believe that the general run of opinion of the men is that they all feel dissatisfied remaining in the states for the [unclear] duration [/unclear] . They don't feel like they are doing their part. [paragraph] In some outfits furloughs are granted when due. In our outfit, there is quite a bit of grumbling in the orderly room when furloughs are mentioned. We never get a 3 day pass & our hours and weeks are long. [paragraph] Our officers very seldom, if ever, talk to the men or show any interests in their chow, entertainment or the problems in general.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I know my Army career would be better and more chances for advancement if I had been place in the branch of Service I had asked for, - as it was along the lines of my civilian work for the past ten years, but I have tired to adapt myself to the branch I was put in, and make the best of it
S64.Q97.Full: I know my Army career would be better and more chances for advancement if I had been place in the branch of Service I had asked for, - as it was along the lines of my civilian work for the past ten years, but I have tired to adapt myself to the branch I was put in, and make the best of it

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: don't like to guard Prisoners of War with nite stick. We have very poor transportation to and from camp. We don't have Class A Passes. Our cap is giving Prisoners too much freedom, as the guards are working them with nite sticks. We have no time off between guards. Chow at this camp is Punk and we have very little beer and no recreation.
S64.Q97.Full: don't like to guard Prisoners of War with nite stick. We have very poor transportation to and from camp. We don't have Class A Passes. Our cap is giving Prisoners too much freedom, as the guards are working them with nite sticks. We have no time off between guards. Chow at this camp is Punk and we have very little beer and no recreation.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: The hours in my case on our work line I notice takes too much from the men and than our army drill etc. has to be taken up at night when they are not able to get enough out of the training offered. Also are not in condition to pull extra duties. I think a regular day of duties should be set so work, extra and regular drill and training are taken up in that
S64.Q97.C_1: time. Men once excused from a day of duties and then recalled re certainly not in the best of shape to grasp the things they need to know worse than one or two extra hours of work. In combat every man expects only the harder end and doesn't look for a few hours of relax (relaxation) so much. Also a man in combat wouldn't be learning all the new army ways.
S64.Q97.Full: The hours in my case on our work line I notice takes too much from the men and than our army drill etc. has to be taken up at night when they are not able to get enough out of the training offered. Also are not in condition to pull extra duties. I think a regular day of duties should be set so work, extra and regular drill and training are taken up in that  time. Men once excused from a day of duties and then recalled re certainly not in the best of shape to grasp the things they need to know worse than one or two extra hours of work. In combat every man expects only the harder end and doesn't look for a few hours of relax (relaxation) so much. Also a man in combat wouldn't be learning all the new army ways.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: Because most of the fellows who fool around get them and those who are honest about their work, don't.
S64.Q97.F: The rules and regulations of the Army I am now in seem a lot overdone. As for the food in this camp, not so good. The Army is supposed to build you up, well with all the running around and the lack of right food, I've lost plenty of weight. You are also required a certain amount of sleep, but you can't get it when you are up at 4:30 A.M., no matter how early you go to bed. Another thing of importance
S64.Q97.C_1: is this, we should have more time off, so we can relax and have some fun. You know the old saying "All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy". They should set up a system, and make it stand for the entire Armies of the United States. Not one Army have this rule and the other one a different one. [paragraph] So lets try and get together on these things we are supposed to be United so lets be that way. I could continue but why bitch all the time.
S64.Q97.Full: The rules and regulations of the Army I am now in seem a lot overdone. As for the food in this camp, not so good. The Army is supposed to build you up, well with all the running around and the lack of right food, I've lost plenty of weight. You are also required a certain amount of sleep, but you can't get it when you are up at 4:30 A.M., no matter how early you go to bed. Another thing of importance is this, we should have more time off, so we can relax and have some fun. You know the old saying "All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy". They should set up a system, and make it stand for the entire Armies of the United States. Not one Army have this rule and the other one a different one. [paragraph] So lets try and get together on these things we are supposed to be United so lets be that way. I could continue but why bitch all the time.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: (1) I think it should be a army rule that the first these pay grades should not have to pull C.Q. or guard duty in training as we do here. [paragraph] (2) I think a soldier should be given a furlough ever four months at least to help keep up the morale of the soldiers.
S64.Q97.Full: (1) I think it should be a army rule that the first these pay grades should not have to pull C.Q. or guard duty in training as we do here. [paragraph] (2) I think a soldier should be given a furlough ever four months at least to help keep up the morale of the soldiers.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: We should have class A passes because we were in over six months and we should also have classes at least twice a week and be station at a [deletion] [/deletion] good army camp instead of Camp Mc Cain, the [deletion] [/deletion] [unclear] worst [/unclear] camp in the U.S. We should also be stationed up north because the people would
S64.Q97.C_1: treat the soldiers better up there.
S64.Q97.Full: We should have class A passes because we were in over six months and we should also have classes at least twice a week and be station at a [deletion] [/deletion] good army camp instead of Camp Mc Cain, the [deletion] [/deletion] [unclear] worst [/unclear] camp in the U.S. We should also be stationed up north because the people would treat the soldiers better up there.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: There is one thing I would like to see done - that is close up Camp McCain in Mississippi. It's a hell hole to be in. The water seems as though it comes from a sewer. It stinks. [paragraph] I've been shipped about 5,000 miles to get where I am now. Why? [paragraph] Why can't they keep soldiers nearer their home. I would feel much better if I were nearer home. - I haven't been home in 8 months now.
S64.Q97.Full: There is one thing I would like to see done - that is close up Camp McCain in Mississippi. It's a hell hole to be in. The water seems as though it comes from a sewer. It stinks. [paragraph] I've been shipped about 5,000 miles to get where I am now. Why? [paragraph] Why can't they keep soldiers nearer their home. I would feel much better if I were nearer home. - I haven't been home in 8 months now.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: We wauld all feel better if there was less detail at night & more time to aur selves
S64.Q97.Full: We wauld all feel better if there was less detail at night & more time to aur selves

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M_marginalia: Yes! We haven't any recreational facilities in this camp. The civilians and soldiers who have cars won't give a buddy a lift. The transportation facilities here are terrible. Taxi service costs $2.50 to ride to a town that is one block around. We have to spend 2 hours of a 5 hour pass waiting for busses and
S64.Q97.F: Yes! We haven't any recreation facilities in this camp. The civilians and soldiers who have cars won't give a buddy a lift. The transportation facilities here are terrible. Tube service costs $2.50 to ride to a town that is one block around. We have to spend 2 hours of a 5 hour pass waiting for buses and
S64.Q97.C_1: We have to travel 100 miles to go to a city. I dont leave camp because of there transportation problems More care should be taken in picking the Cadre's. In our outfit every man who was drafted beat every noncom on the I. Q. test. These conditions are bad because the non comps feel as though we are smart alicks and they throw it up to us quite often. Our C.O. hasn't enough brains and initive to manage the company properly. He has no interest in his men. We eat beans while he eats steak right in front of us. Just because he is a 90 day wonder why should be get better eats than us. After all we do the work he just sits on his big fat fanny and watches. There is quite a bit of rivalry in our Company because the men come from the north and our Cadre are all Southeners. We won the Civil war and they are trying to start another one.
S64.Q97.Full: Yes! We haven't any recreation facilities in this camp. The civilians and soldiers who have cars won't give a buddy a lift. The transportation facilities here are terrible. Tube service costs $2.50 to ride to a town that is one block around. We have to spend 2 hours of a 5 hour pass waiting for buses and  We have to travel 100 miles to go to a city. I dont leave camp because of there transportation problems More care should be taken in picking the Cadre's. In our outfit every man who was drafted beat every noncom on the I. Q. test. These conditions are bad because the non comps feel as though we are smart alicks and they throw it up to us quite often. Our C.O. hasn't enough brains and initive to manage the company properly. He has no interest in his men. We eat beans while he eats steak right in front of us. Just because he is a 90 day wonder why should be get better eats than us. After all we do the work he just sits on his big fat fanny and watches. There is quite a bit of rivalry in our Company because the men come from the north and our Cadre are all Southeners. We won the Civil war and they are trying to start another one.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: The manner in which we handle the conquered Countries will determine whether or not this Country will be involved in another war. The reconstruction program of both these countries and our own should be placed in the hands of far sighted youths who will have to
S64.Q97.C_1: suffer by any mistake they make. One of the greatest faults with our government is the fact that most public officers are held by pig-headed old politicians who are not far-sighted enough to see the seriousness of their fool mistakes. One important phase in army life that makes one rather bitter is this. Many of our highest ranking non coms have I.Q. ranking from 20 to 50 points. This certainly isn't the type of man that I want to follow on the field of battle. This problem really needs attention!!
S64.Q97.Full: The manner in which we handle the conquered Countries will determine whether or not this Country will be involved in another war. The reconstruction program of both these countries and our own should be placed in the hands of far sighted youths who will have to  suffer by any mistake they make. One of the greatest faults with our government is the fact that most public officers are held by pig-headed old politicians who are not far-sighted enough to see the seriousness of their fool mistakes. One important phase in army life that makes one rather bitter is this. Many of our highest ranking non coms have I.Q. ranking from 20 to 50 points. This certainly isn't the type of man that I want to follow on the field of battle. This problem really needs attention!!

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Sir: I feel just this way. I got married after a year's service in the army. planed [planned] on it before but wouldn't for the reason that the public would feel that I was a draft dodger. And my reason for feeling like I do about that I could do more in civilian life is I have a brother physically unfit for service and is on a farm. With so much heavy work lot of it has to be skipped now which wouldn't be if I were home. And find help almost impossible to get, and the work is so heavy.
S64.Q97.C_1: for my sisters. That is my idea of my own picture of the set up. Id like to say a thing or so more about the draft boards and some of the deferments which are being made that I think are unfair.
S64.Q97.Full: Sir: I feel just this way. I got married after a year's service in the army. planed [planned] on it before but wouldn't for the reason that the public would feel that I was a draft dodger. And my reason for feeling like I do about that I could do more in civilian life is I have a brother physically unfit for service and is on a farm. With so much heavy work lot of it has to be skipped now which wouldn't be if I were home. And find help almost impossible to get, and the work is so heavy. for my sisters. That is my idea of my own picture of the set up. Id like to say a thing or so more about the draft boards and some of the deferments which are being made that I think are unfair.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: It is my personal contention that if they are going to select men to be non-coms they should select men with some brains along with qualities of leadership and not a bunch of morons.
S64.Q97.Full: It is my personal contention that if they are going to select men to be non-coms they should select men with some brains along with qualities of leadership and not a bunch of morons.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think a soldier's life on this die should be made more pleasant than it is. He should feel good and given more free time in which to enjoy himself. After all, when he hits the other side he won't have much chance to enjoy himself. Makin a man work all week and then denying him of his liberty on a weekend by giving him extra details. A thing I think would help the morale
S64.Q97.Full: I think a soldier's life on this die should be made more pleasant than it is. He should feel good and given more free time in which to enjoy himself. After all, when he hits the other side he won't have much chance to enjoy himself. Makin a man work all week and then denying him of his liberty on a weekend by giving him extra details. A thing I think would help the morale

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think a soldier's life on this side should be made more pleasant than it is . He should be fed good and given more free time in which to enjoy himself. After all when he hits the other side he won't have much chance to enjoy himself. Making one man work all week and then deyning him of his liberty on a week-end by giving him extra details. A thing I think would like the morale
S64.Q97.C_1: of the army would be too train men in their own corp area. This would give him easy access to his home and love ones. In this way a soldier's life would be made happier and he would do his job more cheerfully and better. This may sound impossible but its the best personally suggestion I can make to make this a better and happier army.
S64.Q97.Full: I think a soldier's life on this side should be made more pleasant than it is . He should be fed good and given more free time in which to enjoy himself. After all when he hits the other side he won't have much chance to enjoy himself. Making one man work all week and then deyning him of his liberty on a week-end by giving him extra details. A thing I think would like the morale of the army would be too train men in their own corp area. This would give him easy access to his home and love ones. In this way a soldier's life would be made happier and he would do his job more cheerfully and better. This may sound impossible but its the best personally suggestion I can make to make this a better and happier army.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I believe most of the first 2 grades of officer (Lieutenants) are too young and much to [insertion] too [/insertion] inexperienced. Non-coms in general are not picked for their ability.
S64.Q97.Full: I believe most of the first 2 grades of officer (Lieutenants) are too young and much to [insertion] too [/insertion] inexperienced. Non-coms in general are not picked for their ability.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: The auto maintenance outfits do not have enough personnel. There should be about 1/3 overstrength added.
S64.Q97.Full: The auto maintenance outfits do not have enough personnel. There should be about 1/3 overstrength added.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Why must men be shipped so far from their home states for basic training - could it be psychology? We could have had our basic near home just as easily - maybe easier there were probably men far from their own home states receiving training near my home state - I don't think this is any time to have us get interested in how the people
S64.Q97.C_1: in the other states ] [/unclear] line - [unclear] [/unclear] etc. It would probably be better to lay down a set plan for furloughs with every company in the U.S. working them the same way. Could use some decent barracks also with some foot lockers. We've been living out of barrack bags for almost seven months and we aren't overseas yet.
S64.Q97.Full: Why must men be shipped so far from their home states for basic training - could it be psychology? We could have had our basic near home just as easily - maybe easier there were probably men far from their own home states receiving training near my home state - I don't think this is any time to have us get interested in how the people in the other states ] [/unclear] line - [unclear] [/unclear] etc. It would probably be better to lay down a set plan for furloughs with every company in the U.S. working them the same way. Could use some decent barracks also with some foot lockers. We've been living out of barrack bags for almost seven months and we aren't overseas yet.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: 1- I am physically handicapped and certain phases of training effect me so badly that i cannot do the proper justice to my primary duty in the company. I would be a handicapped in combat, but if i were assigned to a different type of organization i could be of great value to some, and feel that I was contributing a useful [unclear] [/unclear] (part?)
S64.Q97.C_1: to the war effort. I think the army uses very poor judgement in assigning men such as I - I have seen similar cases turned down completely at the draft board. 2- We have Reveille at 4:30 A.M. and work all day, stand Retreat at 5:55 P.M., sometimes work or drill at night, then have to do a forced march every morning after insufficient slop and in a tropical climate. I think this is one way to undermine the health and morale instead of trying to better both. Too much time, emphatically so, is spent on useless fatigue duties in the company area, such time could be spent on instruction in useful subjects. There is very little co-ordination in the chain of command of our particular Army, Corps, Division, Brigade etc
S64.Q97.Full: 1- I am physically handicapped and certain phases of training effect me so badly that i cannot do the proper justice to my primary duty in the company. I would be a handicapped in combat, but if i were assigned to a different type of organization i could be of great value to some, and feel that I was contributing a useful [unclear] [/unclear] (part?) to the war effort. I think the army uses very poor judgement in assigning men such as I - I have seen similar cases turned down completely at the draft board. 2- We have Reveille at 4:30 A.M. and work all day, stand Retreat at 5:55 P.M., sometimes work or drill at night, then have to do a forced march every morning after insufficient slop and in a tropical climate. I think this is one way to undermine the health and morale instead of trying to better both. Too much time, emphatically so, is spent on useless fatigue duties in the company area, such time could be spent on instruction in useful subjects. There is very little co-ordination in the chain of command of our particular Army, Corps, Division, Brigade etc

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I. When a soldier leaves on Furlough, why can't he have the benefit of a Saturday & Sunday pass to leave on his furlough, which would give him two extra days to travel & he really don't do anything on them two days anyway. The people on the outside are told not to travel on weekends & to leave the soldiers travel. We are told that we are not allowed to travel on weekends. II. I also have very little faith in our Cmdg
S64.Q97.C_1: III as I am sure that they do not know enough about the Army to have such a responsibility. We sure would be in some fix if we were ever sent over seas with these men. I realy would be a fraid if I got over & had to rely on what they told me to do. [paragraph] IV I am sure I would make a better soldier while I am here in the States if I were nearer to home so I could see my Mother & Father at least twice or once a month as they are very old & may soon pass away & it would make me much happier to see my wife every now & then. [paragraph] V Why must we have the floor spotless & then get clean bed cloths once every [triple underline] three [/triple underline] weeks. We get only a matress cover & a pillow case & no sheets. This I realy think is a menace to our health.
S64.Q97.Full: I. When a soldier leaves on Furlough, why can't he have the benefit of a Saturday & Sunday pass to leave on his furlough, which would give him two extra days to travel & he really don't do anything on them two days anyway. The people on the outside are told not to travel on weekends & to leave the soldiers travel. We are told that we are not allowed to travel on weekends. II. I also have very little faith in our Cmdg III as I am sure that they do not know enough about the Army to have such a responsibility. We sure would be in some fix if we were ever sent over seas with these men. I realy would be a fraid if I got over & had to rely on what they told me to do. [paragraph] IV I am sure I would make a better soldier while I am here in the States if I were nearer to home so I could see my Mother & Father at least twice or once a month as they are very old & may soon pass away & it would make me much happier to see my wife every now & then. [paragraph] V Why must we have the floor spotless & then get clean bed cloths once every [triple underline] three [/triple underline] weeks. We get only a matress cover & a pillow case & no sheets. This I realy think is a menace to our health.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: This outfit I am in is one of the worse. Most of the boys hates it as I do. I don't care too much for the officers. I think they would run if they ever saw an enemy. We have not had any combat training.
S64.Q97.Full: This outfit I am in is one of the worse. Most of the boys hates it as I do. I don't care too much for the officers. I think they would run if they ever saw an enemy. We have not had any combat training.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: As far as Officer's Candidate Schools + [&] Special Service Schools for Enlisted men, I do [underline] not [/underline] think that enough is being done to make these schools + [&] classes known to the men. The Army would benefit greatly by the enrollment in these schools, of some of the fellows. I have known since my Army career began.
