S64.Q97.Full: As far as Officer's Candidate Schools + [&] Special Service Schools for Enlisted men, I do [underline] not [/underline] think that enough is being done to make these schools + [&] classes known to the men. The Army would benefit greatly by the enrollment in these schools, of some of the fellows. I have known since my Army career began.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: The only thing I see wrong is that there are too many officers in the army with nothing to do and give the EM a bad time. Non Com do all the work why have officers they only get in the way. Some are usefully but others dream of orders that don't make sense.
S64.Q97.Full: The only thing I see wrong is that there are too many officers in the army with nothing to do and give the EM a bad time. Non Com do all the work why have officers they only get in the way. Some are usefully but others dream of orders that don't make sense.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I would like to be working in some defense job where I could be home, my wife & may mother have no one to stay with, & I feel I could do as much to win the war working in some factory or somewhere. I have trouble with my back & my eyes are not very good.
S64.Q97.Full: I would like to be working in some defense job where I could be home, my wife & may mother have no one to stay with, & I feel I could do as much to win the war working in some factory or somewhere. I have trouble with my back & my eyes are not very good.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I would like to get in the army air corps.
S64.Q97.Full: I would like to get in the army air corps.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: When I came into the army I was told that the ratings were chosen from the men who carry them. But I found out that the man who can buy them [unclear] [/unclear] he suck for himself is the man who gets the break. Not the man who works for them. I believe that this should be remanded. Also the food that we are given is [page ends]
S64.Q97.C_1: get is not what the army claims it to be. I think the army should teach their cooks to take more pains with their food. [paragraph] I also believe that officers should think more of their men's welfare and not think so much of their ranks. Look after their men and not feel that they are some king or the president as a lot of our officers do.
S64.Q97.Full: When I came into the army I was told that the ratings were chosen from the men who carry them. But I found out that the man who can buy them [unclear] [/unclear] he suck for himself is the man who gets the break. Not the man who works for them. I believe that this should be remanded. Also the food that we are given is [page ends]  get is not what the army claims it to be. I think the army should teach their cooks to take more pains with their food. [paragraph] I also believe that officers should think more of their men's welfare and not think so much of their ranks. Look after their men and not feel that they are some king or the president as a lot of our officers do.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Well I think and I am sure most of the boys are with me in saying that our C.O. is the most chicken shit C.O. in the army. He is always bucking and finding unnecessary things for us to do. He never went out of his way for us like the other C.O. in the Bn. did for their men. Also I think somebody is making a
S64.Q97.C_1: money on the side by the way we eat. and our supply Sgt. don't care what he gives you, and charges you for salvage.
S64.Q97.Full: Well I think and I am sure most of the boys are with me in saying that our C.O. is the most chicken shit C.O. in the army. He is always bucking and finding unnecessary things for us to do. He never went out of his way for us like the other C.O. in the Bn. did for their men. Also I think somebody is making a  money on the side by the way we eat. and our supply Sgt. don't care what he gives you, and charges you for salvage.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: be considered very serious. On the other hand if death had struck in the family, or his wife was expecting, and his Co. wouldn't give him an emergency pass; I would consider it justifiable if the man returned,
S64.Q97.Full: be considered very serious. On the other hand if death had struck in the family, or his wife was expecting, and his Co. wouldn't give him an emergency pass; I would consider it justifiable if the man returned,

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I have an interest in fighting not at back of the lines in a [unclear] [/unclear] outfit. I am very much disgusted. I would rather die like a soldier than be a failure in the army.
S64.Q97.Full: I have an interest in fighting not at back of the lines in a [unclear] [/unclear] outfit. I am very much disgusted. I would rather die like a soldier than be a failure in the army.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Pay for Dad remains the same on Fire Department and living conditions have gone up. These war bonds to buy and no raise for the fireman. Think the government would take these things into consideration. After all they do work for the state.
S64.Q97.Full: Pay for Dad remains the same on Fire Department and living conditions have gone up. These war bonds to buy and no raise for the fireman. Think the government would take these things into consideration. After all they do work for the state.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I have been trying for a trans-fer into the air corps as aviation cadet for the last four months. My form was filled [insertion] out [/insertion] , sent home for my parents signature and returned just before changing posts, or camps, which was about three weeks ago but nothing is being done to it since my arrival here. I believe I can make a better
S64.Q97.C_1: soldier and be of better use to my country if this transfer is granted.
S64.Q97.Full: I have been trying for a trans-fer into the air corps as aviation cadet for the last four months. My form was filled [insertion] out [/insertion] , sent home for my parents signature and returned just before changing posts, or camps, which was about three weeks ago but nothing is being done to it since my arrival here. I believe I can make a better soldier and be of better use to my country if this transfer is granted.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: About furloughs and passes I am getting a furlough right away and about passes I am indecided as to yet. and I am more ashamed of my outfit than proud of it. My folks has never received any money although I have had an allotment made out for over 5 months. I don't see why they haven't
S64.Q97.Full: About furloughs and passes I am getting a furlough right away and about passes I am indecided as to yet. and I am more ashamed of my outfit than proud of it. My folks has never received any money although I have had an allotment made out for over 5 months. I don't see why they haven't

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: They wanted to reclassify me to 1 B or limited service. I feel I can do a lot more at home for the war efforts and my family. I am an electrician by trade and have two yrs [years] of navy marine experience behind me. 17 yrs [years] all told in the electricians line. My missus is doing her best to get me out now.
S64.Q97.Full: They wanted to reclassify me to 1 B or limited service. I feel I can do a lot more at home for the war efforts and my family. I am an electrician by trade and have two yrs [years] of navy marine experience behind me. 17 yrs [years] all told in the electricians line. My missus is doing her best to get me out now.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I (I'd) like to say that they should cut a lot of the details out and let a man work at his job. There are to (too) many detail (details) that make you loose (lose) a lot of time at your special job.
S64.Q97.Full: I (I'd) like to say that they should cut a lot of the details out and let a man work at his job. There are to (too) many detail (details) that make you loose (lose) a lot of time at your special job.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: There are men highly skilled in jobs that are classified to that job, send to school in different and then sent to a technical outfit to do a job which he can't use either his skill trade or the trade he learned in school. The classification of army enlisted men is run very poorly. I have been 3 months in school to learn one thing to do here in the army.
S64.Q97.C_1: I have learned more in a week by actual experience here on the line than I did in school about the job I have to do here.[paragraph] There are so many men here that are next to useless, that would be worth many times as much as a civilian on a job he knows best or be placed on a job in the Army that he knows best. At present I have had 10 years of acetylene + Electric welding in machine shops and heavy duty mechanic work. Caterpillar drag lines, oil field equipment. In here I am an armorer. About once a week I clean some guns and sweep out the bldg [building] . The other days are spent on K.P. [kitchen patrol] and guard duty, etc.
S64.Q97.Full: There are men highly skilled in jobs that are classified to that job, send to school in different and then sent to a technical outfit to do a job which he can't use either his skill trade or the trade he learned in school. The classification of army enlisted men is run very poorly. I have been 3 months in school to learn one thing to do here in the army.  I have learned more in a week by actual experience here on the line than I did in school about the job I have to do here.[paragraph] There are so many men here that are next to useless, that would be worth many times as much as a civilian on a job he knows best or be placed on a job in the Army that he knows best. At present I have had 10 years of acetylene + Electric welding in machine shops and heavy duty mechanic work. Caterpillar drag lines, oil field equipment. In here I am an armorer. About once a week I clean some guns and sweep out the bldg [building] . The other days are spent on K.P. [kitchen patrol] and guard duty, etc.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: This war has put my folks in a pretty tough spot, and it is getting when a person wants something they can't get it most generally because the Army gets pretty near all the thing needed in regular life.
S64.Q97.Full: This war has put my folks in a pretty tough spot, and it is getting when a person wants something they can't get it most generally because the Army gets pretty near all the thing needed in regular life.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: As a whole and speaking generally I think enlisted men don't receive enough credit for the work they do in comparison with the work done by most officers. The class distinction between officers & enlisted men is something that doesn't do the Army any good. I know some enlisted men whom I respect
S64.Q97.C_1: and will do more for than most officers even though the army says I must respect the officer and shouldn't even associate with them. A man will get respect if he's a man and not because he does or does not wear bars.
S64.Q97.Full: As a whole and speaking generally I think enlisted men don't receive enough credit for the work they do in comparison with the work done by most officers. The class distinction between officers & enlisted men is something that doesn't do the Army any good. I know some enlisted men whom I respect and will do more for than most officers even though the army says I must respect the officer and shouldn't even associate with them. A man will get respect if he's a man and not because he does or does not wear bars.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: To who so ever reads this: I have two particular buddies of mine, both are brothers. They are somewhere in Australia and neither one of them was in the Army more than eight months. I don't care how the Army officers treat me how bad the chow is or any other thing, but for Pete's sake why can't the Army give a soldier at least one furlough
S64.Q97.C_1: before they send him [unclear] [/unclear] ? The navy gives a sailor a leave right after he finishes boat training and I can't see why the army can't do the same. Thank you. [paragraph] A very Hot tempered Soldier.
S64.Q97.Full: To who so ever reads this: I have two particular buddies of mine, both are brothers. They are somewhere in Australia and neither one of them was in the Army more than eight months. I don't care how the Army officers treat me how bad the chow is or any other thing, but for Pete's sake why can't the Army give a soldier at least one furlough before they send him [unclear] [/unclear] ? The navy gives a sailor a leave right after he finishes boat training and I can't see why the army can't do the same. Thank you. [paragraph] A very Hot tempered Soldier.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I think that through out the country there is a terrific waste in man power in the army - due to politics & jockeying around of men from one organization to another. Hundreds of good men are moved around [unclear] uselessly [/unclear] until they get disgusted a don't care anymore.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that through out the country there is a terrific waste in man power in the army - due to politics & jockeying around of men from one organization to another. Hundreds of good men are moved around [unclear] uselessly [/unclear] until they get disgusted a don't care anymore.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think all of the Limited Service men should be taken out of the army and put into factories and the ones that are in the factories should be in our place [unclear] as [/unclear] most of them are in better health than the Limited Service men.
S64.Q97.Full: I think all of the Limited Service men should be taken out of the army and put into factories and the ones that are in the factories should be in our place [unclear] as [/unclear] most of them are in better health than the Limited Service men.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Drew Field is the worst field I've ever been stationed at according to poor management. Very little time off & poor Laundry & [unclear] Bars [/unclear] conditions - A lot of unnecessary squadron duties for crew chiefs to perform.
S64.Q97.Full: Drew Field is the worst field I've ever been stationed at according to poor management. Very little time off & poor Laundry & [unclear] Bars [/unclear] conditions - A lot of unnecessary squadron duties for crew chiefs to perform.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: Have not been in long enough for a furlough No furlough to date
S64.Q97.F: Some sort of transportation system should be worked out for soldiers on furloughs, or for soldiers where camp is a few mile[s] from a town. [paragraph] Curfew should be standardized for all army posts as 12:30 or 1:00. M.P.'s [Military Police] should be taught that their duty is to protect soldiers rather than show everyone how contemptible they can be over such little matters.
S64.Q97.C_1: A soldier should not be allowed in bars, eating places, etc after established curfew hours. However he should not be picked up by the military police because he is on the streets. As longs as a soldier is going about his business in an orderly manner why should he have to leave the streets of a town. After curfew, as long as a soldier is moving along to his bus stop, taxi stop, or hotel room why should he be picked up if its after curfew.
S64.Q97.Full: Some sort of transportation system should be worked out for soldiers on furloughs, or for soldiers where camp is a few mile[s] from a town. [paragraph] Curfew should be standardized for all army posts as 12:30 or 1:00. M.P.'s [Military Police] should be taught that their duty is to protect soldiers rather than show everyone how contemptible they can be over such little matters.  A soldier should not be allowed in bars, eating places, etc after established curfew hours. However he should not be picked up by the military police because he is on the streets. As longs as a soldier is going about his business in an orderly manner why should he have to leave the streets of a town. After curfew, as long as a soldier is moving along to his bus stop, taxi stop, or hotel room why should he be picked up if its after curfew.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: We are supposed to be training as ground Maintenance men (keep the planes flying) but every other duty (guard - KP - Drill) and review comes before line duty. It carries the earmarks of the Infantry. The uncertainty of orders from the Higher rankined officers contradict each other. Let's get together on one subject just once in a while.
S64.Q97.C_1: There is extreme cases of money being wasted without results to anyone because of changed orders - uncalled for traveling about. Remember we are the ones who have to pay.
S64.Q97.Full: We are supposed to be training as ground Maintenance men (keep the planes flying) but every other duty (guard - KP - Drill) and review comes before line duty. It carries the earmarks of the Infantry. The uncertainty of orders from the Higher rankined officers contradict each other. Let's get together on one subject just once in a while. There is extreme cases of money being wasted without results to anyone because of changed orders - uncalled for traveling about. Remember we are the ones who have to pay.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: It took me eleven months to get my first furlough. That is too long for anyone that is still in the U.S. to wait. Promotions are not given to the hardest working and most deserving. They are given to the men that make the big brass like them by going out on his drinking parties with him or stooging for him. They wouldn't work a minute overtime to save their soul from hell. The smartest men in this army are privates, yet they have to be bossed and kicked
S64.Q97.C_1: around by some whiskey loving master Sergeant that is half drunk all the time. There seems to be to much delegation of authority & strip-pulling. Lets come to Drew Fld: Everything seems to be operated very poorly. Everything seems to be operated very inconveniently for the soldier. The service club opens about 9:00 or 10:00 O'clock. Why couldn't it open at 6:00? The buses stop at the gate. I reckon this is to allow us soldiers to get drenched if it is raining. From Sergeants on up get Class A passes. Since when is it that a Pvt or Corporal isn't as good as the Sergeant? If an enlisted man has money enough to buy a nice uniform, why shouldn't he be allowed to wear it? After all he likes to be well dressed just the same as an officer. The bars should be enough to distinguish the officers from a enlisted man. Since when does a Sergeant not get his barracks as dirty as a Pvt. But the Sergeant doesn't pull room orderly. Why?
S64.Q97.Full: It took me eleven months to get my first furlough. That is too long for anyone that is still in the U.S. to wait. Promotions are not given to the hardest working and most deserving. They are given to the men that make the big brass like them by going out on his drinking parties with him or stooging for him. They wouldn't work a minute overtime to save their soul from hell. The smartest men in this army are privates, yet they have to be bossed and kicked  around by some whiskey loving master Sergeant that is half drunk all the time. There seems to be to much delegation of authority & strip-pulling. Lets come to Drew Fld: Everything seems to be operated very poorly. Everything seems to be operated very inconveniently for the soldier. The service club opens about 9:00 or 10:00 O'clock. Why couldn't it open at 6:00? The buses stop at the gate. I reckon this is to allow us soldiers to get drenched if it is raining. From Sergeants on up get Class A passes. Since when is it that a Pvt or Corporal isn't as good as the Sergeant? If an enlisted man has money enough to buy a nice uniform, why shouldn't he be allowed to wear it? After all he likes to be well dressed just the same as an officer. The bars should be enough to distinguish the officers from a enlisted man. Since when does a Sergeant not get his barracks as dirty as a Pvt. But the Sergeant doesn't pull room orderly. Why?

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I have no use for the south, its people and the way southern camps are run. The people of the North give a soldier a break but here they never try to oblige anybody but themselves. I think my squadron on drew Field is run very poorly and only the nearest friends of the people running it
S64.Q97.C_1: get a break. as far as furloughs are concerned all the friends go first and the ones that work just as hard and many who have been with the squadron longer have to sit back and wait till these other fellows get back. I don't think this is at all fair. In a lot of cases the army puts you in a thing that you can't show your ability to do good and thus you stay in the lower rank. I think if a person was put in work that suited him he could do much better. This field in my opinion is run very poorly.
S64.Q97.Full: I have no use for the south, its people and the way southern camps are run. The people of the North give a soldier a break but here they never try to oblige anybody but themselves. I think my squadron on drew Field is run very poorly and only the nearest friends of the people running it  get a break. as far as furloughs are concerned all the friends go first and the ones that work just as hard and many who have been with the squadron longer have to sit back and wait till these other fellows get back. I don't think this is at all fair. In a lot of cases the army puts you in a thing that you can't show your ability to do good and thus you stay in the lower rank. I think if a person was put in work that suited him he could do much better. This field in my opinion is run very poorly.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: In my opinion too many promotions are given to fellows acting as "teachers pet", rather than fellows with ability. Furloughs in the Air Corps are not given on time. I have known fellows in the service over a year who haven't been home once in that time. Too many times payrolls are so bawled-up that fellows go 2 & 3 months without pay. Laundry presents the worst problem on this particular field.
S64.Q97.Full: In my opinion too many promotions are given to fellows acting as "teachers pet", rather than fellows with ability. Furloughs in the Air Corps are not given on time. I have known fellows in the service over a year who haven't been home once in that time. Too many times payrolls are so bawled-up that fellows go 2 & 3 months without pay. Laundry presents the worst problem on this particular field.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Provisions should be made for the married soldier to live with his wife whenever possible or at least give him the opportunity to spend more than one night a week with her when they are lucky enough to be near each other.
S64.Q97.Full: Provisions should be made for the married soldier to live with his wife whenever possible or at least give him the opportunity to spend more than one night a week with her when they are lucky enough to be near each other.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: The Armed Forces should have more interest in the men personally as to their beliefs in work, recreation, dicipline [discipline] and religious beliefs. Being a Servant of the Lord it is painful to live with Athiests. Being used to promptness very painful to wait around. Being honest seems painful to live with the dishonest. What do you think? Let the sheep live with the sheep. Goats with goats.
S64.Q97.Full: The Armed Forces should have more interest in the men personally as to their beliefs in work, recreation, dicipline [discipline] and religious beliefs. Being a Servant of the Lord it is painful to live with Athiests. Being used to promptness very painful to wait around. Being honest seems painful to live with the dishonest. What do you think? Let the sheep live with the sheep. Goats with goats.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Question (49) Britain is producing more material per head than any of the United Nations. [paragraph] Question (47) We should try to get a President with the foresight and all around ability of Mr Roosevelt.
S64.Q97.Full: Question (49) Britain is producing more material per head than any of the United Nations. [paragraph] Question (47) We should try to get a President with the foresight and all around ability of Mr Roosevelt.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Cause I'm married + my wife isn't fit for work + see her to live on only what she gets + can't buy her cloths like when I was working + we are unhappy
S64.Q97.Full: Cause I'm married + my wife isn't fit for work + see her to live on only what she gets + can't buy her cloths like when I was working + we are unhappy

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: O.C.S. Boards should not select officer candidates because they are tall & look like a Hollywood officer. [para] We should have joined up with Germany & beat Enland & Russia & Japan. Communisms worse than Natsm. [para] The South is in Economic Slavery to the North. In a fight for freedom we should be fighting them. We are but a conquored territory, fighting for them as Austria is fighting for Germany. The Germans sacked only a small town call Ludice. The North
S64.Q97.C_1: in the Civil War ravaged several whole States & put Negro rulers over a conquered people. The most horrible rape in the History of civilization. The South should have resisted & joined up with Germany to beat the North & Japan & Russia.
S64.Q97.Full: O.C.S. Boards should not select officer candidates because they are tall & look like a Hollywood officer. [para] We should have joined up with Germany & beat Enland & Russia & Japan. Communisms worse than Natsm. [para] The South is in Economic Slavery to the North. In a fight for freedom we should be fighting them. We are but a conquored territory, fighting for them as Austria is fighting for Germany. The Germans sacked only a small town call Ludice. The North in the Civil War ravaged several whole States & put Negro rulers over a conquered people. The most horrible rape in the History of civilization. The South should have resisted & joined up with Germany to beat the North & Japan & Russia.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Some system of classifying men so they get jobs they like is needed. Too many men go to GI school to learn jobs they never heard of before. I think it is for the most part a waste of time.
S64.Q97.Full: Some system of classifying men so they get jobs they like is needed. Too many men go to GI school to learn jobs they never heard of before. I think it is for the most part a waste of time.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: If there wasn't so much politics and red tape I think the army would be better off. Many officers were put in through political pull and never even saw a cap pistol fired. they sure wouldn't make a good leader. However it is something I cannot do. Also there is too much authority imposed on the
S64.Q97.C_1: MP's who seem to be the dullest picked men except for a few some of them swagger with clubs and pistol ready to pounce on anyone. They seem to love to show their authority which is being given to them by some poor huff fast lawyers {paragraph} I think if they trained MPs as soldiers friends and not give them so much authority thats one thing which would help the Army. Also many clean cut boys have been thrown in the guard house by officers who don't care for anyone except themselves and hate to do any thing about the men. Court martials always wants to seek the lime light by imposing heavy sentences or the looks of soldiers, while any one with great offenses are easily punished.
S64.Q97.Full: If there wasn't so much politics and red tape I think the army would be better off. Many officers were put in through political pull and never even saw a cap pistol fired. they sure wouldn't make a good leader. However it is something I cannot do. Also there is too much authority imposed on the  MP's who seem to be the dullest picked men except for a few some of them swagger with clubs and pistol ready to pounce on anyone. They seem to love to show their authority which is being given to them by some poor huff fast lawyers {paragraph} I think if they trained MPs as soldiers friends and not give them so much authority thats one thing which would help the Army. Also many clean cut boys have been thrown in the guard house by officers who don't care for anyone except themselves and hate to do any thing about the men. Court martials always wants to seek the lime light by imposing heavy sentences or the looks of soldiers, while any one with great offenses are easily punished.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: The only remarks are the army should try placing the men in same job closer to what they was doing before entering the army. Also let the men know how their age is to be figured on before they enter in the army. The reason for that is I have been told on several occasions by officers my age is against me on some jobs. I agree but as to work close to or about the same
S64.Q97.C_1: I do not agree with the army for I know what I am trying to git [get] into [unclear] [/unclear] as hard or as steady in the army as when working for a company who is out to make ever [every] thing they can from the work one is doing for them. [paragraph] And the army should train the soldiers to do all the work the army has to do not just so much and leave the rest for some outfit out side of the army do it.
S64.Q97.Full: The only remarks are the army should try placing the men in same job closer to what they was doing before entering the army. Also let the men know how their age is to be figured on before they enter in the army. The reason for that is I have been told on several occasions by officers my age is against me on some jobs. I agree but as to work close to or about the same  I do not agree with the army for I know what I am trying to git [get] into [unclear] [/unclear] as hard or as steady in the army as when working for a company who is out to make ever [every] thing they can from the work one is doing for them. [paragraph] And the army should train the soldiers to do all the work the army has to do not just so much and leave the rest for some outfit out side of the army do it.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: the Base I am now Stationed on is the sorriest I have ever seen on or hand off. {paragraph} No system at all to go to town have to eat out of mess kits have no desent beds and this field never saw a bed sheet except in the hospital and a very dam few here. {paragraph} I think every one should have a permanent pass. It takes sometimes
S64.Q97.C_1: 6 and 8 hours to get a overnight pass. Thanks.
S64.Q97.Full: the Base I am now Stationed on is the sorriest I have ever seen on or hand off. {paragraph} No system at all to go to town have to eat out of mess kits have no desent beds and this field never saw a bed sheet except in the hospital and a very dam few here. {paragraph} I think every one should have a permanent pass. It takes sometimes 6 and 8 hours to get a overnight pass. Thanks.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I thank when we get a over nite pass we shud be alowed to stay on the streets after 12 oclock for after all that isent but once a week & another thing I thank the oldest men shud get a leave to go home before anyone else
S64.Q97.Full: I thank when we get a over nite pass we shud be alowed to stay on the streets after 12 oclock for after all that isent but once a week & another thing I thank the oldest men shud get a leave to go home before anyone else

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I would think it would be a good idea to put the boys in something they have been doing. An if they have boys who have finished high school who would like to take up some course that would be a fear or little longer they should be sent because most of them haven't had a chance to go to college & they would like to have a little to help them in their future.
S64.Q97.Full: I would think it would be a good idea to put the boys in something they have been doing. An if they have boys who have finished high school who would like to take up some course that would be a fear or little longer they should be sent because most of them haven't had a chance to go to college & they would like to have a little to help them in their future.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: The morale is bad, although some would never feel differently. The restrictions are too strict. and working hours re to (too) long. In my particular case, I work six days a week. Three of them from 7 a.m. until 11 p.m. and the other three form 7 a.m. until 5:30 p.m. That I can stand, although I do not see the reason for it for there are enough men to go around but, when on my day off I
S64.Q97.C_1: have to keep one step ahead of the duty Sgt. that is enough to hurt anyone. One does not dare put in for a day off pass. for he will find himself on guard or K?
S64.Q97.Full: The morale is bad, although some would never feel differently. The restrictions are too strict. and working hours re to (too) long. In my particular case, I work six days a week. Three of them from 7 a.m. until 11 p.m. and the other three form 7 a.m. until 5:30 p.m. That I can stand, although I do not see the reason for it for there are enough men to go around but, when on my day off I have to keep one step ahead of the duty Sgt. that is enough to hurt anyone. One does not dare put in for a day off pass. for he will find himself on guard or K?

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: It would be a pretty good idea to give men like myself and many other like me, who have put in from 6 months to a year of service at least a 10 or 15 day furlough. It would make them a lot happier and they would enjoy working harder. There isn't any use putting down anymore because I honestly don't believe it will do any good. Thank you.
S64.Q97.Full: It would be a pretty good idea to give men like myself and many other like me, who have put in from 6 months to a year of service at least a 10 or 15 day furlough. It would make them a lot happier and they would enjoy working harder. There isn't any use putting down anymore because I honestly don't believe it will do any good. Thank you.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: In my present army life I have never been away from home. It gives me more responsibility to look after myself, and to know what to do at the right time. I am fairly well acquainted with army life in my six months of being in the service, but hope to sometime remain at home, for a certain length of time.
S64.Q97.Full: In my present army life I have never been away from home. It gives me more responsibility to look after myself, and to know what to do at the right time. I am fairly well acquainted with army life in my six months of being in the service, but hope to sometime remain at home, for a certain length of time.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I've answered this according to the situation I have found at this field. In my opinion the setup is poor. We are having to put too much time on details which take us from our job which I consider an important one in this war. I'm an air corp mechanic. I think we
S64.Q97.C_1: should have more time on our job instead of doing detail about from 5 to 9 days out of every two weeks. We should have general duty men here for that purpose. Our chances here for ratings are poor. I went to P.M. school and Factory school. Now the ones who come through with schools are corporals so that punches us out of our ratings. I've been in almost a year and never had a furlough and my chances here are very slim. In my opinion I'm not getting a fair deal but may be I'm wrong. They can always say think what the guys across are putting up with. They don't figure some day I may face the same thing but while I'm here I like to be given a square deal.
S64.Q97.Full: I've answered this according to the situation I have found at this field. In my opinion the setup is poor. We are having to put too much time on details which take us from our job which I consider an important one in this war. I'm an air corp mechanic. I think we  should have more time on our job instead of doing detail about from 5 to 9 days out of every two weeks. We should have general duty men here for that purpose. Our chances here for ratings are poor. I went to P.M. school and Factory school. Now the ones who come through with schools are corporals so that punches us out of our ratings. I've been in almost a year and never had a furlough and my chances here are very slim. In my opinion I'm not getting a fair deal but may be I'm wrong. They can always say think what the guys across are putting up with. They don't figure some day I may face the same thing but while I'm here I like to be given a square deal.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Serve better chow - see men get their furloughs promptly every six mo. [months] when possible. Have a longer furlough (20 days) have movie pricers cut for soldiers who attend town theaters.
S64.Q97.Full: Serve better chow - see men get their furloughs promptly every six mo. [months] when possible. Have a longer furlough (20 days) have movie pricers cut for soldiers who attend town theaters.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: Except for about 3 mos. (months) when I had no days off without fighting for them.
S64.Q97.F: The theory of the Army as handed down by its non-commissioned officers is that a good soldier is a belligerent, coarse, self-centered individual with no respect for morals. Such a man could win neither a war nor a peace, and he is a direct opposite to the things we are fighting for. I don't believe that the truly great soldiers in this army have such ideals, and I'm sure the recruits don't until and unless they become impressed by the more
S64.Q97.C_1: hardened old-timers. However, the truly great soldiers could demand a better example if they thought it worth the trouble. Give us more tact, more courtesy, more to get the job done well and quickly and less of the "tough guy" tactics. Another thing, give us officers who know their jobs and who are not afraid to get their hands soiled or to be friendly with their men.
S64.Q97.Full: The theory of the Army as handed down by its non-commissioned officers is that a good soldier is a belligerent, coarse, self-centered individual with no respect for morals. Such a man could win neither a war nor a peace, and he is a direct opposite to the things we are fighting for. I don't believe that the truly great soldiers in this army have such ideals, and I'm sure the recruits don't until and unless they become impressed by the more hardened old-timers. However, the truly great soldiers could demand a better example if they thought it worth the trouble. Give us more tact, more courtesy, more to get the job done well and quickly and less of the "tough guy" tactics. Another thing, give us officers who know their jobs and who are not afraid to get their hands soiled or to be friendly with their men.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: There are too much politics in the Army. Too many unfair officers & non coms. Too many officers that aren't fit to be officers. Too much superior officer material in the enlisted ranks. Promotions where they're not deserved. No promotions where they
S64.Q97.C_1: are deserved. I could write a book on the petty injustices I have seen in the army.
S64.Q97.Full: There are too much politics in the Army. Too many unfair officers & non coms. Too many officers that aren't fit to be officers. Too much superior officer material in the enlisted ranks. Promotions where they're not deserved. No promotions where they are deserved. I could write a book on the petty injustices I have seen in the army.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: A soldier should be given a furlough imediatly after he finishes his schooling before being transferred to get his practical experience provided he has been in from 4 to 6 months. [paragraph] A soldier should be given his furloughs more regularly to keep his moral up because that is what a soldier looks forward to.
S64.Q97.Full: A soldier should be given a furlough imediatly after he finishes his schooling before being transferred to get his practical experience provided he has been in from 4 to 6 months. [paragraph] A soldier should be given his furloughs more regularly to keep his moral up because that is what a soldier looks forward to.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: : I think that in many cases army men halls could be improved and a little more point taken in preparing the food, evermore a lot of care eventhough the food is very healthful it is not at all delicious
S64.Q97.Full: : I think that in many cases army men halls could be improved and a little more point taken in preparing the food, evermore a lot of care eventhough the food is very healthful it is not at all delicious

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: Too many brass hats sitting around thinking up some useless regulations that hinders instead of helps To much paper work this too many men inactive "If it won't win the war, forget it." If every officer would remember that we would be in Germany now
S64.Q97.Full: Too many brass hats sitting around thinking up some useless regulations that hinders instead of helps To much paper work this too many men inactive "If it won't win the war, forget it." If every officer would remember that we would be in Germany now

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Select officer material from the ranks after a man has been in the service for at least six months.
S64.Q97.Full: Select officer material from the ranks after a man has been in the service for at least six months.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: My remarks are on the furlough situation. I believe that a soldier as far away from home as I am should be aloud a 10 day with travelling time. For me it takes 5 days to go up & the same amount to come back, that leaves five days at home. Besides the amount of time at home the price of going up is high for any soldier. You take these fellows that live around 12 to 1500 miles
S64.Q97.C_1: from here can get home in a day or so. It cost around 25 to 30 dollars. Then they have 11 to 12 or sometimes 13 days at home. [paragraph] To my opinion it is unfair for fellows like me, all the way around. I would like to see the travelling time be added on, to my information we will be stationed down here in the south for the duration & I plan on getting a furlough very shortly.
S64.Q97.Full: My remarks are on the furlough situation. I believe that a soldier as far away from home as I am should be aloud a 10 day with travelling time. For me it takes 5 days to go up & the same amount to come back, that leaves five days at home. Besides the amount of time at home the price of going up is high for any soldier. You take these fellows that live around 12 to 1500 miles from here can get home in a day or so. It cost around 25 to 30 dollars. Then they have 11 to 12 or sometimes 13 days at home. [paragraph] To my opinion it is unfair for fellows like me, all the way around. I would like to see the travelling time be added on, to my information we will be stationed down here in the south for the duration & I plan on getting a furlough very shortly.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: There is to much legalized waste connected to the building of all government projects. This could be curbed to a great extent. [paragraph] There are two many mis-fits in the army - they could serve a better purpose at home - in short the army has sacrificed quality for quantity in man power. [paragraph] The officers as a whole are pretty good but the qualifications should be a little higher as there is a little too much soft-
S64.Q97.C_1: raft creeping into the officers ranks. Non-coms [non-commissioned officers] ratings should be given men through a true merit system instead of length of service in a squadron.
S64.Q97.Full: There is to much legalized waste connected to the building of all government projects. This could be curbed to a great extent. [paragraph] There are two many mis-fits in the army - they could serve a better purpose at home - in short the army has sacrificed quality for quantity in man power. [paragraph] The officers as a whole are pretty good but the qualifications should be a little higher as there is a little too much soft- raft creeping into the officers ranks. Non-coms [non-commissioned officers] ratings should be given men through a true merit system instead of length of service in a squadron.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M_marginalia: I can't get home to see.
S64.Q97.F: I think the mosquitoes should be gotten rid of for we can't get any rest on our time off for fighting them. The furloughs should be easier to get than they usually are, The people in [(Fla.?)] should treat service men better. They act as thought we are dogs on the street. We have too much time on duty
S64.Q97.C_1: When we could do just as much in less time and have more liberty. We have to stay on the job too long for the work we get completed. (paragraph) Each camp should have enough WAAC's (Women's Army Corps) for every soldier on the base. It is a very bad woman shortage in Florida. (paragraph) I think a much more apporate (appropriate) place could be found for an army base other than the very swamps of Florida. (paragraph) The civilians cold raise the moral (morale) of the soldiers by at least being nice to them and giving a little recreation. (paragraph) Should give soldiers on pass or furlough preference to tranportation (transportation) for if we miss the train or bus we will suffer severe punishment for A.W.O.L. (absent without leave)
S64.Q97.Full: I think the mosquitoes should be gotten rid of for we can't get any rest on our time off for fighting them. The furloughs should be easier to get than they usually are, The people in [(Fla.?)] should treat service men better. They act as thought we are dogs on the street. We have too much time on duty When we could do just as much in less time and have more liberty. We have to stay on the job too long for the work we get completed. (paragraph) Each camp should have enough WAAC's (Women's Army Corps) for every soldier on the base. It is a very bad woman shortage in Florida. (paragraph) I think a much more apporate (appropriate) place could be found for an army base other than the very swamps of Florida. (paragraph) The civilians cold raise the moral (morale) of the soldiers by at least being nice to them and giving a little recreation. (paragraph) Should give soldiers on pass or furlough preference to tranportation (transportation) for if we miss the train or bus we will suffer severe punishment for A.W.O.L. (absent without leave)

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: The Air Corp [Corps] is the best branch I believe but in too many outfits you have to either get in it early or brown nose for a rating and I don't care if I'm a cpl [corporal] for ever[.] I won't brown nose and it disgusts me to see one who does. If a fellow has a good record as mine & tries as I do and the line chief don't [doesn't] notice him & put him up for a rating well its just a poor state of affairs. I also can't see stand by insp
S64.Q97.C_1: with the barracks as crowded as they are. Also I've been down south for 12 months and the people treat us like dogs. When in civilians life I wouldn't ever be seen dead down there. The southern people treat soldiers poorly and what gryps us yankees these dopes are still fighting the civil war instead of treating us like humans. They shun us. Also our squadron gets some of the louziest planes possible and we're not allowed to refuse them and to top it all we get the plane fixed up sure and they take it away is that fair. But all tolled [told] the army isn't too bad it could be much worse I guess.
S64.Q97.Full: The Air Corp [Corps] is the best branch I believe but in too many outfits you have to either get in it early or brown nose for a rating and I don't care if I'm a cpl [corporal] for ever[.] I won't brown nose and it disgusts me to see one who does. If a fellow has a good record as mine & tries as I do and the line chief don't [doesn't] notice him & put him up for a rating well its just a poor state of affairs. I also can't see stand by insp with the barracks as crowded as they are. Also I've been down south for 12 months and the people treat us like dogs. When in civilians life I wouldn't ever be seen dead down there. The southern people treat soldiers poorly and what gryps us yankees these dopes are still fighting the civil war instead of treating us like humans. They shun us. Also our squadron gets some of the louziest planes possible and we're not allowed to refuse them and to top it all we get the plane fixed up sure and they take it away is that fair. But all tolled [told] the army isn't too bad it could be much worse I guess.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I was stationed in Gulfport, Miss. for 5 months and I thought it was pretty bad but compared with Tampa, Fla. it was paradise. The transportation on and off the field has been improved slightly but still stinks. I think the morale on this field is the lowest I've ever come across. It is impossible to sit and write a letter because of the mosquitoes. And nothing has been done to rid us of these pests. I'm not a cry baby but I feel that the right people do not know of these conditions
S64.Q97.Full: I was stationed in Gulfport, Miss. for 5 months and I thought it was pretty bad but compared with Tampa, Fla. it was paradise. The transportation on and off the field has been improved slightly but still stinks. I think the morale on this field is the lowest I've ever come across. It is impossible to sit and write a letter because of the mosquitoes. And nothing has been done to rid us of these pests. I'm not a cry baby but I feel that the right people do not know of these conditions

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Pertaining to question #46. On [unclear] Armores [/unclear] in Civilian life, will have a trade that is not good to him. And an older man will have very little chance of getting employment at another trade because of his age and lax (lack) of keeping up on the changes and improvements
S64.Q97.Full: Pertaining to question #46. On [unclear] Armores [/unclear] in Civilian life, will have a trade that is not good to him. And an older man will have very little chance of getting employment at another trade because of his age and lax (lack) of keeping up on the changes and improvements

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: Men in technical training schools are promised furlows as soon as they are assigned to squadrons. this is a very poor way to [unclear] deceive [/unclear] men and should not be done. If they promise them furlows why don't they give them some. Only a small percentage of men can leave at once here and some wait two or three months that usually makes it a year or near that for their first furlow. They are very necessary for the morall
S64.Q97.Full: Men in technical training schools are promised furlows as soon as they are assigned to squadrons. this is a very poor way to [unclear] deceive [/unclear] men and should not be done. If they promise them furlows why don't they give them some. Only a small percentage of men can leave at once here and some wait two or three months that usually makes it a year or near that for their first furlow. They are very necessary for the morall

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Soldiers should be given a chance to [insertion] be [/insertion] stationed at camps nearer home. (paragraph) The Air Corps should be more lenient with fourloughs (furloughs) and should be given at 4-1/2 month intervals. Also more entertainment such as movie stars & good bands should visit smaller
S64.Q97.C_1: camps, because many times these men think they are completely forgotten, thus causing many of them to lose their morale. A soldier or serviceman should have a little preference in case as such. He should have a discount of clothing & food etc. that he buys in town, because many a soldier can hardly get along all month on what he make after [deletion] paying [/deletion] allotments & insurance are taken out of his pay. Many of these merchant men are just out to take a soldiers money.
S64.Q97.Full: Soldiers should be given a chance to [insertion] be [/insertion] stationed at camps nearer home. (paragraph) The Air Corps should be more lenient with fourloughs (furloughs) and should be given at 4-1/2 month intervals. Also more entertainment such as movie stars & good bands should visit smaller camps, because many times these men think they are completely forgotten, thus causing many of them to lose their morale. A soldier or serviceman should have a little preference in case as such. He should have a discount of clothing & food etc. that he buys in town, because many a soldier can hardly get along all month on what he make after [deletion] paying [/deletion] allotments & insurance are taken out of his pay. Many of these merchant men are just out to take a soldiers money.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Should have some means by which a soldier sailor or marine could get money to go home on when a furlough comes up between pay days, unexpected and emergencies. Something similar to what the Red Cross does only better and more dependable. The Red Cross is doing a wonderful job but it mostly
S64.Q97.C_1: in case of emergencis that they lend you money only I hope I have made myself clear to you.
S64.Q97.Full: Should have some means by which a soldier sailor or marine could get money to go home on when a furlough comes up between pay days, unexpected and emergencies. Something similar to what the Red Cross does only better and more dependable. The Red Cross is doing a wonderful job but it mostly  in case of emergencis that they lend you money only I hope I have made myself clear to you.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: [deletion] passes [/deletion] to last response [insertion] Because of 16 mths service and only 15 days. In other words a day a mth [/insertion]
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Well a soldier should get a break in the Army from what he knows not who he knows. That is why Im only a P.F.C. for being in 16 mths. And fellows only in 6 mths are Staff Sgt.
S64.Q97.Full: Well a soldier should get a break in the Army from what he knows not who he knows. That is why Im only a P.F.C. for being in 16 mths. And fellows only in 6 mths are Staff Sgt.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Ref. 96. I am a single soldier and cannot draw QH & L for my mother (dependent). It seems if a person is married he receives all benefits for a wife. As a mother is just as much a dependent as anyone else why is it impossible for me to receive QH-L?
S64.Q97.Full: Ref. 96. I am a single soldier and cannot draw QH & L for my mother (dependent). It seems if a person is married he receives all benefits for a wife. As a mother is just as much a dependent as anyone else why is it impossible for me to receive QH-L?

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Most all of my friends are overseas. I've been in the army a year & half and am still here. We are supposed to be a combat outfit now, but the way it looks we must be something else.
S64.Q97.Full: Most all of my friends are overseas. I've been in the army a year & half and am still here. We are supposed to be a combat outfit now, but the way it looks we must be something else.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Most of the young men that are in the army, by young I mean from 18 to 20, are usually put into jobs they are unfit for, or jobs they dislike so much they don't give near there best work. It makes them feel they would be doing more on the outside, working in a material defense plant. I think they should try to place the you men a little better.
S64.Q97.Full: Most of the young men that are in the army, by young I mean from 18 to 20, are usually put into jobs they are unfit for, or jobs they dislike so much they don't give near there best work. It makes them feel they would be doing more on the outside, working in a material defense plant. I think they should try to place the you men a little better.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Believe that 0. of. 0. Schools should be done away with as they keep a man away from his place of duty when he could be taught by experienced N.C.Os. Most the instructors never worked on the line and do not have the experience to back them up. Most O.T.U. units are over their T.O. strength which is bad, as this is two men for every job and one of [deletion] [/deletion] [unclear] either [/unclear] of them will not work as a result he has to be forced to work when he gets in a tactical outfit.
S64.Q97.Full: Believe that 0. of. 0. Schools should be done away with as they keep a man away from his place of duty when he could be taught by experienced N.C.Os. Most the instructors never worked on the line and do not have the experience to back them up. Most O.T.U. units are over their T.O. strength which is bad, as this is two men for every job and one of [deletion] [/deletion] [unclear] either [/unclear] of them will not work as a result he has to be forced to work when he gets in a tactical outfit.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: A soldier should be stationed nearer home. He would like the army much better if so. He would have more to do and see his friends more often. [paragraph] We should have more rifle practice then what we do and instead of seeing the way things are done in pictures
S64.Q97.C_1: we should be doing them right out.
S64.Q97.Full: A soldier should be stationed nearer home. He would like the army much better if so. He would have more to do and see his friends more often. [paragraph] We should have more rifle practice then what we do and instead of seeing the way things are done in pictures  we should be doing them right out.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: The only remark I have to make is that I hope [deletion] [/deletion] there are no more wars after this. Once in the army is enough, & I don't care to go through it again. The army in peace time may be O.K., but it stinks in war time.
S64.Q97.Full: The only remark I have to make is that I hope [deletion] [/deletion] there are no more wars after this. Once in the army is enough, & I don't care to go through it again. The army in peace time may be O.K., but it stinks in war time.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: The Army like a big business organization has to depend on its Junior executives to run its affairs -- Quite a few of them are poorly chosen. The enlisted men are given too little responsibility and too little opportunity to use and develop their own ideas. Too much favoritism shown suppressing enthusiasm and abilities of other men.
S64.Q97.Full: The Army like a big business organization has to depend on its Junior executives to run its affairs -- Quite a few of them are poorly chosen. The enlisted men are given too little responsibility and too little opportunity to use and develop their own ideas. Too much favoritism shown suppressing enthusiasm and abilities of other men.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I belive [believe] that every soldier should get a furlough every 3 months for 7 days so his morale can be kept higher than a fellow [soldier] who has been in the army for 11 months and some better than a year without a furlough. So his people [family] do't have to worry about him. And she [his mother] can see her boy every third of a year. Instead
S64.Q97.C_1: of not seeing her boy in about a year. I believe it would also raise the civilians morale as well as the soldiers
S64.Q97.Full: I belive [believe] that every soldier should get a furlough every 3 months for 7 days so his morale can be kept higher than a fellow [soldier] who has been in the army for 11 months and some better than a year without a furlough. So his people [family] do't have to worry about him. And she [his mother] can see her boy every third of a year. Instead of not seeing her boy in about a year. I believe it would also raise the civilians morale as well as the soldiers

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: [unclear] MAH [/unclear] [paragraph] I had my fair share of both passes & furloughs in number; but not the length of furlough time [insertion] [underline] number [/underline] [/insertion] [insertion] [underline] of [/underline] [/insertion] [insertion] [underline] days [/underline] [/insertion] was entitled too.
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Many men are sent to AAF Technical Schools. Upon completion, many men who have had good grades in school are sent out on assignments entirely different from what they were trained to do. This not only is a waste of the man's time, but also a waste of time and money to the govt. in sending him to school. Also, many men are very wrongly classified. I have seen cases where a man has been a mechanic
S64.Q97.C_1: in civilian life & then sent to cooks & bakers school and vice versa.
S64.Q97.Full: Many men are sent to AAF Technical Schools. Upon completion, many men who have had good grades in school are sent out on assignments entirely different from what they were trained to do. This not only is a waste of the man's time, but also a waste of time and money to the govt. in sending him to school. Also, many men are very wrongly classified. I have seen cases where a man has been a mechanic in civilian life & then sent to cooks & bakers school and vice versa.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: the camp I am in now has bad drinking water poor sewer system & the mosquitoes are very bad. one can hardly be out & work after dark. there's too many men in our barracks & transportation to town is very poor. One spends half there evening going & coming from camp. Married men have are permitted overnight passes in town single men only if the go to some neighboring city. Why are married men any different or better.
S64.Q97.Full: the camp I am in now has bad drinking water poor sewer system & the mosquitoes are very bad. one can hardly be out & work after dark. there's too many men in our barracks & transportation to town is very poor. One spends half there evening going & coming from camp. Married men have are permitted overnight passes in town single men only if the go to some neighboring city. Why are married men any different or better.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Men graduating from A.M. (aircraft mechanics) school get Pfc [Private First Class] and a Cpl [Corporal] rating after graduating from a factory school. Most boys attended these same two schools before this order from Wash [Washington] came out and have no rating whatsoever and [insertion] [/insertion] also[insertion] [/insertion] have 6 to 11 months actual experience on the line. Washington should do something about that, its not fair. Most camps could use better food. This one is OK for food. More fatigue clothes could be used also.
S64.Q97.Full: Men graduating from A.M. (aircraft mechanics) school get Pfc [Private First Class] and a Cpl [Corporal] rating after graduating from a factory school. Most boys attended these same two schools before this order from Wash [Washington] came out and have no rating whatsoever and [insertion] [/insertion] also[insertion] [/insertion] have 6 to 11 months actual experience on the line. Washington should do something about that, its not fair. Most camps could use better food. This one is OK for food. More fatigue clothes could be used also.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Other/No answer
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: [all four selections have been crossed out with a line] Handwritten is: I have never asked for furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I would like to state that I do not consider myself mentally endowed with those quality of the mind that tend to make a [underline] good [/underline] soldier. I'm trying desperately to be a good soldier, even to cultivate the will to fight, but I'm afraid I'm a failure. I dislike the thought of killing anyone and hate regimentation.
S64.Q97.Full: I would like to state that I do not consider myself mentally endowed with those quality of the mind that tend to make a [underline] good [/underline] soldier. I'm trying desperately to be a good soldier, even to cultivate the will to fight, but I'm afraid I'm a failure. I dislike the thought of killing anyone and hate regimentation.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Re: 96 above. my friends at home are naturally all married and are better off so far as pay is concerned. Living conditions are getting worse, I am told in their letters. As for my family it is naturally worse for them with me absent - but everyone tries to get along as well as possible by doubling up - i.e living with inlaws etc. A soldiers allotment and allowance is ([underline] not [/underline] ) enough to allow a wife (or wife and child) to live without assistance from others, usually her parents if they are able.
S64.Q97.Full: Re: 96 above. my friends at home are naturally all married and are better off so far as pay is concerned. Living conditions are getting worse, I am told in their letters. As for my family it is naturally worse for them with me absent - but everyone tries to get along as well as possible by doubling up - i.e living with inlaws etc. A soldiers allotment and allowance is ([underline] not [/underline] ) enough to allow a wife (or wife and child) to live without assistance from others, usually her parents if they are able.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Men who graduated from A.M. school or other similar schools prior to March 1943 graduated as privates. Men after that graduated with corporal ratings. There was nothing done to compensate for that. This was and still is resented. New men fill up the ratings allowed each squadron. Stops chance for advancement.
S64.Q97.Full: Men who graduated from A.M. school or other similar schools prior to March 1943 graduated as privates. Men after that graduated with corporal ratings. There was nothing done to compensate for that. This was and still is resented. New men fill up the ratings allowed each squadron. Stops chance for advancement.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Just minor details, such as we could use a laundry system in the army. The small camps that are not near large towns have very poor entertainment.
S64.Q97.Full: Just minor details, such as we could use a laundry system in the army. The small camps that are not near large towns have very poor entertainment.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: One complaint I've heard probably more than anything else, is from the men who have been through a technical school and are still privates, while the men now coming from technical schools are given ratings on completion of their courses. Some of these men have had a good deal of experience, why should a man with no practical experience be rated higher?
S64.Q97.Full: One complaint I've heard probably more than anything else, is from the men who have been through a technical school and are still privates, while the men now coming from technical schools are given ratings on completion of their courses. Some of these men have had a good deal of experience, why should a man with no practical experience be rated higher?

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Discipline too lax. A lack of good non-commissioned officers and junior officers.
S64.Q97.Full: Discipline too lax. A lack of good non-commissioned officers and junior officers.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: The army is the biggest waster of money - it is even worse than [the] W.P.A [Works Progress Administration] . They seem to go around this war-time camp trying to make [up] jobs for civilians to [too] much [many] improvements - such as curbs & planting trees, etc. [paragraph] The war dept. [department] should let the Air Corp [Air Corps] run its self [itself] as it is now the civilians [who] control it - sub depots & depots - a army mechanic
S64.Q97.C_1: can't even get in the depots hardly to get some work done on account of civilian guards. All of us mechanics that are in the air corp should get a chance to do that type of work - in fact it should be done by us - we'd probably do much better work in less time and wouldn't be expecting time and a half and these jack leg civilian workers. More planes are unnecessary grounded from waiting for depot repair work that should be turned out much quicker.
S64.Q97.Full: The army is the biggest waster of money - it is even worse than [the] W.P.A [Works Progress Administration] . They seem to go around this war-time camp trying to make [up] jobs for civilians to [too] much [many] improvements - such as curbs & planting trees, etc. [paragraph] The war dept. [department] should let the Air Corp [Air Corps] run its self [itself] as it is now the civilians [who] control it - sub depots & depots - a army mechanic can't even get in the depots hardly to get some work done on account of civilian guards. All of us mechanics that are in the air corp should get a chance to do that type of work - in fact it should be done by us - we'd probably do much better work in less time and wouldn't be expecting time and a half and these jack leg civilian workers. More planes are unnecessary grounded from waiting for depot repair work that should be turned out much quicker.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Other/No answer
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: Only been in camp five days.
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
