S64.Q97.F: The thing that bothers me more than anything is the red tape you have to go through to get anything done. Another thing is the way they wash cadets out. For just the slightest thing. Also another thing is that we have to pretend like we're busy even though we not. We're getting paid by the month not the hr[hour] .
S64.Q97.Full: The thing that bothers me more than anything is the red tape you have to go through to get anything done. Another thing is the way they wash cadets out. For just the slightest thing. Also another thing is that we have to pretend like we're busy even though we not. We're getting paid by the month not the hr[hour] .

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: One thing I dislike is getting an order one minute and then being told to do the opposite a minute later. Another thing I dislike is having to look hurry all the time. If they give me something to do and do it well in a short time, I shouldn't be made to sweep walks or some other equally useless job.
S64.Q97.C_1: I'm willing to work hard for ten hours a day if the work is constructive and interesting. I don't like [unclear] [/unclear] work or work given out of spite. Just punishment is all right but I don't like to get punished for not showering when I only have ten minutes to wash, get dressed, and make my bed.
S64.Q97.Full: One thing I dislike is getting an order one minute and then being told to do the opposite a minute later. Another thing I dislike is having to look hurry all the time. If they give me something to do and do it well in a short time, I shouldn't be made to sweep walks or some other equally useless job.  I'm willing to work hard for ten hours a day if the work is constructive and interesting. I don't like [unclear] [/unclear] work or work given out of spite. Just punishment is all right but I don't like to get punished for not showering when I only have ten minutes to wash, get dressed, and make my bed.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I am dissatisfied with conditions at this base as I think that all possible steps to relieve some bad conditions are not being taken.
S64.Q97.Full: I am dissatisfied with conditions at this base as I think that all possible steps to relieve some bad conditions are not being taken.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Stop calisthenics for certain branches. Move outfit from Drew Field. USO dance are sorry. No girls. Why has 3 Air Force not sending any outfit accross [across] .
S64.Q97.Full: Stop calisthenics for certain branches. Move outfit from Drew Field. USO dance are sorry. No girls. Why has 3 Air Force not sending any outfit accross [across] .

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: The U.S. waited till the last minute to build her army which makes it poorly runed. It seems that the draftees are getting better jobs than the enlistees. The more training this Army gets that fighters there's be and the quicker the war will end.
S64.Q97.Full: The U.S. waited till the last minute to build her army which makes it poorly runed. It seems that the draftees are getting better jobs than the enlistees. The more training this Army gets that fighters there's be and the quicker the war will end.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: To keep up a soldiers moral nothing is better than being treated like a human being and also to have his furlough every six month if at all possible. Which in lots of cases is sorely neglected. After all we are human too.
S64.Q97.Full: To keep up a soldiers moral nothing is better than being treated like a human being and also to have his furlough every six month if at all possible. Which in lots of cases is sorely neglected. After all we are human too.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: Have had 8-8day passes in 8 years 1-5 day in 15 day & 1-20 day furlough.
S64.Q97.F: It has come to my attention that the Med [Medical} corps men are not geting [getting] a fair deal especially in the Air Craft Warning Units. In some cases instead of leting [letting] the proper member of Medical men go on furlough their names were crossed off the list and Signal Corps men went in their places. This was because Medical Men are not liked in the army and they have a Signal Corps Officer for a C.O. [Commanding Officer] and in a case like this they can not [cannot] be blamed for going A.W.O.l. [absent without leave]
S64.Q97.Full: It has come to my attention that the Med [Medical} corps men are not geting [getting] a fair deal especially in the Air Craft Warning Units. In some cases instead of leting [letting] the proper member of Medical men go on furlough their names were crossed off the list and Signal Corps men went in their places. This was because Medical Men are not liked in the army and they have a Signal Corps Officer for a C.O. [Commanding Officer] and in a case like this they can not [cannot] be blamed for going A.W.O.l. [absent without leave]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I want to stay in the army while the war is going on but would like or rather be out when it is over. [paragraph] I like home better than the army and there is a very few that doesn't.
S64.Q97.Full: I want to stay in the army while the war is going on but would like or rather be out when it is over. [paragraph] I like home better than the army and there is a very few that doesn't.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I have been in the army 3 months and I like it alright, but I really feel that I could do more good towards winning this war if I could go back home to farm for my Father, since my two brothers and I have been drafted and he has nobody to work for him.
S64.Q97.Full: I have been in the army 3 months and I like it alright, but I really feel that I could do more good towards winning this war if I could go back home to farm for my Father, since my two brothers and I have been drafted and he has nobody to work for him.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes

[paragraph] Have not been given much of an opportunity to allow anything and denied everything I asked for and generally got a raw deal. [paragraph] There is no morale at Drew Field.
S64.Q97.Full: [circle] 26 [/circle] I contributed more in one week in my former defense job than I have had the opportunity to do in the army for the entire time. [paragraph] Have not been given much of an opportunity to allow anything and denied everything I asked for and generally got a raw deal. [paragraph] There is no morale at Drew Field.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: My position in army is in Base Administrative Inspectors office and in the course of my duties such as auditing funds, I have occasion to note the ineptitude of many officers who have no knowledge of bookkeeping methods and yet are placed in positions requiring such knowledge. This feature of the army bothers me, that men recently inducted find it almost impossible to attend O.C.S. while there are as many inefficient products of that school now assigned. I feel that a man with an IQ of 150 or better should be given opportunity to advance
S64.Q97.Full: My position in army is in Base Administrative Inspectors office and in the course of my duties such as auditing funds, I have occasion to note the ineptitude of many officers who have no knowledge of bookkeeping methods and yet are placed in positions requiring such knowledge. This feature of the army bothers me, that men recently inducted find it almost impossible to attend O.C.S. while there are as many inefficient products of that school now assigned. I feel that a man with an IQ of 150 or better should be given opportunity to advance

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page

S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I think each man should be checked more often by an army doctor if there is something wrong with them. And I think that we should have much better cooks then we have at the present, some time it [insertion] is [/insertion] terrible most of us can't even get it. The only time we get a good meal is when we go out of camp. And that maybe once a week and sometime [unclear] [/unclear]
S64.Q97.C_1: I think is long is we stay here in this country, we should have a little more recreation then we are getting. some time I think our Company commander is pretty darn selfish about not leting [letting] us out on passes when we don't have any thing special. It seems to me he thinks only of him self and no others some time I wonder if he knows that we men instead of dogs. that's just the way we are treated sometime -

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: The relationship between the officers and enlisted men is very poor. The enlisted men seem to dislike the officers so much they will not put into a thing all they have got. [paragraph] There is also so much red tape that it take the army too long to do anything. [paragraph] There are also many Army A.R.'s they seem so very unnecessary.
S64.Q97.Full: The relationship between the officers and enlisted men is very poor. The enlisted men seem to dislike the officers so much they will not put into a thing all they have got. [paragraph] There is also so much red tape that it take the army too long to do anything. [paragraph] There are also many Army A.R.'s they seem so very unnecessary.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: The army has taken all the farmers away from many farms. All my brothers are in the service. I think at least one of us should have been left to work on the farm
S64.Q97.Full: The army has taken all the farmers away from many farms. All my brothers are in the service. I think at least one of us should have been left to work on the farm

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: The food is very bad. It is not the fault of the cooks all the times. I know they can't cook a good meal if they don't get the food to cook with. [paragraph] To go on sick call is just a joke. They tell you what is wrong with you the first time and when you go back for the same thing, they tell you something else is wrong with you. They think everybody
S64.Q97.C_1: is Gold Bricking.
S64.Q97.Full: The food is very bad. It is not the fault of the cooks all the times. I know they can't cook a good meal if they don't get the food to cook with. [paragraph] To go on sick call is just a joke. They tell you what is wrong with you the first time and when you go back for the same thing, they tell you something else is wrong with you. They think everybody is Gold Bricking.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: In my opinion Medical officers should not be put in command of any tactical unit. They are dissatisfied with administration & don't seem to be able to learn how to "soldier" in the short time period they are given when entering the service. MSC officers would understand the problems much better. I have found this true in more than 3 Div's I have been in.
S64.Q97.C_1: Also the gap 'tween officers & EM should not be so wide. Officers shouldn't have so many privledges over the EM they should eat the same "chow" & "crap" in the same latrine. NCOs should have some special schooling & not have to "pick up" so many pointers on trng, handling of men, ect [etc] . NCOs should also be given a freer hand in the running of his org. There should be more trng of the type that inspires the men to want to do better. To much of the present system kills their interest. They soon get in the habit of their officers of the "pass the buck"! All officers are looked up to but should be better trained for their jobs than they are at present. In general the officers & EM are not concentrating thourghly enough on the job we all have to do. If given a good chance in an org I'm interested in I could be a much better soldier than I am.
S64.Q97.Full: In my opinion Medical officers should not be put in command of any tactical unit. They are dissatisfied with administration & don't seem to be able to learn how to "soldier" in the short time period they are given when entering the service. MSC officers would understand the problems much better. I have found this true in more than 3 Div's I have been in. Also the gap 'tween officers & EM should not be so wide. Officers shouldn't have so many privledges over the EM they should eat the same "chow" & "crap" in the same latrine. NCOs should have some special schooling & not have to "pick up" so many pointers on trng, handling of men, ect [etc] . NCOs should also be given a freer hand in the running of his org. There should be more trng of the type that inspires the men to want to do better. To much of the present system kills their interest. They soon get in the habit of their officers of the "pass the buck"! All officers are looked up to but should be better trained for their jobs than they are at present. In general the officers & EM are not concentrating thourghly enough on the job we all have to do. If given a good chance in an org I'm interested in I could be a much better soldier than I am.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I helped support my Mother and now she gets very little from me only $37.00 from the Army. So isn't enough, after all we are giving up the best years of our life and strength on life and we would fight and cooperate much better if we knew our families were well taken care of.
S64.Q97.C_1: & it isn't how much you know to get any place in the Army, it is who you know and that isn't fair to us. Also all men are supposed to be treated equal, why do some non coms and officers feel so superior to us. Especially those 90 day wonders. If they take a disliking to us, we haven't a chance in the world to get any place. Also to much of our time in the Army is wasted and the way I understand things time is very essential during War times. I don't understand why they ship men from the eastern part of the states to the western parts and the men from the west to the east. They would work much better if closer to home while training in the States.
S64.Q97.Full: I helped support my Mother and now she gets very little from me only $37.00 from the Army. So isn't enough, after all we are giving up the best years of our life and strength on life and we would fight and cooperate much better if we knew our families were well taken care of. & it isn't how much you know to get any place in the Army, it is who you know and that isn't fair to us. Also all men are supposed to be treated equal, why do some non coms and officers feel so superior to us. Especially those 90 day wonders. If they take a disliking to us, we haven't a chance in the world to get any place. Also to much of our time in the Army is wasted and the way I understand things time is very essential during War times. I don't understand why they ship men from the eastern part of the states to the western parts and the men from the west to the east. They would work much better if closer to home while training in the States.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: The reason I say things are worse for family. I lived on farm and helped my parents who are to old to carry on when I left and they can not get help to operate the farm. Therefore makes it harder for them.
S64.Q97.Full: The reason I say things are worse for family. I lived on farm and helped my parents who are to old to carry on when I left and they can not get help to operate the farm. Therefore makes it harder for them.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: To many officers don't know as much as the enlisted men under them. Men do not have the facilities to keep neat & clean. The problem of cleaning and pressing uniforms is too great. I think every soldier should appear very respectful and neat. He does not have a chance thru lack of proper tailoring & cleaning shops. Too many soldiers run around with saggy uniforms due to this fact.
S64.Q97.C_1: 84-B. Too much time is taken fooling with small unimportant things. Inspections marking clothing. Moving dirt & then putting it back. The men should actually be taught how to kill & not be killed. [paragraph] 97 - The soldier is expected to have too many little items not issued. He has a hard time to get them at times. [paragraph] Above all, there is far too much red tape to every procedure. We will win this war by fighting and not on paper. [paragraph] Many men loose their lives because of lack of speed in aiding him when he is injured. By the time a dozen different know nothings get his life history a man will die, who could have been saved if treated first & questioned later. [paragraph] There is too much personal feeling in distribution of ratings. Too many men with [unclear] suction [/unclear] carry the stripes.
S64.Q97.Full: To many officers don't know as much as the enlisted men under them. Men do not have the facilities to keep neat & clean. The problem of cleaning and pressing uniforms is too great. I think every soldier should appear very respectful and neat. He does not have a chance thru lack of proper tailoring & cleaning shops. Too many soldiers run around with saggy uniforms due to this fact. 84-B. Too much time is taken fooling with small unimportant things. Inspections marking clothing. Moving dirt & then putting it back. The men should actually be taught how to kill & not be killed. [paragraph] 97 - The soldier is expected to have too many little items not issued. He has a hard time to get them at times. [paragraph] Above all, there is far too much red tape to every procedure. We will win this war by fighting and not on paper. [paragraph] Many men loose their lives because of lack of speed in aiding him when he is injured. By the time a dozen different know nothings get his life history a man will die, who could have been saved if treated first & questioned later. [paragraph] There is too much personal feeling in distribution of ratings. Too many men with [unclear] suction [/unclear] carry the stripes.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I think that we need better training than we have had. We have had poor training since I came into the army they are to lazy to get lost in these little problems that we have had in the past, the [unclear] [/unclear] feel [unclear] [/unclear] put around here an that not helping us put feeling a bit.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that we need better training than we have had. We have had poor training since I came into the army they are to lazy to get lost in these little problems that we have had in the past, the [unclear] [/unclear] feel [unclear] [/unclear] put around here an that not helping us put feeling a bit.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: The officers (most of them) tell us to think not of ourselves, but of our fellow EM (and our officers) but the most of them think only of their own comfort and to hell with the EM. We do a job well - they get credit and didn't even come around and take part or give instructions. You don't get promoted around here because you're qualified, but
S64.Q97.C_1: because you've sucked around your CO. And why the hell should the officers sleep on air mattresses (on bivouac) & us on the ground. They're no better than we. That is opposite of our principles of democracy. My CO couldn't buy the gas for my packard on the wages he made as a civilian (we checked on his wages) & yet he thinks he's so damned superior to each of us, it's pitiful. All our adjutant thinks about is prosecuting some poor devil who made a mistake & went AWOL, or spoke an honest opinion in a non military manner. In my opinion he'll be a coward in battle. He looks it. He'd never get through OCS the way they've made it harder the last few months. The Bn CO is an arrogant person, who admits he couldn't perform even an appendectomy, yet he's CO of a Medical Bn.
S64.Q97.Full: The officers (most of them) tell us to think not of ourselves, but of our fellow EM (and our officers) but the most of them think only of their own comfort and to hell with the EM. We do a job well - they get credit and didn't even come around and take part or give instructions. You don't get promoted around here because you're qualified, but  because you've sucked around your CO. And why the hell should the officers sleep on air mattresses (on bivouac) & us on the ground. They're no better than we. That is opposite of our principles of democracy. My CO couldn't buy the gas for my packard on the wages he made as a civilian (we checked on his wages) & yet he thinks he's so damned superior to each of us, it's pitiful. All our adjutant thinks about is prosecuting some poor devil who made a mistake & went AWOL, or spoke an honest opinion in a non military manner. In my opinion he'll be a coward in battle. He looks it. He'd never get through OCS the way they've made it harder the last few months. The Bn CO is an arrogant person, who admits he couldn't perform even an appendectomy, yet he's CO of a Medical Bn.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: 96 [circled] Two of us are in the army and we both were the main support, that made it tough on the rest of the family, now the rest have to live on fathers earnings 4 all total
S64.Q97.Full: 96 [circled] Two of us are in the army and we both were the main support, that made it tough on the rest of the family, now the rest have to live on fathers earnings 4 all total

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think if a person is intelligent enough he should have the privilege to transfer. I would lot rather be in the Air Corps. We are not given a chance.
S64.Q97.Full: I think if a person is intelligent enough he should have the privilege to transfer. I would lot rather be in the Air Corps. We are not given a chance.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: The army should do something about eliminating details for combat units. By losing time in this way we hinder the war effort and lose valuable time in training. We may even at times find ourselves with only one army corps in the field where if training had not been held up by details we would have 2 or more. Details as I understand are given to teach the soldier to obey the will of his appointed leader. But due to modern education he resents them and they cause a lowering of his morale. His psychological reaction affects the
S64.Q97.C_1: majority subconsciously other than consciously and reduces his possible potentialities of work or effort. Transfers should be mad more easier than they are at present., Men who are in some branch or unit their dislike cannot do their best under these conditions. Take over the war industries and prevent discontent after the war between the army with its fifty dollars pay and defense industry with its large union last even after taxation. Complete unity of industry and the war department would hasten victory.
S64.Q97.Full: The army should do something about eliminating details for combat units. By losing time in this way we hinder the war effort and lose valuable time in training. We may even at times find ourselves with only one army corps in the field where if training had not been held up by details we would have 2 or more. Details as I understand are given to teach the soldier to obey the will of his appointed leader. But due to modern education he resents them and they cause a lowering of his morale. His psychological reaction affects the  majority subconsciously other than consciously and reduces his possible potentialities of work or effort. Transfers should be mad more easier than they are at present., Men who are in some branch or unit their dislike cannot do their best under these conditions. Take over the war industries and prevent discontent after the war between the army with its fifty dollars pay and defense industry with its large union last even after taxation. Complete unity of industry and the war department would hasten victory.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I would like to be in the U.S. Marines now. Because I have two boy friends in there. And doing their part.
S64.Q97.Full: I would like to be in the U.S. Marines now. Because I have two boy friends in there. And doing their part.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: In regard to passes. Many men are given class "A" passes. I believe either all or none should have them. They should be taken away from the men who disobey the rules but a whole group should not suffer for a few.
S64.Q97.Full: In regard to passes. Many men are given class "A" passes. I believe either all or none should have them. They should be taken away from the men who disobey the rules but a whole group should not suffer for a few.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I have been in the army for nine months but I still don't think I have been trained good enough to go across soon. But I think they should give us more time to get trained to go across in
S64.Q97.C_1: I think the army is ok except that when there are any Ratings open the men whom the officers likes is the man who gets the Rating whether he deserves it or not cause sometimes the officer does not know enough about the army himself & I also don't believe the Sergeants should cuss their men and threaten to hit them.
S64.Q97.Full: I have been in the army for nine months but I still don't think I have been trained good enough to go across soon. But I think they should give us more time to get trained to go across in  I think the army is ok except that when there are any Ratings open the men whom the officers likes is the man who gets the Rating whether he deserves it or not cause sometimes the officer does not know enough about the army himself & I also don't believe the Sergeants should cuss their men and threaten to hit them.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: As I am a member of the army I am doing my best in this [unclear] [/unclear] and fighting however I feel I could do better if I were backing helping on the farm as my dad is trying his best to operate a 1400 [insertion] acre [/insertion] ranch plus 100 to 150 head cattle About 10 percent of the land in that surrounding community is idle because the farmers cant get help to culivate the land and
S64.Q97.C_1: produce the crops that will help win the war.
S64.Q97.Full: As I am a member of the army I am doing my best in this [unclear] [/unclear] and fighting however I feel I could do better if I were backing helping on the farm as my dad is trying his best to operate a 1400 [insertion] acre [/insertion] ranch plus 100 to 150 head cattle About 10 percent of the land in that surrounding community is idle because the farmers cant get help to culivate the land and produce the crops that will help win the war.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I personally think the army isn't a bad place to be in, if given the job you are best suited for. I am disgusted with it because I haven't been put in the proper branch and haven't had a furlough for 9 months. I don't think the arm is giving the soldiers full medical attention as many of them need.
S64.Q97.Full: I personally think the army isn't a bad place to be in, if given the job you are best suited for. I am disgusted with it because I haven't been put in the proper branch and haven't had a furlough for 9 months. I don't think the arm is giving the soldiers full medical attention as many of them need.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)

S64.Q97.F: Rating in the army, are not rated by ability, most of it is gotten by boot licking. There is too much prejudice based on Religion, race, nativity, etc. One would think this army was built to fight each other, instead of a common foe. Some get everything others none, when benefits are to be had. The fighting man, is not treated well enough by the civilian population

There is too much prejudice based on Religion, race, nativity, etc. One would think this army was built to fight each other, instead of a common foe. Some get everything others none, when benefits are to be had. The fighting man, is not treated well enough by the civilian population

There is too much prejudice based on religion, race, nativity, etc. One would think this army was built to fight each other, instead of a common foe. Some get everything others none when benefits are to be had. The fighting man is not treated well enough by the civilian population
S64.Q97.C_1: I have not received a furlough yet, and can not possibly get one for another 4 months. I was withheld from an embarkation pt. because doctors disagreed I was perfectly fit to go. Nothing has been done for me, and if our outfit were to leave oversees today, I would most surely be accepted to go. There is no system at all at embarkation points. My outfit was shipped across after 13 weeks of basic training while other outfits stay here indefinitely. I don't think we should ever have limited service. Either a man be fit for general service, or not accepted at all. A civilian or woman can take their place. I never should be in a combat outfit. I have a heart murmer, and I weigh 114 pounds. I find it tough to do any hard physical labor. The M. Drs just shrug it off, and treat me like I was afraid, or did not want to work. They are the ones who most surely are not fair.
S64.Q97.Full: Ratings in the army, are not rated by ability, most of it is gotten by boot licking. There is too much prejudice based on religion, race, nativity, etc. One would think this army was built to fight each other, instead of a common foe. Some get everything others none when benefits are to be had. The fighting man is not treated well enough by the civilian population  I have not received a furlough yet, and can not possibly get one for another 4 months. I was withheld from an embarkation pt. because doctors disagreed I was perfectly fit to go. Nothing has been done for me, and if our outfit were to leave oversees today, I would most surely be accepted to go. There is no system at all at embarkation points. My outfit was shipped across after 13 weeks of basic training while other outfits stay here indefinitely. I don't think we should ever have limited service. Either a man be fit for general service, or not accepted at all. A civilian or woman can take their place. I never should be in a combat outfit. I have a heart murmer, and I weigh 114 pounds. I find it tough to do any hard physical labor. The M. Drs just shrug it off, and treat me like I was afraid, or did not want to work. They are the ones who most surely are not fair.

S64.Q97.F: Every man in the Armed forces should get to shoot a pistol or rifle more often, some men do not know how to shoot an automatic pistol. As for me I would like to get something in the Armed forces I think I can do much better at. If a man does not like a thing he will not put his mind to it. And I think I could do much better in the Armoured Division and they could put someone in my place here, someone that may like Artillery better.

And I think I could do much better in the Armoured Division and they could put someone in my place here, someone that may like Artillery better.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think that all soldiers should get a furlough regardless. It helps their morale & they will work harder. But if they don't then they don't care whether or not they do anything & if they do do something then it isn't half right when they get through. I think if a company that does give furloughs to all its men before they go across will get more cooperation
S64.Q97.C_1: out of its men than one that don't. Men that don't have furloughs aren't going to be on the ball as much as they would if they had gotten one. I know because our company that I'm in now hasn't given its men furloughs & they don't care wheather [whether] or not they do anything. But the company I was in a couple of months ago were strictly on the ball, because they were getting their furloughs as their time came around. The men all worked together & cooperated with each other & the men were all proud of their company & officers & would have done anything for it.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that all soldiers should get a furlough regardless. It helps their morale & they will work harder. But if they don't then they don't care whether or not they do anything & if they do do something then it isn't half right when they get through. I think if a company that does give furloughs to all its men before they go across will get more cooperation  out of its men than one that don't. Men that don't have furloughs aren't going to be on the ball as much as they would if they had gotten one. I know because our company that I'm in now hasn't given its men furloughs & they don't care wheather [whether] or not they do anything. But the company I was in a couple of months ago were strictly on the ball, because they were getting their furloughs as their time came around. The men all worked together & cooperated with each other & the men were all proud of their company & officers & would have done anything for it.

S64.Q97.C_1: get home again before I go over. There are a lot of boys in camp with me that haven't been home in over 14 months. That is the reason I believe we should get a furlough before we or anyone else goes over.

That is the reason I believe we should get a furlough before we or anyone else goes over.

S64.Q97.C_1: in most kitchens food is cooked right and pretty lousy, where other post it much better.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: This company has been saying they can't give furloughs for the past six months because we were supposed to be on the alert or waiting for shipping orders. I've been in the army for 9 months and have never had a furlough or seen any of my family or my folks.
S64.Q97.C_1: We seen in the paper & heard over the radio that every soldier is suppose to get a furlough be for {before] going over seas, but our company commander says we will never get one because we are suppose to still be on the Alert. Yours truly a Soldier
S64.Q97.Full: This company has been saying they can't give furloughs for the past six months because we were supposed to be on the alert or waiting for shipping orders. I've been in the army for 9 months and have never had a furlough or seen any of my family or my folks. We seen in the paper & heard over the radio that every soldier is suppose to get a furlough be for {before] going over seas, but our company commander says we will never get one because we are suppose to still be on the Alert. Yours truly a Soldier

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I believe it is only right that a soldier have a furlough before he goes across. Every 6 months isn't so important I have been in 11 months and have had no furloughs. I didn't mind it untill now, but we will be leaving for overseas soon, and I will assure you that my moral and ambition for my country hasn't been bettered because of this fact. There is always a chance of my not comming
S64.Q97.C_1: back, and I believe it is only right that I get to visit everyone who is near and dear to me.
S64.Q97.Full: I believe it is only right that a soldier have a furlough before he goes across. Every 6 months isn't so important I have been in 11 months and have had no furloughs. I didn't mind it untill now, but we will be leaving for overseas soon, and I will assure you that my moral and ambition for my country hasn't been bettered because of this fact. There is always a chance of my not comming  back, and I believe it is only right that I get to visit everyone who is near and dear to me.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: What I don't like most about this Army is the way they place men in their jobs. I am in a Technical outfit & a lot of the fellows don't know their jobs well. In my case, I know that I can make good but never did get the chance to do so. Another thing is the way most of them get ratings such as T/5 without working for them. In my case even if I do work for it, there is still isn't
S64.Q97.C_1: any way of getting it because of my job which holds me down. [paragraph] Most of the fellows here aren't soldiers at all & the same thing goes for the officers. The reason they are that way is because it is a technical outfit.
S64.Q97.Full: What I don't like most about this Army is the way they place men in their jobs. I am in a Technical outfit & a lot of the fellows don't know their jobs well. In my case, I know that I can make good but never did get the chance to do so. Another thing is the way most of them get ratings such as T/5 without working for them. In my case even if I do work for it, there is still isn't any way of getting it because of my job which holds me down. [paragraph] Most of the fellows here aren't soldiers at all & the same thing goes for the officers. The reason they are that way is because it is a technical outfit.

S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think I would be better off as a War Worker in civilian life than I am of use to the army. My job isn't important very much and I am in an outfit called Sick Lame and Lazy and a lot of us fellows don't see why we are in the army when we could be of more use as a War Worker than as a soldier. There is something wrong with most of us so that we will never see duty across the seas unless we go over after the war to police up.
S64.Q97.C_1: I don't think we should go over after the war to police up other countries cause we didn't ask for this war. I think the fellows that are across should come home after it is over instead of policing up the countries that are ruined by bombs.

I think the fellows that are across should come home after it is over instead of policing up the countries that are ruined by bombs.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I think that on the whole the Army is doing a good job but that as far as their non-combatant activities are concerned (personnel, supply, finance etc.) there is definite room for improvement and that many valuable men are being wasted the main trouble being with interviewers who are incompetent to a high degree. I think that among the older men the Army
S64.Q97.C_1: could find replacements at a much cheaper figure than now paid civilian employees. I think many man hours are wasted and with the exception of physically fit young men the Army fails to use what it has at hand. In general I do not doubt that we are the best fed, clothed and housed of any army in the world our equipment is as good if not better, and the morale is high. It is very easy to criticize but I still feel that while men usually find their right spot there is too much fumbling about before it is found. Another point worth mentioning is the number of men who are unable to go [insertion] anywhere [/insertion] or do anything due to the fact that they have not been paid. There is too much of missing the payroll going on and it has a most detrimental effect. As I say this does not effect the fighting personnel but only the office staffs with which I am reasonably well acquainted.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that on the whole the Army is doing a good job but that as far as their non-combatant activities are concerned (personnel, supply, finance etc.) there is definite room for improvement and that many valuable men are being wasted the main trouble being with interviewers who are incompetent to a high degree. I think that among the older men the Army  could find replacements at a much cheaper figure than now paid civilian employees. I think many man hours are wasted and with the exception of physically fit young men the Army fails to use what it has at hand. In general I do not doubt that we are the best fed, clothed and housed of any army in the world our equipment is as good if not better, and the morale is high. It is very easy to criticize but I still feel that while men usually find their right spot there is too much fumbling about before it is found. Another point worth mentioning is the number of men who are unable to go [insertion] anywhere [/insertion] or do anything due to the fact that they have not been paid. There is too much of missing the payroll going on and it has a most detrimental effect. As I say this does not effect the fighting personnel but only the office staffs with which I am reasonably well acquainted.

S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I don't feel that the Army is running Drew Field in the proper manner to get the most out of their effort. The men are transferred too often and are not allowed to show all that they are capable of doing. Also the condition here need a lot of improvement, such as the mosquito situation, furlough and classification. Some of these questions do not give a person a chance
S64.Q97.C_1: to express his exact opinion and do not give him a place to state his answer to the question.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't feel that the Army is running Drew Field in the proper manner to get the most out of their effort. The men are transferred too often and are not allowed to show all that they are capable of doing. Also the condition here need a lot of improvement, such as the mosquito situation, furlough and classification. Some of these questions do not give a person a chance to express his exact opinion and do not give him a place to state his answer to the question.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: There are a few things that in my opinion could be handled differently for the benefit of all concerned. There are some who went to school for a short time taking a course unfamiliar to them and after they completed most of us was put doing some other job, they should receive a little practical work because sometime the life of several men may depend on your ability to do your job and then you would be rusty and probably would do a poor job. Another beef is the furlough -
S64.Q97.C_1: I have been told that it was a army regulation that you couldn't take a furlough in the same town that your station was in, just because our town happens to be next to our station I don't see why this should effect our privilege of obtaining a furlough. Why take men, who are too old and too broke down for anything, into the army is one thing I can never figure out. If they are unfit for service why waste time and money trying to make soliders out of them. [para] (Thank You.)
S64.Q97.Full: There are a few things that in my opinion could be handled differently for the benefit of all concerned. There are some who went to school for a short time taking a course unfamiliar to them and after they completed most of us was put doing some other job, they should receive a little practical work because sometime the life of several men may depend on your ability to do your job and then you would be rusty and probably would do a poor job. Another beef is the furlough -  I have been told that it was a army regulation that you couldn't take a furlough in the same town that your station was in, just because our town happens to be next to our station I don't see why this should effect our privilege of obtaining a furlough. Why take men, who are too old and too broke down for anything, into the army is one thing I can never figure out. If they are unfit for service why waste time and money trying to make soliders out of them. [para] (Thank You.)

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page, A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I believe men with previous Military service sould be placed in work that they did before the army. Men placed in limited service with previous experience are held back from advancement by being placed in some outfit that on account of his age and limited service hold him back, therefore
S64.Q97.C_1: lies the reason for most men over thirty eight years of age, filing for a release to the enlisted mens reserve Corp. this conditions I am sure could be remedied there by releasing able bodied men for combat duty - by placing these limited service men on the jobs that men able for combat duty or now holding would greatly relieve the mens mind as to there ability to aid their country in our hour of need -
S64.Q97.C_2: I went to school for Radar and with hard work passed, when out on maneuvers on the set, couldn't keep up [unclear] til [/unclear] the standard on account of eye defects then I was taken of the Unit since then I've been doing details and am not as yet reclassified for anything. [paragraph] The eye clinic reccomended [recommended } limited service for me which as yet I don't think I'm on. [paragraph] I think I [unclear] could [/unclear] [unclear] serve [/unclear] my country best by working in a defense plant such as the shop yard, as I did in civilian life I've been in the [unclear] Army [/unclear] eight months and haven't [unclear] learned [/unclear] anything that could be of much use other than radar.
S64.Q97.Full: I believe men with previous Military service sould be placed in work that they did before the army. Men placed in limited service with previous experience are held back from advancement by being placed in some outfit that on account of his age and limited service hold him back, therefore lies the reason for most men over thirty eight years of age, filing for a release to the enlisted mens reserve Corp. this conditions I am sure could be remedied there by releasing able bodied men for combat duty - by placing these limited service men on the jobs that men able for combat duty or now holding would greatly relieve the mens mind as to there ability to aid their country in our hour of need - I went to school for Radar and with hard work passed, when out on maneuvers on the set, couldn't keep up [unclear] til [/unclear] the standard on account of eye defects then I was taken of the Unit since then I've been doing details and am not as yet reclassified for anything. [paragraph] The eye clinic reccomended [recommended } limited service for me which as yet I don't think I'm on. [paragraph] I think I [unclear] could [/unclear] [unclear] serve [/unclear] my country best by working in a defense plant such as the shop yard, as I did in civilian life I've been in the [unclear] Army [/unclear] eight months and haven't [unclear] learned [/unclear] anything that could be of much use other than radar.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: I do care to go to town because I don't have enough money and there is nothing in the nearest town.
S64.Q97.F: Cooks could be trained more so that they could prepare food better, have better condition for mess where the soldiers would not have to wait in line to get their mess and waiting to wash mess kits. Train men give them schooling while waiting for dentental and medical attention instead of wasting their time just doing a lot of unnecessary labor detail. And let men doing thinking for themselves.
S64.Q97.C_1: I feel that there is to much of a gap between Officers and men and a lot of Officers take advantage of it which shouldn't be. They are on to high a plane and too much red tape to see at times.
S64.Q97.Full: Cooks could be trained more so that they could prepare food better, have better condition for mess where the soldiers would not have to wait in line to get their mess and waiting to wash mess kits. Train men give them schooling while waiting for dentental and medical attention instead of wasting their time just doing a lot of unnecessary labor detail. And let men doing thinking for themselves.  I feel that there is to much of a gap between Officers and men and a lot of Officers take advantage of it which shouldn't be. They are on to high a plane and too much red tape to see at times.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Some of my answers cannot be taken as from a typical man in the A.M. Co. I'm working in a gas station with insufficient help which accounts for the 24 hours on duty with no time off for almost a week at a time. Also, I come into very little contact with the other men noncoms and officers, therefore being neglected when ratings are
S64.Q97.C_1: passed out The "Forgotten Man" as it were, which is very unsatisfactory to me, and I believe myself capable of better things.
S64.Q97.Full: Some of my answers cannot be taken as from a typical man in the A.M. Co. I'm working in a gas station with insufficient help which accounts for the 24 hours on duty with no time off for almost a week at a time. Also, I come into very little contact with the other men noncoms and officers, therefore being neglected when ratings are  passed out The "Forgotten Man" as it were, which is very unsatisfactory to me, and I believe myself capable of better things.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I am the average American young man who would naturally rather be in civilian life working at the job you like best and doing as you please, but am willing to sacrifice those things for a time to fight for them so that we can all keep on living that way. {paragraph} There are a lot of things in the army that some of us don't like and we gripe a lot at times, but when I think about it I realize
S64.Q97.C_1: that the army is a huge organization and that things can't be run to suit everyone. I've ran into lot of non coms and officers that I didn't like and they [the] way that they did some things, but I've found out we had best take things as they come and work together to get this over as soon as possible. [paragraph] Conditions at home some time worry me the same as all of the other fellows, but we all have to make the best of it until it's over.
S64.Q97.Full: I am the average American young man who would naturally rather be in civilian life working at the job you like best and doing as you please, but am willing to sacrifice those things for a time to fight for them so that we can all keep on living that way. {paragraph} There are a lot of things in the army that some of us don't like and we gripe a lot at times, but when I think about it I realize that the army is a huge organization and that things can't be run to suit everyone. I've ran into lot of non coms and officers that I didn't like and they [the] way that they did some things, but I've found out we had best take things as they come and work together to get this over as soon as possible. [paragraph] Conditions at home some time worry me the same as all of the other fellows, but we all have to make the best of it until it's over.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: In regard to question 82. There are too many petty post and camp regulations that benefit us in no way, and as we are a supply unit, and laboring unit, they interfere with the operation and expression of our duties. Our working day has not limit as to the number of hours we are actually on duty -
S64.Q97.Full: In regard to question 82. There are too many petty post and camp regulations that benefit us in no way, and as we are a supply unit, and laboring unit, they interfere with the operation and expression of our duties. Our working day has not limit as to the number of hours we are actually on duty -

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: Yes, I have had my fair share of and passes
S64.Q97.F: My idea of the Army is that a soldier with a good job on the outside before he came does not get the chance he is suposed to get get, it seems in some fields that men who have bin in for a length of time get the grades regardless of what they know of men and how to handle them. Some of the non coms never even had a rifle in their hands or had any basic whatsoever and are put in
S64.Q97.C_1: charge of the men. Let the men who have the knoledge [knowledge] get a chance, rather give a better opportunity than they are getting, for to me it is [deletion] [/deletion] very disheartening to know something about Army ways & drill and not get a chance to use them.
S64.Q97.Full: My idea of the Army is that a soldier with a good job on the outside before he came does not get the chance he is suposed to get get, it seems in some fields that men who have bin in for a length of time get the grades regardless of what they know of men and how to handle them. Some of the non coms never even had a rifle in their hands or had any basic whatsoever and are put in charge of the men. Let the men who have the knoledge [knowledge] get a chance, rather give a better opportunity than they are getting, for to me it is [deletion] [/deletion] very disheartening to know something about Army ways & drill and not get a chance to use them.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I haven't had a 24 hour pass since I arrived here 2 1/2 months ago and also have not had a day off as well. The transportation system is very poorly run. Headquarters seems to be trying to run down the moral[morale] of the men instead of building it up and doesn't seem to know what it is doing. All my troubles could be cured however if I could
S64.Q97.C_1: get a day off every once in a while.
S64.Q97.Full: I haven't had a 24 hour pass since I arrived here 2 1/2 months ago and also have not had a day off as well. The transportation system is very poorly run. Headquarters seems to be trying to run down the moral[morale] of the men instead of building it up and doesn't seem to know what it is doing. All my troubles could be cured however if I could get a day off every once in a while.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Well they send you to schools were you come out you no nothing & I think the actual work would do more good than aything else & I think all married men with children should be taken out & put in defence jobs because if a man is married & has a child his only [unclear] worry [/unclear] is of them & not the Army & about furlougs if you are a [unclear] friens [/unclear]
S64.Q97.C_1: of the first Serfant then you get on pretty quick if not you really have to sweat for it + you take a Sergant thats been in the army 6 mos telling fellows that have been in 3-4 years what to do + that is not right + this field should never be for you are always getting sick one way or another + beside, there is hardly an other recreation for instance take another camp they get popular Bands + all kinds of shows but Dew Field never gets nothing it piss poor this army should be changed as far as soldiers are concerned you take men from N.Y. + send them to Fla. + take me from Fla + send them to N.Y. I think they should stay near home + be a far better soldier.
S64.Q97.Full: Well they send you to schools were you come out you no nothing & I think the actual work would do more good than aything else & I think all married men with children should be taken out & put in defence jobs because if a man is married & has a child his only [unclear] worry [/unclear] is of them & not the Army & about furlougs if you are a [unclear] friens [/unclear]  of the first Serfant then you get on pretty quick if not you really have to sweat for it + you take a Sergant thats been in the army 6 mos telling fellows that have been in 3-4 years what to do + that is not right + this field should never be for you are always getting sick one way or another + beside, there is hardly an other recreation for instance take another camp they get popular Bands + all kinds of shows but Dew Field never gets nothing it piss poor this army should be changed as far as soldiers are concerned you take men from N.Y. + send them to Fla. + take me from Fla + send them to N.Y. I think they should stay near home + be a far better soldier.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M_marginalia: My folks had to leave the farm because there are 4 of us in the army and no one to help at home, and Dad is old.
S64.Q97.F: One thing is the laundry system on the field. Another is the [unclear] poor [/unclear] service the MP, thinks they own every body, Body and soul and I have never had any trouble with them. They dominate everyone
S64.Q97.C_1: We are getting training but we need more combat experience (training) The Army is a little slow on doing things you rush to do something and they wait for hours to do it. In all its not to bad.
S64.Q97.Full: One thing is the laundry system on the field. Another is the [unclear] poor [/unclear] service the MP, thinks they own every body, Body and soul and I have never had any trouble with them. They dominate everyone We are getting training but we need more combat experience (training) The Army is a little slow on doing things you rush to do something and they wait for hours to do it. In all its not to bad.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: ([underline] Why [/underline] ) do we get canned grapefruit when fresh grapefruit grow all around us? [paragraph] Army should purchase more food locally.
S64.Q97.Full: ([underline] Why [/underline] ) do we get canned grapefruit when fresh grapefruit grow all around us? [paragraph] Army should purchase more food locally.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I think the classification of the men should be checked; there are a great number of men who could & would give America more, were they properly classified. - The reversal of rank, both among comm. officers & non-coms, would be funny to see, were it not so tragic, --- Men working at jobs they like & can do will help to curb this desire for
S64.Q97.C_1: rank above all else. - The soldier transportation systems from camps to near by towns is a major problem. A soldiers day off should be free of sq duty as K.P. its, except when absolutely necessary or he forfeits his pass.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the classification of the men should be checked; there are a great number of men who could & would give America more, were they properly classified. - The reversal of rank, both among comm. officers & non-coms, would be funny to see, were it not so tragic, --- Men working at jobs they like & can do will help to curb this desire for  rank above all else. - The soldier transportation systems from camps to near by towns is a major problem. A soldiers day off should be free of sq duty as K.P. its, except when absolutely necessary or he forfeits his pass.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Why do they build camps at a town where a fellow has nothing to do? Some camps are okay like Lowery at Denver in Colorado. But this one is at Tampa Florida it is a {underline}hell[underline} hole. {paragraph} Men have nothing to do, unless they get drunk. It is mostly where the place is and what men have to do in the little
S64.Q97.C_1: free time they love. On what kind of soldier they are.
S64.Q97.Full: Why do they build camps at a town where a fellow has nothing to do? Some camps are okay like Lowery at Denver in Colorado. But this one is at Tampa Florida it is a {underline}hell[underline} hole. {paragraph} Men have nothing to do, unless they get drunk. It is mostly where the place is and what men have to do in the little free time they love. On what kind of soldier they are.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: We don't even a 3 day at any time no matter how long you have been with an outfit.
S64.Q97.F: I don't think it is fair for a man that went through a technical training school in the army and has been classified as such, to do KP or Guard. I believe that there are enough general duty men in the outfit to take care of K.P. As far as the guard goes, I know, that there is a regular guard on the post. [paragraph] Your C.O. comes in yelling all the time that he wants the planes in flying
S64.Q97.C_1: condition at all times. How can this be done, when most of the trained men are taken off the line to do KP & other squadron duties. From what I understand, a non Com is not supposed to get any squadron duties. This does not hold true here. Many of the men get disgusted because they don't get ratings. [unclear] only lo [/unclear] ratings in our outfit since the first of this year. therefore, nobody wants to work. Transportation on this field is PP & I don't mean "Post Paid." Only 5 buses running to the end of the field and then you have to wait until one of the buses from town come to pick you up. If some Officer didn't [unclear] [/unclear] the bus line I think this camp's transportation would be similar to other camps where [unclear] Gil [/unclear] buses would take you into town & also pick you up. P.T. is another thing that they should do away with when it is raining.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't think it is fair for a man that went through a technical training school in the army and has been classified as such, to do KP or Guard. I believe that there are enough general duty men in the outfit to take care of K.P. As far as the guard goes, I know, that there is a regular guard on the post. [paragraph] Your C.O. comes in yelling all the time that he wants the planes in flying  condition at all times. How can this be done, when most of the trained men are taken off the line to do KP & other squadron duties. From what I understand, a non Com is not supposed to get any squadron duties. This does not hold true here. Many of the men get disgusted because they don't get ratings. [unclear] only lo [/unclear] ratings in our outfit since the first of this year. therefore, nobody wants to work. Transportation on this field is PP & I don't mean "Post Paid." Only 5 buses running to the end of the field and then you have to wait until one of the buses from town come to pick you up. If some Officer didn't [unclear] [/unclear] the bus line I think this camp's transportation would be similar to other camps where [unclear] Gil [/unclear] buses would take you into town & also pick you up. P.T. is another thing that they should do away with when it is raining.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I had a good job before coming into the Army. The job I held was more important than what I am doing now. I made three times the amount in a week than I make a month in the army. My home was broken up.
S64.Q97.Full: I had a good job before coming into the Army. The job I held was more important than what I am doing now. I made three times the amount in a week than I make a month in the army. My home was broken up.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I always thought that the army was efficient, but not here. In the troop I am in they have no system as far as some of the work goes, also on passes over the week ends. They treat you like a bunch of kids half of the time.
S64.Q97.Full: I always thought that the army was efficient, but not here. In the troop I am in they have no system as far as some of the work goes, also on passes over the week ends. They treat you like a bunch of kids half of the time.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I don't see why the Army took us married men in the Army when I see such things in the paper such as: They won't ever take married men in the armed forces and I know so many single men of my own age that are just as equally fit as I am and not in the Army. Also when a mans wife lives in some of these seaboard towns I don't see how they expect her and child to get along on $62 a month with living expenses so high as they are. That's my gripe.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't see why the Army took us married men in the Army when I see such things in the paper such as: They won't ever take married men in the armed forces and I know so many single men of my own age that are just as equally fit as I am and not in the Army. Also when a mans wife lives in some of these seaboard towns I don't see how they expect her and child to get along on $62 a month with living expenses so high as they are. That's my gripe.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I think the army should put in a larger personal staff and make more effort to place each man in types of work in which he has had experience and can do the most good for his country. We should be versed in many types of training [unclear] [/unclear] not a Jack of all trades man. For instance, if a man was a good cook, mechanic,
S64.Q97.C_1: or had a good knowledge of a trade. Wouldn't it be the best idea to place him there? He undauditly would put more body and soul to the wheel and be doing a better job.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the army should put in a larger personal staff and make more effort to place each man in types of work in which he has had experience and can do the most good for his country. We should be versed in many types of training [unclear] [/unclear] not a Jack of all trades man. For instance, if a man was a good cook, mechanic,  or had a good knowledge of a trade. Wouldn't it be the best idea to place him there? He undauditly would put more body and soul to the wheel and be doing a better job.

S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: Well I think the Civilians are making it all right but as the wifes of a soldier they have a hard time of making it a solders wife give up her home her husband and ever thing and what dose she get out of it plainly specking She gets a lot of hell [deletion] [/deletion] if you could see the way a lot of them lives
S64.Q97.C_1: has to live you would say the same thing and these men that are striking on these jobs put them in our place and see how they like it and put some of us back there we would be glad to have a job like they have got.

S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: nuts on this army life. If my baby starts out on the right foot, he'll surely get punished for it. The war has seperated everyone so far from home that I didn't see the ones I loved when I had my furlough and I couldn't get to see my wife because I wasn't prepared for it. I had a 2 hr. notice that I was leaving on furlough. nuts.

I had a 2 hr. notice that I was leaving on furlough. nuts.

S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Well the reason i print this one is My dad took ill about 3 months befor i got drafted into the army, and he could not do any work of any kind and still cant as he still is ill docter [doctor] bills have to be paid and highly to, and there was only my income coming in to pay the bills for the doctor and other medacin [medicine] of things that where neded
S64.Q97.C_1: and i erned almost enough to cover these bills where in civilien life. Since i got into the army my folks got into debt so bad that i don't think that thayl ever get out of it. If the war department checkt into my case more i believe thayd find that id do more good out in civilien life then as a soldier. That is i had a defence job putting out good production and in that way could cover the bills that came up at home. I only make 1/6 of the pay in one month now then what i did make in civilin life thats the reason the family is so far in a hole now. And i had to leave a good position and a good future if i had not been drafted into the army. Was learning the traid as a machinist very fast and was taking a course in school to better myself for the future.
S64.Q97.Full: Well the reason i print this one is My dad took ill about 3 months befor i got drafted into the army, and he could not do any work of any kind and still cant as he still is ill docter [doctor] bills have to be paid and highly to, and there was only my income coming in to pay the bills for the doctor and other medacin [medicine] of things that where neded and i erned almost enough to cover these bills where in civilien life. Since i got into the army my folks got into debt so bad that i don't think that thayl ever get out of it. If the war department checkt into my case more i believe thayd find that id do more good out in civilien life then as a soldier. That is i had a defence job putting out good production and in that way could cover the bills that came up at home. I only make 1/6 of the pay in one month now then what i did make in civilin life thats the reason the family is so far in a hole now. And i had to leave a good position and a good future if i had not been drafted into the army. Was learning the traid as a machinist very fast and was taking a course in school to better myself for the future.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I think in selection of non-coms [non-commissioned officers] more care should be taken as sometimes the men who are less obvious and more quiet are better qualified but keep it to themselves. The boistrous [boisterous] ones quite often get the rating but cannot deliver the goods except thru cooperation of the other men who will and can do it but never say so to the officers.
S64.Q97.Full: I think in selection of non-coms [non-commissioned officers] more care should be taken as sometimes the men who are less obvious and more quiet are better qualified but keep it to themselves. The boistrous [boisterous] ones quite often get the rating but cannot deliver the goods except thru cooperation of the other men who will and can do it but never say so to the officers.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Men aren't given chance to get in outfits they volunteered for, or chances to transfer.
S64.Q97.Full: Men aren't given chance to get in outfits they volunteered for, or chances to transfer.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: (Partiality is shown)
S64.Q97.F: Too many non-coms are not worthy of their stripes. When you know about twice as much as your officer knows you don't respect your officers. The average soldier is treated like a dog in the mess halls. When we have good food, we don't get enough of it. Our outfit is always screwed up by our first sergeant or executive officer on passes, while other outfits in the
S64.Q97.C_1: same camp get liberal passes. Treat the men like men and they will be satisfied. We soldiers in combat outfits feel that S.C.U.S (Small Combat Units) are treated better than we are. They can wear garrison hats and belts, whereas we can't. Those two items add 100% to a uniform's appearance. I take pride in my uniform. We do not have adequate transportation to town. Standing in line in a bus depot for 3 to 4 hours takes all the enjoyment out of a pass. The M.P.s (Military Police) are too anxious to run in a soldier in town. Division M.P.s (Military Police) who run the command post are O.K. (okay) for they treat us like men and respect us. SCU (Small Combat Units) M.P.s (Military Police) authority goes to their heads. If you want to improve the Army, give us better non-coms (non-commissioned officers) and officer to work with. Passes are important, so don't screw us up on them if we deserve them.
S64.Q97.Full: Too many non-coms are not worthy of their stripes. When you know about twice as much as your officer knows you don't respect your officers. The average soldier is treated like a dog in the mess halls. When we have good food, we don't get enough of it. Our outfit is always screwed up by our first sergeant or executive officer on passes, while other outfits in the  same camp get liberal passes. Treat the men like men and they will be satisfied. We soldiers in combat outfits feel that S.C.U.S (Small Combat Units) are treated better than we are. They can wear garrison hats and belts, whereas we can't. Those two items add 100% to a uniform's appearance. I take pride in my uniform. We do not have adequate transportation to town. Standing in line in a bus depot for 3 to 4 hours takes all the enjoyment out of a pass. The M.P.s (Military Police) are too anxious to run in a soldier in town. Division M.P.s (Military Police) who run the command post are O.K. (okay) for they treat us like men and respect us. SCU (Small Combat Units) M.P.s (Military Police) authority goes to their heads. If you want to improve the Army, give us better non-coms (non-commissioned officers) and officer to work with. Passes are important, so don't screw us up on them if we deserve them.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: In regard to passes - Sometimes our passes are made out from 12 noon Sat till later, but our first sergeant delays the passes through his own fault sometimes for as much as 2 1/2 hrs. When we are told we are getting a pass it is bad for the moral of the men to have to stand and wait and miss good transportation for no good reason.
S64.Q97.Full: In regard to passes - Sometimes our passes are made out from 12 noon Sat till later, but our first sergeant delays the passes through his own fault sometimes for as much as 2 1/2 hrs. When we are told we are getting a pass it is bad for the moral of the men to have to stand and wait and miss good transportation for no good reason.

S64.Q97.F: The gov't (government) should [deletion] should [/deletion] release all men over thirty form active duty and use them only for positions were (where) the younger and more active men are now insted (instead) of using WACS (Women's Army Corps Service) They have plenty men in this class to use without any more expense to the Gov't (government).
