document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I would like to make a remark on how our mess hall is run. It is run very bad at times the food we are fed I wouldn't feed my dog, usually we go to the PX to eat. There is some exceptions when we have pretty good meals. The mess Sgt sometimes acts as if he has to buy the food, at one time when I was on KP I seen a lot of good food thrown away because when they passed it out the mess Sgt would stand there and watch that ...
S64.Q97.C_1: You wouldn't be given to much. The first Sgt sometimes thinks he is the (little General) just as some of the C.O. leaves the company he has every one on a [unclear] grazy [/unclear] detail just to [unclear] write [/unclear] him or get praised for it in other words he is not very well liked by any one that seems very wrong the way he does things to there isn't enough paper here to say what I would like to say as I will quite.
S64.Q97.Full: I would like to make a remark on how our mess hall is run. It is run very bad at times the food we are fed I wouldn't feed my dog, usually we go to the PX to eat. There is some exceptions when we have pretty good meals. The mess Sgt sometimes acts as if he has to buy the food, at one time when I was on KP I seen a lot of good food thrown away because when they passed it out the mess Sgt would stand there and watch that ... You wouldn't be given to much. The first Sgt sometimes thinks he is the (little General) just as some of the C.O. leaves the company he has every one on a [unclear] grazy [/unclear] detail just to [unclear] write [/unclear] him or get praised for it in other words he is not very well liked by any one that seems very wrong the way he does things to there isn't enough paper here to say what I would like to say as I will quite.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Regarding technicians very few are trained as well as they should be. Also technical equipment is lacking here in the States. I hope it isn't overseas. A great deal of the equipment used in Radio work is very cheap and my opinion is that the government, is getting cheated. We certainly should have the best but its below standard.
S64.Q97.Full: Regarding technicians very few are trained as well as they should be. Also technical equipment is lacking here in the States. I hope it isn't overseas. A great deal of the equipment used in Radio work is very cheap and my opinion is that the government, is getting cheated. We certainly should have the best but its below standard.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Selection of men for non-coms as far as ability is concerned in our unit is definitely a black eye if it were ever published in black and white to the fact hungry public. I enlisted because of two things: to help get the job done and get in some work that I am best capable of doing. I believe that if a comprehensive examination
S64.Q97.C_1: were given to the men who were given ratings, not very many of them would survive the shock of failure. I did not join to get a rating through the foul play of favoritism but through capable ability in the work I have been trained. I have certainly learned many things in the army that would cause e never to join the ranks again. Gentlemen, it leads to this & this only that if a person has to stand up for favoritism among superior officers with other E.M. and being deliberately held down because I wasn't liked enough by the C.O., I don't feel the army is just in bleeding the people. What's the difference? I ask you. I'm still paying taxes for last year income and this is the first time I've had to voice my opinion. For God's sake, can't something be done for the fellow held down by favoritism such as a suitable transfer?
S64.Q97.Full: Selection of men for non-coms as far as ability is concerned in our unit is definitely a black eye if it were ever published in black and white to the fact hungry public. I enlisted because of two things: to help get the job done and get in some work that I am best capable of doing. I believe that if a comprehensive examination  were given to the men who were given ratings, not very many of them would survive the shock of failure. I did not join to get a rating through the foul play of favoritism but through capable ability in the work I have been trained. I have certainly learned many things in the army that would cause e never to join the ranks again. Gentlemen, it leads to this & this only that if a person has to stand up for favoritism among superior officers with other E.M. and being deliberately held down because I wasn't liked enough by the C.O., I don't feel the army is just in bleeding the people. What's the difference? I ask you. I'm still paying taxes for last year income and this is the first time I've had to voice my opinion. For God's sake, can't something be done for the fellow held down by favoritism such as a suitable transfer?

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I'm as good an American as anybody, but I ([underline] hate [/underline] ) the army. I have glasses, and if I ever lost my glasses in combat (which I probably will do), I'd be absolutely no good. I've tried damned hard to be a good soldier, even though I don't like it, and I think I've done a pretty good job (I'm a T/5). But I honestly think I was doing more to win the war in my job in civilian life. I've adapted myself after a fashion to army routine, but its so disorganized. I'm going
S64.Q97.C_1: to try and get out of the army, because I'm not doing much good. I'm an introvert by nature so naturally the army life I've led has not been easy. I wish they would have found out at the induction center and sent me home. Now, about the way the army does things. Our division is going on maneuvers very soon, and I firmly believe that they will fizzle out. I don't believe we're any more ready for them than a bunch of civilians. Not enough training of things we need, and too much of what we don't need. I honestly feel as though I'm in the boy scouts at times. Our officers (commissioned) gripe about petty things, but never give things that are really big, any thought at all. Aw nuts, I'm just disgusted with army life.
S64.Q97.Full: I'm as good an American as anybody, but I ([underline] hate [/underline] ) the army. I have glasses, and if I ever lost my glasses in combat (which I probably will do), I'd be absolutely no good. I've tried damned hard to be a good soldier, even though I don't like it, and I think I've done a pretty good job (I'm a T/5). But I honestly think I was doing more to win the war in my job in civilian life. I've adapted myself after a fashion to army routine, but its so disorganized. I'm going  to try and get out of the army, because I'm not doing much good. I'm an introvert by nature so naturally the army life I've led has not been easy. I wish they would have found out at the induction center and sent me home. Now, about the way the army does things. Our division is going on maneuvers very soon, and I firmly believe that they will fizzle out. I don't believe we're any more ready for them than a bunch of civilians. Not enough training of things we need, and too much of what we don't need. I honestly feel as though I'm in the boy scouts at times. Our officers (commissioned) gripe about petty things, but never give things that are really big, any thought at all. Aw nuts, I'm just disgusted with army life.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I don't feel I could give a true interpretation mainly because of my fate inasmuch as I find myself in Infantry easily withstanding the rigors of training wherein a great many are cracking up. My education and a G.C.T. [General Classification Test] call for a better fate and also my inability to get into the branches of service I wanted from 1940 to 1942 because of a few pounds lacking in might have left me with no ambition, no spunk [deletion] [/deletion]
S64.Q97.C_1: and in general a feeling of being let down and perhaps of letting my country down. (paragraph) [unclear] [/unclear] Question #66 we are fighting for Anglo-Saxon domination of the main sources of the world trade - streamlined imperalism (imperialism) - but so are the members of the axis. On the whole not a very elementary object but despite its shortcomings I would prefer Anglo-Saxon "tyranny" to axis economic domination purely from a selfish viewpoint. This nonsense of the Atlantic Charter is good propaganda but not very sincere as India can show and will continue to sow long after cessation of hostilities (and our victory) - Britons never will be slaves but Hindus will. The U.S. is only fighting for what she stole in the 19th century - but far better for a United Nations victory than an axis-dictated peace. It is simply a 'lesser of two evils' - not any gibberish about a struggle between good and evil. But the truth would be bad medicine for the average man so let the propaganda flow and the thinking man will laugh to himself.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't feel I could give a true interpretation mainly because of my fate inasmuch as I find myself in Infantry easily withstanding the rigors of training wherein a great many are cracking up. My education and a G.C.T. [General Classification Test] call for a better fate and also my inability to get into the branches of service I wanted from 1940 to 1942 because of a few pounds lacking in might have left me with no ambition, no spunk [deletion] [/deletion]  and in general a feeling of being let down and perhaps of letting my country down. (paragraph) [unclear] [/unclear] Question #66 we are fighting for Anglo-Saxon domination of the main sources of the world trade - streamlined imperalism (imperialism) - but so are the members of the axis. On the whole not a very elementary object but despite its shortcomings I would prefer Anglo-Saxon "tyranny" to axis economic domination purely from a selfish viewpoint. This nonsense of the Atlantic Charter is good propaganda but not very sincere as India can show and will continue to sow long after cessation of hostilities (and our victory) - Britons never will be slaves but Hindus will. The U.S. is only fighting for what she stole in the 19th century - but far better for a United Nations victory than an axis-dictated peace. It is simply a 'lesser of two evils' - not any gibberish about a struggle between good and evil. But the truth would be bad medicine for the average man so let the propaganda flow and the thinking man will laugh to himself.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: The food here is no good they have cooks that don't know to make coffee even or fry eggs. The good meat is lozey [lousy] , the potatoes are half done & if you want good men you have to feed them good. I have a bad leg I got hurt on the railroad & they did not put me in limited service. I have a Mother & Dad to keep & now for 2 months they have not received a check yet.
S64.Q97.C_1: That is why I dont thing [think] much off [of] the Army. I am a railroad & my truck is under repair, & they put me in the [deletion] [/deletion] infantry were [where] I have to march a lot & it is hard on my leg. I tried to get in to some place were [where] I would not have to march much but all they say is I see what I can do and it been 8 month now & am still in the infantry. That is why I dont think much off [of] this outfit I in.
S64.Q97.Full: The food here is no good they have cooks that don't know to make coffee even or fry eggs. The good meat is lozey [lousy] , the potatoes are half done & if you want good men you have to feed them good. I have a bad leg I got hurt on the railroad & they did not put me in limited service. I have a Mother & Dad to keep & now for 2 months they have not received a check yet. That is why I dont thing [think] much off [of] the Army. I am a railroad & my truck is under repair, & they put me in the [deletion] [/deletion] infantry were [where] I have to march a lot & it is hard on my leg. I tried to get in to some place were [where] I would not have to march much but all they say is I see what I can do and it been 8 month now & am still in the infantry. That is why I dont think much off [of] this outfit I in.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: The officers are in the opinion of more of the men & myself do not know as much as some non-coms. They expect men to do things they would never thing of doing. They drive the men therefore the work gets done with the wrong attitude. I think the better you treat a man the more you can get out of him. The food in the army isn't all
S64.Q97.C_1: {all caps} They advertise it to be. In eight months in this camp the food has been very poor I think. We do not have the entertainment other camps have. {paragraph} A man in this camp is not only promoted for his efforts. I find most promotions come through favoritism on part of officers. Men have gone AWOL and come back to a very light punishment then got promotions in my opinion the men are better soldiers than the officers. {all caps}
S64.Q97.Full: The officers are in the opinion of more of the men & myself do not know as much as some non-coms. They expect men to do things they would never thing of doing. They drive the men therefore the work gets done with the wrong attitude. I think the better you treat a man the more you can get out of him. The food in the army isn't all {all caps} They advertise it to be. In eight months in this camp the food has been very poor I think. We do not have the entertainment other camps have. {paragraph} A man in this camp is not only promoted for his efforts. I find most promotions come through favoritism on part of officers. Men have gone AWOL and come back to a very light punishment then got promotions in my opinion the men are better soldiers than the officers. {all caps}

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Up to the present time no fathers before Pearl Harbor have been drafted but lots have become fathers since being in the army. Under this condition and as long as it continues and they are give no consideration or thought. I think it is shear neglect and disgrace to the people and a great injustice to the soldier himself. When a
S64.Q97.C_1: man in the service becomes a father I think he should instantly be put into non-combat duty or discharged. The United States has such a large army now it can not feed & handle them all efficiently.
S64.Q97.Full: Up to the present time no fathers before Pearl Harbor have been drafted but lots have become fathers since being in the army. Under this condition and as long as it continues and they are give no consideration or thought. I think it is shear neglect and disgrace to the people and a great injustice to the soldier himself. When a  man in the service becomes a father I think he should instantly be put into non-combat duty or discharged. The United States has such a large army now it can not feed & handle them all efficiently.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: It is my opinion that the army would be a lot better if men were put in a position they liked. Men that like their work & take an interest in it will really go places. I was formerly a machinist and I never had to do any heavy work. Now I am in an outfit where I am required to carry a 50 lb. tripod on my back besides a 50 lb. pack. I am only a little fellow
S64.Q97.C_1: and I can't take it too well. I know I could do a lot better if I was working on airplane parts as I did in civilian life. Men who have had good educations are now doing hard physical labor when I really think they would be doing our country and our army more good at something else. When you ask for a transfer to something else about 9 out of 10 officers try to discourage you even if they do know you would be better fitted for something else. The Army furnishes us with good grades of food but the cooks have never cooked for so many men so a lot of time they really make a poor meal out of one that should be good. I think cooks should have a special school and fellows who could cook in civilian life give them a chance in the army.
S64.Q97.Full: It is my opinion that the army would be a lot better if men were put in a position they liked. Men that like their work & take an interest in it will really go places. I was formerly a machinist and I never had to do any heavy work. Now I am in an outfit where I am required to carry a 50 lb. tripod on my back besides a 50 lb. pack. I am only a little fellow and I can't take it too well. I know I could do a lot better if I was working on airplane parts as I did in civilian life. Men who have had good educations are now doing hard physical labor when I really think they would be doing our country and our army more good at something else. When you ask for a transfer to something else about 9 out of 10 officers try to discourage you even if they do know you would be better fitted for something else. The Army furnishes us with good grades of food but the cooks have never cooked for so many men so a lot of time they really make a poor meal out of one that should be good. I think cooks should have a special school and fellows who could cook in civilian life give them a chance in the army.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think a soldier has to much to do in the week to be made stay in over the week end all the soldier in our company work to hard in the week to be put on some detail and is not allow to go to town That is the only thig I have against the army.
S64.Q97.Full: I think a soldier has to much to do in the week to be made stay in over the week end all the soldier in our company work to hard in the week to be put on some detail and is not allow to go to town That is the only thig I have against the army.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I believe that the procedure for transfer is too complicated - I know that we are at war and that too many men are in the Army who cannot think for themselves in the first place. But there are few who would like to volunteer for jobs more dangerous and more needed overseas thant he one they are holding now. But the procedure is too long and has to have too many approvals. I think that men who want to be transferred to
S64.Q97.C_1: Overseas, or glidder troops or Air Force or any of those units should be alowed to write directly to their Corp. Co. Then the man can be chequed up on - he can get transfered sooner and be on the job he really wants and will work a lot better. With the present procedure to many good men are waisting their time in the U. S. when they could be fighting overseas or getting really ready for it.
S64.Q97.Full: I believe that the procedure for transfer is too complicated - I know that we are at war and that too many men are in the Army who cannot think for themselves in the first place. But there are few who would like to volunteer for jobs more dangerous and more needed overseas thant he one they are holding now. But the procedure is too long and has to have too many approvals. I think that men who want to be transferred to  Overseas, or glidder troops or Air Force or any of those units should be alowed to write directly to their Corp. Co. Then the man can be chequed up on - he can get transfered sooner and be on the job he really wants and will work a lot better. With the present procedure to many good men are waisting their time in the U. S. when they could be fighting overseas or getting really ready for it.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: When a person volunteers for a special branch of service when he could have stayed out about a year longer I think he should be put in the branch of service that he volunteered for.
S64.Q97.Full: When a person volunteers for a special branch of service when he could have stayed out about a year longer I think he should be put in the branch of service that he volunteered for.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: underlined 'passes' in question
S64.Q97.F: Men should be given more freedom. I believe 5 & 6 days is plenty of duty for any soldier while in training. This would bolster morale, make fewer A.W.O.L's, discipline would be better, men would have something to look forward to & would, I believe, make better soldiers. Orders should be handed down accurately, & without as little change as possible.
S64.Q97.C_1: Many [insertion] Comm. [/insertion] [Commissioned] officers should be checked. As far as being fine gentlemen they are all right, but many are not able to lead in the field, but would be better suited in plans & operations, etc or anything like that. A soldier can't be [underline] disciplined, [/underline] which is the main cog in any Army, by an officer that he feels is not capable of leading him when he does get into the real thing. There is too much passing the buck down to non-commissioned, from the officers because of the simple reason that they can't carry on themselves. A lot of the training is unnecessary. I believe that it states in field manual 20-5 that men should not be overtaxed or fatigued without cause. When it is found out who can take it this should stop. We have found out. 50% have been discharged which is to many. We now can take it when we get into combat, but we dont need any more practice. I thank you
S64.Q97.Full: Men should be given more freedom. I believe 5 & 6 days is plenty of duty for any soldier while in training. This would bolster morale, make fewer A.W.O.L's, discipline would be better, men would have something to look forward to & would, I believe, make better soldiers. Orders should be handed down accurately, & without as little change as possible. Many [insertion] Comm. [/insertion] [Commissioned] officers should be checked. As far as being fine gentlemen they are all right, but many are not able to lead in the field, but would be better suited in plans & operations, etc or anything like that. A soldier can't be [underline] disciplined, [/underline] which is the main cog in any Army, by an officer that he feels is not capable of leading him when he does get into the real thing. There is too much passing the buck down to non-commissioned, from the officers because of the simple reason that they can't carry on themselves. A lot of the training is unnecessary. I believe that it states in field manual 20-5 that men should not be overtaxed or fatigued without cause. When it is found out who can take it this should stop. We have found out. 50% have been discharged which is to many. We now can take it when we get into combat, but we dont need any more practice. I thank you

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: My opinion of the U.S. Army is that it is by far the best in the World. But it could be much better. My own particular outfit is a disgrace to the Army. [paragraph] There are few soldiers in the whole division including myself. I'll never be a good soldier doing
S64.Q97.C_1: the job Im doing. [paragraph] But I feel that is [if] I were in the Medics I would be a much better soldier I would have an interest & naturally I'd try harder for a rating. I feel that I'm making the best of a bad bargain.
S64.Q97.Full: My opinion of the U.S. Army is that it is by far the best in the World. But it could be much better. My own particular outfit is a disgrace to the Army. [paragraph] There are few soldiers in the whole division including myself. I'll never be a good soldier doing  the job Im doing. [paragraph] But I feel that is [if] I were in the Medics I would be a much better soldier I would have an interest & naturally I'd try harder for a rating. I feel that I'm making the best of a bad bargain.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page

S64.Q97.F: I think that after a year you're in the service and a few thousand miles from home the [they] should station you in your own home state. It cost too much for a soldier to go on a furlough from here. I get $13 a month after every thing is taken from my payroll so you can imagine what
S64.Q97.C_1: kind of saving, we have to do so in case we get a furlough & seen too much of the dam (damn) west. Every one (everyone) will be satisfied if you ship them to there (their) home state. I'm sure of that. So long . Good luck. Oh, yes too many men are gettin (getting) [unclear] [/unclear] when they can be good i something else.

S64.Q97.F: I want to see [underline] "every' [/underline] man who is on a civilian job now here at least one year of the same training after the war. The higher up's can't seem to make up their minds as to uniform, time, etc. -- the best of food but not prepaired right. Mess equipment very very poor. When a man deserves a discharge, he is held in the army and after 6 or 7 months of training is discharged, waist of time for both.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: There is too many 4F guys and guys getting discharged that could play some kind of a part in this mans army. Some guys that are an civilian left have 1 baby and it not more than 22 yrs of age is just as physically fit for the army as a lot of the boys overseas. This is everybody war not just a few.
S64.Q97.C_1: If they are leaving the 4F in civilian life they could put them in defense plants and pay them army pay. The guys writes that they make big money and good times we are making good money and having good times to (on maneuvers). Those guys could be used for something I know. I am willing to fight for the country, for my family and because a (sucker) has got a hump back or a sore toe he can play some part in this thing too. Well I'm sorry I just had to blow my top a little but it is the truth you know it, (about the (4f's)

If they are leaving the 4F in civilian life they could put them in defense plants and pay them army pay. The guys writes that they make big money and good times we are making good money and having good times to (on maneuvers). Those guys could be used for something I know. I am willing to fight for the country, for my family and because a (sucker) has got a hump back or a sore toe he can play some part in this thing too. Well I'm sorry I just had to blow my top a little but it is the truth you know it, (about the (4f's)

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: The noncoms run our outfit. Officers are remarkable inefficient. I think a 10 year old kid could run a platoon better than those lamebrains we have. They demand respect & don't deserve it. I salute the uniform not the dope that wears it. In our company we only have two officers I .....
S64.Q97.C_1: would trust in combat. Our mess hall is very poorly equipped. I know someone is making lots of money on chow. I wasn't born yesterday Joe. The army is O.K. but if I ever have a kid that starts off with his left foot I'll hit him on the head.
S64.Q97.Full: The noncoms run our outfit. Officers are remarkable inefficient. I think a 10 year old kid could run a platoon better than those lamebrains we have. They demand respect & don't deserve it. I salute the uniform not the dope that wears it. In our company we only have two officers I ..... would trust in combat. Our mess hall is very poorly equipped. I know someone is making lots of money on chow. I wasn't born yesterday Joe. The army is O.K. but if I ever have a kid that starts off with his left foot I'll hit him on the head.

S64.Q97.C_1: Get more extensive and specialized training and I believe any one who has been in actual combat would make a much better instructor than one who haven't therefore I believe every company if possible should have one officer who actually knows what its all about and not ones who have only had 90 days at some officers training school

S64.Q97.F: The army think that we should buy bonds every month some of us dont draw very much as it is still they think we should draw but little. They dont give us very much say in that respect. [paragraph] They say they cant make us but want us to go to school until we do.
S64.Q97.Full: The army think that we should buy bonds every month some of us dont draw very much as it is still they think we should draw but little. They dont give us very much say in that respect. [paragraph] They say they cant make us but want us to go to school until we do.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Just a little comment one thing I do konw. Place wouldn't be so bad if they didn't have two dam many 2nd Lt[lieutenants] trying to run the same job at the same time. Biggest mistake of the army [unclear] [/unclear] and half of them don't know as much as you know.
S64.Q97.Full: Just a little comment one thing I do konw. Place wouldn't be so bad if they didn't have two dam many 2nd Lt[lieutenants] trying to run the same job at the same time. Biggest mistake of the army [unclear] [/unclear] and half of them don't know as much as you know.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: The thing that I see rong [wrong] in so many cases in the army is that the men are not properly classified. They are not put in branch of service that they are best fitted. In my outfit we have to many old men competing with young men.
S64.Q97.Full: The thing that I see rong [wrong] in so many cases in the army is that the men are not properly classified. They are not put in branch of service that they are best fitted. In my outfit we have to many old men competing with young men.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I think the Army should provide all or part of the medical care for an EM's family. Especially maternity cases. In civilian life I had a very good salary and gave my wife the best care money could buy. It's impossible on my army pay. Medical officers should not be commanding officers for any unit. They don't learn enough about the Army in 3 months. Most of
S64.Q97.C_1: them don't like administration, they're no good at it, and they shouldn't be made to do it. There is too much callousness among the medical officers in the station hosp. An EM should be issued more than three pair of heavy wool socks. There should be examinations for all promotions. Favoritism plays too large a part here. Furloughs should 15 days exclusive of travel time. The men should have one afternoon off a week when in garrison.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the Army should provide all or part of the medical care for an EM's family. Especially maternity cases. In civilian life I had a very good salary and gave my wife the best care money could buy. It's impossible on my army pay. Medical officers should not be commanding officers for any unit. They don't learn enough about the Army in 3 months. Most of them don't like administration, they're no good at it, and they shouldn't be made to do it. There is too much callousness among the medical officers in the station hosp. An EM should be issued more than three pair of heavy wool socks. There should be examinations for all promotions. Favoritism plays too large a part here. Furloughs should 15 days exclusive of travel time. The men should have one afternoon off a week when in garrison.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Notice civilians are complaining because of too much war talk and propaganda day after day through radio, newspapers etc. - morale is not helped any.
S64.Q97.Full: Notice civilians are complaining because of too much war talk and propaganda day after day through radio, newspapers etc. - morale is not helped any.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: It is my opinion that in the Med. Dept. [medical department] the company commanders & duty officers should be MAC's [medical corp?] . Too many MC's [medical corps] come into the army with no army experience, and take command of a company. After a short while they get the idea that they know more than an enlisted man who has been in the army 6 or 8 years. I think to let MC's [medical corp] function only where medical attention is needed or in.........
S64.Q97.C_1: charge of sanitation and not as commanders, we would have a far better medical department. Too many of our commissioned officers think only of themselves and do not stand up for the enlisted men in their companies. They take all the credit for worthwhile things and give no credit to the enlisted men. This is lowers morale terribly. I suggest the officers cooperate more freely with their non-coms and privates as well. If they don't, their outfit will never be any good, either in combat or garrison. I think all passes for enlisted men living nearby, who are married should be class "A", from retreat to revillie and that these men should be allowed to go on pass every night that they are not actually on some detail.
S64.Q97.Full: It is my opinion that in the Med. Dept. [medical department] the company commanders & duty officers should be MAC's [medical corp?] . Too many MC's [medical corps] come into the army with no army experience, and take command of a company. After a short while they get the idea that they know more than an enlisted man who has been in the army 6 or 8 years. I think to let MC's [medical corp] function only where medical attention is needed or in......... charge of sanitation and not as commanders, we would have a far better medical department. Too many of our commissioned officers think only of themselves and do not stand up for the enlisted men in their companies. They take all the credit for worthwhile things and give no credit to the enlisted men. This is lowers morale terribly. I suggest the officers cooperate more freely with their non-coms and privates as well. If they don't, their outfit will never be any good, either in combat or garrison. I think all passes for enlisted men living nearby, who are married should be class "A", from retreat to revillie and that these men should be allowed to go on pass every night that they are not actually on some detail.

S64.Q97.F: I don't think the army picks its men for the job according to the man's ability but more by what they intend to train him and in many cases the man picked doesn't even want to that kind of job. Every like those stribed but the shouldn't go to the man with the biggest mouth and no judgement.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I believe the army is trying its best under what it now has to work with, but I do think some of its leaders should be replaced with men who take more personal interest in the men under them. FOR EXAMPLE A newly made colonel in a Medical outfit upon hearing of a wreck involving an ambulance & a jeep asked one of the drivers, "Well how did things turn out?" "Nobody was seriously injured" said the driver. The Colonel thundered back, "I don't mean that -- How is the ambulance & the jeep? I'm mainly concerned about them!"
S64.Q97.C_1: Sir, Do you think that man is fit for the commanding position in a medical Battalion? I would feel very unsafe under such a man as that. [paragraph] I think also there are too many unnecessary reports and not enough attention paid the needs of the men. Paper work takes up too much time leaving other work to suffer.
S64.Q97.Full: I believe the army is trying its best under what it now has to work with, but I do think some of its leaders should be replaced with men who take more personal interest in the men under them. FOR EXAMPLE A newly made colonel in a Medical outfit upon hearing of a wreck involving an ambulance & a jeep asked one of the drivers, "Well how did things turn out?" "Nobody was seriously injured" said the driver. The Colonel thundered back, "I don't mean that -- How is the ambulance & the jeep? I'm mainly concerned about them!" Sir, Do you think that man is fit for the commanding position in a medical Battalion? I would feel very unsafe under such a man as that. [paragraph] I think also there are too many unnecessary reports and not enough attention paid the needs of the men. Paper work takes up too much time leaving other work to suffer.

S64.Q97.F: Our officers are not well trained enough. & they will pick just some certain boys & give them ratings & they dont treat us all a like. [paragraph] I dont feel like the officers are any better than the E.M. but they think so because they have a stripe or [deletion] [/deletion] bars.
S64.Q97.C_1: I feel like I would be more benefit to the army if I were out and back home cultivating the farm to grow something to feed the boys on, because they have got to eat.
S64.Q97.Full: Our officers are not well trained enough. & they will pick just some certain boys & give them ratings & they dont treat us all a like. [paragraph] I dont feel like the officers are any better than the E.M. but they think so because they have a stripe or [deletion] [/deletion] bars. I feel like I would be more benefit to the army if I were out and back home cultivating the farm to grow something to feed the boys on, because they have got to eat.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: Haven't asked for any
S64.Q97.C_1: I said I didn't like some of this Basic pre-cadet training but I think the rest of the cadet program is good. From what I hear and see I think the army is drawing in too many men right now. There seem to be so many men that often the men do nothing valuable for weeks waiting for openings. Entertainment here is fairly plentiful and very good.
S64.Q97.Full: I said I didn't like some of this Basic pre-cadet training but I think the rest of the cadet program is good. From what I hear and see I think the army is drawing in too many men right now. There seem to be so many men that often the men do nothing valuable for weeks waiting for openings. Entertainment here is fairly plentiful and very good.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: The food should be better and we should have more furloughs and less drilling.
S64.Q97.Full: The food should be better and we should have more furloughs and less drilling.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Our basic training here at Sheppard Field you don't receive enough sleep to help your ambitious and awake, ready to do thing. Your lucky if you get six hours a night. I always thought eight hours were about the correct amount. When your sleepy you don't care wether you learn are not.
S64.Q97.Full: Our basic training here at Sheppard Field you don't receive enough sleep to help your ambitious and awake, ready to do thing. Your lucky if you get six hours a night. I always thought eight hours were about the correct amount. When your sleepy you don't care wether you learn are not.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I enlisted into the U.S. states army because I thought it was [deletion] w [/deletion] my duty and my honor. I have been in the army for 6 weeks and although some things are not quite as pleasant as they could be one [deletion] must [/deletion] must realize that war is unpleasant [deletion] I [/deletion] and all things that go with it. My only [deletion] comment [/deletion] comment
S64.Q97.C_1: against the army is the idea of discipline. I believe discipline is a very good thing but I do not believe that everything they tell you is for discipline in or even comes near. They use discipline as a cover all for any unpleasant or unnecessary task that they ask you to perform. [paragraph] Another criticism is the handling of the enlisted men by the non-coms. You can get work out of a soldier by methods other than profanity and a loud voice. I think the non coms that I have come into contact with are the most unqualified, uneducated and uncouth individuals that I have ever had the pleasure to meet. This opinion is a truly unbiased one and one not formed by contact by one single incident or non-com.
S64.Q97.Full: I enlisted into the U.S. states army because I thought it was [deletion] w [/deletion] my duty and my honor. I have been in the army for 6 weeks and although some things are not quite as pleasant as they could be one [deletion] must [/deletion] must realize that war is unpleasant [deletion] I [/deletion] and all things that go with it. My only [deletion] comment [/deletion] comment against the army is the idea of discipline. I believe discipline is a very good thing but I do not believe that everything they tell you is for discipline in or even comes near. They use discipline as a cover all for any unpleasant or unnecessary task that they ask you to perform. [paragraph] Another criticism is the handling of the enlisted men by the non-coms. You can get work out of a soldier by methods other than profanity and a loud voice. I think the non coms that I have come into contact with are the most unqualified, uneducated and uncouth individuals that I have ever had the pleasure to meet. This opinion is a truly unbiased one and one not formed by contact by one single incident or non-com.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: The way I feel is hard to express, but if you feel the way I do the sooner the thing is over the better everyone will be and we have to do this. So let's get it done.
S64.Q97.Full: The way I feel is hard to express, but if you feel the way I do the sooner the thing is over the better everyone will be and we have to do this. So let's get it done.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: Have only asked for passes
S64.Q97.F: I would like it much better here in Texas, where it is unusually hot, if we would drill ([underline] early [/underline] ) in the morning even as early a start as three o'clock, and then during the blistering heat of afternoon to knock off. [paragraph] I think the water is very poor here and I don't think a northern boy is well enough adapted to take this heat immediately.
S64.Q97.Full: I would like it much better here in Texas, where it is unusually hot, if we would drill ([underline] early [/underline] ) in the morning even as early a start as three o'clock, and then during the blistering heat of afternoon to knock off. [paragraph] I think the water is very poor here and I don't think a northern boy is well enough adapted to take this heat immediately.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: In the Air Corps camp I am in the place that is very crowded. There are about twice as many men here than there should be. That makes it very hard to get to use the P.X.'s & service clubs as you always have to wait in a line. Sometimes as long as 1/2 or 3/4 of an hour. There don't seem to be any reason for this at all. We are
S64.Q97.C_1: in the south and after living in the north all your life it is hard to sleep in a barracks with a 100 men when there should only be 60. The air is so close & it is so hot it is very hard to get a good nites sleep. I also find that we don't get a regular change of bedding. We don't use sheets, but we are using our pillow cases and mattress covers for the fourth wk now. Being new to army life this give a very bad impression. You hear about the army being so nice, but you find it altogether different when you get into it.
S64.Q97.Full: In the Air Corps camp I am in the place that is very crowded. There are about twice as many men here than there should be. That makes it very hard to get to use the P.X.'s & service clubs as you always have to wait in a line. Sometimes as long as 1/2 or 3/4 of an hour. There don't seem to be any reason for this at all. We are  in the south and after living in the north all your life it is hard to sleep in a barracks with a 100 men when there should only be 60. The air is so close & it is so hot it is very hard to get a good nites sleep. I also find that we don't get a regular change of bedding. We don't use sheets, but we are using our pillow cases and mattress covers for the fourth wk now. Being new to army life this give a very bad impression. You hear about the army being so nice, but you find it altogether different when you get into it.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Other/No answer
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: Haven't been in the army long enough to get a furlough.
S64.Q97.F: At Sheppard Field If I were in command I would make the men get up about an hour later. Then start them out with a little running then eat. Then about an hour drill and then physical training. Then the different thinks [things] which must be shown on the outside, e.g. Camouflage, Rifle Range, etc. Afternoon a little drill & P.T. to last until 2:00 at 2:00 everybody out of the sun on account of the heat. This time would
S64.Q97.C_1: be spent in lectures & movies, different schools. This is how I would [deletion] [/deletion] have my men work if I were in charge of them.
S64.Q97.Full: At Sheppard Field If I were in command I would make the men get up about an hour later. Then start them out with a little running then eat. Then about an hour drill and then physical training. Then the different thinks [things] which must be shown on the outside, e.g. Camouflage, Rifle Range, etc. Afternoon a little drill & P.T. to last until 2:00 at 2:00 everybody out of the sun on account of the heat. This time would  be spent in lectures & movies, different schools. This is how I would [deletion] [/deletion] have my men work if I were in charge of them.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I think it is foolish to send Air. Cadets here before going to college. Of course it hardens them up but they are bound to get soft gain in college. [paragraph] I think that the officers and non-coms should hear the soldiers side of the story on some subjects such as passes into town for overnite on sat. nites etc.
S64.Q97.C_1: I think that they should have a board to consider military discharges as in my case, I enlisted and now I find that my family is having a terrible time living. I have 4 small children and my wife can't support them as she has been sickly here lately. I worry very much about them and it makes it hard for me to give all the time I need to my job here.
S64.Q97.Full: I think it is foolish to send Air. Cadets here before going to college. Of course it hardens them up but they are bound to get soft gain in college. [paragraph] I think that the officers and non-coms should hear the soldiers side of the story on some subjects such as passes into town for overnite on sat. nites etc.  I think that they should have a board to consider military discharges as in my case, I enlisted and now I find that my family is having a terrible time living. I have 4 small children and my wife can't support them as she has been sickly here lately. I worry very much about them and it makes it hard for me to give all the time I need to my job here.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I haven't been in the Army long enough to have many complaints or otherwise. One thing though, I don't get enough sleep 4 - six hrs a night leaves me still pretty sleepy on the drill field. When I start school I'll have to have more sleep or I'll be sleeping in classes. {paragraph} In the camp I'm in now the
S64.Q97.C_1: [deletion] [/deletion] weather is too hot but otherwise everything is as good as can be expected. [paragraph] Before a person is classified I think he should have a interview with someone so that he can get into a branch that he likes and one that will do him a lot of good. A lot of fellows are in branches that don't interest them at all, therefore making it tough for them.
S64.Q97.Full: I haven't been in the Army long enough to have many complaints or otherwise. One thing though, I don't get enough sleep 4 - six hrs a night leaves me still pretty sleepy on the drill field. When I start school I'll have to have more sleep or I'll be sleeping in classes. {paragraph} In the camp I'm in now the  [deletion] [/deletion] weather is too hot but otherwise everything is as good as can be expected. [paragraph] Before a person is classified I think he should have a interview with someone so that he can get into a branch that he likes and one that will do him a lot of good. A lot of fellows are in branches that don't interest them at all, therefore making it tough for them.

S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I would like to be told when we get paid how come some are paid alot and others very small. Some soldiers with alotment [allotment] & wifes [wives] get more than soliders with just [unclear] . It should be explained.
S64.Q97.Full: I would like to be told when we get paid how come some are paid alot and others very small. Some soldiers with alotment [allotment] & wifes [wives] get more than soliders with just [unclear] . It should be explained.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: 5 1/2 hours a day of drill is ridiculous! Moonlight drill is both physical and mental punishment. A good way to lower morale. As a military unit discipline this one is very lax. Sometimes like a mob of kids. Keep all possible bombers over enemy cities. Knock
S64.Q97.C_1: The Axis out with air power.
S64.Q97.Full: 5 1/2 hours a day of drill is ridiculous! Moonlight drill is both physical and mental punishment. A good way to lower morale. As a military unit discipline this one is very lax. Sometimes like a mob of kids. Keep all possible bombers over enemy cities. Knock The Axis out with air power.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: They tell you in mess halls that waste food and help the Japs, they should follow what they preach for off the one I know of there is a great deal of food wasted that doesn't need to be. At one time I saw 3 big hams thrown away and a lot of these things that could have been save by putting in the ice box
S64.Q97.C_1: and every evening there are 20 to 60 gallons of ice tea or such empytied (emptied) out yet they won't give you a [unclear] [/unclear] glass.
S64.Q97.Full: They tell you in mess halls that waste food and help the Japs, they should follow what they preach for off the one I know of there is a great deal of food wasted that doesn't need to be. At one time I saw 3 big hams thrown away and a lot of these things that could have been save by putting in the ice box  and every evening there are 20 to 60 gallons of ice tea or such empytied (emptied) out yet they won't give you a [unclear] [/unclear] glass.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: some of the non coms should have more training. The landry [laundry] servis [service] is pretty poor here but it is on the account of the men that are running it and we are getting to mutch [much] pork to eat here.
S64.Q97.Full: some of the non coms should have more training. The landry [laundry] servis [service] is pretty poor here but it is on the account of the men that are running it and we are getting to mutch [much] pork to eat here.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: The army should be taught some religion, maybe one hour a week. Let the men choose their own faith or make them listen to different denomination. Non-coms swear entirely too much and I believe it is not needed. Non-coms should be made to practice what they preach. [paragraph] The army is too crowded. I believe men should not be taken into the army until they can train them properly. It is hard
S64.Q97.C_1: On a man's [unclear] [/unclear] to go into the army from a war job and then waste a lot of time in the army. Men should be shown picture shows of our own men at the front & listen to the advice these men give. Maybe the men would train better then and see more reasons for many of things they are forced to do. I do not believe there should be so much distinction between G.I. men and officers. It should be easier for a private to get to see his C.O. The C.O.'s are paid plenty that they should be able to stand being bothered a little bit. Physical punishment such as forced drill without rest on a man's free time should not be allowed, especially after he has completed a hard day. Too much food is thrown away that many people in civilian life could use. Leaves should be granted when a soldier is just awaiting orders.
S64.Q97.Full: The army should be taught some religion, maybe one hour a week. Let the men choose their own faith or make them listen to different denomination. Non-coms swear entirely too much and I believe it is not needed. Non-coms should be made to practice what they preach. [paragraph] The army is too crowded. I believe men should not be taken into the army until they can train them properly. It is hard  On a man's [unclear] [/unclear] to go into the army from a war job and then waste a lot of time in the army. Men should be shown picture shows of our own men at the front & listen to the advice these men give. Maybe the men would train better then and see more reasons for many of things they are forced to do. I do not believe there should be so much distinction between G.I. men and officers. It should be easier for a private to get to see his C.O. The C.O.'s are paid plenty that they should be able to stand being bothered a little bit. Physical punishment such as forced drill without rest on a man's free time should not be allowed, especially after he has completed a hard day. Too much food is thrown away that many people in civilian life could use. Leaves should be granted when a soldier is just awaiting orders.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: Both furloughs and passes crossed and the following comment added: because I haven't been in the Army long enough to rated furlough and 2 have a pass.
S64.Q97.F: I believe the army is like any other organization. It has good points & bad points but enough good points to make it an organization that any soldier or civilian should be proud of. There's plenty [unclear] worse [/unclear] places than basic training camps. [paragraph] This is my honest opinion, so help me GOD.
S64.Q97.Full: I believe the army is like any other organization. It has good points & bad points but enough good points to make it an organization that any soldier or civilian should be proud of. There's plenty [unclear] worse [/unclear] places than basic training camps. [paragraph] This is my honest opinion, so help me GOD.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think the chow could be better and I think a fellow aut (ought) to be able to get a [deletion] pass [/deletion] three day pass once a month and a furlow (furlough) every six months
S64.Q97.Full: I think the chow could be better and I think a fellow aut (ought) to be able to get a [deletion] pass [/deletion] three day pass once a month and a furlow (furlough) every six months

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes so far, none.
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: A man can gripe in this Army can't he? Well, my non-coms will have none of it. How am I going to let off steam? [paragraph] I can't figure out why I haven't gone to college when all my friends here have left except a few for college. I don't have any luck I guess. Shipping orders are slowed up too much. [paragraph] I appreciate my training & like my work here. I know this army
S64.Q97.C_1: is a big organization and I feel that most everything is done to make me a better man & soldier.
S64.Q97.Full: A man can gripe in this Army can't he? Well, my non-coms will have none of it. How am I going to let off steam? [paragraph] I can't figure out why I haven't gone to college when all my friends here have left except a few for college. I don't have any luck I guess. Shipping orders are slowed up too much. [paragraph] I appreciate my training & like my work here. I know this army  is a big organization and I feel that most everything is done to make me a better man & soldier.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: These are my actual feelings as I see them but my experience as a soldier is limited to this particular field alone which I have a certain feeling of dislike for. Another location might change the light somewhat but as a whole I think it would be about the same anywhere.
S64.Q97.Full: These are my actual feelings as I see them but my experience as a soldier is limited to this particular field alone which I have a certain feeling of dislike for. Another location might change the light somewhat but as a whole I think it would be about the same anywhere.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q96.M_marginalia: I think all marrried men should have some time off to be with thier (their) wife and they would be a hell of a lot more satisfied.
S64.Q97.F: I think all married men should have some time off to be with their wifes, and they would be a hell of a lot more satisfied.
S64.Q97.Full: I think all married men should have some time off to be with their wifes, and they would be a hell of a lot more satisfied.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Feel that when a fellow has been in the army for a year or more and hasen't [hasn't] recieved [received] a furlough because of transfering [transferring] and when he has a good record that he should be given a furlough without having to pall [pal] around (suck around) with all the officers. He should be given one wether [whether] he asks for one or not. Because practically every bod wants a furlough even if they don't keep asking for them.
S64.Q97.C_1: Also a man that has been in the army for over a year, has a good record etc and an IQ of over 125 should at least get a P.F.C. rating or corporals. Instead of some fellow that has been in just a few months. I have been disappointed twice for promotions because of being transfered.
S64.Q97.Full: Feel that when a fellow has been in the army for a year or more and hasen't [hasn't] recieved [received] a furlough because of transfering [transferring] and when he has a good record that he should be given a furlough without having to pall [pal] around (suck around) with all the officers. He should be given one wether [whether] he asks for one or not. Because practically every bod wants a furlough even if they don't keep asking for them. Also a man that has been in the army for over a year, has a good record etc and an IQ of over 125 should at least get a P.F.C. rating or corporals. Instead of some fellow that has been in just a few months. I have been disappointed twice for promotions because of being transfered.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: One thing I have to say about this field is that this field isn't very well organized. It has pre-cadets and washouts in the same squadron which I think shouldn't be. We also have to take basic training over here even if we have had it before we got here. I think they should have a certain place for pre-cadets to go where they could go to a Pre- Preflight
S64.Q97.C_1: school and get some idea of what the real thing is like before they get to college. I also believe it is wrong to wash out 20 cadets out of a class of 120 if they only have room for 100 in the next school. They might hold a few over and let them continue to study, no one gets enough education. [paragraph] Enlisted men, wash outs and pre-cadets sleep in the same barracks here. The barracks are too crowded and some things are very unsatisfactory. [paragraph] The drill here is too hard on some of the boys. Because they fall out in formation every day. Some say several have died from heat here, I couldn't say for sure. The dust is awful and the sewage system isn't properly disposed of. The water is also bad and we don't get but one drink all afternoon.
S64.Q97.Full: One thing I have to say about this field is that this field isn't very well organized. It has pre-cadets and washouts in the same squadron which I think shouldn't be. We also have to take basic training over here even if we have had it before we got here. I think they should have a certain place for pre-cadets to go where they could go to a Pre- Preflight school and get some idea of what the real thing is like before they get to college. I also believe it is wrong to wash out 20 cadets out of a class of 120 if they only have room for 100 in the next school. They might hold a few over and let them continue to study, no one gets enough education. [paragraph] Enlisted men, wash outs and pre-cadets sleep in the same barracks here. The barracks are too crowded and some things are very unsatisfactory. [paragraph] The drill here is too hard on some of the boys. Because they fall out in formation every day. Some say several have died from heat here, I couldn't say for sure. The dust is awful and the sewage system isn't properly disposed of. The water is also bad and we don't get but one drink all afternoon.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I think soldiers could be moved thru [through] basic and on to specialist training much more rapidly than they are especially in the Air Corps. I was in as good shape 4 wks after arriving as I am now. We have been having he same thing over and
S64.Q97.C_1: over for quite some time now and it makes you wonder why aren't advancing instead of doing the same things over & over. I agree that there should be water discipline, but I can't see why the water can't be cool at chow all the time. All the other water we get, which is very little while on the field, is nothing short of hot. Also I can't understand why we can't get beer & Coca Colas more often at the P.X. All the post exchanges here are dreadfully overcrowded.
S64.Q97.Full: I think soldiers could be moved thru [through] basic and on to specialist training much more rapidly than they are especially in the Air Corps. I was in as good shape 4 wks after arriving as I am now. We have been having he same thing over and  over for quite some time now and it makes you wonder why aren't advancing instead of doing the same things over & over. I agree that there should be water discipline, but I can't see why the water can't be cool at chow all the time. All the other water we get, which is very little while on the field, is nothing short of hot. Also I can't understand why we can't get beer & Coca Colas more often at the P.X. All the post exchanges here are dreadfully overcrowded.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think a soldier should be shipped right away to a place where he can learn something more advanced, instead of keeping him in pasic training to kill time. A soldier shouldn't have to take basic-trianing more than once.
S64.Q97.Full: I think a soldier should be shipped right away to a place where he can learn something more advanced, instead of keeping him in pasic training to kill time. A soldier shouldn't have to take basic-trianing more than once.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I have not been the army long enough to have a furlough but think every soldier should have one at least every 6 months if not oftener while on home shores.
S64.Q97.Full: I have not been the army long enough to have a furlough but think every soldier should have one at least every 6 months if not oftener while on home shores.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: The morale of the Air Corps as a whole seems very good. But at this field extremely low. just why I don't know. It seems a waste of talent to take a man with years of experiences in a skilled trade, one which is essencial [essential] in the Air Corps and classifie him in something which he has no apptitude [aptitude] for only to have him ...
S64.Q97.C_1: and have to come back to be reclassified seems a waste of time and manpower.
S64.Q97.Full: The morale of the Air Corps as a whole seems very good. But at this field extremely low. just why I don't know. It seems a waste of talent to take a man with years of experiences in a skilled trade, one which is essencial [essential] in the Air Corps and classifie him in something which he has no apptitude [aptitude] for only to have him ... and have to come back to be reclassified seems a waste of time and manpower.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I feel that is a combat zone the army may be run with efficientcy [efficiency] , but here in this country the way the army is run is appalling. Thousands of men are doing nothing and learning nothing. Thousands more are being drafted all the time to increase the labor shortage. There is no place to send these men. All the schools are full and yet the men keep
S64.Q97.C_1: changing their civilian garb for khaki. Perhaps the army believes the survival of the fittest but I believe it is criminal to drill men all day long in the hot texas sun, knowing that one or two will die from heat prostrating, and tens faint from the heat. No one in the Army seems to be in a hurry to accomplish anything. Even with a knowledge that trained men are needed as never before every one seems to have the attitude of slow actions. Only in an emergency does this army act fast. I realize the tremendous expansion made since 1939, but still can not forgive the army for its inefficientcy [inefficiency] . The red tap [tape] which one has to go through in order to even see a sargent {sergeant} is considered by me to be a sad case. I believe the air corps should release it E.P. to the navy, and I believe the navy could make good pilots our of most of them. Is the army afraid the navy would make good pilots of them?
S64.Q97.Full: I feel that is a combat zone the army may be run with efficientcy [efficiency] , but here in this country the way the army is run is appalling. Thousands of men are doing nothing and learning nothing. Thousands more are being drafted all the time to increase the labor shortage. There is no place to send these men. All the schools are full and yet the men keep changing their civilian garb for khaki. Perhaps the army believes the survival of the fittest but I believe it is criminal to drill men all day long in the hot texas sun, knowing that one or two will die from heat prostrating, and tens faint from the heat. No one in the Army seems to be in a hurry to accomplish anything. Even with a knowledge that trained men are needed as never before every one seems to have the attitude of slow actions. Only in an emergency does this army act fast. I realize the tremendous expansion made since 1939, but still can not forgive the army for its inefficientcy [inefficiency] . The red tap [tape] which one has to go through in order to even see a sargent {sergeant} is considered by me to be a sad case. I believe the air corps should release it E.P. to the navy, and I believe the navy could make good pilots our of most of them. Is the army afraid the navy would make good pilots of them?

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: The Army's poor system of placing men has in many cases made neurotic soldiers. The other day a friend of mine who is a very intelligent fellow with a degree in Math was made a gunner, where an the other hand many men with high school educations are being sent to college.
S64.Q97.C_1: in the A.S.T.P. to learn Math because the Army says [unclear] it [/unclear] need men with education (what for to be [unclear] gemmtra [/unclear] ?)
S64.Q97.Full: The Army's poor system of placing men has in many cases made neurotic soldiers. The other day a friend of mine who is a very intelligent fellow with a degree in Math was made a gunner, where an the other hand many men with high school educations are being sent to college. in the A.S.T.P. to learn Math because the Army says [unclear] it [/unclear] need men with education (what for to be [unclear] gemmtra [/unclear] ?)

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: We are at a high altitude here. Calisthenics are good. But to make men double time or run an obstacle course when it feels like their damn heart is tearing right out of their bodies - is not right. It may and probably will permanently injure lots of them. Men shouldn't be switched from one job to another without reason. [paragraph] Formations & inspections should't be called & then cancelled after the company waits an hour or two for the officers to get out of bed.
S64.Q97.Full: We are at a high altitude here. Calisthenics are good. But to make men double time or run an obstacle course when it feels like their damn heart is tearing right out of their bodies - is not right. It may and probably will permanently injure lots of them. Men shouldn't be switched from one job to another without reason. [paragraph] Formations & inspections should't be called & then cancelled after the company waits an hour or two for the officers to get out of bed.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: The run around a soldier gets on applying for a furlough is absolutely a crying shame, and is a big factor in the dissatisfaction very evident, especially at tech schools. 6 months at a stretch is long enough to put up with GI life while the soldier is not in combat, and in any case he needs the chance to relax.
S64.Q97.Full: The run around a soldier gets on applying for a furlough is absolutely a crying shame, and is a big factor in the dissatisfaction very evident, especially at tech schools. 6 months at a stretch is long enough to put up with GI life while the soldier is not in combat, and in any case he needs the chance to relax.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: Too much waste going on and the soldiers time is not arranged whereas he can have a few hours to himself. There is always something to take up his time and then nobody knows what to do. As to the war in general the moral [morale] is good, but as to camps I think the moral [morale] had dropped. Too much chicken!
S64.Q97.Full: Too much waste going on and the soldiers time is not arranged whereas he can have a few hours to himself. There is always something to take up his time and then nobody knows what to do. As to the war in general the moral [morale] is good, but as to camps I think the moral [morale] had dropped. Too much chicken!

S64.Q97.F: This does not concern me directly, but it does others I have noticed that many man who washed out of Cadet training have been in the service. S64.Q97.C_1: course in a technical school of the Air Corps.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: Many of the officers in my squadron were taken by direct commission into the army and do not seem to be able to handle men without passing out threats of busts or restrictions to the post. Under this set up cooperation is not the best.
S64.Q97.Full: Many of the officers in my squadron were taken by direct commission into the army and do not seem to be able to handle men without passing out threats of busts or restrictions to the post. Under this set up cooperation is not the best.

S64.Q97.F: I would like to stay in after war that is if I could hold my rating[.] why take them a way [away] you got to have some one [someone] to depend on. I will stay if [I] can hold my rating & the're a lot that felt that way. Because jobs will be hard to get.
S64.Q97.Full: I would like to stay in after war that is if I could hold my rating[.] why take them a way [away] you got to have some one [someone] to depend on. I will stay if [I] can hold my rating & the're a lot that felt that way. Because jobs will be hard to get.

S64.Q97.F: Entirely too many officers have authority that they don't know how to use - it makes it hard on the enlisted man. Change gradually otherwise it's too rough on the men stationed at the field. Officers should not be made from civilian
S64.Q97.C_1: except in the case of [unclear] doctors [/unclear] . They [underline] do [/underline] [underline] not [/underline] know Army life and have too much authority. [paragraph] Limited service men should be placed in physically fit soldiers' jobs so they can be sent [unclear] accord [/unclear] to their best fitted job.

Change gradually otherwise it's too rough on the men stationed at the field. Officers should not be made from civilian except in the case of [unclear] doctors [/unclear] .
