S64.Q97.F: I think a soldier that lives within 200 miles of his camp should be given at least a 3 day pass every month. I think that excessive and cacti*** should be given the first thing in the early morning instead of late in evening.
S64.Q97.C_1: The field is run the wrong way to suit my opinion. They do too much of (the) same things and not enough of others.
S64.Q97.Full: I think a soldier that lives within 200 miles of his camp should be given at least a 3 day pass every month. I think that excessive and cacti*** should be given the first thing in the early morning instead of late in evening. The field is run the wrong way to suit my opinion. They do too much of (the) same things and not enough of others.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Running the Army is a very big and difficult task because of the size of the army. I don't know enough about military affairs and big business to know whether the army is men right or not. I don't think I would want to try to run it. Much of the time we do rill that we already know. We would be better off if we could be learning something new or something like that.
S64.Q97.Full: Running the Army is a very big and difficult task because of the size of the army. I don't know enough about military affairs and big business to know whether the army is men right or not. I don't think I would want to try to run it. Much of the time we do rill that we already know. We would be better off if we could be learning something new or something like that.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I don't like the army for two principal reasons: one, the non-coms and officers consider themselves more than the men, and because they hold too much of the info and on you and don't fail to use it; secondly, there's nothing around camp that the towns that I like to do. I like to dance but I haven't been to one good dance in 7 months I've been in the army. The USA hasn't enough girls for the soldiers, and down here in Texas
S64.Q97.C_1: there aren't any good private dance halls to go to. As a result I don't enjoy my spare time so much. It's very dull. [paragraph] As far as the war foes, I think we're playing a smart hand so far. I hardly believe we can trust England, or Russia for full co-operation even while the war is going on, and much less after it, because they'll be looking for a big grab somewhere. [paragraph] For being a soldier - I feel I've wasted the last seven months and would have done much more good back at my old defense job. [paragraph] At the present, prospects for learning a good trade for civilian life are good - but if they fall through, I'd say the war has done me more harm than good. I feel I have learned nothing so far; buth there is a good chance I will shortly.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't like the army for two principal reasons: one, the non-coms and officers consider themselves more than the men, and because they hold too much of the info and on you and don't fail to use it; secondly, there's nothing around camp that the towns that I like to do. I like to dance but I haven't been to one good dance in 7 months I've been in the army. The USA hasn't enough girls for the soldiers, and down here in Texas there aren't any good private dance halls to go to. As a result I don't enjoy my spare time so much. It's very dull. [paragraph] As far as the war foes, I think we're playing a smart hand so far. I hardly believe we can trust England, or Russia for full co-operation even while the war is going on, and much less after it, because they'll be looking for a big grab somewhere. [paragraph] For being a soldier - I feel I've wasted the last seven months and would have done much more good back at my old defense job. [paragraph] At the present, prospects for learning a good trade for civilian life are good - but if they fall through, I'd say the war has done me more harm than good. I feel I have learned nothing so far; buth there is a good chance I will shortly.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I like the army O.K. but did not get what I wanted when I came in . I think if things were changed up a little it would be better. There are boys that need to be where I am at in my place that could take on my job a lot better then I can and I would like to traid [trade]
S64.Q97.C_1: some day too. I thank things are going to chang in a short time now. I don't know but I thank if changing places help out a lot and I have chang once i my army life and how I would like to chang now.
S64.Q97.Full: I like the army O.K. but did not get what I wanted when I came in . I think if things were changed up a little it would be better. There are boys that need to be where I am at in my place that could take on my job a lot better then I can and I would like to traid [trade]  some day too. I thank things are going to chang in a short time now. I don't know but I thank if changing places help out a lot and I have chang once i my army life and how I would like to chang now.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I have no further remarks other than this - I think as a good many other enlisted men do that the government should look in to the affairs of every camp or post & check completely on how that particular post or camp is carrying on our rules. I know for a fact there is a lot going on that is definitely uneeded [unneeded] and the information as to such very seldom gets out of the post area & even if it does it very seldom get to the proper authorities. I see this from an enlisted mans point of view.
S64.Q97.Full: I have no further remarks other than this - I think as a good many other enlisted men do that the government should look in to the affairs of every camp or post & check completely on how that particular post or camp is carrying on our rules. I know for a fact there is a lot going on that is definitely uneeded [unneeded] and the information as to such very seldom gets out of the post area & even if it does it very seldom get to the proper authorities. I see this from an enlisted mans point of view.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I believe the Army Air Corps is are could be the best branch of the service but the officers of Sheppard Field are not doing their part to make it that way. The morale is lower in this camp than any place I have ever seen. We all know we have a hard job to make soldiers in a short time but the officers don't have to cuss the men out
S64.Q97.C_1: and refuse to give us plenty of water during hot weather. From 4:45 AM until 5:30 PM is too many hours for what we have to do in basic training. The location of Sheppard Field is bad enough with making it worse by not running the camp the best way possible.
S64.Q97.Full: I believe the Army Air Corps is are could be the best branch of the service but the officers of Sheppard Field are not doing their part to make it that way. The morale is lower in this camp than any place I have ever seen. We all know we have a hard job to make soldiers in a short time but the officers don't have to cuss the men out and refuse to give us plenty of water during hot weather. From 4:45 AM until 5:30 PM is too many hours for what we have to do in basic training. The location of Sheppard Field is bad enough with making it worse by not running the camp the best way possible.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I personally believe if camps like Sheppard Field were done away with the morale of the soldiers would be much better. To many unnecessary things are done here and too much time is wasted. We would all like to get into this thing so the ware would be ended sooner. But if the [insertion] whole [/insertion] Army was run like this camp the war would never be over.
S64.Q97.Full: I personally believe if camps like Sheppard Field were done away with the morale of the soldiers would be much better. To many unnecessary things are done here and too much time is wasted. We would all like to get into this thing so the ware would be ended sooner. But if the [insertion] whole [/insertion] Army was run like this camp the war would never be over.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: As a whole I believe the army is doing its best to make things as easy as possible and at the same time to give them a thorough training. [paragraph] However, here at Sheppard Field things are most inefficiently run. They have a great waste of man power here which should be put into use. It's a crazy idea to give veteran soldiers
S64.Q97.C_1: basic training over and over again. Its inefficient and at the same time its hard on the morale of the soldiers. All efforts should be made to correct this situation and keep these soldiers doing worthwhile things instead of useless things. It is just an all around waste the way it now stands.[paragraph] I think we've drafted too many men. It's hurting our war production. Many of these men should be back as civilians, working in war production. That's another mistake.[paragraph] The air corps is not giving cadets enough of a chance. They work out 50% but the Navy only works 10%. This situation should be corrected. Give the men more time and many more will come through successfully.
S64.Q97.Full: As a whole I believe the army is doing its best to make things as easy as possible and at the same time to give them a thorough training. [paragraph] However, here at Sheppard Field things are most inefficiently run. They have a great waste of man power here which should be put into use. It's a crazy idea to give veteran soldiers  basic training over and over again. Its inefficient and at the same time its hard on the morale of the soldiers. All efforts should be made to correct this situation and keep these soldiers doing worthwhile things instead of useless things. It is just an all around waste the way it now stands.[paragraph] I think we've drafted too many men. It's hurting our war production. Many of these men should be back as civilians, working in war production. That's another mistake.[paragraph] The air corps is not giving cadets enough of a chance. They work out 50% but the Navy only works 10%. This situation should be corrected. Give the men more time and many more will come through successfully.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: At some times, when it gets very hot, I think more attention should be paid to men who pass out, as very serious after effects may result through this neglect of officers in charge. In this respect a little more attention should be paid to the soldier.
S64.Q97.Full: At some times, when it gets very hot, I think more attention should be paid to men who pass out, as very serious after effects may result through this neglect of officers in charge. In this respect a little more attention should be paid to the soldier.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I think the officers should look into each man's abilities and in this way get promotions. In some cases the army hands out some pretty raw deals. I think such cases should have some consideration. God is the determining factor in this war and if our officers and leaders refuse ...
S64.Q97.C_1: to accept him the war will be prolonged I would much rather serve under a christian leader than any auther
S64.Q97.Full: I think the officers should look into each man's abilities and in this way get promotions. In some cases the army hands out some pretty raw deals. I think such cases should have some consideration. God is the determining factor in this war and if our officers and leaders refuse ... to accept him the war will be prolonged I would much rather serve under a christian leader than any auther

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I am at present stationed at Sheppard Field, Texas. This field is very over-crowded. The P.X.'s never have enough to go around and aren't nearly large enough. [paragraph] In my opinion the men aren't given enough rest. [paragraph] The food isn't too good, but could be worse. This fact could be overlooked if there were enough
S64.Q97.C_1: restaurants or P.X.'s on the field. Our dispensary personell [personnel] could be improved. Soldiers physical conditions aren't given enough attention. We have too much of the same type of physical training for the conditions existing in camp, as well as weather etc.
S64.Q97.Full: I am at present stationed at Sheppard Field, Texas. This field is very over-crowded. The P.X.'s never have enough to go around and aren't nearly large enough. [paragraph] In my opinion the men aren't given enough rest. [paragraph] The food isn't too good, but could be worse. This fact could be overlooked if there were enough  restaurants or P.X.'s on the field. Our dispensary personell [personnel] could be improved. Soldiers physical conditions aren't given enough attention. We have too much of the same type of physical training for the conditions existing in camp, as well as weather etc.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: Only been here 6 wks.
S64.Q97.F: If there were less politics in our gov't, we'd win the war a lot quicker & easier. There should be a fairer way to "wash out" cadets in their training -- at least a good reason.
S64.Q97.Full: If there were less politics in our gov't, we'd win the war a lot quicker & easier. There should be a fairer way to "wash out" cadets in their training -- at least a good reason.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: The worst thing is the men have no idea what is going to happen from one day to the next. Of course in battle nobody knows but in basic training when you fall out in the morning nobody has any idea what is to be done even the noncoms sometimes do not know. (Paragraph) Couldn't a schedule be made and followed so that we could plan on it. There has been several [unclear] [/unclear] made without continue [continue on next page]
S64.Q97.C_1: because nobody announced until the time to start to have the equipment required. [paragraph] The overcrowded conditions makes everybody irritated and disgusted. An army should be smaller and well trained rather than larger and know only how to drill. [paragraph] An army cannot fight without proper instruction with a gun and marksmanship. [paragraph] I am a para cadet and have talked to many eliminated cadets. They may not be good enough for pilots but they have brain power so why send them back to a field such as this to take basic training again when they know more about it than the non-coms in charge. [paragraph] Either shorten the basic training or find more to teach the men. Forget a lot of drill for parade, we are in this to fight not parade and the men get tired waiting to be shipped on to learn to fight. I do not know a man in here that does not try a little bit. Too many are becoming discouraged by having no program to follow and just staggering in the dark until we are shipped to a college.
S64.Q97.Full: The worst thing is the men have no idea what is going to happen from one day to the next. Of course in battle nobody knows but in basic training when you fall out in the morning nobody has any idea what is to be done even the noncoms sometimes do not know. (Paragraph) Couldn't a schedule be made and followed so that we could plan on it. There has been several [unclear] [/unclear] made without continue [continue on next page]  because nobody announced until the time to start to have the equipment required. [paragraph] The overcrowded conditions makes everybody irritated and disgusted. An army should be smaller and well trained rather than larger and know only how to drill. [paragraph] An army cannot fight without proper instruction with a gun and marksmanship. [paragraph] I am a para cadet and have talked to many eliminated cadets. They may not be good enough for pilots but they have brain power so why send them back to a field such as this to take basic training again when they know more about it than the non-coms in charge. [paragraph] Either shorten the basic training or find more to teach the men. Forget a lot of drill for parade, we are in this to fight not parade and the men get tired waiting to be shipped on to learn to fight. I do not know a man in here that does not try a little bit. Too many are becoming discouraged by having no program to follow and just staggering in the dark until we are shipped to a college.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think we should have a three day pass and every three months at least especially when you are close enough so you can go see some of your folks that is the reason boys go AWOL from their camp we never get a pass so we can go very gar from this camp to see any
S64.Q97.C_1: one except soldiers.
S64.Q97.Full: I think we should have a three day pass and every three months at least especially when you are close enough so you can go see some of your folks that is the reason boys go AWOL from their camp we never get a pass so we can go very gar from this camp to see any one except soldiers.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: It seems to [deletion] [/deletion] me that some good drill Instructor should drill the men instead of picking someone out of the Patoon to do it. Because the one they Pick out Usually don't know anything about drilling and a lot of them hasn't been in the army but a few days. The drill Instructor and NonCom usuall Pick someone out to drill the men
S64.Q97.C_1: then they make for a shade. I think it ruins the soldier to stay on the drill field for 6 hours a day as hot as it is now and as dusty as it is. [paragraph] I think you should be able to go and see your folks sometime on a weekend pass.
S64.Q97.Full: It seems to [deletion] [/deletion] me that some good drill Instructor should drill the men instead of picking someone out of the Patoon to do it. Because the one they Pick out Usually don't know anything about drilling and a lot of them hasn't been in the army but a few days. The drill Instructor and NonCom usuall Pick someone out to drill the men  then they make for a shade. I think it ruins the soldier to stay on the drill field for 6 hours a day as hot as it is now and as dusty as it is. [paragraph] I think you should be able to go and see your folks sometime on a weekend pass.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I don't really have many remarks about the Army. It's alright but Sheppard Field isn't especially the water. We also should get furloughs a little more often cause it's what causes so many A.W.O.L.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't really have many remarks about the Army. It's alright but Sheppard Field isn't especially the water. We also should get furloughs a little more often cause it's what causes so many A.W.O.L.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I thing [think] the Army is run allright [all right] considering the size of it. There are some things that are bad such as the classification. If the Army needs thirty men they pick out thirty it doesn't make any difference what they did in civilian life. I think the soldier should have more to say when he is being classified. He has to do the job.
S64.Q97.Full: I thing [think] the Army is run allright [all right] considering the size of it. There are some things that are bad such as the classification. If the Army needs thirty men they pick out thirty it doesn't make any difference what they did in civilian life. I think the soldier should have more to say when he is being classified. He has to do the job.

S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I sure do not like the army because it is making it hard for the farms to get help [deletion] to [/deletion] and they couldn't get me to get in the army [insertion] again [/insertion] if I would ever get out and one thing they could get me in Sheppard Field again if they had to.
S64.Q97.Full: I sure do not like the army because it is making it hard for the farms to get help [deletion] to [/deletion] and they couldn't get me to get in the army [insertion] again [/insertion] if I would ever get out and one thing they could get me in Sheppard Field again if they had to.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: The wastage of man hours and man power here at Sheppard Field is staggering and beyond belief. It is also true in other shipping and receiving centers. Men sent here are sometimes held for weeks and in some cases months for reclassification, are held here who might otherwise be rightly
S64.Q97.C_1: employed to be receiving valuable training of a technical nature else where. The machinery set up to take [unclear] care [/unclear] of this situation seems very [unclear] badly [/unclear] over loaded. Men, many of them have nine months to one year of service and more, and some men with overseas service drill daily while they wait weeks and sometimes months to be cleared from this field and be assigned to their respective duties with units badly in need of their services. These men have already been trained or partially trained and are merely waiting to be sent out. The man hours wasted hear would most certainly tip the scales toward a quicker victory. It is situations like this that make enlisted personell who had any sense of [unclear] resposibility [/unclear] , or who held a [unclear] repsonseable [/unclear] position in civilian life, look hopefully to higher headquarters for a remedy to this sorry state of affairs.
S64.Q97.Full: The wastage of man hours and man power here at Sheppard Field is staggering and beyond belief. It is also true in other shipping and receiving centers. Men sent here are sometimes held for weeks and in some cases months for reclassification, are held here who might otherwise be rightly employed to be receiving valuable training of a technical nature else where. The machinery set up to take [unclear] care [/unclear] of this situation seems very [unclear] badly [/unclear] over loaded. Men, many of them have nine months to one year of service and more, and some men with overseas service drill daily while they wait weeks and sometimes months to be cleared from this field and be assigned to their respective duties with units badly in need of their services. These men have already been trained or partially trained and are merely waiting to be sent out. The man hours wasted hear would most certainly tip the scales toward a quicker victory. It is situations like this that make enlisted personell who had any sense of [unclear] resposibility [/unclear] , or who held a [unclear] repsonseable [/unclear] position in civilian life, look hopefully to higher headquarters for a remedy to this sorry state of affairs.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I was drafted into the army, leaving a good home and a fine job and was about to be married. Naturally I did not want to come in to the army but while I am in, I am going to do everything in my power to make this a victory for our side. As I believe my service record thus far will show. However I do believe I should have been put
S64.Q97.C_1: into a category of my own skill instead of only having a choice of three trades to choose from and have to learn an entirely new skill [paragraph] I have seen very little of the army as I have only been in a little as two months but it seems that things are run entirely to (too) slow. Too much standing in line and waiting. [paragraph] Our basic training here seems to consist all most (almost) entirely of close order drill & physical training. This is fine except I beleive (believe) there is such a thing as too much. I do not beleive (believe) that when a man comes in from the drill field completely exausted (exhausted) that his training has done him any good. I beleive (believe) in doing a thing but not over doing it. I think weather conditions should play a important part in the training. Water deciplin (discipline) but not water starvation
S64.Q97.Full: I was drafted into the army, leaving a good home and a fine job and was about to be married. Naturally I did not want to come in to the army but while I am in, I am going to do everything in my power to make this a victory for our side. As I believe my service record thus far will show. However I do believe I should have been put into a category of my own skill instead of only having a choice of three trades to choose from and have to learn an entirely new skill [paragraph] I have seen very little of the army as I have only been in a little as two months but it seems that things are run entirely to (too) slow. Too much standing in line and waiting. [paragraph] Our basic training here seems to consist all most (almost) entirely of close order drill & physical training. This is fine except I beleive (believe) there is such a thing as too much. I do not beleive (believe) that when a man comes in from the drill field completely exausted (exhausted) that his training has done him any good. I beleive (believe) in doing a thing but not over doing it. I think weather conditions should play a important part in the training. Water deciplin (discipline) but not water starvation

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: [deletion] The army as an organization [/deletion] [paragraph] The one thing I do not like about the army is, you get hollered at if you do or don't do anything wrong. I was drafted & the first thing I heard when I got of the bus at the Induction center was somebody hollering his head off making us run up to him & put our bags down.
S64.Q97.C_1: You are also treated like a bunch of pigs instead of men. The food I have eaten so far has been lousy. We have to get up too early in this camp & get thru too late.
S64.Q97.Full: [deletion] The army as an organization [/deletion] [paragraph] The one thing I do not like about the army is, you get hollered at if you do or don't do anything wrong. I was drafted & the first thing I heard when I got of the bus at the Induction center was somebody hollering his head off making us run up to him & put our bags down. You are also treated like a bunch of pigs instead of men. The food I have eaten so far has been lousy. We have to get up too early in this camp & get thru too late.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: The army is a thing I would like to have if I was in the condition to do so but how I feel know & the doctor of the army which supposed to be the best can't take good care of all they don't give a heck about. and I think I do lot better in my farm helping my parent.
S64.Q97.Full: The army is a thing I would like to have if I was in the condition to do so but how I feel know & the doctor of the army which supposed to be the best can't take good care of all they don't give a heck about. and I think I do lot better in my farm helping my parent.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Well, since I'm here at Replacement Center, Sheppard Field, I think they should cut down the close order drill to 2 hrs. a day. Some of the Master Sargs. & Tech. Sarg., Corporals, P.A.C. come in from Field Artillery & etc. and are taking the basic training as any other rookie and I don't think it is fair for them because it only holds up their training for combat duty & etc.
S64.Q97.C_1: And as far as the Indians are concern we sometimes wonder what we're getting out of this war or are we so darn dumb so as to be gyped by the white man? What I'm trying to get is this - If the government could give some land to us that the white man is not using I'm very sure we will make the best of it. But since they just send men around to restore the soil by blocking that [unclear] [/unclear] it will never work. So as far as I'm concern I'd fight for this even if I have to run the highways and start scalping. This is after the war. So far I haven't heard anything of a promise ([underline] from [/underline] ) the white man to the Indian in this present war.
S64.Q97.Full: Well, since I'm here at Replacement Center, Sheppard Field, I think they should cut down the close order drill to 2 hrs. a day. Some of the Master Sargs. & Tech. Sarg., Corporals, P.A.C. come in from Field Artillery & etc. and are taking the basic training as any other rookie and I don't think it is fair for them because it only holds up their training for combat duty & etc. And as far as the Indians are concern we sometimes wonder what we're getting out of this war or are we so darn dumb so as to be gyped by the white man? What I'm trying to get is this - If the government could give some land to us that the white man is not using I'm very sure we will make the best of it. But since they just send men around to restore the soil by blocking that [unclear] [/unclear] it will never work. So as far as I'm concern I'd fight for this even if I have to run the highways and start scalping. This is after the war. So far I haven't heard anything of a promise ([underline] from [/underline] ) the white man to the Indian in this present war.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Yes I have some here at Sheppard Field we get up at 4:45 which is O.K. but when we have close order drill from 4:00 to 11:30 go to the barracks and work on beds or something until chow time then just as soon as we eat go to the cow pasture (drill field) and have close drill until 3:30 again Then we have physical Training from 3:30 until 5:30. We could have run Physical
S64.Q97.C_1: training in the morning and then drill until 4:00 in the evening which would be a lot better. It is hot down here. About 118 degrees now. Since training we have in the evening now has killed many of a boy here. It is not [deletion] that [/deletion] necessary to drive a man that hard when it is so hot. [paragraph] Oh! Yes about chow don't you think some of the other Armys would like some of this pork we have every meal. So much pork in hot weather or any other time isn't good for a body. They ought to know that. [paragraph] There is one good thing that the boys go for and that is the camp shows. They are really O.K.
S64.Q97.Full: Yes I have some here at Sheppard Field we get up at 4:45 which is O.K. but when we have close order drill from 4:00 to 11:30 go to the barracks and work on beds or something until chow time then just as soon as we eat go to the cow pasture (drill field) and have close drill until 3:30 again Then we have physical Training from 3:30 until 5:30. We could have run Physical  training in the morning and then drill until 4:00 in the evening which would be a lot better. It is hot down here. About 118 degrees now. Since training we have in the evening now has killed many of a boy here. It is not [deletion] that [/deletion] necessary to drive a man that hard when it is so hot. [paragraph] Oh! Yes about chow don't you think some of the other Armys would like some of this pork we have every meal. So much pork in hot weather or any other time isn't good for a body. They ought to know that. [paragraph] There is one good thing that the boys go for and that is the camp shows. They are really O.K.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: The Army does a man lots of good in many respects such as good behaviour, discipline etc. But in some places where the living conditions are as bad as they are in this particular field it really turns a fellow against the army. I do think a soldier should be treated as a human being and not as a dog after all he is fighting for what he thinks is right.
S64.Q97.Full: The Army does a man lots of good in many respects such as good behaviour, discipline etc. But in some places where the living conditions are as bad as they are in this particular field it really turns a fellow against the army. I do think a soldier should be treated as a human being and not as a dog after all he is fighting for what he thinks is right.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: For further remarks my are the army is a great life. I like it but I don't like Sheppard field. They feed is very poor here it could be a lot better and they could let us have a little more time off than they do. And as for the cow pasture here I don't think all the stuff you get out there is not necessary.
S64.Q97.C_1: especlly [especially] the sand that blows out there and the drinking water here is awfully [awful] they could have coolers in the barracks would help a lot. There are to [too] many of us here on the field and they are rushing thing [things] threw [through] to [too] quick. if most of us every [ever] gets out of Sheppard field it will seem like a vacation. We do to [too] much close order drill here that is not needed.

They feed is very poor here it could be a lot better and they could let us have a little more time off than they do. document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I don't think our Army is runnd [run] efficiently enough . You waste too much time on things that don't ammount [amount] to very much. Good [unclear] chal [/unclear] our officers are not very good leaders for men. There are lot very good men who would make good officers and noncoms [Non-Commissioned Officers] who don't get a chanch ] [chance] . On the average, good deal of the men
S64.Q97.C_1: are classified wrong. The soldiers placed in jobs they like will do lot more and will like the army better. More passes and furloughs should be granted. The men would rather work hard during the week, but like to get pass on the weekends. They relax and get away from army life. When they get back they work better.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't think our Army is runnd [run] efficiently enough . You waste too much time on things that don't ammount [amount] to very much. Good [unclear] chal [/unclear] our officers are not very good leaders for men. The soldiers placed in jobs they like will do lot more and will like the army better. More passes and furloughs should be granted. The men would rather work hard during the week, but like to get pass on the weekends. They relax and get away from army life. When they get back they work better.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Well in the first place I think a soldier living close to home will work and learn a lot more in the Army. Because he will want to get passes to go home on weekends and he knows if he doesn't do right he wont get a pss and if you see your family quite often then you get a chance to know just what your fighting for. Thats the way I feel about it and I know plenty of the boys here feel
S64.Q97.C_1: the same because I talk to them. Sure it will be hard to leave them when you go across. So what it will make you pretty mad at those Japs and Germans and then thats when you have more fight in you when your mad. Being away from home like this it only makes us mad that we got drafted and instead of being mad at the Japs and Germans we are only mad at the U.S. Goverment for taking us so far from home.
S64.Q97.Full: Well in the first place I think a soldier living close to home will work and learn a lot more in the Army. Because he will want to get passes to go home on weekends and he knows if he doesn't do right he wont get a pss and if you see your family quite often then you get a chance to know just what your fighting for. Thats the way I feel about it and I know plenty of the boys here feel  the same because I talk to them. Sure it will be hard to leave them when you go across. So what it will make you pretty mad at those Japs and Germans and then thats when you have more fight in you when your mad. Being away from home like this it only makes us mad that we got drafted and instead of being mad at the Japs and Germans we are only mad at the U.S. Goverment for taking us so far from home.

S64.Q97.F: All I can say is that I would like to go home more often than I do.

S64.Q97.F: if the U.S. want [wants] a good army they should put men in these camp [camps] who know what they are doing and men who understand boy's [boys] , and I say [deletion] Buy [/deletion] because I am in the first teenage group. Men who help and are willing to work with them. By this I mean the N.C.O. [non-commissioned officer] are not willing to help us, But who are think of there [their] own stripe and not How hard and fast they work the men,
S64.Q97.C_1: We have many N.C.O. who say a rifle bore is not clean after you have been cleaning it for 1/2 hour and you take it to a officer and he say it is a swell job. What [unclear] our [/unclear] young fellow need is a little credit and we will work harder and make much better soldiers. If we do something wrong, if they would left us explain instead of putting [unclear] us [/unclear] on K.P. for a week they would see that we would work better [unclear] to [/unclear] . When I was home I had as many as 25 men under me at a time. I didn't yell at them when I wanted something done. I asked them and I got more work out of them, then the [unclear] [/unclear] does any of its men! Many times at noon after our lunch (which is most of the time not fit for a dog) when we are laying in our bunks the NCO will pick the men who are resting most peachy [unclear] to [/unclear] mop the barracks. We hardly ever have a week night out. if I had anything to say about it I would work my men easyier and give them more time to them self; but what I say is just water over a dam.

S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Yes I should think that some one would see what they can do to get this [unclear] lesson [/unclear] across so they can get a crack at them damn Japs or Germans. I would rather fight the Germans because they are more civilized then the Japs. They at least are out where you can see them and not hiding so that they can stab you in the back when you go by their
S64.Q97.C_1: fore [for] myself I would like to get my hands on that god damn [unclear] [/unclear] to see what makes him tick and I'll bet I would find ice water in his vains.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: One thing I notice at this camp, the grub on a hole is lousy. Recreation isn't what it should be, and on the whole there's a lot of detail handed out that I don't think is necessary.
S64.Q97.Full: One thing I notice at this camp, the grub on a hole is lousy. Recreation isn't what it should be, and on the whole there's a lot of detail handed out that I don't think is necessary.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: All that I ask for is to be sent over seas [overseas] so I can settle my score with some of those yellow Japs [Japanese] . I never liked to fight but since we were stabbed in the back my fighting spirits are sure as hell aroused.
S64.Q97.Full: All that I ask for is to be sent over seas [overseas] so I can settle my score with some of those yellow Japs [Japanese] . I never liked to fight but since we were stabbed in the back my fighting spirits are sure as hell aroused.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: A soldier should be closer to his home in most cases when he is training because he likes to see his parents relation and wife or girl as much as possible before he goes. It is in a good many times the last time he ever will see his home. I know a soldier would work harder then because he can see his home and know what he is fighting for.
S64.Q97.C_1: As I understand the government is letting a lot of men being washed out of flying school. If they can't pass the physical and mental exam the army says is so good why don't the high so called officials or higher rank in there (their) desk jobs in Washington at least see to it that the boys are made pilots without wasting the boy's time and the public's tax money. The public would be saved a lot and a lot more boys time would be saved. Lots of them have a grudge to get even or something in the same order. This is supposed to be a free country full of (the) chance to succeed and the government should help all these boys driving the war so they can be of a great help when our victory is complete the are the future men to run this country.
S64.Q97.Full: A soldier should be closer to his home in most cases when he is training because he likes to see his parents relation and wife or girl as much as possible before he goes. It is in a good many times the last time he ever will see his home. I know a soldier would work harder then because he can see his home and know what he is fighting for. As I understand the government is letting a lot of men being washed out of flying school. If they can't pass the physical and mental exam the army says is so good why don't the high so called officials or higher rank in there (their) desk jobs in Washington at least see to it that the boys are made pilots without wasting the boy's time and the public's tax money. The public would be saved a lot and a lot more boys time would be saved. Lots of them have a grudge to get even or something in the same order. This is supposed to be a free country full of (the) chance to succeed and the government should help all these boys driving the war so they can be of a great help when our victory is complete the are the future men to run this country.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Just a few comments. I personally and many of my comrades get disgusted many times because our training is rushed and very seldom run on schedule. We are rushed and never have any time much to ourselves always detail or appointments to go some place. We have never gotten any 3 day leaves and our furlough time is short only 5 days at home. Don't get home enough. Some fellows get it all
S64.Q97.C_1: all the breaks & favors & some get nothing but detail. I don't like the infantry and feel as though I could be happier & more suited in a better place. Seems sometimes the days never end. We want the proper training before being rushed into combat, & not just half stuff. As a whole we get good food, which means a lot, kind of get tired of the same thing over & over. We have a lot of fun & I'll sum the army up as a pretty fair place to be at the present state of condition the world is in.
S64.Q97.Full: Just a few comments. I personally and many of my comrades get disgusted many times because our training is rushed and very seldom run on schedule. We are rushed and never have any time much to ourselves always detail or appointments to go some place. We have never gotten any 3 day leaves and our furlough time is short only 5 days at home. Don't get home enough. Some fellows get it all all the breaks & favors & some get nothing but detail. I don't like the infantry and feel as though I could be happier & more suited in a better place. Seems sometimes the days never end. We want the proper training before being rushed into combat, & not just half stuff. As a whole we get good food, which means a lot, kind of get tired of the same thing over & over. We have a lot of fun & I'll sum the army up as a pretty fair place to be at the present state of condition the world is in.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I believe that a lot of men are not too well suited for their jobs; I also believe that the country should solve its post war plans and make them more concrete, Britain is doing a far better job at this than we are. [paragraph] More and better equipment to train with is badly needed.
S64.Q97.Full: I believe that a lot of men are not too well suited for their jobs; I also believe that the country should solve its post war plans and make them more concrete, Britain is doing a far better job at this than we are. [paragraph] More and better equipment to train with is badly needed.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think a soldier as young as me should have not less than 12 mts. of training for their young minds forget a lot of thing, they have to know in order to defend themselves. [paragraph] Another thing I don't think is right is to take farm hand from frams. I know and everybody knows we need food + plenty to win this war, but we won't get it if we don't leave these farm hands
S64.Q97.C_1: on the farm. Some say anybody can do farming, but that is far from true. I know a lot of farms that can't be worked for shortage of workers. I also know that there are a lot of boys in the Army from farms that could do more for their county, then they can by being a soldier. [paragraph] I notice here in our [unclear] [/unclear] mess hall we sometimes run mighty short on food. Today at two meals we did have any butter. [paragraph] That about all I know right now.
S64.Q97.Full: I think a soldier as young as me should have not less than 12 mts. of training for their young minds forget a lot of thing, they have to know in order to defend themselves. [paragraph] Another thing I don't think is right is to take farm hand from frams. I know and everybody knows we need food + plenty to win this war, but we won't get it if we don't leave these farm hands on the farm. Some say anybody can do farming, but that is far from true. I know a lot of farms that can't be worked for shortage of workers. I also know that there are a lot of boys in the Army from farms that could do more for their county, then they can by being a soldier. [paragraph] I notice here in our [unclear] [/unclear] mess hall we sometimes run mighty short on food. Today at two meals we did have any butter. [paragraph] That about all I know right now.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: In regard to question no. 28, I don't think the army goes through any trouble at all to classify the majority of men as to where they would best fit into the army. They put the men where they need them most of the time. [paragraph] There is absolutely too much time wasted in the army teaching the men how to shine a mens kit or
S64.Q97.C_1: shine their shoes for an inspection or [unclear] [/unclear] . I think that most of the inspections and parades should be cut out and that time used to teach the men something that will be useful to them in combat. I don't believe in marching men every day on these short marches [deletion] everyday [/deletion] it tires the men out too much and they don't grasp the rest of their training. They are physically too tired.
S64.Q97.Full: In regard to question no. 28, I don't think the army goes through any trouble at all to classify the majority of men as to where they would best fit into the army. They put the men where they need them most of the time. [paragraph] There is absolutely too much time wasted in the army teaching the men how to shine a mens kit or  shine their shoes for an inspection or [unclear] [/unclear] . I think that most of the inspections and parades should be cut out and that time used to teach the men something that will be useful to them in combat. I don't believe in marching men every day on these short marches [deletion] everyday [/deletion] it tires the men out too much and they don't grasp the rest of their training. They are physically too tired.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I believe that we should be given more time to rest. So far it's been very tough. The [unclear] [/unclear] were rotten. The training was given to fast to learn. Some of the officers should be checked up on due to the treatment given there men. (We're US soldiers not dogs.
S64.Q97.Full: I believe that we should be given more time to rest. So far it's been very tough. The [unclear] [/unclear] were rotten. The training was given to fast to learn. Some of the officers should be checked up on due to the treatment given there men. (We're US soldiers not dogs.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: I have had my fair share of passes, [deletion] but [/deletion] [deletion] not [/deletion] [deletion] of [/deletion] [deletion] furloughs [/deletion]
S64.Q97.F: I believe that during basic training subjects are shifted to quickly, instead of having a half day or a day, one period may be devoted to that subject, then a week, maybe two week elapse before that subject is taught. Personally it is hard to absorb subjects that way. ---- I think that soldier, should be given more time to themselves -- If you are lucky enough to have a
S64.Q97.C_1: Sunday off. You can't stay around your barracks and get some needed rest, if you do you are sure to get details. [paragraph] Lights are shut off too quickly in the barracks, they go off at 9 o'clock. This discourages letter writing what is badly needed on the home front. Then too we are not given any time for reading newspapers. It is impossible to find out how the war is coming, although at times we do see a headline.
S64.Q97.Full: I believe that during basic training subjects are shifted to quickly, instead of having a half day or a day, one period may be devoted to that subject, then a week, maybe two week elapse before that subject is taught. Personally it is hard to absorb subjects that way. ---- I think that soldier, should be given more time to themselves -- If you are lucky enough to have a  Sunday off. You can't stay around your barracks and get some needed rest, if you do you are sure to get details. [paragraph] Lights are shut off too quickly in the barracks, they go off at 9 o'clock. This discourages letter writing what is badly needed on the home front. Then too we are not given any time for reading newspapers. It is impossible to find out how the war is coming, although at times we do see a headline.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: My opinion is that it should be possible for most soldiers to be stationed in there own state or close to it and it would avoid many AWOL. Another thing is that hours are too long for this hot wheather [weather] .
S64.Q97.Full: My opinion is that it should be possible for most soldiers to be stationed in there own state or close to it and it would avoid many AWOL. Another thing is that hours are too long for this hot wheather [weather] .

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: but nobody get many except officers and NCO's.
S64.Q97.F: I think a man in the army likes a little time to himself once in a while I know I do, and I feel lucky to come down and answer this even though it is after working hours. No one likes to work 16 hours a day 7 days a week but we do get a Sunday of calisthenics every once a month. I thought this was the army not a Government Prison. the Prisoners of War are used and fed better than we are
S64.Q97.Full: I think a man in the army likes a little time to himself once in a while I know I do, and I feel lucky to come down and answer this even though it is after working hours. No one likes to work 16 hours a day 7 days a week but we do get a Sunday of calisthenics every once a month. I thought this was the army not a Government Prison. the Prisoners of War are used and fed better than we are

S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Well I sure would like to get out of the ground forces and get into something that I could stand that did not hurt me so much.
S64.Q97.Full: Well I sure would like to get out of the ground forces and get into something that I could stand that did not hurt me so much.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Other/No answer
S64.Q97.F: I think a married man has no place in the army, I mean if he marry five years or better, He can't do more in army work than he can do in the army. A married man always worries and has his home on his mind almost all the time. He get more lonesome than the rest in the army. It is alright if you are single and below the age
S64.Q97.C_1: of twenty seven or eight. But older than that you are not much good anymore.
S64.Q97.Full: I think a married man has no place in the army, I mean if he marry five years or better, He can't do more in army work than he can do in the army. A married man always worries and has his home on his mind almost all the time. He get more lonesome than the rest in the army. It is alright if you are single and below the age  of twenty seven or eight. But older than that you are not much good anymore.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: In regards to mail call - I believe too much time is wasted at mail call. Mail should be sorted according to [unclear] brutments [/unclear] or barracks and the noncom (non-commissioned officer) in each barrack should distribute them. Time is valuable in the Army & a soldier could use that time for studying or brushing up on some work of some kind.
S64.Q97.Full: In regards to mail call - I believe too much time is wasted at mail call. Mail should be sorted according to [unclear] brutments [/unclear] or barracks and the noncom (non-commissioned officer) in each barrack should distribute them. Time is valuable in the Army & a soldier could use that time for studying or brushing up on some work of some kind.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I believe a soldier from the northern states should be trained up north and vice versa with the south, for change of climate is very unhealthy, for it's too rapid. Also the south is a great deal too hot for any training especially in the summer.
S64.Q97.Full: I believe a soldier from the northern states should be trained up north and vice versa with the south, for change of climate is very unhealthy, for it's too rapid. Also the south is a great deal too hot for any training especially in the summer.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I believe this country is doing more for its soldiers than any other country. It is my hope they keep up work like this service. I have experience and training in office work. While I wanted to get into the Finance Department - I landed in the Ordnance Department where there is also a little chance for me use this experience. Thank you!
S64.Q97.Full: I believe this country is doing more for its soldiers than any other country. It is my hope they keep up work like this service. I have experience and training in office work. While I wanted to get into the Finance Department - I landed in the Ordnance Department where there is also a little chance for me use this experience. Thank you!

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: As a whole I like the Army real well. The Army is what you make it. You can make it a nice place. You must adjust yourself to your surrounding.
S64.Q97.Full: As a whole I like the Army real well. The Army is what you make it. You can make it a nice place. You must adjust yourself to your surrounding.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Let's get this damn war over as quickly as possible so we call can get back to normalcy one again!
S64.Q97.Full: Let's get this damn war over as quickly as possible so we call can get back to normalcy one again!

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Other/No answer
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: I have not ask for any.
S64.Q97.F: I love my wife and would like to see her more often. I am a long ways from home and a furlough would be awfull short.
S64.Q97.Full: I love my wife and would like to see her more often. I am a long ways from home and a furlough would be awfull short.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: In every outfit I have been in a majority of the non-coms have been the "bully" type. I disapprove heartily of this type of officiating; and I suspect that non-coms are too often choosen [insertion] chosen [/insertion] from fear rather than for their true leadership abilities. Team work is not stressed enough in the Army.
S64.Q97.Full: In every outfit I have been in a majority of the non-coms have been the "bully" type. I disapprove heartily of this type of officiating; and I suspect that non-coms are too often choosen [insertion] chosen [/insertion] from fear rather than for their true leadership abilities. Team work is not stressed enough in the Army.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: All I can say is that I am in the Army & will do the best I can & hope this affair is short so I can get bock home & perform my duties. The Army life is not bod Im in a very good company & they are treating us [unclear] fine [/unclear] they don't expect you to go over your head but I had my mind set from the Quartermaster Corps Div.
S64.Q97.Full: All I can say is that I am in the Army & will do the best I can & hope this affair is short so I can get bock home & perform my duties. The Army life is not bod Im in a very good company & they are treating us [unclear] fine [/unclear] they don't expect you to go over your head but I had my mind set from the Quartermaster Corps Div.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Other/No answer
S64.Q97.F: On question #95 I have not been in the Army for a furlong. But believe a furlong every 5 months should be plenty. As for passes I have never wanted one yet but they seem pretty easy to get for the ones that want one.
S64.Q97.Full: On question #95 I have not been in the Army for a furlong. But believe a furlong every 5 months should be plenty. As for passes I have never wanted one yet but they seem pretty easy to get for the ones that want one.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: There's one thing and that is a (an) officer or non-commission (non-commissioned) officer should serve a year as a private to see how other men live and learn different ways of men and pick up new tricks and most of all to know what you are doing without having to look in a book all the time.
S64.Q97.Full: There's one thing and that is a (an) officer or non-commission (non-commissioned) officer should serve a year as a private to see how other men live and learn different ways of men and pick up new tricks and most of all to know what you are doing without having to look in a book all the time.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I don't believe that American labor so essential in our winning this war gives a damn whatever we do or not. The coal situation proves this. Not enough drastic action was taken or is being taken to remedy this. [paragraph] The powers that be in Washington seem to play too much politics in this matter or are afraid to take any action because they are afraid of these
S64.Q97.C_1: political standing. I personally believe that the reason labor is getting away [insertion] with [/insertion] so much is because the politicians let them do so, so as to get their votes which constitutes their [unclear] [/unclear] success in the war effort is of secondary importance with the politicians in this matter. This is and will prolong the war more in my opinion. I don't blame the workers as much as I do the leaders in Washington for this condition. [paragraph] If the soldiers are asked and ordered to give up their lives for their country I believe that the politicians should be made to give up their prejudices.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't believe that American labor so essential in our winning this war gives a damn whatever we do or not. The coal situation proves this. Not enough drastic action was taken or is being taken to remedy this. [paragraph] The powers that be in Washington seem to play too much politics in this matter or are afraid to take any action because they are afraid of these  political standing. I personally believe that the reason labor is getting away [insertion] with [/insertion] so much is because the politicians let them do so, so as to get their votes which constitutes their [unclear] [/unclear] success in the war effort is of secondary importance with the politicians in this matter. This is and will prolong the war more in my opinion. I don't blame the workers as much as I do the leaders in Washington for this condition. [paragraph] If the soldiers are asked and ordered to give up their lives for their country I believe that the politicians should be made to give up their prejudices.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I am trying to be a good soldier and knowing the job we have to do, Im going to do my best so we can all get back home soon
S64.Q97.Full: I am trying to be a good soldier and knowing the job we have to do, Im going to do my best so we can all get back home soon

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I think there is too much time wasted in useless training. The training period could be much shorter. This would produce more efficient soldiers as they would not lose interest in what they were doing. I think a greater effort should be made to place men in the positions where they could do their best work. I think the army could profit form more suggestions from the men. Also, the
S64.Q97.C_1: officers and non-coms should be more willing to answer questions.
S64.Q97.Full: I think there is too much time wasted in useless training. The training period could be much shorter. This would produce more efficient soldiers as they would not lose interest in what they were doing. I think a greater effort should be made to place men in the positions where they could do their best work. I think the army could profit form more suggestions from the men. Also, the officers and non-coms should be more willing to answer questions.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: If we fellows in the army are wiling to make any sacrifice to be a good soldiers I think certain groups would or should be willing to do the same. If no one has the guts to really step down on these strikers just turn them over to us. I think also that the political parties should remember that this is "war" and forget their bickering and get down to business. [paragraph] A lot of men are in here who are [unclear] ab- [/unclear]
S64.Q97.C_1: solutely unfit for any service and are only being a detriment to themselves as well as others. The main object of almost all my buddies is to get this damn job over with as quick as possible and get home again. sitting and getting sent here and then there is of no help to anyone that I can see. In my own case I was sent to a civilian school to learn a trade that I made a very good living from for nine years. Now we are all set to go anywhere and any place but where is our equipment. If we don't get our equipment how in hell can a company of men learn anything of the job expected of us. We drill and such but we are a mobile unit without equipment. If it goes on much longer as it has been, there is going to be one good outfit that won't be worth the powder to blow them hell. Our officers, C.O. are 100% and is all we need is the proper equipment and arms to be a real fighting outfit. Let's see what can be done about it? The quicker the better.
S64.Q97.Full: If we fellows in the army are wiling to make any sacrifice to be a good soldiers I think certain groups would or should be willing to do the same. If no one has the guts to really step down on these strikers just turn them over to us. I think also that the political parties should remember that this is "war" and forget their bickering and get down to business. [paragraph] A lot of men are in here who are [unclear] ab- [/unclear]  solutely unfit for any service and are only being a detriment to themselves as well as others. The main object of almost all my buddies is to get this damn job over with as quick as possible and get home again. sitting and getting sent here and then there is of no help to anyone that I can see. In my own case I was sent to a civilian school to learn a trade that I made a very good living from for nine years. Now we are all set to go anywhere and any place but where is our equipment. If we don't get our equipment how in hell can a company of men learn anything of the job expected of us. We drill and such but we are a mobile unit without equipment. If it goes on much longer as it has been, there is going to be one good outfit that won't be worth the powder to blow them hell. Our officers, C.O. are 100% and is all we need is the proper equipment and arms to be a real fighting outfit. Let's see what can be done about it? The quicker the better.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page

S64.Q97.F: Why not try and make it possible for married men especially fathers to have an opportunity to see their families, at least for a day, about every 3 months. I know single men should have the same privilege but dont forget, single men can enjoy the company of girls near the Camp whereas any decent father and most of them are long to get a chance to visit home and see his kids and personally I believe they would be much better soldiers if it were possible
S64.Q97.C_1: [unclear] [/unclear] [unclear] needs [/unclear] to be arranged.

I know single men should have the same privilege but dont forget, single men can enjoy the company of girls near the Camp whereas any decent father and most of them are long to get a chance to visit home and see his kids and personally I believe they would be much better soldiers if it were possible [unclear] [/unclear] [unclear] needs [/unclear] to be arranged.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Conditions in general could be greatly improved.
S64.Q97.Full: Conditions in general could be greatly improved.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: The Army Classification system could in my opinion be better. Men could be placed from the start of their army life in jobs where their ability & previous training will be of more value to the army than is actually used.
S64.Q97.Full: The Army Classification system could in my opinion be better. Men could be placed from the start of their army life in jobs where their ability & previous training will be of more value to the army than is actually used.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: The bus service we have in this camp is very poor and should be remodeled at once by having more buses & not crowding of passengers. [paragraph] And the city of Starke Fla should be given a thorough going over by proper officials as to high prices of food and rent way too high for soldiers to pay. The Post Exchange should have much better tailor and laundry service. Cleans very poor.
S64.Q97.C_1: and the price charged is way too high for the kind of work done by them at the present time. Clothes come back from cleaners still dirty and no crease in them. But if you say anything about it, they give you no consideration just an argument, and if articles are [unclear] [/unclear] take too long for them to make them good.
S64.Q97.Full: The bus service we have in this camp is very poor and should be remodeled at once by having more buses & not crowding of passengers. [paragraph] And the city of Starke Fla should be given a thorough going over by proper officials as to high prices of food and rent way too high for soldiers to pay. The Post Exchange should have much better tailor and laundry service. Cleans very poor. and the price charged is way too high for the kind of work done by them at the present time. Clothes come back from cleaners still dirty and no crease in them. But if you say anything about it, they give you no consideration just an argument, and if articles are [unclear] [/unclear] take too long for them to make them good.

S64.Q97.F: Things would be better back home if I hadn't got drafted in the army because I [unclear] [/unclear] needed on the form it would have been more important then what I am doing I was not needed bad. That is my idea about it.
S64.Q97.Full: Things would be better back home if I hadn't got drafted in the army because I [unclear] [/unclear] needed on the form it would have been more important then what I am doing I was not needed bad. That is my idea about it.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M_marginalia: Money is coming in - Dad works 7 days a week - but its going out again because of high cost of living.
S64.Q97.F: Salutes shouldn't be given in town or off post - the EM run the officers up the back streets. The best officers treat their men as men, get the best out of them, overlook some little things and take care of their boys - their boys take care of them. Some officers haven't learned this - they should be relieved. The food issued is good - too many cooks ruin it, too many mess halls are dirty, too many
S64.Q97.C_1: K.P.'s [Kitchen Patrols] are crummy. Inspections should be made [underline] without [/underline] any prior warning - too many outfits was dressed up for inspections - let the inspectors walk in unannounced and find conditions as they are every day. Do away with Sat. [Saturday] AM inspection. [paragraph] Most men are not in the Army for the money they make, but did you ever try to live [insertion] with your wife [/insertion] on 100 a month near an Army post - and that a sgt's [sergeant's] (4th grade) pay - what about a buck pvt [private] or cpls [corporals] . [paragraph] Army towns should be cleaned up of clip joints that charge 200,300, 400, & 500 for 5ct [cent] & 10 ct [cent] store mdss [merchandise] - jewelry that dime stores sold for 25 ct[cents] they get $3.50. Those stores are boom town hustlers that are out to take the soldier. Transportation to & from Army camps is often controlled by one or two companies and often the service is poor. [paragraph] Commission officers should mix more with the men - not try and pull rank with a school solution - they can be wrong - their [they're] human.
S64.Q97.Full: Salutes shouldn't be given in town or off post - the EM run the officers up the back streets. The best officers treat their men as men, get the best out of them, overlook some little things and take care of their boys - their boys take care of them. Some officers haven't learned this - they should be relieved. The food issued is good - too many cooks ruin it, too many mess halls are dirty, too many  K.P.'s [Kitchen Patrols] are crummy. Inspections should be made [underline] without [/underline] any prior warning - too many outfits was dressed up for inspections - let the inspectors walk in unannounced and find conditions as they are every day. Do away with Sat. [Saturday] AM inspection. [paragraph] Most men are not in the Army for the money they make, but did you ever try to live [insertion] with your wife [/insertion] on 100 a month near an Army post - and that a sgt's [sergeant's] (4th grade) pay - what about a buck pvt [private] or cpls [corporals] . [paragraph] Army towns should be cleaned up of clip joints that charge 200,300, 400, & 500 for 5ct [cent] & 10 ct [cent] store mdss [merchandise] - jewelry that dime stores sold for 25 ct[cents] they get $3.50. Those stores are boom town hustlers that are out to take the soldier. Transportation to & from Army camps is often controlled by one or two companies and often the service is poor. [paragraph] Commission officers should mix more with the men - not try and pull rank with a school solution - they can be wrong - their [they're] human.

S64.Q97.Full: I think as whole the United States Army is a wonderful Easter prize and Every soldier is doing his part to win the war as well as war workers in factories [unclear] ect. [/unclear]

S64.Q97.F: The quickest way for this to end is too long.
