document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Well, I'm in limited service because I hurt my right eye when I was small. Therefore every other way I'm physically perfect. I don't see why I can't go over seas in a Med. Battalion. I know I could do more good there than here.
S64.Q97.Full: Well, I'm in limited service because I hurt my right eye when I was small. Therefore every other way I'm physically perfect. I don't see why I can't go over seas in a Med. Battalion. I know I could do more good there than here.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I do not believe in women in the armed forces - and am not in favor of drafting women for it as it has been suggested. I do not think American men want to see women as they are in various posts of the world - leave then at home and to do a women's job as it was intended by the Maker.
S64.Q97.Full: I do not believe in women in the armed forces - and am not in favor of drafting women for it as it has been suggested. I do not think American men want to see women as they are in various posts of the world - leave then at home and to do a women's job as it was intended by the Maker.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: The main thing wrong with the army management is that there is much to much politics in it. One should prove his qualification for ratings by test, seniority, attitude toward duty and efficiency. Too many incompetent men gain places of importance and consequently undermine the confidence of the rest of the personnel. [paragraph] Yet, generally speaking - from my vantage point - it is run fairy decently.
S64.Q97.C_1: The officers and men in my group do not receive enough praise - and those who are incompetent and inefficient - slackers are at a minimum. Most all are ready to do anything in order to bring this crime and catastrophe to a close. Being a conscientious objector - I can say we have been treated wonderfully and royally under most circumstances. Would that this horrible war was over and we could return to our homes and families - resuming a normal peaceful life - with a few more sure-appearing days of happiness.
S64.Q97.Full: The main thing wrong with the army management is that there is much to much politics in it. One should prove his qualification for ratings by test, seniority, attitude toward duty and efficiency. Too many incompetent men gain places of importance and consequently undermine the confidence of the rest of the personnel. [paragraph] Yet, generally speaking - from my vantage point - it is run fairy decently. The officers and men in my group do not receive enough praise - and those who are incompetent and inefficient - slackers are at a minimum. Most all are ready to do anything in order to bring this crime and catastrophe to a close. Being a conscientious objector - I can say we have been treated wonderfully and royally under most circumstances. Would that this horrible war was over and we could return to our homes and families - resuming a normal peaceful life - with a few more sure-appearing days of happiness.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)

S64.Q97.F: I think as a whole we have the greatest army in the world, and that we are fighting for a very worthy cause. We have the best form of government and we have the best leader and [unclear] Cor [/unclear] leaders of any Country. We will work to [unclear] win [/unclear] and win to-gether a peace the whole world over.
S64.Q97.Full: I think as a whole we have the greatest army in the world, and that we are fighting for a very worthy cause. We have the best form of government and we have the best leader and [unclear] Cor [/unclear] leaders of any Country. We will work to [unclear] win [/unclear] and win to-gether a peace the whole world over.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I think that the active participation of the army in the war is run very well, but some problems, especially transportation of supplies in the zone of interior, is run rather slip shod - For instance: If an outfit that has been stationed at this post moves to another post, the material continues to come to this post from the arsenals, sometimes as much as a year afterwords. Sometimes the new location of the outfit is within a hundred
S64.Q97.C_1: miles of the arsenal and over a thousand miles from here. This can be stopped, to some extent if we send a list of all requisitions that have been submitted to the arsenal and are not yet filled to the arsenal, requesting that they be cancelled, but this still doesn't stop the automatic shipments, which are usually major items and therefore the bulkiest, from coming to this post. It can readily be seen that a great deal of transportation space and cost, as well as man power, is wasted in shipping this material here, as well as in reshipping it from here to the new location. All that would be needed would be for the arsenals to keep abreast of the location of the outfits. This information has been furnished them in the case of outfits leaving this post, but with little or no effect. I presume this same condition prevails in other branches of the army as well as in the ordnance.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that the active participation of the army in the war is run very well, but some problems, especially transportation of supplies in the zone of interior, is run rather slip shod - For instance: If an outfit that has been stationed at this post moves to another post, the material continues to come to this post from the arsenals, sometimes as much as a year afterwords. Sometimes the new location of the outfit is within a hundred miles of the arsenal and over a thousand miles from here. This can be stopped, to some extent if we send a list of all requisitions that have been submitted to the arsenal and are not yet filled to the arsenal, requesting that they be cancelled, but this still doesn't stop the automatic shipments, which are usually major items and therefore the bulkiest, from coming to this post. It can readily be seen that a great deal of transportation space and cost, as well as man power, is wasted in shipping this material here, as well as in reshipping it from here to the new location. All that would be needed would be for the arsenals to keep abreast of the location of the outfits. This information has been furnished them in the case of outfits leaving this post, but with little or no effect. I presume this same condition prevails in other branches of the army as well as in the ordnance.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I never did like the army I thought I did but I would be better of on our farm be mor [unclear] [/unclear] than here anytime because I could do mor there than here Im sure of that as I am limited service That all I can say this army dint do me any good at all?
S64.Q97.Full: I never did like the army I thought I did but I would be better of on our farm be mor [unclear] [/unclear] than here anytime because I could do mor there than here Im sure of that as I am limited service That all I can say this army dint do me any good at all?

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I feel that I should never have been drafted. I am blind in one eye, deaf in one ear and hard of hearing in the other. I had a good job but it is now lost to me. The work I am doing in the Army could be done just as well or better by plenty of other men.
S64.Q97.Full: I feel that I should never have been drafted. I am blind in one eye, deaf in one ear and hard of hearing in the other. I had a good job but it is now lost to me. The work I am doing in the Army could be done just as well or better by plenty of other men.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: One thing I have to say there is too much red tape and politics hooked up with the army. I will say it is a wonderful institution of it's sort, if it can be controlled with out politics, and A-1 being to get any where, for I have three brothers beside myselve serving.
S64.Q97.C_1: and they have of all filled this duty with their heart & sole in it. One has not received a furlough for over a yr service coming the 33rd Div, so that show some of of our company ad-ministrative, and who you know, he was turn down every time he ask qs only prove is laryed up in a west coast hospital under several operations, this has [unclear] increased [/unclear] resistance [unclear] wricle [/unclear] out of my [unclear] aged [/unclear] passivity, as he has been a perfect soldier all around

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Yes I think the men that are in lt [light] service should be put out of the army, in war plants, they could do much better, they are an expense to the army, they are nothing but gold bricks anyway. They could do much better outside. Don't you think so?
S64.Q97.Full: Yes I think the men that are in lt [light] service should be put out of the army, in war plants, they could do much better, they are an expense to the army, they are nothing but gold bricks anyway. They could do much better outside. Don't you think so?

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I think all limited service men as near as possible should be replaced by Waacs (Women;s Army Corps) so they can go back to defense jobs, farm work and all other labor shortages. I know lots of limited service men also that isn't (aren't) fit to even be in the Army that is made to drill and go through all sorts of training that shouldn't be allowed. Discharge all limited service men as its breaking the morale
S64.Q97.C_1: There is a lot of able bodied men on the outside yet while on the inside we have cripples, morons and what not. Its a shame for the government to expect so much of crippled up people. I know some that have been hurt in line of duty that don't even get a break. I think they ought to discharge and pension them instead of pushing them around. Who cares to fight for such inhuman people. The Americans are very selfish at times.
S64.Q97.Full: I think all limited service men as near as possible should be replaced by Waacs (Women;s Army Corps) so they can go back to defense jobs, farm work and all other labor shortages. I know lots of limited service men also that isn't (aren't) fit to even be in the Army that is made to drill and go through all sorts of training that shouldn't be allowed. Discharge all limited service men as its breaking the morale There is a lot of able bodied men on the outside yet while on the inside we have cripples, morons and what not. Its a shame for the government to expect so much of crippled up people. I know some that have been hurt in line of duty that don't even get a break. I think they ought to discharge and pension them instead of pushing them around. Who cares to fight for such inhuman people. The Americans are very selfish at times.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I think that in all limited outfits that consist of limited service men drill should not be done. Also a lot of these men that do not play such an important part should be discharged. They could do a lot. Move goods in war production plants on the outside where there is a lot of skilled labor needed. Also I think that outfits should give their men more passes at nights.
S64.Q97.C_1: And week ends for that would help the moral of the soldier very much
S64.Q97.Full: I think that in all limited outfits that consist of limited service men drill should not be done. Also a lot of these men that do not play such an important part should be discharged. They could do a lot. Move goods in war production plants on the outside where there is a lot of skilled labor needed. Also I think that outfits should give their men more passes at nights. And week ends for that would help the moral of the soldier very much

S64.Q97.F: I think the Army should not take too many limited service men & discharge the men in [unclear] [/unclear] service that can't go in combat [unclear] [/unclear] Duty [unclear] [/unclear] is costing the government a world war to win them and it could be available

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Some fellows get stripes by doing "little favors"> That should be cut out.
S64.Q97.Full: Some fellows get stripes by doing "little favors"> That should be cut out.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: In my case as in many of the other fellows I think the U.S. would be better off with me home in the production line. I have a wife and two children. Living on what they get is nearly impossible. My wife is not able to work. My job here in the Army is rather silly and we have six men for a job that takes about 2. We have a fine idea to arm the
S64.Q97.C_1: would and have a large Army. But we cant have both. We are, in my opinion, trying to "keep up with the Joneses" by having a large Army. We cant have an Army as large as our Allies and furnish them with the tools of war too. Women in Industry is fine but we are going to be very sorry later on. Women are not built for some of the jobs they are doing. We are drafting limited service users to take the place of fighting man thats fine. But (underlined) we are also enlisting W.A.A.C.S for the same purpose. Already the W.A.A.C.S are displacing the limited service men. The idea was good but we dont need one W.A.A.C. and one L. S. man to replace every fighting man in the Army. We have more now than there are jobs for if we get 500,000 more W.A.A.C.S. where the hell are we going to put them? Unless we discharge the L.S. men so they can be of some use to their country, which they are not (underlined) now.
S64.Q97.Full: In my case as in many of the other fellows I think the U.S. would be better off with me home in the production line. I have a wife and two children. Living on what they get is nearly impossible. My wife is not able to work. My job here in the Army is rather silly and we have six men for a job that takes about 2. We have a fine idea to arm the would and have a large Army. But we cant have both. We are, in my opinion, trying to "keep up with the Joneses" by having a large Army. We cant have an Army as large as our Allies and furnish them with the tools of war too. Women in Industry is fine but we are going to be very sorry later on. Women are not built for some of the jobs they are doing. We are drafting limited service users to take the place of fighting man thats fine. But (underlined) we are also enlisting W.A.A.C.S for the same purpose. Already the W.A.A.C.S are displacing the limited service men. The idea was good but we dont need one W.A.A.C. and one L. S. man to replace every fighting man in the Army. We have more now than there are jobs for if we get 500,000 more W.A.A.C.S. where the hell are we going to put them? Unless we discharge the L.S. men so they can be of some use to their country, which they are not (underlined) now.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: The army is a very fine institution but too much red tape. The 2nd leiuts. might take it into consideration that we are men as well as they are. My only squawk is that the 2nd Loueys in all them are not treating men as men.
S64.Q97.Full: The army is a very fine institution but too much red tape. The 2nd leiuts. might take it into consideration that we are men as well as they are. My only squawk is that the 2nd Loueys in all them are not treating men as men.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Since about 80% of this Division a Detachment is Limited Service + cannot perform Field Duty The Non-Coms were made non Coms for the work they perform + do not necessarily know how to handle men + therefore would not be the men to follow under battle conditions
S64.Q97.Full: Since about 80% of this Division a Detachment is Limited Service + cannot perform Field Duty The Non-Coms were made non Coms for the work they perform + do not necessarily know how to handle men + therefore would not be the men to follow under battle conditions

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: When a man is limited service and he isn't much good to the service. Why do they keep sending him to different camps. You says it's helping the war. Well I know a few men that are so disgusted with the army that they want to go home. They were hurt while they were in t he service and because they didn't come in Limited
S64.Q97.C_1: service. They have to keep moving around until the war ends.
S64.Q97.Full: When a man is limited service and he isn't much good to the service. Why do they keep sending him to different camps. You says it's helping the war. Well I know a few men that are so disgusted with the army that they want to go home. They were hurt while they were in t he service and because they didn't come in Limited service. They have to keep moving around until the war ends.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q96.M_marginalia: Things are a little better, but not much-but what about us boys away from home. The hell with money jobs etc. We got a bean patch at home.
S64.Q97.F: I want to go home as soon as possible after the war is over. The Wac's can stay and straighten out the records. They are volunteering for just that kind of work.
S64.Q97.Full: I want to go home as soon as possible after the war is over. The Wac's can stay and straighten out the records. They are volunteering for just that kind of work.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I came into the army as general service & was assigned to the infantry. I liked it, but after being injured & reclassified into limited service, I became very disgusted. I'm tired of the pushing around from station to station, attached duty with little change for a rating and the little I'm doing to help win the war. The W.A.C.S. are great; They can replace 80% of us,
S64.Q97.C_1: so why not give us an honorable discharge & give us a chance to produce for the combat soldier. Knowing something of the hardships of a combat soldier & having a brother in the Navy, I'd never let them down. Also, my mother would not have to work and my young sisters would have a better chance in life. {paragraph} If I don't serve overseas, I want to be home producing for the winning side.
S64.Q97.Full: I came into the army as general service & was assigned to the infantry. I liked it, but after being injured & reclassified into limited service, I became very disgusted. I'm tired of the pushing around from station to station, attached duty with little change for a rating and the little I'm doing to help win the war. The W.A.C.S. are great; They can replace 80% of us,  so why not give us an honorable discharge & give us a chance to produce for the combat soldier. Knowing something of the hardships of a combat soldier & having a brother in the Navy, I'd never let them down. Also, my mother would not have to work and my young sisters would have a better chance in life. {paragraph} If I don't serve overseas, I want to be home producing for the winning side.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: The war has almost put me out of business because I don't have the kind of help back home to keep it going & it is impossible for me to get the help I need now. [paragraph] I have a shoe repair shop at (of) my own.
S64.Q97.Full: The war has almost put me out of business because I don't have the kind of help back home to keep it going & it is impossible for me to get the help I need now. [paragraph] I have a shoe repair shop at (of) my own.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Release all limited service men and as near as possible all married men that have large [insertion] amount [/insertion] Dependents for Farming and other war needs they are not needed here.
S64.Q97.Full: Release all limited service men and as near as possible all married men that have large [insertion] amount [/insertion] Dependents for Farming and other war needs they are not needed here.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes [unclear] [/unclear] many were cancelled by me due to my work.
S64.Q97.F: While in the army have seen many cases of poor assignment such as a Boeing test pilot (of instr on B-17) painting signs in an armament shop & his helper who made tools for General Motors. [paragraph] Of officers who appointed non coms [Non Commissioned Officers] over qualified technicians when the noncom had no experience in comparison with
S64.Q97.C_1: privates. Of petty political cliques in Det Sqdn. Regt. etc Hdqtrs where a friend ? could ask & receive while others were practically thrown out. C.O.s are busy but they should have some time to see what goes on. A 1st Sgt for instance should consider his compliment as men who could go to him for advice instead of "I'm too busy." Predudices play too big a part in selecting N.C.O's I don't care if I hate a man if he knows his work & is fair he should have the same chance to advance as anyone else.
S64.Q97.Full: While in the army have seen many cases of poor assignment such as a Boeing test pilot (of instr on B-17) painting signs in an armament shop & his helper who made tools for General Motors. [paragraph] Of officers who appointed non coms [Non Commissioned Officers] over qualified technicians when the noncom had no experience in comparison with privates. Of petty political cliques in Det Sqdn. Regt. etc Hdqtrs where a friend ? could ask & receive while others were practically thrown out. C.O.s are busy but they should have some time to see what goes on. A 1st Sgt for instance should consider his compliment as men who could go to him for advice instead of "I'm too busy." Predudices play too big a part in selecting N.C.O's I don't care if I hate a man if he knows his work & is fair he should have the same chance to advance as anyone else.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I feel that the 1-B man that are not going across should be placed as close as can home. Most of all the married ones.
S64.Q97.Full: I feel that the 1-B man that are not going across should be placed as close as can home. Most of all the married ones.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: The attitude of some officers in this man's army is not what a soldier would expect of a so called "officer and gentleman". This of course does not apply to all of them. In every outfit there is usually one - please instruct them in the fine art of handling men - not cattle.
S64.Q97.Full: The attitude of some officers in this man's army is not what a soldier would expect of a so called "officer and gentleman". This of course does not apply to all of them. In every outfit there is usually one - please instruct them in the fine art of handling men - not cattle.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: One thing that has bothered me is the WAAC situation. Why should there be both WAACs and limited service men when both serve practically the same function. Since most station complements are composed of limited service men the WAACs are not replacing men for combat duty but rather those that aren't. The leaves the
S64.Q97.C_1: limited service man without a home. Why not [deletion] [/deletion] return the limited man back to useful work in war industry - or put the WAACS there - the Army does not need both. Many men in station complement are idle, or are doing little useful work. There seem to be too many hands for the job - especially since the WAACS came in. Without question they could be of more service to their country as war workers. In regard to the WAACS - it would be wise to train more of them for the job they are to fill - before they fill it. Too many have been sent here to fill technical jobs who have no training at all in that field. We have very little time to teach them the job - The result is they end up sweeping floors - leaving both them and us highly dissatisfied.
S64.Q97.Full: One thing that has bothered me is the WAAC situation. Why should there be both WAACs and limited service men when both serve practically the same function. Since most station complements are composed of limited service men the WAACs are not replacing men for combat duty but rather those that aren't. The leaves the  limited service man without a home. Why not [deletion] [/deletion] return the limited man back to useful work in war industry - or put the WAACS there - the Army does not need both. Many men in station complement are idle, or are doing little useful work. There seem to be too many hands for the job - especially since the WAACS came in. Without question they could be of more service to their country as war workers. In regard to the WAACS - it would be wise to train more of them for the job they are to fill - before they fill it. Too many have been sent here to fill technical jobs who have no training at all in that field. We have very little time to teach them the job - The result is they end up sweeping floors - leaving both them and us highly dissatisfied.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think the army could get along without half as many limited service men as they have. I think they should take them out of the army and draft them to work in war factories. I believe they could do more for the country that way. [paragraph] I also think that if the limited services man is going to be in the army, he should be given a chance to go overseas. Most of the boys in my unit feel the same way about it.
S64.Q97.C_1: There should be a better way of placing boys in service when he is best fitted.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the army could get along without half as many limited service men as they have. I think they should take them out of the army and draft them to work in war factories. I believe they could do more for the country that way. [paragraph] I also think that if the limited services man is going to be in the army, he should be given a chance to go overseas. Most of the boys in my unit feel the same way about it. There should be a better way of placing boys in service when he is best fitted.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I think the U.S. Army has done & is still doing a marvelous job in the training & outfitting of its men for this war. However, I do feel that the taking in of limited service men was a mistake especially because of the way these men were trained & eventually chosen for their jobs. Not nearly enough individual attention was given the men and due to
S64.Q97.C_1: personal handicaps many of them had a very difficult time. My frank belief is that a good many of the men I know in limited service could be doing more for their country in defense jobs.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the U.S. Army has done & is still doing a marvelous job in the training & outfitting of its men for this war. However, I do feel that the taking in of limited service men was a mistake especially because of the way these men were trained & eventually chosen for their jobs. Not nearly enough individual attention was given the men and due to  personal handicaps many of them had a very difficult time. My frank belief is that a good many of the men I know in limited service could be doing more for their country in defense jobs.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: In this camp I don't feel like the soldiers are given a fair chance of passes.
S64.Q96.M_marginalia: 4 out of five boys have been drafted so there is practically nothing left at home.
S64.Q97.F: My ideas are: more care should be taken in selection of officers and they should be checked to see that they are doing their job. Haven't heard a lecture from an officer for quite a while as a matter of fact 1 or 2 in a month. Pass the buck to non-coms. Transportation here is very poor; Why doesn't the army provide or supervise transportation so soldiers can have a little of the much needed recreation. Worse
S64.Q97.C_1: is very low of around [unclear] [/unclear] in south are to bring men from the north down and sending the southern boys up north. No reason why men can't be kept near [unclear] [/unclear] leaves a much higher moral (morale). Furthermore, we have been [unclear] [/unclear] absent a yer and still haven't gotten used to the heat, lack of transportation, carpet baggers of the south, lack of recreation, and people. I think a boy should train in one camp for a short period and then be change (changed) to another to [unclear] [/unclear] interest. (paragraph) Another thing I feel like politics are being played in draft boards as sending to [unclear] [/unclear] me with one eye, cripples, and not mentally fit when on the streets are some of the best physical specimens. Some being deferred because they are married and most since draft started [unclear] [/unclear] wife working also. Don't think it is fair. (paragraph) Have supervisors for hdq (headquarters) that are open chair officers to till and advise what should be done in the field, we know they are only bluffing that they know.
S64.Q97.Full: My ideas are: more care should be taken in selection of officers and they should be checked to see that they are doing their job. Haven't heard a lecture from an officer for quite a while as a matter of fact 1 or 2 in a month. Pass the buck to non-coms. Transportation here is very poor; Why doesn't the army provide or supervise transportation so soldiers can have a little of the much needed recreation. Worse is very low of around [unclear] [/unclear] in south are to bring men from the north down and sending the southern boys up north. No reason why men can't be kept near [unclear] [/unclear] leaves a much higher moral (morale). Furthermore, we have been [unclear] [/unclear] absent a yer and still haven't gotten used to the heat, lack of transportation, carpet baggers of the south, lack of recreation, and people. I think a boy should train in one camp for a short period and then be change (changed) to another to [unclear] [/unclear] interest. (paragraph) Another thing I feel like politics are being played in draft boards as sending to [unclear] [/unclear] me with one eye, cripples, and not mentally fit when on the streets are some of the best physical specimens. Some being deferred because they are married and most since draft started [unclear] [/unclear] wife working also. Don't think it is fair. (paragraph) Have supervisors for hdq (headquarters) that are open chair officers to till and advise what should be done in the field, we know they are only bluffing that they know.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M_marginalia: 96. Up to now, has the war made things better or worse for your family and friends back home (such things as jobs, pay, and living conditions)? Pay is higher. Living conditions are worse. [unclear] N, A [/unclear]
S64.Q97.F: 97. If you have any further remarks you would like to make on any subject please write them below as fully as you like. The U. S. Government should see to it the Germany will not start any more wars. America would also be a much better place to live in if they held down the Jews. Hitler did the correct thing but did it in the wrong way when he chased out the Jews. They should also hold down the Negroes especially in the North. There are very few Jews in the Army. There is going to be a war after this one in the United States against the Jews.
S64.Q97.Full: 97. If you have any further remarks you would like to make on any subject please write them below as fully as you like. The U. S. Government should see to it the Germany will not start any more wars. America would also be a much better place to live in if they held down the Jews. Hitler did the correct thing but did it in the wrong way when he chased out the Jews. They should also hold down the Negroes especially in the North. There are very few Jews in the Army. There is going to be a war after this one in the United States against the Jews.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Frankly I have one comment to make about the Army and that is the fellow who is always honeying around the non-coms usually goes up the line much faster than the fellow who works hard and says what he thinks. I don't think that a fellow who just does some
S64.Q97.C_1: thing because it is an order & wont do it otherwise, should even be considered for promotions, let the fellow who is willing to do the work. The fellow that just does it because he has to is the one that tells the non com what a grand guy he is, is usually the one that gets the promotion.
S64.Q97.Full: Frankly I have one comment to make about the Army and that is the fellow who is always honeying around the non-coms usually goes up the line much faster than the fellow who works hard and says what he thinks. I don't think that a fellow who just does some  thing because it is an order & wont do it otherwise, should even be considered for promotions, let the fellow who is willing to do the work. The fellow that just does it because he has to is the one that tells the non com what a grand guy he is, is usually the one that gets the promotion.

S64.Q97.Full: It makes it harder in the Army when you have been engaged to some one and after 6 mo or sooner quit writing & start with someone else.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I have not had a furlough. I have been in for [unclear] 8 [/unclear] months I would like [unclear] [/unclear] well to get one pretty sune [soon]
S64.Q97.Full: I have not had a furlough. I have been in for [unclear] 8 [/unclear] months I would like [unclear] [/unclear] well to get one pretty sune [soon]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: (as I haven't gotten my furlough yet)
S64.Q97.F: I like the army very much, as it has built me up good, but I would rather get into something I'm interested more in and think I would be better suited for, such as the air corps. I'm going to take advantage of it. If I cant get in the air corps, the next best thing I would like would be to have a chance to go to college. through the A.S.T.P.[Army Specialized Training Program] , as
S64.Q97.C_1: it would [unclear] depend [/unclear] later in life and also I believe I could be better suited for college and helping the country at the same time than what I'm doing now. Most [insertion] of the [/insertion] [unclear] rejoining [/unclear] people are going to be the future leaders of this country and they deserve a chance to get an education, to help them later in life. I planned on going to college after I finished high school, but couldn't due to the war. I hope I do get to go to college. If I don't get a chance through A.S.T.P.[Army Specialized Training Program] I'm going after the war is over, as I had planned, if nothing happens.
S64.Q97.Full: I like the army very much, as it has built me up good, but I would rather get into something I'm interested more in and think I would be better suited for, such as the air corps. I'm going to take advantage of it. If I cant get in the air corps, the next best thing I would like would be to have a chance to go to college. through the A.S.T.P.[Army Specialized Training Program] , as it would [unclear] depend [/unclear] later in life and also I believe I could be better suited for college and helping the country at the same time than what I'm doing now. Most [insertion] of the [/insertion] [unclear] rejoining [/unclear] people are going to be the future leaders of this country and they deserve a chance to get an education, to help them later in life. I planned on going to college after I finished high school, but couldn't due to the war. I hope I do get to go to college. If I don't get a chance through A.S.T.P.[Army Specialized Training Program] I'm going after the war is over, as I had planned, if nothing happens.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: As stated in this questionnaire, I would be more of help working in a defence plant, then I would be in the Army. reason is that my job at home would help more for the war, and I don't think I'm fit for combat duty.
S64.Q97.Full: As stated in this questionnaire, I would be more of help working in a defence plant, then I would be in the Army. reason is that my job at home would help more for the war, and I don't think I'm fit for combat duty.

S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: about non coms I thought to be noncoms one should know something about the outfit. In this company they have a few noncoms that know hardly nothing. Therefore I don't think that is right for my opinions and another reason I have in taking farmers that are in limited service into the army I think they are mostly needed on the farm than in the army.
S64.Q97.Full: about non coms I thought to be noncoms one should know something about the outfit. In this company they have a few noncoms that know hardly nothing. document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Staying in one camp for to long a personnel gets manotous [monotonous] on a man & makes him restless for wanting to see new terrotory.
S64.Q97.Full: Staying in one camp for to long a personnel gets manotous [monotonous] on a man & makes him restless for wanting to see new terrotory.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: When a man is trained to do one kind of job for 11 months and don't think he should be changed to a company he does not know anything about and does not like. I can do anything in my line which is motor transportation and repair in engines. I feel I can be of great help in transportation. But I am a failure in CWS agents.
S64.Q97.Full: When a man is trained to do one kind of job for 11 months and don't think he should be changed to a company he does not know anything about and does not like. I can do anything in my line which is motor transportation and repair in engines. I feel I can be of great help in transportation. But I am a failure in CWS agents.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: There are too many men who are misfits in their army jobs. It would be good for some men to spend a few weeks in Army training, but there are times when a man is unable to leave at the time when he would be wanted. Vacations could be spent in the Army. Every boy should spend his summer vacations in the Army if he is Phisically [physically] fit
S64.Q97.C_1: He would then have his years training by the time he graduates from high school. [paragraph] Army training is the best training a man can get. He learns to live better with his fellow men.
S64.Q97.Full: There are too many men who are misfits in their army jobs. It would be good for some men to spend a few weeks in Army training, but there are times when a man is unable to leave at the time when he would be wanted. Vacations could be spent in the Army. Every boy should spend his summer vacations in the Army if he is Phisically [physically] fit He would then have his years training by the time he graduates from high school. [paragraph] Army training is the best training a man can get. He learns to live better with his fellow men.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I would rather be a civilian because I could do more for the war then {than} in the army because I have bum leg and feets [feet] and cant [can't] do my work good there for in civilian life I could stay off of my feet and do more work for the war effort other things there is some of us fellows that cant [can't] take all the drills and that is not good we can do just half of our work
S64.Q97.Full: I would rather be a civilian because I could do more for the war then {than} in the army because I have bum leg and feets [feet] and cant [can't] do my work good there for in civilian life I could stay off of my feet and do more work for the war effort other things there is some of us fellows that cant [can't] take all the drills and that is not good we can do just half of our work

S64.Q97.F: A company should be run by officers not staff sgts. A person from the North should train in the North not the South there be better fighting men that way. There should be better drinking water then they have in the south it rotten. And better food that rotten in the canp I am in the cook burn everything and the meal smell. The army meal are suppose to be the best but there not there rotten.

There should be better drinking water then they have in the south it rotten. And better food that rotten in the canp I am in the cook burn everything and the meal smell. The army meal are suppose to be the best but there not there rotten.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: This war has made things very bad for my father, last April my mother died (this has no direct [unclear] bearing [/unclear] on the war) but it left my father alone as my brother and I are both in the service. My father just started a new business a few years before the war and [insertion] he [/insertion] depended a great deal on me to [insertion] help [/insertion] run this business
S64.Q97.C_1: as he is a cripple having one crippled hand and also foot. He is doing his very best and then some to carry on, hoping some day brother and I will both be back to carry on his business and help him. His is doing more than his part in the war effort. He is buying many war bonds, helping the town out whenever he can for example, lending his truck to gather scrap & etc, takes his turn at the observation post looking for airplanes. (paragraph) My father is of German birth, came to this country before the first World War and is a natralized (naturalized) citizen. Frankly I believe I could do more good at home to win this war than in the Army. I am more suited as a fuse maker than a soldier and food is a war neccesity (necessity) but as long as I am in the Army I will do my best to win this war
S64.Q97.Full: This war has made things very bad for my father, last April my mother died (this has no direct [unclear] bearing [/unclear] on the war) but it left my father alone as my brother and I are both in the service. My father just started a new business a few years before the war and [insertion] he [/insertion] depended a great deal on me to [insertion] help [/insertion] run this business as he is a cripple having one crippled hand and also foot. He is doing his very best and then some to carry on, hoping some day brother and I will both be back to carry on his business and help him. His is doing more than his part in the war effort. He is buying many war bonds, helping the town out whenever he can for example, lending his truck to gather scrap & etc, takes his turn at the observation post looking for airplanes. (paragraph) My father is of German birth, came to this country before the first World War and is a natralized (naturalized) citizen. Frankly I believe I could do more good at home to win this war than in the Army. I am more suited as a fuse maker than a soldier and food is a war neccesity (necessity) but as long as I am in the Army I will do my best to win this war

S64.Q97.F: Well they send me to school for cooking & now they put me in automotive.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Everyone doesn't get treated the same in the army. Camps are built to (too) close to small camps where there is no place to go & nothing to do. Transportation could be a hell of a lot better.
S64.Q97.Full: Everyone doesn't get treated the same in the army. Camps are built to (too) close to small camps where there is no place to go & nothing to do. Transportation could be a hell of a lot better.

S64.Q97.Full: I an now in [unclear] Ned [/unclear] [unclear] Pct [/unclear] S.C. Lined Sevice but when i came in i was 1A and now that i Limed Service i think i could do more [deletion] [/deletion] in our craft plant than i am do now.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: At times it seems that one of the company officers on duty could have a bit more consideration for both soldiers and civilians. - [paragraph] - That goes for recruits from the [unclear] [/unclear] & [unclear] [/unclear] school in our kitchen, who sometimes act as though they pay for the food.
S64.Q97.C_1: I heartily endorse the paying off in envelopes. [paragraph] Short arm (monthly physical) could be twice a day in the barracks. [paragraph] First sergeant should have full authority to issue three-day passes without having to go to the C.C. [Central Command] [paragraph] Also, we shoud have Class "A" passes, permitting us to leave post whenever not on duty.
S64.Q97.Full: At times it seems that one of the company officers on duty could have a bit more consideration for both soldiers and civilians. - [paragraph] - That goes for recruits from the [unclear] [/unclear] & [unclear] [/unclear] school in our kitchen, who sometimes act as though they pay for the food. I heartily endorse the paying off in envelopes. [paragraph] Short arm (monthly physical) could be twice a day in the barracks. [paragraph] First sergeant should have full authority to issue three-day passes without having to go to the C.C. [Central Command] [paragraph] Also, we shoud have Class "A" passes, permitting us to leave post whenever not on duty.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I consider myself a good soldier. I give my best any where but as I have said all through this test I would like the Para troops. I am set in that I volunteered for that sole purpose if I didn't think I was to get it I would have join the RCAF at [deletion] sev [/deletion] 17 years of age but naturally I want to fight for my
S64.Q97.C_1: own country first so if you can make it possible to get me in the Para troops look this test up. That's my hope to get in the Paratroop & they are now asking for enlistments for that branch so here is hoping I get in.
S64.Q97.Full: I consider myself a good soldier. I give my best any where but as I have said all through this test I would like the Para troops. I am set in that I volunteered for that sole purpose if I didn't think I was to get it I would have join the RCAF at [deletion] sev [/deletion] 17 years of age but naturally I want to fight for my own country first so if you can make it possible to get me in the Para troops look this test up. That's my hope to get in the Paratroop & they are now asking for enlistments for that branch so here is hoping I get in.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I would like to state that I enjoy being in the army + I would like to get in some outfit where I might go across in action, but if I can't I will do my best where I am.
S64.Q97.Full: I would like to state that I enjoy being in the army + I would like to get in some outfit where I might go across in action, but if I can't I will do my best where I am.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think that the classification in the army is very bad, that a lot of good man power is being wasted because of initial misplacement and the difficulties thereafter of obtaining transfers to the proper units and outfits. I also cannot understand why a man may be physically able to be a
S64.Q97.C_1: general service soldier and still not able to pass the requirements for officers training.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that the classification in the army is very bad, that a lot of good man power is being wasted because of initial misplacement and the difficulties thereafter of obtaining transfers to the proper units and outfits. I also cannot understand why a man may be physically able to be a general service soldier and still not able to pass the requirements for officers training.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: If I were not limited service I would have answered a lot differently. I feel that because I cannot actually fight I could do more good working at my trade (welder in a shipyard)
S64.Q97.Full: If I were not limited service I would have answered a lot differently. I feel that because I cannot actually fight I could do more good working at my trade (welder in a shipyard)

S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I am a married man. I think I could do a lot more in civil life for my country. I have a wife & baby which need me home more than the army does. Thank you.
S64.Q97.Full: I am a married man. I think I could do a lot more in civil life for my country. I have a wife & baby which need me home more than the army does. Thank you.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I am well satisfied with the Army but would like a little more passes or furloughs
S64.Q97.Full: I am well satisfied with the Army but would like a little more passes or furloughs

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I have an assigned job of 8 hours on and 16 hours off but to get a weekend pass we have to work extra hours for [unclear] [/unclear] away so actually have also not get any earned time off, have had one actual 3 day pass in seven months and very few get furloughs. Each week we work a different [unclear] [/unclear] so can't put our time off to much advantage. Post outfits should get as much time as other outfits on the post.
S64.Q97.Full: I have an assigned job of 8 hours on and 16 hours off but to get a weekend pass we have to work extra hours for [unclear] [/unclear] away so actually have also not get any earned time off, have had one actual 3 day pass in seven months and very few get furloughs. Each week we work a different [unclear] [/unclear] so can't put our time off to much advantage. Post outfits should get as much time as other outfits on the post.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I enlisted as a volunteer in the Air corps hoping I could have the opportunity of getting on with a ground crew. I was told I would be given a chance to qualify. Thirteen months have passed and I'm still waiting. I have been assigned to this M.P. outfit where time off is just one of those rare things. I actually work seven days a week and double two weekends to have one, the third one off. The organization as far
S64.Q97.C_1: As schedules are concerned is far from being run properly. An enlisted man is entitled to thirty days a year. I never have had one. This tends to cause one to be dissatisfied in an outfit such as this. I honestly think that an Inspector for the different branches of the service should appear at least four times a year and straighten out a lot of things in Army routine and life and thus create a willingness in every man's heart that [insertion] will [/insertion] urge him to do his utmost in stead of discouraging him.
S64.Q97.Full: I enlisted as a volunteer in the Air corps hoping I could have the opportunity of getting on with a ground crew. I was told I would be given a chance to qualify. Thirteen months have passed and I'm still waiting. I have been assigned to this M.P. outfit where time off is just one of those rare things. I actually work seven days a week and double two weekends to have one, the third one off. The organization as far As schedules are concerned is far from being run properly. An enlisted man is entitled to thirty days a year. I never have had one. This tends to cause one to be dissatisfied in an outfit such as this. I honestly think that an Inspector for the different branches of the service should appear at least four times a year and straighten out a lot of things in Army routine and life and thus create a willingness in every man's heart that [insertion] will [/insertion] urge him to do his utmost in stead of discouraging him.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I feel that if I was given the opportunity and time I have spent in this company in any other company I feel chance I could of made a lot more of myself as for rank and helping this country win the war. In my time in the army almost three quarters of it was doing guard duty which in my opinion is not
S64.Q97.C_1: to important, and I feel that I have lost a lot of my sense of responsibility which I had before coming into the service. I believe that the type of work I am doing is too strenuous and tiresome for a fellow to do continually. I also have other duties that appeal to my liking but it is not very seldom I have these to do.
S64.Q97.Full: I feel that if I was given the opportunity and time I have spent in this company in any other company I feel chance I could of made a lot more of myself as for rank and helping this country win the war. In my time in the army almost three quarters of it was doing guard duty which in my opinion is not to important, and I feel that I have lost a lot of my sense of responsibility which I had before coming into the service. I believe that the type of work I am doing is too strenuous and tiresome for a fellow to do continually. I also have other duties that appeal to my liking but it is not very seldom I have these to do.

S64.Q97.F: In regard to furlough gos: The last time I was home on furlough, 5 months ago, I went to the ration board and asked for gas coupons & they wouldn't give me any. I think that all service men should be given a few coupons to go around to see his folks.
S64.Q97.Full: In regard to furlough gos: The last time I was home on furlough, 5 months ago, I went to the ration board and asked for gas coupons & they wouldn't give me any. I think that all service men should be given a few coupons to go around to see his folks.

S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: 95. I have had a chance for more passes I just didn't take them. I would like to have a furlough so I could see my family. 96. My Father is making more money now but I wish this war was over so we could all be home together again. I have a brother oversees that I would like to see.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think the biggest defect I have found in the U.S. Army is the lackadaisical manner in which most men react to the information taught them by their officers. They just don't give a damn. In combat, I believe a good percentage of our losses are due to this fault of our soldiers.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the biggest defect I have found in the U.S. Army is the lackadaisical manner in which most men react to the information taught them by their officers. They just don't give a damn. In combat, I believe a good percentage of our losses are due to this fault of our soldiers.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Well if you men put in the job that you asked for like I wanted to go into the Air Corps and was shoved in the inf and I don't think that was a very good idea after all if the army wants to advance
S64.Q97.C_1: they should have some consideration for the men under them. I personally myself would like to get to join the Air Corps if I could but I guess the Army is only a poor organized outfit. And if they would let us get enough sleep at night instead of working hard all [unclear] [/unclear] to grant until 12 to 1 o'clock so that is my opinion of the U.S. Army. And another thing when you are sick they think that you are [unclear] [/unclear] and I don't think that is right that is all that I have to say so long.

I personally myself would like to get to join the Air Corps if I could but I guess the Army is only a poor organized outfit. And if they would let us get enough sleep at night instead of working hard all [unclear] [/unclear] to grant until 12 to 1 o'clock so that is my opinion of the U.S. Army. And another thing when you are sick they think that you are [unclear] [/unclear] and I don't think that is right that is all that I have to say so long.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I would like to get a furlough some time that's what turns a soldier against his work.
S64.Q97.Full: I would like to get a furlough some time that's what turns a soldier against his work.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: This Army consists of 90% cleanliness and 10% Training and drilling. This here Camp Blanding in poorly located spot for an Infantry division. The meals here are terrible at times. I'm afraid to feed a dog with the food they give. Very often do you get a good meal here. The cooks are also terrible, whatever they cook, they must burn it, mabe thats how they know it is cooked or not. Why not make "Kitchen Police" shorter hours
S64.Q97.C_1: You get up at 5.30 in the morning, go to the kitchen at 6 oclock and stay there all day till 9 or 10 oclock at night. Another thing those, cooks and mess sergeants sure ([underline] ride [/underline] ) you plenty in that kitchen all day. ([underline] They eat the good food. [/underline] ) [paragraph] P.F.C. are given too much orders to order privates around. There no better than I am. Noncoms give them all the permission. [paragraph] Don't you think a soldier is entitled to a furlough after his 13 weeks of Basic training. It would make a soldier very happy to get this after each training. I know I would be very happy. And I'll be happy to come back because I was treated swell and live up to my orders and rules of a furlough.
S64.Q97.Full: This Army consists of 90% cleanliness and 10% Training and drilling. This here Camp Blanding in poorly located spot for an Infantry division. The meals here are terrible at times. I'm afraid to feed a dog with the food they give. Very often do you get a good meal here. The cooks are also terrible, whatever they cook, they must burn it, mabe thats how they know it is cooked or not. Why not make "Kitchen Police" shorter hours You get up at 5.30 in the morning, go to the kitchen at 6 oclock and stay there all day till 9 or 10 oclock at night. Another thing those, cooks and mess sergeants sure ([underline] ride [/underline] ) you plenty in that kitchen all day. ([underline] They eat the good food. [/underline] ) [paragraph] P.F.C. are given too much orders to order privates around. There no better than I am. Noncoms give them all the permission. [paragraph] Don't you think a soldier is entitled to a furlough after his 13 weeks of Basic training. It would make a soldier very happy to get this after each training. I know I would be very happy. And I'll be happy to come back because I was treated swell and live up to my orders and rules of a furlough.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: This is just something personal. When I was called into service I came in with an open mind glad of the chance to serve my country. It meant breaking my home and leaving my wife. I was told the army places you in jobs best suited to you. I made out well on my 2-123. My interviewer rushed me and and I found myself in the infantry with a group of 18-19 year olds. I worked in the office of a woolen mfg [manufacturer] , being in charge of the New York showroom and doing designing. I also could
S64.Q97.C_1: type and do bookkeeping. I feel very much misplaced with my present work in the army. I have no new buddies from my outfit. I do not consider myself better than the next man. However, my thoughts run towards a different channel. I have kept up with the training and have done my best to be a good soldier because my wife is with me and my chances of getting a pass are better if I am a good soldier. I really dislike the work I am doing very much and I really believe I was misplaced - or do all infantry men feel the same way.
S64.Q97.Full: This is just something personal. When I was called into service I came in with an open mind glad of the chance to serve my country. It meant breaking my home and leaving my wife. I was told the army places you in jobs best suited to you. I made out well on my 2-123. My interviewer rushed me and and I found myself in the infantry with a group of 18-19 year olds. I worked in the office of a woolen mfg [manufacturer] , being in charge of the New York showroom and doing designing. I also could type and do bookkeeping. I feel very much misplaced with my present work in the army. I have no new buddies from my outfit. I do not consider myself better than the next man. However, my thoughts run towards a different channel. I have kept up with the training and have done my best to be a good soldier because my wife is with me and my chances of getting a pass are better if I am a good soldier. I really dislike the work I am doing very much and I really believe I was misplaced - or do all infantry men feel the same way.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Well I like to tell you that we should see home more often we would feel much better and I hope when you read this that fellow will get more furloughs and see their family more often. I would like to get out of the infantry into a easy outfit because the infantry is too hard for me. I'm a kid yet, can't work hard so I hope I get out of the infantry.
S64.Q97.Full: Well I like to tell you that we should see home more often we would feel much better and I hope when you read this that fellow will get more furloughs and see their family more often. I would like to get out of the infantry into a easy outfit because the infantry is too hard for me. I'm a kid yet, can't work hard so I hope I get out of the infantry.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I requested my draft board to hasten my call into the Service for I knew I would be called eventually. I did so because I felt and feel It should do my very best to aid the war effort. Since my entry I have discovered how unfit physically and temperamentally for duty in my present unit, a unit which requires youth, strength and placidity, none of which I have. My business background and schooling, in view of my limited physical capabilities should permit
S64.Q97.C_1: me to be placed in a unit where I can serve my country and feel satisfaction in so doing or cause me to be placed in a war job I like governments choice or informed to secure such job for myself. [paragraph] I am all for the war effort but must be satisfied with my own attainments in aiding it. A trouble mind is more value to a unit or a nation and I am positively troubled mainly because of my dissatisfaction with my present duty.
S64.Q97.Full: I requested my draft board to hasten my call into the Service for I knew I would be called eventually. I did so because I felt and feel It should do my very best to aid the war effort. Since my entry I have discovered how unfit physically and temperamentally for duty in my present unit, a unit which requires youth, strength and placidity, none of which I have. My business background and schooling, in view of my limited physical capabilities should permit  me to be placed in a unit where I can serve my country and feel satisfaction in so doing or cause me to be placed in a war job I like governments choice or informed to secure such job for myself. [paragraph] I am all for the war effort but must be satisfied with my own attainments in aiding it. A trouble mind is more value to a unit or a nation and I am positively troubled mainly because of my dissatisfaction with my present duty.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: [deletion] yes, i have had my fair share of both fuloughs and passes [/deletion] [initials]
S64.Q97.F: The United States has put all its industrial might behind the war but the people have not entirely relented to helping the situation. Thousands do not even realize that a war exists. The waste in this war is terrific and could be stopped if the man controlling industry wanted to stop it.
S64.Q97.C_1: I think that thousands of soldiers could have been put into jobs that would be more useful to both themselves and the army. The organization of the army today is a gigantic problem and I think it is being handled very good for [unclear] the [/unclear] [unclear] men [/unclear] who are in charge.[paragraph] The reorganization of Europe after the war is a big problem and it will take several men to solve it.
S64.Q97.Full: The United States has put all its industrial might behind the war but the people have not entirely relented to helping the situation. Thousands do not even realize that a war exists. The waste in this war is terrific and could be stopped if the man controlling industry wanted to stop it. I think that thousands of soldiers could have been put into jobs that would be more useful to both themselves and the army. The organization of the army today is a gigantic problem and I think it is being handled very good for [unclear] the [/unclear] [unclear] men [/unclear] who are in charge.[paragraph] The reorganization of Europe after the war is a big problem and it will take several men to solve it.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: When I was drafted I was almost the sole support of my family. My father was ill for a long time, but was drawing only a few dollars a week, but it was enough so that I couldn't make an alotment out. Conditions are still not straightened out yet.
S64.Q97.Full: When I was drafted I was almost the sole support of my family. My father was ill for a long time, but was drawing only a few dollars a week, but it was enough so that I couldn't make an alotment out. Conditions are still not straightened out yet.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I feel that if a man was put in the correct branch of service suited to him. He would enjoy his work & the Army could get more out of him. [paragraph] I also feel that a man after being in for three months is entitled to a furlough in order to see his family & in this way when he returned back to camp he would work a great deal harder.
S64.Q97.Full: I feel that if a man was put in the correct branch of service suited to him. He would enjoy his work & the Army could get more out of him. [paragraph] I also feel that a man after being in for three months is entitled to a furlough in order to see his family & in this way when he returned back to camp he would work a great deal harder.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I don't think the Army takes enough time to place a man in a job that he knows something about or has had experience in, or a job that he has a knack for doing.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't think the Army takes enough time to place a man in a job that he knows something about or has had experience in, or a job that he has a knack for doing.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Yes I should think men over 28 yrs of age shouldn't be in the Infantry. They should be in some branch of service where they can do the Army some good. The Army is O.K. in someways and in someways it is not. To my opinion I don't believe an inspection of full field equipment, as you can't win a war by inspection. Also in lecturing a Rifle Company is not satisfactory to my opinion, the should
S64.Q97.C_1: do things they experience.
S64.Q97.Full: Yes I should think men over 28 yrs of age shouldn't be in the Infantry. They should be in some branch of service where they can do the Army some good. The Army is O.K. in someways and in someways it is not. To my opinion I don't believe an inspection of full field equipment, as you can't win a war by inspection. Also in lecturing a Rifle Company is not satisfactory to my opinion, the should  do things they experience.

The [unclear] [/unclear] in the [unclear] O.D.? [/unclear] is paying for it again. That should have been stoped [stopped] doing before the president did.
