document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I don't like the Army and would like to go back on the farm and help raise something to eat. And take care of my dad and mother who are by their self and are getting pretty old.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't like the Army and would like to go back on the farm and help raise something to eat. And take care of my dad and mother who are by their self and are getting pretty old.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: The army should see that every man get her furlough. I know a fellow who was home and he is like a new man. There is one thing that very important and I find all the soldiers in my outfit complain about - The food is not cooked right. That is the reason why men are not as good soldiers as they would ...
S64.Q97.C_1: like to be. Some soldiers told me they don't care how hard they work. But at the end of hard days work they would like to have properly cooked food. [paragraph] I have friends, cousins in different parts of the country and they all complain about the food [paragraph] Eggs are very greasy. Pancakes are tough, coffee is lousy. [paragraph] I say if the men were fed as good as the officers we would have superb soldiers. I am a cook in the Army. [deletion] They [/deletion] The cooks should have more help so they can cook the food properly. [paragraph] The Army travels on its stomach. Soldier eats a well made he is happy. [paragraph] The Officers in charge should eat in the mess hall with the men so they can see what goes on. Also the other big hats.
S64.Q97.Full: The army should see that every man get her furlough. I know a fellow who was home and he is like a new man. There is one thing that very important and I find all the soldiers in my outfit complain about - The food is not cooked right. That is the reason why men are not as good soldiers as they would ... like to be. Some soldiers told me they don't care how hard they work. But at the end of hard days work they would like to have properly cooked food. [paragraph] I have friends, cousins in different parts of the country and they all complain about the food [paragraph] Eggs are very greasy. Pancakes are tough, coffee is lousy. [paragraph] I say if the men were fed as good as the officers we would have superb soldiers. I am a cook in the Army. [deletion] They [/deletion] The cooks should have more help so they can cook the food properly. [paragraph] The Army travels on its stomach. Soldier eats a well made he is happy. [paragraph] The Officers in charge should eat in the mess hall with the men so they can see what goes on. Also the other big hats.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: 1. I think the army is lax as far as furloughs go. A man in other branches of the service usually have furloughs immediately after basic, but a soldier never knows where he stands. No one can ever tell him definitely when furloughs will be issued. I know of several cases in the Navy where acquaintances had furloughs after 5 weeks basic. We have 13 weeks, which is almost up, yet no knows if or when we will get furloughs.
S64.Q97.C_1: No. 2 I believer officers in the field should not demand comforts their men can't have yet it has been done several times in our outfit.
S64.Q97.Full: 1. I think the army is lax as far as furloughs go. A man in other branches of the service usually have furloughs immediately after basic, but a soldier never knows where he stands. No one can ever tell him definitely when furloughs will be issued. I know of several cases in the Navy where acquaintances had furloughs after 5 weeks basic. We have 13 weeks, which is almost up, yet no knows if or when we will get furloughs. No. 2 I believer officers in the field should not demand comforts their men can't have yet it has been done several times in our outfit.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Well, I'll be 35 years old, and can't take it like the young felllows's [fellows] . I could do a lot more, working in a factory. The army life is alright [all right] , but not for older fellow's [fellows]
S64.Q97.Full: Well, I'll be 35 years old, and can't take it like the young felllows's [fellows] . I could do a lot more, working in a factory. The army life is alright [all right] , but not for older fellow's [fellows]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I think we should get a furlough at least every three months. [paragraph] Why are the waacs in the army for? Why should we soldiers do K.P. [paragraph] The prices at the P.X. are too high. Is there anything the government can do about that.
S64.Q97.C_1: They should be places for soldiers to sleep when he goes to town. Instead of having to sleep in parks. Soldiers should have off from Saturday noon till Monday at revelly [revelry] .
S64.Q97.Full: I think we should get a furlough at least every three months. [paragraph] Why are the waacs in the army for? Why should we soldiers do K.P. [paragraph] The prices at the P.X. are too high. Is there anything the government can do about that.  They should be places for soldiers to sleep when he goes to town. Instead of having to sleep in parks. Soldiers should have off from Saturday noon till Monday at revelly [revelry] .

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: One thing I would like to say is that a soldier should be given enough furloughs to go home at least every 3 months it would make me feel much better. At least I would know how the family would be and the family would not worry like they do now. Another thing buck privates should not be the only ones to do K.P. and soldiers should be given more time for his own personal use.
S64.Q97.Full: One thing I would like to say is that a soldier should be given enough furloughs to go home at least every 3 months it would make me feel much better. At least I would know how the family would be and the family would not worry like they do now. Another thing buck privates should not be the only ones to do K.P. and soldiers should be given more time for his own personal use.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I think there is a great deal of wasted labor. Our laundry is insufficient. Not enough clothes issued. No place to buy clothing. There remains to be too much rivalry between the north and south as yet. Many have the wrong impressions. There is rivalry between different nationalities as yet. All these should be corrected.
S64.Q97.C_1: Why is it so difficult to transfer from one outfit to another after basic training? there is too much contradiction always.
S64.Q97.Full: I think there is a great deal of wasted labor. Our laundry is insufficient. Not enough clothes issued. No place to buy clothing. There remains to be too much rivalry between the north and south as yet. Many have the wrong impressions. There is rivalry between different nationalities as yet. All these should be corrected. Why is it so difficult to transfer from one outfit to another after basic training? there is too much contradiction always.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: There is one thing that I have noticed and which I don't agree upon. When a civilian is inducted into the army he is sent far away from home. I found that this is a great gripe among the soldiers. I believe that if I was stationed nearer to home I would enjoy army life. I believe that absence from there loved ones
S64.Q97.C_1: make it harder on a soldier. If a soldier could see his wife or family at least once a month he would make a better and more contented soldier.
S64.Q97.Full: There is one thing that I have noticed and which I don't agree upon. When a civilian is inducted into the army he is sent far away from home. I found that this is a great gripe among the soldiers. I believe that if I was stationed nearer to home I would enjoy army life. I believe that absence from there loved ones make it harder on a soldier. If a soldier could see his wife or family at least once a month he would make a better and more contented soldier.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I just want the damn thing to be over that all.
S64.Q97.Full: I just want the damn thing to be over that all.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I was told that the Army gives you a chance at what you think you would be more good at, but I found out differently. I've allways wanted the Air Corps. but can't even seem to get a chance at it. So I only wish something is done about this not for me but for others as well.
S64.Q97.Full: I was told that the Army gives you a chance at what you think you would be more good at, but I found out differently. I've allways wanted the Air Corps. but can't even seem to get a chance at it. So I only wish something is done about this not for me but for others as well.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Due to the fact that lots of field problems and so forth come on pass nights we can't go out. I think this can't good for the morale. I f we worked all through the week going through extensive training in the field we should be rewarded by week-end liberation. That is to say if the work done was satisfactory. The transportation facilities used on weekend liberties are horrible. If one has
S64.Q97.C_1: a 6 hour pass he spends 4 hrs of it standing in bus lines. The food is all right.
S64.Q97.Full: Due to the fact that lots of field problems and so forth come on pass nights we can't go out. I think this can't good for the morale. I f we worked all through the week going through extensive training in the field we should be rewarded by week-end liberation. That is to say if the work done was satisfactory. The transportation facilities used on weekend liberties are horrible. If one has a 6 hour pass he spends 4 hrs of it standing in bus lines. The food is all right.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think that the Army spends thousands of dollars foolishly take one thing is these Special Service [unclear] bioneses [/unclear] they have taken us an well you are suppose to go for entertainment you go in G I Trucks sleep on the ground have to be in at 12:00 have to stand roll call the same as if you were in Camp & none of the men like them but still they insist on having them.
S64.Q97.C_1: Another thing my wife is going to have a baby and I want you to tell me how a mother & little baby can live on $62.00 a month However I am proud to be in Uncle Sams army & to fight for him & wear his uniform. What I hope is that it is over soon & we can all go back home. [paragraph] I don't think that every man get's an equal break either to much politics played in this Army to many favors shown to men that don't deserve them.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that the Army spends thousands of dollars foolishly take one thing is these Special Service [unclear] bioneses [/unclear] they have taken us an well you are suppose to go for entertainment you go in G I Trucks sleep on the ground have to be in at 12:00 have to stand roll call the same as if you were in Camp & none of the men like them but still they insist on having them.  Another thing my wife is going to have a baby and I want you to tell me how a mother & little baby can live on $62.00 a month However I am proud to be in Uncle Sams army & to fight for him & wear his uniform. What I hope is that it is over soon & we can all go back home. [paragraph] I don't think that every man get's an equal break either to much politics played in this Army to many favors shown to men that don't deserve them.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I would like to go home before me brother goes into the army August the 24, 1943. I would like to see him or I'll never see him again or after the war is over. See what you can do for me. O.K.
S64.Q97.Full: I would like to go home before me brother goes into the army August the 24, 1943. I would like to see him or I'll never see him again or after the war is over. See what you can do for me. O.K.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I believe the Army places too much stress on formal education in selecting candidates for A.S.T.P. I speak from a selfish viewpoint because I have only 3 yrs. of high school education, but on the Army General Classification test I got a mark of 142 and I have a few years of administration work behind me. I feel that I should at least be allowed to
S64.Q97.C_1: take a competitive test to see whether I deserve to go or not. The way it stands now, I am absolutely prohibited from making such application by reason of my lack of schooling. I have shown an aptitude for learning new things quickly and surely through my training up to now, and my instructors (officers and non-coms [non-commissioned officers] ) admit the fact freely. I also hold the belief that Company Commanders should be more readily accessible to his men. [paragraph] I further believe that the Army should make better use of its present classification system. Quite often, it ignores the facts as presented, or is at least very careless
S64.Q97.Full: I believe the Army places too much stress on formal education in selecting candidates for A.S.T.P. I speak from a selfish viewpoint because I have only 3 yrs. of high school education, but on the Army General Classification test I got a mark of 142 and I have a few years of administration work behind me. I feel that I should at least be allowed to take a competitive test to see whether I deserve to go or not. The way it stands now, I am absolutely prohibited from making such application by reason of my lack of schooling. I have shown an aptitude for learning new things quickly and surely through my training up to now, and my instructors (officers and non-coms [non-commissioned officers] ) admit the fact freely. I also hold the belief that Company Commanders should be more readily accessible to his men. [paragraph] I further believe that the Army should make better use of its present classification system. Quite often, it ignores the facts as presented, or is at least very careless

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I have two other brothers in the service & my allotment isn't enough to help the family which is pretty large. I suggest more allotment money. {paragraph} I sure can use a furlough that's the thing that builds up {underline}morale{underline} both at home & in the service. Keep the U. S. O. Clubs, canteens etc. Give us more furloughs.
S64.Q97.C_1: How about treating the soldier who's father is in German & [underline] Italian [/underline] the same as anyone else his is fighting for this country too. & don't be a scared to give him a promotion. [paragraph] I don't like the idea of working after hours, sometimes. We like a couple of hours to write letters or see a movie, etc. [paragraph] I can't see why they let us train in hot weather. We will do more training & hard training in cooler [deletion] weather [/deletion] climate.
S64.Q97.Full: I have two other brothers in the service & my allotment isn't enough to help the family which is pretty large. I suggest more allotment money. {paragraph} I sure can use a furlough that's the thing that builds up {underline}morale{underline} both at home & in the service. Keep the U. S. O. Clubs, canteens etc. Give us more furloughs. How about treating the soldier who's father is in German & [underline] Italian [/underline] the same as anyone else his is fighting for this country too. & don't be a scared to give him a promotion. [paragraph] I don't like the idea of working after hours, sometimes. We like a couple of hours to write letters or see a movie, etc. [paragraph] I can't see why they let us train in hot weather. We will do more training & hard training in cooler [deletion] weather [/deletion] climate.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: I have had my fair share of passes, only in 3 months and 3 weeks.
S64.Q97.F: About putting a man in his right place in the Army. I wanted the Medical Corps myself. When I came to the Reception Centre and was asked what I had been doing. I told them I had been a student, and was getting ready for college to become a dr [doctor] The fellow disregarded this and asked me if I ever drove a truck I told him no. He put me down as a
S64.Q97.C_1: truck driver. Now if the fellows got in the branch of the service they were studying before the war I am sure they would be much happier. I know I would. I think a greater effort to place men according to their standards ought to be made. I also think people in the service ought to be trained in the climate they have lived in. They will surely learn more this way. Soldiers should get more free amusements - dances, movies, shows, etc. Also more chance to have recreational games such as basketball, baseball, swimming, etc.
S64.Q97.Full: About putting a man in his right place in the Army. I wanted the Medical Corps myself. When I came to the Reception Centre and was asked what I had been doing. I told them I had been a student, and was getting ready for college to become a dr [doctor] The fellow disregarded this and asked me if I ever drove a truck I told him no. He put me down as a  truck driver. Now if the fellows got in the branch of the service they were studying before the war I am sure they would be much happier. I know I would. I think a greater effort to place men according to their standards ought to be made. I also think people in the service ought to be trained in the climate they have lived in. They will surely learn more this way. Soldiers should get more free amusements - dances, movies, shows, etc. Also more chance to have recreational games such as basketball, baseball, swimming, etc.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs no one has had furloughs.
S64.Q97.F: I usually get a pass on pass nights if I want it, but I would like to be stationed near enough home to be able to go home once in a while. A married man likes to see his wife some of the time.
S64.Q97.Full: I usually get a pass on pass nights if I want it, but I would like to be stationed near enough home to be able to go home once in a while. A married man likes to see his wife some of the time.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I would say that the morales of any outfit depends on officers, recreation and privileges men like. When men can go to town nights and is free his morale is high. But as soon as they restrict you to camp to two nights a week and then when Sunday comes the Army has a convoy trip planned to some city for the boys and it is compulsory
S64.Q97.C_1: for every one to go regardless if your wife is here or you dont care to go or wether your broke you still go. I think as fast as the army is training now. A man should have evenings and week ends to them selves while in training without some Special Service Officer planning a week end trip and making it compulosory. Some boys in the U.S. Army get several furloughs a year but all the outfits I have ever been in a furlough was some thing that came from heaven.
S64.Q97.Full: I would say that the morales of any outfit depends on officers, recreation and privileges men like. When men can go to town nights and is free his morale is high. But as soon as they restrict you to camp to two nights a week and then when Sunday comes the Army has a convoy trip planned to some city for the boys and it is compulsory  for every one to go regardless if your wife is here or you dont care to go or wether your broke you still go. I think as fast as the army is training now. A man should have evenings and week ends to them selves while in training without some Special Service Officer planning a week end trip and making it compulosory. Some boys in the U.S. Army get several furloughs a year but all the outfits I have ever been in a furlough was some thing that came from heaven.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: My wife child and mother can not live on what they receive from the Government and at my age and on limited service I see no advancement for me for more money.
S64.Q97.Full: My wife child and mother can not live on what they receive from the Government and at my age and on limited service I see no advancement for me for more money.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think a lot of this army of ours and I will stick with it as long as they need me to help protect it. There is just one thing I want and that is a furlough. I think that if I got one, I could do more efficient and better work than I have been doing. Of course I have been doing good work; but once in a while my mind happens to wander back home. If I could just go home
S64.Q97.C_1: for a few days, I could come back and really show Uncle Sam what I am made of. [paragraph] I was born in this country and I must say that I have been leading a very good life here and intend to keep it that way, in order to do so, when we go overseas, I am going to do my very best of fighting. [paragraph] This is no one man's army and we should play ball together. After all, we live together, work together, sleep and share our trouble with each other. I feel that we can make a very good combat team and go over there and give the axis a good clearing up. [paragraph] Just one more thing, we should have more recreation for all the service men.
S64.Q97.Full: I think a lot of this army of ours and I will stick with it as long as they need me to help protect it. There is just one thing I want and that is a furlough. I think that if I got one, I could do more efficient and better work than I have been doing. Of course I have been doing good work; but once in a while my mind happens to wander back home. If I could just go home  for a few days, I could come back and really show Uncle Sam what I am made of. [paragraph] I was born in this country and I must say that I have been leading a very good life here and intend to keep it that way, in order to do so, when we go overseas, I am going to do my very best of fighting. [paragraph] This is no one man's army and we should play ball together. After all, we live together, work together, sleep and share our trouble with each other. I feel that we can make a very good combat team and go over there and give the axis a good clearing up. [paragraph] Just one more thing, we should have more recreation for all the service men.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I like this Army a lot but would like to go across soon to get this war over with. When we go over it going to be pretty hot on our enemy.
S64.Q97.Full: I like this Army a lot but would like to go across soon to get this war over with. When we go over it going to be pretty hot on our enemy.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: The transportation is terrible to nearby towns. The noncoms relisted are not offering the best men but some of them are what you would call sucking around officers and higher noncoms. K.P. is the most hated detail in camp, recently one bunch of fellows worked from 6 o'clock Friday morning till 2 o'clock Saturday morning. The cooks and new sergeant are very aggravating at times. Everyone does not get to do K.P. as others.
S64.Q97.Full: The transportation is terrible to nearby towns. The noncoms relisted are not offering the best men but some of them are what you would call sucking around officers and higher noncoms. K.P. is the most hated detail in camp, recently one bunch of fellows worked from 6 o'clock Friday morning till 2 o'clock Saturday morning. The cooks and new sergeant are very aggravating at times. Everyone does not get to do K.P. as others.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I should not be in the Army because my father needs me home with him and the lady I live with she is crippel {crippled}. My and I brought [bought] a house, now that I am in the Army my father has to pay for it all. I would like to get a discharge from the Army if I can
S64.Q97.Full: I should not be in the Army because my father needs me home with him and the lady I live with she is crippel {crippled}. My and I brought [bought] a house, now that I am in the Army my father has to pay for it all. I would like to get a discharge from the Army if I can

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Why I say thing are a little worse. I am worried and have a child if I could be home it would be better. But here the whole thing in a nut shell in the best army in the world but us boys are over here have it nice. We should not say anything about what they tell us to do. Them boys themt [that are] fighting got do a lot they are told or pay the [pentely] penalty.
S64.Q97.Full: Why I say thing are a little worse. I am worried and have a child if I could be home it would be better. But here the whole thing in a nut shell in the best army in the world but us boys are over here have it nice. We should not say anything about what they tell us to do. Them boys themt [that are] fighting got do a lot they are told or pay the [pentely] penalty.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I would like to get furloughs. I think we should get them every 4 month. I haven't got a any since I have been in the Army.
S64.Q97.Full: I would like to get furloughs. I think we should get them every 4 month. I haven't got a any since I have been in the Army.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Maybe if we were given good food & had good non coms & officers people wouldn't mind staying in the army. Since I left some my family haven't been making out good. In fact my family almost starved a month ago. Maybe if this country kept their noses clean there wouldnt be any unnecessary killing. You claim that the army has the best doctors & medicine well thats a lie. I was almost dying with pains one day & I went to the dispensary all they
S64.Q97.C_1: did was put me in a hospital for four days. They wouldn't xray me because they were afraid they might find something wrong with me. I am now called a goldbricker by the first sargeant & the medical St. [Sergeant] . They won't let me go on sick call any more. If it weren't for my parents & my girlfriend I would go over the hill. I have to take to [too] much for a lousy $20 a month. They won't give me a transfer to another outfit. A week after this war is over I'm going home and so are many more like me. I'm not a fasciast [fascist] [.] I think I [I've] suffered enough[.] I don't see the sense in duping us in {into} the army. 6 months after the war.[,] Let us go home & draft these defense[unclear] was [/unclear] sent big shots who are laughing at us. Why not let some of us boys go from the army to the Navy[,] Coast Guard or Merchant Marines. Another thing I don't know why to send us Northerners up South & send the Southerners down North. Why not let us stay up North. That is all I have to say.
S64.Q97.Full: Maybe if we were given good food & had good non coms & officers people wouldn't mind staying in the army. Since I left some my family haven't been making out good. In fact my family almost starved a month ago. Maybe if this country kept their noses clean there wouldnt be any unnecessary killing. You claim that the army has the best doctors & medicine well thats a lie. I was almost dying with pains one day & I went to the dispensary all they did was put me in a hospital for four days. They wouldn't xray me because they were afraid they might find something wrong with me. I am now called a goldbricker by the first sargeant & the medical St. [Sergeant] . They won't let me go on sick call any more. If it weren't for my parents & my girlfriend I would go over the hill. I have to take to [too] much for a lousy $20 a month. They won't give me a transfer to another outfit. A week after this war is over I'm going home and so are many more like me. I'm not a fasciast [fascist] [.] I think I [I've] suffered enough[.] I don't see the sense in duping us in {into} the army. 6 months after the war.[,] Let us go home & draft these defense[unclear] was [/unclear] sent big shots who are laughing at us. Why not let some of us boys go from the army to the Navy[,] Coast Guard or Merchant Marines. Another thing I don't know why to send us Northerners up South & send the Southerners down North. Why not let us stay up North. That is all I have to say.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Things would be alright if it wasn't for the officers of high jackets. With my officer at command. The men in this company are mostly ready for combat. In fact they should move us in cars. In fact that was the information the last war. For in the last war not many were prepared for it. And the officer
S64.Q97.C_1: are talking of going overseas. That's the best way to break up the morale. And as for the morale in this outfit I don't think there is any. If a private is low enough to act as a servant to the higher officers he has a chance for a rating. As long as I feel the way I do now, I don't care if I ever get a rating as long as I feel that I am a good soldier and will be awfully happy when this thing is all over when people can live like human beings once again. Amen
S64.Q97.Full: Things would be alright if it wasn't for the officers of high jackets. With my officer at command. The men in this company are mostly ready for combat. In fact they should move us in cars. In fact that was the information the last war. For in the last war not many were prepared for it. And the officer  are talking of going overseas. That's the best way to break up the morale. And as for the morale in this outfit I don't think there is any. If a private is low enough to act as a servant to the higher officers he has a chance for a rating. As long as I feel the way I do now, I don't care if I ever get a rating as long as I feel that I am a good soldier and will be awfully happy when this thing is all over when people can live like human beings once again. Amen

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: In referring to my answers, I most sincerely am speaking about this outfit which I am now in. Their rule and regulations do not meet up with the same of other organizations. It seems to us the soldiers at the Battalion commanders or higher-ups of this organization are looking for pats on the backs or shall I say the glory of it all instead of being a little more human to us boys who have given up everything in life to give our all in this hell of a mess which has caused a
S64.Q97.C_1: a lot of hardships and sacrifices to all. We are tramps to there [their] guys who make us sweat and squirm in this tropical heat with no thought of leniency or let-up during the [insertion] hot [/insertion] summer days. This basic training was the most severe I've heard of although thank God! - I pulled through it all with only one thought in mind - I only hope that some day these men of the higher brackets will realize what harm other than good they are doing to the boys of the USA which I [insertion] am [/insertion] most certain will win the war but not through the spirits of these men but rather through the love for their country and the ones they left unwillingly believed. [paragraph] Gentlemen, I leave you with this one thought [insertion] in mind [/insertion] by John Masefield - [paragraph] Theirs be the music, the color, the glory, the gold Mine be a handful of ashes, a mouthful of mold. Of the maimed, of the halt - in the rain and the cold Of these shall my songs be fashioned - my tales be told.
S64.Q97.Full: In referring to my answers, I most sincerely am speaking about this outfit which I am now in. Their rule and regulations do not meet up with the same of other organizations. It seems to us the soldiers at the Battalion commanders or higher-ups of this organization are looking for pats on the backs or shall I say the glory of it all instead of being a little more human to us boys who have given up everything in life to give our all in this hell of a mess which has caused a  a lot of hardships and sacrifices to all. We are tramps to there [their] guys who make us sweat and squirm in this tropical heat with no thought of leniency or let-up during the [insertion] hot [/insertion] summer days. This basic training was the most severe I've heard of although thank God! - I pulled through it all with only one thought in mind - I only hope that some day these men of the higher brackets will realize what harm other than good they are doing to the boys of the USA which I [insertion] am [/insertion] most certain will win the war but not through the spirits of these men but rather through the love for their country and the ones they left unwillingly believed. [paragraph] Gentlemen, I leave you with this one thought [insertion] in mind [/insertion] by John Masefield - [paragraph] Theirs be the music, the color, the glory, the gold Mine be a handful of ashes, a mouthful of mold. Of the maimed, of the halt - in the rain and the cold Of these shall my songs be fashioned - my tales be told.

S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: In the army they do not give you a chance to tell them were [where] you are best fitted they just put you any old place. Like me now I have a machinest [machinist] trade and I am in very good health and they have me in the infantry were [where] i [I] could make out better if i [I] was in the army air corps ground crew than here. They push too many things [deletion] [/deletion] over on you
S64.Q97.C_1: that is not necessary. They let the moral of the unit go down to low If we were to get a fourlough once in a while i belive that this would be the best army in the world and that there wouldn't be any of this a,w,o,l, [Absent Without Leave] or desertion or any sourit of a thing like that.

They push too many things [deletion] [/deletion] over on you that is not necessary. They let the moral of the unit go down to low If we were to get a fourlough once in a while i belive that this would be the best army in the world and that there wouldn't be any of this a,w,o,l, [Absent Without Leave] or desertion or any sourit of a thing like that.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Why the hell is it, that I volunteered into the Army so as to get in the Ground Crew of the Air Corp. and they put me in the Dam [unclear] Inf [/unclear] . I know a fellow who had only 6 yrs of school and he is in the Ground crew, why the hell can't I.
S64.Q97.Full: Why the hell is it, that I volunteered into the Army so as to get in the Ground Crew of the Air Corp. and they put me in the Dam [unclear] Inf [/unclear] . I know a fellow who had only 6 yrs of school and he is in the Ground crew, why the hell can't I.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: in my opinion, I do not feel that the Army is doing as good a job as possible in the classifying of its personnel and in the appointment of jobs. It seems to me that a great deal of change men are being above around and put in any job just to fill a vacancy even through their qualifications do
S64.Q97.C_1: that jobs. And also people that seem to rate a fairly good job never (sometimes) receive the opportunity to avail themselves to the position so that they would be able to show just what they can do. All in all I do not believe the Army is fair as it should be to the good old buck privates - Details for one are never handed out on a fair and even basis -
S64.Q97.Full: in my opinion, I do not feel that the Army is doing as good a job as possible in the classifying of its personnel and in the appointment of jobs. It seems to me that a great deal of change men are being above around and put in any job just to fill a vacancy even through their qualifications do  that jobs. And also people that seem to rate a fairly good job never (sometimes) receive the opportunity to avail themselves to the position so that they would be able to show just what they can do. All in all I do not believe the Army is fair as it should be to the good old buck privates - Details for one are never handed out on a fair and even basis -

S64.Q97.Full: Passes and furloughs are given in most cases with favoritism in regards to furloughs especially.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: The men should be given a little more free time, after all we are not dogs. We want to be treated right. Isn't it enough to have only about 3.1/2 hrs a day to yourself. Instead of having 3.1/2 hrs you have about 1/2 hour. They send you for shots, physical exams, training films, wash your equipment. Nite hikes. It is not fair and at least a seven day furlough every 6 months.
S64.Q97.Full: The men should be given a little more free time, after all we are not dogs. We want to be treated right. Isn't it enough to have only about 3.1/2 hrs a day to yourself. Instead of having 3.1/2 hrs you have about 1/2 hour. They send you for shots, physical exams, training films, wash your equipment. Nite hikes. It is not fair and at least a seven day furlough every 6 months.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: As far as I am concerned the army couldn't be run any better, but I believe most of the men want this war to get over, [deletion] and [/deletion] so they can get back to civilian life.
S64.Q97.Full: As far as I am concerned the army couldn't be run any better, but I believe most of the men want this war to get over, [deletion] and [/deletion] so they can get back to civilian life.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: There are a lot of things the soldiers dislikes. Most of them could be eliminated by red tape. More time should be given to place men properly. Some have been misplaced and others suffer with them.
S64.Q97.Full: There are a lot of things the soldiers dislikes. Most of them could be eliminated by red tape. More time should be given to place men properly. Some have been misplaced and others suffer with them.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I would just like to see my wife and baby once more before I die. But the way this damn Division and I mean the 66 Division is run a man will be in Europe with his damn head blown off and never will get a furlough. And a furlough is all I want out of the mans army
S64.Q97.Full: I would just like to see my wife and baby once more before I die. But the way this damn Division and I mean the 66 Division is run a man will be in Europe with his damn head blown off and never will get a furlough. And a furlough is all I want out of the mans army

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think the army should give the boys more spare time. Every letter you get from home they ask you what you do on your spare time. The boy don't get much spare time in the army. They work you like hell.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the army should give the boys more spare time. Every letter you get from home they ask you what you do on your spare time. The boy don't get much spare time in the army. They work you like hell.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: If only something could be done to those "gold bricks" without punishing those who are working hard, it would be a good idea, cause (because) to me, a gold brick is worst (worse) than a soldier going A.W.O.L. (absent without leave). (paragraph) Now, I don't think that we get very much out of hikes. It's just a man killer, and furthermore it does more trouble than good.
S64.Q97.Full: If only something could be done to those "gold bricks" without punishing those who are working hard, it would be a good idea, cause (because) to me, a gold brick is worst (worse) than a soldier going A.W.O.L. (absent without leave). (paragraph) Now, I don't think that we get very much out of hikes. It's just a man killer, and furthermore it does more trouble than good.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Lets get rid of the political racketeers in the govt. who are becoming millionaires and get this damn war over with. There are too many who are trying to keep it going. It is a wise man that knows his country and a poor one who sits back and lets others take advantage of him. We've got to work together. Let's do it. Then we can call
S64.Q97.C_1: ourselves, brothers and Americans. Everyone has lost sight of the individual. Its to hell with you. I'm looking out for myself. Things like that should be driven out. When are we all coming to our senses and realize we've got to work together and when are we going to do something about it. Let's start right here in the armed services. Help one another. "Love thy neighbor as thyself". And do unto others as others do unto you. That is our problem. Bringing ourselves closer together as countries and nations.
S64.Q97.Full: Lets get rid of the political racketeers in the govt. who are becoming millionaires and get this damn war over with. There are too many who are trying to keep it going. It is a wise man that knows his country and a poor one who sits back and lets others take advantage of him. We've got to work together. Let's do it. Then we can call ourselves, brothers and Americans. Everyone has lost sight of the individual. Its to hell with you. I'm looking out for myself. Things like that should be driven out. When are we all coming to our senses and realize we've got to work together and when are we going to do something about it. Let's start right here in the armed services. Help one another. "Love thy neighbor as thyself". And do unto others as others do unto you. That is our problem. Bringing ourselves closer together as countries and nations.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: One thing some of the boys work hard and do their duty and get nowheres while some who are not very ambitious get ratings.
S64.Q97.Full: One thing some of the boys work hard and do their duty and get nowheres while some who are not very ambitious get ratings.

S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Three times a week overnite passes for married men restriction should not be. When you consider the money it costs to have a wife with you, that rule is unfair.
