document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think we should have a little more free time to our self. We should have less of these night problems and should get off at noon Sat as in a lot of army camps.
S64.Q97.Full: I think we should have a little more free time to our self. We should have less of these night problems and should get off at noon Sat as in a lot of army camps.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I like the army alright as far as I am concerned. Since I have to be here I am needed at home but things are somewhat better than they were except for help on the farm. I wold rather be out but being out won't win the war as far as everyone in the army is concerned. Since I am here I have decided to make the best of it. It isn't too bad at times. I like my officers and my Sergt. (Sergeant). They are O.K. (okay).
S64.Q97.C_1: I think a lot of most of the fellows in my outfit of course there are always a few whom no one likes. If everyone does his best we will come out of this war alright I think.
S64.Q97.Full: I like the army alright as far as I am concerned. Since I have to be here I am needed at home but things are somewhat better than they were except for help on the farm. I wold rather be out but being out won't win the war as far as everyone in the army is concerned. Since I am here I have decided to make the best of it. It isn't too bad at times. I like my officers and my Sergt. (Sergeant). They are O.K. (okay). I think a lot of most of the fellows in my outfit of course there are always a few whom no one likes. If everyone does his best we will come out of this war alright I think.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Better medical attention and dental. Should not be run like an "assembly line". Should have experienced men not beginners. [paragraph] Should get at least 1 furlough every 3 mon. [months] . Be more careful how new N.C.O.'s are picked. [paragraph] Some part of my outfit are
S64.Q97.C_1: very poorly managed. [paragraph] Every officer gives a different explanation. [paragraph] Not enough time to ourselves. Always something to do. [paragraph] Trying to cram to much technical training [deletion] to [/deletion] into too short a time. [paragraph] There are men in my Co. [Company] that should not be in the Infantry. (Mentaly & Physicaly). [unclear] [/unclear] poor[paragraph] selection of men. They're not selected for what they can or want to do. - But what they [underline] Army [/underline] wants them to do.
S64.Q97.Full: Better medical attention and dental. Should not be run like an "assembly line". Should have experienced men not beginners. [paragraph] Should get at least 1 furlough every 3 mon. [months] . Be more careful how new N.C.O.'s are picked. [paragraph] Some part of my outfit are  very poorly managed. [paragraph] Every officer gives a different explanation. [paragraph] Not enough time to ourselves. Always something to do. [paragraph] Trying to cram to much technical training [deletion] to [/deletion] into too short a time. [paragraph] There are men in my Co. [Company] that should not be in the Infantry. (Mentaly & Physicaly). [unclear] [/unclear] poor[paragraph] selection of men. They're not selected for what they can or want to do. - But what they [underline] Army [/underline] wants them to do.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Since voluntering into the Army my status with my family has changed quite a bit. I feel that a married man with children should be in some kind of war watch at home. He can be of just as much value as the soldier [unclear] [/unclear] in the Army.
S64.Q97.Full: Since voluntering into the Army my status with my family has changed quite a bit. I feel that a married man with children should be in some kind of war watch at home. He can be of just as much value as the soldier [unclear] [/unclear] in the Army.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Well for some of my family the war did good but for me it did not because I lost my mother I was the only one home with her and she was sick when I left she had to get up and work around the house and she died in 9 days. I was in the Army and I think I should have been put to work in a shop to help win the war and I could have my mother now.
S64.Q97.Full: Well for some of my family the war did good but for me it did not because I lost my mother I was the only one home with her and she was sick when I left she had to get up and work around the house and she died in 9 days. I was in the Army and I think I should have been put to work in a shop to help win the war and I could have my mother now.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: In general since there is a war going on I wouldn't much want to be outside now but as soon as it is over I want to be released. Also I want to be able to get a job after the war.
S64.Q97.Full: In general since there is a war going on I wouldn't much want to be outside now but as soon as it is over I want to be released. Also I want to be able to get a job after the war.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I don't mind being in the army. But I think they should put you in a place were [where] you think you can help the war cause and get this thing over as quick as possible. They should send a fellow to climate where he can do his best. They should give us fellows furlough every 3 or 4 months at the most. They
S64.Q97.C_1: could have better cooks because the [they] spoil plenty of food learning to be cooks. They shouldn't rush you through these 13 weeks of training so much. After the 13 weeks of training they should ship you to a job you are best fitted in and give you a furlough.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't mind being in the army. But I think they should put you in a place were [where] you think you can help the war cause and get this thing over as quick as possible. They should send a fellow to climate where he can do his best. They should give us fellows furlough every 3 or 4 months at the most. They could have better cooks because the [they] spoil plenty of food learning to be cooks. They shouldn't rush you through these 13 weeks of training so much. After the 13 weeks of training they should ship you to a job you are best fitted in and give you a furlough.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: In general the Army is not what it could be. The same red tape is always appearing. Personally I would not join the army under any pease time conditions. So much time is wasted. We have a plentiful supply of war material yet we lack certain items for our training. This due largely to civilian not being able to get together
S64.Q97.C_1: The Army on the other hand finds no remedies for these situations. I can understand and appropriate discipline, all good and well. But necessary conditions must be catered to. A fellow having a sick mother or dad should not be restricted to waiting until his mother or dad or even near relative is about to die before he is giving (given) permission to go and visit them. Must can and will win the war. (paragraph) As I mentioned before our Army is great, but room for a lot of improvement. With was (what is) on our minds, we should be allowed every possible pass as furlough possible. We will always come back raring to go. (paragraph) Perhaps the thing needed is a monthly or semi monthly off the record meeting between a comander (commander) and his outfit. Where John Doe can bring his problems to be straightened out. This at least would bring a demacratic (democratic) feeling with his men.
S64.Q97.Full: In general the Army is not what it could be. The same red tape is always appearing. Personally I would not join the army under any pease time conditions. So much time is wasted. We have a plentiful supply of war material yet we lack certain items for our training. This due largely to civilian not being able to get together The Army on the other hand finds no remedies for these situations. I can understand and appropriate discipline, all good and well. But necessary conditions must be catered to. A fellow having a sick mother or dad should not be restricted to waiting until his mother or dad or even near relative is about to die before he is giving (given) permission to go and visit them. Must can and will win the war. (paragraph) As I mentioned before our Army is great, but room for a lot of improvement. With was (what is) on our minds, we should be allowed every possible pass as furlough possible. We will always come back raring to go. (paragraph) Perhaps the thing needed is a monthly or semi monthly off the record meeting between a comander (commander) and his outfit. Where John Doe can bring his problems to be straightened out. This at least would bring a demacratic (democratic) feeling with his men.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I feel that any one who come into the army should be able to apply for what he wants because if you are in same things you want you will work hard. The Infantry is no place for 18 - 20 year olds. Because they are young & they ...
S64.Q97.C_1: [unclear] are [/unclear] need in jobs where [deletion] [/deletion] older men can't do. Take the air corp.
S64.Q97.Full: I feel that any one who come into the army should be able to apply for what he wants because if you are in same things you want you will work hard. The Infantry is no place for 18 - 20 year olds. Because they are young & they ... [unclear] are [/unclear] need in jobs where [deletion] [/deletion] older men can't do. Take the air corp.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: Have had no furloughs yet but [double underscore] hope{/double underscore] to (too) soon.
S64.Q97.F: Things are well except I think there is trouble in getting foodstuffs etc. I also know that that doesn't bother them. Our parents want this war to be over so they can have their boys back home again.
S64.Q97.Full: Things are well except I think there is trouble in getting foodstuffs etc. I also know that that doesn't bother them. Our parents want this war to be over so they can have their boys back home again.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I do not know if everybody in the Army is classified at their Reception Center as we were. It seems to me that new Division was opening up & they needed the men in a hurry to start Basic. Consequently we were railroaded out of the Reception Center & sent to an Infantry Division. It is my opinion that we were not classified as to our best place in the Army as regards our previous occupations, experiences, desires & likes. It would seem to me that the Army would
S64.Q97.C_1: place a man where he is best fitted. I doubt very much if it was done in our division. I may be wrong in my criticism, I do not know how the Army places its men but I can truthfully say that we were earmarked for one place only, the Infantry and our other qualifications were not taken into consideration. If the Army does things that way then I am wrong and also sorry for any unfair criticism.
S64.Q97.Full: I do not know if everybody in the Army is classified at their Reception Center as we were. It seems to me that new Division was opening up & they needed the men in a hurry to start Basic. Consequently we were railroaded out of the Reception Center & sent to an Infantry Division. It is my opinion that we were not classified as to our best place in the Army as regards our previous occupations, experiences, desires & likes. It would seem to me that the Army would place a man where he is best fitted. I doubt very much if it was done in our division. I may be wrong in my criticism, I do not know how the Army places its men but I can truthfully say that we were earmarked for one place only, the Infantry and our other qualifications were not taken into consideration. If the Army does things that way then I am wrong and also sorry for any unfair criticism.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Every place there is a 2nd Lt {Lieutenant] something always goes wrong. Especially these "90 day wonders" who have been in the Army about 3 or 4 months longer that we have and act as if they were "Generals". I believe a fellow in the Army would do a better job is he were in an outfit he choosed [chose] to be in. When a fellow comes in the Army he should be given a chance to choose his branch of the service.
S64.Q97.C_1: I think a newly drafted soldier should receive a 10-15 day furlough as soon as his Basic is over. The furlough system in the Army should pattern after the Navy. Some of the officers are to ready to dish out punishment for trivial things that don't amount to a dam. Sgts shouldn't be allowed to hand out company punishment until it has gone thru the proper hands. To much of a soldiers spare or off duty hours are taken up by things that should be put in the days schedule. Pvts and Pfc shouldn't have as much authority over men in their company. Not enough food for the amt of men. "Chow hands" are the only ones who get enough to eat. There are not enough athletic facilities withing the companies. First Sgts are to grouchy and want to dish out punishment to quick.
S64.Q97.Full: Every place there is a 2nd Lt {Lieutenant] something always goes wrong. Especially these "90 day wonders" who have been in the Army about 3 or 4 months longer that we have and act as if they were "Generals". I believe a fellow in the Army would do a better job is he were in an outfit he choosed [chose] to be in. When a fellow comes in the Army he should be given a chance to choose his branch of the service. I think a newly drafted soldier should receive a 10-15 day furlough as soon as his Basic is over. The furlough system in the Army should pattern after the Navy. Some of the officers are to ready to dish out punishment for trivial things that don't amount to a dam. Sgts shouldn't be allowed to hand out company punishment until it has gone thru the proper hands. To much of a soldiers spare or off duty hours are taken up by things that should be put in the days schedule. Pvts and Pfc shouldn't have as much authority over men in their company. Not enough food for the amt of men. "Chow hands" are the only ones who get enough to eat. There are not enough athletic facilities withing the companies. First Sgts are to grouchy and want to dish out punishment to quick.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I think the officers should be more careful who they pick for non. coms and not pick men who don't know anything about drilling and pick the men who do. because when a man who doesn't know anything about it trys to tell a person who does they have no respect or faith in the non. coms.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the officers should be more careful who they pick for non. coms and not pick men who don't know anything about drilling and pick the men who do. because when a man who doesn't know anything about it trys to tell a person who does they have no respect or faith in the non. coms.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I would like very much to get out and work in a war job plant. Please
S64.Q97.Full: I would like very much to get out and work in a war job plant. Please

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I don't see why all of a company should be punished for what one or two soldiers do, if I do something wrong I deserve the punishment not the company.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't see why all of a company should be punished for what one or two soldiers do, if I do something wrong I deserve the punishment not the company.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: This pertains as far as I know to our company. We have been here too long and none of the fellows like it here at this camp. Most of us have been here for at least six months and we don't seem to be learning what we should. All this doesn't do our morale much good. In fact
S64.Q97.C_1: I know a few who just don't care any more. I think first of all we should go to another camp and then get more training in the type of work that we're going to do over there instead of close order drill and Hiking as much as we do. I myself would rather be overseas instead of staying here and not doing anything worth while or learning anything either.
S64.Q97.Full: This pertains as far as I know to our company. We have been here too long and none of the fellows like it here at this camp. Most of us have been here for at least six months and we don't seem to be learning what we should. All this doesn't do our morale much good. In fact I know a few who just don't care any more. I think first of all we should go to another camp and then get more training in the type of work that we're going to do over there instead of close order drill and Hiking as much as we do. I myself would rather be overseas instead of staying here and not doing anything worth while or learning anything either.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think something should be done about the transportation system around a lot of the camps around the camp. There is sure not enough buses to handle the crowd of soldiers going to town on weekend passes. A good idea would be to use a few Army trucks to bring the fellows to town. Also the Army should train more and better cooks. The Army buys good food, but the way some of those darn [unclear] xx [/unclear] cooks mess it up I wouln't even
S64.Q97.C_1: feed it to the pigs. also give more furloughs. also men who live a long way from their home should be given more time to travel home on furlough. Also they should cut out all faverism (favoritism)when it comes to giving out ratings - also release all married men regardless of age, and send them to work in some vial (vital) war work. Most of them worry too much about their wifes (wives) and children to be worth anything. There still [insertion] is [/insertion] a lot of young men floted (floating) around the streets that should be drafed (drafted). Also most of the store owners in army town are a bunch of money grubers (grubers) - Also the army shouldn't not send men down to the Southern Camps most of the Southern are still fighting the Civil War and they haven't much use for a yankee -Also after a man has been overseas for a year, if possible give him a furlough, so he can visit his folks and friends, then he will feel more like fighting. I could write more, but can't think of anymore offhand.
S64.Q97.Full: I think something should be done about the transportation system around a lot of the camps around the camp. There is sure not enough buses to handle the crowd of soldiers going to town on weekend passes. A good idea would be to use a few Army trucks to bring the fellows to town. Also the Army should train more and better cooks. The Army buys good food, but the way some of those darn [unclear] xx [/unclear] cooks mess it up I wouln't even feed it to the pigs. also give more furloughs. also men who live a long way from their home should be given more time to travel home on furlough. Also they should cut out all faverism (favoritism)when it comes to giving out ratings - also release all married men regardless of age, and send them to work in some vial (vital) war work. Most of them worry too much about their wifes (wives) and children to be worth anything. There still [insertion] is [/insertion] a lot of young men floted (floating) around the streets that should be drafed (drafted). Also most of the store owners in army town are a bunch of money grubers (grubers) - Also the army shouldn't not send men down to the Southern Camps most of the Southern are still fighting the Civil War and they haven't much use for a yankee -Also after a man has been overseas for a year, if possible give him a furlough, so he can visit his folks and friends, then he will feel more like fighting. I could write more, but can't think of anymore offhand.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I think that after the war - men should be given at least one months military training every year - its (its) good for the health, body and mind of the younger generation especially. Also I sincerely believe that well (we'll) be victorious in the military field - but we must win the peace too - that's what were (we're) really fighting for - not to destroy solely for destruction's sake - but to destroy the cancerous growth of totalitarianism - we must work, plan and build in conjunction with our allies - a truly just world for all - 4 (For) freedom - and liberty, equality, and fraternity must be an actual fact and not mere dreams of idealists - it can come, we must not fail this time - or the United Nations depends the future of war and peach for generations to come.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that after the war - men should be given at least one months military training every year - its (its) good for the health, body and mind of the younger generation especially. Also I sincerely believe that well (we'll) be victorious in the military field - but we must win the peace too - that's what were (we're) really fighting for - not to destroy solely for destruction's sake - but to destroy the cancerous growth of totalitarianism - we must work, plan and build in conjunction with our allies - a truly just world for all - 4 (For) freedom - and liberty, equality, and fraternity must be an actual fact and not mere dreams of idealists - it can come, we must not fail this time - or the United Nations depends the future of war and peach for generations to come.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: Why must a soldier stay in the same camp for over six months and do the same thing over and over til [until] he gets sick of it and don't care to do his best any more [anymore] . I join [joined] the Army but in time I feel maybe it would have been better if it had took [taken] the [an] act of Congress to get me
S64.Q97.C_1: in here if a man in a company like ours could only get a job doing something for about eight hours a day in sent of this doing nothing at all. It could improve the company a whole lot and maybe the men would change there (their) minds about something and would not be so strip crazy as they are now. The sooner the war is over the happier the people will be.
S64.Q97.Full: Why must a soldier stay in the same camp for over six months and do the same thing over and over til [until] he gets sick of it and don't care to do his best any more [anymore] . I join [joined] the Army but in time I feel maybe it would have been better if it had took [taken] the [an] act of Congress to get me in here if a man in a company like ours could only get a job doing something for about eight hours a day in sent of this doing nothing at all. It could improve the company a whole lot and maybe the men would change there (their) minds about something and would not be so strip crazy as they are now. The sooner the war is over the happier the people will be.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I think I could be a much better help to are country if I was back home workin on defence work.
S64.Q97.Full: I think I could be a much better help to are country if I was back home workin on defence work.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: This is my third camp and from what I have seen the medical attention a soldier receives is not what it should be. The examinations are not thorough enough. The doctors don't seem to be interested. The quicker they can get rid of you the better. They seem to think every soldier is a ([underline] goldbrick. [/underline] ) Personally I think the medical setup is poor.
S64.Q97.Full: This is my third camp and from what I have seen the medical attention a soldier receives is not what it should be. The examinations are not thorough enough. The doctors don't seem to be interested. The quicker they can get rid of you the better. They seem to think every soldier is a ([underline] goldbrick. [/underline] ) Personally I think the medical setup is poor.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Sir: For 9 yrs I was in the Paint racket. At the Induction Center I told them so I never drove a car in civilian life, but still, "I had my Basic Training [deletion] at [/deletion] and was shipped to a mobile unit. I was and am on the "spot." We have an equipment with which to learn anything. Honestly I have not learned anything in the last 5 months. We have a company of about 125 men
S64.Q97.C_1: The equipment we have is 14 tractors and 4 jeeps for those men. How can they get to send us off to war with no knowledge of how and what to do? What they do is get us out in the hottest part of the day and give us a crazy hike. The last one we went on it was a shame. The weather is very hot down here and the Infantry has cancelled all the day hikes for night ones, but still we do ours during the day. The road-side was littered with men out from the heat. What good is this? Double-timing with g[unclear] [/unclear] with the temperature at about 125 degrees and quick time of 145 paces a minute. At this present time, the morale of this outfit is low low. As for home conditions: Have a widowed mother and a sick sister and my army pay is all they get. Its a sad sack and keeps me awake many nights staring at the ceiling just thinking. Chow is swell. All we need is plenty of training. I mean plenty of it! and we would have the finest Company in US Army!
S64.Q97.Full: Sir: For 9 yrs I was in the Paint racket. At the Induction Center I told them so I never drove a car in civilian life, but still, "I had my Basic Training [deletion] at [/deletion] and was shipped to a mobile unit. I was and am on the "spot." We have an equipment with which to learn anything. Honestly I have not learned anything in the last 5 months. We have a company of about 125 men The equipment we have is 14 tractors and 4 jeeps for those men. How can they get to send us off to war with no knowledge of how and what to do? What they do is get us out in the hottest part of the day and give us a crazy hike. The last one we went on it was a shame. The weather is very hot down here and the Infantry has cancelled all the day hikes for night ones, but still we do ours during the day. The road-side was littered with men out from the heat. What good is this? Double-timing with g[unclear] [/unclear] with the temperature at about 125 degrees and quick time of 145 paces a minute. At this present time, the morale of this outfit is low low. As for home conditions: Have a widowed mother and a sick sister and my army pay is all they get. Its a sad sack and keeps me awake many nights staring at the ceiling just thinking. Chow is swell. All we need is plenty of training. I mean plenty of it! and we would have the finest Company in US Army!

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Yes, there are too many rumours going around. Most of them have no base to it, but they do put me on edge. [paragraph] This camp is too far away from my home city. The people treat you like dogs. As soon as they see you, the price on
S64.Q97.C_1: everything is jacked up sky high. (paragraph) When you ride on busses (buses) they look something like cattle cars and slow in getting to their destination. (paragraph) But all in all I want to know, who the hell is getting all the profits. (paragraph) After everything is taken out of our pay why we have practicaly (practically) nothing to spend. (paragraph) Long Live America
S64.Q97.Full: Yes, there are too many rumours going around. Most of them have no base to it, but they do put me on edge. [paragraph] This camp is too far away from my home city. The people treat you like dogs. As soon as they see you, the price on  everything is jacked up sky high. (paragraph) When you ride on busses (buses) they look something like cattle cars and slow in getting to their destination. (paragraph) But all in all I want to know, who the hell is getting all the profits. (paragraph) After everything is taken out of our pay why we have practicaly (practically) nothing to spend. (paragraph) Long Live America

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Well I think when a man is drafted into the army they should take more time to to fit a man in a branch that he likes and best fit[t] ed for a soldier that feels that they have done all that is possible to place him is a much better soldier
S64.Q97.Full: Well I think when a man is drafted into the army they should take more time to to fit a man in a branch that he likes and best fit[t] ed for a soldier that feels that they have done all that is possible to place him is a much better soldier

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Will you please get rid of some of these war pictures. Us fellows don't have to be reminded on our time off that we are fighting a war. Get those war & propaganda pictures the hell out of here. Please
S64.Q97.Full: Will you please get rid of some of these war pictures. Us fellows don't have to be reminded on our time off that we are fighting a war. Get those war & propaganda pictures the hell out of here. Please

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q96.M_marginalia: gets better pay but food is sky high. My sisters are both working for Navy and Dad is a head guard at a defense plant. Pretty good I should say.
S64.Q97.F: The Army should develop a system like the Navy. Have periodical exams to determine non-coms (non-commissioned officers). I'm not saying this for my benefit but I have too (two) eyes and can see the guy who knows somebody or can be a good A.K. gets ahead. I could write to my Pop. He was a Capt. (Captain) in (the) Med. (Medical) Dept. (Department) and has a lot of practice. Whatever I get I know I earned so if all of us had this feeling there would be 100% better N.C. (non-commissioned officers) & soldiers. Thank you.
S64.Q97.Full: The Army should develop a system like the Navy. Have periodical exams to determine non-coms (non-commissioned officers). I'm not saying this for my benefit but I have too (two) eyes and can see the guy who knows somebody or can be a good A.K. gets ahead. I could write to my Pop. He was a Capt. (Captain) in (the) Med. (Medical) Dept. (Department) and has a lot of practice. Whatever I get I know I earned so if all of us had this feeling there would be 100% better N.C. (non-commissioned officers) & soldiers. Thank you.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: The only thing that bothers me is, why do they take men in I A and put them in a Medical outfit where they don't get a chance to do any fighting.
S64.Q97.Full: The only thing that bothers me is, why do they take men in I A and put them in a Medical outfit where they don't get a chance to do any fighting.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Our people back home is giving up food for us in the service, they all have better jobs but the tax is costing them so much it makes it awful hard for them.
S64.Q97.Full: Our people back home is giving up food for us in the service, they all have better jobs but the tax is costing them so much it makes it awful hard for them.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: When you go out on a pass there are too many things you can't do. You can't go where you want and do what you want. I should think a man on a pass could do the same things on a pass as he did in civilian life as long as he stays out of trouble and comes back when his time is up. I know of a lot of Enlisted men who while better men...
S64.Q97.C_1: in Civilian life then some Officers I have seen and know.
S64.Q97.Full: When you go out on a pass there are too many things you can't do. You can't go where you want and do what you want. I should think a man on a pass could do the same things on a pass as he did in civilian life as long as he stays out of trouble and comes back when his time is up. I know of a lot of Enlisted men who while better men... in Civilian life then some Officers I have seen and know.

S64.Q95.M_marginalia: 6 was scribbled out
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: No I have no remarks. I believe I've said just about everything I wanted to say in General.
S64.Q97.Full: No I have no remarks. I believe I've said just about everything I wanted to say in General.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: My family living conditions is been worse ever since I been in the army and I worry alot about them.
S64.Q97.Full: My family living conditions is been worse ever since I been in the army and I worry alot about them.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: We don't get three day passes & we have to be in bed at 11:00 for bedcheck.
S64.Q97.Full: We don't get three day passes & we have to be in bed at 11:00 for bedcheck.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: I have never had a pass and put furlough in close to 9 month.
S64.Q97.F: I myself have been trying my best to make a good soldier But I still think and will always thing [think] I would be doing more for the war effort by being in as on a defense job back home .
S64.Q97.Full: I myself have been trying my best to make a good soldier But I still think and will always thing [think] I would be doing more for the war effort by being in as on a defense job back home .

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think when a fellow volunteers for any branch of service such as the Air Corps he should get that position largely because he has is mind set on that. Should be more valuable to the country there than what anyone else thinks.
S64.Q97.Full: I think when a fellow volunteers for any branch of service such as the Air Corps he should get that position largely because he has is mind set on that. Should be more valuable to the country there than what anyone else thinks.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: This army would be a lot better if all the G.I. Joes were taken out. A Company Commander should be friendly with his men so that they can respect his uniform and honor the man. Men should be given promotions only when they show that they are worthy of it and not when they go[deletion] [/deletion] around doing sweet little things for the sargeants[sergeants] . Non-comms should have no say in promotion
S64.Q97.C_1: then should be given out only after this CO has looked into the mens record. When I came here from technician school I was introduced to a group of T-4's who were to be my sargeants after talking to other soldiers around the camp I learned that these T-4s have had no technical training and knew less about my type of work then I knew before I went to technician school. Because of the training I've had they seemed to resent me therefore I became uterly discusted with this whole post. Their resent however was carried further when promotion time came around. They saw to it that their pets received their stripes while technicians like myself and my friends were left out. If I tired to see the C.O. about it I'd have to get past the 1st Sgt. and he wouldn't permit me to gripe to the C.O. and if I did see the C.O. he'd just tell me to go to the Chaplin and get a T.S. slip.
S64.Q97.Full: This army would be a lot better if all the G.I. Joes were taken out. A Company Commander should be friendly with his men so that they can respect his uniform and honor the man. Men should be given promotions only when they show that they are worthy of it and not when they go[deletion] [/deletion] around doing sweet little things for the sargeants[sergeants] . Non-comms should have no say in promotion then should be given out only after this CO has looked into the mens record. When I came here from technician school I was introduced to a group of T-4's who were to be my sargeants after talking to other soldiers around the camp I learned that these T-4s have had no technical training and knew less about my type of work then I knew before I went to technician school. Because of the training I've had they seemed to resent me therefore I became uterly discusted with this whole post. Their resent however was carried further when promotion time came around. They saw to it that their pets received their stripes while technicians like myself and my friends were left out. If I tired to see the C.O. about it I'd have to get past the 1st Sgt. and he wouldn't permit me to gripe to the C.O. and if I did see the C.O. he'd just tell me to go to the Chaplin and get a T.S. slip.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: One thing is they change there [their] mind on things too often. It seems they can't get together on the same things. Then to you go on sick call and they give you some kind of a pill for a sore leg. Then to if you fall out of a hike they give you extra dutie [duty] for it. Of course there are a lot of limited service men in it And they Just can't take it like the [unclear] A1 [/unclear] men can.
S64.Q97.C_1: I sure would not[underlined] want to go over seas with this outfit. As the fellows can not get together on the same way of thinking. We have some N.C.O. that know what they are doing. Then we have some that don't. Some were made because they knew what was what and others because they were good friends of the non-com. I don't think that is the way they should be picked.
S64.Q97.Full: One thing is they change there [their] mind on things too often. It seems they can't get together on the same things. Then to you go on sick call and they give you some kind of a pill for a sore leg. Then to if you fall out of a hike they give you extra dutie [duty] for it. Of course there are a lot of limited service men in it And they Just can't take it like the [unclear] A1 [/unclear] men can. I sure would not[underlined] want to go over seas with this outfit. As the fellows can not get together on the same way of thinking. We have some N.C.O. that know what they are doing. Then we have some that don't. Some were made because they knew what was what and others because they were good friends of the non-com. I don't think that is the way they should be picked.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I believe the army of occupation after the war should be voluntary. --- I don't think O.C.S. officers are capable of the commissions they hold --- I believe a lot more could be done to get cooperation in our outfit. Little matters seem to count the most, like passes, wearing civilian shoes off post, etc. ---
S64.Q97.Full: I believe the army of occupation after the war should be voluntary. --- I don't think O.C.S. officers are capable of the commissions they hold --- I believe a lot more could be done to get cooperation in our outfit. Little matters seem to count the most, like passes, wearing civilian shoes off post, etc. ---

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Our officers think too much of themselves instead of the men. We are not given enough time for ourselves. And as is often the case in our company too many non-coms are chosen not for what they know but by who they know. [paragraph] There is too much
S64.Q97.C_1: red tape in the army. Also our officers bother too much with petty things instead of with big things. We are also restricted to much. Not enough passes or furloughs.
S64.Q97.Full: Our officers think too much of themselves instead of the men. We are not given enough time for ourselves. And as is often the case in our company too many non-coms are chosen not for what they know but by who they know. [paragraph] There is too much  red tape in the army. Also our officers bother too much with petty things instead of with big things. We are also restricted to much. Not enough passes or furloughs.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Why does the "2nd Army" only get an eight day furlough when everyone else I've ever met had from ten to fifteen, mostly fifteen.
S64.Q97.Full: Why does the "2nd Army" only get an eight day furlough when everyone else I've ever met had from ten to fifteen, mostly fifteen.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: (the question on furlough I belive every soldier should get 15 days for every 6 months in the army [deletion] [/deletion] Our company was only given 9 days ) questions on passes Our company has class A passes But do not get the [unclear] [/unclear] that a class A pass calls for I believer that noncoms should come up from the ranks and not come in the army with
S64.Q97.C_1: ratings and not the experience. I think the army wastes to much time and equipment that is unnecessary. In the ordance there is to much work done that isn't necessary. I work on trucks and cars. Have changed oil and grease and other things that are wasted that shouldn't have never been changed. Things that are wasted here are the things that are now needed in civilian life. I think that every soldier should get a chance to show just how much he knows. I don't think they are getting that chance in this company. They are put where ever someone else things [thinks] they are needed. The noncoms in this company are the first to fall out on hikes or other test we have.
S64.Q97.Full: (the question on furlough I belive every soldier should get 15 days for every 6 months in the army [deletion] [/deletion] Our company was only given 9 days ) questions on passes Our company has class A passes But do not get the [unclear] [/unclear] that a class A pass calls for I believer that noncoms should come up from the ranks and not come in the army with ratings and not the experience. I think the army wastes to much time and equipment that is unnecessary. In the ordance there is to much work done that isn't necessary. I work on trucks and cars. Have changed oil and grease and other things that are wasted that shouldn't have never been changed. Things that are wasted here are the things that are now needed in civilian life. I think that every soldier should get a chance to show just how much he knows. I don't think they are getting that chance in this company. They are put where ever someone else things [thinks] they are needed. The noncoms in this company are the first to fall out on hikes or other test we have.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: My wife is small and physically unable to work, she cannot provide for my children who are now in a Home for Children. I can only think of this situation and can never make a good job of the Army. I cannot understand with my obligations at home why I was drafted when there were single men in the files at that time. It has cost
S64.Q97.C_1: me plenty in money and has almost dissolved my own family. I feel I am being called on to make a terrific sacrifice. I feel a man of my age is beyond the combat or active duty limits and have more obligations to my family. I feel I could do 100% more in working in a war industry my mind at ease and would really be accomplishing a worthwhile bit to winning the war, taking care of my family at the same time.
S64.Q97.Full: My wife is small and physically unable to work, she cannot provide for my children who are now in a Home for Children. I can only think of this situation and can never make a good job of the Army. I cannot understand with my obligations at home why I was drafted when there were single men in the files at that time. It has cost me plenty in money and has almost dissolved my own family. I feel I am being called on to make a terrific sacrifice. I feel a man of my age is beyond the combat or active duty limits and have more obligations to my family. I feel I could do 100% more in working in a war industry my mind at ease and would really be accomplishing a worthwhile bit to winning the war, taking care of my family at the same time.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: My remarks would be on question 96. Things would of been better for me if I could of stayed home and work awhile longer. Because I had some bills that had to be taken of immediately concerning whether I had a home to live in for my wife and self. I had hospital and undertaker bills to pay. I'm only worried about my wife not myself.
S64.Q97.C_1: She my wife is not in any good of health to work and worry about me. Thats the only reasons I have.
S64.Q97.Full: My remarks would be on question 96. Things would of been better for me if I could of stayed home and work awhile longer. Because I had some bills that had to be taken of immediately concerning whether I had a home to live in for my wife and self. I had hospital and undertaker bills to pay. I'm only worried about my wife not myself.  She my wife is not in any good of health to work and worry about me. Thats the only reasons I have.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: The Army does not put a man in the job he is suited best for. I'm in the Medical and don't like it at all I'd like to be in the Air Corp, All of those 3B and 4F should run the medical outfits. Give the soldier some say, and let him make his own choice, and he will do a much better job.
S64.Q97.Full: The Army does not put a man in the job he is suited best for. I'm in the Medical and don't like it at all I'd like to be in the Air Corp, All of those 3B and 4F should run the medical outfits. Give the soldier some say, and let him make his own choice, and he will do a much better job.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I believe that all men should have a furlough before he goes overseas. It should be within 6 months of his being alerted. He should be told to ship home all small items belonging to himself, like rings, photos, non GI underclothes and such. All soldiers should be told how to conduct
S64.Q97.C_1: themselves in any foreign country. They should be given the chance of sending, to a central point, some sort of harmless souvenier of the local [unclear] [/unclear] behind the zone of communication.
S64.Q97.Full: I believe that all men should have a furlough before he goes overseas. It should be within 6 months of his being alerted. He should be told to ship home all small items belonging to himself, like rings, photos, non GI underclothes and such. All soldiers should be told how to conduct  themselves in any foreign country. They should be given the chance of sending, to a central point, some sort of harmless souvenier of the local [unclear] [/unclear] behind the zone of communication.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: Think every man should be given a 3 day pass a month to go home [insertion] if he wants it [/insertion] a week long pass is no good to most men & a 3 day pass (on a weekend) would only make him miss a day of duty & make him more satisfied with the Army in General
S64.Q97.Full: Think every man should be given a 3 day pass a month to go home [insertion] if he wants it [/insertion] a week long pass is no good to most men & a 3 day pass (on a weekend) would only make him miss a day of duty & make him more satisfied with the Army in General

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I feel that the army on the whole is run quite well, but I have also found that as in civilian life, it is composed of a number of cliques which will decide whether or not a fellow will progress depending on whether he fits into the clique or not, also that certain persons given a little authority let it go to their heads and are very hard to understand and get along with.
S64.Q97.C_1: I feel that every person no matter where he may be stationed throughout the country should be allowed to visit home before being sent overseas, and those persons in the field of combat for a long period of time should be sent home for a visit to restore their morale and the morale of their families.
S64.Q97.Full: I feel that the army on the whole is run quite well, but I have also found that as in civilian life, it is composed of a number of cliques which will decide whether or not a fellow will progress depending on whether he fits into the clique or not, also that certain persons given a little authority let it go to their heads and are very hard to understand and get along with. I feel that every person no matter where he may be stationed throughout the country should be allowed to visit home before being sent overseas, and those persons in the field of combat for a long period of time should be sent home for a visit to restore their morale and the morale of their families.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I am a married man and do not live far from camp I would like to see my wife as much as possible, because you never know how long we are going to stay here, why can't they give the married men a pass to see his wife when he is not on duty, like they do at other camps.
S64.Q97.Full: I am a married man and do not live far from camp I would like to see my wife as much as possible, because you never know how long we are going to stay here, why can't they give the married men a pass to see his wife when he is not on duty, like they do at other camps.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Its hard for my wife to live on $50.00 monthly, because of food prices.
S64.Q97.Full: Its hard for my wife to live on $50.00 monthly, because of food prices.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: The Army should give us a little more time for sport while we are stationed in forts and camps in these United States.
S64.Q97.Full: The Army should give us a little more time for sport while we are stationed in forts and camps in these United States.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: Due to the fact my father being a large side farmer I was needed at home to help farm but since I was drafted he has to let several acres lie idle. I feel as though all farmers should be discharged or released to help produce food which is very much needed at this and the time following the peace.
S64.Q97.Full: Due to the fact my father being a large side farmer I was needed at home to help farm but since I was drafted he has to let several acres lie idle. I feel as though all farmers should be discharged or released to help produce food which is very much needed at this and the time following the peace.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: We could use a lot more training in the job that we are expected to do overseas. I haven't many remarks to make but I am sure that I would like it a lot better if I were given one specific job. The way it is now we never know what we have to do the following day.
S64.Q97.Full: We could use a lot more training in the job that we are expected to do overseas. I haven't many remarks to make but I am sure that I would like it a lot better if I were given one specific job. The way it is now we never know what we have to do the following day.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I have had passes and furloughs but a lot of the boys have not and times thier would be passes when there isn't such as my wife is sick 19 wks away I received one pass to see her i 7 days (still no pass) I have been strained and had an ?? I had also sistic reumatic pains but PP pils won't cure it. Theres worse cases than mine in the companies I've had to go to & would am past the best we could but none of us would last long in combat.
S64.Q97.C_1: As for my job now is when I should be working but if they release married men as soon as the war is over I can get started again. If not I'll live and that's all. For there will be another depression and it will be worse than any so far or that's my idea.
S64.Q97.Full: I have had passes and furloughs but a lot of the boys have not and times thier would be passes when there isn't such as my wife is sick 19 wks away I received one pass to see her i 7 days (still no pass) I have been strained and had an ?? I had also sistic reumatic pains but PP pils won't cure it. Theres worse cases than mine in the companies I've had to go to & would am past the best we could but none of us would last long in combat. As for my job now is when I should be working but if they release married men as soon as the war is over I can get started again. If not I'll live and that's all. For there will be another depression and it will be worse than any so far or that's my idea.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I would rather be home than in the army because I could stand it better at home than in the dam army for I have a wife to worry about. That is enough ?? the army. It is setting me crazy. They give me so much that I am going out of my head. And I do once and awhile for I am doing things I don't know what I am doing. ?? all right now.
S64.Q97.Full: I would rather be home than in the army because I could stand it better at home than in the dam army for I have a wife to worry about. That is enough ?? the army. It is setting me crazy. They give me so much that I am going out of my head. And I do once and awhile for I am doing things I don't know what I am doing. ?? all right now.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: If more of these present army officers would learn more about their guns and equipment instead of relying too much on the shoulders of their noncoms this army of ours would be a lot better off.
S64.Q97.Full: If more of these present army officers would learn more about their guns and equipment instead of relying too much on the shoulders of their noncoms this army of ours would be a lot better off.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I have only one gripe and that is why the army should spend time and money to teach me a trade that is now overloaded when they could have used 4 years of college training and working experience to their advantage.
S64.Q97.Full: I have only one gripe and that is why the army should spend time and money to teach me a trade that is now overloaded when they could have used 4 years of college training and working experience to their advantage.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Many older draftees should be discharged from the army in order to alleviate the manpower shortage. The army is no place for a person over 38 who is accustomed to lead a civilian life. Most of them are miserable and could put more effort in their war work if they were given defense jobs. [paragraph] The problem of classification should be handled by more experienced personnel.
S64.Q97.Full: Many older draftees should be discharged from the army in order to alleviate the manpower shortage. The army is no place for a person over 38 who is accustomed to lead a civilian life. Most of them are miserable and could put more effort in their war work if they were given defense jobs. [paragraph] The problem of classification should be handled by more experienced personnel.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: 1. At every camp that I have been in, it makes me feel pretty good to know that when I salute an officer, and get a snappy return salute means something But when you do salute one and get a sloppy return salute it makes you think that he isn't a good officer. If the enlisted men are called down for poor saluting, why aren't the officers also. [paragraph] 2. A man that has 15 or more years technical training should be allowed to go into that same work in the Army. However after spending
S64.Q97.C_1: a year along the work he knows in the Army, They suddenly decide he would be a better Machine Gunner or what have you. Then when a replacement is asked for they send a 20 year old with 3 months schooling in the army, to replace a man with 15 years or more. It doesn't seem fair at all. Compulsory military training of one year for all men, immediately upon their graduation from High school would really be O.K.
S64.Q97.Full: 1. At every camp that I have been in, it makes me feel pretty good to know that when I salute an officer, and get a snappy return salute means something But when you do salute one and get a sloppy return salute it makes you think that he isn't a good officer. If the enlisted men are called down for poor saluting, why aren't the officers also. [paragraph] 2. A man that has 15 or more years technical training should be allowed to go into that same work in the Army. However after spending a year along the work he knows in the Army, They suddenly decide he would be a better Machine Gunner or what have you. Then when a replacement is asked for they send a 20 year old with 3 months schooling in the army, to replace a man with 15 years or more. It doesn't seem fair at all. Compulsory military training of one year for all men, immediately upon their graduation from High school would really be O.K.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I'm a Supply Sergeant and get a chance to see a little better than most guys what is what on [insertion] & [/insertion] how supplies are handled. I've seen $3,000,000 worth of Secret Equipment stored without guard in a tinder box of a warehouse. Waste, Hells Bells nobody in the army seems to think all this stuff costs money and will have to be paid for out of their own pocket some day. The ASF has finally woke up and is trying to do something about it with a new Stock Control System but it can't work if the Post
S64.Q97.C_1: commanders aren't on the job. Supply it seems is just something that has to be there when an outfit needs it. Cost and work mean nothing to them. It seems [deletion] [/deletion] if a job costs a few thousand yet is useless but someone can [deletion] [/deletion] get a chance for a promotion that it goes right through. Work that as far as I can see is useless to the war effort procedes merrily along with thousands of dollars pouring in it so nothing of benefit will ever come out. There is an old saying in Supply that you never order small quantities as they won't be filled always order something big that costs money and it will be delivered on time whether you need it or not. I hope to hell this thing helps you guys out. Someone ought to do a little looking around.
S64.Q97.Full: I'm a Supply Sergeant and get a chance to see a little better than most guys what is what on [insertion] & [/insertion] how supplies are handled. I've seen $3,000,000 worth of Secret Equipment stored without guard in a tinder box of a warehouse. Waste, Hells Bells nobody in the army seems to think all this stuff costs money and will have to be paid for out of their own pocket some day. The ASF has finally woke up and is trying to do something about it with a new Stock Control System but it can't work if the Post commanders aren't on the job. Supply it seems is just something that has to be there when an outfit needs it. Cost and work mean nothing to them. It seems [deletion] [/deletion] if a job costs a few thousand yet is useless but someone can [deletion] [/deletion] get a chance for a promotion that it goes right through. Work that as far as I can see is useless to the war effort procedes merrily along with thousands of dollars pouring in it so nothing of benefit will ever come out. There is an old saying in Supply that you never order small quantities as they won't be filled always order something big that costs money and it will be delivered on time whether you need it or not. I hope to hell this thing helps you guys out. Someone ought to do a little looking around.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: If civilians can work at an army post, they can also wear a uniform and get placed in accordance to their jobs. When a civilian gets 12 dollars a day and a soldier does his work, something is wrong. When inefficient officers with political pull forget about their enlisted men below them, your privates, cpls, and sgts, forget the patriotic spirit. When the officers remove their finger nail polish and abolish their walking sticks and turn into fighting men, will be in back of them.
S64.Q97.C_1: A word might be mentioned about trying to get rid of family reunions of officers and their relatives at certain army posts. (paragraph) As for me, I am in this army because I want to be. I enlisted even though I was defered (deferred) for war work. I'll always fight for democracy wherever the government thinks I an do best. If they know what the're (they're) doing I'll be happy.
S64.Q97.Full: If civilians can work at an army post, they can also wear a uniform and get placed in accordance to their jobs. When a civilian gets 12 dollars a day and a soldier does his work, something is wrong. When inefficient officers with political pull forget about their enlisted men below them, your privates, cpls, and sgts, forget the patriotic spirit. When the officers remove their finger nail polish and abolish their walking sticks and turn into fighting men, will be in back of them.  A word might be mentioned about trying to get rid of family reunions of officers and their relatives at certain army posts. (paragraph) As for me, I am in this army because I want to be. I enlisted even though I was defered (deferred) for war work. I'll always fight for democracy wherever the government thinks I an do best. If they know what the're (they're) doing I'll be happy.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: It will always stick in my mind the fact I tried to enlist in the Air Corps & The Draft board wouldnt release me, then they drafted me & stuck me in the Infantry.
S64.Q97.Full: It will always stick in my mind the fact I tried to enlist in the Air Corps & The Draft board wouldnt release me, then they drafted me & stuck me in the Infantry.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Conditions at home are the only reason for my feeling like I do about getting our of the Army into war plant work. The army doesn't seem to take into consideration the hardships that are caused men with families because of shortage in pay.
S64.Q97.Full: Conditions at home are the only reason for my feeling like I do about getting our of the Army into war plant work. The army doesn't seem to take into consideration the hardships that are caused men with families because of shortage in pay.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I am not much of a soldier on account of my arm and back, there is very little I can do. I cannot put any pressure on my arm at all. I have pain in my arm whenever I use it to much, and my weak back is from a fall I had when I was a child. So you see, I am not much of a soldier. I cannot do the regular army routines or my drilling.
S64.Q97.Full: I am not much of a soldier on account of my arm and back, there is very little I can do. I cannot put any pressure on my arm at all. I have pain in my arm whenever I use it to much, and my weak back is from a fall I had when I was a child. So you see, I am not much of a soldier. I cannot do the regular army routines or my drilling.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Yes I have been given 2 pr of GI Glasses and none fit even the ones made from my prescription do not fit. I also has been given some type of powders to help my sneezing but are not worth a -. I would like to get home and have my treatments cont, cause they have helped me.
S64.Q97.Full: Yes I have been given 2 pr of GI Glasses and none fit even the ones made from my prescription do not fit. I also has been given some type of powders to help my sneezing but are not worth a -. I would like to get home and have my treatments cont, cause they have helped me.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I don't like the way the food is handled in our battalion. Our battery cooks say the split-up of the battalion food is handled by Hq Btry men who see that their own outfit get the pick of the provisions. If an officer were to be present and supervise, this could not happen and our chow would be improved to a great extent. I think the recreational facilities provided by the army at this post are splendid. The
S64.Q97.C_1: service clubs, movies, day rooms and the USO[United Service Organizations] help enormously to create diversion for the soldiers. [paragraph] I think the War Dept should get after the Telephone Co to cut their rates. Most every service (Railroads, amusements etc) have cut their rates for soldiers but the Telephone Co and Western Union insist on their pound of flesh. Certainly arrangements could be made whereby soldiers could get a liberal discount for calls over 500 miles from home.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't like the way the food is handled in our battalion. Our battery cooks say the split-up of the battalion food is handled by Hq Btry men who see that their own outfit get the pick of the provisions. If an officer were to be present and supervise, this could not happen and our chow would be improved to a great extent. I think the recreational facilities provided by the army at this post are splendid. The service clubs, movies, day rooms and the USO[United Service Organizations] help enormously to create diversion for the soldiers. [paragraph] I think the War Dept should get after the Telephone Co to cut their rates. Most every service (Railroads, amusements etc) have cut their rates for soldiers but the Telephone Co and Western Union insist on their pound of flesh. Certainly arrangements could be made whereby soldiers could get a liberal discount for calls over 500 miles from home.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M_marginalia: for the civilian
S64.Q97.F: I don't agree with a bottery Commander who shows partiality that is outstanding such as happens [unclear] here [/unclear] . I have heard that regardless of how good a man is in his battery he will not be made, unless the Battery C.[Commander] likes him. [paragraph] The soldiers pay is not enough when supporting a wife & trying to keep up with civilian prices, the difference is too great & something should be done. [paragraph] And the ratings are not fair in this outfit
S64.Q97.Full: I don't agree with a bottery Commander who shows partiality that is outstanding such as happens [unclear] here [/unclear] . I have heard that regardless of how good a man is in his battery he will not be made, unless the Battery C.[Commander] likes him. [paragraph] The soldiers pay is not enough when supporting a wife & trying to keep up with civilian prices, the difference is too great & something should be done. [paragraph] And the ratings are not fair in this outfit

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: A fella in the Army should be given a better chance to do the kind of work he's better fitted for. Thereby he can do better for himself and world progress. After the war he can hold his trade as before. He won't have as much difficulty in resuming civilian life. I myself have a job in this army that is entirely out of my line and as ...
S64.Q97.C_1: Time goes on when the war is over. It will be very difficult for me to get a job of this type. If I were a civilian I could be getting education that would help me along in my future life to come with my wife etc. Many men that are fitted for jobs in the army are placed in something they know nothing about where others unfitted for jobs they could do replace them. So it goes. A job I could do is taken by someone who knows little about it. [paragraph] Soldiers that are good talkers usually get a rating while those who can not usually stay behind. [paragraph] The united States is taking too much time in getting this war over. The longer they stall around the harder it will be to take over
S64.Q97.Full: A fella in the Army should be given a better chance to do the kind of work he's better fitted for. Thereby he can do better for himself and world progress. After the war he can hold his trade as before. He won't have as much difficulty in resuming civilian life. I myself have a job in this army that is entirely out of my line and as ... Time goes on when the war is over. It will be very difficult for me to get a job of this type. If I were a civilian I could be getting education that would help me along in my future life to come with my wife etc. Many men that are fitted for jobs in the army are placed in something they know nothing about where others unfitted for jobs they could do replace them. So it goes. A job I could do is taken by someone who knows little about it. [paragraph] Soldiers that are good talkers usually get a rating while those who can not usually stay behind. [paragraph] The united States is taking too much time in getting this war over. The longer they stall around the harder it will be to take over

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I may be prejudiced, but I think more accent should be put on Personnel units of every outfit. I am a battery clerk and have worked extremely hard for 9 months in my job and because of its technicalities have only now been given a specialist serial number at the job. Also a battery or company clerk should be more highly rated compared to other non-coms with easier jobs that require less skill.
S64.Q97.Full: I may be prejudiced, but I think more accent should be put on Personnel units of every outfit. I am a battery clerk and have worked extremely hard for 9 months in my job and because of its technicalities have only now been given a specialist serial number at the job. Also a battery or company clerk should be more highly rated compared to other non-coms with easier jobs that require less skill.
