S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: they have some soldiers in the army such as my self that are unfit for army Duties
S64.Q97.Full: they have some soldiers in the army such as my self that are unfit for army Duties

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: The government ought to let all the limited servicemen go home where they can help their families & do more good for the government instead of letting the government waste its money. Most of the L.S. men cannot earn the money being spent on them in the army; But can save the government money by being a civilian.
S64.Q97.Full: The government ought to let all the limited servicemen go home where they can help their families & do more good for the government instead of letting the government waste its money. Most of the L.S. men cannot earn the money being spent on them in the army; But can save the government money by being a civilian.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: This Barrage Balloon Outfit is of no use up hear (here), The officers treat some of the men worse than dogs. Their Court Marshall (Martial) are one of the most unfairest things I've ever seen, because favoritism is shown. (paragraph) The enlisted men up hear (here) would rather go over seas (overseas) than stay hear (here). Because most of the men have brothers over there and they would rather be over with them doing their share. In stead (Instead) of staying hear (here).
S64.Q97.C_1: We have been classified as 1B, but I'm sure If [if] we were given the right training we can make a good [unclear] account [/unclear] four ourselves as a unit, and Individually [individually] . We weren't given any training at all? [.] Some non coms were made because of some [unclear] more [/unclear] brown nosing with the Lieutenants [lieutenants] . The officers have told us we are not soldiers but a "Working Battalion" but if we get picked up by an M.P. they though [throw] the book at us like a soldier gets in the Infantry [infantry] and its [it's] not fair. We are from the North and our officers are from the South and their [they're] still fighting the Civil War. If we complain about [unclear] our [/unclear] food we get KP for complaining. Now is that fair? I personally, and [am] very dissatisfied with this outfit and not the Army itself. Im [I'm] sure If we were given the opportunity to go overseas anyone would go or want to go. This isn't enough room [unclear] here [/unclear] for me to write everything I want to and any way it won't do us any good. It's mostly that way. But just to write some of my Bitches makes me feel better Truly yours A Dissatisfied solider [unclear] infanty [/unclear] [unclear] [/unclear]

The officers have told us we are not soldiers but a "Working Battalion" but if we get picked up by an M.P. they though [throw] the book at us like a soldier gets in the Infantry [infantry] and its [it's] not fair. We are from the North and our officers are from the South and their [they're] still fighting the Civil War. If we complain about [unclear] our [/unclear] food we get KP for complaining. Now is that fair? I personally, and [am] very dissatisfied with this outfit and not the Army itself. Im [I'm] sure If we were given the opportunity to go overseas anyone would go or want to go. This isn't enough room [unclear] here [/unclear] for me to write everything I want to and any way it won't do us any good. It's mostly that way. But just to write some of my Bitches makes me feel better Truly yours A Dissatisfied solider [unclear] infanty [/unclear] [unclear] [/unclear]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Why must man as he progresses the paths of history continually detour into the ironies of War and bloodshed; His accomplishments destroyed, his field laid waste and his shining Danubes befouled by gory pollution. Can there not be an answer in the cooperation of all the peoples of the world toward a lasting peace, based on the principles of liberty and justice for all?
S64.Q97.Full: Why must man as he progresses the paths of history continually detour into the ironies of War and bloodshed; His accomplishments destroyed, his field laid waste and his shining Danubes befouled by gory pollution. Can there not be an answer in the cooperation of all the peoples of the world toward a lasting peace, based on the principles of liberty and justice for all?

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: If I get out of the Army when the war ends, I plan on joining the Marines. I intended to do so, before coming into the Army, but the draft board beat me to it.
S64.Q97.Full: If I get out of the Army when the war ends, I plan on joining the Marines. I intended to do so, before coming into the Army, but the draft board beat me to it.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I don't have a remark to make I am satisfied if I was out in civilian life I wouldn't be satisfied till the war was over.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't have a remark to make I am satisfied if I was out in civilian life I wouldn't be satisfied till the war was over.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Some of my answers probably will make you think very little of me as a soldier but I can never agree with the army in several points and won't stay in it no longer than I have to.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: My attitude toward the army is probably wrong, but I can truthfully say the[unclear] that [/unclear] I as a fighter will do my best and will come out with the best of them - but I will never be a good soldier.
S64.Q97.Full: My attitude toward the army is probably wrong, but I can truthfully say the[unclear] that [/unclear] I as a fighter will do my best and will come out with the best of them - but I will never be a good soldier.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I don't think its right for an officer or non-com to act the way they do. Right here in camp I only know of one officer and about three non-coms. The felows here say if they ever get into combat with them he'd be the first one to shoot. I think its up to the officer to treat us like human beings after all when going into combat with him later and then best thing he could do is to treat us
S64.Q97.C_1: Just like he is expected to be treated. After all he is treated fairly well by us and in time we would like to have that returned to us. There aren't many like that but the few there are the more we get to hate them. I think we have a swell bunch of fellows and the officers are also swell. I believe we should have more time to ?? than we are allowed now.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't think its right for an officer or non-com to act the way they do. Right here in camp I only know of one officer and about three non-coms. The felows here say if they ever get into combat with them he'd be the first one to shoot. I think its up to the officer to treat us like human beings after all when going into combat with him later and then best thing he could do is to treat us Just like he is expected to be treated. After all he is treated fairly well by us and in time we would like to have that returned to us. There aren't many like that but the few there are the more we get to hate them. I think we have a swell bunch of fellows and the officers are also swell. I believe we should have more time to ?? than we are allowed now.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Other/No answer
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: Have not finished basic
S64.Q97.F: I think the men would be happier if they were told a little about what they will do from one day till the next. [paragraph] [unclear] Their [/unclear] are also sone Non Coms[Non Commissioned Officers] that don't know much about men that the officers don't know about. And one will tell you to do something a certain way then another one will jump all over you for doing
S64.Q97.C_1: it that way as he has another way. [paragraph] If they run out of something to do for an hr. [hour] [insertion] sometime [/insertion] it would help the men out to give them that time off instead of some of the things they dream up.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the men would be happier if they were told a little about what they will do from one day till the next. [paragraph] [unclear] Their [/unclear] are also sone Non Coms[Non Commissioned Officers] that don't know much about men that the officers don't know about. And one will tell you to do something a certain way then another one will jump all over you for doing  it that way as he has another way. [paragraph] If they run out of something to do for an hr. [hour] [insertion] sometime [/insertion] it would help the men out to give them that time off instead of some of the things they dream up.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Well I think all of us boys would like this Army better if we could be at come Camp near home. After all I have been in this Army for 14 months and had one furlough and that was down in Calif [California} were [where] it took me 5 days to get home and 5 to go back were [where] some of the troops were home every 3 month on a 10 day Leve [leave]
S64.Q97.C_1: As far as liking the Army it good all for that I think most of the boys like it but they some time say they hate it but I dont think they do.
S64.Q97.Full: Well I think all of us boys would like this Army better if we could be at come Camp near home. After all I have been in this Army for 14 months and had one furlough and that was down in Calif [California} were [where] it took me 5 days to get home and 5 to go back were [where] some of the troops were home every 3 month on a 10 day Leve [leave]  As far as liking the Army it good all for that I think most of the boys like it but they some time say they hate it but I dont think they do.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Why is it so hard to transfer from one branch of service to another? I had eight years Radio & Radio Operating experience in civilian life. When I cam into the Army in 1941 you had to be a graduate lawyer or doctor with a degree to get into radio. Yet I had experience and forgot more radios than they knew. They get into Radar & the Signal Corps.
S64.Q97.C_1: I'm in the Infantry yet I don't seem to be able to get a transfer. Its killed here by the regiment. I honestly believe I could be of more benefit to the Army in a more technical brand of radio. The radio in this outfit is all portable-low power and very simple to operate.
S64.Q97.Full: Why is it so hard to transfer from one branch of service to another? I had eight years Radio & Radio Operating experience in civilian life. When I cam into the Army in 1941 you had to be a graduate lawyer or doctor with a degree to get into radio. Yet I had experience and forgot more radios than they knew. They get into Radar & the Signal Corps. I'm in the Infantry yet I don't seem to be able to get a transfer. Its killed here by the regiment. I honestly believe I could be of more benefit to the Army in a more technical brand of radio. The radio in this outfit is all portable-low power and very simple to operate.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I haven't time to write very much - I would like to feel that the people at home honestly and wholeheartedly believed in this war and what we're fighting for. I would like to see more reality in training. I would like to see Officers stop cheating and fighting each other because there might be a major open in the Bn [battalion]. I would make "Bucking" a violation. I would like to see men placed in responsible positions because of their proven
S64.Q97.C_1: ability and their capabilities, not because of their apparent lack of pride and character in [unclear] their [/unclear] very accomplished "kissing of asses".
S64.Q97.Full: I haven't time to write very much - I would like to feel that the people at home honestly and wholeheartedly believed in this war and what we're fighting for. I would like to see more reality in training. I would like to see Officers stop cheating and fighting each other because there might be a major open in the Bn [battalion]. I would make "Bucking" a violation. I would like to see men placed in responsible positions because of their proven ability and their capabilities, not because of their apparent lack of pride and character in [unclear] their [/unclear] very accomplished "kissing of asses".

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think the officers are moved from one company to another too much. When we get a good one he don't stay long. In place we get a 90 day wonder and most of them haven't had enough training at O.C.S.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the officers are moved from one company to another too much. When we get a good one he don't stay long. In place we get a 90 day wonder and most of them haven't had enough training at O.C.S.

S64.Q97.F: I would like to be military police so I can help better on account of have my right leg hurt and I cant do very much drill and thats why I like to be military police and about winning this war. I think we will on account the germans and japanese are getting [unclear] want [/unclear] any minute

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: There are to much polices showed in the army. Some of the 90 day wonders are no good. But the men of U.S. are the best fighters in world. [paragraph] Your Enlisted men will win this war.
S64.Q97.Full: There are to much polices showed in the army. Some of the 90 day wonders are no good. But the men of U.S. are the best fighters in world. [paragraph] Your Enlisted men will win this war.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: Generally speaking officers are good but some pull their rank, think they are better than anyone else. I would like to see the time come when rank distinction would end and everyone be buddies like enlisted men. It is good to enforce rank in duty hours to show who is boss providing it is not over done, but after duty hours be a bit sociable. A lot of men have sort of honorary commissions and aren't worth a
S64.Q97.C_1: damn. A (An) officer up from the ranks is best because he has a slant on both roles of the army. Too many officers that don't know what it is alll about and get the enlisted men against them because the feel they would not be led properly in combat. Non-coms (non-commissioned officers) are usually fair, but there are also some who made their rank by favoratism (favoritism) and say are hiring. The best non-com (non-commissioned officer) is one that can hold the respect of his men and this fact together with his knowledge and leadership should be [crossout] [crossout] be made one.
S64.Q97.Full: Generally speaking officers are good but some pull their rank, think they are better than anyone else. I would like to see the time come when rank distinction would end and everyone be buddies like enlisted men. It is good to enforce rank in duty hours to show who is boss providing it is not over done, but after duty hours be a bit sociable. A lot of men have sort of honorary commissions and aren't worth a  damn. A (An) officer up from the ranks is best because he has a slant on both roles of the army. Too many officers that don't know what it is alll about and get the enlisted men against them because the feel they would not be led properly in combat. Non-coms (non-commissioned officers) are usually fair, but there are also some who made their rank by favoratism (favoritism) and say are hiring. The best non-com (non-commissioned officer) is one that can hold the respect of his men and this fact together with his knowledge and leadership should be [crossout] [crossout] be made one.

S64.Q97.F: Well I think the army is alright if you can take it, it will make a good soldier out of you.
S64.Q97.Full: Well I think the army is alright if you can take it, it will make a good soldier out of you.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: In our outfit, we have no time during our regular hours, for sports of any kind. If we do have any sports we try to do so on our "own" time. This fault should be corrected. Some companies have TERRIBLE chow while our neighboring company eats well. They use plates while we have mess kits. Our meals would be better if they would let us use china ware at least.
S64.Q97.Full: In our outfit, we have no time during our regular hours, for sports of any kind. If we do have any sports we try to do so on our "own" time. This fault should be corrected. Some companies have TERRIBLE chow while our neighboring company eats well. They use plates while we have mess kits. Our meals would be better if they would let us use china ware at least.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Officers should be picked men who (have) already seen combat at least once.
S64.Q97.Full: Officers should be picked men who (have) already seen combat at least once.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I think our Officers should get out and do more work with the men and stop riding. Get these subjects better in their mind and stop reading out of a book and then expect the men to know it. I think our Officers should stop picking on things without having a better understanding of the things they are picking on. Give out punishment evenly and accordingly (not like I've seen it). A lot aren't fit to be Officers especially with the rank some obtain through friends.
S64.Q97.Full: I think our Officers should get out and do more work with the men and stop riding. Get these subjects better in their mind and stop reading out of a book and then expect the men to know it. I think our Officers should stop picking on things without having a better understanding of the things they are picking on. Give out punishment evenly and accordingly (not like I've seen it). A lot aren't fit to be Officers especially with the rank some obtain through friends.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: One thing I like to say is that when there is a night for entertainment I think every soldier should have the opportunity to get to go. There was plenty of night I couldn't go to a dance because of a night problem. I don't mind night problem at all, in fact I enjoyed most of them. What got most of us soldiers mad was on nights there was no entertainment in camp we
S64.Q97.C_1: would have a free night. Or night of driving & something else either we were on a night problem or on the firing range. I think the Army should try to make a schedule where it won't do any harm to hurt a soldier enjoyment and at the same time not hurting the training schedule of the Army.
S64.Q97.Full: One thing I like to say is that when there is a night for entertainment I think every soldier should have the opportunity to get to go. There was plenty of night I couldn't go to a dance because of a night problem. I don't mind night problem at all, in fact I enjoyed most of them. What got most of us soldiers mad was on nights there was no entertainment in camp we would have a free night. Or night of driving & something else either we were on a night problem or on the firing range. I think the Army should try to make a schedule where it won't do any harm to hurt a soldier enjoyment and at the same time not hurting the training schedule of the Army.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I don't think the Army gives quite enough attention to first aid & Doctor care especially in this outfit. [paragraph] The shoes are sometimes unproperly fitted & if you needed other ones they don't hurry themselves getting them for you. [paragraph] Otherwise I sort of like the Army. It will make a better frame of mind in the men's
S64.Q97.C_1: view. After the war the whole world will eventually benefit. Maybe it is better for us to lose a little more sleep than usual but I don't think it is necessary.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't think the Army gives quite enough attention to first aid & Doctor care especially in this outfit. [paragraph] The shoes are sometimes unproperly fitted & if you needed other ones they don't hurry themselves getting them for you. [paragraph] Otherwise I sort of like the Army. It will make a better frame of mind in the men's view. After the war the whole world will eventually benefit. Maybe it is better for us to lose a little more sleep than usual but I don't think it is necessary.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I can't see why the Army has so many stiff inspections. I believe every soldier will take care of his equipment without all the inspections. Give the soldiers more fun, and [unclear] Sport [/unclear] We don't get enough of it. Make his work seem interested. Give him a chance to go home more often. He will do better and like the Army better. Get some Officers that
S64.Q97.C_1: know something and will cooperate with enlisted men. Send a man where he want to go. He'll do better. Give them Passes. that one reason soldiers don't like the army they don't get enough passes and do the same thing day after day. Don't punish a man where he didn't understand something explain it to him. Good Officers mean a lot in the army.
S64.Q97.Full: I can't see why the Army has so many stiff inspections. I believe every soldier will take care of his equipment without all the inspections. Give the soldiers more fun, and [unclear] Sport [/unclear] We don't get enough of it. Make his work seem interested. Give him a chance to go home more often. He will do better and like the Army better. Get some Officers that know something and will cooperate with enlisted men. Send a man where he want to go. He'll do better. Give them Passes. that one reason soldiers don't like the army they don't get enough passes and do the same thing day after day. Don't punish a man where he didn't understand something explain it to him. Good Officers mean a lot in the army.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: My personal gripe: [paragraph] I enlisted in the Army in 43[,] was unassigned and held for Aviation Cadet training - Under new physical examination I was disqualified and was shipped out[.] I was given no basic training!!![.] felt foolish doing work with soldiers of 12-24 months experience.
S64.Q97.C_1: This "slight" error bars me from O.C.S.[officer candidate school] and all other officer [unclear] capacities [/unclear] - I had plenty of education; possibly a little too much. 2 yrs[years] of college Political Sciences Mathematics, but my platoon sgt[sergeant] has trouble signing the pay [unclear] [/unclear]
S64.Q97.Full: My personal gripe: [paragraph] I enlisted in the Army in 43[,] was unassigned and held for Aviation Cadet training - Under new physical examination I was disqualified and was shipped out[.] I was given no basic training!!![.] felt foolish doing work with soldiers of 12-24 months experience. This "slight" error bars me from O.C.S.[officer candidate school] and all other officer [unclear] capacities [/unclear] - I had plenty of education; possibly a little too much. 2 yrs[years] of college Political Sciences Mathematics, but my platoon sgt[sergeant] has trouble signing the pay [unclear] [/unclear]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)

S64.Q96.M_marginalia: My family & relatives live in several countries in Europe unfortunately I know is worse
S64.Q97.F: I hope military intelligence depart. will use some day a little liberalism and do not oppress spiritually & morally people that are ready to do & give their best for the only reason that they [deletion] [/deletion] where not born in the U.S.A. -

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: This organization is probably the worst in the army. I have no further comment.
S64.Q97.Full: This organization is probably the worst in the army. I have no further comment.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Through my experience in the army for two years I have noticed that a man over thirty or around the thirties is not good as a soldier as man from eighteen to [deletion] the [/deletion] thirty, but he could be more useful as a worker in a defense job. The way men are drafted is unfair to many people. Men over thirty years of age are unable to keep with youngsters from eighteen to thirty. So either they should be separated
S64.Q97.C_1: or not drafted. An army made of young people would help the war effort more and shorten the war for years. [paragraph] I disagree when a unit is trained for a year or more and then separated. I believe it could be more useful always together because of a feeling of brotherhood among men. [paragraph] The government should do more for the families of soldiers. There should be a pension for the widows or parents of the dead soldiers on top of the insurance they pay for. [paragraph] The American army shouldn't have had others than American in it. The drafting of aliens of any sort has slowed the training and the work of some unit because of this mistake. Those in the army should be discharged and returned to civilian life. They can do more and help the shortage of men labor, existing today. Farming is needed as much as the work in war factories. Food is some time more important than gun. The home morale is based on the food conditions.
S64.Q97.Full: Through my experience in the army for two years I have noticed that a man over thirty or around the thirties is not good as a soldier as man from eighteen to [deletion] the [/deletion] thirty, but he could be more useful as a worker in a defense job. The way men are drafted is unfair to many people. Men over thirty years of age are unable to keep with youngsters from eighteen to thirty. So either they should be separated or not drafted. An army made of young people would help the war effort more and shorten the war for years. [paragraph] I disagree when a unit is trained for a year or more and then separated. I believe it could be more useful always together because of a feeling of brotherhood among men. [paragraph] The government should do more for the families of soldiers. There should be a pension for the widows or parents of the dead soldiers on top of the insurance they pay for. [paragraph] The American army shouldn't have had others than American in it. The drafting of aliens of any sort has slowed the training and the work of some unit because of this mistake. Those in the army should be discharged and returned to civilian life. They can do more and help the shortage of men labor, existing today. Farming is needed as much as the work in war factories. Food is some time more important than gun. The home morale is based on the food conditions.

And am I any danger on the watter front because I have to be so far inland? I could to at least 300 % better in Civilian life for the war effort. I sure want this country to win and that means Amerika {America},

S64.Q97.Full: I believe the war aims of the U.S. at the present time are unclear. [paragraph] [deletion] [/deletion] [deletion] [/deletion] There should be less squabbling, red tape, and easy non-essential jobs in Washington.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I feel wasted in the army. I would like a defense job outside and I feel I would be very good and helpful in that.
S64.Q97.Full: I feel wasted in the army. I would like a defense job outside and I feel I would be very good and helpful in that.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: As a whole I've enjoyed being in the army. But - after 2 1/2 years I'd like to be a civilian again. - I think the army should take into consideration the fact that some soldiers were overseas and place them either on permanent duty in the states or turn them over to important war work. They would be so grateful for the chance
S64.Q97.C_1: to work that they'd produce twice as much as civilians do now. Furthermore they would not strike knowing how it affects the morale of the soldiers overseas. - Special ration of gasoline should be given [unclear] soldiers [/unclear] . They are living in a different part of the country and are unable to enjoy the many interresting [interesting] sights there because of gas rationing - what I'd like to see, and there are quite a few others who feel like I do, is a chance to go to school. To better myself and to be able to do a better job for my country. - Seperate [separate] rations for married men have been discontinued here. That is, some are getting and others are not. Why? Is my wife and am I less good than the Serjeant [Sargent] and his [unclear] [/unclear] [unclear] [/unclear] an allowance for quarters would relieve the [unclear] struggle [/unclear] to exist on $50.00. There is a Government housing project nearby, but only noncoms are permitted to live there. Why? Why separate us. I'm a citizen of the United States born here. I'm better for that than many noncoms born elsewhere. The only trouble is I'm a private or the chaff!
S64.Q97.Full: As a whole I've enjoyed being in the army. But - after 2 1/2 years I'd like to be a civilian again. - I think the army should take into consideration the fact that some soldiers were overseas and place them either on permanent duty in the states or turn them over to important war work. They would be so grateful for the chance to work that they'd produce twice as much as civilians do now. Furthermore they would not strike knowing how it affects the morale of the soldiers overseas. - Special ration of gasoline should be given [unclear] soldiers [/unclear] . They are living in a different part of the country and are unable to enjoy the many interresting [interesting] sights there because of gas rationing - what I'd like to see, and there are quite a few others who feel like I do, is a chance to go to school. To better myself and to be able to do a better job for my country. - Seperate [separate] rations for married men have been discontinued here. That is, some are getting and others are not. Why? Is my wife and am I less good than the Serjeant [Sargent] and his [unclear] [/unclear] [unclear] [/unclear] an allowance for quarters would relieve the [unclear] struggle [/unclear] to exist on $50.00. There is a Government housing project nearby, but only noncoms are permitted to live there. Why? Why separate us. I'm a citizen of the United States born here. I'm better for that than many noncoms born elsewhere. The only trouble is I'm a private or the chaff!

I believe is not a good [unclear] idee [/unclear] having German, [unclear] I [/unclear] [unclear] believe [/unclear] fellows in one spot together, and everybody on the outside know about this, this is not morale building I believe [unclear] what [/unclear] is good for one, is good for the others, so lets go, all together, with no differences to win the war fast,.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I would like to suggest that the personnel in the 620 Eng. be treated better by it's officers & their staff. As a rule we get treated like dirt and get punished for any thing the non-com may say. We also have freedom of speech in this country, in fact that is one of the reasons we are fighting for, and yet we are not allowed to speak our mother tongue here if we wish. We also have a very poor selection of corporals & sergeants; they have been chosen because they can drill and polish the apple, ...
S64.Q97.C_1: but not for what they know, for quite a few of then don't know very much. Most of them get away with murder and have become arrogant little despots.
S64.Q97.Full: I would like to suggest that the personnel in the 620 Eng. be treated better by it's officers & their staff. As a rule we get treated like dirt and get punished for any thing the non-com may say. We also have freedom of speech in this country, in fact that is one of the reasons we are fighting for, and yet we are not allowed to speak our mother tongue here if we wish. We also have a very poor selection of corporals & sergeants; they have been chosen because they can drill and polish the apple, ... but not for what they know, for quite a few of then don't know very much. Most of them get away with murder and have become arrogant little despots.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: When a soldier is in a heavy weapons co (company) why do we have to carry machine gun mortar etc. The Army is all machizial (mechanized. It's not like the last war. I've noticed different books and stuff on japs (japanese), why in the heck can't they pull the cart and all. The Army also said we were to get furloughs every six months. I know fellows who have been in 8 to 10 months and have no chances of getting any. When they wonder why
S64.Q97.C_1: soldiers go A.W.O.L. do you blame them, they have folks and maybe a family back home they would like to visit and see.
S64.Q97.Full: When a soldier is in a heavy weapons co (company) why do we have to carry machine gun mortar etc. The Army is all machizial (mechanized. It's not like the last war. I've noticed different books and stuff on japs (japanese), why in the heck can't they pull the cart and all. The Army also said we were to get furloughs every six months. I know fellows who have been in 8 to 10 months and have no chances of getting any. When they wonder why soldiers go A.W.O.L. do you blame them, they have folks and maybe a family back home they would like to visit and see.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I base my answers that I would be more effective at home than in the army because I'm married and have a child and I worked in an ordnance TNT plant producing more powder in a day to do more damage than I myself can do as an individual in the army. Also the English have had some one fight their wars for a long time. When we win this war it should
S64.Q97.C_1: be the US & that does the dictating not the English because we are the ones who left our homes and sacrificed to save mostly English property through a war that was caused by the English dominating after the world war, and making conditions so hard for the German people that they grasped at straws or Hitler for an exscape (escape) from their servitude.
S64.Q97.Full: I base my answers that I would be more effective at home than in the army because I'm married and have a child and I worked in an ordnance TNT plant producing more powder in a day to do more damage than I myself can do as an individual in the army. Also the English have had some one fight their wars for a long time. When we win this war it should  be the US & that does the dictating not the English because we are the ones who left our homes and sacrificed to save mostly English property through a war that was caused by the English dominating after the world war, and making conditions so hard for the German people that they grasped at straws or Hitler for an exscape (escape) from their servitude.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: There are no chances for promotions in the outfit. (paragraph) And furloughs are 6 and 8 months apart and sometimes longer. All soldiers who have been in longer than I say the same thing.
S64.Q97.Full: There are no chances for promotions in the outfit. (paragraph) And furloughs are 6 and 8 months apart and sometimes longer. All soldiers who have been in longer than I say the same thing.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: & confidance (confidence) to the United States Governance all will go good and [unclear] ? [/unclear] soon for Victory
S64.Q97.Full: & confidance (confidence) to the United States Governance all will go good and [unclear] ? [/unclear] soon for Victory

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I believe furloughs could be given to a man more frequently since we are still on this side. In my outfit there are men who have not had one in nine months.
S64.Q97.Full: I believe furloughs could be given to a man more frequently since we are still on this side. In my outfit there are men who have not had one in nine months.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Why do Farmers have to go to war when they are so needed at home to raise things for the war effort.
S64.Q97.Full: Why do Farmers have to go to war when they are so needed at home to raise things for the war effort.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: It seems to me that in the Army, the best policy is to keep quiet. Because one or two words or actions is held against you. Causing you to get nowhere and at every opportunity they have, being dragged down lower. There is also very much favoritism, which could cause bad morale and quite a bit of jealousy.
S64.Q97.Full: It seems to me that in the Army, the best policy is to keep quiet. Because one or two words or actions is held against you. Causing you to get nowhere and at every opportunity they have, being dragged down lower. There is also very much favoritism, which could cause bad morale and quite a bit of jealousy.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I have a mother at home that depended on me solely for 14 years and now she receives only $37 per moth allowance of which I pay $22. She is 69 years of age and it not able to work. I think this condition is very unfair. If I was married my wife would receive $50 per month and would be able to go out and work. They say there is a reason for everything in the army.
S64.Q97.C_1: Well I would like anyone to explain the reason & fairness about that.
S64.Q97.Full: I have a mother at home that depended on me solely for 14 years and now she receives only $37 per moth allowance of which I pay $22. She is 69 years of age and it not able to work. I think this condition is very unfair. If I was married my wife would receive $50 per month and would be able to go out and work. They say there is a reason for everything in the army. Well I would like anyone to explain the reason & fairness about that.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I cannot see how this Army or any branch of the Service can (thru its officers) justify their wanton extravagance in inefficiency negligence and waste. It seems to me that these leaders are doing their utmost to prolong the war and if not prolonging it
S64.Q97.C_1: failing to cooperate to bring it to a speedy and successful victory. (paragraph) The Service Club here is abomible (abominable) to wit. A foul building to march players by the Officers with the Hostesses and I mean playing. Also why in the Hell should we pay 10 cents for a nickel's worth of Ice Cream. When, as I understand it $18,000 is pigeon-holed in Chicago for Service Club in the Area. (paragraph) And a more rigid reclassification of O and M.C.O. before sailing overseas inasmuch as the greater number will be shot not later than on hour after leaving the gangplank.
S64.Q97.Full: I cannot see how this Army or any branch of the Service can (thru its officers) justify their wanton extravagance in inefficiency negligence and waste. It seems to me that these leaders are doing their utmost to prolong the war and if not prolonging it failing to cooperate to bring it to a speedy and successful victory. (paragraph) The Service Club here is abomible (abominable) to wit. A foul building to march players by the Officers with the Hostesses and I mean playing. Also why in the Hell should we pay 10 cents for a nickel's worth of Ice Cream. When, as I understand it $18,000 is pigeon-holed in Chicago for Service Club in the Area. (paragraph) And a more rigid reclassification of O and M.C.O. before sailing overseas inasmuch as the greater number will be shot not later than on hour after leaving the gangplank.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: As a soldier in the army this is my opinion the army is a great place for men from 18 up to 30 after that - it gets a little tough after all a man is settled at 20 he looks to get married and raise a family, for normal men 18t to 30 there is not a better place to go ahead but you need an education that's the most important thing.
S64.Q97.Full: As a soldier in the army this is my opinion the army is a great place for men from 18 up to 30 after that - it gets a little tough after all a man is settled at 20 he looks to get married and raise a family, for normal men 18t to 30 there is not a better place to go ahead but you need an education that's the most important thing.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I am trying to be a good soldier but what I am doing is not giving me a chance for anything different after the war. I could be more useful at home at a war plant.
S64.Q97.Full: I am trying to be a good soldier but what I am doing is not giving me a chance for anything different after the war. I could be more useful at home at a war plant.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
