S64.Q97.F: How about giving some of the fellows any opportunity to show this ability as tradesman or mechanic
S64.Q97.Full: How about giving some of the fellows any opportunity to show this ability as tradesman or mechanic

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: The most important thing I think is that a soldier should have a furlough at least once every six months, I have not been home for eight months, I think I deserve it. Don't you?
S64.Q97.Full: The most important thing I think is that a soldier should have a furlough at least once every six months, I have not been home for eight months, I think I deserve it. Don't you?

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: (1) Furloughs should be more plentiful depending on the tactical set up of an outfit. It would be better to have men on furlough, if not actually needed, than to have them hanging around doing practically nothing. (2) Officers coming out of O.C.S. have the tendency to use the men as guinea pigs while they learn the basic soldiering at the E.M.'s expense. They do not place enough confidence in their noncoms and as a result
S64.Q97.C_1: 97. (Continued) Continue writing your remarks here. the noncoms feel that their hands are tied and become practically makes as noncoms T live is hard as hell to take from these "90 day wonders". Why the hell dont they train them at O.C.S. to do their own job and have the noncoms work up to the noncoms. I'm sure that both the privates and the N.C.O.'s would appreciate it. Amen
S64.Q97.Full: (1) Furloughs should be more plentiful depending on the tactical set up of an outfit. It would be better to have men on furlough, if not actually needed, than to have them hanging around doing practically nothing. (2) Officers coming out of O.C.S. have the tendency to use the men as guinea pigs while they learn the basic soldiering at the E.M.'s expense. They do not place enough confidence in their noncoms and as a result  97. (Continued) Continue writing your remarks here. the noncoms feel that their hands are tied and become practically makes as noncoms T live is hard as hell to take from these "90 day wonders". Why the hell dont they train them at O.C.S. to do their own job and have the noncoms work up to the noncoms. I'm sure that both the privates and the N.C.O.'s would appreciate it. Amen

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Details are stressed too much for EM on things excused by officers. EM are in uproar at all times on what uniform to wear while officers are continually going about in mixed uniforms. Too much pleasure driving in Army vehicles. Food always too highly seasoned. All too often EM are asked to
S64.Q97.C_1: break regulations by officers such as driving beyond speed limits instead of helping [unclear] EM [/unclear] [Enlisted Men] obey rules. [paragraph] In too many cases [unclear] EM [/unclear] [Enlisted Men] get the ideas and do the work but don't get the credit. [insertion] Officers often act as if they [/insertion] were ornaments only. [paragraph] Passes and furloughs are held down to keep a certain per cent of [unclear] EM [/unclear] [Enlisted Men] on duty at all times while at times it is almost impossible to find an officer in the area. I think they should be held to same percentage. [paragraph] The ruling that Service Clubs are for [unclear] EM [/unclear] [Enlisted Men] only should be more strictly enforced. Too often officers can be found in service clubs. Prices in service clubs and PX's are often higher than in civilian stores. [paragraph] Many inspection details are ridiculous, men should not be forced to hide things.
S64.Q97.Full: Details are stressed too much for EM on things excused by officers. EM are in uproar at all times on what uniform to wear while officers are continually going about in mixed uniforms. Too much pleasure driving in Army vehicles. Food always too highly seasoned. All too often EM are asked to break regulations by officers such as driving beyond speed limits instead of helping [unclear] EM [/unclear] [Enlisted Men] obey rules. [paragraph] In too many cases [unclear] EM [/unclear] [Enlisted Men] get the ideas and do the work but don't get the credit. [insertion] Officers often act as if they [/insertion] were ornaments only. [paragraph] Passes and furloughs are held down to keep a certain per cent of [unclear] EM [/unclear] [Enlisted Men] on duty at all times while at times it is almost impossible to find an officer in the area. I think they should be held to same percentage. [paragraph] The ruling that Service Clubs are for [unclear] EM [/unclear] [Enlisted Men] only should be more strictly enforced. Too often officers can be found in service clubs. Prices in service clubs and PX's are often higher than in civilian stores. [paragraph] Many inspection details are ridiculous, men should not be forced to hide things.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: We should get more furloughs than we are. A soldier feels more like working when he gets back from furlough
S64.Q97.Full: We should get more furloughs than we are. A soldier feels more like working when he gets back from furlough

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think that our outfit is unfair in giving 7 day leave while other oufits all around are given 10 day leave. And after they are letting fellows graduate early that here will divisevly lead to them instead of getting fellows that have had a fair go at it
S64.Q97.Full: I think that our outfit is unfair in giving 7 day leave while other oufits all around are given 10 day leave. And after they are letting fellows graduate early that here will divisevly lead to them instead of getting fellows that have had a fair go at it

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: In my opinion, the army is OK. but is confined quite a bit. They tell you one thing to do then 10 minutes later they change it. I hate K.P. also.
S64.Q97.Full: In my opinion, the army is OK. but is confined quite a bit. They tell you one thing to do then 10 minutes later they change it. I hate K.P. also.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Why does an outfit have to stay in a place where it doesn't seem to be doing any good.
S64.Q97.Full: Why does an outfit have to stay in a place where it doesn't seem to be doing any good.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think that some outfits should try to let more men have furloughs while they are stationed in the U.S.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that some outfits should try to let more men have furloughs while they are stationed in the U.S.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: The army ough [ought] to make a better rule in making a soldier respect non com's [non-commissioned officers] more. furloughs should be given out more to men in camps in far out of the way places, especially when its the only way a man gets home.
S64.Q97.Full: The army ough [ought] to make a better rule in making a soldier respect non com's [non-commissioned officers] more. furloughs should be given out more to men in camps in far out of the way places, especially when its the only way a man gets home.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: If possible & in the U.S. a soldier should be given 30 days a year furlough & not when the battery commander feels like Also some army regulations should be done away with. Officers should be told to take more interest in their men & try to be more worth of their bars. Some officers let the 1st sergeant run the outfit & it isn't a good policy, as he might not be a good
S64.Q97.C_1: soldier himself. The food
S64.Q97.Full: If possible & in the U.S. a soldier should be given 30 days a year furlough & not when the battery commander feels like Also some army regulations should be done away with. Officers should be told to take more interest in their men & try to be more worth of their bars. Some officers let the 1st sergeant run the outfit & it isn't a good policy, as he might not be a good soldier himself. The food

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I would like to know the reasons for a 11:30 P.M. curfuew in the town we are near. It seems like we are a bunch of babies and it causes difficulties. In my opinion I think is only gets men in trouble.
S64.Q97.Full: I would like to know the reasons for a 11:30 P.M. curfuew in the town we are near. It seems like we are a bunch of babies and it causes difficulties. In my opinion I think is only gets men in trouble.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Personally, most married men should stay in the states. I know if I was in action I wouldn't fight like I would if I was single. If I were single I'd volenter (volunteer) to go in combat. And some of the men in our outfit are no good. It only takes one man to ruin it. But we have more than one.
S64.Q97.Full: Personally, most married men should stay in the states. I know if I was in action I wouldn't fight like I would if I was single. If I were single I'd volenter (volunteer) to go in combat. And some of the men in our outfit are no good. It only takes one man to ruin it. But we have more than one.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: We are stationed in a theatre of operations and we are treated as if we were going through basic training again. We have classes, Infantry Drill and of course QCS Inspections every week. One of our officers likes his drink too much and is very nervous. Mot of the B[unclear] ??? [/unclear] does not think very much of him.
S64.Q97.Full: We are stationed in a theatre of operations and we are treated as if we were going through basic training again. We have classes, Infantry Drill and of course QCS Inspections every week. One of our officers likes his drink too much and is very nervous. Mot of the B[unclear] ??? [/unclear] does not think very much of him.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Well the only thing I can say a soldier should have the rights to go home at least every six months. And they should get a longer furlow than just a few days. I'm in ten months and never had a furlow so far in my army life and a lot of others only had a few day home since they are here in the Army. Most of those men in my outfit are disappointed in the way we were getting treated. Otherwise the Army is all right. That is if
S64.Q97.C_1: you can stand it. Some of them don't try and make that chance. To each man should have at least thirty day a year off to see his folks back home. For they are going to sacrifice their life for they freedom and to keep this country torch burning. As far as officers go we have the best. But some don't seem to be fit for there men. Some off them don't want to be bothered in any way with them. But in my opinion we have the best off every thing and every body is treated alike.
S64.Q97.Full: Well the only thing I can say a soldier should have the rights to go home at least every six months. And they should get a longer furlow than just a few days. I'm in ten months and never had a furlow so far in my army life and a lot of others only had a few day home since they are here in the Army. Most of those men in my outfit are disappointed in the way we were getting treated. Otherwise the Army is all right. That is if you can stand it. Some of them don't try and make that chance. To each man should have at least thirty day a year off to see his folks back home. For they are going to sacrifice their life for they freedom and to keep this country torch burning. As far as officers go we have the best. But some don't seem to be fit for there men. Some off them don't want to be bothered in any way with them. But in my opinion we have the best off every thing and every body is treated alike.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think the army should give a man a chance to get all the schooling he can absorb as long as he is willing to try. Because I am 24 years of age the army considers me too old for expensive, extensive training. As Radar operator I have to learn just what I can by working with the equipment but can get no technical training. [paragraph] Contrary to popular belief there are no openings for advancement in an outfit
S64.Q97.C_1: that is already made
S64.Q97.Full: I think the army should give a man a chance to get all the schooling he can absorb as long as he is willing to try. Because I am 24 years of age the army considers me too old for expensive, extensive training. As Radar operator I have to learn just what I can by working with the equipment but can get no technical training. [paragraph] Contrary to popular belief there are no openings for advancement in an outfit  that is already made

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Pertaining to the last question no. 96 - Everything is better except for pleasure driving and getting enough men to run the farms.
S64.Q97.Full: Pertaining to the last question no. 96 - Everything is better except for pleasure driving and getting enough men to run the farms.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I think should give a man a better chance to be on his job before they take off and put him on some other job. because he can't leave his job right in a week for he has to much on his mind at one time. I think a man should I have at least eight or nine months training before he is full
S64.Q97.C_1: full trained and ready to get into combat. I think a man should be in the country[unclear] at [/unclear] least two or three months before he is sent out to fight.
S64.Q97.Full: I think should give a man a better chance to be on his job before they take off and put him on some other job. because he can't leave his job right in a week for he has to much on his mind at one time. I think a man should I have at least eight or nine months training before he is full full trained and ready to get into combat. I think a man should be in the country[unclear] at [/unclear] least two or three months before he is sent out to fight.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: In most cases I don't think the Army puts men where they are best fitted. There are many men in this battery who would do a lot more good in other branches. I, myself am very much dissatisfied. I had 3 1/2 years experience at a line, in which the Army has a particular branch. Instead of being there where I could do so much better, I am here. They probably have to train men to do the kind of work I am speaking of, whereas I could fit right in. I have no interest in the work I am doing. Knowing that I could do so much more in another branch, I would have been
S64.Q97.C_1: Much happier if I were doing the kind of work I did as a civilian, and therefore I would be a much better soldier.
S64.Q97.Full: In most cases I don't think the Army puts men where they are best fitted. There are many men in this battery who would do a lot more good in other branches. I, myself am very much dissatisfied. I had 3 1/2 years experience at a line, in which the Army has a particular branch. Instead of being there where I could do so much better, I am here. They probably have to train men to do the kind of work I am speaking of, whereas I could fit right in. I have no interest in the work I am doing. Knowing that I could do so much more in another branch, I would have been Much happier if I were doing the kind of work I did as a civilian, and therefore I would be a much better soldier.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: How is it that other outfits get 10 to 15 day furloughs and my outfit only gets seven days we are all in the same army.
S64.Q97.Full: How is it that other outfits get 10 to 15 day furloughs and my outfit only gets seven days we are all in the same army.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I think we have too many inspections and that we should have more training for active combat service instead.
S64.Q97.Full: I think we have too many inspections and that we should have more training for active combat service instead.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: To whom it may concern, I want to do my share in the army I feel like it is my duty but sometimes some fellows have some weakness somewhere and if he don't do the job as good as the next fellow and that weakness holds him back well I think that fellow should be put to where that weakness won't bother him you know if some fellow had some little ailment wrong with him when he came in the army they [unclear] [/unclear]
S64.Q97.C_1: it could be fixed but couldn't such as my case understand now I am not beefing because I want simphyty [sympathy] but there are lots of them like myself one way or another, in my case is my feet my toes stay cramped up when walking or sitting down. They have always been that way and [deletion] not [/deletion] nothing can be done about it for if they was to try and fix them they would do them worse for I have seen it tryed before and it didn't work out so that is the reason I say let fellows such as in my case have a job to do so they can be off of their feet for probably that is the reason some fellows can't make good some have ailments in arms, hands, legs, or they could be sickly. What I mean by the last is that they don't never feel good such boys could work around hospitals and maby the doctors while he was working around him could find out the cause and probably some fellows can't learn fast as others if that the case he should be given more time to learn in the army in matter of fact every man that is in the service should and could be studyed and put to where he could do a good job in the army with out any thing to worry him till he got in combat zones and then they will do a better job in the army.
S64.Q97.Full: To whom it may concern, I want to do my share in the army I feel like it is my duty but sometimes some fellows have some weakness somewhere and if he don't do the job as good as the next fellow and that weakness holds him back well I think that fellow should be put to where that weakness won't bother him you know if some fellow had some little ailment wrong with him when he came in the army they [unclear] [/unclear]  it could be fixed but couldn't such as my case understand now I am not beefing because I want simphyty [sympathy] but there are lots of them like myself one way or another, in my case is my feet my toes stay cramped up when walking or sitting down. They have always been that way and [deletion] not [/deletion] nothing can be done about it for if they was to try and fix them they would do them worse for I have seen it tryed before and it didn't work out so that is the reason I say let fellows such as in my case have a job to do so they can be off of their feet for probably that is the reason some fellows can't make good some have ailments in arms, hands, legs, or they could be sickly. What I mean by the last is that they don't never feel good such boys could work around hospitals and maby the doctors while he was working around him could find out the cause and probably some fellows can't learn fast as others if that the case he should be given more time to learn in the army in matter of fact every man that is in the service should and could be studyed and put to where he could do a good job in the army with out any thing to worry him till he got in combat zones and then they will do a better job in the army.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: In question 95 you do not mention whether it is a five hour pass or a twenty four hour pass. I haven't had a 24 hr pass in two & half months. I think the 12 o clock curfew should be lifted allowing the men to report for revelie. In cooking why not leave onions out of meats & put into a seperate dish for anyone who may not have an agreeable stomach for them.
S64.Q97.C_1: There should be convoys (that) leave for nearby towns every so often for recreation of some sort. Perhaps swimming or enjoying a play etc.
S64.Q97.Full: In question 95 you do not mention whether it is a five hour pass or a twenty four hour pass. I haven't had a 24 hr pass in two & half months. I think the 12 o clock curfew should be lifted allowing the men to report for revelie. In cooking why not leave onions out of meats & put into a seperate dish for anyone who may not have an agreeable stomach for them. There should be convoys (that) leave for nearby towns every so often for recreation of some sort. Perhaps swimming or enjoying a play etc.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I believe there is a whole lot of lack of cooperation between officers and officers with Non Coms. Sincerity among officers seems to be the main gripe.
S64.Q97.Full: I believe there is a whole lot of lack of cooperation between officers and officers with Non Coms. Sincerity among officers seems to be the main gripe.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: In my situation - being on active duty there is no such thing as a pass for more than six hours or so. The soldier must be in every night before midnight unless he is married and allowed an overnight pass. I think this should be changed to allow all men at least once a month to get a complete weekend off and be allowed to travel at least 100 miles in any direction.
S64.Q97.Full: In my situation - being on active duty there is no such thing as a pass for more than six hours or so. The soldier must be in every night before midnight unless he is married and allowed an overnight pass. I think this should be changed to allow all men at least once a month to get a complete weekend off and be allowed to travel at least 100 miles in any direction.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I would like to see the Government do something about all these strikes that are going on. How do we expect to win the war with all these holdups. If all these men that are striking were put in the armed forces and soldiers put in their places production would steadily be on the increase. Another thing I would like to
S64.Q97.C_1: would be less favoritism showed to certain enlisted men by officers. I would like to see some better equipment shipped to our boys oversea. I have some friend oversea that claim their equipment is old an out of date.
S64.Q97.Full: I would like to see the Government do something about all these strikes that are going on. How do we expect to win the war with all these holdups. If all these men that are striking were put in the armed forces and soldiers put in their places production would steadily be on the increase. Another thing I would like to  would be less favoritism showed to certain enlisted men by officers. I would like to see some better equipment shipped to our boys oversea. I have some friend oversea that claim their equipment is old an out of date.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Thats all, there isn't any more [paragraph] P.S. How about Week-end passes
S64.Q97.Full: Thats all, there isn't any more [paragraph] P.S. How about Week-end passes

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Yes, I am 37 years old, have a brother two years younger. We are both in the army. Leaving my widowed mother alone a very sick woman, no relations. If she should pass away while we were gone who will take care of her? The draft board does not consider things. There are too many men on the streets
S64.Q97.C_1: with no dependents, too many young men.
S64.Q97.Full: Yes, I am 37 years old, have a brother two years younger. We are both in the army. Leaving my widowed mother alone a very sick woman, no relations. If she should pass away while we were gone who will take care of her? The draft board does not consider things. There are too many men on the streets with no dependents, too many young men.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I think the Army needs a taste of stronger discipline. One way to achieve it is to give the NCOs more authority and respect and to be sure the NCO can carry the authority and respect. The enlisted men of the different grades are too chummy.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the Army needs a taste of stronger discipline. One way to achieve it is to give the NCOs more authority and respect and to be sure the NCO can carry the authority and respect. The enlisted men of the different grades are too chummy.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: 6. Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes more than fair.
S64.Q97.F: Our regiment has become stagnated, stale and lost the respect of many because after 2 1/2 yrs in the service we are still in the country. Whenever people learn that fact they judge us as deliberate shirkers. We can't show our faces to one who has a relative overseas. Makes me feel like a corrupt
S64.Q97.C_1: politician. Don't you think the army is sacrificing too many desirable traits peculiar to older experienced people in emphasizing youth in the field officers. It is hard to give respect and confidence to a 22 yr old just out of school who is obviously just off a dance floor. I would hesitate placing my life in their hands.
S64.Q97.Full: Our regiment has become stagnated, stale and lost the respect of many because after 2 1/2 yrs in the service we are still in the country. Whenever people learn that fact they judge us as deliberate shirkers. We can't show our faces to one who has a relative overseas. Makes me feel like a corrupt politician. Don't you think the army is sacrificing too many desirable traits peculiar to older experienced people in emphasizing youth in the field officers. It is hard to give respect and confidence to a 22 yr old just out of school who is obviously just off a dance floor. I would hesitate placing my life in their hands.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I think men here should be given wk end passes - it would certainly step up morale and make better soldiers - all work & no play does make Johnny a dull boy - especially in his own back yard.
S64.Q97.Full: I think men here should be given wk end passes - it would certainly step up morale and make better soldiers - all work & no play does make Johnny a dull boy - especially in his own back yard.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think we should have more furloughs in the future because it makes a man who has been home feel and act as a good soldier when he returns from home.
S64.Q97.Full: I think we should have more furloughs in the future because it makes a man who has been home feel and act as a good soldier when he returns from home.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I would like to get into some other branch of the service where I think I'm best fitted. Where I now am stationed. I think we should have more passes - especially weekend passes, and more places to go that are [unclear] new [/unclear] [unclear] [/unclear] to us. Because of being stationed so far from home, & should have a longer furlough, to allow for transportation
S64.Q97.C_1: because it now is hard to travel. To have a chance to get into something I like better.
S64.Q97.Full: I would like to get into some other branch of the service where I think I'm best fitted. Where I now am stationed. I think we should have more passes - especially weekend passes, and more places to go that are [unclear] new [/unclear] [unclear] [/unclear] to us. Because of being stationed so far from home, & should have a longer furlough, to allow for transportation because it now is hard to travel. To have a chance to get into something I like better.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: About passes, as long as only three men in a squad are given passes each nite, why is there still a 12 midnite curfew.
S64.Q97.Full: About passes, as long as only three men in a squad are given passes each nite, why is there still a 12 midnite curfew.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: In reference to question 96; jobs, and pay may be a little better than before the war, but what good are things like that when your family is widely separated and can't enjoy them. I know our family would prefer being together in poverty than separated, as we are now. The end of this mess can't come too soon for us.
S64.Q97.Full: In reference to question 96; jobs, and pay may be a little better than before the war, but what good are things like that when your family is widely separated and can't enjoy them. I know our family would prefer being together in poverty than separated, as we are now. The end of this mess can't come too soon for us.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: (1) I believe that there is a great waste of talent whether military or not. It has been proven to me by observation that talents that could prove of immense value to the unit, Regiment and Army is either wasted or at least misdirected. An attempt should be or should have been to fit a machinist into a job where his past experience would have been utilized without the army spending time and money teaching a chemist to be a cook. The
S64.Q97.C_1: foregoing is merely an example and not a personal gripe. (2) Train officers to secure the respect of their men for their ability & accomplishment & not because they wear officers insignia. (3) Do not allow the spurious [insertion] officers [/insertion] caste system to continue. (4) Institute a program to teach the fundamentals of democracy, good government & the effect - actual and probable - of world current events upon the day-to-day life of the individual soldier. (5) Teach the Officers respect for the intelligence of the average soldier which is higher - quite often - than that of the officer. (6) Do not keep a dark secret as so often done the reason for any activity work or method done by the men - particularly in field work. The men would desire more satisfaction & benefit if field problems were explained to them and were given the opportunity to work them out themselves.
S64.Q97.Full: (1) I believe that there is a great waste of talent whether military or not. It has been proven to me by observation that talents that could prove of immense value to the unit, Regiment and Army is either wasted or at least misdirected. An attempt should be or should have been to fit a machinist into a job where his past experience would have been utilized without the army spending time and money teaching a chemist to be a cook. The  foregoing is merely an example and not a personal gripe. (2) Train officers to secure the respect of their men for their ability & accomplishment & not because they wear officers insignia. (3) Do not allow the spurious [insertion] officers [/insertion] caste system to continue. (4) Institute a program to teach the fundamentals of democracy, good government & the effect - actual and probable - of world current events upon the day-to-day life of the individual soldier. (5) Teach the Officers respect for the intelligence of the average soldier which is higher - quite often - than that of the officer. (6) Do not keep a dark secret as so often done the reason for any activity work or method done by the men - particularly in field work. The men would desire more satisfaction & benefit if field problems were explained to them and were given the opportunity to work them out themselves.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I don't like the cursing, language, drinking, and good for nothing woman around the Camps. Gambling is bad too. [paragraph] A lot of young boys are not becoming better men in a moral sense of the word when they go back to civilian life Religion is not what it should be at all.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't like the cursing, language, drinking, and good for nothing woman around the Camps. Gambling is bad too. [paragraph] A lot of young boys are not becoming better men in a moral sense of the word when they go back to civilian life Religion is not what it should be at all.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Men should be able to get transfers to branches of service if they are better fitted for it. But that is not considered here. [paragraph] Men should get more furloughs, one every three months & 3 day passes. Men should be taught to get along with their fellow Negro soldiers & not taught to hate them. [paragraph] They should not be station on one place for almost 2 years as we are doing [unclear] nothing [/unclear] It breaks down morale. Me should be taught how to read & write when it is
S64.Q97.C_1: found out they don't know how. Anti-Negro talk & anti-Semetic talk from officers & men is play Hitler game divided the people. we can't have a good regiment that way, it is a crime against every thing we our fighting for if not corrected the American people will pay a very heavy price for it. We should be at the front or given more liberty's. The men are restless that is why so many of them are in the guardhouse. It is of little importance that I join a branch of service & was sent here to get my basic then told I could go back to that branch of services but can even be considered for a transfer out of here when I am doing nothing here. The thing that is important is that there are many of us the same way. We have every thing to win & everything to lose. We want victory, defeat well mean [unclear] Germany [/unclear] we want a 2nd front now! This country must not be guilty of the crimes that the Fascist our [are] mistreating the Negro People we can't win this war with out them we have never won a war without them.
S64.Q97.Full: Men should be able to get transfers to branches of service if they are better fitted for it. But that is not considered here. [paragraph] Men should get more furloughs, one every three months & 3 day passes. Men should be taught to get along with their fellow Negro soldiers & not taught to hate them. [paragraph] They should not be station on one place for almost 2 years as we are doing [unclear] nothing [/unclear] It breaks down morale. Me should be taught how to read & write when it is found out they don't know how. Anti-Negro talk & anti-Semetic talk from officers & men is play Hitler game divided the people. we can't have a good regiment that way, it is a crime against every thing we our fighting for if not corrected the American people will pay a very heavy price for it. We should be at the front or given more liberty's. The men are restless that is why so many of them are in the guardhouse. It is of little importance that I join a branch of service & was sent here to get my basic then told I could go back to that branch of services but can even be considered for a transfer out of here when I am doing nothing here. The thing that is important is that there are many of us the same way. We have every thing to win & everything to lose. We want victory, defeat well mean [unclear] Germany [/unclear] we want a 2nd front now! This country must not be guilty of the crimes that the Fascist our [are] mistreating the Negro People we can't win this war with out them we have never won a war without them.

S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much

In the army as a whole while on this side, diciplinary (disciplinary) measures should be enforced to the utmost so that when you have to go in combat your men are well diciplined (disciplined).

S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I'm for the Army. If I'm in a good outfit. Artillery with a good [unclear] game cause [/unclear] ! [unclear] Fignal [/unclear] is not for me. I'm a yankee!
S64.Q97.Full: I'm for the Army. If I'm in a good outfit. Artillery with a good [unclear] game cause [/unclear] ! [unclear] Fignal [/unclear] is not for me. I'm a yankee!

S64.Q97.Full: I just don't like my outfit. I would like to be a soldier and have some soldier life.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Men are too often placed in a branch of service or on particular types of work for which they are not at all suited. However there are jobs which they could do very well having had experience in similar jobs before entering the army. More care should be taken to place a man in work for which he is already qualified rather than
S64.Q97.C_1: to waste time and money in training someone else for the work who has no aptitude for it.
S64.Q97.Full: Men are too often placed in a branch of service or on particular types of work for which they are not at all suited. However there are jobs which they could do very well having had experience in similar jobs before entering the army. More care should be taken to place a man in work for which he is already qualified rather than  to waste time and money in training someone else for the work who has no aptitude for it.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Married men should be home at nights when not on duty, but here thy refuse to give a married man pass, single men just half of [insertion] the [/insertion] single men never use the over night pass. No rating unless you buy insurance ($10,000) & [unclear] bond [/unclear] . [paragraph] They put you in working with civilians & you have to take orders from them & you have too track then the work. The greatest mistake ever made was
S64.Q97.C_1: when the W. A. A. C. came to this camp. Most of the Com. Officers don't know as much about your work as you do yourself. The Army is very good training. I like it very much. [paragraph] Too much red tape.
S64.Q97.Full: Married men should be home at nights when not on duty, but here thy refuse to give a married man pass, single men just half of [insertion] the [/insertion] single men never use the over night pass. No rating unless you buy insurance ($10,000) & [unclear] bond [/unclear] . [paragraph] They put you in working with civilians & you have to take orders from them & you have too track then the work. The greatest mistake ever made was when the W. A. A. C. came to this camp. Most of the Com. Officers don't know as much about your work as you do yourself. The Army is very good training. I like it very much. [paragraph] Too much red tape.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: As should have been gathered by now, I think entirely too much time is being wasted on parade ground drill, teach men to fight - use tools - just enough drill to maintain pliability of movement of troops. Discipline - The best disciplined - best parading troops are those which have only been in the army a few months - from observation
S64.Q97.C_1: it seems to me that the longer men are in the Army the more contemptuos [contemptuous] they get of non coms rule etc - which again comes back to the fact that men feel their time is being waster. [paragraph] The method of trying to get men to do things by scaring them to death (loud [insertion] mouth [/insertion] bellowing seargent) should go produces more trouble than results [paragraph] To [Too] much friction seems to exist between administrative squadron and school departments on technical training posts such as this - rules conflict - duties overlap - stubborness [stubbornness] of policy is adhered to at expense of men [paragraph] Failure to recognize records from previous posts - ie medical - in many instances - men transferred from post to post have had to take entire series of shots up to 3 times with six or nine months. [paragraph] - Medical department refusing to excuse from duty men with cold, [underline] 'strep' [/underline] sore throat etc - in many cases men handle food possibility of infecting entire post.
S64.Q97.Full: As should have been gathered by now, I think entirely too much time is being wasted on parade ground drill, teach men to fight - use tools - just enough drill to maintain pliability of movement of troops. Discipline - The best disciplined - best parading troops are those which have only been in the army a few months - from observation  it seems to me that the longer men are in the Army the more contemptuos [contemptuous] they get of non coms rule etc - which again comes back to the fact that men feel their time is being waster. [paragraph] The method of trying to get men to do things by scaring them to death (loud [insertion] mouth [/insertion] bellowing seargent) should go produces more trouble than results [paragraph] To [Too] much friction seems to exist between administrative squadron and school departments on technical training posts such as this - rules conflict - duties overlap - stubborness [stubbornness] of policy is adhered to at expense of men [paragraph] Failure to recognize records from previous posts - ie medical - in many instances - men transferred from post to post have had to take entire series of shots up to 3 times with six or nine months. [paragraph] - Medical department refusing to excuse from duty men with cold, [underline] 'strep' [/underline] sore throat etc - in many cases men handle food possibility of infecting entire post.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I don't think it necessary for us to get up at 6 in in the and going to Calastetics and drill directly after dinner. The non coms treat us like babies and not soldiers I don't see any sense of removing pictures of loved one in the barracks for inspections. We do not get paid on time. About 3,000 eat in one mess hall when there are 4 or 5 ideal ones on the field. I think each barrack should get the same day off together so as we may get more sleep. One soldier
S64.Q97.C_1: gets off one day and comes in a little high and wakes up the Barracks it goes on every day. So if they all get off together they could raise hell for 1 night and that's all. We have a lot of unnecessary inspections. The meals are not good the civilians say the soldiers get all the meat and food but we are not, who the hell is "Our allies such as Russia and England?" If we are told to do something by our non coms or officers we have to do it without asking why we are doing it. And why all the rush to do things and when we get their we have to wait on line for 6 hours or more. I don't think the Jewish people are in this war and what few are have the easy jobs (non combatant). They seem to be making all the money in this war why don't we see that England gets more of her army and Navy in the Pacific. And Russia allowing us air bases in Russia and force her to drop relations with Japanese. Aerial gunners should get more of a rating than Corporals and the Air Corp is piss poor in giving furloughs and when they do its for a few days.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't think it necessary for us to get up at 6 in in the and going to Calastetics and drill directly after dinner. The non coms treat us like babies and not soldiers I don't see any sense of removing pictures of loved one in the barracks for inspections. We do not get paid on time. About 3,000 eat in one mess hall when there are 4 or 5 ideal ones on the field. I think each barrack should get the same day off together so as we may get more sleep. One soldier gets off one day and comes in a little high and wakes up the Barracks it goes on every day. So if they all get off together they could raise hell for 1 night and that's all. We have a lot of unnecessary inspections. The meals are not good the civilians say the soldiers get all the meat and food but we are not, who the hell is "Our allies such as Russia and England?" If we are told to do something by our non coms or officers we have to do it without asking why we are doing it. And why all the rush to do things and when we get their we have to wait on line for 6 hours or more. I don't think the Jewish people are in this war and what few are have the easy jobs (non combatant). They seem to be making all the money in this war why don't we see that England gets more of her army and Navy in the Pacific. And Russia allowing us air bases in Russia and force her to drop relations with Japanese. Aerial gunners should get more of a rating than Corporals and the Air Corp is piss poor in giving furloughs and when they do its for a few days.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Other/No answer
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: Haven't had any
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Wha gripes me most is things like pictures of loved ones must be taken off the shelves and hidden from view when we have inspection. Another thing we're treated more like boy scouts instead of men. The hours we have to work, when we are supposed to have
S64.Q97.C_1: time off they pull an inspection or some thing like that. I know their reason for doing this is for dicipline[discipline] . but its pretty hard when they wake us up a 3:00 AM. Paragraph Last but not least is the chow. the food may be the best but the mess sgts.[Sergeants] just don't give a dam for the way its prepared Paragraph The men in the Air Corp don't seem to get many furloughs, when they do its just for a short time, but as for the other outfits in both army and Navy they have more furloughs and they are longer.
S64.Q97.Full: Wha gripes me most is things like pictures of loved ones must be taken off the shelves and hidden from view when we have inspection. Another thing we're treated more like boy scouts instead of men. The hours we have to work, when we are supposed to have  time off they pull an inspection or some thing like that. I know their reason for doing this is for dicipline[discipline] . but its pretty hard when they wake us up a 3:00 AM. Paragraph Last but not least is the chow. the food may be the best but the mess sgts.[Sergeants] just don't give a dam for the way its prepared Paragraph The men in the Air Corp don't seem to get many furloughs, when they do its just for a short time, but as for the other outfits in both army and Navy they have more furloughs and they are longer.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: This army is ran very poor because men are put in places where they don't belong. The mess halls are run very poorly and serve bad foods. In Buckly Field the food is much better I do not see any reason for it. The P.X. are much poor here then Buckley Field Officers in the Army are not trained long enough to handle men. Any man before coming an officer should have at
S64.Q97.C_1: least one year of good training. They should not pick out leaders because they are high school or college graduates or because his father is a big shot or because his is a well known actor or sport player . They should pick our men leaders by there ability to handle men and be able to do things that they order men under them to do. I have hear some of these "90 day wonders" give orders I think that my kid cousin 12 years old who has been in the naval cadets for 2 years can honestly teach these officers a few think. I have seen men who have been in the Army there whole life and are just master sargents these are the men that should be are leaders as officers.
S64.Q97.Full: This army is ran very poor because men are put in places where they don't belong. The mess halls are run very poorly and serve bad foods. In Buckly Field the food is much better I do not see any reason for it. The P.X. are much poor here then Buckley Field Officers in the Army are not trained long enough to handle men. Any man before coming an officer should have at least one year of good training. They should not pick out leaders because they are high school or college graduates or because his father is a big shot or because his is a well known actor or sport player . They should pick our men leaders by there ability to handle men and be able to do things that they order men under them to do. I have hear some of these "90 day wonders" give orders I think that my kid cousin 12 years old who has been in the naval cadets for 2 years can honestly teach these officers a few think. I have seen men who have been in the Army there whole life and are just master sargents these are the men that should be are leaders as officers.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: We lose too much time doing nothing toward the war effort in most of the camps I have been in. We should all work together to get this thing over with and go home.
S64.Q97.Full: We lose too much time doing nothing toward the war effort in most of the camps I have been in. We should all work together to get this thing over with and go home.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Don't see why kids of 18 years old are drafted. They have no voice in the Government, should take these draft dodgers from 1917 up to present who were never in the last war or this war. And had nice jobs since last war got all the gravy from last +this war. Let them fight they got plenty to fight for.
S64.Q97.Full: Don't see why kids of 18 years old are drafted. They have no voice in the Government, should take these draft dodgers from 1917 up to present who were never in the last war or this war. And had nice jobs since last war got all the gravy from last +this war. Let them fight they got plenty to fight for.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think a soldier is intitled to at least a 10 furlough every 6 months as I think that all aerial gunners deserve a commission, even more so than a cadet.
S64.Q97.Full: I think a soldier is intitled to at least a 10 furlough every 6 months as I think that all aerial gunners deserve a commission, even more so than a cadet.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Personally I think the calisthenics at this field is awfull. I'm a student on the A shift. We get up at 3 15 Am & get out of school at 11:30 AM. We eat lunch then & get out of the mess hall just in time to fall out for two hours of calisthenics. I'll be gone in a few weeks, but I don't want the other boys to have to go through the same thing. Give us 1 hr,
S64.Q97.C_1: rest after lunch & then we would be well satisfied.
S64.Q97.Full: Personally I think the calisthenics at this field is awfull. I'm a student on the A shift. We get up at 3 15 Am & get out of school at 11:30 AM. We eat lunch then & get out of the mess hall just in time to fall out for two hours of calisthenics. I'll be gone in a few weeks, but I don't want the other boys to have to go through the same thing. Give us 1 hr, rest after lunch & then we would be well satisfied.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: I haven't had enough time in to rate a furlough.
S64.Q97.F: As long as I am in the Army I have no complaints. The only thing is that my wife and I struggled through the hard times together and now that things are a little easier I find myself in the Army and a lot of non-essential younger men are still being classified by their local draft board as being essential to the war industry.
S64.Q97.Full: As long as I am in the Army I have no complaints. The only thing is that my wife and I struggled through the hard times together and now that things are a little easier I find myself in the Army and a lot of non-essential younger men are still being classified by their local draft board as being essential to the war industry.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: As a soldier who has seen and been in the combat zone with the Merchant Marines I would say that the army has too many 90 day wonders for officers. If perhaps they could see and be in combat they would make much better officers. Perhaps they would try and be more legislative not partial.
S64.Q97.Full: As a soldier who has seen and been in the combat zone with the Merchant Marines I would say that the army has too many 90 day wonders for officers. If perhaps they could see and be in combat they would make much better officers. Perhaps they would try and be more legislative not partial.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: There seems to be quite an argument as to Married Soilders (Soldiers) having the right to draw rations and live off the post. We are very fortunate here at my station this privilege is extended to all married men regardless of rank which is a very good thing. Some camps only give the privilege to the first 3 grades
S64.Q97.C_1: This was probably a very good idea in peace time. But as many married men as in the army, I think the privilege should be extended to all married men regardless of rank. Nothing helps the moral of a soldier as much as getting to go home nights. My outfit is 40% married men that live off the post. they make much better soldiers. Why does the war dept. make so much difference in grade [deletion] among [/deletion] between noncoms anyway. just because a fellow is Staff Sgt is he more honest, love his wife more than an ordinary Sgt of even a Private?
S64.Q97.Full: There seems to be quite an argument as to Married Soilders (Soldiers) having the right to draw rations and live off the post. We are very fortunate here at my station this privilege is extended to all married men regardless of rank which is a very good thing. Some camps only give the privilege to the first 3 grades This was probably a very good idea in peace time. But as many married men as in the army, I think the privilege should be extended to all married men regardless of rank. Nothing helps the moral of a soldier as much as getting to go home nights. My outfit is 40% married men that live off the post. they make much better soldiers. Why does the war dept. make so much difference in grade [deletion] among [/deletion] between noncoms anyway. just because a fellow is Staff Sgt is he more honest, love his wife more than an ordinary Sgt of even a Private?

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Besides the coal strikes which give me extremely the two other things which worry me are food rationing and it's prices, And unnecessary gas rationing. Some food relich in rational need not be because if lachs only trangles-lation and is rotting. A lot is said about food prices but nothing is done. Some rationing in states or rations of the country is stupid and
S64.Q97.C_1: needless. If the govt. plans to use civilian tires and are trying to save them then give the people a reason for gas rationing when it is plentiful and if the govt.[deletion] wants [/deletion] doesn't want the tires, then why worry about wearing them out, worry about bigger things as winning the war.
S64.Q97.Full: Besides the coal strikes which give me extremely the two other things which worry me are food rationing and it's prices, And unnecessary gas rationing. Some food relich in rational need not be because if lachs only trangles-lation and is rotting. A lot is said about food prices but nothing is done. Some rationing in states or rations of the country is stupid and needless. If the govt. plans to use civilian tires and are trying to save them then give the people a reason for gas rationing when it is plentiful and if the govt.[deletion] wants [/deletion] doesn't want the tires, then why worry about wearing them out, worry about bigger things as winning the war.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: The army as a whole does very well. I expect a man is better off in the army than as a civilian. [paragraph] The only gripe I have is that for a democracy and a supposedly democratic army there is a caste system that divides the enlisted men
S64.Q97.C_1: and the officers worse than any Indian paraih [pariah] . [paragraph] The salute should be rendered to the flag and when actually on duty. Any ([underline] other time [/underline] is a waste of time and a farce.
S64.Q97.Full: The army as a whole does very well. I expect a man is better off in the army than as a civilian. [paragraph] The only gripe I have is that for a democracy and a supposedly democratic army there is a caste system that divides the enlisted men and the officers worse than any Indian paraih [pariah] . [paragraph] The salute should be rendered to the flag and when actually on duty. Any ([underline] other time [/underline] is a waste of time and a farce.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: The army Technical Schools to my opinion could be run a little better. There should be chairs for the student to sit down in. It is true they don't need them all the time, that is when they are doing pratical work. But when they have to stand up, after
S64.Q97.C_1: the first hour all they think of is their feet, and there isn't much learned. There should be written tests given in these schools. There are some students that can learn by practical methods that couldn't pass a test. I think tests should be given all. Then judge the ones that don't pass. Where tests are not given, they don't put forth any effort to grasp the subject. And there just doesn't seem to be any spirit in the school. Human nature is that boys try to out do their buddies where they don't have tests they don't have a chance.
S64.Q97.Full: The army Technical Schools to my opinion could be run a little better. There should be chairs for the student to sit down in. It is true they don't need them all the time, that is when they are doing pratical work. But when they have to stand up, after the first hour all they think of is their feet, and there isn't much learned. There should be written tests given in these schools. There are some students that can learn by practical methods that couldn't pass a test. I think tests should be given all. Then judge the ones that don't pass. Where tests are not given, they don't put forth any effort to grasp the subject. And there just doesn't seem to be any spirit in the school. Human nature is that boys try to out do their buddies where they don't have tests they don't have a chance.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Many of these questions don't apply to our squadron nearly as much as they would to a normal combat outfit. [paragraph] Here we're all non-coms, we're all technicians and instructors and even if we went overseas we wouldn't have combat duty. [paragraph] Having six years of college
S64.Q97.C_1: I wanted to be an officer - applied six times - passed three boards - became a cadet - and was disqualified because of a minor physical reason. Am not too happy about this. But now that I'm married and resigned to an inferior place in the army I want to stay here. I'd rather not be an officer now if it involved moving from here. [paragraph] Lowry Field's one of the best places I've ever been in the Army - and I've lived in about 20 camps and fields.
S64.Q97.Full: Many of these questions don't apply to our squadron nearly as much as they would to a normal combat outfit. [paragraph] Here we're all non-coms, we're all technicians and instructors and even if we went overseas we wouldn't have combat duty. [paragraph] Having six years of college  I wanted to be an officer - applied six times - passed three boards - became a cadet - and was disqualified because of a minor physical reason. Am not too happy about this. But now that I'm married and resigned to an inferior place in the army I want to stay here. I'd rather not be an officer now if it involved moving from here. [paragraph] Lowry Field's one of the best places I've ever been in the Army - and I've lived in about 20 camps and fields.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: When I came into the army I expected to find an efficient organization run by [underline] men [/underline] . Instead I find an inefficient organization run by civilians, officers and enlisted who in many case, no all, are interested in making all the money they can. They play politics and any stupid regulation as long as it meets with political favor is enforced.
S64.Q97.C_1: There is too much shifting of responsibility and lack of intelligent administration. The above is seen in all branches from the War Department down. [paragraph] Why the Armed Forces have to listen to the whims of some two-bib politican is something that should be investigated. [paragraph] There is too much profit in war industry. If all profits were absorbed by the governments wars would cease. [paragraph] If we are going to have an efficient army the men who run it must be efficient. [paragraph] No war has ever been won or will be won with a beer bottle in one hand and a woman in the other. [paragraph] When ever the men who are responsible for the operation and administration of the armed services realize that a war must be won We will be well on the road to victory.
S64.Q97.Full: When I came into the army I expected to find an efficient organization run by [underline] men [/underline] . Instead I find an inefficient organization run by civilians, officers and enlisted who in many case, no all, are interested in making all the money they can. They play politics and any stupid regulation as long as it meets with political favor is enforced. There is too much shifting of responsibility and lack of intelligent administration. The above is seen in all branches from the War Department down. [paragraph] Why the Armed Forces have to listen to the whims of some two-bib politican is something that should be investigated. [paragraph] There is too much profit in war industry. If all profits were absorbed by the governments wars would cease. [paragraph] If we are going to have an efficient army the men who run it must be efficient. [paragraph] No war has ever been won or will be won with a beer bottle in one hand and a woman in the other. [paragraph] When ever the men who are responsible for the operation and administration of the armed services realize that a war must be won We will be well on the road to victory.
