A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I believe that when a soldier is sent to school to learn material that the air corps puts out and requires deep concentration to understand this material he should not be subjected to strenuous exercises & hikes & drilling every morning. I being one of these unfortunates find I have about 30 minutes to myself from the time I get up in the morning till I get released from school. In this 30 minutes we are supposed to wash, shine shoes, get your
S64.Q97.C_1: laundry, get your mail, make your bunk and sometimes we are supposed to come for extra study at night. I also believe that the army could be a little more lenient with there furloughs. They don't seem to realize how much a furlough means to a soldier it seems. Don't they realize that it might be the last time he'll see his loved ones. Some times the army leaves men at posts where he has to wait a few days or weeks for some not too important order. Don't you think they would let him go home for that time. No just because some rotten officer doesn't think it is a good idea, the poor guy has to wander around the post going nuts by himself. In conclusion I would like to say that if some of us were treated like human beings instead of cattle the army would be better run & more could be gotten out of it.
S64.Q97.Full: I believe that when a soldier is sent to school to learn material that the air corps puts out and requires deep concentration to understand this material he should not be subjected to strenuous exercises & hikes & drilling every morning. I being one of these unfortunates find I have about 30 minutes to myself from the time I get up in the morning till I get released from school. In this 30 minutes we are supposed to wash, shine shoes, get your laundry, get your mail, make your bunk and sometimes we are supposed to come for extra study at night. I also believe that the army could be a little more lenient with there furloughs. They don't seem to realize how much a furlough means to a soldier it seems. Don't they realize that it might be the last time he'll see his loved ones. Some times the army leaves men at posts where he has to wait a few days or weeks for some not too important order. Don't you think they would let him go home for that time. No just because some rotten officer doesn't think it is a good idea, the poor guy has to wander around the post going nuts by himself. In conclusion I would like to say that if some of us were treated like human beings instead of cattle the army would be better run & more could be gotten out of it.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Technical should be run on a basis similar to that of public institutions. Instead of creating asinine working hours and frequent changes within the teaching personnel a steady and reliable program should be instituted. The men who are in charge of these schools should undergo the exact treatment of the enlisted man and see whether the working hours place a strain upon the health and morale of the individual. Too many officers in
S64.Q97.C_1: responsible factions put regulations into effect and then wait for results while sitting on their posterior end. If results are not satisfactory the responsibility is shifted to the individual carrying out the regulations. When a man is entitled to a day off he should have that day to himself. The officers at this field are positive that nothing interferes on their day off but the enlisted man has to appear for reviews, parades, etc. Equality should be established between the rules pertaining to the officers and the enlisted personnel. ratings should be passed out according to seniority and ability rather than upon friendship with the officers responsible for the issuance of ratings. The morale and behaviour of the enlisted man would benefit by an increase in occasional ratings.
S64.Q97.Full: Technical should be run on a basis similar to that of public institutions. Instead of creating asinine working hours and frequent changes within the teaching personnel a steady and reliable program should be instituted. The men who are in charge of these schools should undergo the exact treatment of the enlisted man and see whether the working hours place a strain upon the health and morale of the individual. Too many officers in  responsible factions put regulations into effect and then wait for results while sitting on their posterior end. If results are not satisfactory the responsibility is shifted to the individual carrying out the regulations. When a man is entitled to a day off he should have that day to himself. The officers at this field are positive that nothing interferes on their day off but the enlisted man has to appear for reviews, parades, etc. Equality should be established between the rules pertaining to the officers and the enlisted personnel. ratings should be passed out according to seniority and ability rather than upon friendship with the officers responsible for the issuance of ratings. The morale and behaviour of the enlisted man would benefit by an increase in occasional ratings.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: Do away with stupid formations army regulations, make the soldier a happy fellow, build his morale instead of crush it. Get some decent leaders instead of ex-cons, (Poletti) Treat us like American people instead of negro slaves. Restore a few of our rights as civilians instead of taking them all away as soon as we are sworn
S64.Q97.C_1: in against our will to obey in blind obedience all crackpot ideas some two-bit leader thinks up because he believes he was delegated to be a tin Hitler himself. How about an 8 or 9 hour day instead of 15 & 16 while were here in the U.S. Overseas is a different story. We all understand that, above all, Calistlenics, get rid of them, toss them out, but whatever is done, one way or the other, abolish this asinine, morale busting, time wasting, foolish bit of nonsense that some Park Avenue, silver spoon born dictator, thought up to make life even more miserable for the dogs that we are as soldiers in this Army. At least so they tell us in most cities, "Dogs & soldiers keep off the grass."
S64.Q97.Full: Do away with stupid formations army regulations, make the soldier a happy fellow, build his morale instead of crush it. Get some decent leaders instead of ex-cons, (Poletti) Treat us like American people instead of negro slaves. Restore a few of our rights as civilians instead of taking them all away as soon as we are sworn  in against our will to obey in blind obedience all crackpot ideas some two-bit leader thinks up because he believes he was delegated to be a tin Hitler himself. How about an 8 or 9 hour day instead of 15 & 16 while were here in the U.S. Overseas is a different story. We all understand that, above all, Calistlenics, get rid of them, toss them out, but whatever is done, one way or the other, abolish this asinine, morale busting, time wasting, foolish bit of nonsense that some Park Avenue, silver spoon born dictator, thought up to make life even more miserable for the dogs that we are as soldiers in this Army. At least so they tell us in most cities, "Dogs & soldiers keep off the grass."

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Better selection of Officers should be made. Most Officers I have contact with can not do their job, yet there are many enlisted men serving under them would could and would do a good job. The same goes for N.C.O.s [non-commissioned officers] . Stop telling the public that the army is eating steak twice a day. We really aren't you know.
S64.Q97.Full: Better selection of Officers should be made. Most Officers I have contact with can not do their job, yet there are many enlisted men serving under them would could and would do a good job. The same goes for N.C.O.s [non-commissioned officers] . Stop telling the public that the army is eating steak twice a day. We really aren't you know.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: One thing I can't see is why do they have bed check for a soldier who has duty every other day.
S64.Q97.Full: One thing I can't see is why do they have bed check for a soldier who has duty every other day.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I think too much emphasis is placed on drilling and calisthenics. If more time were utilized in practical training and sports, I think the morale of the army would be greatly increased. I think that if a man's physical condition is good enough for combat duty it should be
S64.Q97.C_1: good enough to pass the exam for O.C.S. [Officer Candidate School]
S64.Q97.Full: I think too much emphasis is placed on drilling and calisthenics. If more time were utilized in practical training and sports, I think the morale of the army would be greatly increased. I think that if a man's physical condition is good enough for combat duty it should be good enough to pass the exam for O.C.S. [Officer Candidate School]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: The U.S. Army is under-officered. I think our higher officers (West Pointers) are okay but it is weak as hell from there down. I think Naval officers are far superior. Why should a soldier work on Sunday when the officers all stay home?
S64.Q97.Full: The U.S. Army is under-officered. I think our higher officers (West Pointers) are okay but it is weak as hell from there down. I think Naval officers are far superior. Why should a soldier work on Sunday when the officers all stay home?

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I don't think men should go to any officers training school direct from civilian life. Men should be picked with at least a year of army service.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't think men should go to any officers training school direct from civilian life. Men should be picked with at least a year of army service.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: Why do Army men consider Col. [college] so important to make good officers? I have seem many men who are good leaders and far better men, in some cases, than the officers who turned them down, refused cadets & OCS [Officer Candidate School] due to lack of formal education. Wise up - we need men, not boys to win this.
S64.Q97.Full: Why do Army men consider Col. [college] so important to make good officers? I have seem many men who are good leaders and far better men, in some cases, than the officers who turned them down, refused cadets & OCS [Officer Candidate School] due to lack of formal education. Wise up - we need men, not boys to win this.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: 19. con't) Most of the men, I was with. The personell of my classification center was a [underline] most [/underline] incompetent bunch of G.I.s, classifying men to do jobs they were wholly unfitted for. [paragraph] When there is such a crying need for man power in civilian life, why not permanently discharge [unclear] qualified [/unclear] men from the army and let them help out? (over)
S64.Q97.C_1: I know that where the war is over I'll want to get out immediately. I hope this survey will bring some results. Personally I've had a very good deal out of the army. But I've seen some men get so much crap thrown at them that its no wonder they go over the hill. So here's hoping the the army will be cleared out a bit and a few parasites eliminated. It would be a much better place to be connected with, if such action were taken

(over) I know that where the war is over I'll want to get out immediately. I hope this survey will bring some results. Personally I've had a very good deal out of the army. But I've seen some men get so much crap thrown at them that its no wonder they go over the hill. So here's hoping the the army will be cleared out a bit and a few parasites eliminated. document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I. Lowry Field is a Technical School field - [insertion] students [/insertion] [insertion] are [/insertion] sent here to learn Armament or photography - yet they spend most of their time on Physical Training, Infantry drill, etc. Our students are so exhausted, mentally and physically, they cannot do justice to their technical courses. [underline] Why [/underline] cannot P.T. & I.D. be given in Basic Training center before the students are sent here? [underline] Why [/underline] is Infantry Drill so damned important
S64.Q97.C_1: in the Air Corps? Why cannot some of the older officers realize we are trying to make [underline] technicians [/underline] out of these students and not drill automatons. [paragraph] II. Why cannot the Commanding General of a field set up a definite, fair, orderly program and then carry that program to completion? [underline] Rather [/underline] than having the whole field in complete confusion all of the time? Are real officers [underline] that [/underline] scarce? [paragraph] III. I think the U.S. should maintain a large army after the war- should have 1 year compulsory military training for all males. The permanent personnel should be high type, educated non-coms [non-commissioned officers] & officers- the pay scale should be high enough to attract good men. Good men should be allowed to enlist in grade after the war and their warrants made permanent.
S64.Q97.Full: I. Lowry Field is a Technical School field - [insertion] students [/insertion] [insertion] are [/insertion] sent here to learn Armament or photography - yet they spend most of their time on Physical Training, Infantry drill, etc. Our students are so exhausted, mentally and physically, they cannot do justice to their technical courses. [underline] Why [/underline] cannot P.T. & I.D. be given in Basic Training center before the students are sent here? [underline] Why [/underline] is Infantry Drill so damned important in the Air Corps? Why cannot some of the older officers realize we are trying to make [underline] technicians [/underline] out of these students and not drill automatons. [paragraph] II. Why cannot the Commanding General of a field set up a definite, fair, orderly program and then carry that program to completion? [underline] Rather [/underline] than having the whole field in complete confusion all of the time? Are real officers [underline] that [/underline] scarce? [paragraph] III. I think the U.S. should maintain a large army after the war- should have 1 year compulsory military training for all males. The permanent personnel should be high type, educated non-coms [non-commissioned officers] & officers- the pay scale should be high enough to attract good men. Good men should be allowed to enlist in grade after the war and their warrants made permanent.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: 1. There is to much waste in the Army of food etc. 2. Men should be classified better. 3. Commissions should not be given from Civilian life. It seems as though to get a commission you have to be a band leader, movie star or a Congress mans nephew.
S64.Q97.C_1: All class distinctions should cease in the Army. There should be a closer bond between officers and men. We respect the officers but act as tho they are little tin Gods. [paragraph] Furloughs should be given regularly also thee day passes. [paragraph] A War time Army should be considered in a different light than a peace time Army. [paragraph] [deletion] After [/deletion]
S64.Q97.Full: 1. There is to much waste in the Army of food etc. 2. Men should be classified better. 3. Commissions should not be given from Civilian life. It seems as though to get a commission you have to be a band leader, movie star or a Congress mans nephew. All class distinctions should cease in the Army. There should be a closer bond between officers and men. We respect the officers but act as tho they are little tin Gods. [paragraph] Furloughs should be given regularly also thee day passes. [paragraph] A War time Army should be considered in a different light than a peace time Army. [paragraph] [deletion] After [/deletion]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Air Corps tech. [technical] tr. [troops] camps are only military Boy Scouts posts. Having been a scout master - have basis to the same opinion of many of my comrades. Military discipline in the AAFTTC [Army Air Forces Tactical Terminal Control] have been to [unclear] [/unclear] , thus creating a backlog of dissatisfaction among EM [enlisted men] . Some of this is caused by the actions of officers - who are unable to maintain an unbiased equity of humans.
S64.Q97.C_1: Army regulations are laws governing conduct and procedure - But like civilian laws - Do not gain the prominence they were destined to.
S64.Q97.Full: Air Corps tech. [technical] tr. [troops] camps are only military Boy Scouts posts. Having been a scout master - have basis to the same opinion of many of my comrades. Military discipline in the AAFTTC [Army Air Forces Tactical Terminal Control] have been to [unclear] [/unclear] , thus creating a backlog of dissatisfaction among EM [enlisted men] . Some of this is caused by the actions of officers - who are unable to maintain an unbiased equity of humans. Army regulations are laws governing conduct and procedure - But like civilian laws - Do not gain the prominence they were destined to.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I truly believe the soldier [deletion] should [/deletion] should be told more and in detail what is going on in this war. Many civilians know more about than most of us do.
S64.Q97.Full: I truly believe the soldier [deletion] should [/deletion] should be told more and in detail what is going on in this war. Many civilians know more about than most of us do.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I have tried to find out about OCS [Officer Candidate School] but I am discouraged in my effort because non-coms [non-commissioned officers] either don't know or don't want to take time to give the information.[paragraph] I will have been in the army almost a year before I will be able to get a furlough or 3 day pass. It seems things are not properly adjusted because many men will have had ...
S64.Q97.C_1: two furloughs by then although they came in when I did. I need some time off to look after some property interests. This is not a personal matter because other fellows in my outfit are in the same boat.
S64.Q97.Full: I have tried to find out about OCS [Officer Candidate School] but I am discouraged in my effort because non-coms [non-commissioned officers] either don't know or don't want to take time to give the information.[paragraph] I will have been in the army almost a year before I will be able to get a furlough or 3 day pass. It seems things are not properly adjusted because many men will have had ... two furloughs by then although they came in when I did. I need some time off to look after some property interests. This is not a personal matter because other fellows in my outfit are in the same boat.

S64.Q97.Full: I think the Army would be much better if [insertion] it [/insertion] would get rid of some of these Chicken shits which exist. I [deletion] [/deletion] think there is entirely too much hand shaking going on. Some of the boys don't get a fair chance.

S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Instead of court marshal for the soldiers that go A.W.O.L. there had better be a court marshal for some of these big shots that are making a [unclear] racket [/unclear] out of the army. document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: Whenever possible we should be informed of the duties we are expected to perform. At least a day in advance. Too many conflicting orders create a war of nerves and accomplish nothing. Let everyone concentrate on his duties which concern the prosecution of the war and forget the unimportant but time consuming details. Whenever possible the experienced men should be chosen for
S64.Q97.C_1: officer training as it is bad on morale to have recruits given the opportunities that you deserve

Whenever possible the experienced men should be chosen for  officer training as it is bad on morale to have recruits given the opportunities that you deserve

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: [A checked box and an additional answer has been added below answer 9. Answer 6 has been checked and has the initials DSC beside it and is recorded as the answer in the right column. The added answer reads as:] Have had them offered but have not taken them.
S64.Q97.F: Why not confer commissions upon men who have ability. Most of the officers I have seen know about enough to come in out of the rain. The non-coms runs the army, so why not give them their just desserts. I do want to say however that I have met some excellent officers, but most if them were non-coms before the war. [paragraph]

The non-coms runs the army, so why not give them their just desserts. I do want to say however that I have met some excellent officers, but most if them were non-coms before the war. [paragraph]

S64.Q96.M_marginalia: No labor so my old mother & father must do work they shouldn't

S64.Q97.C_1: in one field should be placed if possible in this place in army instead of depending too much upon army tests.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: (1) The army tries to impose discipline from the top. It should develop from the ranks. Soldiers should be given political understanding - the rest would be easy.[paragraph] (2) The army uses childish methods to build "morale." Again, the only possible way to build it is through policital understanding.[paragraph] (3) Pull & familiarization are plentiful in the army.
S64.Q97.C_1: (4) orders are made & rescinded constantly. This suggests the officers are totally confused. Inefficiency & commotion are the results. [paragraph] (5) Each outfit should have the power to choose its own non-coms[non commissioned officers] & have a large voice in the choice of officers - only after a lot of political understanding is developed. [paragraph] (6) Each outfit should hold regular meetings for self criticism & suggestions
S64.Q97.Full: (1) The army tries to impose discipline from the top. It should develop from the ranks. Soldiers should be given political understanding - the rest would be easy.[paragraph] (2) The army uses childish methods to build "morale." Again, the only possible way to build it is through policital understanding.[paragraph] (3) Pull & familiarization are plentiful in the army. (4) orders are made & rescinded constantly. This suggests the officers are totally confused. Inefficiency & commotion are the results. [paragraph] (5) Each outfit should have the power to choose its own non-coms[non commissioned officers] & have a large voice in the choice of officers - only after a lot of political understanding is developed. [paragraph] (6) Each outfit should hold regular meetings for self criticism & suggestions

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes

S64.Q97.Full: My mother is all alone now and she has trouble getting rationed meat. She doesn't get any more rent but the taxes are higher. Except for her, all the conditions seem about the same as before.

S64.Q97.Full: If they did not give us so much to do beside our school job I think we could do a better job and turn out better students. [paragraph]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: Married men with pregnant wives should be given an additional allotment as soon as pregnancy can be determined by medical exam. An enlisted man's allotment of 3 dlrs is damn little for a girl to live on who can't work because of her condition.
S64.Q97.Full: Married men with pregnant wives should be given an additional allotment as soon as pregnancy can be determined by medical exam. An enlisted man's allotment of 3 dlrs is damn little for a girl to live on who can't work because of her condition.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Other/No answer
S64.Q97.F: I think everybody should have their share of K.P. [kitchen patrol] Why put a few hundred on permanent. I have been bypass as a mechanic at Miami Beach Fla [Florida] I was then sent to Atlantic City New Jersey for 12 week P.O.E. [Port of Embarkation] training. We were told that we were going overseas after the P.O.E. [Port of Embarkation] training but
S64.Q97.C_1: instead went to Bols after 2 month there we were shipped to Sheppard Field Texas and assigned to Permanent K. P. [Kitchen Patrol]
S64.Q97.Full: I think everybody should have their share of K.P. [kitchen patrol] Why put a few hundred on permanent. I have been bypass as a mechanic at Miami Beach Fla [Florida] I was then sent to Atlantic City New Jersey for 12 week P.O.E. [Port of Embarkation] training. We were told that we were going overseas after the P.O.E. [Port of Embarkation] training but instead went to Bols after 2 month there we were shipped to Sheppard Field Texas and assigned to Permanent K. P. [Kitchen Patrol]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I believe there is a terrible waste of man power many times in our forces in U.S. Training is not complete enough in some cases for men to do their best. Men are not classified correct for their civilian abilities in many cases. [paragraph] Many limited service men should be home working at war work.
S64.Q97.Full: I believe there is a terrible waste of man power many times in our forces in U.S. Training is not complete enough in some cases for men to do their best. Men are not classified correct for their civilian abilities in many cases. [paragraph] Many limited service men should be home working at war work.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Sometimes I think I can do more as a civillin [civilian] diffense [defense] worker and other times as a soldier. To make any rank you must be very well known to the officer in your sqdn [squadron] and stay very close to him before you are really recognized at all.
S64.Q97.Full: Sometimes I think I can do more as a civillin [civilian] diffense [defense] worker and other times as a soldier. To make any rank you must be very well known to the officer in your sqdn [squadron] and stay very close to him before you are really recognized at all.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I signed up for the army I signed up for aireil gunner I was not given the chance to take it and I would still like to have it. [deletion] [/deletion] But this post won't give a soldier a chance. [paragraph] I even signed up for over seas duty. They won't even let me tak a 63 examination.
S64.Q97.Full: I signed up for the army I signed up for aireil gunner I was not given the chance to take it and I would still like to have it. [deletion] [/deletion] But this post won't give a soldier a chance. [paragraph] I even signed up for over seas duty. They won't even let me tak a 63 examination.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think that after a certain amount of time in the service a man is entitled to a furlough, every man in my outfit and myself have been in for 9 months or more and have never had a furlough yet, while other men have had 2 in this time. Is that very fair? I don't think so. It is said that the Army gets the best
S64.Q97.C_1: of food, well, in my opinion the food at "Sheppard Field Tex." isn't fit for a pig to eat, the men out here live like cattle and are treated as such. We have been waiting around for 3 weeks now for shippement since we finished A.M. school, couldn't they give us at least a 10 day furlough? We had to wait 2 weeks before we started school and all we did was K.P. and guard duty, now the new students who are waiting to start school are getting furloughs, we have been in 9 months, they have been in 4 months. Do you think getting a deal like that will make a man very ambitious, as a matter of fact it's getting to the point where we just don't give a damn any more.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that after a certain amount of time in the service a man is entitled to a furlough, every man in my outfit and myself have been in for 9 months or more and have never had a furlough yet, while other men have had 2 in this time. Is that very fair? I don't think so. It is said that the Army gets the best of food, well, in my opinion the food at "Sheppard Field Tex." isn't fit for a pig to eat, the men out here live like cattle and are treated as such. We have been waiting around for 3 weeks now for shippement since we finished A.M. school, couldn't they give us at least a 10 day furlough? We had to wait 2 weeks before we started school and all we did was K.P. and guard duty, now the new students who are waiting to start school are getting furloughs, we have been in 9 months, they have been in 4 months. Do you think getting a deal like that will make a man very ambitious, as a matter of fact it's getting to the point where we just don't give a damn any more.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I like the army alright but when the war is over I am ready to go home. I am a aerial gunner and I think my job is very important. I think the best army camps are the one I leave & the one I go to until I go across.
S64.Q97.Full: I like the army alright but when the war is over I am ready to go home. I am a aerial gunner and I think my job is very important. I think the best army camps are the one I leave & the one I go to until I go across.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think most things in the Army camps here could be done more smoothly and without so much loss of time if the high ranking officers would lower their chins and put more interest in the job they should be doing. Instead most of them don't think of what the privates and etc are going through and if it takes a week to do an hours job they seem to feel O.K. about it. The Army camp here is very overload and I here [hear] its [sic] this way all over.
S64.Q97.C_1: so if that is true I think they should build more camps or if they have to many men let the older married men with children out because after all they have a lot more to live for considering there wives and children also a lot more to worry about which is bound to be a handicap as far as being a good soldier.
S64.Q97.Full: I think most things in the Army camps here could be done more smoothly and without so much loss of time if the high ranking officers would lower their chins and put more interest in the job they should be doing. Instead most of them don't think of what the privates and etc are going through and if it takes a week to do an hours job they seem to feel O.K. about it. The Army camp here is very overload and I here [hear] its [sic] this way all over. so if that is true I think they should build more camps or if they have to many men let the older married men with children out because after all they have a lot more to live for considering there wives and children also a lot more to worry about which is bound to be a handicap as far as being a good soldier.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: As a soldier I have to say a person who was taken into the army in good condition, after a period of months was found to have a perforated ear. The officials took and put him up for a discharge & he refused it. Since he has been in the service he has liked & does not want to leave. They take & return him back to general service. About 2 mo. [months] later he goes to sick call with wax in his ear and they take & put him up for C.D.D. [Certificate of Disability for Discharge] . The doctors ...
S64.Q97.C_1: takes and gives him a slip to report to the hospital. He takes and rips it up because he wants to stay in and fight for his country and likes army life. Is there anyway he can be relieved from not getting a discharge?[paragraph] The weather is very hot down here in the western part of Texas. We do P.T. [Physical training] 6 times a wk [week] . Some fellows can stand it and others can't do it. A fellow came off the P.T. field with the chills. A non com [non-commissioned officer] took and threw a bucket of water on him and it killed him. That shows the results of physical training.[paragraph] The water is very hot down here and you can hardly get a cool drink of water.[paragraph] The beer in the army camps are not worth a damn. It is the most distasteful stuff a man ever drank. I would think they could get some good brand of beer.
S64.Q97.Full: As a soldier I have to say a person who was taken into the army in good condition, after a period of months was found to have a perforated ear. The officials took and put him up for a discharge & he refused it. Since he has been in the service he has liked & does not want to leave. They take & return him back to general service. About 2 mo. [months] later he goes to sick call with wax in his ear and they take & put him up for C.D.D. [Certificate of Disability for Discharge] . The doctors ... takes and gives him a slip to report to the hospital. He takes and rips it up because he wants to stay in and fight for his country and likes army life. Is there anyway he can be relieved from not getting a discharge?[paragraph] The weather is very hot down here in the western part of Texas. We do P.T. [Physical training] 6 times a wk [week] . Some fellows can stand it and others can't do it. A fellow came off the P.T. field with the chills. A non com [non-commissioned officer] took and threw a bucket of water on him and it killed him. That shows the results of physical training.[paragraph] The water is very hot down here and you can hardly get a cool drink of water.[paragraph] The beer in the army camps are not worth a damn. It is the most distasteful stuff a man ever drank. I would think they could get some good brand of beer.

S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much

S64.Q97.F: We could stand better chow. [paragraph] I don't see any reason for having bed check while we are going to school as most of the boys like the school and wouldn't stay out and miss any of it. If [deletion] [/deletion] we didn't have bed check we could sleep out in the squadron area once in a while and not smother in the barracks. [paragraph] [deletion] [/deletion] about the furloughs. When I started school I wasn't in long enough
S64.Q97.C_1: to get one but when I get through with it I sure hope I can get one.
S64.Q97.Full: We could stand better chow. [paragraph] I don't see any reason for having bed check while we are going to school as most of the boys like the school and wouldn't stay out and miss any of it. If [deletion] [/deletion] we didn't have bed check we could sleep out in the squadron area once in a while and not smother in the barracks. [paragraph] [deletion] [/deletion] about the furloughs. When I started school I wasn't in long enough to get one but when I get through with it I sure hope I can get one.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: We could do without so much P.T. these hot days & also we could stand better chow most of the time [paragraph]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: The things I would remark about are all mostly about picking the right man for the right job. The army spends more money, time & such trying to keep a fellow on the beam when I should thing [think] they would spend more time picking the leaders & spend more money to entertain & keep the soldiers busy & out of trouble.
S64.Q97.Full: The things I would remark about are all mostly about picking the right man for the right job. The army spends more money, time & such trying to keep a fellow on the beam when I should thing [think] they would spend more time picking the leaders & spend more money to entertain & keep the soldiers busy & out of trouble.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: The army as a whole is pretty good but the only thing bad in the Air Corp is it take to long a time to get a furlough. As for Sheppard Field the fellows are crowded to much in barracks such as ours especially in this warm weather. Chow can be ranged a little better than it is the sufficient food
S64.Q97.C_1: but it isn't cooked properly. During this warm weather school students should only have one hour of Physical Training.
S64.Q97.Full: The army as a whole is pretty good but the only thing bad in the Air Corp is it take to long a time to get a furlough. As for Sheppard Field the fellows are crowded to much in barracks such as ours especially in this warm weather. Chow can be ranged a little better than it is the sufficient food but it isn't cooked properly. During this warm weather school students should only have one hour of Physical Training.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: The army should do away with certain laying down exercise the student soldiers have to do after school as they cannot keep clean and keep their uniforms clean by rolling around in dust and dirt. And have better system in the mess halls and not have them all eating in one section and having another section vacant. And should allow the soldiers out during their free time.
S64.Q97.Full: The army should do away with certain laying down exercise the student soldiers have to do after school as they cannot keep clean and keep their uniforms clean by rolling around in dust and dirt. And have better system in the mess halls and not have them all eating in one section and having another section vacant. And should allow the soldiers out during their free time.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I have a few remarks about Sheppard Field and Vicinity. [paragraph] There are all together too many M.P.s[Military Personnel] bothering us for passes. In camps before, we didn't need passes to go out the gates. All we did was to sign our name in the orderly rooms stating where we were going as long as it wasn't over 50 miles away. Also on the east coast we didn't have a curfew law. As long as we were in for revielle[revelry] we were safe. There also should be a few more PX's[army exchange] here at the field.
S64.Q97.C_1: They should cut out physical training altogether here because instead of building us up they make us sick of living and we lose altogether to much weight to keep in physical fit. We should get more milk to drink and at least 1 steak meal a week. [paragraph]
S64.Q97.Full: I have a few remarks about Sheppard Field and Vicinity. [paragraph] There are all together too many M.P.s[Military Personnel] bothering us for passes. In camps before, we didn't need passes to go out the gates. All we did was to sign our name in the orderly rooms stating where we were going as long as it wasn't over 50 miles away. Also on the east coast we didn't have a curfew law. As long as we were in for revielle[revelry] we were safe. There also should be a few more PX's[army exchange] here at the field.  They should cut out physical training altogether here because instead of building us up they make us sick of living and we lose altogether to much weight to keep in physical fit. We should get more milk to drink and at least 1 steak meal a week. [paragraph]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: My answers to questions 30 & 31 may not seem to agree but I feel that if I remain in the army long enough, my talents will be recognized with a few promotions. Up till now I've been stuck in Air Corps technical schools. When I am graduated from the last of these I think things will look a lot better. My opinion on officers must be limited to officers stationed
S64.Q97.C_1: in training squadrons. On the whole they're pretty rough & unreasonable. I have been commanded by and officer who was disabled at Pearl Harbor. If all combat officers are like he was, risking ones beck won't be so bad. He had a method.
S64.Q97.Full: My answers to questions 30 & 31 may not seem to agree but I feel that if I remain in the army long enough, my talents will be recognized with a few promotions. Up till now I've been stuck in Air Corps technical schools. When I am graduated from the last of these I think things will look a lot better. My opinion on officers must be limited to officers stationed in training squadrons. On the whole they're pretty rough & unreasonable. I have been commanded by and officer who was disabled at Pearl Harbor. If all combat officers are like he was, risking ones beck won't be so bad. He had a method.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: My remarks are all meant about Shepperd Field, Texas alone. It has the worst system of orginization [organization] I have ever seen and I have been in 4 large camps besides this one. On the whole the officers seem to care less about their men and morale. The food is good but the way it is cooked is not a bit good. There is also not enough variety of foods. I believe men should be allowed to leave camp any night as long as they are back by revale [Reveille] . Passes are given out [insertion] but [/insertion] once a week and there are too many men to be let loose at one Time
S64.Q97.C_1: during each week. The physical training does more harm than good and is entirely too long. Our entertainment is about the best I have ever had or seen but for my part there is entirely too little. On the whole it is a poor camp and I will be glad to leave when my time comes.
S64.Q97.Full: My remarks are all meant about Shepperd Field, Texas alone. It has the worst system of orginization [organization] I have ever seen and I have been in 4 large camps besides this one. On the whole the officers seem to care less about their men and morale. The food is good but the way it is cooked is not a bit good. There is also not enough variety of foods. I believe men should be allowed to leave camp any night as long as they are back by revale [Reveille] . Passes are given out [insertion] but [/insertion] once a week and there are too many men to be let loose at one Time during each week. The physical training does more harm than good and is entirely too long. Our entertainment is about the best I have ever had or seen but for my part there is entirely too little. On the whole it is a poor camp and I will be glad to leave when my time comes.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: A Air Corp should be Air Corp, just because there is an Infantry man why have Air Corp Infantry. School is tough enough with out over exercising oneself on a drill field. One hour of calesthenics and a good obstacle course is plenty for any one while racking his brain in school, he needs rest not tearing down in such intense heat as Texas has.
S64.Q97.Full: A Air Corp should be Air Corp, just because there is an Infantry man why have Air Corp Infantry. School is tough enough with out over exercising oneself on a drill field. One hour of calesthenics and a good obstacle course is plenty for any one while racking his brain in school, he needs rest not tearing down in such intense heat as Texas has.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: My biggest beef upon army conditions is the apparent waste of man power. I have seen so many times that Jobs have to be invented to keep men busy. I feel that there isn't as much of a place in the army for limited service men as there would be in civilian life. Limited service men released to war jobs would enable a lot of healthy war workers to become soldiers who would be able to do their best when needed. I personally find
S64.Q97.C_1: that as yet married men with children are not needed, and any in the army now should be given a chance to be drafted into war jobs if they so desire. [paragraph] Our country's ideals are built upon the family and home. Why should men's families suffer when other men are still out the the army yet they have no children, etc. I feel as though the men with the least home duties should be well trained as soldiers.
S64.Q97.Full: My biggest beef upon army conditions is the apparent waste of man power. I have seen so many times that Jobs have to be invented to keep men busy. I feel that there isn't as much of a place in the army for limited service men as there would be in civilian life. Limited service men released to war jobs would enable a lot of healthy war workers to become soldiers who would be able to do their best when needed. I personally find that as yet married men with children are not needed, and any in the army now should be given a chance to be drafted into war jobs if they so desire. [paragraph] Our country's ideals are built upon the family and home. Why should men's families suffer when other men are still out the the army yet they have no children, etc. I feel as though the men with the least home duties should be well trained as soldiers.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: About the guesses of when the war will be over. They were just(?) if Italy should surrender + if Germany falls in the near future. As far as my personal feeling about Army life is concerned I don't like it at all. But as long as I am here I will do my best to get all the learning I can get.
S64.Q97.C_1: About Sheppard Field I think it is a pretty lousy place. [unclear] [/unclear] the first reason it must be run by some old Infantry man, at least it seems that way. They want us to do P.T. the same as the infantry & artillery have it. I think some one should tell him this is the Air Corps. That not the only thing it is the way the camp is run in general. I like the Air Corps as a matter of fact I think it is the best bunch in the service. But not the way it is run in Sheppard Field, Texas.
S64.Q97.Full: About the guesses of when the war will be over. They were just(?) if Italy should surrender + if Germany falls in the near future. As far as my personal feeling about Army life is concerned I don't like it at all. But as long as I am here I will do my best to get all the learning I can get. About Sheppard Field I think it is a pretty lousy place. [unclear] [/unclear] the first reason it must be run by some old Infantry man, at least it seems that way. They want us to do P.T. the same as the infantry & artillery have it. I think some one should tell him this is the Air Corps. That not the only thing it is the way the camp is run in general. I like the Air Corps as a matter of fact I think it is the best bunch in the service. But not the way it is run in Sheppard Field, Texas.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I can't figure out why the government would have to build a camp on a place like it. The army is healthful but the dirt blows around here is not they should realize that and it breaks the moral a lot and its the opinion of all the boys at this field, there is not enough entertainment at this field when a soldier gets finish his duty for the day he would like to relax.
S64.Q97.Full: I can't figure out why the government would have to build a camp on a place like it. The army is healthful but the dirt blows around here is not they should realize that and it breaks the moral a lot and its the opinion of all the boys at this field, there is not enough entertainment at this field when a soldier gets finish his duty for the day he would like to relax.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: 1) I think the mess halls could be kept a little bit cleaner and also better food. 2) I can't see why a soldier, in the Air Corps on student status can't get a furlough until he is assigned which is usually 10 to 12 months.
S64.Q97.Full: 1) I think the mess halls could be kept a little bit cleaner and also better food. 2) I can't see why a soldier, in the Air Corps on student status can't get a furlough until he is assigned which is usually 10 to 12 months.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M_marginalia: the one corps is in my [unclear] [/unclear] the head branch of the army. their [unclear] [/unclear] of giving furloughs is [unclear] [/unclear] though there should be a better arrangement in which men will get home on a [unclear] [/unclear] on time [unclear] [/unclear] such has been the case. a furlough [unclear] [/unclear] the morale of a soldier and [unclear] [/unclear] made him a better fighting man. So also [unclear] [/unclear] for phone [unclear] [/unclear] home [unclear] [/unclear]
S64.Q97.F: The air corps is in my estimation the best branch of the army. Their system of giving furloughs is pretty bad though. There should be a better arrangement in which men will go home in a shorter space of time than such has been the case. A furlough boosts the morale of a soldier and tends to make him a better fighting man. It also makes for a stronger home front.
S64.Q97.C_1: 97. (Continued) Continue writing your remarks here. Every force in the United States is dependent on one another so I say treat each in the same manner. An air corps man waits on average of nine months before he can ever see home.
S64.Q97.Full: The air corps is in my estimation the best branch of the army. Their system of giving furloughs is pretty bad though. There should be a better arrangement in which men will go home in a shorter space of time than such has been the case. A furlough boosts the morale of a soldier and tends to make him a better fighting man. It also makes for a stronger home front. 97. (Continued) Continue writing your remarks here. Every force in the United States is dependent on one another so I say treat each in the same manner. An air corps man waits on average of nine months before he can ever see home.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: The mess halls - you have to stand in line for everything and it seems that some of it could be done away with. With two sides with tables on each we have to crowd up on one side and going out both the exits instead of one could be used. Our physical training should be used to teach us battle tactics such as judo, rifle firing and bayonet drill rather than drill and exercise in the heat
S64.Q97.C_1: when it does more harm than good. If we were given things that would actually help men in case we were attacked by an enemy using any form of weapon. When men came from civilian life and are put in the army some were already trained for something and had experience instead of putting them where they could do their most they were put in something that they were needed by the classification boards.
S64.Q97.Full: The mess halls - you have to stand in line for everything and it seems that some of it could be done away with. With two sides with tables on each we have to crowd up on one side and going out both the exits instead of one could be used. Our physical training should be used to teach us battle tactics such as judo, rifle firing and bayonet drill rather than drill and exercise in the heat when it does more harm than good. If we were given things that would actually help men in case we were attacked by an enemy using any form of weapon. When men came from civilian life and are put in the army some were already trained for something and had experience instead of putting them where they could do their most they were put in something that they were needed by the classification boards.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: well after a soldier finishes his training and schooling why not send him to a post near his home. If that can't be done why not let him go home for a few days every two or three months.
S64.Q97.Full: well after a soldier finishes his training and schooling why not send him to a post near his home. If that can't be done why not let him go home for a few days every two or three months.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I believe a lot of the cases of A..W.O.L. could be stopped if soldiers were given a furlough in case of serious illness in the family. I also think a soldier should be allowed to go home in case he becomes a father. - In several cases I know of soldiers were not permited to go home even tho their wives were in dangerous condition when the child
S64.Q97.C_1: was born. At this particular field it is necessary that the drinking water be chlorinated and during the hot months the water is almost unbearable, - it seems something could be done to remedy this condition. It has always been my understanding that officers are supposed to be gentlemen, - but in numerous instances in the past I have noticed some very ungentlemanly acts being committed by officers.
S64.Q97.Full: I believe a lot of the cases of A..W.O.L. could be stopped if soldiers were given a furlough in case of serious illness in the family. I also think a soldier should be allowed to go home in case he becomes a father. - In several cases I know of soldiers were not permited to go home even tho their wives were in dangerous condition when the child  was born. At this particular field it is necessary that the drinking water be chlorinated and during the hot months the water is almost unbearable, - it seems something could be done to remedy this condition. It has always been my understanding that officers are supposed to be gentlemen, - but in numerous instances in the past I have noticed some very ungentlemanly acts being committed by officers.

S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I think a soldier should get a furlough at least every three months & even in war time except for those over seas. I lost all interest in the army because I can't get a furlough. I miss my folks at home and I would do anything to see them.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: The mess halls at this field are atrocious. There is plenty of food, but it is either cooked poorly or not enough. There is very little variety - we have eggs, potatoes & pork almost every day at breakfast time we are given only one cup of milk (whole day). We cannot get any seconds. Same is tru for lunch - no seconds. The food is so poor I havent had supper for almost a month. We had to stand on [unclear] for everything
S64.Q97.C_1: there is no music or drinks worth having. There are two sides to a man + we are [insertion] all [/insertion] crowded into one side. [paragraph] It would be a good idea to put pitchers of milk or drink on the table then on hand barrels or other items with which the pitcher may be refilled as often as necessary. Allow seconds. [paragraph] The P.T. is for the most part uneccesary and in fact bad for the soldiers. After standing up all day in school weight an hour close order drill which is absolutely unnecessary. Few of the flight do need drilling. The calisthenics + sand run or obstacle course for one hour a day is plenty. [paragraph] The sick call in this squadron is pretty big. It is unnecessary. Most boys don't feel sick. They feel tired + unable to go out on drill field. The officers should give men permission to take a days rest when requested if the man's record is clear + he doesn't do the same thing persistently. Records can be kept of men taking a day off the same as sick call.
S64.Q97.Full: The mess halls at this field are atrocious. There is plenty of food, but it is either cooked poorly or not enough. There is very little variety - we have eggs, potatoes & pork almost every day at breakfast time we are given only one cup of milk (whole day). We cannot get any seconds. Same is tru for lunch - no seconds. The food is so poor I havent had supper for almost a month. We had to stand on [unclear] for everything  there is no music or drinks worth having. There are two sides to a man + we are [insertion] all [/insertion] crowded into one side. [paragraph] It would be a good idea to put pitchers of milk or drink on the table then on hand barrels or other items with which the pitcher may be refilled as often as necessary. Allow seconds. [paragraph] The P.T. is for the most part uneccesary and in fact bad for the soldiers. After standing up all day in school weight an hour close order drill which is absolutely unnecessary. Few of the flight do need drilling. The calisthenics + sand run or obstacle course for one hour a day is plenty. [paragraph] The sick call in this squadron is pretty big. It is unnecessary. Most boys don't feel sick. They feel tired + unable to go out on drill field. The officers should give men permission to take a days rest when requested if the man's record is clear + he doesn't do the same thing persistently. Records can be kept of men taking a day off the same as sick call.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I believe in farm furloughs. I am really needed at home during harvest, but not badly enough for a farm discharge. As much as I can find out, there is no legitimate way to get home this fall.[paragraph] There should be a physhological [psychological] school for both non coms [non-commissioned officers] & commissioned officers to teach them to teach the men.
S64.Q97.C_1: under them - rather than being doctotors [doctors] . This would keep down the battle between free thinking and Army thinking in other words keep the average soldier from being a zombie. [paragraph]
S64.Q97.Full: I believe in farm furloughs. I am really needed at home during harvest, but not badly enough for a farm discharge. As much as I can find out, there is no legitimate way to get home this fall.[paragraph] There should be a physhological [psychological] school for both non coms [non-commissioned officers] & commissioned officers to teach them to teach the men.  under them - rather than being doctotors [doctors] . This would keep down the battle between free thinking and Army thinking in other words keep the average soldier from being a zombie. [paragraph]

S64.Q97.F: We have steady K.P. which I think is unfair. My I.q. is low but I should not be in the Air Corp instead I should be in the Infantry. K.P. is hard we are ashamed to write home and to our friends. Our officers and Non com are not treating us right. I loved the army before I came to this camp.

K.P. is hard we are ashamed to write home and to our friends. Our officers and Non com are not treating us right. I loved the army before I came to this camp.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: This mess squadron is something which should be discontinued at once. The other men besides myself think its [sic] hell. No chance for ratings, no increase in pay. I know from experience that I can do more in some other job and many ...
S64.Q97.C_1: others thinks the same. I was going more toward winning the war when I was farming than I am now. I would like the Army if I could [get] a job or in a branch of service which I liked. I would consider staying in the Army after the war if I were in another branch of service. The job which I now have [deletion] [/deletion] makes me want to go A.W.O.L. at times its just the same old racket ever day through the month.

I would like the Army if I could [get] a job or in a branch of service which I liked. I would consider staying in the Army after the war if I were in another branch of service. The job which I now have [deletion] [/deletion] makes me want to go A.W.O.L. at times its just the same old racket ever day through the month.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think there should never be a permanent mess sqd. No soldier should be made to do K.P. permanently. Also they should let us go to reclassification but they don't. When a soldier comes into the Army I think the biggest mistake is by sending him so damn far from home. If he is classified for a certain school, well
S64.Q97.C_1: why don't they send him to the nearest school of which he is going which is nearer to his home. By sending a soldier far from home while he is in the states, causes a great percentage of A.W.O.L.
S64.Q97.Full: I think there should never be a permanent mess sqd. No soldier should be made to do K.P. permanently. Also they should let us go to reclassification but they don't. When a soldier comes into the Army I think the biggest mistake is by sending him so damn far from home. If he is classified for a certain school, well  why don't they send him to the nearest school of which he is going which is nearer to his home. By sending a soldier far from home while he is in the states, causes a great percentage of A.W.O.L.

S64.Q97.F: I would like to make s statement. I have been having a sore back since 1938 and I've heard that the Army of the U.S. had the best doctors. As I don't doubt, but as for me I haven't seen any doctor whose done anything for me. I've been suffering for a long time, and been complaining, but to no improvement, and I would like to have something done in order to have disabled men ...
S64.Q97.C_1: taken care of the way they're supposed to be taken care of. or we won't have much of an Army. And they should give a good more [deletion] [/deletion] complete + right examination before [unclear] entering [/unclear] the Army. I told them about my back and they didn't pay any attention to me. So here I am [unclear] been [/unclear] suffering and can't make any kind of a Soldier. So I would do better in a war industry. A bad back is very Serious [unclear] in [/unclear] the Army because everybody has to have a good strong back + a strong body to do everything [unclear] we're [/unclear] supposed to do.
S64.Q97.Full: I would like to make s statement. I have been having a sore back since 1938 and I've heard that the Army of the U.S. had the best doctors. As I don't doubt, but as for me I haven't seen any doctor whose done anything for me. I've been suffering for a long time, and been complaining, but to no improvement, and I would like to have something done in order to have disabled men ... taken care of the way they're supposed to be taken care of. or we won't have much of an Army. And they should give a good more [deletion] [/deletion] complete + right examination before [unclear] entering [/unclear] the Army. I told them about my back and they didn't pay any attention to me.
