A bad back is very Serious [unclear] in [/unclear] the Army because everybody has to have a good strong back + a strong body to do everything [unclear] we're [/unclear] supposed to do.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: I don't use them.
S64.Q96.M_marginalia: in my own family
S64.Q97.F: I think that furloughs should be given every six months while a soldier is training in this country and in combat they should be give when ever possible. Every three months if possible. These passes are not too good at times it detracts the mind of the soilder, specialy when some of these towns around the camp have very little to offer, but VICE. Give the soilder more day rooms with more equipment - The will stay in the Camp area - [paragraph]
S64.Q97.Full: I think that furloughs should be given every six months while a soldier is training in this country and in combat they should be give when ever possible. Every three months if possible. These passes are not too good at times it detracts the mind of the soilder, specialy when some of these towns around the camp have very little to offer, but VICE. Give the soilder more day rooms with more equipment - The will stay in the Camp area - [paragraph]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I was with an outfit in an Anti Aircraft outfit which was a crack outfit. When something was to be done it was done with precision. Also the Non-Coms ran it and they were in there pitching with the men. We had duty hours and they were run off line clock work. No standing around waiting for something to do. They were respected and orders followed out. It was a pleasure to work with an outfit like that. They were one for all and all for one. Since I have
S64.Q97.C_1: Transfered to the Air Force it hasn't seen anything like it. At this field it is disorganized and run like a football team with out any coaching. They don't mean what they say, don't keep there promises, nom-coms have the attitude of don't give a damn. Keep you stading around for hours on end just for the sake of keeping you there. In other words no clock like precision run there time into your own time. Can't take a son bath unless you have a "T shirt, trunks, and shoes on. I thought this was a man's army. Being in a crack outfit before and coming to an outfit seen as this. I just can't express my feeling towards it. I want to be with an outfit that is really run well and disciplines. It make sound funny but you get a big kick out of it working together instead of against one another. These are just a few comments, but there are more by the hundreds I could state. One more that is important can't wash clothes out in barracks. One coveral a week, sweat and dirt clinges and do they stink after a week. This is a post rule. Has often been refeared to as a concentration camp.
S64.Q97.Full: I was with an outfit in an Anti Aircraft outfit which was a crack outfit. When something was to be done it was done with precision. Also the Non-Coms ran it and they were in there pitching with the men. We had duty hours and they were run off line clock work. No standing around waiting for something to do. They were respected and orders followed out. It was a pleasure to work with an outfit like that. They were one for all and all for one. Since I have Transfered to the Air Force it hasn't seen anything like it. At this field it is disorganized and run like a football team with out any coaching. They don't mean what they say, don't keep there promises, nom-coms have the attitude of don't give a damn. Keep you stading around for hours on end just for the sake of keeping you there. In other words no clock like precision run there time into your own time. Can't take a son bath unless you have a "T shirt, trunks, and shoes on. I thought this was a man's army. Being in a crack outfit before and coming to an outfit seen as this. I just can't express my feeling towards it. I want to be with an outfit that is really run well and disciplines. It make sound funny but you get a big kick out of it working together instead of against one another. These are just a few comments, but there are more by the hundreds I could state. One more that is important can't wash clothes out in barracks. One coveral a week, sweat and dirt clinges and do they stink after a week. This is a post rule. Has often been refeared to as a concentration camp.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I think a soldier should be able to get a furlough at least every six months. Some of the food is pretty bad. You should get some better rating than you get now. I attended a school which formerly gave sergeant stripes now they PFC. I was supposed to get sergeant from this school but will probably get corporal. Schools, with a
S64.Q97.C_1: a shorter period of training are getting better ratings than those of a longer period.
S64.Q97.Full: I think a soldier should be able to get a furlough at least every six months. Some of the food is pretty bad. You should get some better rating than you get now. I attended a school which formerly gave sergeant stripes now they PFC. I was supposed to get sergeant from this school but will probably get corporal. Schools, with a a shorter period of training are getting better ratings than those of a longer period.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think the chow here is poor except when a general comes on the field. I think one should have a furlough every 6 months regardless as to what he is doing.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the chow here is poor except when a general comes on the field. I think one should have a furlough every 6 months regardless as to what he is doing.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think we should always get furloughs after nine months, even though we are in [unclear] [/unclear] . Another thing we soldiers are [underline] men [/underline] , and we mutually dislike being treated like a bunch of kids, as we always are. [Paragraph] I have been in six months and have never had a pass for more than 12 hours. Is that fair? A friend of mine was in three months but got a furlough. Why can't I get a pass? [Paragraph] Another thing I don't like is the grading
S64.Q97.C_1: system in the Airplane Mechanics schools. They grade by guess. I have heard the instructors admit it. Some of the most deserving fellows get a low grade, while some that don't learn a thing get high marks. Yet when we finish, our future in the Army is decided by our grades.
S64.Q97.Full: I think we should always get furloughs after nine months, even though we are in [unclear] [/unclear] . Another thing we soldiers are [underline] men [/underline] , and we mutually dislike being treated like a bunch of kids, as we always are. [Paragraph] I have been in six months and have never had a pass for more than 12 hours. Is that fair? A friend of mine was in three months but got a furlough. Why can't I get a pass? [Paragraph] Another thing I don't like is the grading  system in the Airplane Mechanics schools. They grade by guess. I have heard the instructors admit it. Some of the most deserving fellows get a low grade, while some that don't learn a thing get high marks. Yet when we finish, our future in the Army is decided by our grades.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Why don't they consider serving the public not a depocity [unclear] [/unclear] job where they defer farmers and farm hand?
S64.Q97.Full: Why don't they consider serving the public not a depocity [unclear] [/unclear] job where they defer farmers and farm hand?

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I think that a man with four dependents at home who are not able to do steady enough work to make a living should be out. But I can't even talk to the officers about such they say that's your hard luck. I think a better exam should be given to the men when they come in such as ruptures and broken feet & bones.
S64.Q97.C_1: no more, thats important.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that a man with four dependents at home who are not able to do steady enough work to make a living should be out. But I can't even talk to the officers about such they say that's your hard luck. I think a better exam should be given to the men when they come in such as ruptures and broken feet & bones. no more, thats important.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: The selective service boards are not fair keeping some at home and sending others under same conditions. I believe there is money involved sometimes. [paragraph] The army doctor sometimes makes a person for a liar never before in civil life have I experienced this they don't listen to a man's idea at all.
S64.Q97.Full: The selective service boards are not fair keeping some at home and sending others under same conditions. I believe there is money involved sometimes. [paragraph] The army doctor sometimes makes a person for a liar never before in civil life have I experienced this they don't listen to a man's idea at all.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: The food we get as a whole is lousy. I wouldn't give it to a dog. [paragraph] When I came to this post after I got through with my basic training I waited one whole month before I started school. All that time I did nothing but hang around. I believe I should have gotten a furlough then. I wasn't the only one. There were about 800
S64.Q97.C_1: others too. There are other cases too in which a soldier is shipped overseas without even getting a furlough. I don't blame him if he goes AWOL [Absent Without Official Leave] [paragraph] There is no liquor sold in town. I don't think that's right because a soldier likes to get drunk once in a while.
S64.Q97.Full: The food we get as a whole is lousy. I wouldn't give it to a dog. [paragraph] When I came to this post after I got through with my basic training I waited one whole month before I started school. All that time I did nothing but hang around. I believe I should have gotten a furlough then. I wasn't the only one. There were about 800 others too. There are other cases too in which a soldier is shipped overseas without even getting a furlough. I don't blame him if he goes AWOL [Absent Without Official Leave] [paragraph] There is no liquor sold in town. I don't think that's right because a soldier likes to get drunk once in a while.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: This field has many restrictions and regulations that are not called for in the least, such as strict dress etc upon leaving field. Forced chow formations when a soldier doesn't care to eat. In most any army field or air base reveille is a fall out in the mornings for roll call. This field has a 25 min [minute]
S64.Q97.C_1: (Bull session) between noncoms at that time. This field could have better transportation at a more reasonable rate if some action was taken. A special restriction on the students being able to leave the field only on weekends. A soldier likes to get away from his field in a few spare moments occasionally on business + especially when he is staying at a field where it is handy to do so.
S64.Q97.Full: This field has many restrictions and regulations that are not called for in the least, such as strict dress etc upon leaving field. Forced chow formations when a soldier doesn't care to eat. In most any army field or air base reveille is a fall out in the mornings for roll call. This field has a 25 min [minute]  (Bull session) between noncoms at that time. This field could have better transportation at a more reasonable rate if some action was taken. A special restriction on the students being able to leave the field only on weekends. A soldier likes to get away from his field in a few spare moments occasionally on business + especially when he is staying at a field where it is handy to do so.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M_marginalia: They have taken three of my brothers beside myself and that leaves Mother to earn her own living and support my crippled sister. However mother is getting along fairly well and is very proud of all her sons in the service. [written to the right of the answers]
S64.Q97.F: I think the boys would like it a lot better if given a few more privileges. I know I would although I have like the army since the day I was inducted. A furlough would seem pretty good once in a while as I am a long way from home and haven't seen my folks at all since I entered the army. Also the sports program could be enlarged and also the chow improved. Outside of that it is a good life and...
S64.Q97.C_1: I may re-inlist [enlist] after the war is over. I think it would make a pretty good career.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the boys would like it a lot better if given a few more privileges. I know I would although I have like the army since the day I was inducted. A furlough would seem pretty good once in a while as I am a long way from home and haven't seen my folks at all since I entered the army. Also the sports program could be enlarged and also the chow improved. Outside of that it is a good life and... I may re-inlist [enlist] after the war is over. I think it would make a pretty good career.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Passes and Furloughs are very few in most camps. Men in the Service rather go home often enough to keep in good Army morale. Every six months a Soldier should have a furlough.
S64.Q97.Full: Passes and Furloughs are very few in most camps. Men in the Service rather go home often enough to keep in good Army morale. Every six months a Soldier should have a furlough.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I have just completed courses in AM [Aircraft Maintenance] here at Sheppard Field [Wichita Falls, TX] . This school has the best equipment a school of this type could have, but the instructors or the way and attitude they teach should be improved. I have found the civilians who are teachers are more concerned with my problems then are G.I. [enlisted soldier] instructors. When it comes to aviation engines and mechanical ...
S64.Q97.C_1: parts of an aircraft women instructors are NO GOOD I find the best instructors are veterans of the last war. There are no written tests to determine who and who does not know what has been taught. The instructors are changed to often so that what you know is seldom determined by them - As a matter of fact they are not allowed to ask questions -- We have mess halls that are large, but the men are crowded up on one side. If we too be crowded up, why were they built so big?
S64.Q97.Full: I have just completed courses in AM [Aircraft Maintenance] here at Sheppard Field [Wichita Falls, TX] . This school has the best equipment a school of this type could have, but the instructors or the way and attitude they teach should be improved. I have found the civilians who are teachers are more concerned with my problems then are G.I. [enlisted soldier] instructors. When it comes to aviation engines and mechanical ... parts of an aircraft women instructors are NO GOOD I find the best instructors are veterans of the last war. There are no written tests to determine who and who does not know what has been taught. The instructors are changed to often so that what you know is seldom determined by them - As a matter of fact they are not allowed to ask questions -- We have mess halls that are large, but the men are crowded up on one side. If we too be crowded up, why were they built so big?

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Sheppard Field [Wichita Falls, TX] can be improve some of the rules they lay down don't help the enlisted man but are more for the higher ups.
S64.Q97.Full: Sheppard Field [Wichita Falls, TX] can be improve some of the rules they lay down don't help the enlisted man but are more for the higher ups.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Since I have been at Sheppard Field [Wichita County, Texas] training as an aviation mechanic, I found conditions here are not as they should be for several reasons. The food is not up to what it should be, also water conditions is bad, and in some instances the men were poorly treated. Recreation in town around here is poor. The result is loss of cooperation among the men.
S64.Q97.C_1: sort of breaks down the morale. If it was in combat Zone the men wouldn't mind the conditions but while they're here you would think it was in Combat Zone. Lots of the towns are unfriendly to a soldier because they think all they want to do is to sow wild oats well no soldiers are no worse than the civilians. The only difference is we are in uniform.
S64.Q97.Full: Since I have been at Sheppard Field [Wichita County, Texas] training as an aviation mechanic, I found conditions here are not as they should be for several reasons. The food is not up to what it should be, also water conditions is bad, and in some instances the men were poorly treated. Recreation in town around here is poor. The result is loss of cooperation among the men. sort of breaks down the morale. If it was in combat Zone the men wouldn't mind the conditions but while they're here you would think it was in Combat Zone. Lots of the towns are unfriendly to a soldier because they think all they want to do is to sow wild oats well no soldiers are no worse than the civilians. The only difference is we are in uniform.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: The Field I am now on undergoes too many changes and a fellow can't [deletion] [/deletion] keep up with them. [paragraph] The men must weat [wait] too long before starting school and after finish schoo [school] and valuable time is lost.
S64.Q97.Full: The Field I am now on undergoes too many changes and a fellow can't [deletion] [/deletion] keep up with them. [paragraph] The men must weat [wait] too long before starting school and after finish schoo [school] and valuable time is lost.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I'd like to write a little about this field I'm at - Sheppard Field, Texas. I don't mind saying its the worst field I've ever seen. I don't know exactly how to say it in words. This field could be a swell place. For one thing they insist on regarding us as rookies. The airplane mechanics especially. I've
S64.Q97.C_1: graduated from this school -- but can't say as I figure I've learned much. They have a poor marking system -- it [underline] seems [/underline] that the non-coms [non-commissioned officers] are rated as a better & smarter man than are Pfc's [Private 1st class] & Pvts [Private}. The civilain [civilian] instructors treat some of the G.I.'s as so much trash. Another thing that fellows dislike is the food. In a certain mess hall here they [underline] make [/underline] you eat every last piece -- bones gristle fat. One more thing -- Everytime you turn around here -- some officers or non-coms [non-commissioned officers] brings up court martial. Thats no way to treat a human being. Were all in her for the same thing. I like the Army swell -- I'll take orders -- & do my part -- but I don't like to be threatened everytime I turn around. I speak for my buddies & all the rest of the soldiers here. We'll play ball -- if this field will [underline] get on [/underline] the ball. I have more gripes but no space.
S64.Q97.Full: I'd like to write a little about this field I'm at - Sheppard Field, Texas. I don't mind saying its the worst field I've ever seen. I don't know exactly how to say it in words. This field could be a swell place. For one thing they insist on regarding us as rookies. The airplane mechanics especially. I've graduated from this school -- but can't say as I figure I've learned much. They have a poor marking system -- it [underline] seems [/underline] that the non-coms [non-commissioned officers] are rated as a better & smarter man than are Pfc's [Private 1st class] & Pvts [Private}. The civilain [civilian] instructors treat some of the G.I.'s as so much trash. Another thing that fellows dislike is the food. In a certain mess hall here they [underline] make [/underline] you eat every last piece -- bones gristle fat. One more thing -- Everytime you turn around here -- some officers or non-coms [non-commissioned officers] brings up court martial. Thats no way to treat a human being. Were all in her for the same thing. I like the Army swell -- I'll take orders -- & do my part -- but I don't like to be threatened everytime I turn around. I speak for my buddies & all the rest of the soldiers here. We'll play ball -- if this field will [underline] get on [/underline] the ball. I have more gripes but no space.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: The army is a political machine. It is full of graft. It isn't "what" you know, in hte army, it's "who" you know. Sheppard Field, Texas, the hell hole of the Air Corps! General Chaney's concentration camp! This is the rottenest camp I've been to, and I've been to 8 camps. They ask us not to [unclear] ??? [/unclear] Sheppard Field down in front of civilians, but I do it
S64.Q97.C_1: everytime. [paragraph] The Army doesn't give a damn for any private.
S64.Q97.Full: The army is a political machine. It is full of graft. It isn't "what" you know, in hte army, it's "who" you know. Sheppard Field, Texas, the hell hole of the Air Corps! General Chaney's concentration camp! This is the rottenest camp I've been to, and I've been to 8 camps. They ask us not to [unclear] ??? [/unclear] Sheppard Field down in front of civilians, but I do it everytime. [paragraph] The Army doesn't give a damn for any private.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M_marginalia: considering food shortages + worries
S64.Q97.F: The army seems to promise you a thing, but it is very seldom you get it. I like the army but for a few things. It seems they are doing more harm than good on this field for a student who has already received his basic training to drill 3 hours a day on a very dusty field where you can hardly breathe for dust blowing. I believe 1/2 to 1 hr of exercise a day is a good idea. In some places, but not all, your
S64.Q97.C_1: advancement was determined by how much politics you played. In some cases seemed quite unfair. Otherwise the army is o.k.
S64.Q97.Full: The army seems to promise you a thing, but it is very seldom you get it. I like the army but for a few things. It seems they are doing more harm than good on this field for a student who has already received his basic training to drill 3 hours a day on a very dusty field where you can hardly breathe for dust blowing. I believe 1/2 to 1 hr of exercise a day is a good idea. In some places, but not all, your advancement was determined by how much politics you played. In some cases seemed quite unfair. Otherwise the army is o.k.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Here at Sheppard Field [Wichita Falls, TX] some very definite changes should be made. First I think that the food situation should be investigated. Very few are the meals that the men really enjoy. The drill field is being used, not as a means of building up a man but terring [tearing] him down.
S64.Q97.Full: Here at Sheppard Field [Wichita Falls, TX] some very definite changes should be made. First I think that the food situation should be investigated. Very few are the meals that the men really enjoy. The drill field is being used, not as a means of building up a man but terring [tearing] him down.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I am a aviation mechanic graduate from AM [Aircraft maintenance] school. This school at Sheppard field [Wichita Falls, TX] is one of the best, I am sure. I have learned a lot but I do not see who or why any organization should want men to take calisthenics & drill for three hours a day. Men get disgusted and very irritated at such doings. I say that one hour a day would be the proper amount and if some of ...
S64.Q97.C_1: these officers who never go out on the drill field would do as and and see conditions. Maybe they would get more reasonably & [unclear] [/unclear] and not only go out but do what the men have to do.
S64.Q97.Full: I am a aviation mechanic graduate from AM [Aircraft maintenance] school. This school at Sheppard field [Wichita Falls, TX] is one of the best, I am sure. I have learned a lot but I do not see who or why any organization should want men to take calisthenics & drill for three hours a day. Men get disgusted and very irritated at such doings. I say that one hour a day would be the proper amount and if some of ... these officers who never go out on the drill field would do as and and see conditions. Maybe they would get more reasonably & [unclear] [/unclear] and not only go out but do what the men have to do.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page

S64.Q95.M_marginalia: 1 over night pass in 9 1/2 months
S64.Q97.F: Army life agrees with me and I like it. You can see for yourself if 1700 men are AWOL at this fleet. THERE IS SOMETHING WRONG
S64.Q97.C_1: somewhere at the hospital they dont treat a soldier [deletion] right [/deletion] like he should be teated I went to the 1st aid one morning with a stomach ache and they gave me aspirin I think this field needs some looking into. Otherwise the U.S. Army is the Best in the world.

THERE IS SOMETHING WRONG somewhere at the hospital they dont treat a soldier [deletion] right [/deletion] like he should be teated I went to the 1st aid one morning with a stomach ache and they gave me aspirin I think this field needs some looking into. Otherwise the U.S. Army is the Best in the world.

S64.Q97.F: I don't think it is right for a fellow to have been in the Army for about year & not be able to get a furlough. I haven't seen my folks for one hour since I left for the Army almost a year ago. I would at least like to get home once before I go across. [paragraph] This camp [deletion] [/deletion] [insertion] I'm [/insertion] In now the water is always so hot you can't hardly drink it.
S64.Q97.C_1: [deletion] [/deletion] It is also always so dusty out on the field where we take P.T. that at night you keep spitting dust. I dont that that will build a man up. It's more likely to hurt him.

I haven't seen my folks for one hour since I left for the Army almost a year ago. I would at least like to get home once before I go across. [paragraph] This camp [deletion] [/deletion] [insertion] I'm [/insertion] In now the water is always so hot you can't hardly drink it. [deletion] [/deletion] It is also always so dusty out on the field where we take P.T. that at night you keep spitting dust. I dont that that will build a man up. It's more likely to hurt him.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Men that have finished schools should e sent to advanced classes or put in combat instead of having to stay at a reception center & keep reviewing basic training. This post has the most poorerly planned & trained officers of any post that I've ever encountered. It is typical to be a back passer in this army, but this post takes the cake, with all of its chicken shit officers. I've had three previous years of service, so I understand a little of army ways. The Air Corps should have a different & better uniform than they have at the present time. [paragraph]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M_marginalia: Sheppard field which is located in the north t r[unclear] [/unclear] is not the best of my knowledge the best
S64.Q97.F: Sheppard Field [Wichita Falls] which is located in North Texas is not to the best of my knowledge to [too] good of a camp. First of all, one has to travel to [too] far to see anything of interest. I being from the North think differently about racial differences. The climate is exceptionally a hot one. I do not like ...
S64.Q97.C_1: ... the curfew of which we have to abide by??? The officers do not have??? the do consider of the men for which I think they should have. The morale of the field as a whole I feel is not to good. The food is not as good as I have found it in the other camps that I have been in. The business establishments in the neighboring town seem only to egar to take all the soldiers money and give very little in return.
S64.Q97.Full: Sheppard Field [Wichita Falls] which is located in North Texas is not to the best of my knowledge to [too] good of a camp. First of all, one has to travel to [too] far to see anything of interest. I being from the North think differently about racial differences. The climate is exceptionally a hot one. I do not like ... ... the curfew of which we have to abide by??? The officers do not have??? the do consider of the men for which I think they should have. The morale of the field as a whole I feel is not to good. The food is not as good as I have found it in the other camps that I have been in. The business establishments in the neighboring town seem only to egar to take all the soldiers money and give very little in return.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I feel this war is being started and fought for by the rich. The poor are doing the fighting and gain nothing by it. The rich immediately get a commission in the service where a poor average fellow could many times do as good or even better had he a drag with the big shots. I'm from the North + here in life majority of m/sgt. + t/sgt. etc. are Texans while us boys from up North are treated like occupational troops. In Chicago + all in north, these[insertion] [/insertion]
S64.Q97.C_1: Southern fellas are treated swell. Entertainment, recreations etc. Us boys stationed in Texas having nothing. In this book you're asked how often we go into town, why we can go only 1 or 2 times a month, the stores in town have sky high profits & they hold you up without a gun, its a shame how they raise prices to get rich on us G.I.s while the war is on. Every one of us fellas agree, to restrict G.I.s from town for about a month, till the people lower their prices to normal. These Texans are still fighting the civil war. Moral here in Texas is very low. Up North its heaven for a service man. This Sheppard field is bad. I don't mind training etc. since I am (or was) an athlete. But the drinking water is lukewarm & the dust is more harmful than beneficial. Bks. is always filthy with dust. To make strong healthy bodies, I'd suggest the Charles Atlas way of training a better yet weight lifting. I know from experience, cause the calisthenics (that's what they call swinging your arms around at this field) made me more soft & sluggish. While in civilian life, thru Atlas & weight training, I felt fit to challenge anyone. The physical instructors here are poor examples of men & physiques, they're mostly pot bellied & flabby & probably never did body building exercise. I'm speaking for the air corps, its nothing but a bunch of softies. Infantry et., is the real training I wish to have in the Marines.

The rich immediately get a commission in the service where a poor average fellow could many times do as good or even better had he a drag with the big shots. I'm from the North + here in life majority of m/sgt. + t/sgt. etc. are Texans while us boys from up North are treated like occupational troops. In Chicago + all in north, these[insertion] [/insertion]  Southern fellas are treated swell. Entertainment, recreations etc. Us boys stationed in Texas having nothing. In this book you're asked how often we go into town, why we can go only 1 or 2 times a month, the stores in town have sky high profits & they hold you up without a gun, its a shame how they raise prices to get rich on us G.I.s while the war is on. Every one of us fellas agree, to restrict G.I.s from town for about a month, till the people lower their prices to normal. These Texans are still fighting the civil war. Moral here in Texas is very low. Up North its heaven for a service man. This Sheppard field is bad. I don't mind training etc. since I am (or was) an athlete. But the drinking water is lukewarm & the dust is more harmful than beneficial. Bks. is always filthy with dust. To make strong healthy bodies, I'd suggest the Charles Atlas way of training a better yet weight lifting. I know from experience, cause the calisthenics (that's what they call swinging your arms around at this field) made me more soft & sluggish. While in civilian life, thru Atlas & weight training, I felt fit to challenge anyone. The physical instructors here are poor examples of men & physiques, they're mostly pot bellied & flabby & probably never did body building exercise. I'm speaking for the air corps, its nothing but a bunch of softies. Infantry et., is the real training I wish to have in the Marines.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I was making twice the money before I came in the army than I am now. There fore my family don't get now what they did when I was at home working at my job. [paragraph] My age is sort of a handicap to me for I can't take it like the younger men. So I think I could serve best in defense work than in the army at the present.
S64.Q97.C_1: I could use the training I have acquired in the service and go to some factor and put it to good usage in making planes for the army air force and I think it would as much there as it would in the army. If I was young like our men in the [unclear] [/service?] should be there wouldn't be any [unclear] [/unclear] . But if I could serve best in defense work why not serve where I'm best suited.
S64.Q97.Full: I was making twice the money before I came in the army than I am now. There fore my family don't get now what they did when I was at home working at my job. [paragraph] My age is sort of a handicap to me for I can't take it like the younger men. So I think I could serve best in defense work than in the army at the present. I could use the training I have acquired in the service and go to some factor and put it to good usage in making planes for the army air force and I think it would as much there as it would in the army. If I was young like our men in the [unclear] [/service?] should be there wouldn't be any [unclear] [/unclear] . But if I could serve best in defense work why not serve where I'm best suited.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: their are many men who could make piolets but haven't been given a fair chance. Such as a metle tesh many a man can do things a sinash men can't, I will admit a smart man will learn faster but you sure aren't getting enough piolets. And many of your officers are chickens shit or and not being human. They seem to think a man
S64.Q97.C_1: has become an animal after entering the army and forget that he is just a human as the officer. Many of the officers here never served as a plane old G.I. In uncle sams army and don't even know of what it is all about. they should remember we have left our sweet hearts and wives and mother, fathers, brothers, & sisters behind, and we do have other things to worrie about. Of course we all appericate all they have done for us and how much good advice we have received from some of our well trained officers whom have a sense of humer. And many of our men in Washington should look at it from both ways from the SOldiers point of view and from their point of view of course their are such things as training in different kinds of fighting but set things of that [unclear] [/unclear] aside. Thank you.

Such as a metle tesh many a man can do things a sinash men can't, I will admit a smart man will learn faster but you sure aren't getting enough piolets. Many of the officers here never served as a plane old G.I. In uncle sams army and don't even know of what it is all about. they should remember we have left our sweet hearts and wives and mother, fathers, brothers, & sisters behind, and we do have other things to worrie about. Of course we all appericate all they have done for us and how much good advice we have received from some of our well trained officers whom have a sense of humer. And many of our men in Washington should look at it from both ways from the SOldiers point of view and from their point of view of course their are such things as training in different kinds of fighting but set things of that [unclear] [/unclear] aside. Thank you.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think there should be left more help on the farms than there has been. Because without something to eat you can't win a war.
S64.Q97.Full: I think there should be left more help on the farms than there has been. Because without something to eat you can't win a war.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Well I don't think married men with two or three children should be in the army. I can't see why they keep drafting these young kids [deletion] [/deletion] in the army. They don't need them thats the trouble with the army that have more men than they can take care of properly. [paragraph] I think the living conditions of the soldiers could be improved.
S64.Q97.C_1: Such as the food. Some times the food is good and other times it very poor. The living quarters are not very healthy in the camp I am in the barracks have way more beds in them than they should have.
S64.Q97.Full: Well I don't think married men with two or three children should be in the army. I can't see why they keep drafting these young kids [deletion] [/deletion] in the army. They don't need them thats the trouble with the army that have more men than they can take care of properly. [paragraph] I think the living conditions of the soldiers could be improved. Such as the food. Some times the food is good and other times it very poor. The living quarters are not very healthy in the camp I am in the barracks have way more beds in them than they should have.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Well when I came in the Army I lift a war job and I also lift 5 Dependants back home a mother and 4 sisters. My father is Dead and they are having a hard time on what the army is sending them.
S64.Q97.Full: Well when I came in the Army I lift a war job and I also lift 5 Dependants back home a mother and 4 sisters. My father is Dead and they are having a hard time on what the army is sending them.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Some of the Officers lack personal interest in their men - and don't really understand men. [paragraph] Some meals are very sloppy and poorly cooked. [paragraph] Not enough free time compared to other camps.
S64.Q97.C_1: We should have more entertainment for our soldiers all over instead of just a few chosen spots. Better classification, I was in the Drug Business; and had 3 years of a Pharmacy College & Medicine. & would have been a better medical man than mechanic. Which I was classified as. I never had a liking for mechanics nor do I understand it now.
S64.Q97.Full: Some of the Officers lack personal interest in their men - and don't really understand men. [paragraph] Some meals are very sloppy and poorly cooked. [paragraph] Not enough free time compared to other camps. We should have more entertainment for our soldiers all over instead of just a few chosen spots. Better classification, I was in the Drug Business; and had 3 years of a Pharmacy College & Medicine. & would have been a better medical man than mechanic. Which I was classified as. I never had a liking for mechanics nor do I understand it now.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: There is too darn much time lost during training which makes it tiresome and disgusting to the soldier. Training should be shortened but made more compact and beneficial. [paragraph] To keep a soldier's moral [morale] always high he should be stationed as near home as possible
S64.Q97.C_1: possible so he could make frequent visits to his folks. [paragraph] Get rid of all this silly detail punishment given by non-coms. It's a waste of valuable time.
S64.Q97.Full: There is too darn much time lost during training which makes it tiresome and disgusting to the soldier. Training should be shortened but made more compact and beneficial. [paragraph] To keep a soldier's moral [morale] always high he should be stationed as near home as possible possible so he could make frequent visits to his folks. [paragraph] Get rid of all this silly detail punishment given by non-coms. It's a waste of valuable time.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I think the Army has too many men right now for the amount of room & equipment it has. The crowded conditions make living conditions poor and lack of equipment makes lack of training. However in time I believe these conditions will improve. We also have too many men
S64.Q97.C_1: who thinks they know it all and have such a persuasive impression that they make it hard on new soldiers in the army.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the Army has too many men right now for the amount of room & equipment it has. The crowded conditions make living conditions poor and lack of equipment makes lack of training. However in time I believe these conditions will improve. We also have too many men who thinks they know it all and have such a persuasive impression that they make it hard on new soldiers in the army.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I think the Army is being run swell, sometimes we might not think so, but I look at it this way. The U.S. never has lost a war and I don't think they will loose this one. Every thing they do is for your own good and someday will help us if we see combat duty. I just hope the job can be done as quick as possible and we can all go back to doing the things we like, but till then I will do my best to keep them flying.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the Army is being run swell, sometimes we might not think so, but I look at it this way. The U.S. never has lost a war and I don't think they will loose this one. Every thing they do is for your own good and someday will help us if we see combat duty. I just hope the job can be done as quick as possible and we can all go back to doing the things we like, but till then I will do my best to keep them flying.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: plenty of time to go home when the war is over
S64.Q97.F: Atheletes [athletes] in training are not allowed to smoke or drink but [unclear] herb [/unclear] where we are supposed to be tops fellows just live on cigeretts [cigarettes] and are slaves to the drug also the [unclear] impare [/unclear] kept busy with the drunk. There is a article of war on gambling we never seen it enforced and theres nothing else that will breed or influence theft. and other trouble profanity and seems to be so prevelent [prevalent] how can we expect to be on gods side if we insult him.
S64.Q97.Full: Atheletes [athletes] in training are not allowed to smoke or drink but [unclear] herb [/unclear] where we are supposed to be tops fellows just live on cigeretts [cigarettes] and are slaves to the drug also the [unclear] impare [/unclear] kept busy with the drunk. There is a article of war on gambling we never seen it enforced and theres nothing else that will breed or influence theft. and other trouble profanity and seems to be so prevelent [prevalent] how can we expect to be on gods side if we insult him.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: No cold or cool water in Texas.[paragraph] Chow is rotten.[paragraph] Why do they send us Northern fellows West and South??
S64.Q97.C_1: Take the obysteal [obstacle] corse out. Have games to play that you fully concentrate on. Have races, [unclear] [/unclear] , excitement, ect
S64.Q97.Full: No cold or cool water in Texas.[paragraph] Chow is rotten.[paragraph] Why do they send us Northern fellows West and South?? Take the obysteal [obstacle] corse out. Have games to play that you fully concentrate on. Have races, [unclear] [/unclear] , excitement, ect

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I have no special gripe but I do feel that after almost seven months in the Army I have a furlough coming to me. Some fellows from my home town who [underline] did not [/underline] join the Air Force have already been home once and sometimes twice even though they joined up after I did. I would like to see my wife and 10 mos [month old] daughter once at least before being shipped overseas.
S64.Q97.Full: I have no special gripe but I do feel that after almost seven months in the Army I have a furlough coming to me. Some fellows from my home town who [underline] did not [/underline] join the Air Force have already been home once and sometimes twice even though they joined up after I did. I would like to see my wife and 10 mos [month old] daughter once at least before being shipped overseas.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: The army should promote more sports, such as basket ball, base ball, foot ball, boxing, gym work outs. I think they could spare a little time from drill & commanded exercise. It would boost the morale of the average soldier. [paragraph] Why should men in orderly rooms, who are most likely those who cant take it, and don't get along with the gang, get ratings much faster than those men, who really
S64.Q97.C_1: get out and work, maintaining plan on the line and have a GREAT DEAL MORE RESPONSIBILITY. [paragraph]
S64.Q97.Full: The army should promote more sports, such as basket ball, base ball, foot ball, boxing, gym work outs. I think they could spare a little time from drill & commanded exercise. It would boost the morale of the average soldier. [paragraph] Why should men in orderly rooms, who are most likely those who cant take it, and don't get along with the gang, get ratings much faster than those men, who really get out and work, maintaining plan on the line and have a GREAT DEAL MORE RESPONSIBILITY. [paragraph]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think most of these questions deal with persons who are a little older than I was when I was drafted. A person just out of school doesn't have much time to find out about jobs, living conditions, etc.
S64.Q97.Full: I think most of these questions deal with persons who are a little older than I was when I was drafted. A person just out of school doesn't have much time to find out about jobs, living conditions, etc.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I have a remark on the way Off. [Officers] and some non com [non-commissioned officers] keep on pushing me when unable to keep up with the rest of the Co. [company] due to a flaw in the health. Outside of that I wouldn't mind thing[s] so much in the army.
S64.Q97.Full: I have a remark on the way Off. [Officers] and some non com [non-commissioned officers] keep on pushing me when unable to keep up with the rest of the Co. [company] due to a flaw in the health. Outside of that I wouldn't mind thing[s] so much in the army.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I say again that to much time is wasted on inspections & that if that time were spent learning something useful it would help speed up the end of the war. I would really rather be back in civillian life but as long as there's a war on & a job to be done I'll be the last to back out.
S64.Q97.Full: I say again that to much time is wasted on inspections & that if that time were spent learning something useful it would help speed up the end of the war. I would really rather be back in civillian life but as long as there's a war on & a job to be done I'll be the last to back out.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I realize that I'm here for a purpose and there are many fathers and husbands here like me but it's impossible to be a perfect soldier when you are constantly thinking of those loved ones at home. No matter how hard I try to keep from it I still think of them.
S64.Q97.Full: I realize that I'm here for a purpose and there are many fathers and husbands here like me but it's impossible to be a perfect soldier when you are constantly thinking of those loved ones at home. No matter how hard I try to keep from it I still think of them.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Well first of all I like the Army and I am proud to be a soldier of U.S. and I am going to stay in the Army after the war. But this camp I'm in just no good. First of all to much hills and then to much rain, and last but not least, to far away from a town or city.
S64.Q97.Full: Well first of all I like the Army and I am proud to be a soldier of U.S. and I am going to stay in the Army after the war. But this camp I'm in just no good. First of all to much hills and then to much rain, and last but not least, to far away from a town or city.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M_marginalia: Up to now, has the war made things better or worse for your family [deletion] and friends back home [/deletion]
S64.Q97.F: I would suggest that married men with families be left behind in this war. Even though a man knows it is his duty to fight, he will be a detriment because his thoughts and thinking powers will be back home with his family therefore he will be, more or less, just that much excess baggage. This is not only my attitude but also that of all
S64.Q97.C_1: family men I have thus far encountered in the Army. Also - More free time would do the larger percentage of the men a whole lot of good.
S64.Q97.Full: I would suggest that married men with families be left behind in this war. Even though a man knows it is his duty to fight, he will be a detriment because his thoughts and thinking powers will be back home with his family therefore he will be, more or less, just that much excess baggage. This is not only my attitude but also that of all family men I have thus far encountered in the Army. Also - More free time would do the larger percentage of the men a whole lot of good.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I think that a soldier should be allowed more than five days furlough at the end of basic training. And I think that soldiers should be stationed near their homes when they are not in combat.[paragraph] There should be more schools for specialized training.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that a soldier should be allowed more than five days furlough at the end of basic training. And I think that soldiers should be stationed near their homes when they are not in combat.[paragraph] There should be more schools for specialized training.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I would like a transfer out of this outfit and Div
S64.Q97.Full: I would like a transfer out of this outfit and Div

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I would like to say something about the meals which are lousey. The food is good but when it is cooked it is ruined by the cooks. About half of the flavor is cooked out or it is not cooked enough. Also about full field displays we have one every week and I can see no use of having one that often. We also haven't had enough sleep for about three months and also
S64.Q97.C_1: have work details on saturday afternoon and sometimes on sunday. I also think a little of the red tape could be cut out to get a new pair of sox it takes almost three weeks and I turned in a worn out pair of leggins about 2 months ago for salvage and still don't have a pair to replace them. Also, other outfits in the division get 3 day passes and we haven't as yet had anything like that. I also don't think 2 pairs of shoes are enough because when one pair is in repair you have about 5 minutes to get ready for retreat at nite and have to clean a pair of shoes it doesn't give you enough time. The location of this camp is also poor because of no large towns close you use up 6 or 8 hours of your pass getting to and from the city and don't get any time for having a good time.
S64.Q97.Full: I would like to say something about the meals which are lousey. The food is good but when it is cooked it is ruined by the cooks. About half of the flavor is cooked out or it is not cooked enough. Also about full field displays we have one every week and I can see no use of having one that often. We also haven't had enough sleep for about three months and also have work details on saturday afternoon and sometimes on sunday. I also think a little of the red tape could be cut out to get a new pair of sox it takes almost three weeks and I turned in a worn out pair of leggins about 2 months ago for salvage and still don't have a pair to replace them. Also, other outfits in the division get 3 day passes and we haven't as yet had anything like that. I also don't think 2 pairs of shoes are enough because when one pair is in repair you have about 5 minutes to get ready for retreat at nite and have to clean a pair of shoes it doesn't give you enough time. The location of this camp is also poor because of no large towns close you use up 6 or 8 hours of your pass getting to and from the city and don't get any time for having a good time.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: 96th question - Don't get enough to get along on.
S64.Q97.Full: 96th question - Don't get enough to get along on.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think the physical part of the Army training is entered into entirely too rapidly. Men fresh from jobs where they have been inactive are forced to take too rigirous [rigorous] exercise and are likely to injure themselves instead of being rounded into proper shape gradually. If a person reports himself sick he is considered a goldbrick
S64.Q97.C_1: until proven otherwise. The men do not get enough sleep. Almost every man in my outfit has fallen asleep in class at one time or another. There is too much chance for the cooks to ... food, and cause a shortage for the men. I think that every furlough should allow at least a week and maybe two weeks at home. Ours will give us about five days, which isn't much considering the length of time you might be away. There should be some place for soldiers wives to stay on the post. It isn't good for a married man's morale too see. accommodations for ordinary civilians who work on the post, and then not be able to keep his wife within a couple of miles. (Ft Leonard Wood, Missouri). Whenever the men have leisure time, the Army always picks out about fifty personnel for work detail.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the physical part of the Army training is entered into entirely too rapidly. Men fresh from jobs where they have been inactive are forced to take too rigirous [rigorous] exercise and are likely to injure themselves instead of being rounded into proper shape gradually. If a person reports himself sick he is considered a goldbrick until proven otherwise. The men do not get enough sleep. Almost every man in my outfit has fallen asleep in class at one time or another. There is too much chance for the cooks to ... food, and cause a shortage for the men. I think that every furlough should allow at least a week and maybe two weeks at home. Ours will give us about five days, which isn't much considering the length of time you might be away. There should be some place for soldiers wives to stay on the post. It isn't good for a married man's morale too see. accommodations for ordinary civilians who work on the post, and then not be able to keep his wife within a couple of miles. (Ft Leonard Wood, Missouri). Whenever the men have leisure time, the Army always picks out about fifty personnel for work detail.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: If this place had different officers and noncoms [non-commissioned officers] that would treat us like humans it would be much better. They are always giving us details for nothing at all. Some of our noncoms haven't got enough brains to run an outfit. The more that we do the less they think of it. Just to prove my statement I'll write the incident that happened today. One of our noncoms went through the ...
S64.Q97.C_1: barracks and tore up ever bed for no reason at all. He didn't do it once but twice in this pitcular day. They would work us twenty four hours a day if they could.
S64.Q97.Full: If this place had different officers and noncoms [non-commissioned officers] that would treat us like humans it would be much better. They are always giving us details for nothing at all. Some of our noncoms haven't got enough brains to run an outfit. The more that we do the less they think of it. Just to prove my statement I'll write the incident that happened today. One of our noncoms went through the ... barracks and tore up ever bed for no reason at all. He didn't do it once but twice in this pitcular day. They would work us twenty four hours a day if they could.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I think the Noncoms in our outfit are given too much authority. I heard the 1st lang say to the Capt. the other day, "Who's running this Company, you or me." And what's more he meant every word of it. Two soldiers went into town with the 1st lang. and together they spent $26 on him. That same week they were both made [unclear] [/unclear] The punishment for most minor misbehavior, such as, not having your helmet on your head straight is too strict.
S64.Q97.C_1: I got two days of extra detail for that incident. The classification system the army uses is not fair. I was completely qualified as an aviation cadet, and had previous flying experience yet they put me in the Medical Corp. Now after 4 wasted months, I am being transferred to the Air Corps. The ratings in the 75th are not given out fairly, not that I should have one, but I know of fellows who should have ratings but havent and fellows who have got ratings but shouldn't have them The officers of this outfit are not officers in the true sense of the word. They let the noncoms run all over them. We have to work too hard getting ready for inspections. I can remember twice we have had to stay up all night on Fridays to get the barracks ready for an inspection on Saturday.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the Noncoms in our outfit are given too much authority. I heard the 1st lang say to the Capt. the other day, "Who's running this Company, you or me." And what's more he meant every word of it. Two soldiers went into town with the 1st lang. and together they spent $26 on him. That same week they were both made [unclear] [/unclear] The punishment for most minor misbehavior, such as, not having your helmet on your head straight is too strict. I got two days of extra detail for that incident. The classification system the army uses is not fair. I was completely qualified as an aviation cadet, and had previous flying experience yet they put me in the Medical Corp. Now after 4 wasted months, I am being transferred to the Air Corps. The ratings in the 75th are not given out fairly, not that I should have one, but I know of fellows who should have ratings but havent and fellows who have got ratings but shouldn't have them The officers of this outfit are not officers in the true sense of the word. They let the noncoms run all over them. We have to work too hard getting ready for inspections. I can remember twice we have had to stay up all night on Fridays to get the barracks ready for an inspection on Saturday.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I feel that the Medical Corp is not the place for me. I know some mechanics and a lot about airplane assembly. I think I could find a job in the Air Corp ground crew more suited to me than my present job in the Army. As far as things at home are, before I came in the Army I was supporting my wife, Mother and Brother now my wife is working and my Mother part time they had more when I was home but can get along on what they
S64.Q97.C_1: have now. If I know they are all right back home I would like to stay in the Army but not at my present job, If I can do anything about it. I think the Medical Corps is a good outfit and is very necessary to the Army but it's not for me. [paragraph] In this Battalion or at least in my company we have entirely too many details and the most of them are for no reason at all. It is mostly the fault of our noncoms [non-commissioned officers] we have the best commissioned Officers anyone could ask for. We don't get enough to eat and pretty poor what we get we buy our own sorts of meal [unclear] [/unclear] or anything else with. We haven't had a furlough and very few passes the closest town of any size that over 400 is about 100 miles away. Not much of any kind of amusement around camp. You have to go to a show or service club to keep out of details on weekends. We hardly ever have any time for our selves & have to find time to write home. I have never heard of another Army camp like this.
S64.Q97.Full: I feel that the Medical Corp is not the place for me. I know some mechanics and a lot about airplane assembly. I think I could find a job in the Air Corp ground crew more suited to me than my present job in the Army. As far as things at home are, before I came in the Army I was supporting my wife, Mother and Brother now my wife is working and my Mother part time they had more when I was home but can get along on what they have now. If I know they are all right back home I would like to stay in the Army but not at my present job, If I can do anything about it. I think the Medical Corps is a good outfit and is very necessary to the Army but it's not for me. [paragraph] In this Battalion or at least in my company we have entirely too many details and the most of them are for no reason at all. It is mostly the fault of our noncoms [non-commissioned officers] we have the best commissioned Officers anyone could ask for. We don't get enough to eat and pretty poor what we get we buy our own sorts of meal [unclear] [/unclear] or anything else with. We haven't had a furlough and very few passes the closest town of any size that over 400 is about 100 miles away. Not much of any kind of amusement around camp. You have to go to a show or service club to keep out of details on weekends. We hardly ever have any time for our selves & have to find time to write home. I have never heard of another Army camp like this.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I have been married over 6 1/2 years and everything I have I worked for untill the army broke up my home and took every thing away from me that was worth living for. I cannot keep my mind on the army & what I am doing for wondering how my wife is getting along with out any way to live on what money she gets from me. The married man doesn't have enough money left after the allotment is taken out to live on him
S64.Q97.C_1: self. If we haft to do the same duties as the single man we should have the same money they get besige what goes to our wives at home. In my Company it dosent matter wheather you are on the ball or not when it comes to advancements. [paragraph] The army advancements are left up to the noncoms[non commissioned officers] to much and if some one spends a lot of money buying them beer they are the ones that gets the brakes and you are left out if you dont drink with them [paragraph] I thought the army was the highth of profficiency but I find that it is the most corrupt thing and dirtie deals pulled of any thing I have ever had any ting to do with. [paragraph] In this division we dont even get hardly enough to eat keep up our weight and all the energy we haft to put out bsige. [paragraph] If a man cant have but a 5 day furlough this old U.S. Army must be in a terrible shape.
S64.Q97.Full: I have been married over 6 1/2 years and everything I have I worked for untill the army broke up my home and took every thing away from me that was worth living for. I cannot keep my mind on the army & what I am doing for wondering how my wife is getting along with out any way to live on what money she gets from me. The married man doesn't have enough money left after the allotment is taken out to live on him self. If we haft to do the same duties as the single man we should have the same money they get besige what goes to our wives at home. In my Company it dosent matter wheather you are on the ball or not when it comes to advancements. [paragraph] The army advancements are left up to the noncoms[non commissioned officers] to much and if some one spends a lot of money buying them beer they are the ones that gets the brakes and you are left out if you dont drink with them [paragraph] I thought the army was the highth of profficiency but I find that it is the most corrupt thing and dirtie deals pulled of any thing I have ever had any ting to do with. [paragraph] In this division we dont even get hardly enough to eat keep up our weight and all the energy we haft to put out bsige. [paragraph] If a man cant have but a 5 day furlough this old U.S. Army must be in a terrible shape.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: 75th Div. [Division]
S64.Q97.F: Why are first Sgts [insertion] Richard [/insertion] [insertion] Miller [/insertion] not men who enjoy working with the men. Men in this Company are not on equal basis with each other. Why is intelligence + education not considered in this company. Then enlisted man should have more say so in the company. Men in this company work longer than other companies. Why do men not do the job they are assigned too. Main Non Coms run company to suit him self.
S64.Q97.C_1: Co. C, 375th Med. Bn. [paragraph] Some non coms are allowed to be partially under the influence of liquor while on duty. Why are non coms allowed to stop good impulses of the company. Enlisted men should be given more time to them selves. Why must I first have permission from the squad leader, Cpl, Sgt S/Sgt 1st Sgt to ask the C.O. for a weekend or 3 day pass. Their is to much segregation between Officers + men especially in this company. [paragraph] If it is part of our job to do extra details why not do them on company time. Why do cooks hit the line 2 days + then cook one day in this camp + not in others. Soap + supplies should not be rationed to us. Why should a licensed driver spend the day with the company + then spend half the night working on their vehicle at the motor pool. Bn commander doesn't know what is going on. To many officers like to be reminded of the rank the hold. [paragraph] Why aren't these papers shown to Co. + Bn, Regt. + Div Commanders so he will know what is going on. [paragraph] All ratings were given out unfairly. Moral of the company is low all because of the 1st Sgt.
S64.Q97.Full: Why are first Sgts [insertion] Richard [/insertion] [insertion] Miller [/insertion] not men who enjoy working with the men. Men in this Company are not on equal basis with each other. Why is intelligence + education not considered in this company. Then enlisted man should have more say so in the company. Men in this company work longer than other companies. Why do men not do the job they are assigned too. Main Non Coms run company to suit him self. Co. C, 375th Med. Bn. [paragraph] Some non coms are allowed to be partially under the influence of liquor while on duty. Why are non coms allowed to stop good impulses of the company. Enlisted men should be given more time to them selves. Why must I first have permission from the squad leader, Cpl, Sgt S/Sgt 1st Sgt to ask the C.O. for a weekend or 3 day pass. Their is to much segregation between Officers + men especially in this company. [paragraph] If it is part of our job to do extra details why not do them on company time. Why do cooks hit the line 2 days + then cook one day in this camp + not in others. Soap + supplies should not be rationed to us. Why should a licensed driver spend the day with the company + then spend half the night working on their vehicle at the motor pool. Bn commander doesn't know what is going on. To many officers like to be reminded of the rank the hold. [paragraph] Why aren't these papers shown to Co. + Bn, Regt. + Div Commanders so he will know what is going on. [paragraph] All ratings were given out unfairly. Moral of the company is low all because of the 1st Sgt.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Why aren't men given jobs they are trained for?? I can't understand why a soldier must be oppressed. This only lowers his morale. In our company the first sergeant seems to own the company. He does as he pleases with the men, he gives out details & can't give a reason for them. Everyone he doesn't like personally lives the life of a dog. He even goes as far as to lie, (give false reasons) to get men details this lowers morale of the men and also is abuse of his rank. In my opinion it's as bad as sabotage. If CoC 375 Miller was not oppressed in this way it really would make
S64.Q97.C_1: a swell outfit. But the morale of the men is very low because of unfairness. Why isn't there some way for the men to get an even chance in this company. They can't even get a first sargeant that is in the army to win the war & help his men instead of a man (he shouldn't even be called a man) who abuses his rank to get personal joy out of abusing half the men who he doesn't like personally. The men can't do anything about it nor even tell the officers because we have the chain of command hanging over our head. I have great personal reasons for wanting to do a real job in this army & war and it really grippes me to be hindered & abused thus by a sargeant. [paragraph] The men should get more time for themselves instead of doing ridiculous details for no good reason. This would boost the morale & make better army men out of us. As it is with all the bitching that's going on, This outfit is worthless. [paragraph] If we could get a man for a sargeant, instead of a rat. This could be one of the best outfits in the Army but we privates can't even let our officers know what's going on as we must suffer in silence while the chain of command shield the top sarge. & platoon sargeant with whom he is in cahoots. [paragraph] Promotions one gives to friends of the platoon sargeant & top sargeant. I'll be [deletion] [/deletion] damed if I buy beds & drinks for them just to get a PFC stripe. [paragraph]
S64.Q97.Full: Why aren't men given jobs they are trained for?? I can't understand why a soldier must be oppressed. This only lowers his morale. In our company the first sergeant seems to own the company. He does as he pleases with the men, he gives out details & can't give a reason for them. Everyone he doesn't like personally lives the life of a dog. He even goes as far as to lie, (give false reasons) to get men details this lowers morale of the men and also is abuse of his rank. In my opinion it's as bad as sabotage. If CoC 375 Miller was not oppressed in this way it really would make a swell outfit. But the morale of the men is very low because of unfairness. Why isn't there some way for the men to get an even chance in this company. They can't even get a first sargeant that is in the army to win the war & help his men instead of a man (he shouldn't even be called a man) who abuses his rank to get personal joy out of abusing half the men who he doesn't like personally. The men can't do anything about it nor even tell the officers because we have the chain of command hanging over our head. I have great personal reasons for wanting to do a real job in this army & war and it really grippes me to be hindered & abused thus by a sargeant. [paragraph] The men should get more time for themselves instead of doing ridiculous details for no good reason. This would boost the morale & make better army men out of us. As it is with all the bitching that's going on, This outfit is worthless. [paragraph] If we could get a man for a sargeant, instead of a rat. This could be one of the best outfits in the Army but we privates can't even let our officers know what's going on as we must suffer in silence while the chain of command shield the top sarge. & platoon sargeant with whom he is in cahoots. [paragraph] Promotions one gives to friends of the platoon sargeant & top sargeant. I'll be [deletion] [/deletion] damed if I buy beds & drinks for them just to get a PFC stripe. [paragraph]

S64.Q97.F: In the first place we do not have much time for ourselves. [unclear] Nce [/unclear] we get off duty then we have extra duty at night. [paragraph] We do not have enough recreation facilities. [paragraph] Our furlough time that we are going to get is so short that it really wouldn't be worth your while to go home.
