document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: This army is a "necessary evil". I'll do my job the best I can, as long as I'm put in a job I'm suited for. Too much stress can not be laid on that one thing - placing a man in his right place in the army. It makes all the difference in the world. Right now I'm happy to say I'm where I want to be, the army is utilizing my civilian occupation very well.
S64.Q97.Full: This army is a "necessary evil". I'll do my job the best I can, as long as I'm put in a job I'm suited for. Too much stress can not be laid on that one thing - placing a man in his right place in the army. It makes all the difference in the world. Right now I'm happy to say I'm where I want to be, the army is utilizing my civilian occupation very well.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I believe I could do more at home for my country as I have a wife and child to support. I believe there are men who are not in the service and have no dependents who could take the place of married men who have dependents, and let the married men do war work which will help in the war and also better support their families.
S64.Q97.Full: I believe I could do more at home for my country as I have a wife and child to support. I believe there are men who are not in the service and have no dependents who could take the place of married men who have dependents, and let the married men do war work which will help in the war and also better support their families.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I do feel as though I would be much better off with my family, and working on another good war job and trying to make the best of this than I'm doing now. For I was helping to move and maintain the movements of troops. And now that I'm in the Army
S64.Q97.C_1: I don't see why I shouldn't have a chance at machine work or automobile or truck mechanics works for I'm just not a medical man.
S64.Q97.Full: I do feel as though I would be much better off with my family, and working on another good war job and trying to make the best of this than I'm doing now. For I was helping to move and maintain the movements of troops. And now that I'm in the Army I don't see why I shouldn't have a chance at machine work or automobile or truck mechanics works for I'm just not a medical man.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Well all I have to say about the camp I am in is that it is to stricked [strick] with the fellows. I believe in discipline but I dont believe in treating the boys like they were convicts and thats the way I sometime feel in this camp like a convict. There are to many bosses it seems, everytime you look around some noncom [non-commissioned officer] or officer is giving you a job. I dont mind doing my share of
S64.Q97.C_1: the work, and they really give us to much work on our own time, we really just eat work and sleep and don't get much time off for relaxation or for entertainment and it dont seem just.
S64.Q97.Full: Well all I have to say about the camp I am in is that it is to stricked [strick] with the fellows. I believe in discipline but I dont believe in treating the boys like they were convicts and thats the way I sometime feel in this camp like a convict. There are to many bosses it seems, everytime you look around some noncom [non-commissioned officer] or officer is giving you a job. I dont mind doing my share of  the work, and they really give us to much work on our own time, we really just eat work and sleep and don't get much time off for relaxation or for entertainment and it dont seem just.

S64.Q97.Full: The Army's O.K. . It's worth anything to win the war.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: The food around here stinks. Personally I wouldn't feed it to a dog. I don't mind working but when it comes to eating I feel a soldier should get the best to eat. We can't win a war with [deletion] a [/deletion] half fed soldiers. I haven't since dessert for so long I don't know what it looks or taste like. [paragraph] The pass situation is very poor. We are only allowed out of camp 3 nights a week and if we good out of camp on
S64.Q97.C_1: our three nights we are not allowed a week-end pass. A soldier likes to get out of camp and mingle with the other half of the people for a while. But you sure cant do it with this situation. Personally I think it "stinks".
S64.Q97.Full: The food around here stinks. Personally I wouldn't feed it to a dog. I don't mind working but when it comes to eating I feel a soldier should get the best to eat. We can't win a war with [deletion] a [/deletion] half fed soldiers. I haven't since dessert for so long I don't know what it looks or taste like. [paragraph] The pass situation is very poor. We are only allowed out of camp 3 nights a week and if we good out of camp on our three nights we are not allowed a week-end pass. A soldier likes to get out of camp and mingle with the other half of the people for a while. But you sure cant do it with this situation. Personally I think it "stinks".

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think there should be more discipline in the Army. In this div. a non -com rates no more than a private. More attention should be paid to important things in training and less to such things as parades and barracks inspections. Too many officers and non-coms trying to drill men when the officers are non-com don't know and can't do what...
S64.Q97.C_1: he is trying to teach the private. If a man does not have a job in an outfit and could be of more service in some other place he should be allowed to transfered. If he is sent to one outfit for a job and they cant use him he should be sent back to his original outfit and allowed to try something else. Not just mark time for months in the outfit that decided they did not feel they had a job for him.
S64.Q97.Full: I think there should be more discipline in the Army. In this div. a non -com rates no more than a private. More attention should be paid to important things in training and less to such things as parades and barracks inspections. Too many officers and non-coms trying to drill men when the officers are non-com don't know and can't do what... he is trying to teach the private. If a man does not have a job in an outfit and could be of more service in some other place he should be allowed to transfered. If he is sent to one outfit for a job and they cant use him he should be sent back to his original outfit and allowed to try something else. Not just mark time for months in the outfit that decided they did not feel they had a job for him.

S64.Q97.F: Can't quite understand the Army methods of picking inefficient [unclear] calres [/unclear] and officers [unclear] in [/unclear] forming a Company. Rank and [unclear] ratings [/unclear] should come from efficiency in handling men equal jobs and no [unclear] [/unclear] "Petty" politics as they seem to. Also why should we only get five day furloughs
S64.Q97.C_1: when men from other outfits get more. [paragraph]
S64.Q97.Full: Can't quite understand the Army methods of picking inefficient [unclear] calres [/unclear] and officers [unclear] in [/unclear] forming a Company. Rank and [unclear] ratings [/unclear] should come from efficiency in handling men equal jobs and no [unclear] [/unclear] "Petty" politics as they seem to. Also why should we only get five day furloughs when men from other outfits get more. [paragraph]

S64.Q97.Full: The trouble is they sent a soldier to school for one subject that is a special trade, and when he is out of school a send him into a company, and they put him in a trade that he doesn't know any thing about. Do you think that is fair, it is all wasted

S64.Q97.F: I think a person, to really make a good soldier, be allowed to transfer into any branch of the service the wanted. Only after his basic training is over. Basic training is very important. [paragraph] But for a man to be his best he must also like his work. You can't drive a fellow to do his best, if he doesn't like his work.
S64.Q97.Full: I think a person, to really make a good soldier, be allowed to transfer into any branch of the service the wanted. Only after his basic training is over. Basic training is very important. [paragraph] But for a man to be his best he must also like his work. You can't drive a fellow to do his best, if he doesn't like his work.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: The army today is a good thing for any man or women. It builds up your body, gives you education & makes you obey orders which are important as far as discipline concerns. As far as the moral concern is low in some men as others, Because men always had their mind set on special things that would like to do in their future life - like being a engineer, pilot, etc. The army
S64.Q97.C_1: has all those special things for you, [underline] but [/underline] most men don't get in the branch of service they want + instead they give you something you dislike all together. This is going to break the moral of every soldier. [paragraph] But he stick on because he is help fighting for his country but could do a hell of a lot better if he like his line of work. [paragraph] I think their should be more transfers given out to men or given a oral or written test to what the want.
S64.Q97.Full: The army today is a good thing for any man or women. It builds up your body, gives you education & makes you obey orders which are important as far as discipline concerns. As far as the moral concern is low in some men as others, Because men always had their mind set on special things that would like to do in their future life - like being a engineer, pilot, etc. The army  has all those special things for you, [underline] but [/underline] most men don't get in the branch of service they want + instead they give you something you dislike all together. This is going to break the moral of every soldier. [paragraph] But he stick on because he is help fighting for his country but could do a hell of a lot better if he like his line of work. [paragraph] I think their should be more transfers given out to men or given a oral or written test to what the want.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M_marginalia: as far as jobs & pay naturally, but C.C. no!
S64.Q97.F: MPs sometimes get in a fellows hair, think that they should not be given so much authority where petty things are concerned and be disciplined for discourtesy in performance of duty. [paragraph] A sign "Hitch hiking by Soldiers [insertion] Prohibited [/insertion] by order of War Dept" is a damn dirty truck. Maybe doesn't look nice for soldiers to be hike, but it should be made plain to public that soldiers may
S64.Q97.C_1: be offered ride. The sign "scares" motorists. But they could give more rides. After all, most of us gave up our cars, for a while, at least and do want to get around a little. With transportation like it is hitch hiking is often the only way to get around. But any crime committed by soldiers should bring heavy penalty, (even death). But public must not fear us, or mistrust us.
S64.Q97.Full: MPs sometimes get in a fellows hair, think that they should not be given so much authority where petty things are concerned and be disciplined for discourtesy in performance of duty. [paragraph] A sign "Hitch hiking by Soldiers [insertion] Prohibited [/insertion] by order of War Dept" is a damn dirty truck. Maybe doesn't look nice for soldiers to be hike, but it should be made plain to public that soldiers may be offered ride. The sign "scares" motorists. But they could give more rides. After all, most of us gave up our cars, for a while, at least and do want to get around a little. With transportation like it is hitch hiking is often the only way to get around. But any crime committed by soldiers should bring heavy penalty, (even death). But public must not fear us, or mistrust us.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Having across country many times, am acquainted with all walks of life. The soldier himself is the product of its superior officers. Men selected for training of men understand, believe and in doing so will have unlimited help even from the worst goldbricker. Men from all walks of life will do better to be asked
S64.Q97.C_1: to do something item order to. This doesn't mean [deletion] [/deletion] their shouldn't be army dicipline [discipline] . Talk and treat like they were men and your results will manifold a thousand times in return. There a million things an officer can do for his men and still be well within the army regulations. This all goes back to that old saying it depends on the terrain. [paragraph] For instance. [paragraph] A. Give a party once a month out of the Co. fund. [paragraph] B. Heart to heart talks. [paragraph] C. Let his personal feeling be his own [paragraph] D. Help the men in their trouble no matter how small. And if a man in his company happens to get into trouble whether good or bad go to bat for him. And 9 out of 10 he will be a better soldier if he already isn't.
S64.Q97.Full: Having across country many times, am acquainted with all walks of life. The soldier himself is the product of its superior officers. Men selected for training of men understand, believe and in doing so will have unlimited help even from the worst goldbricker. Men from all walks of life will do better to be asked to do something item order to. This doesn't mean [deletion] [/deletion] their shouldn't be army dicipline [discipline] . Talk and treat like they were men and your results will manifold a thousand times in return. There a million things an officer can do for his men and still be well within the army regulations. This all goes back to that old saying it depends on the terrain. [paragraph] For instance. [paragraph] A. Give a party once a month out of the Co. fund. [paragraph] B. Heart to heart talks. [paragraph] C. Let his personal feeling be his own [paragraph] D. Help the men in their trouble no matter how small. And if a man in his company happens to get into trouble whether good or bad go to bat for him. And 9 out of 10 he will be a better soldier if he already isn't.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Well the thing I think you should know about is that the non-comissioned officers are all [underline] suck [/underline] [underline] asses [/underline] . If you haven't got a [underline] wart [/underline] on your toungue you are a private for duration. I never sucked anybody's ass yet and I'll be damned if I'll start in the Army. Also there are several N.C.O.'s if you lend them a few dollars when they are short you will get a couple of stripes more. I don't believe in that old shit.
S64.Q97.C_1: The thing I don't think is right most is, If you would like to get in a certain outfit that you know something about and like they always stick you in some damn thing that you hate to do. I think that is why there are so many going A.W.O.L. When I first came in in 1941 I was put in a horse troop. I was born and raised on a farm but I always hated horses. I also was a truck driver and that is the job I liked most. I am more or less mechanickly [mechanically] minded and know quite a bit about trucks. After I got reclassified out of the horse outfit I was put on M.P. for over a year. Well I hated that as much as the horses or maybe more. I tried to get ahead here but as I said before I haven't got the right shape to my tongue and no money [unclear] [/unclear] the N.C.A.C. I got transferred to the A.E.M.L. and I am now working in the Salvage Depot I like that better than any branch of service I have been in I'd still like to be a truck driver though. They have the W.A.C. driving those and the Ordnance can just as well order a new transmition for all those truck. Finis.
S64.Q97.Full: Well the thing I think you should know about is that the non-comissioned officers are all [underline] suck [/underline] [underline] asses [/underline] . If you haven't got a [underline] wart [/underline] on your toungue you are a private for duration. I never sucked anybody's ass yet and I'll be damned if I'll start in the Army. Also there are several N.C.O.'s if you lend them a few dollars when they are short you will get a couple of stripes more. I don't believe in that old shit. The thing I don't think is right most is, If you would like to get in a certain outfit that you know something about and like they always stick you in some damn thing that you hate to do. I think that is why there are so many going A.W.O.L. When I first came in in 1941 I was put in a horse troop. I was born and raised on a farm but I always hated horses. I also was a truck driver and that is the job I liked most. I am more or less mechanickly [mechanically] minded and know quite a bit about trucks. After I got reclassified out of the horse outfit I was put on M.P. for over a year. Well I hated that as much as the horses or maybe more. I tried to get ahead here but as I said before I haven't got the right shape to my tongue and no money [unclear] [/unclear] the N.C.A.C. I got transferred to the A.E.M.L. and I am now working in the Salvage Depot I like that better than any branch of service I have been in I'd still like to be a truck driver though. They have the W.A.C. driving those and the Ordnance can just as well order a new transmition for all those truck. Finis.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I would be a lot more good to win the war if I was out where I could do some good instead of in here in an outfit that will never see combat any way. and above all they should turn the farm labor out of the limited service so the could help produce
S64.Q97.C_1: food for the one that will see combat.
S64.Q97.Full: I would be a lot more good to win the war if I was out where I could do some good instead of in here in an outfit that will never see combat any way. and above all they should turn the farm labor out of the limited service so the could help produce food for the one that will see combat.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I am a limited service soldier - own a farm of my own + married, and find that it is hard to get any experienced help to work on said farm. However, I have been able to get by last spring and now harvest is coming on. In my opinion, many of the limited service boys could be used on farms + do more good than [unclear] some [/unclear] [unclear] work [/unclear] I've seen. Not only on farms but also in essential war industry. There are too many of these boys that can do jobs that will
S64.Q97.C_1: benefit the war effort - rather than have then shoveling a little dirt around on post. To speak of the Wacs - (which are supposed to replace men for combat) about all I have seen them replace is Limited Service men who could not do field duty but who can do quite a number of army duties. These same Wacs could be used in war industry to much better advantage ([underline] unless [/underline] ) -there were not a whole bunch placed on one job which one L.S. soldier could do. It looks as if it is just so much wasted effort. If properly utilized and placed I can see their beneficial qualities or usefulness in the army. [paragraph] I do not think that many men are classified right upon induction, from experience of my own. My first assignment was as far from doing what I was qualified for as possible; and had I not asked for a transfer and reassignment I may yet have been at the same assignment, drawing taxpayers money when I could have been doing something of value which I was qualified for. From talks with fellow soldiers I believe this to be a common occurrence.
S64.Q97.Full: I am a limited service soldier - own a farm of my own + married, and find that it is hard to get any experienced help to work on said farm. However, I have been able to get by last spring and now harvest is coming on. In my opinion, many of the limited service boys could be used on farms + do more good than [unclear] some [/unclear] [unclear] work [/unclear] I've seen. Not only on farms but also in essential war industry. There are too many of these boys that can do jobs that will benefit the war effort - rather than have then shoveling a little dirt around on post. To speak of the Wacs - (which are supposed to replace men for combat) about all I have seen them replace is Limited Service men who could not do field duty but who can do quite a number of army duties. These same Wacs could be used in war industry to much better advantage ([underline] unless [/underline] ) -there were not a whole bunch placed on one job which one L.S. soldier could do. It looks as if it is just so much wasted effort. If properly utilized and placed I can see their beneficial qualities or usefulness in the army. [paragraph] I do not think that many men are classified right upon induction, from experience of my own. My first assignment was as far from doing what I was qualified for as possible; and had I not asked for a transfer and reassignment I may yet have been at the same assignment, drawing taxpayers money when I could have been doing something of value which I was qualified for. From talks with fellow soldiers I believe this to be a common occurrence.

S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: 97. If you have any further remarks you would like to make on any subject please write them below as fully as you like. If my vision was good I would like to be in the air corp and overseas and doing a good job for my country. But as I am limited [insertion] service [/insertion] and I am in Station Complement I am not doing a very important job. And I would ([unclear] rather[unclear] ) be a civilian
S64.Q97.C_1: where I can do something with worthwhile my vision is gradually getting worse. And I cannot do the job I am doing. Therefore I would take as C.D.D. as our medical officer suggested and has not taken any action. I still think we have the best armed forces in the world and have the best fighters in the world. If we could spend the billions of dollars in helping the Peoples of the world instead of killing of one another.
S64.Q97.Full: 97. If you have any further remarks you would like to make on any subject please write them below as fully as you like. If my vision was good I would like to be in the air corp and overseas and doing a good job for my country. But as I am limited [insertion] service [/insertion] and I am in Station Complement I am not doing a very important job. And I would ([unclear] rather[unclear] ) be a civilian where I can do something with worthwhile my vision is gradually getting worse. And I cannot do the job I am doing. Therefore I would take as C.D.D. as our medical officer suggested and has not taken any action. I still think we have the best armed forces in the world and have the best fighters in the world. If we could spend the billions of dollars in helping the Peoples of the world instead of killing of one another.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: This outfit is provided with most of the poorest officers in the U.S. I wouldn't want their leadership at all. Many of them are too young and think they are big which doesn't impress me one bit. The commanding officer has a reputation of having burned out one outfit and I believe it now in looking at these poor fellows in the ranks. As far as I'm concerned I'll take a discharge right now and wouldn't even regret it. And I'd like to meet a few of these
S64.Q97.C_1: supposed superior 2nd Lts. in civilian clothes. No men in this outfit cooperates with another. Everybody is for himself and naturally that gives me a tendency to do the same. Anyone who would send this outfit in combat hasn't the sense of a jackass or shall I say a dog who has been dead and rotten. I'm fed up with everything. Why don't you smash the opie men before everyone else is burned out. Besides, there are always TE in questions. What's the necessity. Just to do something to kill the spare time that a soldier can have to himself. Reorganisations with the companies are a pain in the seat. Why doesn't someone make up his mind schedule one irreglar after changing every hour. Somebody should quit and go home and let someone that can do the job right to do it. I'm fed up with it all.
S64.Q97.Full: This outfit is provided with most of the poorest officers in the U.S. I wouldn't want their leadership at all. Many of them are too young and think they are big which doesn't impress me one bit. The commanding officer has a reputation of having burned out one outfit and I believe it now in looking at these poor fellows in the ranks. As far as I'm concerned I'll take a discharge right now and wouldn't even regret it. And I'd like to meet a few of these  supposed superior 2nd Lts. in civilian clothes. No men in this outfit cooperates with another. Everybody is for himself and naturally that gives me a tendency to do the same. Anyone who would send this outfit in combat hasn't the sense of a jackass or shall I say a dog who has been dead and rotten. I'm fed up with everything. Why don't you smash the opie men before everyone else is burned out. Besides, there are always TE in questions. What's the necessity. Just to do something to kill the spare time that a soldier can have to himself. Reorganisations with the companies are a pain in the seat. Why doesn't someone make up his mind schedule one irreglar after changing every hour. Somebody should quit and go home and let someone that can do the job right to do it. I'm fed up with it all.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Why does the Army keep men not pysically fit for duty. Officers should be closer to the men and should understand every men atleast try to. Men that [unclear] Sc [/unclear] , things up in an outfit on this side, will be the ones that [unclear] Sc [/unclear] ; things up over there. More camp shows.
S64.Q97.Full: Why does the Army keep men not pysically fit for duty. Officers should be closer to the men and should understand every men atleast try to. Men that [unclear] Sc [/unclear] , things up in an outfit on this side, will be the ones that [unclear] Sc [/unclear] ; things up over there. More camp shows.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: The Furloughs and passes in my company are not given out right some of the boys get 3 furloughs to some of the other boys one [space] My out fit as a whole is not run right and I wouldn't like to go the combat with it. The officers are no good. They spend to much time pulling
S64.Q97.C_1: full field inspections, and we are not getting enough combat training. We are not getting enough of the work that we would do in actual combat.[paragraph] The moral [morale] of my company is very low.
S64.Q97.Full: The Furloughs and passes in my company are not given out right some of the boys get 3 furloughs to some of the other boys one [space] My out fit as a whole is not run right and I wouldn't like to go the combat with it. The officers are no good. They spend to much time pulling full field inspections, and we are not getting enough combat training. We are not getting enough of the work that we would do in actual combat.[paragraph] The moral [morale] of my company is very low.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: Well the outfit I am with his [is] not good Because they do not no [know] how to work in a outfit if we wood [would] go across the sea we would get kill because we stay close up to much and the officer his not good Because they do not no how they should work. They should be a Private in the army because they dont no a thing about Combat. I would rather [deletion] [/deletion] die over here than go over there with
S64.Q97.C_1: because they wood [would] have the outfit kill and the officers is not worth a dime.
S64.Q97.Full: Well the outfit I am with his [is] not good Because they do not no [know] how to work in a outfit if we wood [would] go across the sea we would get kill because we stay close up to much and the officer his not good Because they do not no how they should work. They should be a Private in the army because they dont no a thing about Combat. I would rather [deletion] [/deletion] die over here than go over there with  because they wood [would] have the outfit kill and the officers is not worth a dime.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: About this outfit being a glider Inf is it just a set up cause we do more hiking then any [unclear] Girbox [/unclear] if this is suppose to be a glider outfit then why not do more of glider work but not a month of glider this about 3 month hikeing and [unclear] broning [/unclear] every man out which at the end will not be good at all even [underline] combat [/underline] [paragraph]
S64.Q97.Full: About this outfit being a glider Inf is it just a set up cause we do more hiking then any [unclear] Girbox [/unclear] if this is suppose to be a glider outfit then why not do more of glider work but not a month of glider this about 3 month hikeing and [unclear] broning [/unclear] every man out which at the end will not be good at all even [underline] combat [/underline] [paragraph]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: Why is it [deletion] if [/deletion] a citizen of [deletion] friendly [/deletion] co-belligerant allied nation cannot enlist in the American Army but can be drafted right in the Infantry of the U.S. and cannot transfer out because he is not a citizen. It seems very unfair to me. But I suppose you have your reasons.
S64.Q97.Full: Why is it [deletion] if [/deletion] a citizen of [deletion] friendly [/deletion] co-belligerant allied nation cannot enlist in the American Army but can be drafted right in the Infantry of the U.S. and cannot transfer out because he is not a citizen. It seems very unfair to me. But I suppose you have your reasons.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Because my mother needs me at home [paragraph]
S64.Q97.Full: Because my mother needs me at home [paragraph]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Most men come in the army with a tough disposition and can't get accustom to army life. This is the reason for so many A.W.O.L.'s I think the army is the best in the world. It has very good equipment and will see victory within the next year.
S64.Q97.Full: Most men come in the army with a tough disposition and can't get accustom to army life. This is the reason for so many A.W.O.L.'s I think the army is the best in the world. It has very good equipment and will see victory within the next year.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: We need more free time in the Army, more furloughs & passes. We do not get our authorized number of days per year. We should have much more time to spend in athletics because athletics, as wall as extensive training, will keep a man in physical shape. At the same time he enjoys himself. If the training programs are very
S64.Q97.C_1: ... boring??? at times. We have two or three hours of athletics per month, and that is not enough. I think the Army should give more attention to the food we have. We should have more of clean cooked nourishing food. At times it is not so good and we don't get enough. Another thing, our barracks are too crowded. I suggest some officers from the War Dept. should inspect the posts & stations more thoroughly Some one would be surprised at the conditions the men have to sleep in. Very unhealthful.
S64.Q97.Full: We need more free time in the Army, more furloughs & passes. We do not get our authorized number of days per year. We should have much more time to spend in athletics because athletics, as wall as extensive training, will keep a man in physical shape. At the same time he enjoys himself. If the training programs are very ... boring??? at times. We have two or three hours of athletics per month, and that is not enough. I think the Army should give more attention to the food we have. We should have more of clean cooked nourishing food. At times it is not so good and we don't get enough. Another thing, our barracks are too crowded. I suggest some officers from the War Dept. should inspect the posts & stations more thoroughly Some one would be surprised at the conditions the men have to sleep in. Very unhealthful.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: A good many men in my outfit are too old to stay up with the younger ones on the airborn thay should not be over 25 years old. [paragraph]
S64.Q97.Full: A good many men in my outfit are too old to stay up with the younger ones on the airborn thay should not be over 25 years old. [paragraph]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think that it would save trouble if all men in the Army would be required to take a test before their rank were increased. Men loose their own confidence when they have to follow or be lead by an individual who is uncertain.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that it would save trouble if all men in the Army would be required to take a test before their rank were increased. Men loose their own confidence when they have to follow or be lead by an individual who is uncertain.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Well I don't like the army because I think I could do lots more at home and could do more to win this war. And I don't care for the part of the army I am in . I think it no placy to a 18 year old fellow because he don't realize what it all about. I think they could do more if they were in something they like
S64.Q97.Full: Well I don't like the army because I think I could do lots more at home and could do more to win this war. And I don't care for the part of the army I am in . I think it no placy to a 18 year old fellow because he don't realize what it all about. I think they could do more if they were in something they like

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: The reason I answered question 90 like I did is that I have a sore back that bothers me sometimes. If it wasn't for that my answer may have been different.
S64.Q97.Full: The reason I answered question 90 like I did is that I have a sore back that bothers me sometimes. If it wasn't for that my answer may have been different.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: There's an old army saying "a good soldier always complains." Well, I take things as they come, both good and bad, so I guess then I'm not a very good soldier when it comes to complaining. However, everybody has their gripes about one thing or another and opinions help make the world go round. Enjoy life while you can is a motto I have always lived by so complaints are ruled out. The army ain't bad at all.
S64.Q97.Full: There's an old army saying "a good soldier always complains." Well, I take things as they come, both good and bad, so I guess then I'm not a very good soldier when it comes to complaining. However, everybody has their gripes about one thing or another and opinions help make the world go round. Enjoy life while you can is a motto I have always lived by so complaints are ruled out. The army ain't bad at all.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: A lot of these questions do not fit in with this outfit as we are just finishing basic training. I would have different opinions later on most likely as my training is advanced.
S64.Q97.Full: A lot of these questions do not fit in with this outfit as we are just finishing basic training. I would have different opinions later on most likely as my training is advanced.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think that if the higher ups in the army would stop dickering about what uniform we are to wear on a certain day or days it would be a good thing. I don't know whether that is a way to keep us on the ball or not but it is terribly annoying to tell a soldier one thing one day and another thing pertaining to the same subject. We need ...
S64.Q97.Full: I think that if the higher ups in the army would stop dickering about what uniform we are to wear on a certain day or days it would be a good thing. I don't know whether that is a way to keep us on the ball or not but it is terribly annoying to tell a soldier one thing one day and another thing pertaining to the same subject. We need ...

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: One point I would like to make is this. The classification of a man at the induction center is not handled correctly. I know of many men who are talented in many useful trades who are in the infantry and know others who have no trade at all who are put in highly technical jobs. Also many men who cant take this life are put in the infantry and made to suffer
S64.Q97.C_1: physically through no fault of their own. I think it would be wise to see that the physical exam given an inductee be very strict so as to reject him then rather than after 3 or 4 mos. This will cost the Army less and also will save the man from humiliation and suffering.
S64.Q97.Full: One point I would like to make is this. The classification of a man at the induction center is not handled correctly. I know of many men who are talented in many useful trades who are in the infantry and know others who have no trade at all who are put in highly technical jobs. Also many men who cant take this life are put in the infantry and made to suffer physically through no fault of their own. I think it would be wise to see that the physical exam given an inductee be very strict so as to reject him then rather than after 3 or 4 mos. This will cost the Army less and also will save the man from humiliation and suffering.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: How about a little more amusement. All work is no good. More weekend passes. I feel that some of the non-coms [non-commissioned officers] received stripes by being such asses for the officers. Lot of them would be afraid in combat.
S64.Q97.Full: How about a little more amusement. All work is no good. More weekend passes. I feel that some of the non-coms [non-commissioned officers] received stripes by being such asses for the officers. Lot of them would be afraid in combat.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: My remaks [remarks] are as follows: When I was drafted into the army, I signed up for the air corp [corps] and they put me into the infrenty [infantry] . I didn't think that was the right thing to do because I had my hart [heart] set on being in the aircorp [air corps] . There are a lot of other boys in this camp that feel the same
S64.Q97.C_1: way about it. They should not promise to put you into a certain part of the service if there is no opening. I would have joined the army a long time before I was drafted if I knew this was going to happen.
S64.Q97.Full: My remaks [remarks] are as follows: When I was drafted into the army, I signed up for the air corp [corps] and they put me into the infrenty [infantry] . I didn't think that was the right thing to do because I had my hart [heart] set on being in the aircorp [air corps] . There are a lot of other boys in this camp that feel the same way about it. They should not promise to put you into a certain part of the service if there is no opening. I would have joined the army a long time before I was drafted if I knew this was going to happen.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: They make NCO.s to soon usually, and sometimes they don't know as much as the ones who are under the. They do not use enough common sense about how we should be trained and take to much of it out of a book. [paragraph]
S64.Q97.Full: They make NCO.s to soon usually, and sometimes they don't know as much as the ones who are under the. They do not use enough common sense about how we should be trained and take to much of it out of a book. [paragraph]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think we should have more to eat and cooked so we can eat it the army should not be as wasteful. We should have better Barracks to live in. We should have more of a chance to express our opinion. We should also know more about war conditions across the pond. We should hear more War news and also more recretation it may be
S64.Q97.C_1: the last we will get. although we don't figure on getting killed. I also think we should be allowed to have more clothes. we cannot keep a clean uniform in the summer. we do not need so many inspections, it lowers the morale of the individual soldier. we do not get enough money considering our job and a job in civilian life at the present time, We need a little security.
S64.Q97.Full: I think we should have more to eat and cooked so we can eat it the army should not be as wasteful. We should have better Barracks to live in. We should have more of a chance to express our opinion. We should also know more about war conditions across the pond. We should hear more War news and also more recretation it may be the last we will get. although we don't figure on getting killed. I also think we should be allowed to have more clothes. we cannot keep a clean uniform in the summer. we do not need so many inspections, it lowers the morale of the individual soldier. we do not get enough money considering our job and a job in civilian life at the present time, We need a little security.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I think that a soldier should get at least a 7 day furlough [insertion] with [/insertion] [insertion] traveling [/insertion] [insertion] time [/insertion] [deletion] because [/deletion] instead of a 5 day furlough, because after he goes back [deletion] into [/deletion] to camp he may be shipped across without seeing them again. I think 5 days is [insertion] entirely [/insertion] too short.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that a soldier should get at least a 7 day furlough [insertion] with [/insertion] [insertion] traveling [/insertion] [insertion] time [/insertion] [deletion] because [/deletion] instead of a 5 day furlough, because after he goes back [deletion] into [/deletion] to camp he may be shipped across without seeing them again. I think 5 days is [insertion] entirely [/insertion] too short.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Well men in the service should get the same amount of furlough. Some get 5 10-15 I don't thing thats fair as a matter of fact it's not fair. That is for every branch of the service. If I get 5 days I should the next man should get five.
S64.Q97.Full: Well men in the service should get the same amount of furlough. Some get 5 10-15 I don't thing thats fair as a matter of fact it's not fair. That is for every branch of the service. If I get 5 days I should the next man should get five.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: It has made it a very hard for the family because of the recent death of my Father, and I was the sole support of the family. [paragraph]
S64.Q97.Full: It has made it a very hard for the family because of the recent death of my Father, and I was the sole support of the family. [paragraph]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: no I havent [sic] got any remarks to make.
S64.Q97.C_1: I haven't got to much to say about the army. I thank I would done has much good the job that I had as I can where I am. I was doning every thing I could to win this war I work for the rail road tha is all I can thank of now
S64.Q97.Full: no I havent [sic] got any remarks to make. I haven't got to much to say about the army. I thank I would done has much good the job that I had as I can where I am. I was doning every thing I could to win this war I work for the rail road tha is all I can thank of now

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I feel every soldier is entitled to a furlough before going across some have I know they are needed and battles decided by hours yet he may never see his loved ones again for a few days why couldn't a soldier have a furlough he deserves it.
S64.Q97.Full: I feel every soldier is entitled to a furlough before going across some have I know they are needed and battles decided by hours yet he may never see his loved ones again for a few days why couldn't a soldier have a furlough he deserves it.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think I was doing much more good for the country when I was on a farm than I am here although the army wouldn't be so bad if they didn't make the boys do detail about every night.
S64.Q97.Full: I think I was doing much more good for the country when I was on a farm than I am here although the army wouldn't be so bad if they didn't make the boys do detail about every night.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: There should be no more K.P. [kitchen patrol] except for the limited service men. [paragraph] We should be able to eat out of dishes rather than a mess kit like a bunch of dogs.
S64.Q97.Full: There should be no more K.P. [kitchen patrol] except for the limited service men. [paragraph] We should be able to eat out of dishes rather than a mess kit like a bunch of dogs.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: One thing the men in my regiment and company is that [deletion] tha [/deletion] they don't get much of training such as bayonett [bayonet] how to use it and all that. I think that every man should know how to use it I have seen some of the men qualify as experts in rifle, bayonet and they don't even know how to use it. In the use of the hand grenade is another thing which we lack a lot some
S64.Q97.C_1: if the men don't know how throw it and you know thats a pretty dangerous weapon. One [deletion] the [/deletion] day they show you how to use some of the weapons and the next day they expect you to make an expert and I have seen it done and that way I think we are having a lack of traing [training] in the arms in which we are to use.
S64.Q97.Full: One thing the men in my regiment and company is that [deletion] tha [/deletion] they don't get much of training such as bayonett [bayonet] how to use it and all that. I think that every man should know how to use it I have seen some of the men qualify as experts in rifle, bayonet and they don't even know how to use it. In the use of the hand grenade is another thing which we lack a lot some if the men don't know how throw it and you know thats a pretty dangerous weapon. One [deletion] the [/deletion] day they show you how to use some of the weapons and the next day they expect you to make an expert and I have seen it done and that way I think we are having a lack of traing [training] in the arms in which we are to use.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Army life is one of the best physical exercises and health builders there is as a whole I don't mind the army life.
S64.Q97.Full: Army life is one of the best physical exercises and health builders there is as a whole I don't mind the army life.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Should discharge older men from service if married. [paragraph] Should try harder to keep moral [morale] of soldiers up. [paragraph] Should have set off duty hours for men in training.
S64.Q97.Full: Should discharge older men from service if married. [paragraph] Should try harder to keep moral [morale] of soldiers up. [paragraph] Should have set off duty hours for men in training.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: The doctors at the induction centers are not giving the men thorough examinations. They run you through like a bunch of cattle, consequently many men are get in branches they are not fitted for. Then to much valuable time & money is wasted on these men, for they break
S64.Q97.C_1: down after awhile & are put on limited service or given discharges. [paragraph] Many of them wait around for a long time also before they get transferred.
S64.Q97.Full: The doctors at the induction centers are not giving the men thorough examinations. They run you through like a bunch of cattle, consequently many men are get in branches they are not fitted for. Then to much valuable time & money is wasted on these men, for they break  down after awhile & are put on limited service or given discharges. [paragraph] Many of them wait around for a long time also before they get transferred.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I would like very much to go to some technical school and also have a furlough as often as the army promised them.
S64.Q97.Full: I would like very much to go to some technical school and also have a furlough as often as the army promised them.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I would like to see men be shipped away from home when entering the Army so they can not go home ever night. That would make better soldier to stay on the post until they have reached the grade to do so.
S64.Q97.Full: I would like to see men be shipped away from home when entering the Army so they can not go home ever night. That would make better soldier to stay on the post until they have reached the grade to do so.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I think that the soldier of any post or camp, that is near a town or city where transportation is available, the men of that post should be given passes to go to town when not on duty and if they have friends or relations in that town he like to stay out over night and be back the next morning in time for duty. I have that by doing this the soldier take more interest in their training and
S64.Q97.C_1: duty and cooperate inevery way possible with rules & regulations of the army. The men I have under me have the foregoing privilege and are doing a swell job in there work. I have talked to them about what would they do should their overnight passes be taken away during the week and most of them said they would not care to put much interest in their work knowing that they couls not spend a few hours in town or staying over with with family. The men really work and take interest in their wotk because of having passes to leave the post when off duty and have signed out with the 1st Sgt.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that the soldier of any post or camp, that is near a town or city where transportation is available, the men of that post should be given passes to go to town when not on duty and if they have friends or relations in that town he like to stay out over night and be back the next morning in time for duty. I have that by doing this the soldier take more interest in their training and  duty and cooperate inevery way possible with rules & regulations of the army. The men I have under me have the foregoing privilege and are doing a swell job in there work. I have talked to them about what would they do should their overnight passes be taken away during the week and most of them said they would not care to put much interest in their work knowing that they couls not spend a few hours in town or staying over with with family. The men really work and take interest in their wotk because of having passes to leave the post when off duty and have signed out with the 1st Sgt.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I think Air Corps men who are engaged in training cadets should not be held too strictly to regulation as apply to combat units until time for overseas duty. I think that we should be allowed to do as we please when we have finished our period of duty each day. In the case of a man with a family he should be free to leave the post and to stay with his family overnight every night.
S64.Q97.C_1: so long as his absence from the past doesn't interfere with his efficiencey in completing his duties.
S64.Q97.Full: I think Air Corps men who are engaged in training cadets should not be held too strictly to regulation as apply to combat units until time for overseas duty. I think that we should be allowed to do as we please when we have finished our period of duty each day. In the case of a man with a family he should be free to leave the post and to stay with his family overnight every night. so long as his absence from the past doesn't interfere with his efficiencey in completing his duties.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I don't think that just because a man has a defect such as bad eyes, he should be stuck away in a [unclear] [/unclear] . limited service is a hell of a classification for any man that feels that he could better himself (and had done so in civilian life) and yet in the army he is stuck on some job that a W.A.C. [Womans Army Corps] or his grandmother could perform without getting in a strain.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't think that just because a man has a defect such as bad eyes, he should be stuck away in a [unclear] [/unclear] . limited service is a hell of a classification for any man that feels that he could better himself (and had done so in civilian life) and yet in the army he is stuck on some job that a W.A.C. [Womans Army Corps] or his grandmother could perform without getting in a strain.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: It's not what they promise you when you get in.
S64.Q97.F: Gentlemen -- I feel that I am as good a soldier as the majority on my post. I do not feel extremely hard toward the army or the officers. But, I will say this -- I think the army should be more standardized. If the boys can stay out all night in Chicago why should they be made to get off the streets in Houston -- If the boys wear Garrison Caps nearly all other places, why should we be made to wear the silly looking
S64.Q97.C_1: overseas caps issues us. It appears to me the officers are jealous of the average G.I. soldier - he is afraid if he is allowed to wear anything that fits him, he will in some small way resemble an officer or make a hit with some girl whom the officer would like to go with. They should allow soldiers the same priviledge everywhere but it seems that we have a very unusual staff at the head of this 8th corps area - probably run by the Baptist Ladies and Jesse Jones. Maybe they don't know it but just such things as I have mentioned makes a soldier a lot less interested in his work (especially since the men of the 1st 3 grades are allowed to do this and that any things regular G.I.s who deserve as much are not allowed to do.) Also Gentlemen -- running the soldiers off the streets at 11:30 isn't helping the veneral disease disasters here. It will come a time when the officers of higher up will finally see that the average soldier will only have to take "any old port in the storm" since he does not have a fair chance with a reasonably nice girl. Outside of that I am happy about the whole thing.
S64.Q97.Full: Gentlemen -- I feel that I am as good a soldier as the majority on my post. I do not feel extremely hard toward the army or the officers. But, I will say this -- I think the army should be more standardized. If the boys can stay out all night in Chicago why should they be made to get off the streets in Houston -- If the boys wear Garrison Caps nearly all other places, why should we be made to wear the silly looking overseas caps issues us. It appears to me the officers are jealous of the average G.I. soldier - he is afraid if he is allowed to wear anything that fits him, he will in some small way resemble an officer or make a hit with some girl whom the officer would like to go with. They should allow soldiers the same priviledge everywhere but it seems that we have a very unusual staff at the head of this 8th corps area - probably run by the Baptist Ladies and Jesse Jones. Maybe they don't know it but just such things as I have mentioned makes a soldier a lot less interested in his work (especially since the men of the 1st 3 grades are allowed to do this and that any things regular G.I.s who deserve as much are not allowed to do.) Also Gentlemen -- running the soldiers off the streets at 11:30 isn't helping the veneral disease disasters here. It will come a time when the officers of higher up will finally see that the average soldier will only have to take "any old port in the storm" since he does not have a fair chance with a reasonably nice girl. Outside of that I am happy about the whole thing.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I would like to mention again that we as [deletion] [/deletion] a Country will not be lenient with offenders when making settlement. Let us remember that a dead foe can do us no harm while punished men can surge up against us even worse than before. My only cry is shown them no mercy for the lives they have taken from our Country. [paragraph] Secondly I hope some fair arrangement is made to take care of the
S64.Q97.C_1: boys who fought this war. Not in the line of pensioners but simply gainful employment after the war as a reward for their selfless sacrifice. Believe me they've earned it.
S64.Q97.Full: I would like to mention again that we as [deletion] [/deletion] a Country will not be lenient with offenders when making settlement. Let us remember that a dead foe can do us no harm while punished men can surge up against us even worse than before. My only cry is shown them no mercy for the lives they have taken from our Country. [paragraph] Secondly I hope some fair arrangement is made to take care of the  boys who fought this war. Not in the line of pensioners but simply gainful employment after the war as a reward for their selfless sacrifice. Believe me they've earned it.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: My problem is really secondary in most respects, except that my being in the army has nearly broken up my home completely. My wife is very nervous & has been unable to secure employment which would make her financially stable. Under present conditions I cannot be with her as much as she needs me. Her disposition is such that she needs constant guiding and being in the
S64.Q97.C_1: army under the usual restrictions of an enlisted man it is impossible for me to be of much help to her & after relying and depending on me for 10 yrs [years] , it is quite a hardship.
S64.Q97.Full: My problem is really secondary in most respects, except that my being in the army has nearly broken up my home completely. My wife is very nervous & has been unable to secure employment which would make her financially stable. Under present conditions I cannot be with her as much as she needs me. Her disposition is such that she needs constant guiding and being in the  army under the usual restrictions of an enlisted man it is impossible for me to be of much help to her & after relying and depending on me for 10 yrs [years] , it is quite a hardship.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I do not feel that the N.C.O. [non-commissioned officer] should promise the men ratings and then never see to it that they get any at all.[paragraph] Also I do not think the Army should not draft men for permanent K.P. [Kitchen Patrol] .
S64.Q97.Full: I do not feel that the N.C.O. [non-commissioned officer] should promise the men ratings and then never see to it that they get any at all.[paragraph] Also I do not think the Army should not draft men for permanent K.P. [Kitchen Patrol] .

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I believe to take more liberty from the boys would be bad for moral.
S64.Q97.Full: I believe to take more liberty from the boys would be bad for moral.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: army chow is fair Medical Detachment of this station Ellington Field Texas should have a thorough investigation from washington Looking [deletion] [/deletion] especially for supposedly doctors that are not mentally fit to hold their present position also officers of Med Det that are easily influenced by personal [unclear] [/unclear] (over)
S64.Q97.C_1: Officers should investigate conditions pertaining to E.M. personal. Take a soldiers word for a few things & then investigate & see if he is wright or wrong. Give him a fair chance to explain himself by talking to him man-to-man rather than a Tin God to scum. Some officers are experienced in handling men & know how to handle them. These are not the ones I am bleeding about. It is the ones that have received the rank by political pull & other means.
S64.Q97.Full: army chow is fair Medical Detachment of this station Ellington Field Texas should have a thorough investigation from washington Looking [deletion] [/deletion] especially for supposedly doctors that are not mentally fit to hold their present position also officers of Med Det that are easily influenced by personal [unclear] [/unclear] (over) Officers should investigate conditions pertaining to E.M. personal. Take a soldiers word for a few things & then investigate & see if he is wright or wrong. Give him a fair chance to explain himself by talking to him man-to-man rather than a Tin God to scum. Some officers are experienced in handling men & know how to handle them. These are not the ones I am bleeding about. It is the ones that have received the rank by political pull & other means.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I think that when a soldier is of [off] duty he should be given a chance to go to town to see his wife and family, as often as he can because after he is across [overseas] he may never see them again.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that when a soldier is of [off] duty he should be given a chance to go to town to see his wife and family, as often as he can because after he is across [overseas] he may never see them again.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: While I understand everything is being done to properly classify all men into their best line of work, I have frequently noted that men who are well qualified for one line of work are never given a chance at this work.
S64.Q97.Full: While I understand everything is being done to properly classify all men into their best line of work, I have frequently noted that men who are well qualified for one line of work are never given a chance at this work.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: A new regulation the War Department has issued in the 8th Corps Area can easily be dispensed with. In my opinion, a soldier be given free time when actually of duty. The new Regulations to start on August 3, 1943 at Ellington Field Texas, concerning passes, is not all favorable
S64.Q97.C_1: with 90% of the Training Personnel, and it shall cause a great deal of trouble and friction. The Commissioned officers will be able to leave, why can't the Enlisted men, the backbone of the entire Army & organization. [?]
S64.Q97.Full: A new regulation the War Department has issued in the 8th Corps Area can easily be dispensed with. In my opinion, a soldier be given free time when actually of duty. The new Regulations to start on August 3, 1943 at Ellington Field Texas, concerning passes, is not all favorable with 90% of the Training Personnel, and it shall cause a great deal of trouble and friction. The Commissioned officers will be able to leave, why can't the Enlisted men, the backbone of the entire Army & organization. [?]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I thank [think] that before I would want to go to combat service that I need a lot more combat training, because I have had very little.
S64.Q97.Full: I thank [think] that before I would want to go to combat service that I need a lot more combat training, because I have had very little.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)

S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Present plans to discontinue giving class "A" passes to all those ??? the first three grades will not be well accepted generally and probably will increase the number of men going AWOL if the rule is put in effect.
S64.Q97.Full: Present plans to discontinue giving class "A" passes to all those ??? the first three grades will not be well accepted generally and probably will increase the number of men going AWOL if the rule is put in effect.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: [answer 7 also has a mark in the box, but the initials AT are beside the answer 6 box and the score in the right hand column is 6]
S64.Q97.F: I think we should be aloud to keep our class a passes and it will keep the moral of the soilders up otherwise the soilder will loose all faith in the army it would be different if we were on the Fighting Front.
S64.Q97.Full: I think we should be aloud to keep our class a passes and it will keep the moral of the soilders up otherwise the soilder will loose all faith in the army it would be different if we were on the Fighting Front.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Non-coms [non-commissioned officers] are often demoted at points of embarkation due to lack of training which has never been available to them thus causing an unfair situation and embarrassment. This should be remedied by finding out from all sources what is needed and then include it in the training courses.
S64.Q97.Full: Non-coms [non-commissioned officers] are often demoted at points of embarkation due to lack of training which has never been available to them thus causing an unfair situation and embarrassment. This should be remedied by finding out from all sources what is needed and then include it in the training courses.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: In regard to question No. 90. I think many skilled men are drafted into the service that could be doing a better job as a civilian.
S64.Q97.Full: In regard to question No. 90. I think many skilled men are drafted into the service that could be doing a better job as a civilian.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think men who are stationed close enough to their homes should be allowed to stay home nights, whether they are of the first three grades or not. That seems like discrimination.
S64.Q97.Full: I think men who are stationed close enough to their homes should be allowed to stay home nights, whether they are of the first three grades or not. That seems like discrimination.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I think this pass deal in going to be a bad thing - because only having one day or night at home with your wife or girl isn't going to make the soldiers feel no good & the moral isn't going to be as strong. [paragraph] I think you will find more soldier going AWOL & etc. More veneral disease & drinking the few times we get off - - [paragraph]
S64.Q97.Full: I think this pass deal in going to be a bad thing - because only having one day or night at home with your wife or girl isn't going to make the soldiers feel no good & the moral isn't going to be as strong. [paragraph] I think you will find more soldier going AWOL & etc. More veneral disease & drinking the few times we get off - - [paragraph]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Well there is just one thing I would like to say; and that is a soldier is aloud two 15 days furlough a year and I only got one, I don't think that is very fair
S64.Q97.Full: Well there is just one thing I would like to say; and that is a soldier is aloud two 15 days furlough a year and I only got one, I don't think that is very fair

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: If the present rumor about class "A" passes being taken up goes into effect, I think it will be a bad mistake. It will make the boys take less interest in the Army and many more will be "over the hill".
S64.Q97.Full: If the present rumor about class "A" passes being taken up goes into effect, I think it will be a bad mistake. It will make the boys take less interest in the Army and many more will be "over the hill".

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I would rather you wouldn't think Im mad at the whole, but rater at the unfair way the camp at which I am; is run. Here we get no compat training and yet we are supposed to fight a war with all us young fellows sitting on our ass. To many of the ground officers I have no respect
S64.Q97.C_1: For as they have in [too] many cases gotten [their] rating on pull rather than actual knowledge of the Army. I [feel] that there should be more investigations of the Army camps here in the States. In closing I honestly [feel] I would have a lot better time if I could respect some of my superior non-commissioned and officers. A-men
S64.Q97.Full: I would rather you wouldn't think Im mad at the whole, but rater at the unfair way the camp at which I am; is run. Here we get no compat training and yet we are supposed to fight a war with all us young fellows sitting on our ass. To many of the ground officers I have no respect For as they have in [too] many cases gotten [their] rating on pull rather than actual knowledge of the Army. I [feel] that there should be more investigations of the Army camps here in the States. In closing I honestly [feel] I would have a lot better time if I could respect some of my superior non-commissioned and officers. A-men

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I don't want to take Physical Training & I want to keep my A pass.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't want to take Physical Training & I want to keep my A pass.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Ones that live over three hundred miles from camp should have a furlough every eight months. because we cannot get three day passes. While we are in service in the states.
S64.Q97.Full: Ones that live over three hundred miles from camp should have a furlough every eight months. because we cannot get three day passes. While we are in service in the states.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: If I had my way I would not let anyone volunteer for the other services outside of the Army as I did this and got put at the end of the line and when my application came up to be signed for the Navy they said the other draftees had got it. Then I was promised to go to school for diesel training and all the fellows I came with were going there too but all got stuck when we came here. As long as I don't get my ...
S64.Q97.C_1: trade. I will never feel proud of being in Army clothes and will never do my best work. [paragraph] We are getting too much details such as K.P. every other week, the same goes with guard duty. [paragraph] Make us stay up when the next day is inspection so as everything will be cleaned when it could be done during the week or during the day.
S64.Q97.Full: If I had my way I would not let anyone volunteer for the other services outside of the Army as I did this and got put at the end of the line and when my application came up to be signed for the Navy they said the other draftees had got it. Then I was promised to go to school for diesel training and all the fellows I came with were going there too but all got stuck when we came here. As long as I don't get my ... trade. I will never feel proud of being in Army clothes and will never do my best work. [paragraph] We are getting too much details such as K.P. every other week, the same goes with guard duty. [paragraph] Make us stay up when the next day is inspection so as everything will be cleaned when it could be done during the week or during the day.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
