S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: The nocoms do not give the men any consideration. The men do not have much heart in there work and there is not much moral. There is not enough to do in our time off which we have very little. When the men know they can get off in the afternoon and there is something to do they all pich in and do very good
S64.Q97.C_1: work but we very seldom have that pleasure, there is no reward for hard work
S64.Q97.Full: The nocoms do not give the men any consideration. The men do not have much heart in there work and there is not much moral. There is not enough to do in our time off which we have very little. When the men know they can get off in the afternoon and there is something to do they all pich in and do very good work but we very seldom have that pleasure, there is no reward for hard work

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: This army is supposed to be the best well fed, clothed, payed army in the world. It is well clothed & payed but food is rotten, no 1st aid unless you are almost dead, no cooperation from 1st Sgt (to old) some officers, & non coms. After all they should have more furloughs to keep up morale even though it is wartime. Positively it could be Ft. Leonard Wood, Mo. 75th Division
S64.Q97.C_1: a whole lot better army then it is. At this camp the only way you can make good is kiss all the non coms + officer's tail, or else you are just no good. You can't make good. There [deletion] are [/deletion] is to much partiality giving to certain men. Some don't get the chance they should. Also they never notice the good things you do, it's always the bad then you don't get the chance you need + want. Although we are not yellow we have sweethearts as myself at home familys Mothers, fathers, brothers + sister, and wives. We need more chances to show what we can do and less chances to show what we can't do.
S64.Q97.Full: This army is supposed to be the best well fed, clothed, payed army in the world. It is well clothed & payed but food is rotten, no 1st aid unless you are almost dead, no cooperation from 1st Sgt (to old) some officers, & non coms. After all they should have more furloughs to keep up morale even though it is wartime. Positively it could be Ft. Leonard Wood, Mo. 75th Division a whole lot better army then it is. At this camp the only way you can make good is kiss all the non coms + officer's tail, or else you are just no good. You can't make good. There [deletion] are [/deletion] is to much partiality giving to certain men. Some don't get the chance they should. Also they never notice the good things you do, it's always the bad then you don't get the chance you need + want. Although we are not yellow we have sweethearts as myself at home familys Mothers, fathers, brothers + sister, and wives. We need more chances to show what we can do and less chances to show what we can't do.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: about the non-coms. Do you think it is right to make a soldier a non-com, who has been in this camp for three months two & one half of which he was in the hospital I thought after a person got a pair of stripes, he earned it, and was deserving of it. but as all it is around here is a [unclear] [/unclear] . They made two noncoms just that way. There's another one who was made a noncom who played catcher on the [unclear] [/unclear] team. (he was [unclear] [/unclear] too!) The least liked
S64.Q97.C_1: him so Le made it too. Because of this, the men take their orders unwillingly and that isn't so good. Something should be done. [paragraph] One thing that is to be reminded, is, that these questions, i.e. most of them, are answered on the view my being transferred to the air Corp. [paragraph] Another thing about our Company: - we rise at five, come off the field at 11:30 eat chow, go back out on the field at 1:00 come back at 5:30 eat chow, and then we have a detail that will last up to 11:00 at night. We cannot get our personal work done, then they wonder why we are not on the ball in the morning. Something should be done. [paragraph] Why can't a private have a Class "A" pass after his basic training is over? For the little time he will be here, it's the least thing that the Army can give to him. But not until he shows that he deserves it.
S64.Q97.Full: about the non-coms. Do you think it is right to make a soldier a non-com, who has been in this camp for three months two & one half of which he was in the hospital I thought after a person got a pair of stripes, he earned it, and was deserving of it. but as all it is around here is a [unclear] [/unclear] . They made two noncoms just that way. There's another one who was made a noncom who played catcher on the [unclear] [/unclear] team. (he was [unclear] [/unclear] too!) The least liked  him so Le made it too. Because of this, the men take their orders unwillingly and that isn't so good. Something should be done. [paragraph] One thing that is to be reminded, is, that these questions, i.e. most of them, are answered on the view my being transferred to the air Corp. [paragraph] Another thing about our Company: - we rise at five, come off the field at 11:30 eat chow, go back out on the field at 1:00 come back at 5:30 eat chow, and then we have a detail that will last up to 11:00 at night. We cannot get our personal work done, then they wonder why we are not on the ball in the morning. Something should be done. [paragraph] Why can't a private have a Class "A" pass after his basic training is over? For the little time he will be here, it's the least thing that the Army can give to him. But not until he shows that he deserves it.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: The army could be better in lots of way [ways] if we all would get together and not work to hurt the other man.
S64.Q97.Full: The army could be better in lots of way [ways] if we all would get together and not work to hurt the other man.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: We have to [too] many unneeded inspections when we should be having more time off. Working to [too] late hours on uneed [sic] details.
S64.Q97.Full: We have to [too] many unneeded inspections when we should be having more time off. Working to [too] late hours on uneed [sic] details.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Other/No answer
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: I could have had more passes. Furloughs are not in order right now.
S64.Q97.F: Well sir, in my case it would have been better for me to have been home a little while longer before being sent to camp. But I am not complaining. I think a five day furlough is rather short for some people could use a few more days well at home. Business reasons etc. A week before coming to
S64.Q97.C_1: the army is rather short especially when you have homes etc to straighten out for the duration of the war.
S64.Q97.Full: Well sir, in my case it would have been better for me to have been home a little while longer before being sent to camp. But I am not complaining. I think a five day furlough is rather short for some people could use a few more days well at home. Business reasons etc. A week before coming to  the army is rather short especially when you have homes etc to straighten out for the duration of the war.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: A few place the question was did I think I would do better as a war worker or as a soldier. [unclear] Wr [/unclear] I gave the answer as a war worker. The reason is I would be closer to my wife, although I don't care so much about being in the army, I am very proud to be able to wear the U.S. uniform. But I think it is alright to draft married men and train them but they ought not to be sent across until they have to. Out
S64.Q97.C_1: I am willing to fight for my country until I die if I have to. I had rather it be that way than to have my wife and family to have to live in a slave world. Personally I don't think we will live in a slave world as long as there is an american left. Including wives and children. Most of us american boys hate war but we will give the enemy hell as long as we are able to do it and I know we will be able to do it.
S64.Q97.Full: A few place the question was did I think I would do better as a war worker or as a soldier. [unclear] Wr [/unclear] I gave the answer as a war worker. The reason is I would be closer to my wife, although I don't care so much about being in the army, I am very proud to be able to wear the U.S. uniform. But I think it is alright to draft married men and train them but they ought not to be sent across until they have to. Out  I am willing to fight for my country until I die if I have to. I had rather it be that way than to have my wife and family to have to live in a slave world. Personally I don't think we will live in a slave world as long as there is an american left. Including wives and children. Most of us american boys hate war but we will give the enemy hell as long as we are able to do it and I know we will be able to do it.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: This camp is just no good. In the first place it is not near enough to a large town or city where we can enjoy ourselves like some other camps are situated. Another reason is that first they tell you to do one thing and the next minute they tell you to go another. Before the day is ended we go almost crazy.
S64.Q97.Full: This camp is just no good. In the first place it is not near enough to a large town or city where we can enjoy ourselves like some other camps are situated. Another reason is that first they tell you to do one thing and the next minute they tell you to go another. Before the day is ended we go almost crazy.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I will start out saying I don't like the way the infantry is runned but, I wouldn't want them back home to know this, because then they would worry, but since I am here there not much I can do about it only tell them back home I like it. Here we don't get hardly any time off. When we suppose to get off they always
S64.Q97.C_1: find something for you to do. For a while I got a pass 3 weeks in a roll, but since then I haven't had a week end off in 4 weeks alway putting me on a detail, and I don't see any reason for it. But I don't mind going on, but when the keep putting you on every week end then its time to holler. If they let you off once in a while, I might think more of the branch I'm in, but I'm getting to a point where I am getting tired of it a whole lot. I do know boys here that haven't even had a week end pass. Maybe it's mostly there fault but not all of it. I think the whole outfit could be even a little better, and show what we can really do. If they only give you a chance that's all I got to say.
S64.Q97.Full: I will start out saying I don't like the way the infantry is runned but, I wouldn't want them back home to know this, because then they would worry, but since I am here there not much I can do about it only tell them back home I like it. Here we don't get hardly any time off. When we suppose to get off they always find something for you to do. For a while I got a pass 3 weeks in a roll, but since then I haven't had a week end off in 4 weeks alway putting me on a detail, and I don't see any reason for it. But I don't mind going on, but when the keep putting you on every week end then its time to holler. If they let you off once in a while, I might think more of the branch I'm in, but I'm getting to a point where I am getting tired of it a whole lot. I do know boys here that haven't even had a week end pass. Maybe it's mostly there fault but not all of it. I think the whole outfit could be even a little better, and show what we can really do. If they only give you a chance that's all I got to say.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I think that if us men had a little more time off at night. The week end passes or OK but when a man comes in from a hard days work he likes to be free a little. I get it off but not much nights we come in we haft to work cleaning the barracks I think that not [deletion] f [/deletion] fair to us.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that if us men had a little more time off at night. The week end passes or OK but when a man comes in from a hard days work he likes to be free a little. I get it off but not much nights we come in we haft to work cleaning the barracks I think that not [deletion] f [/deletion] fair to us.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: My honest opionion is that a soldier should [deletion] now [/deletion] have more recreation + time off after retreat because if he don't it lowers the moral of the men + many get angry + some even go AWOL, because here in the Infantry you work to much on details way in the middle of the night + [underline] no [/underline] time for recreation.
S64.Q97.Full: My honest opionion is that a soldier should [deletion] now [/deletion] have more recreation + time off after retreat because if he don't it lowers the moral of the men + many get angry + some even go AWOL, because here in the Infantry you work to much on details way in the middle of the night + [underline] no [/underline] time for recreation.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think it would make ti a better army if a [deletion] pri [/deletion] an enlisted man could have his family on his post an given some kind of job. More pay so we can afford to get married although we are soldiers. [paragraph] The young boys that are soldiers and are about to get married and can't on account of living conditions thats what makes a great increase on AWOL's and desertion. Although he is no soldiers
S64.Q97.C_1: ... if he does.
S64.Q97.Full: I think it would make ti a better army if a [deletion] pri [/deletion] an enlisted man could have his family on his post an given some kind of job. More pay so we can afford to get married although we are soldiers. [paragraph] The young boys that are soldiers and are about to get married and can't on account of living conditions thats what makes a great increase on AWOL's and desertion. Although he is no soldiers ... if he does.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I made some comments about the noncoms, put in my squad in my platoon our squad leaders one of the best, also our platoon Sargent [Sergeant] is all right, its just the other squad leaders that have let thier [their] jobs go to thier [their] heads that I do not like. I cannot kick about our first Sarge as he is one of the best, but the other platoon leaders I do not like.
S64.Q97.C_1: Another thing I think is totaly [totally] wrong and that is their [their] system of K.P. Pertickulary [Particularly] in my camp we sometimes put in 20 are [or] more straight hr's [hours] sometimes getting off as late at night as 2 AM. Then they [unclear] [/unclear] us out at 5 for the days work. I would suggest the shift be split no one man working over a certain amount of time are to get the following morning off.
S64.Q97.Full: I made some comments about the noncoms, put in my squad in my platoon our squad leaders one of the best, also our platoon Sargent [Sergeant] is all right, its just the other squad leaders that have let thier [their] jobs go to thier [their] heads that I do not like. I cannot kick about our first Sarge as he is one of the best, but the other platoon leaders I do not like. Another thing I think is totaly [totally] wrong and that is their [their] system of K.P. Pertickulary [Particularly] in my camp we sometimes put in 20 are [or] more straight hr's [hours] sometimes getting off as late at night as 2 AM. Then they [unclear] [/unclear] us out at 5 for the days work. I would suggest the shift be split no one man working over a certain amount of time are to get the following morning off.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Why is it that an order that could be given the day before is held up until the last minute when it is almost impossible to carry out the order. Then if you fail to carry out the order and complete you catch holy hell, this done quite often at this camp.
S64.Q97.Full: Why is it that an order that could be given the day before is held up until the last minute when it is almost impossible to carry out the order. Then if you fail to carry out the order and complete you catch holy hell, this done quite often at this camp.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: The food is good, but treated & made in a sloppy fashion. The overseas caps make a woolen Ord. uniform look crummy, I think the Garrison hat & belt would improve it.
S64.Q97.Full: The food is good, but treated & made in a sloppy fashion. The overseas caps make a woolen Ord. uniform look crummy, I think the Garrison hat & belt would improve it.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Some of the Officers could be better they [insertion] don't [/insertion] know how to handle men and understand them and we don't get enough time off after working hours.
S64.Q97.Full: Some of the Officers could be better they [insertion] don't [/insertion] know how to handle men and understand them and we don't get enough time off after working hours.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Just my thanks for being one of the lucky ones to fill out this sheet. I take it a privilege more than just something extra to do.
S64.Q97.Full: Just my thanks for being one of the lucky ones to fill out this sheet. I take it a privilege more than just something extra to do.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: The Army should give you a chance in some of a persons own trade that he can be more willing. I do a hell of a lot better in the army. [paragraph] When a person is suppose to have evenings off they put a fellow on detail.
S64.Q97.Full: The Army should give you a chance in some of a persons own trade that he can be more willing. I do a hell of a lot better in the army. [paragraph] When a person is suppose to have evenings off they put a fellow on detail.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: The only thing that I can really find fault with in the army is that some of the officers are just a trifle bit overbearing and unconsiderate. There are a few that you have to be afraid to ask a question of and then there are some that you are perfectly at ease when conversing with them. There is no need no matter how many bars & stars for some of things
S64.Q97.C_1: that some of the officers do and say to the enlisted men. Of course to get a few men lined up correctly they have to be tough, but with the rank & file there isn't any need for getting tough etc.
S64.Q97.Full: The only thing that I can really find fault with in the army is that some of the officers are just a trifle bit overbearing and unconsiderate. There are a few that you have to be afraid to ask a question of and then there are some that you are perfectly at ease when conversing with them. There is no need no matter how many bars & stars for some of things that some of the officers do and say to the enlisted men. Of course to get a few men lined up correctly they have to be tough, but with the rank & file there isn't any need for getting tough etc.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I would not mind being in the army if I were put in a position of place I would be interested in and have ability to do. I don't believe I would ever think of leaving if I were in a division of that type. The privates, in the army has the easiest job, but also get the least amount of freedoms. They push everybody together just to get a
S64.Q97.C_1: division started [deletion] know [/deletion] no matter whether they are qualified or unqualified. [paragraph]
S64.Q97.Full: I would not mind being in the army if I were put in a position of place I would be interested in and have ability to do. I don't believe I would ever think of leaving if I were in a division of that type. The privates, in the army has the easiest job, but also get the least amount of freedoms. They push everybody together just to get a  division started [deletion] know [/deletion] no matter whether they are qualified or unqualified. [paragraph]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: [deletion] I phink [/deletion] I think we should get longer furloughs and longer passes because the men work hard and they deserve them.
S64.Q97.Full: [deletion] I phink [/deletion] I think we should get longer furloughs and longer passes because the men work hard and they deserve them.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I like the Army, but I don't like what I'm in. I would like to opt into the Air Corps.
S64.Q97.Full: I like the Army, but I don't like what I'm in. I would like to opt into the Air Corps.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: After working hour on drilling hours they give you too many detail to do. We have very little time off at night for baseball or some other sports.
S64.Q97.Full: After working hour on drilling hours they give you too many detail to do. We have very little time off at night for baseball or some other sports.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: The job of classifying men should be done more carefully. I know dozens of men with real talent along war-needed lines of work who are thrown into a job they are in no way fitted for. Ages should be considered - don't throw an older man among a bunch of kids and expect him to be contented and efficient.
S64.Q97.C_1: Naturally some older men are needed among the young fellows but due care must be taken as D types!
S64.Q97.Full: The job of classifying men should be done more carefully. I know dozens of men with real talent along war-needed lines of work who are thrown into a job they are in no way fitted for. Ages should be considered - don't throw an older man among a bunch of kids and expect him to be contented and efficient. Naturally some older men are needed among the young fellows but due care must be taken as D types!

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: There are too many demoralizing rumors. Not enough recreational facilities in the camps themselves, too much sickening monotony. Nothing to look forward to in the future except maybe a transfer. Drill goes on day after day and the only future is possible an injury or death. Sometimes wonder if it's worthwhile.
S64.Q97.Full: There are too many demoralizing rumors. Not enough recreational facilities in the camps themselves, too much sickening monotony. Nothing to look forward to in the future except maybe a transfer. Drill goes on day after day and the only future is possible an injury or death. Sometimes wonder if it's worthwhile.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Keep the married men home with children & wifes where they are most needed. A family man worries more about his family than he does of getting sent across, his mind is a blank as far as the army work is concerned.
S64.Q97.Full: Keep the married men home with children & wifes where they are most needed. A family man worries more about his family than he does of getting sent across, his mind is a blank as far as the army work is concerned.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: We are getting too much goat meat. We do not have enough freedom and too many details. Men will leave their barracks and get out of the company tour to avoid detail jobs every night and day. Some of the noncoms curse at the men too much.
S64.Q97.Full: We are getting too much goat meat. We do not have enough freedom and too many details. Men will leave their barracks and get out of the company tour to avoid detail jobs every night and day. Some of the noncoms curse at the men too much.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Most of the men I think could use more time for relaxation and for another thing the men do not have enough adequate weekly physical check ups and many serious mishaps & diseases & deformities, and therefore C.D.D. Discharges could be avoided. This would benefit the Army the Country & the men.
S64.Q97.Full: Most of the men I think could use more time for relaxation and for another thing the men do not have enough adequate weekly physical check ups and many serious mishaps & diseases & deformities, and therefore C.D.D. Discharges could be avoided. This would benefit the Army the Country & the men.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Could do a few things to help morale to comman soldier only can't get in proper channels and only am waiting now for oppertunity. In a general way I'm very skilled in 2 trades. -Musician + card sharp [dective?] . Food is very filty + scarce. badly prepared, from my experience in civil life. U.S. is at fault
S64.Q97.C_1: for this war very much, damn thrutfully I believe so, and could debate for ever on this.
S64.Q97.Full: Could do a few things to help morale to comman soldier only can't get in proper channels and only am waiting now for oppertunity. In a general way I'm very skilled in 2 trades. -Musician + card sharp [dective?] . Food is very filty + scarce. badly prepared, from my experience in civil life. U.S. is at fault for this war very much, damn thrutfully I believe so, and could debate for ever on this.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: We should have some mail privleage. We don't have any at all here.
S64.Q97.Full: We should have some mail privleage. We don't have any at all here.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: to start with I think it is foolishness to ship a man 2500 miles to a camp when he could take the same kind of training at a camp near home he will get enough of staying away when he goes overseas without stations now The food [unclear] [/unclear] could be better here we have sheep and goat meat so often the men holler like sheep when they come in the mess hall Another thing is a man has to
S64.Q97.C_1: leave the Barracks when he is off duty to keep from getting some detail thrown at him he cant rest in peace for a minute. Details could also be divided more equally between the men and that goes for guard duty too. I also think that when a man gets a week end pass he should not have to report until Monday morning we have to be back to camp at 1030 Sunday nights and town is about 90 or 100 miles away so it takes him half of Sunday to get back to camp. I sure would like to swimming pools at some of thease camps too. We also have our early training in the cool morning and then they take us out to drill in the heat around noon and supper time and get up so heated up that we cant eat & havent felt like eaten for several days now because I was so worn when chow time came.
S64.Q97.Full: to start with I think it is foolishness to ship a man 2500 miles to a camp when he could take the same kind of training at a camp near home he will get enough of staying away when he goes overseas without stations now The food [unclear] [/unclear] could be better here we have sheep and goat meat so often the men holler like sheep when they come in the mess hall Another thing is a man has to  leave the Barracks when he is off duty to keep from getting some detail thrown at him he cant rest in peace for a minute. Details could also be divided more equally between the men and that goes for guard duty too. I also think that when a man gets a week end pass he should not have to report until Monday morning we have to be back to camp at 1030 Sunday nights and town is about 90 or 100 miles away so it takes him half of Sunday to get back to camp. I sure would like to swimming pools at some of thease camps too. We also have our early training in the cool morning and then they take us out to drill in the heat around noon and supper time and get up so heated up that we cant eat & havent felt like eaten for several days now because I was so worn when chow time came.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: The army does not give me any leisure time at all during Basic Training. We work like horses all day and there is always a good chance of detail at night and week ends. K.P. should be abolished. It is a damn waste of time to a good soldier if he doesn't deserve it. The food in this Company is terrible and living conditions and surroundings are demoralizing. Every soldier should be able to plan on having a certain time off rather than live in fear of a call for "Volunteers for a work detail",
S64.Q97.Full: The army does not give me any leisure time at all during Basic Training. We work like horses all day and there is always a good chance of detail at night and week ends. K.P. should be abolished. It is a damn waste of time to a good soldier if he doesn't deserve it. The food in this Company is terrible and living conditions and surroundings are demoralizing. Every soldier should be able to plan on having a certain time off rather than live in fear of a call for "Volunteers for a work detail",

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: The food we get is not cooked right. They have muttion about three times a week and the won't hardly eat it. and the officers don't work to gether with the men as much as they should for ex they have a metting at night and the next day they say we have just so much to do. Then tell us very little about it till the time comes. In other words [underline] this [/underline] [underline] is [/underline] [underline] a [/underline] [underline] dam [/underline] [underline] poor [/underline] [underline] outfit [/underline] .
S64.Q97.Full: The food we get is not cooked right. They have muttion about three times a week and the won't hardly eat it. and the officers don't work to gether with the men as much as they should for ex they have a metting at night and the next day they say we have just so much to do. Then tell us very little about it till the time comes. In other words [underline] this [/underline] [underline] is [/underline] [underline] a [/underline] [underline] dam [/underline] [underline] poor [/underline] [underline] outfit [/underline] .

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I believe I would be worth more on the outside because I have a bullet in my shoulder and they won't do a thing for me and it bothers me most of the time. The way things stand in my family I am needed badly. This outfit is running the morale of the men so dam [damn] low it is pityful [pitiful] , the reason is because they get to [too] much detail throwed [thrown] at them after duty hour's [hours] and if it is kept up this outfit will go on the rock's [rocks] .
S64.Q97.C_1: If they keep it up in our next training period they will be lucky to have a company here. This place is run like a military academy instead of a fighting unit. The reason for that is because they don't know what is going to happen from day to day. If I had another chance to get into the fighting forces I would pick the navy or coast Guard because I don't think the men have as much extra work throwed at them. This Fort Leonard wood has a lot to do with the way the men feel, when a certain person said that Fort Leonard wood was little aclatraz he was right all the way. I know that is how I feel about it and most of the other men feel the same way or more.
S64.Q97.Full: I believe I would be worth more on the outside because I have a bullet in my shoulder and they won't do a thing for me and it bothers me most of the time. The way things stand in my family I am needed badly. This outfit is running the morale of the men so dam [damn] low it is pityful [pitiful] , the reason is because they get to [too] much detail throwed [thrown] at them after duty hour's [hours] and if it is kept up this outfit will go on the rock's [rocks] . If they keep it up in our next training period they will be lucky to have a company here. This place is run like a military academy instead of a fighting unit. The reason for that is because they don't know what is going to happen from day to day. If I had another chance to get into the fighting forces I would pick the navy or coast Guard because I don't think the men have as much extra work throwed at them. This Fort Leonard wood has a lot to do with the way the men feel, when a certain person said that Fort Leonard wood was little aclatraz he was right all the way. I know that is how I feel about it and most of the other men feel the same way or more.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: The reason things are worse for my family is because my wife and children are not getting enough too money too [to] live on because my wife is sickly and there have been a lot of doctor bills besides the high cost of living and she has no folks too go too because her mother is dead and her father is married again.
S64.Q97.Full: The reason things are worse for my family is because my wife and children are not getting enough too money too [to] live on because my wife is sickly and there have been a lot of doctor bills besides the high cost of living and she has no folks too go too because her mother is dead and her father is married again.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Most of the company officers are fresh out of school and are new at the game and therefore can not inspire too much confidence in their men. Some show a lack of background and don't curb the older noncoms as they should in matters of morality. Some of the noncoms show a complete lack of moral standards which influence greater the young men who are entering into the army.
S64.Q97.C_1: Specialized training classes in basic training are run in a haphazard fashion and most of them to my way of thinking are a waste of time. Those who have the ability to absorb knowledge are being pushed ahead fast enough. Ratings are sometimes handed out because of pull rather than ability. We have no real platoon leader who will go to bat for us and our non coms will not stand up for us. Period.
S64.Q97.Full: Most of the company officers are fresh out of school and are new at the game and therefore can not inspire too much confidence in their men. Some show a lack of background and don't curb the older noncoms as they should in matters of morality. Some of the noncoms show a complete lack of moral standards which influence greater the young men who are entering into the army.  Specialized training classes in basic training are run in a haphazard fashion and most of them to my way of thinking are a waste of time. Those who have the ability to absorb knowledge are being pushed ahead fast enough. Ratings are sometimes handed out because of pull rather than ability. We have no real platoon leader who will go to bat for us and our non coms will not stand up for us. Period.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: wrong [is written to the left of answer 6, which has been marked and scratched out and there are three X's written to the left of answer 7]
S64.Q97.F: All I ask is a fair job, when us boys get out, so we won't have to start a war all over to find a job. & we won't strike either, just have a job so we can make a fair living for our love ones.[paragraph] We all feel the same.
S64.Q97.Full: All I ask is a fair job, when us boys get out, so we won't have to start a war all over to find a job. & we won't strike either, just have a job so we can make a fair living for our love ones.[paragraph] We all feel the same.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: In basic training why is it they send you a long ways from home sometimes instead of close to home so you can enjoy a little time with the family while you have a chance?
S64.Q97.Full: In basic training why is it they send you a long ways from home sometimes instead of close to home so you can enjoy a little time with the family while you have a chance?

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I think the reception center are too forceful on forcing men to take Cl B (Bonds out) and only leaves soldiers a few dollars. Leave soldier take as much as he wish. There's plenty of civilians to buy bonds. [paragraph] Make them all take Cl N under warrated conditions. [paragraph] Hours are too long. After drill all days + clean Barrack for inspections 1/2 nite.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the reception center are too forceful on forcing men to take Cl B (Bonds out) and only leaves soldiers a few dollars. Leave soldier take as much as he wish. There's plenty of civilians to buy bonds. [paragraph] Make them all take Cl N under warrated conditions. [paragraph] Hours are too long. After drill all days + clean Barrack for inspections 1/2 nite.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Frankly I don't think I am getting anywhere at all in the Army.[paragraph] I have been in 4 months and am still a pvt [private] . It's probably me though so don't worry about it.
S64.Q97.Full: Frankly I don't think I am getting anywhere at all in the Army.[paragraph] I have been in 4 months and am still a pvt [private] . It's probably me though so don't worry about it.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: I had all I wanted
S64.Q97.F: My platoon has a 2nd Lt. [Lieutenant] who is supposed to be the Leader. He also is Brn. Mt Officer. It don't give him much time to stay with his men and see how they get along. I don't think an officer should have only one job.
S64.Q97.Full: My platoon has a 2nd Lt. [Lieutenant] who is supposed to be the Leader. He also is Brn. Mt Officer. It don't give him much time to stay with his men and see how they get along. I don't think an officer should have only one job.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I don't think this Government is fair to its soldiers. The ask them to give their lives with little or no pay. Any body with right conections can get defferred. To much money is thrown away uselessly. In such emergencies all pay should be the same. Soldiers are [unclear] [/unclear] . No big profits for
S64.Q97.C_1: Manufacturers. After all it's their skin the little man is saving. The middle man will be eliminated before the war is over - little business is finished. There is no differential in laws to govern the ability + size of companies to pay + produce. If the little man has to give life home + all why in the hell can't the rich give part of their money. Too much graft + political schemes connected with our war efforts. [paragraph] Give the soldier his choice army work at army pay or war work at army pay and he'll swap any day. If the soldier is so cheap its a poor set up. He is the loser all the way around. Lets all get on one level + quit trying to rob each other and at the same time pretend were busting our ass for each others welfare.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't think this Government is fair to its soldiers. The ask them to give their lives with little or no pay. Any body with right conections can get defferred. To much money is thrown away uselessly. In such emergencies all pay should be the same. Soldiers are [unclear] [/unclear] . No big profits for  Manufacturers. After all it's their skin the little man is saving. The middle man will be eliminated before the war is over - little business is finished. There is no differential in laws to govern the ability + size of companies to pay + produce. If the little man has to give life home + all why in the hell can't the rich give part of their money. Too much graft + political schemes connected with our war efforts. [paragraph] Give the soldier his choice army work at army pay or war work at army pay and he'll swap any day. If the soldier is so cheap its a poor set up. He is the loser all the way around. Lets all get on one level + quit trying to rob each other and at the same time pretend were busting our ass for each others welfare.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think there should be more organization especially when you come to fall out you never how 4 minutes before what you going to move in the line of equipment. The work is not planned far enough ahead and we have very little time to our self without detail and we should have a decent place to write a letter or recreation. The equipment for this staff is very poor. The stuff that sent to the kitchens is
S64.Q97.C_1: good [unclear] [/unclear] not [unclear] properity [/unclear] pared. The lighting in the quarters could be improved so that you do not half to strain your eyes so much. The work day could be shorter to a certain extent so the individual soldiers get a chance to write a letter. The equipment from the supply should be given more freely so that every man will have decent things to ware. As to taken care of the quarters there never nothing there to work with. With a little material and the proper handling of it there could be a big improvement to the camp and the Individual.
S64.Q97.Full: I think there should be more organization especially when you come to fall out you never how 4 minutes before what you going to move in the line of equipment. The work is not planned far enough ahead and we have very little time to our self without detail and we should have a decent place to write a letter or recreation. The equipment for this staff is very poor. The stuff that sent to the kitchens is good [unclear] [/unclear] not [unclear] properity [/unclear] pared. The lighting in the quarters could be improved so that you do not half to strain your eyes so much. The work day could be shorter to a certain extent so the individual soldiers get a chance to write a letter. The equipment from the supply should be given more freely so that every man will have decent things to ware. As to taken care of the quarters there never nothing there to work with. With a little material and the proper handling of it there could be a big improvement to the camp and the Individual.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I would like to have my [unclear] [/unclear] of after we are done with training during the day so we don't have to worry about details coming up when we sit down to write a letter we should be off work after 4 oclock that should be our time off after 4 till we go to bed. we would like to have a little more order in the camp. the camp aint got enough recreation for the soldiers at all.
S64.Q97.Full: I would like to have my [unclear] [/unclear] of after we are done with training during the day so we don't have to worry about details coming up when we sit down to write a letter we should be off work after 4 oclock that should be our time off after 4 till we go to bed. we would like to have a little more order in the camp. the camp aint got enough recreation for the soldiers at all.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: because they having any one to look after them and I haven't seen any up there since I enter in the Army in March
S64.Q97.Full: because they having any one to look after them and I haven't seen any up there since I enter in the Army in March

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: [deletion] both furloughs and [/deletion]
S64.Q97.F: I don't think they should draft a man over 35 by the time he is trained he is of no use to the army & he cant keep up with the younger boys. Most of them are willing & try harder than the young but just can't take it. For the government to be more watchfull of Draft boards in larger citys where there is to much graft as example Detroit. This is not a personal beef but I know and turned a man in to the fbi for buying himself out for another 6 months but he is in now
S64.Q97.C_1: I have nothing more to say, only to the person who is checking this question. That every body will be happy when its all over. The same as you. So the boys can go home to their loved ones + Mothers + Fathers. [underline] We [/underline] [underline] Will [/underline] [underline] Win [/underline]
S64.Q97.Full: I don't think they should draft a man over 35 by the time he is trained he is of no use to the army & he cant keep up with the younger boys. Most of them are willing & try harder than the young but just can't take it. For the government to be more watchfull of Draft boards in larger citys where there is to much graft as example Detroit. This is not a personal beef but I know and turned a man in to the fbi for buying himself out for another 6 months but he is in now I have nothing more to say, only to the person who is checking this question. That every body will be happy when its all over. The same as you. So the boys can go home to their loved ones + Mothers + Fathers. [underline] We [/underline] [underline] Will [/underline] [underline] Win [/underline]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I dont think it does a man any good at all to be on the go all the time. And when he doews get a free sunday he has to run to a show or to the P.X. [post exchange] to keep from being put on a detail.[paragraph] And when a noncom [non-commissioned officer] gits [gets] a order he should find out for sure what the order is before he passes it in to the rest of the guys.
S64.Q97.C_1: Why don't they have some kind of statement showing what money is taken out of our pay? [paragraph] Other then this things are O.K. [paragraph]
S64.Q97.Full: I dont think it does a man any good at all to be on the go all the time. And when he doews get a free sunday he has to run to a show or to the P.X. [post exchange] to keep from being put on a detail.[paragraph] And when a noncom [non-commissioned officer] gits [gets] a order he should find out for sure what the order is before he passes it in to the rest of the guys. Why don't they have some kind of statement showing what money is taken out of our pay? [paragraph] Other then this things are O.K. [paragraph]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: 97. If you have any further remarks you would like to make on any subject please write them below as fully as you like. I find not just myself but about all men over 30 become weaker physically by trying to stay up with men younger. Married men should get a pass when not on duty, [unclear] through [/unclear] the week, instead of just weekends or maybe not even that. It should be a mans right while in this country the officers get them.
S64.Q97.C_1: There's a lot of men in the army that could do more in civilian war work.
S64.Q97.Full: 97. If you have any further remarks you would like to make on any subject please write them below as fully as you like. I find not just myself but about all men over 30 become weaker physically by trying to stay up with men younger. Married men should get a pass when not on duty, [unclear] through [/unclear] the week, instead of just weekends or maybe not even that. It should be a mans right while in this country the officers get them. There's a lot of men in the army that could do more in civilian war work.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: about the non coms & officers. when we eat they have better food, more milk, and they think that there better than us and some of the noncoms thats all they think of is taking advantage of us privates. Im in the habit of being treated like a white man not a slave. Thy been working us day & night, what
S64.Q97.C_1: tents, I had to write in the dark. Why we never get enough sleep, sometimes, 2 + 3 hours, how do you expect to make a soldier out of man, and some of the food you feed us, I wouldn't give it to a pig. The army is suppose to get the best food, but I've been on K.P. and I see some of the food we eat, I send home sometimes to get something to eat and at times they confine us to the barracks, as if we're prisoners of war, and the prisoners of war in this army are treated better than we are. And the medical officer, I sometimes wonder, if he ever tried to cure a case in order to get medical care, you have to be half dead. Thats all they give you is a pill when you go on sickcall, the first thing they think of is Gold Bricking, and everything we do, we're treated like slaves.
S64.Q97.Full: about the non coms & officers. when we eat they have better food, more milk, and they think that there better than us and some of the noncoms thats all they think of is taking advantage of us privates. Im in the habit of being treated like a white man not a slave. Thy been working us day & night, what tents, I had to write in the dark. Why we never get enough sleep, sometimes, 2 + 3 hours, how do you expect to make a soldier out of man, and some of the food you feed us, I wouldn't give it to a pig. The army is suppose to get the best food, but I've been on K.P. and I see some of the food we eat, I send home sometimes to get something to eat and at times they confine us to the barracks, as if we're prisoners of war, and the prisoners of war in this army are treated better than we are. And the medical officer, I sometimes wonder, if he ever tried to cure a case in order to get medical care, you have to be half dead. Thats all they give you is a pill when you go on sickcall, the first thing they think of is Gold Bricking, and everything we do, we're treated like slaves.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: I have had my fair share of passes, [deletion] but not of furloughs/deletion]
S64.Q96.M_marginalia: [insertion] since I came into the army [/insertion]
S64.Q97.F: Yes. The food the soldiers are getting isn't good enough. If a soldier got to change camps more often he would be a better soldier, that is different climates.
S64.Q97.Full: Yes. The food the soldiers are getting isn't good enough. If a soldier got to change camps more often he would be a better soldier, that is different climates.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: definitely
S64.Q97.F: In this camp you should be given at least 1 or 2 3-day passes a month. Now I live only 350 miles away from home and do you think they would give you a 3 day pass of which we fully deserve, hell no. We put in 6 full days and 2 or 3 or more nights a week extra detail and if you don't think we deserve a 3 day pass why you just come
S64.Q97.C_1: and we will sure prove it. The largest town from here is 150 miles and how you are lucky if you can get transportation. Now our mess hall is all right if they would start serving food in it. and our recreation is great we may get to look at a baseball diamond if we are lucky.
S64.Q97.Full: In this camp you should be given at least 1 or 2 3-day passes a month. Now I live only 350 miles away from home and do you think they would give you a 3 day pass of which we fully deserve, hell no. We put in 6 full days and 2 or 3 or more nights a week extra detail and if you don't think we deserve a 3 day pass why you just come and we will sure prove it. The largest town from here is 150 miles and how you are lucky if you can get transportation. Now our mess hall is all right if they would start serving food in it. and our recreation is great we may get to look at a baseball diamond if we are lucky.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Well I won't say I like the army, for I don't, but I'm willing to stay and see it through, for I know we've got a job to do. And I'm going to do my part to the fullest extent, and hope to go home and start life over after we do this job.
S64.Q97.Full: Well I won't say I like the army, for I don't, but I'm willing to stay and see it through, for I know we've got a job to do. And I'm going to do my part to the fullest extent, and hope to go home and start life over after we do this job.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think the army is a good thing and most all the men but they work too hard and haft to loose so much sleep and don't get any chance to make up their sleep.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the army is a good thing and most all the men but they work too hard and haft to loose so much sleep and don't get any chance to make up their sleep.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: In question 96 I believe things are better in a little way because before the War there were three working in our family now only two and my sister is working before my brother my father and I had jobs. Another thing I don't like in this army is too many bosses. One officer will give you an order
S64.Q97.C_1: and the next one will [deletion] [/deletion] contradict his order and give you another one. [paragraph] The food in this camp is very good sometimes but other times it isn't very good for the work we do. We sometimes aren't fed enough. I think the supply in this Camp is poor because a soldier sometimes has to wait four or five months for a piece of clothing or equipment. [paragraph] Another thing I dislike is the drawing of too many details for a soldier while another one receives very few of these details. For no reason at all some soldiers get more details than other ones do. [paragraph] but in all I believe the army is a swell place to be in if some of these things are adjusted to help out the buck privates in this army.
S64.Q97.Full: In question 96 I believe things are better in a little way because before the War there were three working in our family now only two and my sister is working before my brother my father and I had jobs. Another thing I don't like in this army is too many bosses. One officer will give you an order and the next one will [deletion] [/deletion] contradict his order and give you another one. [paragraph] The food in this camp is very good sometimes but other times it isn't very good for the work we do. We sometimes aren't fed enough. I think the supply in this Camp is poor because a soldier sometimes has to wait four or five months for a piece of clothing or equipment. [paragraph] Another thing I dislike is the drawing of too many details for a soldier while another one receives very few of these details. For no reason at all some soldiers get more details than other ones do. [paragraph] but in all I believe the army is a swell place to be in if some of these things are adjusted to help out the buck privates in this army.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I have been a 1st Sergeant in two newly formed Div. [divisions] in the past year and I find that in both cases the officers have no faith in their NCO's [non-commissioned officers] which only means one thing, they are carrying a heavier load on their shoulders than they were
S64.Q97.C_1: Normally trained for. If this continues there is no need of having NCO's. It discourages the NCO's and even when the responsibility is handed down to them they don't feel that the Officer has faith and trust in them. I think this wrong. they should show their trust and faith in the NCO's from the first. then if the NCO is not to be trusted he will find out soon enough but if he waits until they get into combat and the Officer should get wounded the whole backbone drops from the organization because he is not there to ask advise from or to give the orders.
S64.Q97.Full: I have been a 1st Sergeant in two newly formed Div. [divisions] in the past year and I find that in both cases the officers have no faith in their NCO's [non-commissioned officers] which only means one thing, they are carrying a heavier load on their shoulders than they were Normally trained for. If this continues there is no need of having NCO's. It discourages the NCO's and even when the responsibility is handed down to them they don't feel that the Officer has faith and trust in them. I think this wrong. they should show their trust and faith in the NCO's from the first. then if the NCO is not to be trusted he will find out soon enough but if he waits until they get into combat and the Officer should get wounded the whole backbone drops from the organization because he is not there to ask advise from or to give the orders.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Why is it - you go + work your fool head off for promises of passes for the week end, + then comes Sat. + inspection + for just a little dust in the bore of your rifle no pass - why is it? [paragraph] When you read this + then read the paper about the boys who have been butchered
S64.Q97.C_1: think of me & of my [underline] wife [/underline] .
S64.Q97.Full: Why is it - you go + work your fool head off for promises of passes for the week end, + then comes Sat. + inspection + for just a little dust in the bore of your rifle no pass - why is it? [paragraph] When you read this + then read the paper about the boys who have been butchered think of me & of my [underline] wife [/underline] .

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: In a lot of cases the officers & non-coms let their rank go to their head instead of on their sleeve or shoulders. Then as a result they try to show off to drive the men around like a bunch of dogs. The average man don't like that & it often leads to such things as AWOL & desertions & striking an officer in some cases the man who do
S64.Q97.C_1: committed the offence is quite justified [unclear] [/unclear] actions. But as I said there are some higher ups that don't give a hoot about the man in the low ranks & as a result the officer or non-com [non commissioned officer] dosen't [doesn't] get a thing done to him. But the man who has committed the offense gets the book & every thing in it piled on him as a result more trouble. If there is any thing that the average man despises most it's the guy who's always trying to pull his rank on some body [somebody] . I've seen it happen more than once & I can truthfully say I don't like it a little bit. [paragraph] And then there's the guy who polishes the [deletion] [/deletion] C.O's [Commanding Officer] shoes just to get another stripe. There should be some way figured out to learn these guy's [guys] ' a lesson. I call them guy's [guys] because they aren't capible [capable] of standing up to the decency of a man. [Yours truly Just Plain me.]
S64.Q97.Full: In a lot of cases the officers & non-coms let their rank go to their head instead of on their sleeve or shoulders. Then as a result they try to show off to drive the men around like a bunch of dogs. The average man don't like that & it often leads to such things as AWOL & desertions & striking an officer in some cases the man who do committed the offence is quite justified [unclear] [/unclear] actions. But as I said there are some higher ups that don't give a hoot about the man in the low ranks & as a result the officer or non-com [non commissioned officer] dosen't [doesn't] get a thing done to him. But the man who has committed the offense gets the book & every thing in it piled on him as a result more trouble. If there is any thing that the average man despises most it's the guy who's always trying to pull his rank on some body [somebody] . I've seen it happen more than once & I can truthfully say I don't like it a little bit. [paragraph] And then there's the guy who polishes the [deletion] [/deletion] C.O's [Commanding Officer] shoes just to get another stripe. There should be some way figured out to learn these guy's [guys] ' a lesson. I call them guy's [guys] because they aren't capible [capable] of standing up to the decency of a man. [Yours truly Just Plain me.]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: In this Post they work you to much on our time and not much recreation. [paragraph] The food or rations we get is enough but not cooked well.
S64.Q97.Full: In this Post they work you to much on our time and not much recreation. [paragraph] The food or rations we get is enough but not cooked well.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I am generally discouraged with the Army because, before entering the service I was a Sheet Metal Worker, and now I am in the engineers as a mechanic in the 2nd echalon which is nothing more than a grease monkey, now why couldn't they have put me in the Air Corps a ground crew, for the most planes now are all sheet aluminum. This all adds up to make not give a dam for anything.
S64.Q97.C_1: True I like to work or rather keep busy, it makes the time pass faster, this being the only reason I think that I received my P.F.C. rating. And then [deletion] I [/deletion] our officers or somebody up the line is [deletion] all [/deletion] always screwing up, and this makes the men work twice as hard as we should. But don't get me wrong I really like to wear the uniform of a soldier and I am proud of it.
S64.Q97.Full: I am generally discouraged with the Army because, before entering the service I was a Sheet Metal Worker, and now I am in the engineers as a mechanic in the 2nd echalon which is nothing more than a grease monkey, now why couldn't they have put me in the Air Corps a ground crew, for the most planes now are all sheet aluminum. This all adds up to make not give a dam for anything.  True I like to work or rather keep busy, it makes the time pass faster, this being the only reason I think that I received my P.F.C. rating. And then [deletion] I [/deletion] our officers or somebody up the line is [deletion] all [/deletion] always screwing up, and this makes the men work twice as hard as we should. But don't get me wrong I really like to wear the uniform of a soldier and I am proud of it.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I don't like the food I am [unclear] severside [/unclear] our office get to like some but of the Bn and that who they give the stripe to. [paragraph] Afau have a chance to get into the line of work you like best an which you could sever the government best [paragraph] No time off hardly every. No enjoyment. [paragraph]
S64.Q97.C_1: not good transport. Never enough sleep.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't like the food I am [unclear] severside [/unclear] our office get to like some but of the Bn and that who they give the stripe to. [paragraph] Afau have a chance to get into the line of work you like best an which you could sever the government best [paragraph] No time off hardly every. No enjoyment. [paragraph]  not good transport. Never enough sleep.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: A married man doesn't have much money to spend in the army. My pay for the first month was $11.57 second $20.50 and third $12.31. I still don't know what I am to get each month. Also, this Fort Leonard Wood in my estimation is the worst post of the United States. Prefer being over seas to here. The man in uniform doesn't get many breaks in towns
S64.Q97.C_1: located near here. Twenty cents for lantern glass, etc.
S64.Q97.Full: A married man doesn't have much money to spend in the army. My pay for the first month was $11.57 second $20.50 and third $12.31. I still don't know what I am to get each month. Also, this Fort Leonard Wood in my estimation is the worst post of the United States. Prefer being over seas to here. The man in uniform doesn't get many breaks in towns  located near here. Twenty cents for lantern glass, etc.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: There should be ways to keep the boys from being worked too long hours. I believe a soldier needs so much rest to be on the ball and if he gets too much extra details and is confined to quarters too much he gets dull and loses his spirit.
S64.Q97.Full: There should be ways to keep the boys from being worked too long hours. I believe a soldier needs so much rest to be on the ball and if he gets too much extra details and is confined to quarters too much he gets dull and loses his spirit.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: One of our Lieut. [Lieutenants] treats us like dogs and the rest are alright but I don't think this one knows how to handle me at any time and I sure wouldnt [wouldn't] want to go across with him leading us.
S64.Q97.Full: One of our Lieut. [Lieutenants] treats us like dogs and the rest are alright but I don't think this one knows how to handle me at any time and I sure wouldnt [wouldn't] want to go across with him leading us.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: On a whole the army isn't so bad after you get used to it some. But I believe from a personal standpoint that I could do a lot better job in the air corp. The placing of men in their proper place seems to be one of the Armies short comings. If a man is doing what he likes to do as much as possible he will always turn out a better job for his employers.
S64.Q97.Full: On a whole the army isn't so bad after you get used to it some. But I believe from a personal standpoint that I could do a lot better job in the air corp. The placing of men in their proper place seems to be one of the Armies short comings. If a man is doing what he likes to do as much as possible he will always turn out a better job for his employers.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: In my opinion in this QMCo they are just trying to see how much a soldier can stand not teaching him to fight & too little time off for sleep we are as tired as if we had been threw a war. The officers are to young and all they do is back each other loosing a lot of time getting anything done. After all the training we have had they are giving in a break 5 days at home when we are
S64.Q97.C_1: All nerves wrecks neaver any fun in this camp just work of course I kno that we aren't here for a vacation but hard work doesn't hurt any one if he can see that he is getting some thing done Also I would be a lot better soldier if I could be at a post nearer home and see my wife & son once in a while to know that they are getting along alright. That way it would be a lot better can't see why they send us down here when there are so many camps near home. Also should be treated like men not animals. [paragraph]
S64.Q97.Full: In my opinion in this QMCo they are just trying to see how much a soldier can stand not teaching him to fight & too little time off for sleep we are as tired as if we had been threw a war. The officers are to young and all they do is back each other loosing a lot of time getting anything done. After all the training we have had they are giving in a break 5 days at home when we are All nerves wrecks neaver any fun in this camp just work of course I kno that we aren't here for a vacation but hard work doesn't hurt any one if he can see that he is getting some thing done Also I would be a lot better soldier if I could be at a post nearer home and see my wife & son once in a while to know that they are getting along alright. That way it would be a lot better can't see why they send us down here when there are so many camps near home. Also should be treated like men not animals. [paragraph]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I came into the army willingly in fact. Tried to enlist and was turned down. Have physical defect and am not given medical aid as I should get - had great feeling for the army but losing moral [morale]
S64.Q97.Full: I came into the army willingly in fact. Tried to enlist and was turned down. Have physical defect and am not given medical aid as I should get - had great feeling for the army but losing moral [morale]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: would suggest we have more leadership in officers and non coms and no man be kept in the states more than one year
S64.Q97.Full: would suggest we have more leadership in officers and non coms and no man be kept in the states more than one year

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I would like to know why the Doctors won't tell you what is wrong with you. They give some answer a soldier can't even understand. Why should soldier have to pay for articals that are lost in laundry. The food is not so good.
S64.Q97.Full: I would like to know why the Doctors won't tell you what is wrong with you. They give some answer a soldier can't even understand. Why should soldier have to pay for articals that are lost in laundry. The food is not so good.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Take up too much time displaying equipment and inspections.
S64.Q97.Full: Take up too much time displaying equipment and inspections.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think the army should pay more attention to its men. Such as trying to get into the A/C school.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the army should pay more attention to its men. Such as trying to get into the A/C school.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Soldiers are kept too long in camps in the states. Many of them would like to go overseas. Volunteering for overseas should be given more consideration.
S64.Q97.Full: Soldiers are kept too long in camps in the states. Many of them would like to go overseas. Volunteering for overseas should be given more consideration.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think that a man married 12 years or over could be sent nearer home so that he wouldn't have to be worrying over them because they could be there if they was needed and a man that is used to colder climate could do better training and have least to worry about and when a man works hard for 5 or 6
S64.Q97.C_1: months and is so far from home then he only get 5 days to be at home on his furlough. And the hours here are really too long when some of the Comdr can't keep their work that they give to you. I am 31 years old lived with my wife going on 13 years I think my place is at home in a war plant working as I had 3 years in the National Guard.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that a man married 12 years or over could be sent nearer home so that he wouldn't have to be worrying over them because they could be there if they was needed and a man that is used to colder climate could do better training and have least to worry about and when a man works hard for 5 or 6 months and is so far from home then he only get 5 days to be at home on his furlough. And the hours here are really too long when some of the Comdr can't keep their work that they give to you. I am 31 years old lived with my wife going on 13 years I think my place is at home in a war plant working as I had 3 years in the National Guard.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I know I would be better as a war worker on account of my condition. My condition is my right eye is gone for good, my left eye is not to [too] good, and I have bad nerves so I don't see why they keep me with the army or transfer me to something else [unclear] easier [/unclear] or get transfered near home as long as I am not sure of going across. Why is it that the family [unclear] [/unclear] do nothing for you and the Army (why).
S64.Q97.C_1: another thing is about the furlows. [furloughs] I am getting a furlow this week in Aug 1943 am getting only five days. Why can't I get ten or twelve days at home. [paragraph] If a soldier could see his folks once in a while he would have better ([underline] moral [/underline] ) (I am sure).
S64.Q97.Full: I know I would be better as a war worker on account of my condition.
