My condition is my right eye is gone for good, my left eye is not to [too] good, and I have bad nerves so I don't see why they keep me with the army or transfer me to something else [unclear] easier [/unclear] or get transfered near home as long as I am not sure of going across. Why is it that the family [unclear] [/unclear] do nothing for you and the Army (why). another thing is about the furlows. [furloughs] I am getting a furlow this week in Aug 1943 am getting only five days. Why can't I get ten or twelve days at home. [paragraph] If a soldier could see his folks once in a while he would have better ([underline] moral [/underline] ) (I am sure).

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: This company is commanded very poorly. There isn't any cooperation between the soldiers. Officers and non-coms don't care about their men. When non-coms were chosen the officers used their feelings and partialities toward certain men instead of choosing them as to their military ability. The job I do now isn't exactly necessary. I was a good repair man in
S64.Q97.C_1: civilian life. I learn my trade from my father in our own garage and all I do in the army is check to see if bolts and nuts are tight and no repair work at all. We are worked day and night. Training and checking trucks and not given enough time to rest. The mechanics I work with are always half sick & drowsy from fatigue. I don't think it's right to take men away from home and not give them a furlough. I have been away for 4 months and didn't get home yet. This it the first time I was ever away from home and I think I should bet a furlough. This outfit is a drunkards outfit and none of the men care about anything that happens or they won't cooperate. I wanted to go to school in the army for mechanical training or O.C.S. but I'm not popular with the officers so I don't get a decent break. There is too much partiality shown and politics in the army.
S64.Q97.Full: This company is commanded very poorly. There isn't any cooperation between the soldiers. Officers and non-coms don't care about their men. When non-coms were chosen the officers used their feelings and partialities toward certain men instead of choosing them as to their military ability. The job I do now isn't exactly necessary. I was a good repair man in civilian life. I learn my trade from my father in our own garage and all I do in the army is check to see if bolts and nuts are tight and no repair work at all. We are worked day and night. Training and checking trucks and not given enough time to rest. The mechanics I work with are always half sick & drowsy from fatigue. I don't think it's right to take men away from home and not give them a furlough. I have been away for 4 months and didn't get home yet. This it the first time I was ever away from home and I think I should bet a furlough. This outfit is a drunkards outfit and none of the men care about anything that happens or they won't cooperate. I wanted to go to school in the army for mechanical training or O.C.S. but I'm not popular with the officers so I don't get a decent break. There is too much partiality shown and politics in the army.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I have asked for a pass twice to go home, a three day pass in Feb. 1943 I was turned down on one to home and file my income tax and could not get it, then got them, I asked for a week end pass when I was asking. Some fellows could get drunk and get it [unclear] [/unclear] passes like nothing it was easy for them some could
S64.Q97.C_1: start fights in barracks [unclear] [/unclear] rooms or nothing done about it.
S64.Q97.Full: I have asked for a pass twice to go home, a three day pass in Feb. 1943 I was turned down on one to home and file my income tax and could not get it, then got them, I asked for a week end pass when I was asking. Some fellows could get drunk and get it [unclear] [/unclear] passes like nothing it was easy for them some could start fights in barracks [unclear] [/unclear] rooms or nothing done about it.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I'm a married man why couldn't of I had more time to see my wife & child. I been in the army for nearly a year & only had five days off on furlough & its tough being close & can't see them only once a year.
S64.Q97.Full: I'm a married man why couldn't of I had more time to see my wife & child. I been in the army for nearly a year & only had five days off on furlough & its tough being close & can't see them only once a year.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think anyone in a school and capable of completing the course should be allowed to complete the course before being eliminated and sent to another and where he is not specially needed. After completing one school he should be put out on the line to see if he is
S64.Q97.C_1: capable of doing that job before being sent to another
S64.Q97.Full: I think anyone in a school and capable of completing the course should be allowed to complete the course before being eliminated and sent to another and where he is not specially needed. After completing one school he should be put out on the line to see if he is  capable of doing that job before being sent to another

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: On this particular post + most air corps fields that I've been on they seem to have no order or system + they concentrate on petty things instead of the more vital ones. Our food is none to good + the morale of the men is low. The shift we work is poor + we have to sleep 3 or [unclear] so [/unclear] hrs in the daylight (evening) + thats hard for some men to do. Due to the shift hours the men have very little if any time off during the week. Our classes are long + very monotonous. I believe shorter hours + more interesting methods of teaching should be installed. [paragraph] over
S64.Q97.C_1: I also believe that a man school be granted a furlough after completing any G.I. school, before joining his outfit & his moral would be alot better for that little trip home. Soldiers should be better taken care of as to laundry (the GI laundry is a disgrace to the service) & dry cleaning etc. Our clothes are dirtier when they come out of the post tailor shop than when they went in. Our primary purpose on this field is to learn the technical subjects we are taught in school. A man can't learn if he is continually [unclear] [/unclear] about meals restrictions & fair play. The first year I liked the army. Then I [unclear] [/unclear] on A/C & and washed out. That Pilot training background means nothing around here you are just another GI and that A/C's are any better soldiers but it seems to me that with that background we could be used better somewhere else.
S64.Q97.Full: On this particular post + most air corps fields that I've been on they seem to have no order or system + they concentrate on petty things instead of the more vital ones. Our food is none to good + the morale of the men is low. The shift we work is poor + we have to sleep 3 or [unclear] so [/unclear] hrs in the daylight (evening) + thats hard for some men to do. Due to the shift hours the men have very little if any time off during the week. Our classes are long + very monotonous. I believe shorter hours + more interesting methods of teaching should be installed. [paragraph] over  I also believe that a man school be granted a furlough after completing any G.I. school, before joining his outfit & his moral would be alot better for that little trip home. Soldiers should be better taken care of as to laundry (the GI laundry is a disgrace to the service) & dry cleaning etc. Our clothes are dirtier when they come out of the post tailor shop than when they went in. Our primary purpose on this field is to learn the technical subjects we are taught in school. A man can't learn if he is continually [unclear] [/unclear] about meals restrictions & fair play. The first year I liked the army. Then I [unclear] [/unclear] on A/C & and washed out. That Pilot training background means nothing around here you are just another GI and that A/C's are any better soldiers but it seems to me that with that background we could be used better somewhere else.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I believe a man in the armed forces should have a little more leisure time and at least a 3 day pass every two or three months. Another thing a furlough when he has the required no. of days that permit him to have a furlough. A little more time would add morale to us all.
S64.Q97.Full: I believe a man in the armed forces should have a little more leisure time and at least a 3 day pass every two or three months. Another thing a furlough when he has the required no. of days that permit him to have a furlough. A little more time would add morale to us all.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Army is a good clean and healthy live. It teaches you to be a man and to look out after yourself.
S64.Q97.Full: Army is a good clean and healthy live. It teaches you to be a man and to look out after yourself.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: At this camp they have too much calisthenics in other places they have one day exercise the next day games. When playing games you are more fit for war duty than by taking calisthenics.
S64.Q97.Full: At this camp they have too much calisthenics in other places they have one day exercise the next day games. When playing games you are more fit for war duty than by taking calisthenics.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: People often listen to our complaints and do very little about it. I hope this isn't one of those. I don't see how it can help but be one though because it is next to impossible for the War Department to reach down and fix all the small things that the enlisted man calls "chicken shit". This tendency to be 'chicken' is especially prominent in the air corps
S64.Q97.C_1: They tell me that in the other branchs the officers and men operate more on an honor system. Here the check and double check on everything one says. You are a liar until proven otherwise. The air royal is especially tough on handing out furloughs. I will have been in nine months before I can even begin to hope for one.
S64.Q97.Full: People often listen to our complaints and do very little about it. I hope this isn't one of those. I don't see how it can help but be one though because it is next to impossible for the War Department to reach down and fix all the small things that the enlisted man calls "chicken shit". This tendency to be 'chicken' is especially prominent in the air corps They tell me that in the other branchs the officers and men operate more on an honor system. Here the check and double check on everything one says. You are a liar until proven otherwise. The air royal is especially tough on handing out furloughs. I will have been in nine months before I can even begin to hope for one.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: We have to fly 12 hours a day so why do we have to drill for an hour. Also [unclear] fowry Field [/unclear] is under very poor supervision. We need some rest as well as the officers. The 90 day wonders are very stupid.
S64.Q97.Full: We have to fly 12 hours a day so why do we have to drill for an hour. Also [unclear] fowry Field [/unclear] is under very poor supervision. We need some rest as well as the officers. The 90 day wonders are very stupid.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I believe if a soldier is given a leave from duty between Army school it would help him get thru the next school a lot easier. Too many schools will just tend to mix a soldier on what job he really must do the best. One or two schools are enough. If the classification centers would ask a soldier what he wants to do and can do best it would help end this war sooner.
S64.Q97.Full: I believe if a soldier is given a leave from duty between Army school it would help him get thru the next school a lot easier. Too many schools will just tend to mix a soldier on what job he really must do the best. One or two schools are enough. If the classification centers would ask a soldier what he wants to do and can do best it would help end this war sooner.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I was the one that stayed to home and allways worked for my folks, now they are alone on the farm which make's it hard for them. Becuase of hard to get help and they a getting old. But they are trying the best they can, as far as me I am doing allright in the army Like it good because I know its my duty.
S64.Q97.Full: I was the one that stayed to home and allways worked for my folks, now they are alone on the farm which make's it hard for them. Becuase of hard to get help and they a getting old. But they are trying the best they can, as far as me I am doing allright in the army Like it good because I know its my duty.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: The set up of personell in the Orderly rooms are terrible, the Non Coms the army pick for the Orderly Rooms and permanent party are a breed of them selfes I have found this true of every camp I have been stationed in why it is so has most of the soldiers puzzled the only answer is politics why the army dont streigten it out after a hundred and fifty years is a mystery they have a political set up of their own which is rotten.
S64.Q97.Full: The set up of personell in the Orderly rooms are terrible, the Non Coms the army pick for the Orderly Rooms and permanent party are a breed of them selfes I have found this true of every camp I have been stationed in why it is so has most of the soldiers puzzled the only answer is politics why the army dont streigten it out after a hundred and fifty years is a mystery they have a political set up of their own which is rotten.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I think sometimes the draft boards should consider the family a little more instead of worrying about quotas. Army cooks could spend a little more time trying to make food a little more edible. A mans status in civilian life should have more to do with his job in the army than
S64.Q97.C_1: ... it does at present. The attitudes of some officers toward enlisted men could be improved.
S64.Q97.Full: I think sometimes the draft boards should consider the family a little more instead of worrying about quotas. Army cooks could spend a little more time trying to make food a little more edible. A mans status in civilian life should have more to do with his job in the army than ... it does at present. The attitudes of some officers toward enlisted men could be improved.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I am an P.S. now going to school and it is hell to get up at three oclock and go to school. When we get out of school we have two hours drill and bed check at eight o clock. That gives us about four hours to do any thing we want to. if any bodys likes that I want to meat him. I though the army was O.K. as long as I was in my Sqd.
S64.Q97.C_1: But now I am not so [unclear] rare [/unclear] . I like the school I am going to O.K. but it is the hours we have to go that I don't like. Another thing I don't like we get our meals. We eat chow at 3:15 am the morning. Then it is twelve oclock be fore we get dinner. A fellow gets pretty hungerly [hungry] be fore he gets down there for dinner! It wouldn't be so bad if we always had plenty to eat at breakfast. There are times we get a half a pint of milk and a peace [piece] ore [or] to [two] of toast then it is [unclear] to da [/unclear] until dinner How do you think a man feels?

That gives us about four hours to do any thing we want to. if any bodys likes that I want to meat him. I though the army was O.K. as long as I was in my Sqd. But now I am not so [unclear] rare [/unclear] . I like the school I am going to O.K. but it is the hours we have to go that I don't like. Another thing I don't like we get our meals. We eat chow at 3:15 am the morning. Then it is twelve oclock be fore we get dinner. A fellow gets pretty hungerly [hungry] be fore he gets down there for dinner! It wouldn't be so bad if we always had plenty to eat at breakfast. There are times we get a half a pint of milk and a peace [piece] ore [or] to [two] of toast then it is [unclear] to da [/unclear] until dinner How do you think a man feels?

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: no furloughs after about 13 mos. of my life.
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I have been told that I would never be allowed to fly for the army of the U.S. as bombardier, pilot or navigator because I was flunked out of classification test center on an interview by a psychiatrist on a test called ARMD, The Air Corps is my whole life, to be a bombardier was my most precious desire the interview lasted 3 mins or so & nothing I said or done could have told the psychiatrist that I couldn't be a bombardier. I am 5ft. 10 in., perfect health
S64.Q97.C_1: never had any broken bones, nervous breakdowns or any family trouble. I never get sea sick or air sick + have flown many times. I like the Air Corps, but don't feel that I got a square chance to even try to rank a bombardier. I didn't even get to pre-flight school. Furthermore, they told me that my I.Q. tests were high, my coordination very good, but I'd never be allowed to fly for the U.S. Army. [paragraph] I want to know why the Hell some crack pot doctors can ruin a whole young fellows life by telling him this after he's only had a 3 min. talk. [paragraph] I know I can make just as good a bombardier + officer as the next man + furthermore some [unclear] Ret [/unclear] ought to be passed allowing the eliminees of A.R.M.A. to have another chance at the Aviation Cadets. I've got a perfect mind + eye sight + ought to be given a chance to try for bombardier. The man who'd behind the job [insertion] or [/insertion] [insertion] system [/insertion] [insertion] of [/insertion] washing out cadets on this A.R.M.A. ought to have his head examined, because most of the fellows washed out on this were from military families, good stock, well educated + had high marks + good qualifications. They were also of good physical standing. I do hope something comes out of this. I want to fly + even die if necessary as a bombardier.
S64.Q97.Full: I have been told that I would never be allowed to fly for the army of the U.S. as bombardier, pilot or navigator because I was flunked out of classification test center on an interview by a psychiatrist on a test called ARMD, The Air Corps is my whole life, to be a bombardier was my most precious desire the interview lasted 3 mins or so & nothing I said or done could have told the psychiatrist that I couldn't be a bombardier. I am 5ft. 10 in., perfect health  never had any broken bones, nervous breakdowns or any family trouble. I never get sea sick or air sick + have flown many times. I like the Air Corps, but don't feel that I got a square chance to even try to rank a bombardier. I didn't even get to pre-flight school. Furthermore, they told me that my I.Q. tests were high, my coordination very good, but I'd never be allowed to fly for the U.S. Army. [paragraph] I want to know why the Hell some crack pot doctors can ruin a whole young fellows life by telling him this after he's only had a 3 min. talk. [paragraph] I know I can make just as good a bombardier + officer as the next man + furthermore some [unclear] Ret [/unclear] ought to be passed allowing the eliminees of A.R.M.A. to have another chance at the Aviation Cadets. I've got a perfect mind + eye sight + ought to be given a chance to try for bombardier. The man who'd behind the job [insertion] or [/insertion] [insertion] system [/insertion] [insertion] of [/insertion] washing out cadets on this A.R.M.A. ought to have his head examined, because most of the fellows washed out on this were from military families, good stock, well educated + had high marks + good qualifications. They were also of good physical standing. I do hope something comes out of this. I want to fly + even die if necessary as a bombardier.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I would like to suggest that an investigation (confidential) be made into the social relation between the officer instructors and student nurses at the army air force school of Air Evacuation at Bowman Field Ky. A report that was very authentic stated conditions were disgusting and a respectable nurse had some official pressure put on her to
S64.Q97.C_1: agree to some condition degrading morally. In general some of the social offerings there are nothing more than social brawls. It should be a woman's or man's personal business how his affairs are conducted as long as their military duties are seen efficiently. And not a request or order from those in authority to anyone regarding social or personal affairs. Also I do not think it right to be ordered to take out National Service Life Insurance when civilian policies give ample coverage. As was the recent case.
S64.Q97.Full: I would like to suggest that an investigation (confidential) be made into the social relation between the officer instructors and student nurses at the army air force school of Air Evacuation at Bowman Field Ky. A report that was very authentic stated conditions were disgusting and a respectable nurse had some official pressure put on her to agree to some condition degrading morally. In general some of the social offerings there are nothing more than social brawls. It should be a woman's or man's personal business how his affairs are conducted as long as their military duties are seen efficiently. And not a request or order from those in authority to anyone regarding social or personal affairs. Also I do not think it right to be ordered to take out National Service Life Insurance when civilian policies give ample coverage. As was the recent case.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: I understood when I came here I would not be eligible for pass or furlough. I would like to know that when I finish here I would get a furlough.
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I feel that if the army were to treat the men more as thinking individuals than as a serial number the men would be much more inclined to do the jobs assigned to them. The policy of having men do something that seems to be the whim of the person in command leads a man to think he doesn't know enough to do a thing without being told. In cases
S64.Q97.C_1: where disagreeable jobs have to be done it would be better to give some reason for doing them rather than "by order of"
S64.Q97.Full: I feel that if the army were to treat the men more as thinking individuals than as a serial number the men would be much more inclined to do the jobs assigned to them. The policy of having men do something that seems to be the whim of the person in command leads a man to think he doesn't know enough to do a thing without being told. In cases where disagreeable jobs have to be done it would be better to give some reason for doing them rather than "by order of"

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M_marginalia: Option 2 shows erasure
S64.Q97.F: I know darn well enough, that if I was home working on the farm for me of my dad I would do much better for my country than I do here in the army. My dad has a 700 acre farm and no help what so ever.
S64.Q97.Full: I know darn well enough, that if I was home working on the farm for me of my dad I would do much better for my country than I do here in the army. My dad has a 700 acre farm and no help what so ever.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: N.A.M.
S64.Q97.F: I believe & feel that men in civilian life with war jobs who walk out on the job should be made work if refuse brought in the army & disciplined. [paragraph] Give them some idea what our fighting men are facing every day in combat zones. [paragraph] Also there should be a more reasonable consideration on men with dependents who are not
S64.Q97.C_1: able to help them selves. [paragraph] For instance people who have become dependents after their dependent came in the armed Services. [paragraph] All folks at home should not suffer from cold & hungry in this war if possible on account of a few Men at a time, being away from home.
S64.Q97.Full: I believe & feel that men in civilian life with war jobs who walk out on the job should be made work if refuse brought in the army & disciplined. [paragraph] Give them some idea what our fighting men are facing every day in combat zones. [paragraph] Also there should be a more reasonable consideration on men with dependents who are not able to help them selves. [paragraph] For instance people who have become dependents after their dependent came in the armed Services. [paragraph] All folks at home should not suffer from cold & hungry in this war if possible on account of a few Men at a time, being away from home.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: The Military Police, pay too much attention to the small things, and let the big ones go. Too many "stripe" happy nocoms and try to run everything in General. [paragraph] Never should keep the "colored" boys in the same camp as the "White boys! - [paragraph]
S64.Q97.C_1: The privates never get a "break" things should be on the level with everyone and treated a like. Too many men don't participate in everything. The army ships their men around too much. To many men have too far to go on furlough. "The "govt" spending is to great on unnessary things.
S64.Q97.Full: The Military Police, pay too much attention to the small things, and let the big ones go. Too many "stripe" happy nocoms and try to run everything in General. [paragraph] Never should keep the "colored" boys in the same camp as the "White boys! - [paragraph]  The privates never get a "break" things should be on the level with everyone and treated a like. Too many men don't participate in everything. The army ships their men around too much. To many men have too far to go on furlough. "The "govt" spending is to great on unnessary things.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M_marginalia: Father lost his business, but got a fair job in war plant.
S64.Q97.F: In lots of cases it seems that there is too damn much red tape connected with the army. May be unavoidable tho, I don't know. (Example is the old Cl "A" Pay Reservation. Where are our bands?) Chow is pretty fair, but it seems that in a lot of cases, mess personnel is incompetent. Location of some camps is unhealthful, & also bad on morale. Some local "ground rules" , or post re-
S64.Q97.C_1: questions seem unnecessary or superfluous. [paragraph] At end of the war, we should [underline] not [/underline] hold a grudge against Germany or Japan. We're [underline] supposed [/underline] to be a Christian nation, but we sure don't show it at times. We should help all nations to get on their feet after the war. Be firm with them, but don't try to get revenge on them. There should be a world union of some sort established with a police power with enough authority to keep all nations in line. Membership should be compulsory, by all nations. I feel tho, that it will end up much the same as last time, unless the people get out of the idea of "an eye for an eye", etc. [space] Finis
S64.Q97.Full: In lots of cases it seems that there is too damn much red tape connected with the army. May be unavoidable tho, I don't know. (Example is the old Cl "A" Pay Reservation. Where are our bands?) Chow is pretty fair, but it seems that in a lot of cases, mess personnel is incompetent. Location of some camps is unhealthful, & also bad on morale. Some local "ground rules" , or post re- questions seem unnecessary or superfluous. [paragraph] At end of the war, we should [underline] not [/underline] hold a grudge against Germany or Japan. We're [underline] supposed [/underline] to be a Christian nation, but we sure don't show it at times. We should help all nations to get on their feet after the war. Be firm with them, but don't try to get revenge on them. There should be a world union of some sort established with a police power with enough authority to keep all nations in line. Membership should be compulsory, by all nations. I feel tho, that it will end up much the same as last time, unless the people get out of the idea of "an eye for an eye", etc. [space] Finis

S64.Q97.F: often men go on sick call repeatedly especially on Sundays or their days off. I think the Med. Officers should look into their case more thoroughly. [paragraph] Mess Sergeants and Student Cooks should be stopped from [unclear] cussing [/unclear] at the K.P.s. [paragraph]
S64.Q97.C_1: If a man gets a rating it should be stated why. [paragraph] Every Non-Com should be made to take a test or quiz periodically to prove he is capable of being a Non-Com.

[paragraph] Every Non-Com should be made to take a test or quiz periodically to prove he is capable of being a Non-Com.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I think as far as it is run there isn't enough attention paid to the way things at home are run. A man doesn't win the whole war with men if he doesn't have enough help at tome to produce. There are to many soldiers & not enough men left home. I think if women are to be in the army put them in the medical dept. and put men in actual duties women are half doing. I don't think we
S64.Q97.C_1: have had enough actual training in the work we do.
S64.Q97.Full: I think as far as it is run there isn't enough attention paid to the way things at home are run. A man doesn't win the whole war with men if he doesn't have enough help at tome to produce. There are to many soldiers & not enough men left home. I think if women are to be in the army put them in the medical dept. and put men in actual duties women are half doing. I don't think we have had enough actual training in the work we do.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Well I came into the army on my own free will after being promised the ground crew of the Air Force but did not get it. That part of the service is the only part were I know I could ever make good in. And do not think it was fair that I should not get it after coming in the army in my own free will. I know it would be a lot better for
S64.Q97.C_1: my country as well as my self if I am placed there.
S64.Q97.Full: Well I came into the army on my own free will after being promised the ground crew of the Air Force but did not get it. That part of the service is the only part were I know I could ever make good in. And do not think it was fair that I should not get it after coming in the army in my own free will. I know it would be a lot better for  my country as well as my self if I am placed there.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I think more rigid tests should be giving in the selection of non-com and O.C.S. candidates, also the food at various camps should be looked into and above all special consideration should be given to the illiteretes in the army as there are many. [paragraph] I think too that something should be done about the sex problems of the army and there are many, after all.
S64.Q97.C_1: a soldier is human and should have some form of outlet for his passion where he doesn't have to worry about disease. As to a bonus after the war action should be started now as it might be an added incentive to our fighting men.
S64.Q97.Full: I think more rigid tests should be giving in the selection of non-com and O.C.S. candidates, also the food at various camps should be looked into and above all special consideration should be given to the illiteretes in the army as there are many. [paragraph] I think too that something should be done about the sex problems of the army and there are many, after all. a soldier is human and should have some form of outlet for his passion where he doesn't have to worry about disease. As to a bonus after the war action should be started now as it might be an added incentive to our fighting men.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: It seems to me most of the Officers in the Medial Corps are Jews. Naturally if their is a Jew E.M. they seem to give them the breaks. Thats the only thing I have against the Medical Corps of the Army. [paragraph] As far as food and clothing I have no complaints. I feel like a soldier should be entitled to a bonus after this whole thing.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: 97. If you have any further remarks you would like to make on any subject please write them below as fully as you like. I wasn't cut out to be a Medical Soldier and I don't think any farm boy has enough education for it and beside it is to much in door work for a farm boy. They ought to give him a job in the army that he is suited for such as Marcanicial([Mechanical] ) work as some
S64.Q97.C_1: Motorizes units. I am a farm boy and I think most farm boys feel the same way I do. Sincerely yours
S64.Q97.Full: 97. If you have any further remarks you would like to make on any subject please write them below as fully as you like. I wasn't cut out to be a Medical Soldier and I don't think any farm boy has enough education for it and beside it is to much in door work for a farm boy. They ought to give him a job in the army that he is suited for such as Marcanicial([Mechanical] ) work as some Motorizes units. I am a farm boy and I think most farm boys feel the same way I do. Sincerely yours

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I have been in the army 11 month and had 1 furlough and some had two so I think I am not getting my share of furloughs. I had 1 year of hospital training and some had none and get a better charge than me. [paragraph]
S64.Q97.Full: I have been in the army 11 month and had 1 furlough and some had two so I think I am not getting my share of furloughs. I had 1 year of hospital training and some had none and get a better charge than me. [paragraph]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I don't see why the Medical Dept makes men that are working in hospitals on this side drill when they have important work to do in the hospital. [paragraph] Why don't the army compel all the officers of a unit as well as the men to drill & march & exercise in preparation for oversea duty.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't see why the Medical Dept makes men that are working in hospitals on this side drill when they have important work to do in the hospital. [paragraph] Why don't the army compel all the officers of a unit as well as the men to drill & march & exercise in preparation for oversea duty.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Well the Army is O.K. but I don't get any breaks, or chances to show my work. My folks back home all need of money I think it worse since I came to the Army. I don't, know, I would rather be in California my home state. The Air Corp is the best outfit We are always on the ball--that is all
S64.Q97.Full: Well the Army is O.K. but I don't get any breaks, or chances to show my work. My folks back home all need of money I think it worse since I came to the Army. I don't, know, I would rather be in California my home state. The Air Corp is the best outfit We are always on the ball--that is all

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I would liek to say that the boys who live near their homes and can go home over the week ends seem not to mind being away from home fora few days because every weekend they can go home. They take a real interest in what they are learning. As for myself I'm sure I could take a
S64.Q97.C_1: better interest in what we are learning if I could go home every weekend. But during most lectures my mind wonders off, and the first thing I know I'm thinking about home instead of the lesson that's being taught.
S64.Q97.Full: I would liek to say that the boys who live near their homes and can go home over the week ends seem not to mind being away from home fora few days because every weekend they can go home. They take a real interest in what they are learning. As for myself I'm sure I could take a better interest in what we are learning if I could go home every weekend. But during most lectures my mind wonders off, and the first thing I know I'm thinking about home instead of the lesson that's being taught.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: On the whole I am pretty well satisfied with Army life and take pride in trying to be a good soldier.
S64.Q97.Full: On the whole I am pretty well satisfied with Army life and take pride in trying to be a good soldier.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I believe we should have more sports in the army I mean in some way have contests in our spare time so as to keep the morale of the boys in the army away from home for very often boys have a habit of thinking of home when they're alone, but this way they can have something to occupy their sparetime.
S64.Q97.Full: I believe we should have more sports in the army I mean in some way have contests in our spare time so as to keep the morale of the boys in the army away from home for very often boys have a habit of thinking of home when they're alone, but this way they can have something to occupy their sparetime.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I would like to be closer to home where I could see my wife and baby once in a while. Why do they send men from California to the east coast, and the mean from the east to the west coast. Why [insertion] "Why" is underlined [/insertion] get them as far away from home as possible.
S64.Q97.Full: I would like to be closer to home where I could see my wife and baby once in a while. Why do they send men from California to the east coast, and the mean from the east to the west coast. Why [insertion] "Why" is underlined [/insertion] get them as far away from home as possible.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I think men who volunteered or who were drafted before Dec. 7, 1941, should be the first ones to be released from the army after the peace terms have been made, that is if it is at all possible. There should be a rule made regardless of how many times one is transferred, he should be entitled to a furlough every 6 months. That is if he has a good clean record. (I've had 27 days in 29 months) one 15 day furlough  " 12 " "
S64.Q97.C_1: I think they could discontinue the drafting of men over 25 who are married, in fact I think the Army is large enough now. They should have compulsory military training for one year when all men reach the age of 18. I mean after the war is over. [paragraph] I believe I'll be home for good by Xmas 1944.
S64.Q97.Full: I think men who volunteered or who were drafted before Dec. 7, 1941, should be the first ones to be released from the army after the peace terms have been made, that is if it is at all possible. There should be a rule made regardless of how many times one is transferred, he should be entitled to a furlough every 6 months. That is if he has a good clean record. (I've had 27 days in 29 months) one 15 day furlough  " 12 " " I think they could discontinue the drafting of men over 25 who are married, in fact I think the Army is large enough now. They should have compulsory military training for one year when all men reach the age of 18. I mean after the war is over. [paragraph] I believe I'll be home for good by Xmas 1944.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Where he couldn't go - by asking the Company Commander or in case of broke down car - not making connection by bus, I wouldn't say that wasnt serious. But to go AWOL under any conditions otherwise would be plenty serious.
S64.Q97.Full: Where he couldn't go - by asking the Company Commander or in case of broke down car - not making connection by bus, I wouldn't say that wasnt serious. But to go AWOL under any conditions otherwise would be plenty serious.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: they buy them from the officers & 1st Sgt [Sergeant] a lot of times.
S64.Q96.M_marginalia: It has put more work on my folks that I was doing.
S64.Q97.F: Some of the officers & nocoms [noncoms] are very poor. But still you have to take there [their] orders, right or wrong. Some officers hold personal grudge against some men.
S64.Q97.Full: Some of the officers & nocoms [noncoms] are very poor. But still you have to take there [their] orders, right or wrong. Some officers hold personal grudge against some men.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: According to the rest of the boys. [written in the space to the right of answer 6]
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: They can abolish too damn much callesthenics, anytime. We do our hour of it every morning for a while, then quit for awhile. I think it should be more consistent - say 15 minutes a day - all the time. [paragraph] I think if a man can do more at home, they should let him out to do that work - as long as he does it. [paragraph] A lot of people in war plants get
S64.Q97.C_1: by too easily and are coddled. I think a soldier has just as much right to be coddled as anybody and a hell of a lot more than some bird that just 8 hours a day keeps awake. [paragraph]
S64.Q97.Full: They can abolish too damn much callesthenics, anytime. We do our hour of it every morning for a while, then quit for awhile. I think it should be more consistent - say 15 minutes a day - all the time. [paragraph] I think if a man can do more at home, they should let him out to do that work - as long as he does it. [paragraph] A lot of people in war plants get by too easily and are coddled. I think a soldier has just as much right to be coddled as anybody and a hell of a lot more than some bird that just 8 hours a day keeps awake. [paragraph]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I think any Army personal with physical ailment would rather be in civilian life doing some job for there country in preferance to Army life. And a lot of Army personel would like to get part time jobs if given a chance.
S64.Q97.Full: I think any Army personal with physical ailment would rather be in civilian life doing some job for there country in preferance to Army life. And a lot of Army personel would like to get part time jobs if given a chance.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I dont think the Army should conduct exercises before Breakfast at any time they should be given either the middle of the morning or after noon. Our troop does 45 minutes exercise before breakfast whitch is to much & also against Army regulations.
S64.Q97.Full: I dont think the Army should conduct exercises before Breakfast at any time they should be given either the middle of the morning or after noon. Our troop does 45 minutes exercise before breakfast whitch is to much & also against Army regulations.

S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I would like to get on Give charge from the army so I cold go home and go to worke and pay [deletion] for [/deletion] the det we are in [paragraph]
S64.Q97.Full: I would like to get on Give charge from the army so I cold go home and go to worke and pay [deletion] for [/deletion] the det we are in [paragraph]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: One major fault with the army is the type of officers in command In civilian life most of the National Guard men were in the organisation for the dollar or two a month that they could get on Vax - is most were the
S64.Q97.C_1: insignificant, poor class of society -- these conditions brought on a inferiority complex. Later when guard units were mobilized these men find themselves in authority over men whom they envied in civilian life -- In order to overcome this inferiority complex of theirs, this temporary authority is abused in an effort to counteract their true complex -- Naturally this brings about dissension and ill feeling -- -- My personal gripe is about wearing woolen O.D. clothing especially in the summer I'm sure that 9/10 of the men want cotton O.D. all the time regardless of climate and would take more interest in army life which would bring about better soldiers.
S64.Q97.Full: One major fault with the army is the type of officers in command In civilian life most of the National Guard men were in the organisation for the dollar or two a month that they could get on Vax - is most were the  insignificant, poor class of society -- these conditions brought on a inferiority complex. Later when guard units were mobilized these men find themselves in authority over men whom they envied in civilian life -- In order to overcome this inferiority complex of theirs, this temporary authority is abused in an effort to counteract their true complex -- Naturally this brings about dissension and ill feeling -- -- My personal gripe is about wearing woolen O.D. clothing especially in the summer I'm sure that 9/10 of the men want cotton O.D. all the time regardless of climate and would take more interest in army life which would bring about better soldiers.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think I can do more on the outside because if a soldier doesn't eat he can not work of fight. The food has to come from the farm & that is what I lived on all my life, so therefore I feel I can do more back on the farm then I can in the army. We have all the equipment need and good land, but help is to where you can't get it unless you give half your crop to pay the labor. They
S64.Q97.C_1: need more labor on the farm now[unclear] [/unclear] what they have. Farming in my view point is just as essential in War [unclear] work [/unclear] as any of the rest.
S64.Q97.Full: I think I can do more on the outside because if a soldier doesn't eat he can not work of fight. The food has to come from the farm & that is what I lived on all my life, so therefore I feel I can do more back on the farm then I can in the army. We have all the equipment need and good land, but help is to where you can't get it unless you give half your crop to pay the labor. They need more labor on the farm now[unclear] [/unclear] what they have. Farming in my view point is just as essential in War [unclear] work [/unclear] as any of the rest.

S64.Q97.F: 91-B. it varies some to much some to little

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I think that the men should be better classified & put where they belong & that there are a lot of men in the army that should never have been in. They should have had a better examination before entering.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that the men should be better classified & put where they belong & that there are a lot of men in the army that should never have been in. They should have had a better examination before entering.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: I have had no furlough coming yet.
S64.Q97.F: We have a very nice camp and all here but I see no reason for having men lying about when we could just as well be in the fight doing some good. There are men here who have been in for two three years and all we do is lie around. If that is all we need men for why not let most of them go home. I see no reason for drafting more men
S64.Q97.C_1: when we don't use them. So how about shoving some of us over and let us do something worth while! They say we are here to gaurd the West coast, well can't you put new men in here and let the do that as they train. One year of training is plenty. So don't blame us if we go AWOL.
S64.Q97.Full: We have a very nice camp and all here but I see no reason for having men lying about when we could just as well be in the fight doing some good. There are men here who have been in for two three years and all we do is lie around. If that is all we need men for why not let most of them go home. I see no reason for drafting more men  when we don't use them. So how about shoving some of us over and let us do something worth while! They say we are here to gaurd the West coast, well can't you put new men in here and let the do that as they train. One year of training is plenty. So don't blame us if we go AWOL.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: The First Sarg [Sergeant] is to [too] damn smart and thinks that he can run the whole army [deletion] he will get a big surprise [/deletion]
S64.Q97.Full: The First Sarg [Sergeant] is to [too] damn smart and thinks that he can run the whole army [deletion] he will get a big surprise [/deletion]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: The First Sargent thinks he is to smart, has to much authority is to hard on the men, has no sense humor, does not look at his mens side of the story.
S64.Q97.Full: The First Sargent thinks he is to smart, has to much authority is to hard on the men, has no sense humor, does not look at his mens side of the story.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I think that the officers are very unfair. They give stripes to men who do not deserve them. We have some fellows in our outfit who are a lot better soldiers than the ones who are getting stripes. There is too much favoritism. Some of the fellows get away with everything (the ones that get the stripes) but the rest of us get gigged for every little thing. Don't get me wrong on the subject, I know I am a private, but I think I know a lot more about
S64.Q97.C_1: the army than some of these [underline] pet [/underline] non-coms [non-commissioned officers] do when an officer don't like a guy. The poor fellow never gets a chance to show what he's got. I think that the army sure does a poor job of picking officers.[paragraph] I am in the engineers and I do not like the outfit. I have tried to get a transfer but "no soap." I think they should put a fellow in the branch of service he is best suited for. I know I am not suited for this job.[paragraph] We do not have enough time for recreation. We do not have the equipment for recreation. In a "whole" I think the army is run very poorly.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that the officers are very unfair. They give stripes to men who do not deserve them. We have some fellows in our outfit who are a lot better soldiers than the ones who are getting stripes. There is too much favoritism. Some of the fellows get away with everything (the ones that get the stripes) but the rest of us get gigged for every little thing. Don't get me wrong on the subject, I know I am a private, but I think I know a lot more about the army than some of these [underline] pet [/underline] non-coms [non-commissioned officers] do when an officer don't like a guy. The poor fellow never gets a chance to show what he's got. I think that the army sure does a poor job of picking officers.[paragraph] I am in the engineers and I do not like the outfit. I have tried to get a transfer but "no soap." I think they should put a fellow in the branch of service he is best suited for. I know I am not suited for this job.[paragraph] We do not have enough time for recreation. We do not have the equipment for recreation. In a "whole" I think the army is run very poorly.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I do think that the army should have better food and more of it. And also more dances and sports in the camps so that the boys will not be so home sick while they are in camp.
S64.Q97.Full: I do think that the army should have better food and more of it. And also more dances and sports in the camps so that the boys will not be so home sick while they are in camp.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: One great fault of the army is that men aren't placed where they would do the army more good. The officers aren't tough & can't take the rough going. Non-coms aren't picked properly. It seems that non-coms are made according to the way they kiss ass & that ability isn't even considered. Good men are at times never
S64.Q97.C_1: given an opportunity to show how good they are because they just don't hand shake. [paragraph] Many officers know way less than the non-coms & I can't understand why the non-coms aren't the officers instead. [paragraph] Education still seems to be the best reason for attending O. [Officer] C. [Candidate] S. [School] & I'll disagree, because although not a high school graduate I still have lots of good common sense & a lot better than my officers. [paragraph] The Jew are always getting the easiest jobs & always seem to find an easy way out of a combat outfits. [paragraph] Jews are killing morale in the army because of there easy way of getting out of work. [paragraph] Our chain of commands are never clear: & on maneuvers no one, including high ranking seem to know whats going on [paragraph] In other wards our army is still five years behind or enemies armies. We may lose the war if these things aren't taken care of immediately.
S64.Q97.Full: One great fault of the army is that men aren't placed where they would do the army more good. The officers aren't tough & can't take the rough going. Non-coms aren't picked properly. It seems that non-coms are made according to the way they kiss ass & that ability isn't even considered. Good men are at times never given an opportunity to show how good they are because they just don't hand shake. [paragraph] Many officers know way less than the non-coms & I can't understand why the non-coms aren't the officers instead. [paragraph] Education still seems to be the best reason for attending O. [Officer] C. [Candidate] S. [School] & I'll disagree, because although not a high school graduate I still have lots of good common sense & a lot better than my officers. [paragraph] The Jew are always getting the easiest jobs & always seem to find an easy way out of a combat outfits. [paragraph] Jews are killing morale in the army because of there easy way of getting out of work. [paragraph] Our chain of commands are never clear: & on maneuvers no one, including high ranking seem to know whats going on [paragraph] In other wards our army is still five years behind or enemies armies. We may lose the war if these things aren't taken care of immediately.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I look up to the army and which it stands for, but I can't see the sense in taking men 18 & 19, just out of school & putting them in the army. I think we could do much more good at home, working in war jobs. I also can't see the sense in sending a person ...
S64.Q97.C_1: so far from his home, that it is impossible for anyone to see him, or him see them unless he gets a 20 day furlough. There are lots of camps closer home where you could go see your Dad and mom on weekends. I also believe in a furlough system that is divided [unclear] [/unclear] evenly & not one guy get one in 3 months and not then [unclear] [/unclear] a year.
S64.Q97.Full: I look up to the army and which it stands for, but I can't see the sense in taking men 18 & 19, just out of school & putting them in the army. I think we could do much more good at home, working in war jobs. I also can't see the sense in sending a person ... so far from his home, that it is impossible for anyone to see him, or him see them unless he gets a 20 day furlough. There are lots of camps closer home where you could go see your Dad and mom on weekends. I also believe in a furlough system that is divided [unclear] [/unclear] evenly & not one guy get one in 3 months and not then [unclear] [/unclear] a year.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: 1. We back here in Camp Don't get much chow and some of it is not so good
S64.Q97.Full: 1. We back here in Camp Don't get much chow and some of it is not so good

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think men who go on maneuvers should be given a furlough of 15 days plus traveling time. Traveling time should be given because many boys have to go from one end of our country to the other.
S64.Q97.Full: I think men who go on maneuvers should be given a furlough of 15 days plus traveling time. Traveling time should be given because many boys have to go from one end of our country to the other.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Am going to school. Have to get up 3:15 am the morning. Find it pretty hard and sleep best just about that time. Also have to make bedcheck at 8:00. Bad for I can't sleep till about 10:00 or 11:00 7 hours of school I think are too much for one day. Also I think I would put more heart to my Drill & P.T. if it were cut in half. I think a half hour of each [paragraph]
S64.Q97.C_1: is enough. had enough of Drill & PT on basic Tr. all one would need after Basic Tr is enough to keep him. I think if possible one should be sent to a camp nearest his home. would be able to see his folks more often. This I am once would keep him happier & so would try much harder in his work as a soldier.
S64.Q97.Full: Am going to school. Have to get up 3:15 am the morning. Find it pretty hard and sleep best just about that time. Also have to make bedcheck at 8:00. Bad for I can't sleep till about 10:00 or 11:00 7 hours of school I think are too much for one day. Also I think I would put more heart to my Drill & P.T. if it were cut in half. I think a half hour of each [paragraph]  is enough. had enough of Drill & PT on basic Tr. all one would need after Basic Tr is enough to keep him. I think if possible one should be sent to a camp nearest his home. would be able to see his folks more often. This I am once would keep him happier & so would try much harder in his work as a soldier.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: The officers are too young and not enough experience in the army. [paragraph] The food could be better. [paragraph] The equipment we get is not in very good shape and we don't get enough of it to do the work we have to do. [paragraph] They take too much of our time for things that could be done on the Army time.
S64.Q97.Full: The officers are too young and not enough experience in the army. [paragraph] The food could be better. [paragraph] The equipment we get is not in very good shape and we don't get enough of it to do the work we have to do. [paragraph] They take too much of our time for things that could be done on the Army time.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I believe the army could use more bands. I only know of 1 that's in our group and its in a different camp. What chance have we here, who would like to stay in this outfit, but else play in a band.
S64.Q97.Full: I believe the army could use more bands. I only know of 1 that's in our group and its in a different camp. What chance have we here, who would like to stay in this outfit, but else play in a band.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: [marked up to read, "No, I have not had [deletion] my fair share of [/deletion] either a furloughs or a passes"]
S64.Q97.F: It is rumored that all Class "A" passes are to be taken up for the field. [paragraph] This would not aid the war effort. The soldiers here are assigned duties which they are preforming fully under the present set-up. 85-90% are local boys. It would demoralize + work unnecessary hardships on many families which
S64.Q97.C_1: may be enjoying their last days together.
S64.Q97.Full: It is rumored that all Class "A" passes are to be taken up for the field. [paragraph] This would not aid the war effort. The soldiers here are assigned duties which they are preforming fully under the present set-up. 85-90% are local boys. It would demoralize + work unnecessary hardships on many families which  may be enjoying their last days together.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I would like to see more men work for the good of the group than for just themselves. Even though the grade of Sgt. does not afford me rations & quarters I thank goodness my Class "A" pass permits me to see my wife when I'm off duty. I think its the duty of every prospective father
S64.Q97.C_1: to give his wife all the assistance he can. If this privilege were taken away now, I think it would have a definite effect on my morale and of those persons in the same condition. I also think that if such a privilege is taken away from one soldier it should be taken away from all, not just certain ones or grades. Commissioned officers have a right to feel they are a part of the army too and they should be included in its activities.
S64.Q97.Full: I would like to see more men work for the good of the group than for just themselves. Even though the grade of Sgt. does not afford me rations & quarters I thank goodness my Class "A" pass permits me to see my wife when I'm off duty. I think its the duty of every prospective father to give his wife all the assistance he can. If this privilege were taken away now, I think it would have a definite effect on my morale and of those persons in the same condition. I also think that if such a privilege is taken away from one soldier it should be taken away from all, not just certain ones or grades. Commissioned officers have a right to feel they are a part of the army too and they should be included in its activities.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: At this post there is talk of our Class "A" passes, which entitle us to be away from the past when actually off duty, being taken away from us. This seems unjust. Many of us have our wives and families here and it seems unfair to keep us from being with them while we can. Our families mean as much to of us as the officers. Will they be required to remain on the post and get to see their wives only one night a week? This is not probable. If we are sent to some place where
S64.Q97.C_1: it will be impossible to be near our people we will become accustomed to it. But, under these conditions our morale will only be lowered 100% if they are taken up.[paragraph] There is a saying that the Army places men where they are best fitted. That is a joke. We have men that have been 1st class machinists for 18 to 20 years. They are now to taught to cook. Is that proper placement? This is just one example. Hundreds of others could be cited in this command alone.[paragraph] At this point it is [underline] who you [/underline] know and not [underline] what you [/underline] know that gets ratings. We have non-coms [non-commissioned officers] in our outfit that made as low as 76 ob=n their AGC [Army General Classification] test. Others that made 123-127 etc are still Pvts [Privates] after 10 to 12 mo [months] in the service.[paragraph] The army would drive an efficiency expert crazy in 2 hours time!
S64.Q97.Full: At this post there is talk of our Class "A" passes, which entitle us to be away from the past when actually off duty, being taken away from us. This seems unjust. Many of us have our wives and families here and it seems unfair to keep us from being with them while we can. Our families mean as much to of us as the officers. Will they be required to remain on the post and get to see their wives only one night a week? This is not probable. If we are sent to some place where it will be impossible to be near our people we will become accustomed to it. But, under these conditions our morale will only be lowered 100% if they are taken up.[paragraph] There is a saying that the Army places men where they are best fitted. That is a joke. We have men that have been 1st class machinists for 18 to 20 years. They are now to taught to cook. Is that proper placement? This is just one example. Hundreds of others could be cited in this command alone.[paragraph] At this point it is [underline] who you [/underline] know and not [underline] what you [/underline] know that gets ratings. We have non-coms [non-commissioned officers] in our outfit that made as low as 76 ob=n their AGC [Army General Classification] test. Others that made 123-127 etc are still Pvts [Privates] after 10 to 12 mo [months] in the service.[paragraph] The army would drive an efficiency expert crazy in 2 hours time!

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: All in all, there is too much laxity in performance of assigned duties and discipline. Officers and non coms alike fail to enforce required disciplinary measures and to back up their junior officers and non-coms when they do try. When you have a lot of men to control and supervise, you have to do it or the job just doesn't
S64.Q97.C_1: ... get done. Too many officers and enlisted men alike are getting by on what the could do as a civilian and not what they can do for the army.
S64.Q97.Full: All in all, there is too much laxity in performance of assigned duties and discipline. Officers and non coms alike fail to enforce required disciplinary measures and to back up their junior officers and non-coms when they do try. When you have a lot of men to control and supervise, you have to do it or the job just doesn't  ... get done. Too many officers and enlisted men alike are getting by on what the could do as a civilian and not what they can do for the army.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page

S64.Q97.F: I think every dept [department] should have a trained man to investigate a means of promotions (a civilian) and cut out the favorite feelings some guys receive. Your work as a soldier should be realized as to your ability, interest, and dependability, instead of some guys getting a rating on the basis of pull from dept. heads and influential friends.
S64.Q97.C_1: We need a swimming pool here at [unclear] ???pton [/unclear] .
S64.Q97.Full: I think every dept [department] should have a trained man to investigate a means of promotions (a civilian) and cut out the favorite feelings some guys receive. Your work as a soldier should be realized as to your ability, interest, and dependability, instead of some guys getting a rating on the basis of pull from dept. heads and influential friends. We need a swimming pool here at [unclear] ???pton [/unclear] .

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I doubt if anyone will ever read this paper, but if anyone does I would like let them know that there is too much race prejudice in the Army. {paragraph] If you would issue one directive stating that anyone caught discriminating between men of different creeds, and nationalities would be court martialed for treason, I'll bet you would be reminded hundred men
S64.Q97.C_1: start tomorrow morning right after the sun came up.
S64.Q97.Full: I doubt if anyone will ever read this paper, but if anyone does I would like let them know that there is too much race prejudice in the Army. {paragraph] If you would issue one directive stating that anyone caught discriminating between men of different creeds, and nationalities would be court martialed for treason, I'll bet you would be reminded hundred men start tomorrow morning right after the sun came up.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)

S64.Q97.F: I wish the bunch of officers who are jealous of the Enlisted mans privilege on this post would leave us alone. The post is run by a splendid man but his assistants are not so good. I think that a soldier should be able to enjoy life on this side while he can.
S64.Q97.Full: I wish the bunch of officers who are jealous of the Enlisted mans privilege on this post would leave us alone. The post is run by a splendid man but his assistants are not so good. I think that a soldier should be able to enjoy life on this side while he can.

S64.Q97.Full: Placing of men qualified in one Branch on something entirely foreign to them. Getting promotions by who they know and not what they know. Teach OC, something else beside Haze. Not so much delay in supplies, cut down on paper work eliminate red tape.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Ratings should be given more on merit. There is too much politics and suction at least in my outfit. It's discouraging when a fellow works hard, behaves well and still makes no advancement. Shouldn't the men who are too old for basic A.S.J.P. course and lack sufficient college work for advanced courses be given a break? I'm 29,
S64.Q97.C_1: have a fairly high A.G.C. score, but am too old for basic and probably couldn't make the grade in advanced A.S.T.P. because I've been out of college for 10 years and am probably a little rusty. Yet with a little training I feel that do a much more important job - and do it just as well as the younger men or the men with college degrees.
S64.Q97.Full: Ratings should be given more on merit. There is too much politics and suction at least in my outfit. It's discouraging when a fellow works hard, behaves well and still makes no advancement. Shouldn't the men who are too old for basic A.S.J.P. course and lack sufficient college work for advanced courses be given a break? I'm 29,  have a fairly high A.G.C. score, but am too old for basic and probably couldn't make the grade in advanced A.S.T.P. because I've been out of college for 10 years and am probably a little rusty. Yet with a little training I feel that do a much more important job - and do it just as well as the younger men or the men with college degrees.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I might add that the War Dept. should if possible check on the way the P.X's [Postal Exchanges] are run. When I first came into the army many months ago we were told that P.X's were for the benefit of the soldiers but since that time it seems that this is not true. Even the officers the control them
S64.Q97.C_1: act like a bunch of civilians trying to make a big profit. Our post paper published over a year and a half ago that the P.X. was buying us a swimming pool but we still have none. Probably some one else should furnish this pool but the P.X. could do without those outrageous prices we pay. When I first came in I was taught that there were no politics in the army and have believed that until it has become so noticeable throughout the Army now. Couldn't something be done to do away with this. I hope it is different overseas. What is needed is to send these so called politicians over there and let the ones doing the actual fighting come back for a rest -- Amen.
S64.Q97.Full: I might add that the War Dept. should if possible check on the way the P.X's [Postal Exchanges] are run. When I first came into the army many months ago we were told that P.X's were for the benefit of the soldiers but since that time it seems that this is not true. Even the officers the control them act like a bunch of civilians trying to make a big profit. Our post paper published over a year and a half ago that the P.X. was buying us a swimming pool but we still have none. Probably some one else should furnish this pool but the P.X. could do without those outrageous prices we pay. When I first came in I was taught that there were no politics in the army and have believed that until it has become so noticeable throughout the Army now. Couldn't something be done to do away with this. I hope it is different overseas. What is needed is to send these so called politicians over there and let the ones doing the actual fighting come back for a rest -- Amen.
