document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: All I have to say is the army is O.K. I would feel much better toward it if I could get a furlough. Some officers show too much partiality. But I suppose that is to be expected. I think all enlisted men should have the
S64.Q97.C_1: privileges such as [paragraph] Letting non coms [non-commissioned officers] of the 1st 3 grades have passes and anytime and the others only part of the time.
S64.Q97.Full: All I have to say is the army is O.K. I would feel much better toward it if I could get a furlough. Some officers show too much partiality. But I suppose that is to be expected. I think all enlisted men should have the privileges such as [paragraph] Letting non coms [non-commissioned officers] of the 1st 3 grades have passes and anytime and the others only part of the time.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I enlisted at 39 1/2 years of age. I am now nearly 40 1/2 & have not made application for discharge. I'm serious about this army and this war. I made application last December for combat duty overseas, and was turned down because of my age, yet I see them shipping W.A.C.'s [Womens Army Corps] overseas many of them at least my age. I certainly can do anything any woman can.
S64.Q97.C_1: do in a war. They have discharged <over 38> many more men than the entire W.A.C. personnel. Those men can drive trucks, operate typewriters and all the non-combat jobs. While it seems that I am too old for overseas service they, paradoxically enough, don't think I'm to old to run cross-country and run a commando obstacle course. I think men over 40, if they are not ever going to leave this country, should be excused from all but the lightest Physical Training. I also think that all Commanding Officers should see that the Non Coms have the full backing of Headquarters. Until they do, the Air Corps will continue to be a country club and the barracks the same as college dormitories.
S64.Q97.Full: I enlisted at 39 1/2 years of age. I am now nearly 40 1/2 & have not made application for discharge. I'm serious about this army and this war. I made application last December for combat duty overseas, and was turned down because of my age, yet I see them shipping W.A.C.'s [Womens Army Corps] overseas many of them at least my age. I certainly can do anything any woman can. do in a war. They have discharged <over 38> many more men than the entire W.A.C. personnel. Those men can drive trucks, operate typewriters and all the non-combat jobs. While it seems that I am too old for overseas service they, paradoxically enough, don't think I'm to old to run cross-country and run a commando obstacle course. I think men over 40, if they are not ever going to leave this country, should be excused from all but the lightest Physical Training. I also think that all Commanding Officers should see that the Non Coms have the full backing of Headquarters. Until they do, the Air Corps will continue to be a country club and the barracks the same as college dormitories.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I think as [unclear] sholdiers [/unclear] [soldiers we] should be treated like a human and have Friday to get when off duty and they will work and do better they have more interest in Army life.[paragraph] I don't think a sholdier [soldier] should have to suck some noncoms [non-commissioned officer's] ass to get stripes.
S64.Q97.C_1: You would have lots less AWOL [Absent Without Official Leave] then you do if you will give us freedom and not continue to take it away from us. I don't care to work any and no other does I have seen. And let us have a chance to look like men not slaves when we go to town. For instance, let the men wear their garrison caps and dress shoes, people think they look a lot nicer and our handbook says a soldier must look neat at all times. How in the [underline] HELL [/underline] is he if they won't let him.[paragraph] [underline] Please Consider [/underline]
S64.Q97.Full: I think as [unclear] sholdiers [/unclear] [soldiers we] should be treated like a human and have Friday to get when off duty and they will work and do better they have more interest in Army life.[paragraph] I don't think a sholdier [soldier] should have to suck some noncoms [non-commissioned officer's] ass to get stripes. You would have lots less AWOL [Absent Without Official Leave] then you do if you will give us freedom and not continue to take it away from us. I don't care to work any and no other does I have seen. And let us have a chance to look like men not slaves when we go to town. For instance, let the men wear their garrison caps and dress shoes, people think they look a lot nicer and our handbook says a soldier must look neat at all times. How in the [underline] HELL [/underline] is he if they won't let him.[paragraph] [underline] Please Consider [/underline]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)

S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I would like to have furloughs be given consideration as much as possible as of Army Regulations fifteen days furlough at every six months. [paragraph] I only had a ten days furlough out of twelve months.
S64.Q97.Full: I would like to have furloughs be given consideration as much as possible as of Army Regulations fifteen days furlough at every six months. [paragraph] I only had a ten days furlough out of twelve months.

S64.Q97.F: Officers can't keep up with men. Think too much of themselves & not enough of men. Also non-coms [non-commissioned officers] made for had-shaking & not actual ability.
S64.Q97.Full: Officers can't keep up with men. Think too much of themselves & not enough of men. Also non-coms [non-commissioned officers] made for had-shaking & not actual ability.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: No, I'm too damned disgusted. This survey in on our time and on the last night we'll be able to go to town for 20 days. It's not a way to build a man up by tearing his spirit out and trying to make him muscle bound and crippled. Sound prejudiced don't I? I wish I had more time to write.
S64.Q97.Full: No, I'm too damned disgusted. This survey in on our time and on the last night we'll be able to go to town for 20 days. It's not a way to build a man up by tearing his spirit out and trying to make him muscle bound and crippled. Sound prejudiced don't I? I wish I had more time to write.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think the Army should allow a soldier at least one three day pass a month, but at the present time havent seen one. Here they are more concerned about your appearance than they are to make you a good soldier. The only think I'll be useful for after this war is to make some girl a good housewife. Too much discipline
S64.Q97.C_1: a soldier want used to of taking orders and the Army takes it too hard on a soldier when he first gets in.

Here they are more concerned about your appearance than they are to make you a good soldier. The only think I'll be useful for after this war is to make some girl a good housewife. Too much discipline  a soldier want used to of taking orders and the Army takes it too hard on a soldier when he first gets in.

S64.Q97.Full: I want to be a soldier for my country doing all I can at all times I can to see [underline] we [/underline] , all good Americans enjoy a real life in the near future, but above all, I do want to see our nation as a whole, more Christianized than it is now and do our best after the war to get the true [underline] Gosple [/underline] to all other nations so the world as a whole will consider [unclear] ourselves [/unclear] as true brothers and real soldiers for our [underline] Lord + Savior Jesus Christ [/underline]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think we should get more to eat here in this camp for all the other camps that I know of get a lot more than we get here. I think they have been too hard on us boy for we are all not as good a man now as we were when we came here, They should give us more time off and build us up as we get our training.
S64.Q97.Full: I think we should get more to eat here in this camp for all the other camps that I know of get a lot more than we get here. I think they have been too hard on us boy for we are all not as good a man now as we were when we came here, They should give us more time off and build us up as we get our training.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: The officer and non-com situation is desperate. We have strictly field manual soldiers. Initiative and daring are left at Fort Benning. Ingenuity was for Thomas Edison. Non-coms are nurse maids and not leaders. Good men have repeatedly refused offers to assume non-com jobs. It seems most in authority are afraid to assume leadership because they have to back some old
S64.Q97.C_1: bogey of an officer who thinks its peace time army. men in control have failed to recognize that half the men under them know twice as much as they do. Officers want someone who knows and usually such persons go on a special list that is used for Saturdays and Sundays. It would probably be a great day if we started running the army on a profit basis instead of loss. I often wonder where they can get enough red ink.[paragraph] K.P. for combat outfits should be filled by limited service men. Full field packs should be lightened to conserve the strength of men. Classification of men should really be studied. Nearly everyone could fill a job which would require half the training [unclear] memory [/unclear] . [paragraph] Non-com schools should be established. Salt should not be put in drinking water. And thank God I don't have to put my name, rank and serial number - I'd never be out of the kitchen.
S64.Q97.Full: The officer and non-com situation is desperate. We have strictly field manual soldiers. Initiative and daring are left at Fort Benning. Ingenuity was for Thomas Edison. Non-coms are nurse maids and not leaders. Good men have repeatedly refused offers to assume non-com jobs. It seems most in authority are afraid to assume leadership because they have to back some old  bogey of an officer who thinks its peace time army. men in control have failed to recognize that half the men under them know twice as much as they do. Officers want someone who knows and usually such persons go on a special list that is used for Saturdays and Sundays. It would probably be a great day if we started running the army on a profit basis instead of loss. I often wonder where they can get enough red ink.[paragraph] K.P. for combat outfits should be filled by limited service men. Full field packs should be lightened to conserve the strength of men. Classification of men should really be studied. Nearly everyone could fill a job which would require half the training [unclear] memory [/unclear] . [paragraph] Non-com schools should be established. Salt should not be put in drinking water. And thank God I don't have to put my name, rank and serial number - I'd never be out of the kitchen.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I cannot say much for the Army's classification or induction center medical depts. I was rejected from the Air Corps for eyes not 20/20 after passing a strict mental exam. In the Infantry my records reads 20/20. Secondly, my interview in my reception center was not by a skill man as was promised but by a private
S64.Q97.C_1: who had exactly three days more service than I. Though I am a highly skilled optician with a number of years of experience and having owned my own Company, I was not put into a Mobile Optical Unit as any skilled man should be in this trade of which there are not many. [paragraph] Our Camp has a great fault in that there is almost no recreation at all. This is no exageration. Our Infantry Regiments read of Field Artillery contests of all varieties none ever have come our way. Also we never no if or when we will be off. Nowaday, scrubbing of barracks [unclear] for [/unclear] [unclear] a [/unclear] time is the schedule. Personally I believe [deletion] [/deletion] our Reg. and Div. Commanders do not have the men's welfare in mind one bit, but are aiming at personal promotions.
S64.Q97.Full: I cannot say much for the Army's classification or induction center medical depts. I was rejected from the Air Corps for eyes not 20/20 after passing a strict mental exam. In the Infantry my records reads 20/20. Secondly, my interview in my reception center was not by a skill man as was promised but by a private  who had exactly three days more service than I. Though I am a highly skilled optician with a number of years of experience and having owned my own Company, I was not put into a Mobile Optical Unit as any skilled man should be in this trade of which there are not many. [paragraph] Our Camp has a great fault in that there is almost no recreation at all. This is no exageration. Our Infantry Regiments read of Field Artillery contests of all varieties none ever have come our way. Also we never no if or when we will be off. Nowaday, scrubbing of barracks [unclear] for [/unclear] [unclear] a [/unclear] time is the schedule. Personally I believe [deletion] [/deletion] our Reg. and Div. Commanders do not have the men's welfare in mind one bit, but are aiming at personal promotions.

S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think every man should get a furlough at least every 3 or 4 months.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I think the army should grant furloughs to new fathers as we are fighting for the right to raise a family in freedom and some of us may never see that family and if not what the hell is the use of our fighting for something we wont [won't] have. I am one of those men who has recently become a father and I feel that way the time can be spared for me.
S64.Q97.C_1: to go home as my outfit wastes about 10 days out of every 30 of my time anyway
S64.Q97.Full: I think the army should grant furloughs to new fathers as we are fighting for the right to raise a family in freedom and some of us may never see that family and if not what the hell is the use of our fighting for something we wont [won't] have. I am one of those men who has recently become a father and I feel that way the time can be spared for me. to go home as my outfit wastes about 10 days out of every 30 of my time anyway

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page

S64.Q97.F: Yes, too much petty politics in the companies ------ time lost when not practicing on moving targits -- every man in same company qualified for each others job senority rules, also
S64.Q97.C_1: rules by merits --- there is time to exercise & time to relax lets have a little of each also discretion ---common horse sense a good horse can be rode to death ---- Leaders are made by the efforts of their followers who in turn only ask that a man be judged by or taught by all concerned who knows the value of life & things worth its while -- I am ready to die so my loved ones and other inocent may carry on comming there --
S64.Q97.Full: Yes, too much petty politics in the companies ------ time lost when not practicing on moving targits -- every man in same company qualified for each others job senority rules, also rules by merits --- there is time to exercise & time to relax lets have a little of each also discretion ---common horse sense a good horse can be rode to death ---- Leaders are made by the efforts of their followers who in turn only ask that a man be judged by or taught by all concerned who knows the value of life & things worth its while -- I am ready to die so my loved ones and other inocent may carry on comming there --

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: The men need more time to themselves for recreation of all types. [paragraph] We need better officers. Just because a man graduates from O.C.S. he is not always a leader. Officers should be more thoroughly checked for leadership.
S64.Q97.C_1: Recruit WAKS and Release civial service girls Let the boy keep their Class A pass, or let the men have them that are married. pay all men Ration money that live with their wifes
S64.Q97.Full: The men need more time to themselves for recreation of all types. [paragraph] We need better officers. Just because a man graduates from O.C.S. he is not always a leader. Officers should be more thoroughly checked for leadership. Recruit WAKS and Release civial service girls Let the boy keep their Class A pass, or let the men have them that are married. pay all men Ration money that live with their wifes

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think the five day furlough or pass as we call it is unfair as several of us have wives and children back home and five days is pretty short to be with them maybe for the last time. Others are getting fourteen days, why don't we? Another thing we dont [sic] get near enough time to ourselves. Another thing we dont [sic] have near enough entertainment.
S64.Q97.C_1: There is one thing I would like to say and that is that some officers in this company have there wires crossed somewhere. What I mean is they will spend a long while teaching us something and when we have a test on the subject we find out we have been taught the wrong way and fail out and besides we get bawled out about it. One other thing I would like to say is that ever time especially on Sundays when we have a little time off to rest we can't lay on our bunks or even in the barracks for fear of someone putting you on detail work and it happens very often. Another thing there is to many favorites among the men payed by the non coms. The routine duty isn't run right at all for some of us get KP or guard duty two times in one week when we shouldn't get it but every three weeks, to many mistakes when we privates have to pay.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the five day furlough or pass as we call it is unfair as several of us have wives and children back home and five days is pretty short to be with them maybe for the last time. Others are getting fourteen days, why don't we? Another thing we dont [sic] get near enough time to ourselves. Another thing we dont [sic] have near enough entertainment. There is one thing I would like to say and that is that some officers in this company have there wires crossed somewhere. What I mean is they will spend a long while teaching us something and when we have a test on the subject we find out we have been taught the wrong way and fail out and besides we get bawled out about it. One other thing I would like to say is that ever time especially on Sundays when we have a little time off to rest we can't lay on our bunks or even in the barracks for fear of someone putting you on detail work and it happens very often. Another thing there is to many favorites among the men payed by the non coms. The routine duty isn't run right at all for some of us get KP or guard duty two times in one week when we shouldn't get it but every three weeks, to many mistakes when we privates have to pay.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: There seems to be a lot of little odd jobs to do which takes up a lot of our time off. These little things are what makes most of us mad. When we get through at night we like to have some fun and forget about Army life but this is impossible when you're always getting some little job to do which may take two or three hours of your time. When you get through your usually
S64.Q97.C_1: so darn mad you don't care if got out or not. We also need more recreation places. The service clubs and U.S.O. clubs are always too crowded
S64.Q97.Full: There seems to be a lot of little odd jobs to do which takes up a lot of our time off. These little things are what makes most of us mad. When we get through at night we like to have some fun and forget about Army life but this is impossible when you're always getting some little job to do which may take two or three hours of your time. When you get through your usually so darn mad you don't care if got out or not. We also need more recreation places. The service clubs and U.S.O. clubs are always too crowded

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: It seems to me that espcially in this camp Ft Leonard Wood that there is more officers holding such ranks as Majors and Liet and such giving orders to privates that they [unclear] [/unclear] can't follow. Many nights I have gone to bed for only two or three hours sleep. I have enlisted in the service and I never had an even break since Ive come into the Army. I was hospitalized for an operation and was promised a twenty eight day leave but I was cheated out of it and convalest in the hospital for that time doing calisthenics right after an operation.
S64.Q97.Full: It seems to me that espcially in this camp Ft Leonard Wood that there is more officers holding such ranks as Majors and Liet and such giving orders to privates that they [unclear] [/unclear] can't follow. Many nights I have gone to bed for only two or three hours sleep. I have enlisted in the service and I never had an even break since Ive come into the Army. I was hospitalized for an operation and was promised a twenty eight day leave but I was cheated out of it and convalest in the hospital for that time doing calisthenics right after an operation.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: Because I was on a Farm with my Mother alone and when I was drafted I had to sell all of my stock and farming tools and rent the farm out they are 4 of us boys in the service and I was the last one on the farm.
S64.Q97.Full: Because I was on a Farm with my Mother alone and when I was drafted I had to sell all of my stock and farming tools and rent the farm out they are 4 of us boys in the service and I was the last one on the farm.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: We are supposed to be in Limited Service. But I think we all could do combat duty. We pull guard duty a week at a time. The guard prisoners of War in the day time while they work. On our fort as high as nine hours without sitting down. And that is to much for Limited Service men. This camp is sure run [unclear] [/unclear]
S64.Q97.C_1: as hell. We were in [unclear] another [/unclear] [unclear] internment [/unclear] camp for three weeks. The talk of AWOL dropped 90 percent. We have poor transportation in getting in and out if we are lucky enough to get a pass. When we are off of duty. We are [deletion] [/deletion] tied to go any place for a good time. I think it should be investigated. And try some other method for the good of the morale of the men in the Army.
S64.Q97.Full: We are supposed to be in Limited Service. But I think we all could do combat duty. We pull guard duty a week at a time. The guard prisoners of War in the day time while they work. On our fort as high as nine hours without sitting down. And that is to much for Limited Service men. This camp is sure run [unclear] [/unclear]  as hell. We were in [unclear] another [/unclear] [unclear] internment [/unclear] camp for three weeks. The talk of AWOL dropped 90 percent. We have poor transportation in getting in and out if we are lucky enough to get a pass. When we are off of duty. We are [deletion] [/deletion] tied to go any place for a good time. I think it should be investigated. And try some other method for the good of the morale of the men in the Army.

About the only remarks I have to make further are that Internment camps should not be centered within a training center and camp or [unclear] [/unclear] . ([Paragraph] ) And would rather been reclassified and placed within the medical corp than the [unclear] MPEG [/unclear]
S64.Q97.Full: 97. If you have any further remarks you would like to make on any subject please write them below as fully as you like. ([Paragraph] ) And would rather been reclassified and placed within the medical corp than the [unclear] MPEG [/unclear]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: Army regulations usually are all right and properly interpreted and enforced, but our officers have a complete disregard for such things as a soldier's right to worship, by planning required drill or classes on Sunday at church hours, when other hours could be used. No planned recreation for the larger group of men is available either. Much AWOL [Absent Without Official Leave] is caused by the lack of a few such privileges as these.
S64.Q97.Full: Army regulations usually are all right and properly interpreted and enforced, but our officers have a complete disregard for such things as a soldier's right to worship, by planning required drill or classes on Sunday at church hours, when other hours could be used. No planned recreation for the larger group of men is available either. Much AWOL [Absent Without Official Leave] is caused by the lack of a few such privileges as these.

S64.Q97.F: I think that a man 35 years or older that has live on a farm or down [done] hard jobs all his life should not be in the army cause [because] he cant [sic] keep up with the other men. And I think it will be harder on him after he is out of the army.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that a man 35 years or older that has live on a farm or down [done] hard jobs all his life should not be in the army cause [because] he cant [sic] keep up with the other men. And I think it will be harder on him after he is out of the army.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: When a man his dicoved [divorced] and ordered to pay $15 a mo. on these allments why does the goverment hold out all 22.00 for. when a man does not have a order to pay that much.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: In my opinion much time, money, and manpower is wasted in the army on reports and red tape that to me seem to have no connection with the war effort. My work is guarding prisoners of war, it seems that they often have a better deal than we do, for instance why should they have plenty of all foods that even our families
S64.Q97.C_1: at home must go without? Also they waste food by poor cooking, and the mere fact that they have so much available makes them waste it. the prisoners of war have roomier barracks and more recreational facilities than we do, such as radios etc. It also is my opinion that we have too many officer with too little to do, who take delight in confusing us in our daily routine, which we are probably more familiar with than they are. Many men have never received any furloughs since we have been at this camp, although we have spent many weeks doing useless work, such as clearing and policing wooded areas, "to keep the men from becoming stale", as our Commanding officer put it. All passes have been discouraged, in an attempt to keep the men from even applying for three day passes.
S64.Q97.Full: In my opinion much time, money, and manpower is wasted in the army on reports and red tape that to me seem to have no connection with the war effort. My work is guarding prisoners of war, it seems that they often have a better deal than we do, for instance why should they have plenty of all foods that even our families at home must go without? Also they waste food by poor cooking, and the mere fact that they have so much available makes them waste it. the prisoners of war have roomier barracks and more recreational facilities than we do, such as radios etc. It also is my opinion that we have too many officer with too little to do, who take delight in confusing us in our daily routine, which we are probably more familiar with than they are. Many men have never received any furloughs since we have been at this camp, although we have spent many weeks doing useless work, such as clearing and policing wooded areas, "to keep the men from becoming stale", as our Commanding officer put it. All passes have been discouraged, in an attempt to keep the men from even applying for three day passes.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: The army should be democratic. The men + officers should judge each person as to his ability to perform a duty and not give it to one because its his friend, I don't think that a man should be a Major or Colonel just because he was Mayor of some large city or because he was a former senator or congressman. "Give Honor To Whom Honor is Due". The men
S64.Q97.C_1: in the fighting zones should be thought of first. The army cannot win a war without civilian backing. A lot of people on the outside hardly know the war is on. ( If I am off the subject I am very sorry) Let some of our lawmakers who make the laws for the army examine themselves. Some would not find themselves worthy of the job. Let's get the war over first and afterwards win our political fame and wealth.
S64.Q97.Full: The army should be democratic. The men + officers should judge each person as to his ability to perform a duty and not give it to one because its his friend, I don't think that a man should be a Major or Colonel just because he was Mayor of some large city or because he was a former senator or congressman. "Give Honor To Whom Honor is Due". The men in the fighting zones should be thought of first. The army cannot win a war without civilian backing. A lot of people on the outside hardly know the war is on. ( If I am off the subject I am very sorry) Let some of our lawmakers who make the laws for the army examine themselves. Some would not find themselves worthy of the job. Let's get the war over first and afterwards win our political fame and wealth.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: 97. If you have any further remarks you would like to make on any subject please write them below as fully as you like. Limited service is silly. There are men in my outfit right now that have [unclear] [/unclear] they could take all same line outfits are taking. Unless a man is too crippled he should be given a chance to enter into combat service.
S64.Q97.Full: 97. If you have any further remarks you would like to make on any subject please write them below as fully as you like. Limited service is silly. There are men in my outfit right now that have [unclear] [/unclear] they could take all same line outfits are taking. Unless a man is too crippled he should be given a chance to enter into combat service.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: The war is coming along satisfactorily but people at home do not yet or will not realize to the fullest what the boys overseas are giving up. Such things as black market and wartime rackets and too much pleasure driving should be abolished. I think baseball should continue.
S64.Q97.C_1: Prices are two high around a big Fort or camp that is where there isn't many towns. Government should see that soldiers bonds are sent home if requested. I think people in war industries need relaxation and some pleasure to do their best at home in this war.
S64.Q97.Full: The war is coming along satisfactorily but people at home do not yet or will not realize to the fullest what the boys overseas are giving up. Such things as black market and wartime rackets and too much pleasure driving should be abolished. I think baseball should continue. Prices are two high around a big Fort or camp that is where there isn't many towns. Government should see that soldiers bonds are sent home if requested. I think people in war industries need relaxation and some pleasure to do their best at home in this war.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I still would like to be in civilian life I would work hard to win the war [paragraph]
S64.Q97.Full: I still would like to be in civilian life I would work hard to win the war [paragraph]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Would like to get free postage to Canada as well as the USA as long as we are fighting with them.
S64.Q97.Full: Would like to get free postage to Canada as well as the USA as long as we are fighting with them.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I do think that a lot of this limited service that came from the farm and production line could do more good in the way of producing things for the army than they can where they are at now. Some are in such condition that it is impossible for them to carry on full duty in the service
S64.Q97.C_1: but could do a world of good at jobs that they could fit themselves to such as they had before they were drafted. I also think that these limited service men should be considered to a release when they are losing property by staying in the service. I also think that the release should be given on real facts instead of just some such shun with some officer or some big political guy in civilian life. There should be somthing done about these strikers to as they just want more all the time and the soldier should just take what he gets besides risk his life for them and then they strike all the time is would do them a lot of good to be put in the army and let some one work that will and be satisfied with a normal wage.
S64.Q97.Full: I do think that a lot of this limited service that came from the farm and production line could do more good in the way of producing things for the army than they can where they are at now. Some are in such condition that it is impossible for them to carry on full duty in the service but could do a world of good at jobs that they could fit themselves to such as they had before they were drafted. I also think that these limited service men should be considered to a release when they are losing property by staying in the service. I also think that the release should be given on real facts instead of just some such shun with some officer or some big political guy in civilian life. There should be somthing done about these strikers to as they just want more all the time and the soldier should just take what he gets besides risk his life for them and then they strike all the time is would do them a lot of good to be put in the army and let some one work that will and be satisfied with a normal wage.

S64.Q97.F: As to the WAC [Womens Army Corps] organization which was taken into the Army is outragious [outrageous] . Where they belong is in industry producing war ...
S64.Q97.C_1: products. Near this thing is the taking of limited service men into the Army. If they are not fit for General Service they are not fit for the Army. They are an added expense to the Govt. [Government] . Some of these fellows on the draft boards should be punished for the men they put in the US Army. These limited service men should be replaced with married men that have no children. There are plenty of general service men yet that aren't in the Army. Men in the other war, that had small children, volunteered - This time they are to greedy, so are the big manufacturers. If it weren't for money they wouldn't be [unclear] [/unclear] . Take out a lot of the excess cushion help.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I believe there are a few outfits that move to slow. Perhaps some of them are intended for work in the same place for the duration but when a soldier remains in the same place doing exactly the same thing seeing the same things he becomes unsettled and begins to slacken his ability. [paragraph] As I am in the Medics thats all I can write. I believe almost only
S64.Q97.C_1: technician ratings should be given. They should be given a little more free because of the reaction of the patient. Which would you like to sew up a laceration on, you a private or a Sgt [sergeant] ? I'm trying to stress the psychological effect on the patient. Believe me there is one.[paragraph] I feel too many of the good men are being left behind for training purposes.[paragraph] I'm strictly against the idea of WAC's [Womens Army Corps] as I feel they have replaced few soldiers if that was the contention. [paragraph] I believe the limited service man should have the chance in overseas duty. If he can do his job over here [USA] he can also do the same over there.[paragraph] Prisoners of war are treated with too much respect and guidance for what our boys are getting over there.[paragraph] The morale of the American soldier is excellent.
S64.Q97.Full: I believe there are a few outfits that move to slow. Perhaps some of them are intended for work in the same place for the duration but when a soldier remains in the same place doing exactly the same thing seeing the same things he becomes unsettled and begins to slacken his ability. [paragraph] As I am in the Medics thats all I can write. I believe almost only technician ratings should be given. They should be given a little more free because of the reaction of the patient. Which would you like to sew up a laceration on, you a private or a Sgt [sergeant] ? I'm trying to stress the psychological effect on the patient. Believe me there is one.[paragraph] I feel too many of the good men are being left behind for training purposes.[paragraph] I'm strictly against the idea of WAC's [Womens Army Corps] as I feel they have replaced few soldiers if that was the contention. [paragraph] I believe the limited service man should have the chance in overseas duty. If he can do his job over here [USA] he can also do the same over there.[paragraph] Prisoners of war are treated with too much respect and guidance for what our boys are getting over there.[paragraph] The morale of the American soldier is excellent.

S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: One thing they should give fathers a furlough every 4 months. I know for one I can't keep my mind on my work if I don't see my child., as for now I haven't seen my daughter in 5 months and would have the nerve to go AWOL [Absent Without Official Leave] if I don't see her soon.
S64.Q97.Full: One thing they should give fathers a furlough every 4 months. I know for one I can't keep my mind on my work if I don't see my child., as for now I haven't seen my daughter in 5 months and would have the nerve to go AWOL [Absent Without Official Leave] if I don't see her soon.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)

S64.Q97.F: I think the ratings are very few for medical technicians, for one reason there is too much responsibility to be just a buck Private. [paragraph] Especially after being in the Army for 17 months. That's one reason why I don't like my outfit or my job. There don't seem to be any future.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the ratings are very few for medical technicians, for one reason there is too much responsibility to be just a buck Private. [paragraph] Especially after being in the Army for 17 months. That's one reason why I don't like my outfit or my job. There don't seem to be any future.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I am very proud to have the privilege of giving my opinion here. I feel sure that 80% of the other men feel the same as I do. So far we haven't been treated exactly fair in having non - com's appointed. Some can't take it or either [deletion] dished [/deletion] dish it out while others can do both and haven't had a chance to prove themselves.
S64.Q97.C_1: The officers believe in keeping the enlisted men busy for about 14 to 16 hrs per day. They gig us for our barracks while theirs are far dirtier and much more disorderly than ours. I have saw that the case more than once. An officer when he is among other people considers himself above enlisted men while the majority of service men think all men should be equally based there. In the long run there is good reason for most of this. We are not given as much amusement & excitement as we would like to have. We appreciate the many privileges we are given on such thing as discounts at PX and free mail. Some men growl but when it comes down to the real thing they see different. Non coms newly appointed among other men that came in the same time are given too much authority. So far we have gotten along O.K. with meals decent. Thanks for this opportunity
S64.Q97.Full: I am very proud to have the privilege of giving my opinion here. I feel sure that 80% of the other men feel the same as I do. So far we haven't been treated exactly fair in having non - com's appointed. Some can't take it or either [deletion] dished [/deletion] dish it out while others can do both and haven't had a chance to prove themselves. The officers believe in keeping the enlisted men busy for about 14 to 16 hrs per day. They gig us for our barracks while theirs are far dirtier and much more disorderly than ours. I have saw that the case more than once. An officer when he is among other people considers himself above enlisted men while the majority of service men think all men should be equally based there. In the long run there is good reason for most of this. We are not given as much amusement & excitement as we would like to have. We appreciate the many privileges we are given on such thing as discounts at PX and free mail. Some men growl but when it comes down to the real thing they see different. Non coms newly appointed among other men that came in the same time are given too much authority. So far we have gotten along O.K. with meals decent. Thanks for this opportunity

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page, A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: A furlough of [underline] only 5 [/underline] days coming up next month.
S64.Q97.F: I think the morale of the average soldier is not high enough - to be given their evenings off after training hours & let them do as they want instead of cleaning equipment, barracks & special details - time during the day should be allotted for that & their evenings free to do as they like - not necessarily a pass but allowed out of the company area. I think a physical exam should be given more often - some soldiers are in a positive
S64.Q97.C_1: a job that is not suitable to their health - while stronger & more capable men may have an easy job -
S64.Q97.C_2: I am getting a furlough next month so I can't say any thing about the army. I get [deletion] [/deletion] passes when I want them.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the morale of the average soldier is not high enough - to be given their evenings off after training hours & let them do as they want instead of cleaning equipment, barracks & special details - time during the day should be allotted for that & their evenings free to do as they like - not necessarily a pass but allowed out of the company area. I think a physical exam should be given more often - some soldiers are in a positive a job that is not suitable to their health - while stronger & more capable men may have an easy job - I am getting a furlough next month so I can't say any thing about the army. I get [deletion] [/deletion] passes when I want them.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I think that some provision should be made [underline] right now [/underline] to take care of ex-servicemen after the war. When I come back I want my job, a home & everything I'm fighting for there & I want the right to work for it. I would also like to see educational opportunities extended, as we will lose many capable, well-educated men, & someone must take their places. I, personally, would like to continue my own education before I settle down after the war.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that some provision should be made [underline] right now [/underline] to take care of ex-servicemen after the war. When I come back I want my job, a home & everything I'm fighting for there & I want the right to work for it. I would also like to see educational opportunities extended, as we will lose many capable, well-educated men, & someone must take their places. I, personally, would like to continue my own education before I settle down after the war.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page

S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: There are three ways in this ARmy the right, wrong & Army way and the half of the time here you don't (know) what you are doing. Till it all over with and the whole thing is got to be done all over, You go to bed doing details and you get up doing details A fellow hadn't got five
S64.Q97.C_1: minutes to his selfe to write a letter or get off to see his friend or love one for you can't get off far ever time you turn around you looking right straight at some Sgt. hunting a pvt. for some dirty detail after the CO has said you have this time off. You see what I mean. What get me why they officers + noncoms don't stick with what they said and carry every thing is don't check gave have got me. and this goes for the whole out fit from the lowest Pvt. to the highest ranking Officer. [paragraph] Good Bye + Good Luck and may God Bless you + I here now and the day to come may God Bless you all. + Good Luck.
S64.Q97.Full: There are three ways in this ARmy the right, wrong & Army way and the half of the time here you don't (know) what you are doing. Till it all over with and the whole thing is got to be done all over, You go to bed doing details and you get up doing details A fellow hadn't got five minutes to his selfe to write a letter or get off to see his friend or love one for you can't get off far ever time you turn around you looking right straight at some Sgt. hunting a pvt. for some dirty detail after the CO has said you have this time off. You see what I mean. What get me why they officers + noncoms don't stick with what they said and carry every thing is don't check gave have got me. and this goes for the whole out fit from the lowest Pvt. to the highest ranking Officer. [paragraph] Good Bye + Good Luck and may God Bless you + I here now and the day to come may God Bless you all. + Good Luck.

S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I think a man working 8 or10 hrs. [hours] a day is entitled to more time off than we have. And our subjects [training] have been jammed at us to [too] fast to learn to our best advantage. Most of the officers in this Division are bucking to [too] hard, it is not hard on them but it is hard on the men under them. There are a lot of good young ...
S64.Q97.C_1: men in this Division that would make good fast and efficient soldiers if they had the right kind of training and a little more time for themselves. There is nothing to do on this Post for amusement besides go to show and the dances are so crowded and not enough women. And, the nearest decent town are at least 90 to 130 miles away. The bus system and [unclear] traveling [/unclear] system is terrible.
S64.Q97.Full: I think a man working 8 or10 hrs. [hours] a day is entitled to more time off than we have. And our subjects [training] have been jammed at us to [too] fast to learn to our best advantage. Most of the officers in this Division are bucking to [too] hard, it is not hard on them but it is hard on the men under them. There are a lot of good young ... men in this Division that would make good fast and efficient soldiers if they had the right kind of training and a little more time for themselves. There is nothing to do on this Post for amusement besides go to show and the dances are so crowded and not enough women. And, the nearest decent town are at least 90 to 130 miles away. The bus system and [unclear] traveling [/unclear] system is terrible.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I believe that the army should put a man in an outfit that he wants to get in, and then if he doesn't make out so go put him where they want to. Don't put him in any outfit they want to, just to get one [deletion] [/deletion] outfit filled and then go to another outfit and fill it up. Put him in an outfit that he likes. If a man has an ability to be a tank driver don't put him in the Infantry
S64.Q97.C_1: put him in the Armor Forces and then if he should fail put him in the next best thing he would like. Never put a man in a place that he despises because he will never make a good soldier.
S64.Q97.Full: I believe that the army should put a man in an outfit that he wants to get in, and then if he doesn't make out so go put him where they want to. Don't put him in any outfit they want to, just to get one [deletion] [/deletion] outfit filled and then go to another outfit and fill it up. Put him in an outfit that he likes. If a man has an ability to be a tank driver don't put him in the Infantry  put him in the Armor Forces and then if he should fail put him in the next best thing he would like. Never put a man in a place that he despises because he will never make a good soldier.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Yes, I have one comment to make that I have been meaning to get off my chest for quite a time. This comment is on how the 75th Division is run. For one thing, it seems to be all screwed up. The officers don't know whether they are coming or going. I am most positive it could
S64.Q97.C_1: be run more efficiently and [deletion] [/deletion] to give better results. The men in this division don't have an ounce of confidence in themselves and in the division. They all seem to think it will be broken up before long. We just don't care much for anything anymore. If we were to go into actual combat within the next 6 months it would be complete suicide for all of us. In general, we know a little bit of everything and not much of anything. What we need is more definite training, more encouragement, higher morale and better - all around soldier.
S64.Q97.Full: Yes, I have one comment to make that I have been meaning to get off my chest for quite a time. This comment is on how the 75th Division is run. For one thing, it seems to be all screwed up. The officers don't know whether they are coming or going. I am most positive it could be run more efficiently and [deletion] [/deletion] to give better results. The men in this division don't have an ounce of confidence in themselves and in the division. They all seem to think it will be broken up before long. We just don't care much for anything anymore. If we were to go into actual combat within the next 6 months it would be complete suicide for all of us. In general, we know a little bit of everything and not much of anything. What we need is more definite training, more encouragement, higher morale and better - all around soldier.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I would like to know why the majority of the soldiers are sent so far from home. I think it best to keep them as close to home as possible and then gradually ween them from their personal surroundings.
S64.Q97.Full: I would like to know why the majority of the soldiers are sent so far from home. I think it best to keep them as close to home as possible and then gradually ween them from their personal surroundings.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think that a soldier going on furloughs should be able to get enough gas to drive home and back also to call on friends while at home a man can go cheaper also more convenience also more sure on gitting back on time. Also I think a married man or any Soldier should be alow more than two passes a week if he is off duty I believe in letting them off to injoy themself
S64.Q97.C_1: when possible I also think the chow could be better or rather more in cirtain kinds especially what the men will eat
S64.Q97.Full: I think that a soldier going on furloughs should be able to get enough gas to drive home and back also to call on friends while at home a man can go cheaper also more convenience also more sure on gitting back on time. Also I think a married man or any Soldier should be alow more than two passes a week if he is off duty I believe in letting them off to injoy themself when possible I also think the chow could be better or rather more in cirtain kinds especially what the men will eat

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: training schedules could be better prepared so that two and three days in a row wouldn't be devoted entirely to a subject that is pretty dull at best because I am certain men do not learn much when they have lost interest. too many of our commissioned officers do not have enough training before entering OCS
S64.Q97.Full: training schedules could be better prepared so that two and three days in a row wouldn't be devoted entirely to a subject that is pretty dull at best because I am certain men do not learn much when they have lost interest. too many of our commissioned officers do not have enough training before entering OCS

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I like to know why the hell the Army allows a man to remain as a mess Sergent whne all he could dish out is slop. I like to know why a soldier has to eat out of his mess kit instead of dishes. Why does the Army allow a man to remain as top kick when he goes around hitting a soldier, and splitting his head, with the butt of a rifle.
S64.Q97.C_1: Why the hell can't a soldier be treated like a human being rather than a dog? And also why don't they use a fair method of picking non-coms? Instead of picking a kiss ass soldier all the time weither he has the ability, or weither he deserves to be or not. Why does a soldier have to be a personal slave to a non-com?
S64.Q97.Full: I like to know why the hell the Army allows a man to remain as a mess Sergent whne all he could dish out is slop. I like to know why a soldier has to eat out of his mess kit instead of dishes. Why does the Army allow a man to remain as top kick when he goes around hitting a soldier, and splitting his head, with the butt of a rifle. Why the hell can't a soldier be treated like a human being rather than a dog? And also why don't they use a fair method of picking non-coms? Instead of picking a kiss ass soldier all the time weither he has the ability, or weither he deserves to be or not. Why does a soldier have to be a personal slave to a non-com?

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Well they don't give me enough time to our selfs always working on some kind of detail or scrubbing barracks. Sometimes you can't blame the fellows for going A.W.O.L. Some times I felt like going my self but I though twice before I went. They keep you in camp for the least little thing you do wrong & I think that aint write I think a soldier is entitled to his week ends off.
S64.Q97.Full: Well they don't give me enough time to our selfs always working on some kind of detail or scrubbing barracks. Sometimes you can't blame the fellows for going A.W.O.L. Some times I felt like going my self but I though twice before I went. They keep you in camp for the least little thing you do wrong & I think that aint write I think a soldier is entitled to his week ends off.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: The last question in particular. My family are very poor & their having their living conditions pretty tough & it is almost breaking my home life too.[paragraph] I don't think they should draft married men, it hurts them a lot to leave there [their] family.
S64.Q97.C_1: & There is some that don't care, & they would volunteer.
S64.Q97.Full: The last question in particular. My family are very poor & their having their living conditions pretty tough & it is almost breaking my home life too.[paragraph] I don't think they should draft married men, it hurts them a lot to leave there [their] family. & There is some that don't care, & they would volunteer.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Well the Army has made it much worse for my family with sickness and doctor bills and no one there to meet them it sure has been hell for my folks.
S64.Q97.Full: Well the Army has made it much worse for my family with sickness and doctor bills and no one there to meet them it sure has been hell for my folks.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: All I can say I wish I could be home working then in the army.
S64.Q97.Full: All I can say I wish I could be home working then in the army.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I rather be in combat than in the United States any day there are reasons which I can not give for that would probably be held against me + I would throw out [unclear] of [/unclear] the country. So if you will excuse my saying so. A very dear friend
S64.Q97.Full: I rather be in combat than in the United States any day there are reasons which I can not give for that would probably be held against me + I would throw out [unclear] of [/unclear] the country. So if you will excuse my saying so. A very dear friend

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Well my idea is I would like to be back somewhere in some state away from the desert for a while, because I have been in these Mojave desert for the last 9 months, and didn't have a good time while I was there, at least I would like a little change, the I would be a better soldier, and I would think more of the army, and furthermore ...
S64.Q97.C_1: I wouldn't be thinking about going AWOL. Where I am stationed at now we have no library no USO no other sports like the other soldiers have it in camps. The only time I can have a good time is when I get a 3 days pass, and most of the time I spend in travelling to get there so I don't get to see much.
S64.Q97.Full: Well my idea is I would like to be back somewhere in some state away from the desert for a while, because I have been in these Mojave desert for the last 9 months, and didn't have a good time while I was there, at least I would like a little change, the I would be a better soldier, and I would think more of the army, and furthermore ...  I wouldn't be thinking about going AWOL. Where I am stationed at now we have no library no USO no other sports like the other soldiers have it in camps. The only time I can have a good time is when I get a 3 days pass, and most of the time I spend in travelling to get there so I don't get to see much.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I was once in an armored division and while there had wonderful. Now I am in a separate tank Battalion and the officers are the worst God-damned fools I have ever worked with. I have seen the Lt. Col. [Lieutenant Colonel] who commands us Drunk on duty, and yet he gave an enlisted man 6 months and a heavy fine for the same offense.
S64.Q97.C_1: Personally, I think a no-good Bastard like that should be shot. His subordinates are just as bad. I want to emphasize that I myself have not been so badly treated, but many of my buddies have been kicked around like a bunch of God-damned dog's. there must be some other outfits like our's and Jesus Christ, if there is, they will be poor God-damned fighters, because they won't have any damned morale at all. I like the army. It is the finest fellowship in the world. I am proud of it. The Armored Forced. But i hate my present outfit.
S64.Q97.Full: I was once in an armored division and while there had wonderful. Now I am in a separate tank Battalion and the officers are the worst God-damned fools I have ever worked with. I have seen the Lt. Col. [Lieutenant Colonel] who commands us Drunk on duty, and yet he gave an enlisted man 6 months and a heavy fine for the same offense. Personally, I think a no-good Bastard like that should be shot. His subordinates are just as bad. I want to emphasize that I myself have not been so badly treated, but many of my buddies have been kicked around like a bunch of God-damned dog's. there must be some other outfits like our's and Jesus Christ, if there is, they will be poor God-damned fighters, because they won't have any damned morale at all. I like the army. It is the finest fellowship in the world. I am proud of it. The Armored Forced. But i hate my present outfit.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Well as a whole the Army life is fine fore most men but it seems to me like my job should be on the out side as lots of [deletion] [/deletion] single men are out and don't have wife + children to think of. [paragraph] And food is hard to get now that it was then.
S64.Q97.Full: Well as a whole the Army life is fine fore most men but it seems to me like my job should be on the out side as lots of [deletion] [/deletion] single men are out and don't have wife + children to think of. [paragraph] And food is hard to get now that it was then.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I can make my self a good soldier but as long as I say [stay] in the Fort Sheridan guard house I can't make my self a good [soldier] if they keep slaping [slapping] us kicking and everything.
S64.Q97.Full: I can make my self a good soldier but as long as I say [stay] in the Fort Sheridan guard house I can't make my self a good [soldier] if they keep slaping [slapping] us kicking and everything.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I think the army could put men on jobs that they belong on. [paragraph] The army has too many old men in the wrong place. [paragraph] I went A.W.O.L [absence without official leave] after 10 months because I was tired of working day and night and they expect too much of a man who has tried hard to be a man.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the army could put men on jobs that they belong on. [paragraph] The army has too many old men in the wrong place. [paragraph] I went A.W.O.L [absence without official leave] after 10 months because I was tired of working day and night and they expect too much of a man who has tried hard to be a man.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: [crossed out] furloughs[crossed out]
S64.Q97.F: I don't see any sense in sending a soldier far away from his home to train; if he can get the same training near home. A chance to get home once & awhile would cut down A.W.O.L.'s and build up the morale of the soldiers. [paragraph] A through check-up should be made of all [unclear] prison [/unclear] camps GI and look into conditions.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't see any sense in sending a soldier far away from his home to train; if he can get the same training near home. A chance to get home once & awhile would cut down A.W.O.L.'s and build up the morale of the soldiers. [paragraph] A through check-up should be made of all [unclear] prison [/unclear] camps GI and look into conditions.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I'm a soldier who would like to be in the Air Corps for I think I could really make something out of myself & really accomplish a trade for after this war airplanes will be the most important kind of work. I think our United States has a great Army & cannot fail for it is really a great team and you know what a good team ...
S64.Q97.C_1: can do if you all stick together & play well with each other
S64.Q97.Full: I'm a soldier who would like to be in the Air Corps for I think I could really make something out of myself & really accomplish a trade for after this war airplanes will be the most important kind of work. I think our United States has a great Army & cannot fail for it is really a great team and you know what a good team ... can do if you all stick together & play well with each other

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I do not see why an M.P. should try to be unreasonable with soldiers. There are some of us fellows who try to do the thing we think best. I am in the guard house at the point time because of an M.P. who is in my opinion working for stripes. They should not be allowed to insult a soldier, kick or slap him as I have seen done here. I intend
S64.Q97.C_1: to have some one pay an unexpected visit to a place where I have seen soldiers who were A.W.O.L. for reasons unknown kicked, slapped, and cursed at. I think it is very unnecessary for such a display of authority. An M.P. should be a soldiers friend, not his enemy as a soldier thinks of him now.
S64.Q97.Full: I do not see why an M.P. should try to be unreasonable with soldiers. There are some of us fellows who try to do the thing we think best. I am in the guard house at the point time because of an M.P. who is in my opinion working for stripes. They should not be allowed to insult a soldier, kick or slap him as I have seen done here. I intend to have some one pay an unexpected visit to a place where I have seen soldiers who were A.W.O.L. for reasons unknown kicked, slapped, and cursed at. I think it is very unnecessary for such a display of authority. An M.P. should be a soldiers friend, not his enemy as a soldier thinks of him now.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: All I can say is I only wish I were able to get back into uniform and also I would like a crack at those Dirty Japs and Germans across water because I am no dam good to my Country or uniform laying in some rotten Post Guard House while others are out fighting for their rights and freedom for all.
S64.Q97.Full: All I can say is I only wish I were able to get back into uniform and also I would like a crack at those Dirty Japs and Germans across water because I am no dam good to my Country or uniform laying in some rotten Post Guard House while others are out fighting for their rights and freedom for all.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I would like to be home with my family or be sent over seas to fight so that I could come home to my family before they forget me. [paragraph] I will never make a good soldier in the army.
S64.Q97.Full: I would like to be home with my family or be sent over seas to fight so that I could come home to my family before they forget me. [paragraph] I will never make a good soldier in the army.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I him a Wisconsin farming have be all my life born raise on one and still they drafted me. I have a farm in wisconsin of 460 arces and 56 heads of milk cows and 32 head of young stock and I left my camp in Fla to go home and do my summer work and now that have me in the Guard house I done see what the use of it is
S64.Q97.C_1: were I could be home doing my work there been in this place here in all I & problise could be discharge for the army too do my work. I would do a lot if you think it is not wother it let me know will you, hope you don't mind me saying this but a don't like the army a bit if I could have stay home on my farm I could have done a lot more than I him doing now. So if I can go back and do it. This is a prisoner of war that filled this out, so look at it good.
S64.Q97.Full: I him a Wisconsin farming have be all my life born raise on one and still they drafted me. I have a farm in wisconsin of 460 arces and 56 heads of milk cows and 32 head of young stock and I left my camp in Fla to go home and do my summer work and now that have me in the Guard house I done see what the use of it is were I could be home doing my work there been in this place here in all I & problise could be discharge for the army too do my work. I would do a lot if you think it is not wother it let me know will you, hope you don't mind me saying this but a don't like the army a bit if I could have stay home on my farm I could have done a lot more than I him doing now. So if I can go back and do it. This is a prisoner of war that filled this out, so look at it good.

S64.Q97.C_1: in his twenties. S64.Q97.Full: I am now in the guardhouse which is a very old and condemned building - unhealthy - insanitary, not enough air and no sunlight enters the [unclear] areas [/unclear] where the prisoners are quartered - both colored and white men are together - men with venereal disease are not segregated from the prisoners no distinction is made (as to type of work done) because of age - a man of my age cannot do so much hard work as a man  in his twenties. I feel that all enlisted men of thirty eight or over should be given [unclear] [/unclear] of a discharge - cannot see why if [unclear] [/unclear] was set as [unclear] [/unclear] date - simply when I am thirty eight I will [unclear] [/unclear] [unclear] [/unclear] any better physical condition than [unclear] [/unclear] have been at the same age on that date - Let me again stress the [unclear] [/unclear] that their should be a secret investigation of all stockade and [unclear] [/unclear] in the country - conditions (in some) [unclear] [/unclear] base then in most jails or penitentiaries - I know this from experience and any man who has been in one will verify this statement - I am have for a [unclear] [/unclear] I'll [unclear] [/unclear] and the lack of air at night [unclear] [/unclear] a severe cold - also because of the hard work I am suffering from varicose veins - cannot get treatment which in [unclear] [/unclear]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: First I would like to be reclassifated & be put where I can amount to something [paragraph] Thank you [paragraph] Sincerely
S64.Q97.Full: First I would like to be reclassifated & be put where I can amount to something [paragraph] Thank you [paragraph] Sincerely

S64.Q97.Full: When a man returns to a guard house more than once, and is punish buy making him G.I. [clean] floor after lites are out, and making him lose sleep, and taking meals away from him for every little thing, because it no fun to lose a meal and still have to work at nite.

S64.Q97.F: The only thing I find wrong his [is] that when you are in the guard house for AWOL [Absent Without Official Leave] that the Noncoms [non-commissioned officers] hit the prisoners when they [are] marching and most of the time they take your supper away from [you] for not standing at attention in ranks and this happened at Fort Sheridan [Lake County, Illinois] .
S64.Q97.Full: The only thing I find wrong his [is] that when you are in the guard house for AWOL [Absent Without Official Leave] that the Noncoms [non-commissioned officers] hit the prisoners when they [are] marching and most of the time they take your supper away from [you] for not standing at attention in ranks and this happened at Fort Sheridan [Lake County, Illinois] .

S64.Q97.F: I'm not at all happy in the army and I will never be. I would very much rather work in a defense plant 16 hrs [hours] a day seven days a week then be in the army.
S64.Q97.Full: I'm not at all happy in the army and I will never be. I would very much rather work in a defense plant 16 hrs [hours] a day seven days a week then be in the army.

S64.Q97.C_1: and is to independant. Also in this particular gaurd house they do not adhere to the articles of war in that they slap the boys for having their hat aim up which anyone can forget about.
S64.Q97.Full: (1) I personally would like either overseas duty combat that is or a discharge from the Army.[paragraph] (2) They are to [too] strict in the guard house and throw boys in what is populary called the hole for two [too] minor of an offense and the soldier of today loves his freedom to [too] much for that. and is to independant. Also in this particular gaurd house they do not adhere to the articles of war in that they slap the boys for having their hat aim up which anyone can forget about.

The navy offers better opportunities to advance yourself. You also lead a much cleaner life than the soldier and they don't stick you in a hole and leave you there for years or so.
