document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Why should I fight for freedom and never get any of it? Why should the people in this country hang my people for nothing [unclear] [/unclear] that. And I will go willing to fight but until there is a change you will never get me over sea
S64.Q97.Full: Why should I fight for freedom and never get any of it? Why should the people in this country hang my people for nothing [unclear] [/unclear] that. And I will go willing to fight but until there is a change you will never get me over sea

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: As a man that wants to do his part in this war I would like to be sent into the fight just as I am or be put back to my defense work. I can fight, but be damned if I can be ordered around by everyone. If I have to have more training and they send me to fight then give us our training as a man, not a damn dog. [paragraph] A man is better of working for
S64.Q97.C_1: his country as a defence [defense] worker than sitting in a ground house or picking up all the time. [paragraph]
S64.Q97.Full: As a man that wants to do his part in this war I would like to be sent into the fight just as I am or be put back to my defense work. I can fight, but be damned if I can be ordered around by everyone. If I have to have more training and they send me to fight then give us our training as a man, not a damn dog. [paragraph] A man is better of working for  his country as a defence [defense] worker than sitting in a ground house or picking up all the time. [paragraph]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Every man in the army should have at least 30 days a year to do as he pleases and after work or drill he should be as he was back home go where he won'ts[wants] with out pass As I said before we are not kids. There woulds be less A.W.O.L. if this were so,
S64.Q97.Full: Every man in the army should have at least 30 days a year to do as he pleases and after work or drill he should be as he was back home go where he won'ts[wants] with out pass As I said before we are not kids. There woulds be less A.W.O.L. if this were so,

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: 1. Just what will be the status of the negro after the war? 2. Is it right for guard house guards to call the prisoners sons of B, , cock suckers, and to kick them because they weren't in step or some minor fault? It happens here at Camp Sheridan. Here the American soldiers are treated worse the Jap, German or Italian prisoners.
S64.Q97.C_1: 3. Why does the U.S. Gov't waste so very much. Working at the dump here, I see good lumber, stacked and [underline] burned [/underline] . Three years ago I saw a whole 3-C camp torn down & burned by the N.Y.A. [paragraph] 4. At the present time I am in the guard house & I think unjustly. I had a pass (3 day) to go to Indiana - Mon - Thurs. morning on tuesday I was in Chicago & was picked up by the MP who said I was AWOL. I was not AWOL from my company however I was not at the designation of my pass. I had a return ticket also So far I've spent one week of Hell. The first day here I wished I were dead. For me I dont care it is just he worry and shame I brought upon y mother & family by being picked up by M.P's. [paragraph]
S64.Q97.Full: 1. Just what will be the status of the negro after the war? 2. Is it right for guard house guards to call the prisoners sons of B, , cock suckers, and to kick them because they weren't in step or some minor fault? It happens here at Camp Sheridan. Here the American soldiers are treated worse the Jap, German or Italian prisoners. 3. Why does the U.S. Gov't waste so very much. Working at the dump here, I see good lumber, stacked and [underline] burned [/underline] . Three years ago I saw a whole 3-C camp torn down & burned by the N.Y.A. [paragraph] 4. At the present time I am in the guard house & I think unjustly. I had a pass (3 day) to go to Indiana - Mon - Thurs. morning on tuesday I was in Chicago & was picked up by the MP who said I was AWOL. I was not AWOL from my company however I was not at the designation of my pass. I had a return ticket also So far I've spent one week of Hell. The first day here I wished I were dead. For me I dont care it is just he worry and shame I brought upon y mother & family by being picked up by M.P's. [paragraph]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Well the only remark that I would like to say is this: as a soldier I think I am a purty good one. But I don't think the Army give their soldiers as much priviledges as they should. For example, if they would give each soldier the priviage that due him like passes, furloughs and
S64.Q97.C_1: time off, their Would be less -AWOL- then they are now. For example I ben in the Army 12 months. I have had only one furlough. Another thing: my mother were sick in the hospitle [hospital] . They would not even let me go to visit her. Think life that make a soilder [soldier] feel like he is not treated fare. Then the next thing jump in his mind is to go over the hill.
S64.Q97.Full: Well the only remark that I would like to say is this: as a soldier I think I am a purty good one. But I don't think the Army give their soldiers as much priviledges as they should. For example, if they would give each soldier the priviage that due him like passes, furloughs and  time off, their Would be less -AWOL- then they are now. For example I ben in the Army 12 months. I have had only one furlough. Another thing: my mother were sick in the hospitle [hospital] . They would not even let me go to visit her. Think life that make a soilder [soldier] feel like he is not treated fare. Then the next thing jump in his mind is to go over the hill.

S64.Q97.F: I don't think a man on parole should be in the army
S64.Q97.Full: I don't think a man on parole should be in the army

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I wish the Army would realize and stop sending the soldiers from the north in the south because the civilian in the south treat the soldier like hell and we will be better soldier if we could be around home and would mine going over and fighting
S64.Q97.C_1: or driving for this country if we get treated like men. as you the people around hme will treat you nice. And it won't be all of this race prejudice in the north. And I realize that is where all of your trouble come in when the men from the north are sent down south.
S64.Q97.Full: I wish the Army would realize and stop sending the soldiers from the north in the south because the civilian in the south treat the soldier like hell and we will be better soldier if we could be around home and would mine going over and fighting  or driving for this country if we get treated like men. as you the people around hme will treat you nice. And it won't be all of this race prejudice in the north. And I realize that is where all of your trouble come in when the men from the north are sent down south.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: If they would only be a little more generous with furloughs. I am sure there would be a lot better army. There is a lot of fellows where I am at who would never of went A.W.O.L. [Absent Without Official Leave] if they could of had a little more time to home with the wife and daughter or you could of stationed them nearer to home. I am stationed 2,400 mi [miles] from home just for training purposes.
S64.Q97.C_1: I realize that wars are fought a long way from the U.S. but I would of made a better soilder [soldier] than I have if I could only of been nearer my home when I could get a week-end once in a while and I am not the only one then are 400,000 soilder in your guard houses now who feel the same way I do.
S64.Q97.Full: If they would only be a little more generous with furloughs. I am sure there would be a lot better army. There is a lot of fellows where I am at who would never of went A.W.O.L. [Absent Without Official Leave] if they could of had a little more time to home with the wife and daughter or you could of stationed them nearer to home. I am stationed 2,400 mi [miles] from home just for training purposes.  I realize that wars are fought a long way from the U.S. but I would of made a better soilder [soldier] than I have if I could only of been nearer my home when I could get a week-end once in a while and I am not the only one then are 400,000 soilder in your guard houses now who feel the same way I do.

S64.Q97.Full: if they would give a soldier a fair brake and a little more pay it would help a lot, if the girls in the defence factory could get less and a boy or a soldier more pay they would fight more for they country and if half of the white collar men at Washington were on the front lines the war would end overnight.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: The gaurd house at Fort Sheridan could be change they treat the souldiers like a slave, they beat us, put us in the hole on bread and wather, dont feed us enough, dont send us, back to our outfit soon enough, dont let us smoke enough, or write home enough make you miss supper for the
S64.Q97.C_1: slightest reason dont permit any breaks when you are working it is just like it is in germany and japan a slave house and the A.W.O.L. soldiers are the slaves
S64.Q97.Full: The gaurd house at Fort Sheridan could be change they treat the souldiers like a slave, they beat us, put us in the hole on bread and wather, dont feed us enough, dont send us, back to our outfit soon enough, dont let us smoke enough, or write home enough make you miss supper for the slightest reason dont permit any breaks when you are working it is just like it is in germany and japan a slave house and the A.W.O.L. soldiers are the slaves

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: When I returned to the states I was to get 30 days off but had to argue for a busy 10 day leave.
S64.Q97.F: I had a chance to get a C.P.D about two months ago and refused. Now, often seeing a little more of the bullshit we have to contend with I wish I had taken it. [paragraph] Officers are too much of chicken shits. They demand too much respect, especially these 90 day won [unclear] died, [/unclear] and often a
S64.Q97.C_1: lot of dissention is caused in an outfit by them. Over here they're mean but when overseas it's a different story. One hand washes the other which they are aware of, so, why can't they act the same way here as over there. How many officers during this war have been killed by our own troops??? Think it over.
S64.Q97.Full: I had a chance to get a C.P.D about two months ago and refused. Now, often seeing a little more of the bullshit we have to contend with I wish I had taken it. [paragraph] Officers are too much of chicken shits. They demand too much respect, especially these 90 day won [unclear] died, [/unclear] and often a  lot of dissention is caused in an outfit by them. Over here they're mean but when overseas it's a different story. One hand washes the other which they are aware of, so, why can't they act the same way here as over there. How many officers during this war have been killed by our own troops??? Think it over.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Since I got drafted my wife & I "broke up" [paragraph] I use to like the Army but one trip to Ft. Sheridan's Guard House & I Hate it.
S64.Q97.Full: Since I got drafted my wife & I "broke up" [paragraph] I use to like the Army but one trip to Ft. Sheridan's Guard House & I Hate it.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: I have never had a furlough or three day pass in over nine months. [ is handwritten after the text of answer 9]
S64.Q97.F: I have been in the Army Air Force since Nov. [November] 23, 1942. Since that time I have only received $10 in Army pay. I was shipped as far from my home as possible and have never in that length of time had even so much as a 3 day pass. I asked for permission to go 500 miles on a 29 hour pass to see my mother who was seriously hurt in an accident. They refused to let me have the permit
S64.Q97.C_1: even though I had plane reservations. I went anyway and took two extra days. This was my first and only time AWOL [Absent Without Official Leave] and for it I am serving a full 3 mo [month] sentence at Ft. Sheridan Illinois (Little Alcatraz). 2 weeks in this place would be punishment enough for the [underline] worst [/underline] crime. A prisoner is beaten for every wrong move he makes. By a Jap Sgt [Sergeant] at that. This is a hell hole and not fit for a dog to be in. If I had done something drastic it would not be so bad but 3 months and no time off for 2 days AWOL is certainly drastic. Also I would like to be married but while I'm in the GH [Guard House] and not receiving Army pay I cant do it. I was supposed to be released July 25 and for some inobvious [unknown] reason they are holding me overtime. This Guardhouse should be changed. Its full of cockroaches and bedbugs. Its over crowded to an extent that it is very unhealthful. A fellow's moral [morale] is not very high after a while in Ft. Sheridan Illinois.
S64.Q97.Full: I have been in the Army Air Force since Nov. [November] 23, 1942. Since that time I have only received $10 in Army pay. I was shipped as far from my home as possible and have never in that length of time had even so much as a 3 day pass. I asked for permission to go 500 miles on a 29 hour pass to see my mother who was seriously hurt in an accident. They refused to let me have the permit even though I had plane reservations. I went anyway and took two extra days. This was my first and only time AWOL [Absent Without Official Leave] and for it I am serving a full 3 mo [month] sentence at Ft. Sheridan Illinois (Little Alcatraz). 2 weeks in this place would be punishment enough for the [underline] worst [/underline] crime. A prisoner is beaten for every wrong move he makes. By a Jap Sgt [Sergeant] at that. This is a hell hole and not fit for a dog to be in. If I had done something drastic it would not be so bad but 3 months and no time off for 2 days AWOL is certainly drastic. Also I would like to be married but while I'm in the GH [Guard House] and not receiving Army pay I cant do it. I was supposed to be released July 25 and for some inobvious [unknown] reason they are holding me overtime. This Guardhouse should be changed. Its full of cockroaches and bedbugs. Its over crowded to an extent that it is very unhealthful. A fellow's moral [morale] is not very high after a while in Ft. Sheridan Illinois.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Treatment of Military Prisoners in Guardhouses should be regulated by the War Dept. Strongarm treatment on soldiers for disciplinary reasons should done away with strictly. Guardhouse prisoners should
S64.Q97.C_1: be treated as soldiers not as slaves or dogs like they do here at Fort Sheridan [Lake County, Illinois] . When a man leaves here he don't feel like a man, but like an animal, and there is but one thought on his mind, and that is revenge. And I am one of those who intend to get it either from those who have persecuted us or by going A.W.O.L. [Absent Without Official Leave] .
S64.Q97.Full: Treatment of Military Prisoners in Guardhouses should be regulated by the War Dept. Strongarm treatment on soldiers for disciplinary reasons should done away with strictly. Guardhouse prisoners should be treated as soldiers not as slaves or dogs like they do here at Fort Sheridan [Lake County, Illinois] . When a man leaves here he don't feel like a man, but like an animal, and there is but one thought on his mind, and that is revenge. And I am one of those who intend to get it either from those who have persecuted us or by going A.W.O.L. [Absent Without Official Leave] .

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: While in civilian life my folks used to get over a $100.00 a month and now since I'm in the army she only gets $ 72.00 a month and she can't meet her payments. I have five brothers & five sisters home all younger than myself.
S64.Q97.Full: While in civilian life my folks used to get over a $100.00 a month and now since I'm in the army she only gets $ 72.00 a month and she can't meet her payments. I have five brothers & five sisters home all younger than myself.

S64.Q97.C_1: Wife comes first then anything else I think So.
S64.Q97.Full: I just don't like the outfit I am in they don't treat you like a white man they treat you like a dog won't let you go on a pass or furlough or get married with-out persmoies that is why most of the boys go over the hill from all over the country because after all your mother and  Wife comes first then anything else I think So.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: This Army is run like the Kelly + Nash outfit you never get credit for what you know but who you know.
S64.Q97.Full: This Army is run like the Kelly + Nash outfit you never get credit for what you know but who you know.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Why do recruiting officers talk you into a dangerous branch then put you in another. My case I enlisted in the Paratroops, passed all exams and was thrown in the Infantry. If they had put me in the paratroops I wouldn't have gone A.W.O.L. and I would be a West Point Cadet today. It's the government's fault.
S64.Q97.Full: Why do recruiting officers talk you into a dangerous branch then put you in another. My case I enlisted in the Paratroops, passed all exams and was thrown in the Infantry. If they had put me in the paratroops I wouldn't have gone A.W.O.L. and I would be a West Point Cadet today. It's the government's fault.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: On furlough! I think a man could have at least 10 days out of 90 days for furlough if in this country. I don't see why the army is so bad about letting men home for a few days. And about taking care of the family at home. The allotments are poor and folks cant leave what they had before, they should increase them.
S64.Q97.C_1: to my [unclear] appensate [/unclear] a soldier sould have more leave and his family sould be their [insertion] [unclear] one [/unclear] [/insertion] better for by the goverment. And I think the boys who are married would have a better time in the army and would make better soldiers. If they can see there family well care for and see them more often. A example of a bad part of the army just to bring out what I mean. My brother was married about 2 years and was taken in to the army 17 months ago. he stayed in U.S.A. for 11 months and never had a furlough or gotten to see his wife since he left home. [paragraph] I say more furlough to soldier to see there familys back home
S64.Q97.Full: On furlough! I think a man could have at least 10 days out of 90 days for furlough if in this country. I don't see why the army is so bad about letting men home for a few days. And about taking care of the family at home. The allotments are poor and folks cant leave what they had before, they should increase them. to my [unclear] appensate [/unclear] a soldier sould have more leave and his family sould be their [insertion] [unclear] one [/unclear] [/insertion] better for by the goverment. And I think the boys who are married would have a better time in the army and would make better soldiers. If they can see there family well care for and see them more often. A example of a bad part of the army just to bring out what I mean. My brother was married about 2 years and was taken in to the army 17 months ago. he stayed in U.S.A. for 11 months and never had a furlough or gotten to see his wife since he left home. [paragraph] I say more furlough to soldier to see there familys back home

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: After a man comes back from over three years foreign service he should not be prejudiced against in the matter of furloughs & ratings. I've seen men not have a furlough for four years & come back here & see men with less than a year service go home two or three times. They also worked hard for their ratings & because of not being in
S64.Q97.C_1: an outfit long enough be reduced in favor of men that's maybe started with the outfit & have about 8 months service with it. All I can say is after putting quite a few years in Im finally convinced the Army is rotten & no good & I would not put in a day longer than I have to!
S64.Q97.Full: After a man comes back from over three years foreign service he should not be prejudiced against in the matter of furloughs & ratings. I've seen men not have a furlough for four years & come back here & see men with less than a year service go home two or three times. They also worked hard for their ratings & because of not being in  an outfit long enough be reduced in favor of men that's maybe started with the outfit & have about 8 months service with it. All I can say is after putting quite a few years in Im finally convinced the Army is rotten & no good & I would not put in a day longer than I have to!

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: 364 days a year would not be enough
S64.Q97.F: I believe this war is a political one and I do not believe the little guy will benefit from it as if he ever has, and, I further think that the people who have a lot at stake should fight instead of producing propaganda with their money inspiring the ignorant layman into thinking it is his war.
S64.Q97.Full: I believe this war is a political one and I do not believe the little guy will benefit from it as if he ever has, and, I further think that the people who have a lot at stake should fight instead of producing propaganda with their money inspiring the ignorant layman into thinking it is his war.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: In this last question #96 has the Army done my family any good, I should say not about 6 months after I went in the army my father died and he was sick for about a year and I never got to go home to see him and three weeks ago he died and I still am not home. It shure done a lot for me
S64.Q97.C_1: Most of the Army life is alright but as I said in some of the questions I answered there are two [too] many men in the Army who are not placed where they can do the most good if any such things as Myself I am a mechanic and I haven't seen a motor in 19 months And that isent [isn't] all I probly [probably] never will.
S64.Q97.Full: In this last question #96 has the Army done my family any good, I should say not about 6 months after I went in the army my father died and he was sick for about a year and I never got to go home to see him and three weeks ago he died and I still am not home. It shure done a lot for me  Most of the Army life is alright but as I said in some of the questions I answered there are two [too] many men in the Army who are not placed where they can do the most good if any such things as Myself I am a mechanic and I haven't seen a motor in 19 months And that isent [isn't] all I probly [probably] never will.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I haven't any thing much to say only i don't think that I'll now be a very good soldier. I'd be a lot better off back in civilian life, I can do a lot more good for my country.
S64.Q97.Full: I haven't any thing much to say only i don't think that I'll now be a very good soldier. I'd be a lot better off back in civilian life, I can do a lot more good for my country.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I feel that a man after a fair trial has not adjusted himself to the Army should be discharged or placed in a defense factory where he could be of some help. A man that continually gets in trouble + goes awol should be discharged. Some men if you kept them in the Army ten yrs. would never be soldiers.
S64.Q97.Full: I feel that a man after a fair trial has not adjusted himself to the Army should be discharged or placed in a defense factory where he could be of some help. A man that continually gets in trouble + goes awol should be discharged. Some men if you kept them in the Army ten yrs. would never be soldiers.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: First they should give a soldier a furlough each six month at least 14 days and then they would not have so many AWOL [Absent Without Official Leave] .
S64.Q97.Full: First they should give a soldier a furlough each six month at least 14 days and then they would not have so many AWOL [Absent Without Official Leave] .

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I do think married men with two or more children and over 30 yrs old should be discharged out of the army as the allotment the government gives is not enough to pay all the bills and buy food and still be able to give the children the kind of ease they need. I do think 10 million men in the service is too many men
S64.Q97.C_1: I feel that by married men being in the army is just going to brake [break] up homes.
S64.Q97.Full: I do think married men with two or more children and over 30 yrs old should be discharged out of the army as the allotment the government gives is not enough to pay all the bills and buy food and still be able to give the children the kind of ease they need. I do think 10 million men in the service is too many men I feel that by married men being in the army is just going to brake [break] up homes.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: The officers are not watched close enough, they get away with murder "literally" - There is not enough time for relaxation considering the hard work we do! towns near the camps are no damn good at all and the camps themselves don't afford any relaxation or off duty pleasure -! Inspections are silly and too much like
S64.Q97.C_1: an old maids home would do it.[paragraph] Ranking men and officers are always bucking for more rank and they don't care what they do to the men to get it. There are too many "old men" officers especially that take great joy in making life miserable for you such as Gestapo agents that don't know what the hell the score is themselves, food and living conditions could be improved.
S64.Q97.Full: The officers are not watched close enough, they get away with murder "literally" - There is not enough time for relaxation considering the hard work we do! towns near the camps are no damn good at all and the camps themselves don't afford any relaxation or off duty pleasure -! Inspections are silly and too much like an old maids home would do it.[paragraph] Ranking men and officers are always bucking for more rank and they don't care what they do to the men to get it. There are too many "old men" officers especially that take great joy in making life miserable for you such as Gestapo agents that don't know what the hell the score is themselves, food and living conditions could be improved.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think war makes it very hard on the familys at home, we should get this one over with in a hurry and then stay out if possible.
S64.Q97.Full: I think war makes it very hard on the familys at home, we should get this one over with in a hurry and then stay out if possible.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Certain men after being inducted are put into places in the army were they just waste time. They could be used in more important places. Men 30 years of age and over can't take what younger men can. They could fit in better places if given chance. Up till now the kids have been given better opportunities then men in their early 30's and over. Why I've tried myself to get a better place.
S64.Q97.C_1: But for being almost 31. I am handicapped because of a college education. Why not give us older men a chance. Younger men are better fighters on foot and all around fighting while men older are married and have things at home that [deletion] [/deletion] takes a lot out of their fighting ability, at one time I was quiet atheletic [athletic] but after twelve or fourteen years I feel all fogged out. I think the Army would [deletion] [/deletion] do a lot of it would check over on men from 28 to 38. Some men just can't take it.
S64.Q97.Full: Certain men after being inducted are put into places in the army were they just waste time. They could be used in more important places. Men 30 years of age and over can't take what younger men can. They could fit in better places if given chance. Up till now the kids have been given better opportunities then men in their early 30's and over. Why I've tried myself to get a better place. But for being almost 31. I am handicapped because of a college education. Why not give us older men a chance. Younger men are better fighters on foot and all around fighting while men older are married and have things at home that [deletion] [/deletion] takes a lot out of their fighting ability, at one time I was quiet atheletic [athletic] but after twelve or fourteen years I feel all fogged out. I think the Army would [deletion] [/deletion] do a lot of it would check over on men from 28 to 38. Some men just can't take it.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Officers should try to raise moral instead of busting up whats left of the moral. Not to talk against company when they are trying their best
S64.Q97.Full: Officers should try to raise moral instead of busting up whats left of the moral. Not to talk against company when they are trying their best

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: In our outfit which I am quite proud - sometimes - I don't see enough cooperation among the men. Too many "goldbricks" and no cooperation with the "noncoms". There are many privates in our outfit they know much more than any "non-Com" I've always said, "
S64.Q97.C_1: Never tell anyone to do anything unless you do it yourself. Our "non-coms" [non-commissioned officers] are pretty fair for the duties around camp, but in combat I personally would hate to be with them.[paragraph] On most problems the men aren't told enough "info" and consequently when the problem is finished no one knows what happened. Another thing during my basic training on various things, in fact most of them, all we do is "simulate," we have this, and have that, no actual material or equipment to work with. Men often get tired of simulating. Many organizations could be greatly improved if this were corrected. The cooperation of the men would greatly improved. Many officers, company commanders don't act human toward the men, they could be much thoughtful.
S64.Q97.Full: In our outfit which I am quite proud - sometimes - I don't see enough cooperation among the men. Too many "goldbricks" and no cooperation with the "noncoms". There are many privates in our outfit they know much more than any "non-Com" I've always said, "  Never tell anyone to do anything unless you do it yourself. Our "non-coms" [non-commissioned officers] are pretty fair for the duties around camp, but in combat I personally would hate to be with them.[paragraph] On most problems the men aren't told enough "info" and consequently when the problem is finished no one knows what happened. Another thing during my basic training on various things, in fact most of them, all we do is "simulate," we have this, and have that, no actual material or equipment to work with. Men often get tired of simulating. Many organizations could be greatly improved if this were corrected. The cooperation of the men would greatly improved. Many officers, company commanders don't act human toward the men, they could be much thoughtful.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: We should be given a chance for the Branch of service we think we could benefit the United States. Put us in Branch of service we would be interested in. I don't think southern boys should be sent north and northern boys south.
S64.Q97.C_1: they shouldnt have drafted 18 & 19 yr old boys because there are to many dodgeing the draft.. Not enough entertainment in this camp. [unclear] [/unclear] boys in Branch of service they was for if it can be possible.
S64.Q97.Full: We should be given a chance for the Branch of service we think we could benefit the United States. Put us in Branch of service we would be interested in. I don't think southern boys should be sent north and northern boys south. they shouldnt have drafted 18 & 19 yr old boys because there are to many dodgeing the draft.. Not enough entertainment in this camp. [unclear] [/unclear] boys in Branch of service they was for if it can be possible.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I believe that Japan proper should be bombed with everything this country has, get at the root of her empire, instead of wasting men and materials so heavily on the Islands which could prolong the war for years.
S64.Q97.Full: I believe that Japan proper should be bombed with everything this country has, get at the root of her empire, instead of wasting men and materials so heavily on the Islands which could prolong the war for years.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I believe that the army should be more particular about the officers. Our officers have had a good education in warfare but they are not practical enough when in the field. Some of our officers seem to take no interest in the mens welfare and think only of their own pleasures. The majority of our officers make a bad impression on their troops as far as morals go. [paragraph] As for the non-commissioned officers I believe that at least half are not suited for their jobs.
S64.Q97.C_1: Non Com. seem to be chosen for seniority, rather than ability. We should have better non coms. Our Battalion commander does not have any idea of how to raise morale. The morale of our battalion is probably the lowest in the army. I believe that a furlough is the greatest morale builder there is but they come too few and far between.
S64.Q97.Full: I believe that the army should be more particular about the officers. Our officers have had a good education in warfare but they are not practical enough when in the field. Some of our officers seem to take no interest in the mens welfare and think only of their own pleasures. The majority of our officers make a bad impression on their troops as far as morals go. [paragraph] As for the non-commissioned officers I believe that at least half are not suited for their jobs. Non Com. seem to be chosen for seniority, rather than ability. We should have better non coms. Our Battalion commander does not have any idea of how to raise morale. The morale of our battalion is probably the lowest in the army. I believe that a furlough is the greatest morale builder there is but they come too few and far between.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: In my own honest opinion I believe that there is favoritism in the Army, I don't know whether it's just in this outfit I'm in now or if that's the procedure throughout the whole Army. I'm sure there is a lot of soldiers who have no rating at all and are a better soldier than some of the non-com's. Another thing I can't understand is how some soldiers who had aircraft experience are
S64.Q97.C_1: placed in certain basic outfits while soldiers who hardly know any thing in regard to an airplane are in the Air Corps ground crew. [paragraph] One more thing, why is it that some organizations get week-end passes, passed during the week without no trouble while others really have a hard time getting a 12 hour pass. Also other organizations get more time to them selves while others whenever there on their own time are always given something to do . I understand this is the Army and I know liberties should not be demanded too much but when one outfit can get breaks so can the other.
S64.Q97.Full: In my own honest opinion I believe that there is favoritism in the Army, I don't know whether it's just in this outfit I'm in now or if that's the procedure throughout the whole Army. I'm sure there is a lot of soldiers who have no rating at all and are a better soldier than some of the non-com's. Another thing I can't understand is how some soldiers who had aircraft experience are placed in certain basic outfits while soldiers who hardly know any thing in regard to an airplane are in the Air Corps ground crew. [paragraph] One more thing, why is it that some organizations get week-end passes, passed during the week without no trouble while others really have a hard time getting a 12 hour pass. Also other organizations get more time to them selves while others whenever there on their own time are always given something to do . I understand this is the Army and I know liberties should not be demanded too much but when one outfit can get breaks so can the other.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I realize that the army has to have a just deal of discipline because there are small number of soldiers who abuse section privileges. I also think that a new officer is disliked more than an old one, because he hasn't yet handled enough men to know what men as a majority like to do. [paragraph] I think that soldiers should be allowed to go farther from camp because townspeople near an army camp get money mad and don't
S64.Q97.C_1: treat a soldier as he would like to be treated.
S64.Q97.Full: I realize that the army has to have a just deal of discipline because there are small number of soldiers who abuse section privileges. I also think that a new officer is disliked more than an old one, because he hasn't yet handled enough men to know what men as a majority like to do. [paragraph] I think that soldiers should be allowed to go farther from camp because townspeople near an army camp get money mad and don't  treat a soldier as he would like to be treated.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: About the only remark I have is, "I would like to go across and see some action. Not sit around or mostly walk around which is not needed any longer. I think I have had enough training to do something worth while."
S64.Q97.Full: About the only remark I have is, "I would like to go across and see some action. Not sit around or mostly walk around which is not needed any longer. I think I have had enough training to do something worth while."

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think furloughs should be given equal, not just good friends of the [underline] First Sergeant [/underline] .[paragraph] To many ratings given by favertisms.
S64.Q97.Full: I think furloughs should be given equal, not just good friends of the [underline] First Sergeant [/underline] .[paragraph] To many ratings given by favertisms.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: About a soldier going A.W.O.L. [Absent Without Official Leave] . Sometimes a man has troubles at home. He should be considered for a leave of a few days to help straighten things out. After all keeping a man away from somebody sick at home is certainly not going to keep his work up as it should or toughen him up.[paragraph] About furloughs. If a death occurs in a mans [man's] family and is given an emergency ...
S64.Q97.C_1: furlough. After a period of five months from this emergency furlough why should he be refused a regular furlough. For many others and myself I think it's a lousy idea. It also can be straightened out.
S64.Q97.Full: About a soldier going A.W.O.L. [Absent Without Official Leave] . Sometimes a man has troubles at home. He should be considered for a leave of a few days to help straighten things out. After all keeping a man away from somebody sick at home is certainly not going to keep his work up as it should or toughen him up.[paragraph] About furloughs. If a death occurs in a mans [man's] family and is given an emergency ... furlough. After a period of five months from this emergency furlough why should he be refused a regular furlough. For many others and myself I think it's a lousy idea. It also can be straightened out.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I don't believe that the soldiers here are getting the food that they should get. It seems that the only one who eats in our company are the cooks. [paragraph] As for recreation about all we have is shows. [paragraph] We can't go to the service club cafeteria without our C.O's [Commanding Officer's] O'K. [paragraph] The officers that we have had have shown a lack of ability to handle
S64.Q97.C_1: men. They are not getting enough schooling in my estimation. Most of them are bluffing their way along. We need more officers that are willing to go through the same thing that the men do and go across where the men are needed. [paragraph] Another fault is that the men that come into the army are not treated like men but like little babies that can't walk yet. I think that psycology [psychology] should be taught to our officers and non-coms so that they know how to handle men. [paragraph] I also believe that a soldier should be allowed to go into the branch that he selects since he will do better in the field he chooses. In some cases of course there will have to be exceptions. [paragraph] Some outfits believe in holding a man to his job when he is best qualified for another type. This should not be.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't believe that the soldiers here are getting the food that they should get. It seems that the only one who eats in our company are the cooks. [paragraph] As for recreation about all we have is shows. [paragraph] We can't go to the service club cafeteria without our C.O's [Commanding Officer's] O'K. [paragraph] The officers that we have had have shown a lack of ability to handle  men. They are not getting enough schooling in my estimation. Most of them are bluffing their way along. We need more officers that are willing to go through the same thing that the men do and go across where the men are needed. [paragraph] Another fault is that the men that come into the army are not treated like men but like little babies that can't walk yet. I think that psycology [psychology] should be taught to our officers and non-coms so that they know how to handle men. [paragraph] I also believe that a soldier should be allowed to go into the branch that he selects since he will do better in the field he chooses. In some cases of course there will have to be exceptions. [paragraph] Some outfits believe in holding a man to his job when he is best qualified for another type. This should not be.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think Civilian War workers such as the coal miners back east should be drafted or shot for going on a strike in War times & I personaly think John L Lewis should be thrown in jail for the duration. I think all soldiers living more than 2000 miles from home should get at least 20 day furloughs & at least every 4 to six months.
S64.Q97.Full: I think Civilian War workers such as the coal miners back east should be drafted or shot for going on a strike in War times & I personaly think John L Lewis should be thrown in jail for the duration. I think all soldiers living more than 2000 miles from home should get at least 20 day furloughs & at least every 4 to six months.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: We came back to the states from the Alcan Highway in March too sit on a furlough & returned then we have been kicked around so much that every one of the four truck cadres are ready to do most any thing except what they should do. We had a good bunch to start with but I wouldn't say so much for us now. Some one has evidently made an
S64.Q97.C_1: error & no one wants to take the blame for it. It doesn't stand to reason that they can have 28 men lay around this way that is just a waste of the money spent on War bonds. At least it's no encouragement for buying more.[paragraph] We would all like to see something happen. This being kicked around & dog robbing [running errands for officers] for every outfit in the army is very disgusting if you don't believe it try it some time.
S64.Q97.Full: We came back to the states from the Alcan Highway in March too sit on a furlough & returned then we have been kicked around so much that every one of the four truck cadres are ready to do most any thing except what they should do. We had a good bunch to start with but I wouldn't say so much for us now. Some one has evidently made an error & no one wants to take the blame for it. It doesn't stand to reason that they can have 28 men lay around this way that is just a waste of the money spent on War bonds. At least it's no encouragement for buying more.[paragraph] We would all like to see something happen. This being kicked around & dog robbing [running errands for officers] for every outfit in the army is very disgusting if you don't believe it try it some time.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: If we end this war in a stalemate our chance for Victory is lost. We do not need politics in the Army. We have too many leaders through politics who are leaders only in name - example the army at Guadalcanal - 48 officers had to be relieved after the first battle. [unclear] ??? [/unclear] McArthur something to fight with! Make the prisoners in this country work. Our folks have hard enough time feeding our own army.
S64.Q97.Full: If we end this war in a stalemate our chance for Victory is lost. We do not need politics in the Army. We have too many leaders through politics who are leaders only in name - example the army at Guadalcanal - 48 officers had to be relieved after the first battle. [unclear] ??? [/unclear] McArthur something to fight with! Make the prisoners in this country work. Our folks have hard enough time feeding our own army.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Why is the army taking in so many physical unfit men when they are needed in war plants & so forth? I myself have only been fit for duty half the time I've been in the army when if [unclear] out [/unclear] could have taken care of myself & been a lot better help to my country.
S64.Q97.Full: Why is the army taking in so many physical unfit men when they are needed in war plants & so forth? I myself have only been fit for duty half the time I've been in the army when if [unclear] out [/unclear] could have taken care of myself & been a lot better help to my country.

S64.Q97.F: It hell
S64.Q97.Full: It hell

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: The United States should inaugurate a definate policy on race and religious discrimination in the army. Jews and Negroes are continuously being made the butt of jokes. My Captain insists on calling Negroes, niggers. Ridicule of Negroes is too often left unpunished. The Jews are looked
S64.Q97.C_1: upon with disfavor. [paragraph] From the time I was a private until my present rank, it was necessary for me to fight for my rights in the army because I'm a Jew. [paragraph] What are we fighting for, if not to abolish the slavery of fascism? Why allow rabble rousers and fascist in our midst, when we are supposed to be dying to preserve democracy. Let us look for a full freedom. [paragraph]
S64.Q97.Full: The United States should inaugurate a definate policy on race and religious discrimination in the army. Jews and Negroes are continuously being made the butt of jokes. My Captain insists on calling Negroes, niggers. Ridicule of Negroes is too often left unpunished. The Jews are looked upon with disfavor. [paragraph] From the time I was a private until my present rank, it was necessary for me to fight for my rights in the army because I'm a Jew. [paragraph] What are we fighting for, if not to abolish the slavery of fascism? Why allow rabble rousers and fascist in our midst, when we are supposed to be dying to preserve democracy. Let us look for a full freedom. [paragraph]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: It has worked a hardship upon them on the farm to get their work done. Many times strenous [strenuous] labor and too long hours for health.
S64.Q97.Full: It has worked a hardship upon them on the farm to get their work done. Many times strenous [strenuous] labor and too long hours for health.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: A person hates to see their lifes work of saving and slaving go to pot. Help is very scarce and a farmer cannot compete on the range. Bid for them as other war time jobs but don't worry we'll eat when its over. Do you think you will?
S64.Q97.Full: A person hates to see their lifes work of saving and slaving go to pot. Help is very scarce and a farmer cannot compete on the range. Bid for them as other war time jobs but don't worry we'll eat when its over. Do you think you will?

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: Too many unnecessary restrictions.
S64.Q97.F: I would like to see some simplified regulations be issued by the War Department so that there will be less red tape and muddleing. I can quote many regulations that may be and usually are interpreted in three or four different ways. Half the time on this post is spent wading around foolish regulations. Some civilian employees of this post are incompetent in their present jobs. Some of the
S64.Q97.C_1: officers could be reclassified as to their capabilities in their present position. Too many officers let their rank go to their heads. These officers do not lead their men - They sit in a jeep and issue orders by the thousands. Instead of treating the men as soldiers they treat them as dogs. Some of the above mentioned officers are that way because they want to make a big impression on their superiors. The men who serve under this type of officer do not respect him at all. I would safely say that this type of officer stands a good chance of being shot by his own men on the battlefield.
S64.Q97.Full: I would like to see some simplified regulations be issued by the War Department so that there will be less red tape and muddleing. I can quote many regulations that may be and usually are interpreted in three or four different ways. Half the time on this post is spent wading around foolish regulations. Some civilian employees of this post are incompetent in their present jobs. Some of the officers could be reclassified as to their capabilities in their present position. Too many officers let their rank go to their heads. These officers do not lead their men - They sit in a jeep and issue orders by the thousands. Instead of treating the men as soldiers they treat them as dogs. Some of the above mentioned officers are that way because they want to make a big impression on their superiors. The men who serve under this type of officer do not respect him at all. I would safely say that this type of officer stands a good chance of being shot by his own men on the battlefield.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I feel that the army is too much of a political set up. That is the men too often receive their promotions etc because they know the right people or do things for only ones who have the power to give them their promotions. I have also seen cases of ratings being practically bought.
S64.Q97.Full: I feel that the army is too much of a political set up. That is the men too often receive their promotions etc because they know the right people or do things for only ones who have the power to give them their promotions. I have also seen cases of ratings being practically bought.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think that the Commissioned officers of our Army have too many privileges that are not given to the enlisted men and that officer that have been commissioned from a O.C.S. seem to have a tendency of over rating them selves. At the same time they are jealous of their rank and do not give men of ability equal to theirs a chance that thex themselves had.
S64.Q97.C_1: It is my pet gripe that officers should not [underline] but do [/underline] eat better than the enlisted men. The E.M. [enlisted men] do the harder work & have the poorer eats. [paragraph] No soldiers ever looked at a advertisement or a publication in the magazines & papers showing the public what, how much, & how the Army eats without getting a laugh. They all seem over done, and also after reading how well the Army places its men. they say we are placed where we are best suited. And in my own case for example I was a well known skeet shot in one of the western states. Now I'm placed in the medics & haven't even held a gun in my hands since my induction, while at the same time men from cities who didn't anything about a gun or how to shoot it have been placed in combat service and a lot of time & training has been used on them. I might add that I'm General Service not a 4F commando, which is usually found in the medics.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that the Commissioned officers of our Army have too many privileges that are not given to the enlisted men and that officer that have been commissioned from a O.C.S. seem to have a tendency of over rating them selves. At the same time they are jealous of their rank and do not give men of ability equal to theirs a chance that thex themselves had. It is my pet gripe that officers should not [underline] but do [/underline] eat better than the enlisted men. The E.M. [enlisted men] do the harder work & have the poorer eats. [paragraph] No soldiers ever looked at a advertisement or a publication in the magazines & papers showing the public what, how much, & how the Army eats without getting a laugh. They all seem over done, and also after reading how well the Army places its men. they say we are placed where we are best suited. And in my own case for example I was a well known skeet shot in one of the western states. Now I'm placed in the medics & haven't even held a gun in my hands since my induction, while at the same time men from cities who didn't anything about a gun or how to shoot it have been placed in combat service and a lot of time & training has been used on them. I might add that I'm General Service not a 4F commando, which is usually found in the medics.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: We are at a camp mid-way between the main Post & town. The busses are crowded and lots of civilians who are earning their living on the army post drive by in cars with room but do not take the time to stop and give us a ride. Are we not good enough to ride with these people? [paragraph] This is the only cause that makes us wonder what these people would
S64.Q97.C_1: As if we didn't think it any more worth fighting for than.
S64.Q97.Full: We are at a camp mid-way between the main Post & town. The busses are crowded and lots of civilians who are earning their living on the army post drive by in cars with room but do not take the time to stop and give us a ride. Are we not good enough to ride with these people? [paragraph] This is the only cause that makes us wonder what these people would  As if we didn't think it any more worth fighting for than.
