S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q96.M_marginalia: [answer 3 was checked but the check mark has been scratched out]
S64.Q97.F: well I have an old mom on back home and she rased me and she 82 years of age and can't get out to do any thing and she got no one to do any thing for her and she [unclear] [/unclear] her life no one with heat all and I got a [unclear] barn [/unclear] no one there to look after the place. I think I would be more benfit at home than here.
S64.Q97.Full: well I have an old mom on back home and she rased me and she 82 years of age and can't get out to do any thing and she got no one to do any thing for her and she [unclear] [/unclear] her life no one with heat all and I got a [unclear] barn [/unclear] no one there to look after the place. I think I would be more benfit at home than here.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: Men my age should be at home with family as long as possiable [possible] . I think I could be of more servise [service] doing a defence [defense] job, although I am willing to do as much as possible either way.
S64.Q97.C_1: Regular Army men should be considered more after this war than before? our army was too weak at the beginning, This should wise some of our leader up.
S64.Q97.Full: Men my age should be at home with family as long as possiable [possible] . I think I could be of more servise [service] doing a defence [defense] job, although I am willing to do as much as possible either way. Regular Army men should be considered more after this war than before? our army was too weak at the beginning, This should wise some of our leader up.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: There is too much confusion. The officers are not trained enough and are influenced by privates and PFC. On the problems in the field the men do no know what is expected of them because they have not been trained well by the 90 day wonders that call themselves officers. The 1st Sgt. and first three grades are only there because they have been in the army a good many years
S64.Q97.C_1: and are mostly regular army men. The 1st Sgt [sergeant] in our company made the grand total of 89 on his I.Q. test and attended school for his entire life at least four or five years. He does not know how to spell the most simple words when he writes up his reports and murders the English language whenever he open his mouth.[paragraph] There is also too much of this hurry up and wait. Hurry to a certain spot at top speed and then wait a half hour. Also too many tests, reviews and talks in our time instead of between 7:30 and 5:00.
S64.Q97.Full: There is too much confusion. The officers are not trained enough and are influenced by privates and PFC. On the problems in the field the men do no know what is expected of them because they have not been trained well by the 90 day wonders that call themselves officers. The 1st Sgt. and first three grades are only there because they have been in the army a good many years and are mostly regular army men. The 1st Sgt [sergeant] in our company made the grand total of 89 on his I.Q. test and attended school for his entire life at least four or five years. He does not know how to spell the most simple words when he writes up his reports and murders the English language whenever he open his mouth.[paragraph] There is also too much of this hurry up and wait. Hurry to a certain spot at top speed and then wait a half hour. Also too many tests, reviews and talks in our time instead of between 7:30 and 5:00.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I wish the Politicians in this country thought as much of men's lives as they do a vote. Some of them think you can always get another man but not another vote.
S64.Q97.Full: I wish the Politicians in this country thought as much of men's lives as they do a vote. Some of them think you can always get another man but not another vote.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I was drafted into the Army but my heart is in the Navy who turned me down because of bad eyes. However I am learning to like the army rapidly.
S64.Q97.Full: I was drafted into the Army but my heart is in the Navy who turned me down because of bad eyes. However I am learning to like the army rapidly.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think men are put at jobs they dont like to much and C.O.'s pick their friends for N.C.O's too much. [paragraph]
S64.Q97.Full: I think men are put at jobs they dont like to much and C.O.'s pick their friends for N.C.O's too much. [paragraph]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: Well we don't get enought time off. Because a guy's a corpal, he gets out of all details works, just a certain bunch gets all of the work. The army wants you to be on the ball all the time but when their's a break for a soldier the officers don't give it to us. You always wait on them. Too much picked non com.
S64.Q97.Full: Well we don't get enought time off. Because a guy's a corpal, he gets out of all details works, just a certain bunch gets all of the work. The army wants you to be on the ball all the time but when their's a break for a soldier the officers don't give it to us. You always wait on them. Too much picked non com.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Soldiers of other Divisions are given more privileges than others mainly us, being closer to large towns helps a lot.
S64.Q97.Full: Soldiers of other Divisions are given more privileges than others mainly us, being closer to large towns helps a lot.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I am in the kitchen, first cook holding T/5 rating [Technician Fifth Grade] , not enough help. The last 9 days problems we must have had 2 hours sleep wen [Wednesday?] night. No chance to wash our clothes. Rest of company off when in bivouac except kitchen help and cooks. It is 3 times I told the ...
S64.Q97.C_1: mess sergraent I wanted out of the kitchens. The next 10 days problem starting tomorrow ending I quit. I told him so we are taking for a risk. [paragraph] Furloughs. - 10 days isn't enough with out traveling time. [paragraph]
S64.Q97.Full: I am in the kitchen, first cook holding T/5 rating [Technician Fifth Grade] , not enough help. The last 9 days problems we must have had 2 hours sleep wen [Wednesday?] night. No chance to wash our clothes. Rest of company off when in bivouac except kitchen help and cooks. It is 3 times I told the ... mess sergraent I wanted out of the kitchens. The next 10 days problem starting tomorrow ending I quit. I told him so we are taking for a risk. [paragraph] Furloughs. - 10 days isn't enough with out traveling time. [paragraph]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Why couldn't this examination been given during duty hours instead of after duty hours, we had a chance to have a little time off.
S64.Q97.Full: Why couldn't this examination been given during duty hours instead of after duty hours, we had a chance to have a little time off.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: Too much ass sucking - fellows who work hardest to the job not given enough credit - too much double crossing to get rating. Not enough attention given to leadership, too many poor leaders in Army. Selective Service could have done a lot better job placing men. and C.O.s in units do not seem to advance sufficient initiative.
S64.Q97.C_1: along same line. Too many men not doing much such as men in Service Commands - poor use of manpower, would say we could do the present job with 25% less men.
S64.Q97.Full: Too much ass sucking - fellows who work hardest to the job not given enough credit - too much double crossing to get rating. Not enough attention given to leadership, too many poor leaders in Army. Selective Service could have done a lot better job placing men. and C.O.s in units do not seem to advance sufficient initiative. along same line. Too many men not doing much such as men in Service Commands - poor use of manpower, would say we could do the present job with 25% less men.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Indecision on the part of the officers is very irritating to the men. Officers in charge of Engineers - should have some contact with construction outside before they are used to instruct men from actual conditions and with far more experience than themselves. Army manuals are very good but they should be gotten away from at times. Every thing can't be done by the numbers
S64.Q97.C_1: There are short cuts in civilian life that men knowing these methods should be allowed to use. Cigar salesmen cannot be made into first class Engineers because they go to a 3 month intensive manual course. They must have the proper background to add this training to.
S64.Q97.Full: Indecision on the part of the officers is very irritating to the men. Officers in charge of Engineers - should have some contact with construction outside before they are used to instruct men from actual conditions and with far more experience than themselves. Army manuals are very good but they should be gotten away from at times. Every thing can't be done by the numbers There are short cuts in civilian life that men knowing these methods should be allowed to use. Cigar salesmen cannot be made into first class Engineers because they go to a 3 month intensive manual course. They must have the proper background to add this training to.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: It is possible to get more out of a person if he is placed where he would like to be then where he is sometime sent [paragraph] For if a person knows of nothing and is placed where he would want to go he will learn more readily
S64.Q97.Full: It is possible to get more out of a person if he is placed where he would like to be then where he is sometime sent [paragraph] For if a person knows of nothing and is placed where he would want to go he will learn more readily

S64.Q97.Full: on furloughs I think a man in the service as long as I have been that is 9 mos. [months] should have more than 8 days for a furlough

S64.Q97.F: I would like to get in the merchant Marines [deletion] [/deletion] I feel my service would be much better there than in the Army I was there for 3 months and sure would like to get back there so if there is any possible chance please leave the 327 Engineer know about it
S64.Q97.Full: I would like to get in the merchant Marines [deletion] [/deletion] I feel my service would be much better there than in the Army I was there for 3 months and sure would like to get back there so if there is any possible chance please leave the 327 Engineer know about it

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: A well trained Army without any [deletion] equipment [/deletion] moral is no Army at all. Some of the officers, when they give a command or tell an Enlisted Man what to do, ought to remember that the Enlisted Man [underline] is [/underline] a [underline] man [/underline] and not a dog at their feet. Like I said before in this paper. I was born in Germany
S64.Q97.C_1: I was a little boy when I came over. I was raised in this country, educated here, learned its [deletion] [/deletion] language and customs, got a job here, my girl here, my folks here. Every thing a person could ever dream of having I have or did have. And I owe it all to America. I'll fight for the freedom of this country and if necessary I'll die for it. I'd be willing to go across today if I had the chance.
S64.Q97.Full: A well trained Army without any [deletion] equipment [/deletion] moral is no Army at all. Some of the officers, when they give a command or tell an Enlisted Man what to do, ought to remember that the Enlisted Man [underline] is [/underline] a [underline] man [/underline] and not a dog at their feet. Like I said before in this paper. I was born in Germany I was a little boy when I came over. I was raised in this country, educated here, learned its [deletion] [/deletion] language and customs, got a job here, my girl here, my folks here. Every thing a person could ever dream of having I have or did have. And I owe it all to America. I'll fight for the freedom of this country and if necessary I'll die for it. I'd be willing to go across today if I had the chance.

S64.Q97.Full: A little more recreation facilities and less of this dog-robbing for Officers within and out of garrison. They are depending on the EM [Enlisted Men] too much to take care of their difficulties & Personal Equipment.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)

S64.Q97.F: Personally I think that there are lots of men like myself that were on 100% war work that could do a lot more to help win the war at home than they can here, in some cases war work is just as important as fighting.
S64.Q97.Full: Personally I think that there are lots of men like myself that were on 100% war work that could do a lot more to help win the war at home than they can here, in some cases war work is just as important as fighting.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)

S64.Q97.F: Yes, Its about the morale in this camp very poor Infact the B. C. says the hell with morale, their leadership is very poor, [unclear] should have someone to come around & ask men personally what they think about their unit, In that way you would get facts & could correct things before they get to far. Our officers need more schooling, some are very poor & act just like Boys. This is really a fact in the Camp.
S64.Q97.Full: Yes, Its about the morale in this camp very poor Infact the B. C. says the hell with morale, their leadership is very poor, [unclear] should have someone to come around & ask men personally what they think about their unit, In that way you would get facts & could correct things before they get to far. Our officers need more schooling, some are very poor & act just like Boys. This is really a fact in the Camp.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Not as much recreation here as we should have. Don't have much to do. Also many of these southern people are prejudiced against the Damn Yankees and really show it. Also to much partiality in the battery.
S64.Q97.Full: Not as much recreation here as we should have. Don't have much to do. Also many of these southern people are prejudiced against the Damn Yankees and really show it. Also to much partiality in the battery.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I don't think the Army does full justice to new men when they are classified for different branches of the service. As a result I think there are many misfits who would be excellent soldiers were they doing some type of work that would fit in with their past training. For example I have mechanical training and I am now working on radio which does not arouse my interest in the least.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't think the Army does full justice to new men when they are classified for different branches of the service. As a result I think there are many misfits who would be excellent soldiers were they doing some type of work that would fit in with their past training. For example I have mechanical training and I am now working on radio which does not arouse my interest in the least.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: - One officer-EM problem - why should there be such a gulf between them? We have had orders to refrain from talking to them on personal matters or as one human to another. [paragraph[ - Saluting - why should I have to salute an officer I don't know - he's
S64.Q97.C_1: do a much better job if I knew why but no one ever tells us what we're doing things for. It's a sort of theirs not to reason why. Men [unclear] had [/unclear] to do or die attitude which seems very stupid. [paragraph] - Why are so many [unclear] tours [/unclear] and useless ceremonies used? I suppose in a peace time army such formality keeps a garrison busy but in war time? [paragraph] - Why do so many men + especially non coms think that yelling + profanity are the only ways to get a job done. I respond to a request much better than to an order - but then I'm not a soldier and probably don't understand such a system! [paragraph] It seems to me that the army is far too big - a more selected group for fighting and a larger group remaining on war production would feed the nation. I've seen too many poor soldiers who were excellent farmers, mechanics and irreplaceable [unclear] experts [/unclear] in production. [paragraph] I realize I'm an "old man" (age 40) and was an art teacher in a University before being drafted. I tried for camouflage which I would be very good at and ended up in FA as a mathematician which I never was any good at so - [unclear] skip [/unclear] it!
S64.Q97.Full: - One officer-EM problem - why should there be such a gulf between them? We have had orders to refrain from talking to them on personal matters or as one human to another. [paragraph[ - Saluting - why should I have to salute an officer I don't know - he's do a much better job if I knew why but no one ever tells us what we're doing things for. It's a sort of theirs not to reason why. Men [unclear] had [/unclear] to do or die attitude which seems very stupid. [paragraph] - Why are so many [unclear] tours [/unclear] and useless ceremonies used? I suppose in a peace time army such formality keeps a garrison busy but in war time? [paragraph] - Why do so many men + especially non coms think that yelling + profanity are the only ways to get a job done. I respond to a request much better than to an order - but then I'm not a soldier and probably don't understand such a system! [paragraph] It seems to me that the army is far too big - a more selected group for fighting and a larger group remaining on war production would feed the nation. I've seen too many poor soldiers who were excellent farmers, mechanics and irreplaceable [unclear] experts [/unclear] in production. [paragraph] I realize I'm an "old man" (age 40) and was an art teacher in a University before being drafted. I tried for camouflage which I would be very good at and ended up in FA as a mathematician which I never was any good at so - [unclear] skip [/unclear] it!

Have it so you don't have to buy your ratings from a non-com above you. Make non-coms obey orders and bust them if they don't. Then
S64.Q97.C_1: get away with a lot of dirt that would bust anyone below a staff sgt, rating Tell the officers were men and they dont have all the brains even if they think they do

S64.Q97.C_1: as a Sgt but the B.C. won't let me go but I'm going to mess up or go to him about it again if he don't do anything for me soon

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Speaking from an enlisted mans standpoint, I don't think the enlisted man is given justice. The Commissioned officer or at least most of the ones that I have had dealings with are just waiting for the chance to reduce some enlisted man or to give him trouble of some sort. I realize that discipline in the army is a very important factor, but when a man is commissioned I think
S64.Q97.C_1: he sould at least cut the child play and settle down and go to work, there are definitly to many kids running things. In our outfit when the Privates [unclear] [/unclear] [unclear] [/unclear] don't like the way things are going we call a meeting for the Battery Commander, and try and get things ironed out, but then what will you do if you Battalion commander is a West Point stuffed shift who thinks the enlisted men [deletion] and [/deletion] are just about the standard of [unclear] curr [/unclear] dog. With all the griping I've done the officers as a whole try to be good fellows [insertion] although [/insertion] [deletion] [/deletion] most of them don't know how, as they are bucking too much for another bar or or a gold leaf. I think all men should do their best work but not wait until he sees one of his superior officers coming his way before he sounds off and plays big shot. There is an awful lot of partiality in the army or should I say petty politics.
S64.Q97.Full: Speaking from an enlisted mans standpoint, I don't think the enlisted man is given justice. The Commissioned officer or at least most of the ones that I have had dealings with are just waiting for the chance to reduce some enlisted man or to give him trouble of some sort. I realize that discipline in the army is a very important factor, but when a man is commissioned I think he sould at least cut the child play and settle down and go to work, there are definitly to many kids running things. In our outfit when the Privates [unclear] [/unclear] [unclear] [/unclear] don't like the way things are going we call a meeting for the Battery Commander, and try and get things ironed out, but then what will you do if you Battalion commander is a West Point stuffed shift who thinks the enlisted men [deletion] and [/deletion] are just about the standard of [unclear] curr [/unclear] dog. With all the griping I've done the officers as a whole try to be good fellows [insertion] although [/insertion] [deletion] [/deletion] most of them don't know how, as they are bucking too much for another bar or or a gold leaf. I think all men should do their best work but not wait until he sees one of his superior officers coming his way before he sounds off and plays big shot. There is an awful lot of partiality in the army or should I say petty politics.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)

S64.Q97.F: Let's get the war finished as soon as possible. [paragraph] Why not amass a great lot of troops, all we can spare, at a point in Sicily & launch an attack, both air & land into Italy & from there thru to Germany.
S64.Q97.Full: Let's get the war finished as soon as possible. [paragraph] Why not amass a great lot of troops, all we can spare, at a point in Sicily & launch an attack, both air & land into Italy & from there thru to Germany.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: The Officers of this camp are not trained enough to teach the soldiers what they should know.
S64.Q97.Full: The Officers of this camp are not trained enough to teach the soldiers what they should know.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: 97. If you have any further remarks you would like to make on any subject please write them below as fully as you like. Some of the things I don't like about the Army is the way [unclear] [/unclear] yell at you. And also we don't get enough free time. I think if you want to get in the branch of service you like that everything should be done to get you there. I also think there should be less detail work so as to give a
S64.Q97.C_1: person a chance to learn something.
S64.Q97.Full: 97. If you have any further remarks you would like to make on any subject please write them below as fully as you like. Some of the things I don't like about the Army is the way [unclear] [/unclear] yell at you. And also we don't get enough free time. I think if you want to get in the branch of service you like that everything should be done to get you there. I also think there should be less detail work so as to give a person a chance to learn something.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I believe each man should be given a army job as close as possible to the one he had in civilian life , and this is important I think because the individual can produce more in his own trade, of course that is if the person had a trade or profession of any importance or skill.
S64.Q97.C_1: The army does a fair job of classifying the men but there is room for improvement I think. One way would be not to rush the men through their classifying test although there is some men who have army jobs that fit them, but there are also some who haven't and could do more for their country if they had a job that fitted them.
S64.Q97.Full: I believe each man should be given a army job as close as possible to the one he had in civilian life , and this is important I think because the individual can produce more in his own trade, of course that is if the person had a trade or profession of any importance or skill. The army does a fair job of classifying the men but there is room for improvement I think. One way would be not to rush the men through their classifying test although there is some men who have army jobs that fit them, but there are also some who haven't and could do more for their country if they had a job that fitted them.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: The Army is run too much like an old woman's Army. I believe in discipline and neatness, but when it comes to rolling socks a certain way, that is "shit for the birds". You can't win a war or kill a Jap by showing him a rolled sock 2" long, 5/8 " wide, and 1 1/2" high. There are too many Gestapoes sticking their nose in. Too much of the
S64.Q97.C_1: training is unrelated and too may dry runs. [paragraph] The Army should teach you how to fight and get you over there before you forget it all trying to learn how to fold a pair of G.I. [Government Issue] underware.
S64.Q97.Full: The Army is run too much like an old woman's Army. I believe in discipline and neatness, but when it comes to rolling socks a certain way, that is "shit for the birds". You can't win a war or kill a Jap by showing him a rolled sock 2" long, 5/8 " wide, and 1 1/2" high. There are too many Gestapoes sticking their nose in. Too much of the training is unrelated and too may dry runs. [paragraph] The Army should teach you how to fight and get you over there before you forget it all trying to learn how to fold a pair of G.I. [Government Issue] underware.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think that if the army would give the soldier a chance to show them How well they could do their spechelized [specialized] training in they could be of more use to Government. And in winning the present war. [paragraph]
S64.Q97.Full: I think that if the army would give the soldier a chance to show them How well they could do their spechelized [specialized] training in they could be of more use to Government. And in winning the present war. [paragraph]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M_marginalia: But they would rather have my brother and I home.
S64.Q97.F: There is too much favoritism in the Army. It seems to me a man has to have a big mouth to get anywhere in our company. Why isn't it possible for a man to transfer to a different branch of the service? It seems almost impossible in our company. Why isn't possible to transfer to the Navy?
S64.Q97.C_1: They should be more particular in handing outn ratings. I'd say about one man out of every four (non-coms) actually earned it. I don't believe in any OCS material, but of course in such times as the present it is all the govt can do for officers. Whenever there are field problems things should be explained to the men as well as to non-commissioned officers.
S64.Q97.Full: There is too much favoritism in the Army. It seems to me a man has to have a big mouth to get anywhere in our company. Why isn't it possible for a man to transfer to a different branch of the service? It seems almost impossible in our company. Why isn't possible to transfer to the Navy? They should be more particular in handing outn ratings. I'd say about one man out of every four (non-coms) actually earned it. I don't believe in any OCS material, but of course in such times as the present it is all the govt can do for officers. Whenever there are field problems things should be explained to the men as well as to non-commissioned officers.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: The main objection I have is that I was never given a chance to get in the branch I wanted. My IQ was high enough to qualify for anything. Ratings have been handed out more or less at random, the men who have received them are not yet worthy of them, later on they might of been. The Co. Officers and non-coms are always saying that it is not right to show partiality, yet they have shown it very much at times.
S64.Q97.C_1: I like the army as a whole but I very much wanted to get in the Navy. I feel that I could haved [have] served my country and myself better for the simple reason I would have been satisfied.
S64.Q97.Full: The main objection I have is that I was never given a chance to get in the branch I wanted. My IQ was high enough to qualify for anything. Ratings have been handed out more or less at random, the men who have received them are not yet worthy of them, later on they might of been. The Co. Officers and non-coms are always saying that it is not right to show partiality, yet they have shown it very much at times. I like the army as a whole but I very much wanted to get in the Navy. I feel that I could haved [have] served my country and myself better for the simple reason I would have been satisfied.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: 1. Regards Advancement in grades - This is my old army technical school - the present one are of the highest in army ratings. Fellows who haven't attended any or have attended only one or two are more grades higher in rank than I am. Many fellows in my position return to their outfits with T.O. ratings full - Their schooling would merit higher ratings but which are filled. 2. Family allotments - Present family allotments are too low to sustain soldier's family during war time especially for those families who live in large cities.
S64.Q97.C_1: (3.) Frequently not enough stress is laid on the fact that each individual soldier helps make an outfit a good one. In many instances soldiers feel he is extra baggage. (4) Army does [underline] not [/underline] make full use of its man power. Squandering men thru senseless red Tape - paper work which isn't used as often as many times duplicated that it is pitiful. (5) Should start a procedure for central depot for materials not used or going to be used by one outfit - but probably necessary for another. Or if such policy in effect to enforce it (The base I am attached to has Thousands of one type of equipment never used & steadily accumulaties [accumulates] over 1 1/2 that I have been a member of it) (6.) Allow mechanic or armorer (as in case of air corps) to repair motor part or gun part instead of replacing with new part & sending repairable part back to same supply depot - ordinance or service group. Much valuable Time & "material" wasted. (7.) Transfer more bases to northern states were northern-reared soldiers are [unclear] aclimated [/unclear] acclimated & here thus would be able to be more efficient.
S64.Q97.Full: 1. Regards Advancement in grades - This is my old army technical school - the present one are of the highest in army ratings. Fellows who haven't attended any or have attended only one or two are more grades higher in rank than I am. Many fellows in my position return to their outfits with T.O. ratings full - Their schooling would merit higher ratings but which are filled. 2. Family allotments - Present family allotments are too low to sustain soldier's family during war time especially for those families who live in large cities.  (3.) Frequently not enough stress is laid on the fact that each individual soldier helps make an outfit a good one. In many instances soldiers feel he is extra baggage. (4) Army does [underline] not [/underline] make full use of its man power. Squandering men thru senseless red Tape - paper work which isn't used as often as many times duplicated that it is pitiful. (5) Should start a procedure for central depot for materials not used or going to be used by one outfit - but probably necessary for another. Or if such policy in effect to enforce it (The base I am attached to has Thousands of one type of equipment never used & steadily accumulaties [accumulates] over 1 1/2 that I have been a member of it) (6.) Allow mechanic or armorer (as in case of air corps) to repair motor part or gun part instead of replacing with new part & sending repairable part back to same supply depot - ordinance or service group. Much valuable Time & "material" wasted. (7.) Transfer more bases to northern states were northern-reared soldiers are [unclear] aclimated [/unclear] acclimated & here thus would be able to be more efficient.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: When my Dad came to visit me I was on KP and with all of the men doing nothing but goldbricking I had to go AWOL to see him. [deletion] I are for [/deletion] My former C.O. was strictly lousy. When we completed Armament school, we got our diplomas at 10:00 AM. at 10:30 we were on detail. The fellows from the other squadrons were given
S64.Q97.C_1: passes to go to town. All of the fellows from other squadrons who were waiting to start this new school had furloughs to go home. We had detail. Some fellows are in the Army 4 months and get furloughs. Of my buddies all of us have been in 8 months or more and we get hell. We complete one school and when we get done do we go across, No - we go to more schools. Do we get 3 day passes when the rest get them, No - we get nothing. We are promised Corporal stripes - do we get them, no. Washington recognizes our present school as advanced - says we should be corporals. Where the hell are our stripes. We go to school nights, the instructors change shifts - do we - hell no. We are allowed 54 a day for food, do we eat well, no - [underline] who [/underline] [underline] makes [/underline] [underline] the [/underline] [underline] money [/underline] .

[deletion] I are for [/deletion] My former C.O. was strictly lousy. When we completed Armament school, we got our diplomas at 10:00 AM. at 10:30 we were on detail. The fellows from the other squadrons were given passes to go to town. All of the fellows from other squadrons who were waiting to start this new school had furloughs to go home. We had detail. Some fellows are in the Army 4 months and get furloughs. Of my buddies all of us have been in 8 months or more and we get hell. We complete one school and when we get done do we go across, No - we go to more schools. Do we get 3 day passes when the rest get them, No - we get nothing. We are promised Corporal stripes - do we get them, no. Washington recognizes our present school as advanced - says we should be corporals. Where the hell are our stripes. We go to school nights, the instructors change shifts - do we - hell no. We are allowed 54 a day for food, do we eat well, no - [underline] who [/underline] [underline] makes [/underline] [underline] the [/underline] [underline] money [/underline] .

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: To start with it takes to much sucksion to get a rating. [paragraph] If one officer tells you to do one thing one way + another one another way you get hell no matter which way you do it. [paragraph] There sure as hell should never have been a N Camp Polk La built in this hell hole, because there isn't any towns to near that is worth
S64.Q97.C_1: dammed & no place to enjoy your [deletion] [/deletion] self of [off] the post within 100 miles. [paragraph] The post could be run a lot better with better beer & more cold drinks on hand all the time. [paragraph] We don't have enough time off & on sat and sun we have to work some of the time, at night after 5 most of the time. I think it would be very good if we had wed afternoon off & sat afternoon including all day sunday. The non-coms & officers think there shit don't stink & hardly talk to the plain private unless he is a ([underline] suck ass. [/underline] ) [paragraph] The sporting equipment is very good but I ask you why it stays in the cases all the tine. [paragraph] The homes we live in is to small for the amount of men in it mainly 120 men in one regular size house 2 floors. [paragraph] The day room should have more of a supply of books & entertainment.
S64.Q97.Full: To start with it takes to much sucksion to get a rating. [paragraph] If one officer tells you to do one thing one way + another one another way you get hell no matter which way you do it. [paragraph] There sure as hell should never have been a N Camp Polk La built in this hell hole, because there isn't any towns to near that is worth dammed & no place to enjoy your [deletion] [/deletion] self of [off] the post within 100 miles. [paragraph] The post could be run a lot better with better beer & more cold drinks on hand all the time. [paragraph] We don't have enough time off & on sat and sun we have to work some of the time, at night after 5 most of the time. I think it would be very good if we had wed afternoon off & sat afternoon including all day sunday. The non-coms & officers think there shit don't stink & hardly talk to the plain private unless he is a ([underline] suck ass. [/underline] ) [paragraph] The sporting equipment is very good but I ask you why it stays in the cases all the tine. [paragraph] The homes we live in is to small for the amount of men in it mainly 120 men in one regular size house 2 floors. [paragraph] The day room should have more of a supply of books & entertainment.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I would like to have a decent PX to buy things at. The present one I go to at North Camp Polk, they could close it up for they never have anything to accomodate a soldier. [paragraph] I think we could have more time off than we do, also more recreation such as a pool table in our company day room and bowling alleys on the post. [paragraph] Being here in North Camp Post is like
S64.Q97.C_1: being in no mans land We are miles from any town and it takes too long to get to them We have a town called Leesville about seven miles from camp and if you want my frank opinion they ought to close it down

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: The army would be a much pleasanter [more pleasant] place if it weren't for the rigid discipline. It causes soldiers to become [unclear] [/unclear] quarrelsome & [unclear] discurted [/unclear] , so much so that at times they don't care what would happen. Their moral [morale] becomes very low and they begin to wonder whether it's all worth while. The army would also be more pleasant if all were treated in the
S64.Q97.C_1: same manner. I am sorry to say, that there is partiality. Sometimes it is very unfair. Certain men will be chosen to work after duty hours merely because they happen to be around. Others who went away will be missed This The one's who stay in the barracks & write letters or such are often forced to do things, while the one's that are out on pass or such are not working. [underline] Such [/underline] things [underline] should [/underline] not happen, better administration is gravely needed. [paragraph]
S64.Q97.Full: The army would be a much pleasanter [more pleasant] place if it weren't for the rigid discipline. It causes soldiers to become [unclear] [/unclear] quarrelsome & [unclear] discurted [/unclear] , so much so that at times they don't care what would happen. Their moral [morale] becomes very low and they begin to wonder whether it's all worth while. The army would also be more pleasant if all were treated in the same manner. I am sorry to say, that there is partiality. Sometimes it is very unfair. Certain men will be chosen to work after duty hours merely because they happen to be around. Others who went away will be missed This The one's who stay in the barracks & write letters or such are often forced to do things, while the one's that are out on pass or such are not working. [underline] Such [/underline] things [underline] should [/underline] not happen, better administration is gravely needed. [paragraph]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: 1. We have 120 men living in one barrack, I think it is very unsanitary and something should be done to remedy this condition right away. 2. Would like to have some time off to go home on a furlough and see my folks. Also would like more of 3 day passes to go to town. Have been at this
S64.Q97.C_1: camp for about 4 months and as yet was never issued a 3 day pass. [space] [paragraph] We have double decker bunks in our barracks and would much prefer single bunks. As it is we are very crowded & most of the time when we have to go to the Latrine we have to form a line as the facilities aren't ample to accomadate [accommodate] the amount of men in our Barracks. [space] Would like to be sent to a camp where the climate is better. Cant get acclimated to this climate.
S64.Q97.Full: 1. We have 120 men living in one barrack, I think it is very unsanitary and something should be done to remedy this condition right away. 2. Would like to have some time off to go home on a furlough and see my folks. Also would like more of 3 day passes to go to town. Have been at this camp for about 4 months and as yet was never issued a 3 day pass. [space] [paragraph] We have double decker bunks in our barracks and would much prefer single bunks. As it is we are very crowded & most of the time when we have to go to the Latrine we have to form a line as the facilities aren't ample to accomadate [accommodate] the amount of men in our Barracks. [space] Would like to be sent to a camp where the climate is better. Cant get acclimated to this climate.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: If a fellow has lived on the farm all of his life and has been drafted why can't he go back to the farm. We also run a truck line. Dad and a 14 year old brother who is still going to school are the only ones there. Dad drives the truck 5 days a week leaves 1 day for farming. Brother is in school. Just tell me why I can't go back home + farm. I have had 4 years of Agriculture schooling.
S64.Q97.C_1: and won the state farmer degree. I feel pretty sure that with a small amount of advice from Dad that I can carry on the farming program quite well. You say you need farmers so why not let the farm boys go back and do a little farming. How about giving it a little consideration. Thank You
S64.Q97.Full: If a fellow has lived on the farm all of his life and has been drafted why can't he go back to the farm. We also run a truck line. Dad and a 14 year old brother who is still going to school are the only ones there. Dad drives the truck 5 days a week leaves 1 day for farming. Brother is in school. Just tell me why I can't go back home + farm. I have had 4 years of Agriculture schooling. and won the state farmer degree. I feel pretty sure that with a small amount of advice from Dad that I can carry on the farming program quite well. You say you need farmers so why not let the farm boys go back and do a little farming. How about giving it a little consideration. Thank You

S64.Q97.Full: I would like a bigger and better P.X. [Post Exchange] and also a larger show house [theater] . I am to [too] far from home when there are camps closer to home.[paragraph] I would also like to have a pool table and also bowling alleys in the camp where we are stationed.

S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: The Army as a whole could be a swell place but its not really run the way it ought to be run. You see they take a fellow from civilian life and make him really go thru loops, when in comes time for a pass they you fell [feel] as though their doing you a favor.
S64.Q97.Full: The Army as a whole could be a swell place but its not really run the way it ought to be run. You see they take a fellow from civilian life and make him really go thru loops, when in comes time for a pass they you fell [feel] as though their doing you a favor.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: not in long enough for furlough
S64.Q97.F: I feel that if we could do away with the red tape that is in the Army, well not in the Army alone it would help. Cut down the profiteering on War Contracts. The Government have stricter control over the laborer who it seems is always striking. We who are in the Army are not getting a fair shake in
S64.Q97.C_1: in the matter. I know that living cost are up but they are not willing to make any sacrifices for their country. About 70% of the men who are sticking are foreign born and should be glad to make a sacrifice to be able to call this United States of America their home. We are willing to lay our lives down for it. We are proud of the Flag which waves over it. We rather die than see that flag fall. I can assure you that I for one would not come to be alive if I had to live under Hitler or Mussolini.
S64.Q97.Full: I feel that if we could do away with the red tape that is in the Army, well not in the Army alone it would help. Cut down the profiteering on War Contracts. The Government have stricter control over the laborer who it seems is always striking. We who are in the Army are not getting a fair shake in in the matter. I know that living cost are up but they are not willing to make any sacrifices for their country. About 70% of the men who are sticking are foreign born and should be glad to make a sacrifice to be able to call this United States of America their home. We are willing to lay our lives down for it. We are proud of the Flag which waves over it. We rather die than see that flag fall. I can assure you that I for one would not come to be alive if I had to live under Hitler or Mussolini.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: So far
S64.Q97.F: My wife was sick & still is and I'm in business. So in that respect I can not give my full thoughts to the army when I know I should be home to help and take care of her & my business. I wouldn't mind the army as far as I personally am concerned if my wife wasnt sick or still more so if I were single
S64.Q97.C_1: and the army was run systematically & didnt have guys bucking all the time for higher ratings & gave them to the ones who really deserved them & I also believe that as a rule if all officers come up thru the ranks they would be much nicer to associate with. As a rule [unclear] procially [/unclear] all officers figure you are just so much dirt under there feet. There is to much distinction between the officer & a private. The idea that you can't talk to him unless you have somebodys permission is a lot of bunk. After all we to are Human beings let us be treated as such. Work hand in hand. Personally I hate all the officers I know expect one. & I never knew him before I cam e in the army. [paragraph] My business is in a farming Country & I sell to the farmers supplies. So I figure that is essential to. Also there is to much graft & politics in the draft board. [paragraph]
S64.Q97.Full: My wife was sick & still is and I'm in business. So in that respect I can not give my full thoughts to the army when I know I should be home to help and take care of her & my business. I wouldn't mind the army as far as I personally am concerned if my wife wasnt sick or still more so if I were single and the army was run systematically & didnt have guys bucking all the time for higher ratings & gave them to the ones who really deserved them & I also believe that as a rule if all officers come up thru the ranks they would be much nicer to associate with. As a rule [unclear] procially [/unclear] all officers figure you are just so much dirt under there feet. There is to much distinction between the officer & a private. The idea that you can't talk to him unless you have somebodys permission is a lot of bunk. After all we to are Human beings let us be treated as such. Work hand in hand. Personally I hate all the officers I know expect one. & I never knew him before I cam e in the army. [paragraph] My business is in a farming Country & I sell to the farmers supplies. So I figure that is essential to. Also there is to much graft & politics in the draft board. [paragraph]

S64.Q97.F: I think the army camp should have more P.X. an theater??? so a soldier should have more time to himself because after all when we get on the other side then we want to be able to have time to our selve??? document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Personally I think this Comp [Company] is for prisoners of War instead of U.S. Soldiers. [paragraph] I don't know of one soldier who wouldn't give anything to get out of here. [paragraph] It is impossible to do our work well in this kind of a climate.
S64.Q97.Full: Personally I think this Comp [Company] is for prisoners of War instead of U.S. Soldiers. [paragraph] I don't know of one soldier who wouldn't give anything to get out of here. [paragraph] It is impossible to do our work well in this kind of a climate.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think the U.S. Army should give a soldier a furlough every 4 months. And it should be compulsory to give out furlough. Men will enjoy the army more if they get a furlough every four months. It will build moral [morale] 100%. [paragraph] I also believe if every body got a furlough you would have no
S64.Q97.C_1: one go AWOL
S64.Q97.Full: I think the U.S. Army should give a soldier a furlough every 4 months. And it should be compulsory to give out furlough. Men will enjoy the army more if they get a furlough every four months. It will build moral [morale] 100%. [paragraph] I also believe if every body got a furlough you would have no one go AWOL

S64.Q97.F: I think all married men with children that have been married 4 years or more should by no means be in the army. There should be a check up on all men in the U.S. who are still single or who got married in the past since the ...
S64.Q97.C_1: war has started. [paragraph] I also think the camps in the Southern U.S. should be moved to a cooler climate in the Summer time Louisiana is a hell of a State if you ask me [paragraph]
S64.Q97.Full: I think all married men with children that have been married 4 years or more should by no means be in the army. There should be a check up on all men in the U.S. who are still single or who got married in the past since the ... war has started. [paragraph] I also think the camps in the Southern U.S. should be moved to a cooler climate in the Summer time Louisiana is a hell of a State if you ask me [paragraph]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: The only reason I in this army is to get this war over and go back home with the world in peace.
S64.Q97.Full: The only reason I in this army is to get this war over and go back home with the world in peace.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Boys under 21 should [underline] not [/underline] be in the army especially in my case.[paragraph] I had to leave my 61 [year old] mother all alone with no support other than an allotment which isn't enough. I continually worry about her and can't concentrate on my Army duties.
S64.Q97.Full: Boys under 21 should [underline] not [/underline] be in the army especially in my case.[paragraph] I had to leave my 61 [year old] mother all alone with no support other than an allotment which isn't enough. I continually worry about her and can't concentrate on my Army duties.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I feel that the morale of every outfit would be improved greatly if [insertion] it [/insertion] was given a locality, in which to train, that was closest to home for the greatest number of men of the outfit.
S64.Q97.Full: I feel that the morale of every outfit would be improved greatly if [insertion] it [/insertion] was given a locality, in which to train, that was closest to home for the greatest number of men of the outfit.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Better food. [paragraph] Nearer to a a large city less hours of work [paragraph] more pay [paragraph] more time off for passes and things like that.
S64.Q97.Full: Better food. [paragraph] Nearer to a a large city less hours of work [paragraph] more pay [paragraph] more time off for passes and things like that.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: My chief grievance is that I feel that in my job I have no opportunity to employ my abilities and training, while I do have a splendid chance to show my lack of physical stamina. Despite an AGCT score of 129, 6 1/2 years of college, and 3 years of teaching experience, my Army job is carrying letters. Moreover, with the reduction of OCS quotas, the closing of the psychology section of ASTP, and a local ruling against applying for OCS until
S64.Q97.C_1: completing 6 months of training, I cannot help but feel that, as far as I am concerned, the Army is a dead-end street.
S64.Q97.Full: My chief grievance is that I feel that in my job I have no opportunity to employ my abilities and training, while I do have a splendid chance to show my lack of physical stamina. Despite an AGCT score of 129, 6 1/2 years of college, and 3 years of teaching experience, my Army job is carrying letters. Moreover, with the reduction of OCS quotas, the closing of the psychology section of ASTP, and a local ruling against applying for OCS until completing 6 months of training, I cannot help but feel that, as far as I am concerned, the Army is a dead-end street.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)

And to have a little more sports and things to cheer them up. For instant [sic] , I am a boxer myself and I have not had a chance to prove I can do good

And to have a little more sports and things to cheer them up. For instant [sic] , I am a boxer myself and I have not had a chance to prove I can do good

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Yes. The morale is very low down here. it would take a whole book to give you all the answers first we are supposed to get 10 day furloughs which it takes some of us 3 1/2 days to go home. no traveling time, Can't get nothing at P.X. very little recreation and I still have not got all my equipment and a whole lot more of things I have not time to write down here
S64.Q97.Full: Yes. The morale is very low down here. it would take a whole book to give you all the answers first we are supposed to get 10 day furloughs which it takes some of us 3 1/2 days to go home. no traveling time, Can't get nothing at P.X. very little recreation and I still have not got all my equipment and a whole lot more of things I have not time to write down here

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: [Answer 9 was checked but the check mark has been scribbled out and the words "or passes" in answer 9 has been lined through]
S64.Q97.F: Why in the world do you the army take fellows from the north & send them to the south & teach them the same thing they are teaching the southerns up north. The best way to boost morale to 1000 is to send them nearer home.
S64.Q97.Full: Why in the world do you the army take fellows from the north & send them to the south & teach them the same thing they are teaching the southerns up north. The best way to boost morale to 1000 is to send them nearer home.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think we could be fed better. Most of the boys never get enough to eat & milk must be plenty scarce , don't get enough to taste it. [paragraph] I think we should get more time for relaxation & time to at least write a letter home or some where. [paragraph] I think they should treat us more as a man & not a dog part of the time it seems as if
S64.Q97.C_1: they have to give you the devil to get you to turn around. And thats the truth. You never get a chance to feel contrable. We have to beg for our mail + if there is any thing a soilder wants is his mail. [paragraph] If you want to mail a pkg home you have to get some one who stays in camp during day to go because they done before we get off. [paragraph] To my opinion a soilder at least in my outfit is nothing but a slave. [paragraph] And when you are out on bivouac they never let us know how long we are going to be out - an we run out of ciggarettes + of an have to go with out them. If this was actual combat there would be + excuse but 10 miles from camp + truck going in every night + still can't get any. [deletion] [/deletion] We have to eat out of messkits am more am a lot of others are not fit for a pig to eat out of it rusts while I am eating out of it. We never get to eat out of plates although we have them. Its a crime to try + eat out of one.
S64.Q97.Full: I think we could be fed better. Most of the boys never get enough to eat & milk must be plenty scarce , don't get enough to taste it. [paragraph] I think we should get more time for relaxation & time to at least write a letter home or some where. [paragraph] I think they should treat us more as a man & not a dog part of the time it seems as if  they have to give you the devil to get you to turn around. And thats the truth. You never get a chance to feel contrable. We have to beg for our mail + if there is any thing a soilder wants is his mail. [paragraph] If you want to mail a pkg home you have to get some one who stays in camp during day to go because they done before we get off. [paragraph] To my opinion a soilder at least in my outfit is nothing but a slave. [paragraph] And when you are out on bivouac they never let us know how long we are going to be out - an we run out of ciggarettes + of an have to go with out them. If this was actual combat there would be + excuse but 10 miles from camp + truck going in every night + still can't get any. [deletion] [/deletion] We have to eat out of messkits am more am a lot of others are not fit for a pig to eat out of it rusts while I am eating out of it. We never get to eat out of plates although we have them. Its a crime to try + eat out of one.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: There could be a lot more recreation and more than anything more time for recreation in Camp Polk [Leesville, Louisiana] . There should be better towns to go to near Camp Polk. They also ought to be cleaner towns. We shouldn't have to wear neckties in this kind of climate.
S64.Q97.Full: There could be a lot more recreation and more than anything more time for recreation in Camp Polk [Leesville, Louisiana] . There should be better towns to go to near Camp Polk. They also ought to be cleaner towns. We shouldn't have to wear neckties in this kind of climate.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Recreation [unclear] periods [/unclear] here are too small. Not enough recreation too help keep up the morale. Meals are terrible too often. Good food wasted by bad cooking. Too many men going hungry for lack of food which they can eat. One pleasure I and so many others my same RG [regiment] had (38) and that was looking forward to the evening of Sunday that I could go to service club for a good meal. But now they have cut that out, as many other things, too numerous for the soldiers good. I understand that mess hall sergeants were raising
S64.Q97.C_1: hell because men were going to service club to eat too long hours and too hard at beginning of basic training cuts down soldiers too fast, physically & morally. Too many noncoms pull rank with smart answers to questions asked and too free about asking our K.P to E.M for no reason at all and then act together for big laugh over it all. Too many N.C.Os not capable of handling. Use rank and fear of A.Rs to force men into things which are not in line of duty [paragraph] I often wonder how many men have same problem as me. -When U was inducted into army I intended to try to make the best of things in march After three weeks in army counting one week in hospital, I finally decided I had better try to get out for reason being unable to take training as [unclear] persebee [/unclear] . Went to see top sergeant about information regarding discharge for men over 38. Was told he would look it up and let me know. Three days later ask again received. short smart alec answer one week later ask again, was given hell and [deletion] [/deletion] told to report [deletion] [/deletion] to kitchen for K.P since the time have found that had I by 6/1/43 I would have received discharge without delay. Have since inquired about discharge with employers letter and [deletion] [/deletion] [insertion] now [/insertion] receive nothing but K.P and evening details for the want of a defense discharge. T/S has told me he had good notion to put me in limited service and send me to stock and camp as [unclear] guard [/unclear] T/s will not issue me a pass for weekend stating he thought I should stay in case I was needed for detail. Have been [underline] over to front [/underline]
S64.Q97.Full: Recreation [unclear] periods [/unclear] here are too small. Not enough recreation too help keep up the morale. Meals are terrible too often. Good food wasted by bad cooking. Too many men going hungry for lack of food which they can eat. One pleasure I and so many others my same RG [regiment] had (38) and that was looking forward to the evening of Sunday that I could go to service club for a good meal. But now they have cut that out, as many other things, too numerous for the soldiers good. I understand that mess hall sergeants were raising hell because men were going to service club to eat too long hours and too hard at beginning of basic training cuts down soldiers too fast, physically & morally. Too many noncoms pull rank with smart answers to questions asked and too free about asking our K.P to E.M for no reason at all and then act together for big laugh over it all. Too many N.C.Os not capable of handling. Use rank and fear of A.Rs to force men into things which are not in line of duty [paragraph] I often wonder how many men have same problem as me. -When U was inducted into army I intended to try to make the best of things in march After three weeks in army counting one week in hospital, I finally decided I had better try to get out for reason being unable to take training as [unclear] persebee [/unclear] . Went to see top sergeant about information regarding discharge for men over 38. Was told he would look it up and let me know. Three days later ask again received. short smart alec answer one week later ask again, was given hell and [deletion] [/deletion] told to report [deletion] [/deletion] to kitchen for K.P since the time have found that had I by 6/1/43 I would have received discharge without delay. Have since inquired about discharge with employers letter and [deletion] [/deletion] [insertion] now [/insertion] receive nothing but K.P and evening details for the want of a defense discharge. T/S has told me he had good notion to put me in limited service and send me to stock and camp as [unclear] guard [/unclear] T/s will not issue me a pass for weekend stating he thought I should stay in case I was needed for detail. Have been [underline] over to front [/underline]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Get this army organized so that the soft soap and floor flusher are out. Men that can manage should head and run the arm not a bunch of, so call military men. Our Camp is full of (officers) men that think they are tough. They have rank and if you ask me that type of rank smells.
S64.Q97.Full: Get this army organized so that the soft soap and floor flusher are out. Men that can manage should head and run the arm not a bunch of, so call military men. Our Camp is full of (officers) men that think they are tough. They have rank and if you ask me that type of rank smells.

S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much

S64.Q97.Full: There should be more recreation for the individual soldier such as company baseball teams instead of regimental. Another theater and much [deletion] [/deletion] better P'X's should be built.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Why is there so much dry runs always in the Army. A soldier gets sick of doing the same monotonous things day in and day out. Why train northern men in the damn southern heat?
S64.Q97.Full: Why is there so much dry runs always in the Army. A soldier gets sick of doing the same monotonous things day in and day out. Why train northern men in the damn southern heat?

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M_marginalia: Personally I think the south is to crammed with soldiers when the north could be used more: The things a soldier needs like foods and good transportation are to hard to get down here and I think that does a lot to keep up the soldiers morals. On the whole I'd say the army is run pretty well, personally I'd say the American youth makes a pretty good soldier.
S64.Q97.F: Personally I think the south is to [too] crammed with soldiers when the north could be used more. The things a soldier needs like foods and good transportation are to [too] hard to get down here and I think that [unclear] does [/unclear] a lot to keep up the soldiers morals [morale] . On the whole I'd say the army is run pretty well, personally I'd say the American youth makes a pretty good soldier.
S64.Q97.Full: Personally I think the south is to [too] crammed with soldiers when the north could be used more. The things a soldier needs like foods and good transportation are to [too] hard to get down here and I think that [unclear] does [/unclear] a lot to keep up the soldiers morals [morale] .
