document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Let's have a three day pass at least once a month. [paragraph] We've been on bivouac all week and just arrived back to dress up and come down to fill out this leaflet in the boiling hot sun. The sun that Easterners are not use to at all. Tomorrow night the co. stands guard. We haven't been to even the PX and won't be till Sunday.
S64.Q97.C_1: Let's have a little time off! However if the Army can dish it out, I can take it but aren't there others who can't. Let's have a change of diet. Hardly ever have any thing else to drink but water!
S64.Q97.Full: Let's have a three day pass at least once a month. [paragraph] We've been on bivouac all week and just arrived back to dress up and come down to fill out this leaflet in the boiling hot sun. The sun that Easterners are not use to at all. Tomorrow night the co. stands guard. We haven't been to even the PX and won't be till Sunday. Let's have a little time off! However if the Army can dish it out, I can take it but aren't there others who can't. Let's have a change of diet. Hardly ever have any thing else to drink but water!

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: for my time in service (4 months)
S64.Q97.F: Steady hired K.P.'s in the Army. Less goldbricking and playing around in Washington. I personally feel that this war could [deletion] f [/deletion] have been over by now if the bigwigs in Washington would pay more attention to the war.
S64.Q97.Full: Steady hired K.P.'s in the Army. Less goldbricking and playing around in Washington. I personally feel that this war could [deletion] f [/deletion] have been over by now if the bigwigs in Washington would pay more attention to the war.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M_marginalia: [there is a check on box 1 but it is lighter so I think it was an erasure]
S64.Q97.F: They should give the 8th division [ Infantry Division] furloughs as they certainly deserve them and also move out of this hell hole of [unclear] [/unclear] .
S64.Q97.Full: They should give the 8th division [ Infantry Division] furloughs as they certainly deserve them and also move out of this hell hole of [unclear] [/unclear] .

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I think we should get more time off. Some days we spend at the motor park wasting time. It is wash the cars about 6 times. Boy that gets on your nerves [deletion] nerves [/deletion] .
S64.Q97.Full: I think we should get more time off. Some days we spend at the motor park wasting time. It is wash the cars about 6 times. Boy that gets on your nerves [deletion] nerves [/deletion] .

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: No need for long tiresome parades and inspection no sense in so much extra details after supper. [paragraph] Absolutely foolish to get up at 4:30 instead of 5:30 or 6:00 when not falling out until 7:00
S64.Q97.Full: No need for long tiresome parades and inspection no sense in so much extra details after supper. [paragraph] Absolutely foolish to get up at 4:30 instead of 5:30 or 6:00 when not falling out until 7:00

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I have a wife and a nine year old girl who don't get along on [$] 62.00 month. Do you think that she can? Or do you think that your wife and baby can? That is why I am not interest in the army. I think that I can help the army on the outside because I by [buy] a [war] bond every week.
S64.Q97.C_1: It doesn't seem that the men are placed in work best suited. Farmers in offices and office workers and semi-professional men driving truck and so on. [paragraph]
S64.Q97.Full: I have a wife and a nine year old girl who don't get along on [$] 62.00 month. Do you think that she can? Or do you think that your wife and baby can? That is why I am not interest in the army. I think that I can help the army on the outside because I by [buy] a [war] bond every week. It doesn't seem that the men are placed in work best suited. Farmers in offices and office workers and semi-professional men driving truck and so on. [paragraph]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: They should put the fellows [unclear] [/unclear] closer to home. Then they would have something to look forward too [to] everytime [every time] a three day pass [deletion] [/deletion] rolls around. The food doesn't agree with the fellows from the North & down South
S64.Q97.Full: They should put the fellows [unclear] [/unclear] closer to home. Then they would have something to look forward too [to] everytime [every time] a three day pass [deletion] [/deletion] rolls around. The food doesn't agree with the fellows from the North & down South

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: It is a little worse for the simple reason my father is not able to work and I was supporting him.
S64.Q97.Full: It is a little worse for the simple reason my father is not able to work and I was supporting him.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I think this classification test the army gives you is a lot of bunk, as they don't put you where you are best suited.
S64.Q97.Full: I think this classification test the army gives you is a lot of bunk, as they don't put you where you are best suited.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: 97. If you have any further remarks you would like to make on any subject please write them below as fully as you like. Louisiana is a lousy and mud ridden state. We are located out in the wilderness with a clapped up town the nearest to us. Bus service is so crowded you are lucky to get a seat. Then the nearest city ([,] ) you have to leave early and generally stand up. When you get their([there] ) all you see Is so many soldiers you can't get anything. We work longer days than any other outfit we have details just about every night to clean tanks or guns. Then we are out on
S64.Q97.C_1: bivouac we dry run and get little time for chow. Other Co. eat in plates while we eat in mess kits and then we have to clean them in about an hour. It is too hot here and we have very little recreation we don't much time. PX is so crowded and slow service and then everything is hot. Instead of volunteering they pick you out for details. When this war is over this is one place I would never come back too including the outfit or State, if I was in another outfit I wouldn't mind. When we came in we had about [insertion] a day and [/insertion] half in the induction centers, on the run at all time, didn't get a chance to pick they just told us were [where] we were going. And one doesn't work hard if they don't like the job they hold. The non coms and officers get on one soldier and they don't help him out. There seems to be a scarcity of milk down here at least for the privates we are as good as the non coms they get things we don't get. But on the bivouac we drink coffee, black, why are they rationing sugar & coffee back home they seem to be wasting it because we aren't getting it. The nearer the end of the war we get the harder we work. All the good officers are sent out why. They tell us one thing one day and another thing the next time. [deletion] [/deletion]
S64.Q97.Full: 97. If you have any further remarks you would like to make on any subject please write them below as fully as you like. Louisiana is a lousy and mud ridden state. We are located out in the wilderness with a clapped up town the nearest to us. Bus service is so crowded you are lucky to get a seat. Then the nearest city ([,] ) you have to leave early and generally stand up. When you get their([there] ) all you see Is so many soldiers you can't get anything. We work longer days than any other outfit we have details just about every night to clean tanks or guns. Then we are out on bivouac we dry run and get little time for chow. Other Co. eat in plates while we eat in mess kits and then we have to clean them in about an hour. It is too hot here and we have very little recreation we don't much time. PX is so crowded and slow service and then everything is hot. Instead of volunteering they pick you out for details. When this war is over this is one place I would never come back too including the outfit or State, if I was in another outfit I wouldn't mind. When we came in we had about [insertion] a day and [/insertion] half in the induction centers, on the run at all time, didn't get a chance to pick they just told us were [where] we were going. And one doesn't work hard if they don't like the job they hold. The non coms and officers get on one soldier and they don't help him out. There seems to be a scarcity of milk down here at least for the privates we are as good as the non coms they get things we don't get. But on the bivouac we drink coffee, black, why are they rationing sugar & coffee back home they seem to be wasting it because we aren't getting it. The nearer the end of the war we get the harder we work. All the good officers are sent out why. They tell us one thing one day and another thing the next time. [deletion] [/deletion]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I mentioned in one of the questions that there is too much class distinction between the officers and enlisted men. I truly believe that there would be a greater amount of willful cooperation if the discipline wasn't so rigid. Most of the men who came into the army after the war started were certainly not used to this. The rule that officers and enlisted men can't eat together, walk together, or be seen in public together seems very petty to me. I can understand that a great deal of discipline is needed but not to the extent that it is being practiced. I have also found that any
S64.Q97.C_1: enlisted men's opinion isn't considered by some of the officers. We're all in this together so why not be men together.
S64.Q97.Full: I mentioned in one of the questions that there is too much class distinction between the officers and enlisted men. I truly believe that there would be a greater amount of willful cooperation if the discipline wasn't so rigid. Most of the men who came into the army after the war started were certainly not used to this. The rule that officers and enlisted men can't eat together, walk together, or be seen in public together seems very petty to me. I can understand that a great deal of discipline is needed but not to the extent that it is being practiced. I have also found that any enlisted men's opinion isn't considered by some of the officers. We're all in this together so why not be men together.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: In the first place a division as large as this should be in a camp which is near a city that could have room for recreation etc for all the men.[paragraph] In La. [Louisiana} it seems that it's about one of the dirtiest states full of skin diseases etc.
S64.Q97.Full: In the first place a division as large as this should be in a camp which is near a city that could have room for recreation etc for all the men.[paragraph] In La. [Louisiana} it seems that it's about one of the dirtiest states full of skin diseases etc.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Our company Commander thinks only of himself. He is trying to get some where in this army at the expense of the men. I do not have enough time off. I work from 4 am till no special time in the [underline] night [/underline] And also Sunday. Most of [deletion] [/deletion] officers are very good and only think of their men. But our CO thinks only of himself. I hardly have enough time to write home. Which is the worst
S64.Q97.C_1: part of all. I don't think I am getting very well fed. We are served hot coffee on very hot day. I am all done in when the day is done, that is late at night. As a whole they are treating us like dogs. Too much dry run. All work and no play makes me a very angry soldier. I see no reason for getting G.I. haircut.
S64.Q97.Full: Our company Commander thinks only of himself. He is trying to get some where in this army at the expense of the men. I do not have enough time off. I work from 4 am till no special time in the [underline] night [/underline] And also Sunday. Most of [deletion] [/deletion] officers are very good and only think of their men. But our CO thinks only of himself. I hardly have enough time to write home. Which is the worst part of all. I don't think I am getting very well fed. We are served hot coffee on very hot day. I am all done in when the day is done, that is late at night. As a whole they are treating us like dogs. Too much dry run. All work and no play makes me a very angry soldier. I see no reason for getting G.I. haircut.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Believe our officers should have much longer training. Psychology should be taught in a manner that will not allow them to forget.

S64.Q97.F: After the war I am going to get a job and only work 8 hours a day, not 15 hours a day like I do in the Army. [paragraph] I can eat as much as I want at home I ain't hungry after I am done eating at [deletion] hereford [/deletion] home like I am now since I am in the Army, As long as I am in the Army I cant be happy any more if I was home I would be happy.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: On the question of whether the Army is run well or not. I think the Army on the whole is run quite well but this division is definitely not. There is too much fooling around. The higher up officers disagree to often. I do not think they are sure of what they want themselves.
S64.Q97.Full: On the question of whether the Army is run well or not. I think the Army on the whole is run quite well but this division is definitely not. There is too much fooling around. The higher up officers disagree to often. I do not think they are sure of what they want themselves.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Other/No answer
S64.Q97.F: (1) There should be more sleep in Air Force. [paragraph] (2) There should be more convoys to larger cities for longer time by more comfortable transportation. [paragraph] (3) Keep non commissioned officers from drinking all the cold milk. [paragraph] (4) Don't get third enough milk to drink. [paragraph] (5) Make officers eat at all times in there own mess hall. [paragraph] over
S64.Q97.C_1: (5) Get too much hell when equipment is accidentally lost. [paragraph] (6) Too much red tape involved and too long to wait when we try to get new equipment when we need. [paragraph] (7) If a soldier thinks himself physically & mentally fit for a more desired branch of service, he should be given a chance to prove himself satisfactory. [paragraph] (8) Recreation should be more organized and more time should be given for recreation.
S64.Q97.Full: (1) There should be more sleep in Air Force. [paragraph] (2) There should be more convoys to larger cities for longer time by more comfortable transportation. [paragraph] (3) Keep non commissioned officers from drinking all the cold milk. [paragraph] (4) Don't get third enough milk to drink. [paragraph] (5) Make officers eat at all times in there own mess hall. [paragraph] over (5) Get too much hell when equipment is accidentally lost. [paragraph] (6) Too much red tape involved and too long to wait when we try to get new equipment when we need. [paragraph] (7) If a soldier thinks himself physically & mentally fit for a more desired branch of service, he should be given a chance to prove himself satisfactory. [paragraph] (8) Recreation should be more organized and more time should be given for recreation.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Why do the Officer and N.C.O. get melon which should go to the Co. and the privates don't? [paragraph] Why do we hardly ever get milk? [paragraph] Why does the Co. Com. always get mad when we go to the dispensary? [paragraph] Why do we have to get on hands and knees to get our mail? [paragraph] Why are we restricted from our own day rooms and the Officers and N.C.O. always get the CocaCola while when we finally do get the Coke machine it is always empty.
S64.Q97.C_1: The officers walk into the kitchen and get milk any time of the day while we don't even get it in the mornings? [paragraph] Why do they have to sit us in the hot sun to hold classes for we are so uncomfortable that we never learn anything anyway? [paragraph] Why is it that we never seem to have free time. We seem to be working 23 hours a day? [paragraph] We were told on coning in the the army that we would be able to transfer after Basic but we we have not heard [deletion] from [/deletion] anything about transfers since? [paragraph] We have a fellow with one lung in my company. When we go on marches he is really tired and when we double time he looks as if he will collapse any minute. Every time I see him suffer at double time I feel like crying. He would fall out for one reason. He didn't once before and what did Major Rogers make him do: Run around the obstacle course once a day for a whole week. Then the Com. Co. says that he is goldbricking and that gets me so mad that I feel like hitting him but I heard it is punishable by death. [paragraph] I think that Major Rogers and Colonel Noble should be transfered and take charge of a prison camp for japs where they can really practice their torture. [paragraph] How can we ever have a good time here when there is a shortage of P.X.'s, Movies, ICE, and airplanes on which we can get to a city with.
S64.Q97.Full: Why do the Officer and N.C.O. get melon which should go to the Co. and the privates don't? [paragraph] Why do we hardly ever get milk? [paragraph] Why does the Co. Com. always get mad when we go to the dispensary? [paragraph] Why do we have to get on hands and knees to get our mail? [paragraph] Why are we restricted from our own day rooms and the Officers and N.C.O. always get the CocaCola while when we finally do get the Coke machine it is always empty. The officers walk into the kitchen and get milk any time of the day while we don't even get it in the mornings? [paragraph] Why do they have to sit us in the hot sun to hold classes for we are so uncomfortable that we never learn anything anyway? [paragraph] Why is it that we never seem to have free time. We seem to be working 23 hours a day? [paragraph] We were told on coning in the the army that we would be able to transfer after Basic but we we have not heard [deletion] from [/deletion] anything about transfers since? [paragraph] We have a fellow with one lung in my company. When we go on marches he is really tired and when we double time he looks as if he will collapse any minute. Every time I see him suffer at double time I feel like crying. He would fall out for one reason. He didn't once before and what did Major Rogers make him do: Run around the obstacle course once a day for a whole week. Then the Com. Co. says that he is goldbricking and that gets me so mad that I feel like hitting him but I heard it is punishable by death. [paragraph] I think that Major Rogers and Colonel Noble should be transfered and take charge of a prison camp for japs where they can really practice their torture. [paragraph] How can we ever have a good time here when there is a shortage of P.X.'s, Movies, ICE, and airplanes on which we can get to a city with.

S64.Q97.F: I think before an officer is given charge of an outfit or Company - he should be checked by higher people. I'm not the only one who thinks this. One and the worse cause I find falt with this Army is - The officers are as young and green as we are. The treat men like dogs instead of
S64.Q97.C_1: [unclear] [/unclear] They some of them not all in our Camp but it is the first chance to put on the dog and they take it out on us. If men were trusted better by their officers youd find less AWOL [unclear] [/unclear] Also all would pull and win this war instead of a officer bucking against his charge. This may seem like a joke but the men is really men here at our company.
S64.Q97.Full: I think before an officer is given charge of an outfit or Company - he should be checked by higher people. I'm not the only one who thinks this. One and the worse cause I find falt with this Army is - The officers are as young and green as we are. The treat men like dogs instead of [unclear] [/unclear] They some of them not all in our Camp but it is the first chance to put on the dog and they take it out on us. If men were trusted better by their officers youd find less AWOL [unclear] [/unclear] Also all would pull and win this war instead of a officer bucking against his charge. This may seem like a joke but the men is really men here at our company.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think a married man should be near home and get wife used to Army life showing what abouts of camp so if I should go for active combat it will be easier on her. And being 2,000 miles away from home and had no furlow [furlough] since in army its not easy just to go home for few hr. and come back and so far away. I say because I love my wife and worry a lot only if I can speak to her even if I were near for one 1 day even 2 times a month.
S64.Q97.Full: I think a married man should be near home and get wife used to Army life showing what abouts of camp so if I should go for active combat it will be easier on her. And being 2,000 miles away from home and had no furlow [furlough] since in army its not easy just to go home for few hr. and come back and so far away. I say because I love my wife and worry a lot only if I can speak to her even if I were near for one 1 day even 2 times a month.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: most of all to passes - one question usually bellyached about furloughs. Some outfits such as F.A & A.C. (most of all) seem to have furloughs very often & this particular camp it seems you'll have to cut the Generals throat to get one. & if you do get one It seems they want you to be indebted to them. I don't see why. This burns the worst part of me. This outfit putting quite a bit of work in. I....
S64.Q97.C_1: should say to mind tune & very often work nights till late & wake in the middle of the night do nothing far 1 1/2, work all day & continue this schedule for a week at a time & if we are good we'd get the week-end of & what we hear from other camps about Passes & furloughs & places to go to without being robbed of your pay (raising price & such). Seems this camp is getting a raw deal on furloughs & places of recreation. Although we had very little time for recreation on account of letter writing which could be considered a form of recreation - We are hoping the recreation situation might change.
S64.Q97.Full: most of all to passes - one question usually bellyached about furloughs. Some outfits such as F.A & A.C. (most of all) seem to have furloughs very often & this particular camp it seems you'll have to cut the Generals throat to get one. & if you do get one It seems they want you to be indebted to them. I don't see why. This burns the worst part of me. This outfit putting quite a bit of work in. I.... should say to mind tune & very often work nights till late & wake in the middle of the night do nothing far 1 1/2, work all day & continue this schedule for a week at a time & if we are good we'd get the week-end of & what we hear from other camps about Passes & furloughs & places to go to without being robbed of your pay (raising price & such). Seems this camp is getting a raw deal on furloughs & places of recreation. Although we had very little time for recreation on account of letter writing which could be considered a form of recreation - We are hoping the recreation situation might change.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Only objection I have is our Company officer told us no one could get out of the Armored Division and yet I think I've been placed wrong because I like mechanics with very little experience but am willing to learn and just for a change I'd like to place all my knowledge and effort in the United States Air forces in the ground Crew. [paragraph] Adam
S64.Q97.Full: Only objection I have is our Company officer told us no one could get out of the Armored Division and yet I think I've been placed wrong because I like mechanics with very little experience but am willing to learn and just for a change I'd like to place all my knowledge and effort in the United States Air forces in the ground Crew. [paragraph] Adam

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think the army has been slightly wrong on the jobs some men are given. Mostly all men have some definite job they would like to do. It is my opinion that the Army find out the job they like best give them some training in that job yet do not slight the rest of the duties, then it can easily be noticeable what job or duties he likes best, but in war
S64.Q97.C_1: time I realize that this cannot be done. This does not mean that the Army does not know what it is doing, cause it knows very well, [unclear] nor [/unclear] that I don't like Army life. I love Army life, and all that the U.S.A. stands for and will ever stand for, Liberty, Freedom, and Democracy.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the army has been slightly wrong on the jobs some men are given. Mostly all men have some definite job they would like to do. It is my opinion that the Army find out the job they like best give them some training in that job yet do not slight the rest of the duties, then it can easily be noticeable what job or duties he likes best, but in war time I realize that this cannot be done. This does not mean that the Army does not know what it is doing, cause it knows very well, [unclear] nor [/unclear] that I don't like Army life. I love Army life, and all that the U.S.A. stands for and will ever stand for, Liberty, Freedom, and Democracy.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think we should have more time off and more furloughs because take a guy like me for instance just young and it goes pretty hard for a young person to be pent up like this for a long period of time and to be left far away from home and why should we be filing out things like this on our own
S64.Q97.C_1: times and more yet Louisiana is a dump with snakes, swamps, chiggers and clap.
S64.Q97.Full: I think we should have more time off and more furloughs because take a guy like me for instance just young and it goes pretty hard for a young person to be pent up like this for a long period of time and to be left far away from home and why should we be filing out things like this on our own  times and more yet Louisiana is a dump with snakes, swamps, chiggers and clap.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think the war should be ended as soon as possible because there are a lot of married women going through more misery than the men are and it seems to me being a married man that they should not have any men in the army that were married before Pearl Harbor and when war is over I think they should let them go home first to get jobs to support their family.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the war should be ended as soon as possible because there are a lot of married women going through more misery than the men are and it seems to me being a married man that they should not have any men in the army that were married before Pearl Harbor and when war is over I think they should let them go home first to get jobs to support their family.

Do you feel that you have been given your fair share of furloughs and passes since you have been in this camp? 6 yes, i have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes 7. i have had my fair share of furloughs but not of passes 8. i have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs 9. [unclear] [/unclear] before they can be obeyed. i have been given to understand that my father is a very known no other outfit. to perhaps i cant give a very fair opinion of of any life. the [unclear] [/unclear] , no one seems to be a great deal of incompetency [unclear] [/unclear] some high ranking officer.
S64.Q97.F: I think that there is too much indecision in some of the commanders. My pet peeve is the issuing of orders, and them changing them. Almost before they can be obeyed. I have been given to understand that my battery is a very poor criterion of average army life. I have known no other outfit so perhaps I can't give a very fair opinion of army life. The does, to me, seem to be a great deal of incompetency among [underline] some [/underline] high ranking officers.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that there is too much indecision in some of the commanders. My pet peeve is the issuing of orders, and them changing them. Almost before they can be obeyed. I have been given to understand that my battery is a very poor criterion of average army life. I have known no other outfit so perhaps I can't give a very fair opinion of army life. The does, to me, seem to be a great deal of incompetency among [underline] some [/underline] high ranking officers.

S64.Q97.F: We work all day and half the nite and then the officers expect you to be in tip-top shape with your barracks personal stuff.
S64.Q97.Full: We work all day and half the nite and then the officers expect you to be in tip-top shape with your barracks personal stuff.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: We should be given more time to ourselves. Our food that is what food we get isn't fit for a dog. We are treated like dogs not human beings. As for the food we get the same food & enough feed a rabbit.
S64.Q97.Full: We should be given more time to ourselves. Our food that is what food we get isn't fit for a dog. We are treated like dogs not human beings. As for the food we get the same food & enough feed a rabbit.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: About these furloughs, I think every soldier should get them more often. After all he's fighting for his country. And if he doesn't get any, I think it's dam bad giving your life when, you don't get brake. [break] After our Basic everyone should get a furlough, a fifthteen [fifteen] day furlough isn't much, considering the time he put in Basic Training, it gets tiresome at times, I don't think it's fair.
S64.Q97.C_1: I think if they gave everybody furlough, some of the soliders won't go A.W.O.L. or over the hill. After all a man's giving his life fighting for his country and love ones. So I think he deserves to get home and see them. That's all I have to say.
S64.Q97.Full: About these furloughs, I think every soldier should get them more often. After all he's fighting for his country. And if he doesn't get any, I think it's dam bad giving your life when, you don't get brake. [break] After our Basic everyone should get a furlough, a fifthteen [fifteen] day furlough isn't much, considering the time he put in Basic Training, it gets tiresome at times, I don't think it's fair. I think if they gave everybody furlough, some of the soliders won't go A.W.O.L. or over the hill. After all a man's giving his life fighting for his country and love ones. So I think he deserves to get home and see them. That's all I have to say.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: First when I volunteered in this army I felt that it was in my place to join the army but in all conditions I see now where I made a mistake. I have a wife and three children back home and I could do more good if I were with them.
S64.Q97.Full: First when I volunteered in this army I felt that it was in my place to join the army but in all conditions I see now where I made a mistake. I have a wife and three children back home and I could do more good if I were with them.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Other/No answer
S64.Q97.F: I'm trying my best to be a good soldier but if they keep this working night and during day I don't know what I'll do. If I was in actual combat then I wouldn't mind even if I had to be on duty 24 hours the night. There was one day we got up about 4:30 AM and worked all day and night up until 3 AM the next day. It's more like concentration camp. Every soldier
S64.Q97.C_1: in my battery don't like it. Most of them are trying to get [unclear] discharged [/unclear] . I was in the National Guard and I worked hard but I enjoyed being a member of that outfit. I am still very proud of the N.G. [National Guard] .
S64.Q97.Full: I'm trying my best to be a good soldier but if they keep this working night and during day I don't know what I'll do. If I was in actual combat then I wouldn't mind even if I had to be on duty 24 hours the night. There was one day we got up about 4:30 AM and worked all day and night up until 3 AM the next day. It's more like concentration camp. Every soldier in my battery don't like it. Most of them are trying to get [unclear] discharged [/unclear] . I was in the National Guard and I worked hard but I enjoyed being a member of that outfit. I am still very proud of the N.G. [National Guard] .

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I believe this camp location [underline] at [/underline] [underline] Camp [/underline] [underline] Polk [/underline] [underline] La. [/underline] [Louisiana] is [insertion] a [/insertion] rotten place to bring a fellow but has to given credit for being a good manurering ground. I would much rather be out of here but like to stay with the Division. [paragraph] I don't believe that some of the new non coms were properly picked & I believe that there is too many favorites shown by no - coms .
S64.Q97.C_1: officers alike.
S64.Q97.Full: I believe this camp location [underline] at [/underline] [underline] Camp [/underline] [underline] Polk [/underline] [underline] La. [/underline] [Louisiana] is [insertion] a [/insertion] rotten place to bring a fellow but has to given credit for being a good manurering ground. I would much rather be out of here but like to stay with the Division. [paragraph] I don't believe that some of the new non coms were properly picked & I believe that there is too many favorites shown by no - coms . officers alike.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: The only thing I have to say is we have to many officers here that have to many assignments such as from corporal to captain and they don't know what to do with us most of the time or how to handle us. For the amount of work we do our food is just very very poor.
S64.Q97.Full: The only thing I have to say is we have to many officers here that have to many assignments such as from corporal to captain and they don't know what to do with us most of the time or how to handle us. For the amount of work we do our food is just very very poor.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Often the food is very rotten. A piece of french toast and a half of grapefruit for breakfast and a cup of coffee if you drink it. It need a better system on daily schedules, you don't know what your [you're] going to do from one minute to the next. Lot of time you only get three or four [hours] of sleep a night.
S64.Q97.Full: Often the food is very rotten. A piece of french toast and a half of grapefruit for breakfast and a cup of coffee if you drink it. It need a better system on daily schedules, you don't know what your [you're] going to do from one minute to the next. Lot of time you only get three or four [hours] of sleep a night.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think that a soldier's first furlough should be for 21 days because it's his first time home. And soldiers who are far from home should get more traveling time as we spend half of our furlough going home and coming back to camp.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that a soldier's first furlough should be for 21 days because it's his first time home. And soldiers who are far from home should get more traveling time as we spend half of our furlough going home and coming back to camp.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: Furloughs haven't been given yet and we work so much that we have a proportionate amount of passes for our free time.
S64.Q97.F: Too much night work and details & even when we get free time there is no place or town in which to have an enjoyable time. [paragraph] Not enough entertainment in camp. We have some but not enough to accomodate [accommodate] so many soldiers.
S64.Q97.Full: Too much night work and details & even when we get free time there is no place or town in which to have an enjoyable time. [paragraph] Not enough entertainment in camp. We have some but not enough to accomodate [accommodate] so many soldiers.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I think all men should be [deletion] [/deletion] given furloughs of more than 10 days and traveling time before going over seas
S64.Q97.Full: I think all men should be [deletion] [/deletion] given furloughs of more than 10 days and traveling time before going over seas

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M_marginalia: Things are a lot worse for my family not friends
S64.Q97.F: My only recreation here at camp was eating at the Service Club restaurant. Now it's only for civilians and soldiers with escorts. A U.S.O. Club for civilians, thats pretty good isn't it! Where the h-ll can I get an escort. The food in the mess hall is poor in quality and variety no beverages like tea or coffee except for breakfast. Only water. The climate here is terrific. I wouldn't swap one foot of Massachusetts for this
S64.Q97.C_1: entire state. Furloughs - when we get them - are restricted to 10 days only. I'll need 6 days traveling time to get to Boston. My next furlough - if any - won't be for 6 months. What good can 4 days possibly do one after 4 months here. Then getting acclimated to this life again - Whew! Leesville, the nearest town has an unsavory reputation and poorer recreational facilities. Theres nothing to do here, evenings except write letters or play ball. I can overlook a lot of things like short furloughs, recreation, climate, etc. but not the food we get in the mess hall. If that order barring soldiers from the USO restuarant could be rescinded I'd be glad to buy my own meals.
S64.Q97.Full: My only recreation here at camp was eating at the Service Club restaurant. Now it's only for civilians and soldiers with escorts. A U.S.O. Club for civilians, thats pretty good isn't it! Where the h-ll can I get an escort. The food in the mess hall is poor in quality and variety no beverages like tea or coffee except for breakfast. Only water. The climate here is terrific. I wouldn't swap one foot of Massachusetts for this  entire state. Furloughs - when we get them - are restricted to 10 days only. I'll need 6 days traveling time to get to Boston. My next furlough - if any - won't be for 6 months. What good can 4 days possibly do one after 4 months here. Then getting acclimated to this life again - Whew! Leesville, the nearest town has an unsavory reputation and poorer recreational facilities. Theres nothing to do here, evenings except write letters or play ball. I can overlook a lot of things like short furloughs, recreation, climate, etc. but not the food we get in the mess hall. If that order barring soldiers from the USO restuarant could be rescinded I'd be glad to buy my own meals.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think if a fellow was put into a job to what he is qualified for such asd something similar to what he was doing in civilian life. I was an electrician in civilian life now they have me in the motor maint [maintenance] of the field artillery. I don't like it and never will like it.
S64.Q97.Full: I think if a fellow was put into a job to what he is qualified for such asd something similar to what he was doing in civilian life. I was an electrician in civilian life now they have me in the motor maint [maintenance] of the field artillery. I don't like it and never will like it.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: But none of us has had enough
S64.Q97.F: They claim moral [morale] to be all - important and do everything in their power to break it down. Why? By "they" I mean the officers & non-coms. They make everything as hard as possible and bring about more griping than is necessary to make a good soldier even if griping does make a good soldier. The food is lousy and far from being balanced. If the officers tried being human and take some of the load off the chaplain's shoulders everything would be fine. They say you can lead a horse to water but you can't
S64.Q97.C_1: make him drink. All the personal [personnel] shouldn't be treated the same as the few that many need rough treatment
S64.Q97.Full: They claim moral [morale] to be all - important and do everything in their power to break it down. Why? By "they" I mean the officers & non-coms. They make everything as hard as possible and bring about more griping than is necessary to make a good soldier even if griping does make a good soldier. The food is lousy and far from being balanced. If the officers tried being human and take some of the load off the chaplain's shoulders everything would be fine. They say you can lead a horse to water but you can't  make him drink. All the personal [personnel] shouldn't be treated the same as the few that many need rough treatment

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Other/No answer
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: Mine was a sick [unclear] [/unclear]
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Put more recreation in North Camp Polk if you don't their going to be a lot more going over the hill
S64.Q97.Full: Put more recreation in North Camp Polk if you don't their going to be a lot more going over the hill

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: There should be a greater attempt to instill active hatred of enemy by an expert in of what the ? very stands for are what we stake is in the war -- and what should happen, actually first in [unclear] [/unclear] [unclear] [/unclear] if we should lose. A greater program of "Orientation" lectures more centrally controlled (ie. W. O.) instead of relying on officers insufficiently trained or acquainted with such subject. Some of the orientation
S64.Q97.C_1: speakers were very capable. Unfortunately, many were not and the men, bored, missed important material. This has been to me a weakness because our enemies have some good jobs in that department and there is nothing they can do that we can't do back. Another item is the slowness of the personnel work, but this is a personal gripe, other men have had more fortunate experience with it. Food's good, too much meat for fair weather. The camp is situated too far from any real community and furloughs and passes and pay do not make any attempt to "bridge" this deficiency. It's a big job running a war and I confess that solving the problems of individual camps, leave alone soldier is not to be expected 100%
S64.Q97.Full: There should be a greater attempt to instill active hatred of enemy by an expert in of what the ? very stands for are what we stake is in the war -- and what should happen, actually first in [unclear] [/unclear] [unclear] [/unclear] if we should lose. A greater program of "Orientation" lectures more centrally controlled (ie. W. O.) instead of relying on officers insufficiently trained or acquainted with such subject. Some of the orientation  speakers were very capable. Unfortunately, many were not and the men, bored, missed important material. This has been to me a weakness because our enemies have some good jobs in that department and there is nothing they can do that we can't do back. Another item is the slowness of the personnel work, but this is a personal gripe, other men have had more fortunate experience with it. Food's good, too much meat for fair weather. The camp is situated too far from any real community and furloughs and passes and pay do not make any attempt to "bridge" this deficiency. It's a big job running a war and I confess that solving the problems of individual camps, leave alone soldier is not to be expected 100%

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Other/No answer
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Yes there is. I belive a soldier have a furlough every three months. Because most of them may go over sea and many never come back to their homes. If he can receive a furlough every three to four months, I believe you will find he will do a better job in the army & will more interested in it.
S64.Q97.Full: Yes there is. I belive a soldier have a furlough every three months. Because most of them may go over sea and many never come back to their homes. If he can receive a furlough every three to four months, I believe you will find he will do a better job in the army & will more interested in it.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: 1- Service Clubs are closed to soldiers unless accompanied by parents or wives. [space] 2 Unecessary dicipline [discipline] - such as being required to wear full dress summer "A" every where outside barracks during off duty hours. Ties are required in day room. [space] 3- We have a Retreat Parade every week for the same few persons in very hot weather.
S64.Q97.C_1: Pork is the main meat we are fed in this hot Louisiana climate. Too few spare moments for our needs. Officers "bucking" for higher grades get unreasonable in some instances. This camp is composed of boys from the North and have not readily become acclimatized to hot weather and are suffering extreme discomfort from heat rash, etc. Very few recreational facilities for a camp as isolated as Camp Polk. Poor service and poorly equiped P.X.'s.
S64.Q97.Full: 1- Service Clubs are closed to soldiers unless accompanied by parents or wives. [space] 2 Unecessary dicipline [discipline] - such as being required to wear full dress summer "A" every where outside barracks during off duty hours. Ties are required in day room. [space] 3- We have a Retreat Parade every week for the same few persons in very hot weather. Pork is the main meat we are fed in this hot Louisiana climate. Too few spare moments for our needs. Officers "bucking" for higher grades get unreasonable in some instances. This camp is composed of boys from the North and have not readily become acclimatized to hot weather and are suffering extreme discomfort from heat rash, etc. Very few recreational facilities for a camp as isolated as Camp Polk. Poor service and poorly equiped P.X.'s.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Should give all up men in Camp Polk La. Furloughs as soon as Basic Training is over, and after furloughs are finished ship [insertion] us [/insertion] up some place up north where we are used to freezing and not [unclear] sweating [/unclear] in the sun. We do not have enough time to our-selves and shout get more time off. Our food is not worth while talking about and some of the
S64.Q97.C_1: times you dont get enough. Dont do much if you go to the dispensary when a guy is sick they say he is faking. [para] Take back to [unclear] P.G. [/unclear]
S64.Q97.Full: Should give all up men in Camp Polk La. Furloughs as soon as Basic Training is over, and after furloughs are finished ship [insertion] us [/insertion] up some place up north where we are used to freezing and not [unclear] sweating [/unclear] in the sun. We do not have enough time to our-selves and shout get more time off. Our food is not worth while talking about and some of the times you dont get enough. Dont do much if you go to the dispensary when a guy is sick they say he is faking. [para] Take back to [unclear] P.G. [/unclear]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think a man should have a furlough every six months or often. It will keep up his moral more and that what it takes. It will also keep the morale of our folks and sweethearts up, if we have a chance to see them at least when we are here in the United States. I've known fellows who have been in the Army for 1 1/2 years and never have had a furlough.
S64.Q97.Full: I think a man should have a furlough every six months or often. It will keep up his moral more and that what it takes. It will also keep the morale of our folks and sweethearts up, if we have a chance to see them at least when we are here in the United States. I've known fellows who have been in the Army for 1 1/2 years and never have had a furlough.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: since have had only had 5 hour passes and no furloughs
S64.Q97.F: 1 We dont get enough to eat 2 Do not have much time for enjoyment as after write letters get caught up on my sleep (and I surely dont get enough of that) Get restricted for what somebody selse does wrong or do extra detail, clean rifles to be inspected by a guy with eyes like a Buzzard, and a magnifying glass, Get off of work to late sometimes in order to go anyplace
S64.Q97.C_1: #NAME?
S64.Q97.Full: 1 We dont get enough to eat 2 Do not have much time for enjoyment as after write letters get caught up on my sleep (and I surely dont get enough of that) Get restricted for what somebody selse does wrong or do extra detail, clean rifles to be inspected by a guy with eyes like a Buzzard, and a magnifying glass, Get off of work to late sometimes in order to go anyplace #NAME?

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I think that it should be impressed upon the soldiers more while they are in their basic training that this is a service thing and that they will probably be in combat in the near future. I think that the army food is good in quality but not so good in quantity. My company in particular does not get enough to eat. I think sick calls should be checked
S64.Q97.C_1: on more carefully, many of them are just goldbricks. I qualified for Army special training course and was told that I would go before an examining board within 2 weeks, it has been three months now and I haven't heard anything yet or no one knows when I will. I think the army should have after hours classes in basic school subjects for those who want it. I think there are enough to make it worth while. Some of the soldiers would rather be in a camp close to home, I don't think this should be done, they have to learn to be independent, to be a good combat soldier I think that so outfits could go into combat sooner than they do , that is if transportation is possible. I think the army as a whole is run quite well.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that it should be impressed upon the soldiers more while they are in their basic training that this is a service thing and that they will probably be in combat in the near future. I think that the army food is good in quality but not so good in quantity. My company in particular does not get enough to eat. I think sick calls should be checked on more carefully, many of them are just goldbricks. I qualified for Army special training course and was told that I would go before an examining board within 2 weeks, it has been three months now and I haven't heard anything yet or no one knows when I will. I think the army should have after hours classes in basic school subjects for those who want it. I think there are enough to make it worth while. Some of the soldiers would rather be in a camp close to home, I don't think this should be done, they have to learn to be independent, to be a good combat soldier I think that so outfits could go into combat sooner than they do , that is if transportation is possible. I think the army as a whole is run quite well.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I think we could do more across the pond than we could do here.
S64.Q97.Full: I think we could do more across the pond than we could do here.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I wish that they would clean our swimming pool here in camp sometime other than Sun. We could use more service clubs according to the size of the camp. When you go to Die one and only you can't ever get in and if you do possibly get in you can't buy anything because most of the officers have been there. Because they have better
S64.Q97.C_1: transportation than an enlisted man. [paragraph] They could have more and better entertainment at the U.S.O. clubs.
S64.Q97.Full: I wish that they would clean our swimming pool here in camp sometime other than Sun. We could use more service clubs according to the size of the camp. When you go to Die one and only you can't ever get in and if you do possibly get in you can't buy anything because most of the officers have been there. Because they have better transportation than an enlisted man. [paragraph] They could have more and better entertainment at the U.S.O. clubs.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: This camp needs more U.S.O. {United Service Organizations] clubs, more theaters and more entertainment for the troops. I would rather be in any of the other states than here in Louisiana. Some of the sergeants I do not like a bit. I always get in trouble with one sergeant in particular. I would like to be closer to home. Our mail situation is very poor. We could use some men who know what they are doing and not
S64.Q97.C_1: ... do about half the work they should. I do not think we should be living in tents, but in barracks. I wish they would at least give us two days a week off. In other words, to make a long story short, I do not like the army. I would like to see this army run the way it should be run.
S64.Q97.Full: This camp needs more U.S.O. {United Service Organizations] clubs, more theaters and more entertainment for the troops. I would rather be in any of the other states than here in Louisiana. Some of the sergeants I do not like a bit. I always get in trouble with one sergeant in particular. I would like to be closer to home. Our mail situation is very poor. We could use some men who know what they are doing and not ... do about half the work they should. I do not think we should be living in tents, but in barracks. I wish they would at least give us two days a week off. In other words, to make a long story short, I do not like the army. I would like to see this army run the way it should be run.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: We don't get enough to eat and and have to work to hard and not enough to eat to keep us going.
S64.Q97.Full: We don't get enough to eat and and have to work to hard and not enough to eat to keep us going.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: The question preceded this one is the question I [deletion] [/deletion] am talking on. Since the time I've entered the army my father has become worse than he was before. It is [insertion] caused [/insertion] mostly by me being in the army and he is worried about me getting killed. It is also caused by the varicouse [varicose] viens [veins] he has and also the run down condition
S64.Q97.C_1: he is in. They wanted to amputate his leg but he didn't want to. This is the cause of his run down condition. I am slightly worried about him because he has been getting sick lately and there is no one to take care of him when he does get sick. The cause of no one taking care of him when he is sick is because he isnt married and my brothers and sister do not go and see him at any time. I was and I am the only one who would take care of him when he did get sick. Therefore he worries about me more than anything else even himself. That is why I wrote this in order to get it off of my chest so I wouldn't be the only one who knows about it.
S64.Q97.Full: The question preceded this one is the question I [deletion] [/deletion] am talking on. Since the time I've entered the army my father has become worse than he was before. It is [insertion] caused [/insertion] mostly by me being in the army and he is worried about me getting killed. It is also caused by the varicouse [varicose] viens [veins] he has and also the run down condition  he is in. They wanted to amputate his leg but he didn't want to. This is the cause of his run down condition. I am slightly worried about him because he has been getting sick lately and there is no one to take care of him when he does get sick. The cause of no one taking care of him when he is sick is because he isnt married and my brothers and sister do not go and see him at any time. I was and I am the only one who would take care of him when he did get sick. Therefore he worries about me more than anything else even himself. That is why I wrote this in order to get it off of my chest so I wouldn't be the only one who knows about it.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I like the Army swell, but I hate this camp I'm in. When you go town all you see is soldier. For the town is so dam small. The soldier can't even eat up at the service club & I thought they were for the soldiers instead of the civilians. Another thing they've got a swimming pool but close it on weekends to clean it out. That is the only time a soldier gets off
S64.Q97.C_1: is on a weekend. I think if they are going to close it on a weekend they might as well fill the thing up. [paragraph]
S64.Q97.Full: I like the Army swell, but I hate this camp I'm in. When you go town all you see is soldier. For the town is so dam small. The soldier can't even eat up at the service club & I thought they were for the soldiers instead of the civilians. Another thing they've got a swimming pool but close it on weekends to clean it out. That is the only time a soldier gets off is on a weekend. I think if they are going to close it on a weekend they might as well fill the thing up. [paragraph]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I would suggest in all seriousness furloughs for men where & whenever possible. I believe this helps moral & gives a man a better outlook in the army, for his future, & helps him to see what he is fighting for. I know this is true. We have very little time to ourselves, even in off duty hours. Lately we have had none, even as far as Sunday are concerned.
S64.Q97.C_1: I don't feel it's all the C.O.'s[Commanding Officer] fault, but some of it is. I suggest a good working day for all & time to relax & write home. We are all willing to do our share of work, but we want some consideration & a little time off. I also don't think alot of several new 90 day wonders from O.C.S.[Officer Candidate School] At times things are run very inefficient in this outfit especially when you are supposed to be two or three places at once. There are too many changes. Things should be more stable. [paragraph] I also think very strongly about the subject of military courtesy. In this company it is decidedly over done. I think saluting & courtesy should be shown an officer, but as far as yelling attention & driving the stuff into our heads; well that's too much. I hope I havn't said anything out of turn or out of position, but it's all my honest opinion.
S64.Q97.Full: I would suggest in all seriousness furloughs for men where & whenever possible. I believe this helps moral & gives a man a better outlook in the army, for his future, & helps him to see what he is fighting for. I know this is true. We have very little time to ourselves, even in off duty hours. Lately we have had none, even as far as Sunday are concerned.  I don't feel it's all the C.O.'s[Commanding Officer] fault, but some of it is. I suggest a good working day for all & time to relax & write home. We are all willing to do our share of work, but we want some consideration & a little time off. I also don't think alot of several new 90 day wonders from O.C.S.[Officer Candidate School] At times things are run very inefficient in this outfit especially when you are supposed to be two or three places at once. There are too many changes. Things should be more stable. [paragraph] I also think very strongly about the subject of military courtesy. In this company it is decidedly over done. I think saluting & courtesy should be shown an officer, but as far as yelling attention & driving the stuff into our heads; well that's too much. I hope I havn't said anything out of turn or out of position, but it's all my honest opinion.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M_marginalia: The overhead is still there with income decreased [written to the right of the answers]
S64.Q97.F: I want to get into the ASTP [Army Specialized Training Program] and increase my knowledge. The orderly room doesn't listen to any inquiries from us fellows who are trying our darndest to get ahead. It is who you know not what you know all the time. Try to get into the work you like in the location you like and you get a cold shoulder from the CO [Commanding Officer] .
S64.Q97.Full: I want to get into the ASTP [Army Specialized Training Program] and increase my knowledge. The orderly room doesn't listen to any inquiries from us fellows who are trying our darndest to get ahead. It is who you know not what you know all the time. Try to get into the work you like in the location you like and you get a cold shoulder from the CO [Commanding Officer] .

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: This may seem like a letter to the chairman but in the Sig. Co, [Signal Corps/Company] there seems to be one chief complaint - that being the fact that all the chances to get ahead are given to a select few. It causes a great deal of friction and dissatisfaction. It's too much like school and the teacher's pet. It certainly is a big disappointment to most fellows who looked forward to getting into the army.
S64.Q97.Full: This may seem like a letter to the chairman but in the Sig. Co, [Signal Corps/Company] there seems to be one chief complaint - that being the fact that all the chances to get ahead are given to a select few. It causes a great deal of friction and dissatisfaction. It's too much like school and the teacher's pet. It certainly is a big disappointment to most fellows who looked forward to getting into the army.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I do not think enough trouble is taken in classifying a man for a place in the army to which he is best suited. If this were so, there would be less men applying for transfers into different branches. Also in the army, there is such a thing as discipline and there is also plain foolishness. Too many times the men are subjected to what is just plain foolishness under the guise of discipline. Most men
S64.Q97.C_1: do not mind taking orders because they realize the man in charge has to give them, but what they do resent is being continually harped on for some thing which just amounts to nothing at all. This cause much dissension instead of unification which [underline] discipline [/underline] is intended to do.
S64.Q97.Full: I do not think enough trouble is taken in classifying a man for a place in the army to which he is best suited. If this were so, there would be less men applying for transfers into different branches. Also in the army, there is such a thing as discipline and there is also plain foolishness. Too many times the men are subjected to what is just plain foolishness under the guise of discipline. Most men do not mind taking orders because they realize the man in charge has to give them, but what they do resent is being continually harped on for some thing which just amounts to nothing at all. This cause much dissension instead of unification which [underline] discipline [/underline] is intended to do.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I've tryed [tried] very hard getting into the Signal corps and succeeded but was very disappointed when I arrive at the Signal [deletion] [/deletion] my reason why I wanted to get into the signal outfit is of the experience I have as a Pigeoneer. I have 10 years of experience of training & flying homing pigeons. My work as a pigeoneer
S64.Q97.C_1: will be more valuable to the Army as a pigeoneer than any other job in the army.
S64.Q97.Full: I've tryed [tried] very hard getting into the Signal corps and succeeded but was very disappointed when I arrive at the Signal [deletion] [/deletion] my reason why I wanted to get into the signal outfit is of the experience I have as a Pigeoneer. I have 10 years of experience of training & flying homing pigeons. My work as a pigeoneer  will be more valuable to the Army as a pigeoneer than any other job in the army.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think draftees in the Armored forces should have as much chance to transfer as other outfits in the army. No wonder some of the fellows go over the hill. We stay in this damn outfit so damn long before we get furloughs. Fellows who live over a thousand miles away from home... 8th A.D. 148th Arm'd Sig Co.
S64.Q97.C_1: should get a least fifteen days. We should at least be near a half decent city instead of the little towns. It ruins a soldiers morale when not able to get to a big city and walk around We are about 75 miles from an half decent city here in Camp Polk.
S64.Q97.Full: I think draftees in the Armored forces should have as much chance to transfer as other outfits in the army. No wonder some of the fellows go over the hill. We stay in this damn outfit so damn long before we get furloughs. Fellows who live over a thousand miles away from home... 8th A.D. 148th Arm'd Sig Co. should get a least fifteen days. We should at least be near a half decent city instead of the little towns. It ruins a soldiers morale when not able to get to a big city and walk around We are about 75 miles from an half decent city here in Camp Polk.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: A soldier should be closer to some towns where he could go to enjoy himself after duty hrs, [hours] And a furlough about every 3 months for about 10 days just to keep up the moral [morale] , as myself I think I could work a lot better under those conditions. They should have all day Sat [Saturday] and Sunday off.
S64.Q97.Full: A soldier should be closer to some towns where he could go to enjoy himself after duty hrs, [hours] And a furlough about every 3 months for about 10 days just to keep up the moral [morale] , as myself I think I could work a lot better under those conditions. They should have all day Sat [Saturday] and Sunday off.

S64.Q97.F: I do not think they need so many men in the service here in the United States I think that they could be of more use at war work

S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I have been in the army 6 months - I've did my best to be a damn good soldier - I know radio very good and I volunteered so I could help the Army with my experience. But - the signal company has too many suck asses - and I never have the chance to show my experience - I don't like to bitch but I thing every
S64.Q97.C_1: SOLDIER DESERVES A CHANCE TO SHOW WHAT HE KNOWS - I ONLY GET TO GO TO COMMUNICATION SCHOOL 3 TIMES A WEEK - AND IF THEY NEED MEN FOR DETAIL THEY PICK US OPERATORS - TO MY NOTION, THEY OUGHT TO GIVE US BETTER SCHOOLING/ AND SOME FIELD EXPERIENCE ON RADIOS SO WE CAN GET THIS MANS WAR OVER WITH - I CAN TAKE 20 WORDS A MINUTE ON CW- RADIO AND WHAT DO I GET - I OPERATE I PICK AND SHOVEL - DON'T GET ME WRONG I DON'T MIND DOING MY JOB - BUT SCHOOLING HERE IN NORTH CAMP POLK IS BAD THE BOYS LIKED SIGNAL CO. UNTIL THE SCHOOL OPENED AND NOW EVERY BODY WANTS TRANSFERRED TO SOMETHING - WHEN THEY CAN SETTLE DOWN AND LEARN SOMETHING - NO RATINGS IN 6 MONTHS EXCEPT THE OFFICERS PETS
S64.Q97.Full: I have been in the army 6 months - I've did my best to be a damn good soldier - I know radio very good and I volunteered so I could help the Army with my experience. But - the signal company has too many suck asses - and I never have the chance to show my experience - I don't like to bitch but I thing every  SOLDIER DESERVES A CHANCE TO SHOW WHAT HE KNOWS - I ONLY GET TO GO TO COMMUNICATION SCHOOL 3 TIMES A WEEK - AND IF THEY NEED MEN FOR DETAIL THEY PICK US OPERATORS - TO MY NOTION, THEY OUGHT TO GIVE US BETTER SCHOOLING/ AND SOME FIELD EXPERIENCE ON RADIOS SO WE CAN GET THIS MANS WAR OVER WITH - I CAN TAKE 20 WORDS A MINUTE ON CW- RADIO AND WHAT DO I GET - I OPERATE I PICK AND SHOVEL - DON'T GET ME WRONG I DON'T MIND DOING MY JOB - BUT SCHOOLING HERE IN NORTH CAMP POLK IS BAD THE BOYS LIKED SIGNAL CO. UNTIL THE SCHOOL OPENED AND NOW EVERY BODY WANTS TRANSFERRED TO SOMETHING - WHEN THEY CAN SETTLE DOWN AND LEARN SOMETHING - NO RATINGS IN 6 MONTHS EXCEPT THE OFFICERS PETS

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think many Soldiers would be happier & would like Army life much better if they were in the branch of Service they liked and done the work they like to do. Also I believe they should give the Soldiers a little more time so they can go out or do some studying or have a good rest, And I also believe a Soldier should be paid a little more. The soldiers are giving their lives & most of the war workers are taking it easy & they are getting a good Salary.
S64.Q97.Full: I think many Soldiers would be happier & would like Army life much better if they were in the branch of Service they liked and done the work they like to do. Also I believe they should give the Soldiers a little more time so they can go out or do some studying or have a good rest, And I also believe a Soldier should be paid a little more. The soldiers are giving their lives & most of the war workers are taking it easy & they are getting a good Salary.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Individual companys are not equipped as well with tools & equipment needed to maintain their vehicles as they should be. Being a mechanic in our company I see many chances to save government time & money if the company maintenance men could have equipment to go into 3rd & 4th [unclear] [/unclear] of vehicles.
S64.Q97.C_1: Each company should have spark plug cleaning + testing equipment. They should also have equipment to perform ring jobs + valve grinding jobs. [paragraph] It requires too much time to take a vehicle to the Maintance Battalion to be repaired. Many jobs that I've seen go to the maintance shop I feel I could do equally as well and also in much shorter time. [paragraph] Tools are half of the job. If we do not have the tools to do the job with the government can't expect first class work turned out.
S64.Q97.Full: Individual companys are not equipped as well with tools & equipment needed to maintain their vehicles as they should be. Being a mechanic in our company I see many chances to save government time & money if the company maintenance men could have equipment to go into 3rd & 4th [unclear] [/unclear] of vehicles. Each company should have spark plug cleaning + testing equipment. They should also have equipment to perform ring jobs + valve grinding jobs. [paragraph] It requires too much time to take a vehicle to the Maintance Battalion to be repaired. Many jobs that I've seen go to the maintance shop I feel I could do equally as well and also in much shorter time. [paragraph] Tools are half of the job. If we do not have the tools to do the job with the government can't expect first class work turned out.

S64.Q97.Full: I would like to know why a young person under 20 don't get his pick of what branch of service he would like to be in, that is if he passes the requirements.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think some type of ruling should be made that after a soldier completes 3 months of basic training he should get a furlough. Make this a definite rule. You can't expect a person to rush from home & not ever get back for months & months. The navy does, why not the Army? After the first furlough one every 6 months there after, any way.
S64.Q97.Full: I think some type of ruling should be made that after a soldier completes 3 months of basic training he should get a furlough. Make this a definite rule. You can't expect a person to rush from home & not ever get back for months & months. The navy does, why not the Army? After the first furlough one every 6 months there after, any way.
