document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: As far as basic training goes it's all right but when it come to reviews and drilling save that for the infantry not the Air Corps. Why when it comes to mil. [military] courtesy why should an enlisted man salute the officers. They are human beings & not lords. Saluting to me is like saying (Heil) to some superman of the U.S.
S64.Q97.Full: As far as basic training goes it's all right but when it come to reviews and drilling save that for the infantry not the Air Corps. Why when it comes to mil. [military] courtesy why should an enlisted man salute the officers. They are human beings & not lords. Saluting to me is like saying (Heil) to some superman of the U.S.

S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: In my opinion, Russia should be watched and not allowed to make any seperate peace or even a hint of running things her own way. [paragraph] I feel that I could benefit, and the army also, if I could spend my base time studying the newer planes I will some day go in. After a [unclear] ferry [/unclear] trip is over now, we do general duty work which makes us 'rusty' in
S64.Q97.C_1: -- our real jobs. In other words we can never learn too much, but if we stay away for a month at a time from our old job we can't do our best. We, also, do not derive any exceptional additional chances of increasing our knowledge of our work. I feel all o

After a [unclear] ferry [/unclear] trip is over now, we do general duty work which makes us 'rusty' in -- our real jobs. In other words we can never learn too much, but if we stay away for a month at a time from our old job we can't do our best. document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I do think that some fellows who deserve stripes do no get them, as for myself & a few other boys that I know that have been in the army one year & been working on planes for 8 months, & also been put up for stripes for the last 6 months & Im still waiting like my other friends are. [paragraph]
S64.Q97.Full: I do think that some fellows who deserve stripes do no get them, as for myself & a few other boys that I know that have been in the army one year & been working on planes for 8 months, & also been put up for stripes for the last 6 months & Im still waiting like my other friends are. [paragraph]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Lets throw some politics & "brown nosing" out of the army & give credit where credit is due for services rendered.
S64.Q97.Full: Lets throw some politics & "brown nosing" out of the army & give credit where credit is due for services rendered.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Enlisted men's per diem should be same as officers. They're no damn better than we are and we work as hard as they do but the get the credit and glory and the E.M. get the leftovers.
S64.Q97.Full: Enlisted men's per diem should be same as officers. They're no damn better than we are and we work as hard as they do but the get the credit and glory and the E.M. get the leftovers.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: When a soldier isn't even in an overseas [unclear] [/unclear] he should be allowed a few extra hours on his pass. Say for instance he misses a train and calls the Fort or post where he is stationed and notifies his commanding officer, he shouldn't be punished. On overseas or combat zone it is different. Over on back.
S64.Q97.C_1: 15) The Air Corp as a pilot, even if it was only ferrying planes to different places. 25) I don't care just as long as I could fly a plane. 34) That is here to Fort Sheridan. 36) Anything takes time to do it right. 64) This is up to the Commander-in -Chief.
S64.Q97.Full: When a soldier isn't even in an overseas [unclear] [/unclear] he should be allowed a few extra hours on his pass. Say for instance he misses a train and calls the Fort or post where he is stationed and notifies his commanding officer, he shouldn't be punished. On overseas or combat zone it is different. Over on back.  15) The Air Corp as a pilot, even if it was only ferrying planes to different places. 25) I don't care just as long as I could fly a plane. 34) That is here to Fort Sheridan. 36) Anything takes time to do it right. 64) This is up to the Commander-in -Chief.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: We should be more furloughs than we do. [paragraph] And better food than we do get in some camps and a little more free time than we do get. and in some camps we should get more entertainment. and we can always use a little more money. I [unclear] crange [/unclear] to go home more often than we do when we do?
S64.Q97.Full: We should be more furloughs than we do. [paragraph] And better food than we do get in some camps and a little more free time than we do get. and in some camps we should get more entertainment. and we can always use a little more money. I [unclear] crange [/unclear] to go home more often than we do when we do?

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Speaking of clothes I believe the we should be allowed to regard our field jackets as part of our winter uniform and we should be issued a summer jacket. Sometimes it is too cool to run around in just shirt sleeves. I feel that a soldier should be permitted to have his camera on the post with him. Many fellows like
S64.Q97.C_1: Myself get a great deal of pleasure out of cameras and I feel that they have given up enough without a [unclear] parish [/unclear] thing like that I happen to know that some posts allow camera's so why shouldn't all of them. [paragraph] [insertion] [column] 12.00 [/column] [column] [underline] 550 [/underline] [/column] [column] 6.30 [/column] [column] 24:00 [/column] [column] [underline] 5.30 [/underline] [/column] [column] 36 [/column] [/insertion] I believe that the design of the day tags could be revised and smaller tags made. These tags are cumbersome. I feel that any soldier regardless of age should be allowed to buy liquor if he so desires, but I also believe that any soldier whether he is an officer or enlisted man should be court-martialed for appearing in public when drunk or otherwise a disgrace to his uniform. I believe that when a soldier lives within traveling distance of his home that he should have the privilege of going there on his. My home is 20 miles from [unclear] breand [/unclear] is only a 3 hour ride but my pass is good for 100 miles only and I have almost 36 hours of liberty every week end that I could so easily spend at home if it werent for the 100 mile limit. [paragraph] The Army food could be greatly improved and that would eliminate some of the enormous waste of food. [paragraph]

Many fellows like  Myself get a great deal of pleasure out of cameras and I feel that they have given up enough without a [unclear] parish [/unclear] thing like that I happen to know that some posts allow camera's so why shouldn't all of them. document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Some of these Officers should be sent back to school or put back in the ranks until they grow up and look like men instead of kids and act like men. There also should be better cooks around here. there guys can't boil water with out burning it. I think it is unnecessary to take a man's week-end privelige away from
S64.Q97.C_1: him for a mistake that maybe was accidental. They are too tough on some things and not tough enough on others. [paragraph] Conditions here are very unsanitary especially the mess halls. The food is terrible and the mess Sgt. is worse he is always giving some one hell and I don't like that atmosphere when I am eating. I know I am not alone with this feeling, there are a lot of other ones, that think the same thing. [paragraph] Officers are very lax in saluting.
S64.Q97.Full: Some of these Officers should be sent back to school or put back in the ranks until they grow up and look like men instead of kids and act like men. There also should be better cooks around here. there guys can't boil water with out burning it. I think it is unnecessary to take a man's week-end privelige away from him for a mistake that maybe was accidental. They are too tough on some things and not tough enough on others. [paragraph] Conditions here are very unsanitary especially the mess halls. The food is terrible and the mess Sgt. is worse he is always giving some one hell and I don't like that atmosphere when I am eating. I know I am not alone with this feeling, there are a lot of other ones, that think the same thing. [paragraph] Officers are very lax in saluting.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Just let us get this thing called war over with so I can go home and live a nice and peaceful home life. That is what we are all fighting for is it not?
S64.Q97.Full: Just let us get this thing called war over with so I can go home and live a nice and peaceful home life. That is what we are all fighting for is it not?

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Personally I think the army should have better fraternal communications at the post so a member would have some where to go in leisure hours especially one who is quite a distance from home. Also, I think they should be more liberal with furloughs to married men whenever possible to help take care of home problems that they are responsible for their wives to aid as financially and legal status.
S64.Q97.C_1: Also think that draft boards should be made to drain larger cities of all available single men before draining the married men from small towns and villages.
S64.Q97.Full: Personally I think the army should have better fraternal communications at the post so a member would have some where to go in leisure hours especially one who is quite a distance from home. Also, I think they should be more liberal with furloughs to married men whenever possible to help take care of home problems that they are responsible for their wives to aid as financially and legal status.  Also think that draft boards should be made to drain larger cities of all available single men before draining the married men from small towns and villages.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: At present I am a member of a school training auto-mechanics. I am grateful to the army for this opportunity and am going to make the best of it. It is hard to give view-points on an outfit like this, since there are men here from all branches of the service. Having been a former service man, I would like to have been put back with my old outfit, but I guess the Army didn't want it that way. I am satisfied however, and I am damn sure that the U.S. is going to come out on top. This questionaire is one of the best ways that I have
S64.Q97.C_1: seen for an E.M. to give his ideas. Good for you & keep it up. [paragraph] I was discharged in Aug. 1941 [unclear] (departing) [/unclear] . Married in '42 and enlisted in May 43. Somewhere a son who I want to hear say that he's proud of his dad.
S64.Q97.Full: At present I am a member of a school training auto-mechanics. I am grateful to the army for this opportunity and am going to make the best of it. It is hard to give view-points on an outfit like this, since there are men here from all branches of the service. Having been a former service man, I would like to have been put back with my old outfit, but I guess the Army didn't want it that way. I am satisfied however, and I am damn sure that the U.S. is going to come out on top. This questionaire is one of the best ways that I have seen for an E.M. to give his ideas. Good for you & keep it up. [paragraph] I was discharged in Aug. 1941 [unclear] (departing) [/unclear] . Married in '42 and enlisted in May 43. Somewhere a son who I want to hear say that he's proud of his dad.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I can't see why they keep saying in the paper that married men will be deffered [deferred] a while longer. I am married and have a child 10 months old who was born on Sept 24, 1942. And I think personally my place is at home with my wife and baby doing a war job. I would be a lot happier and would be able to do a lot more towards the war effort.
S64.Q97.C_1: I also think that the draft board do no do the right thing by the men. I asked for a weeks longer time before entering the army so I could sell my house which I had just started to buy so I could leave my wife and baby some money to get along on and they refused me permission. Yet there are a lot of single fellows in California who who get 6 months deferment for being apprentice war workers. I personally don't think they have the right people running the draft board. [paragraph] I also think they should give a few more rating to the general service men in the army instead of giving most of them to the limited service men. [paragraph] If men were instructed by general service men instead of limited service men they would not mind taking orders. But these limited service men are a pain in the neck and should be sent home where they belong.
S64.Q97.Full: I can't see why they keep saying in the paper that married men will be deffered [deferred] a while longer. I am married and have a child 10 months old who was born on Sept 24, 1942. And I think personally my place is at home with my wife and baby doing a war job. I would be a lot happier and would be able to do a lot more towards the war effort. I also think that the draft board do no do the right thing by the men. I asked for a weeks longer time before entering the army so I could sell my house which I had just started to buy so I could leave my wife and baby some money to get along on and they refused me permission. Yet there are a lot of single fellows in California who who get 6 months deferment for being apprentice war workers. I personally don't think they have the right people running the draft board. [paragraph] I also think they should give a few more rating to the general service men in the army instead of giving most of them to the limited service men. [paragraph] If men were instructed by general service men instead of limited service men they would not mind taking orders. But these limited service men are a pain in the neck and should be sent home where they belong.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Why don't we have more sports and recreation on Sundays than now. [paragraph] Are all camps getting enough food as we are. The Army travels on its stomach & they can't and it empty. The army is getting its share of things but are civilians that are giving up their sugar where does it go, we don't get it and many other things there
S64.Q97.C_1: is enough on this side for us. Is the boys that are fighting over there getting what they should. Give them more we can do without here as to a certain extent. Send men accross more letters + ciggarette, we have what we need. [paragraph] The Army I think in this camp is almost like a summer resort to some I know of they don't have enough privileges thats why they go A.W.O.L. and you can't blame them. When they are off duty why should they lay around in the barricks when they could be having a better time at home with their folks.
S64.Q97.Full: Why don't we have more sports and recreation on Sundays than now. [paragraph] Are all camps getting enough food as we are. The Army travels on its stomach & they can't and it empty. The army is getting its share of things but are civilians that are giving up their sugar where does it go, we don't get it and many other things there is enough on this side for us. Is the boys that are fighting over there getting what they should. Give them more we can do without here as to a certain extent. Send men accross more letters + ciggarette, we have what we need. [paragraph] The Army I think in this camp is almost like a summer resort to some I know of they don't have enough privileges thats why they go A.W.O.L. and you can't blame them. When they are off duty why should they lay around in the barricks when they could be having a better time at home with their folks.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think athletics are neglected at some posts and I can't think of anything that is better for morale. The Navy seems to have plenty of time for athletics so why can't the Army?[paragraph] I also think that there are quite a few men in the Army that should be out and at home with their families. I also think or rather know quite a few men that are not ...
S64.Q97.C_1: physically fit for the Army. There are also too many political fulls it seems as if it's who you know and not what you know. there are also too many different rules and regulations in different camps and I think the Army should have one set of rules for all camps, such as making up beds, and also drilling, hours of liberty.
S64.Q97.Full: I think athletics are neglected at some posts and I can't think of anything that is better for morale. The Navy seems to have plenty of time for athletics so why can't the Army?[paragraph] I also think that there are quite a few men in the Army that should be out and at home with their families. I also think or rather know quite a few men that are not ... physically fit for the Army. There are also too many political fulls it seems as if it's who you know and not what you know. there are also too many different rules and regulations in different camps and I think the Army should have one set of rules for all camps, such as making up beds, and also drilling, hours of liberty.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Darn sorry that I had to miss 2 hrs of school to fill out this blank as I don't think anything will come of it anyway and I will never be able to get back my lost time.
S64.Q97.Full: Darn sorry that I had to miss 2 hrs of school to fill out this blank as I don't think anything will come of it anyway and I will never be able to get back my lost time.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think in the War Dept. Would leave all of the farmers on the farms it would be a lot quicker war. As the farmers do a lot in the war part. As if I was home I could do a lot more then I could in the Army. There are to many men out of the Army that should be in here.
S64.Q97.Full: I think in the War Dept. Would leave all of the farmers on the farms it would be a lot quicker war. As the farmers do a lot in the war part. As if I was home I could do a lot more then I could in the Army. There are to many men out of the Army that should be in here.

S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Will I think a married person should be able to go home at nite where his wife is living now where he can be back every morning in time for duty witch he does not get to do in this camp but it is 50,5
S64.Q97.Full: Will I think a married person should be able to go home at nite where his wife is living now where he can be back every morning in time for duty witch he does not get to do in this camp but it is 50,5

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: The first three grades are treated more or less like pvts that shouldn't be that is your brains of your outfit. Officers dont know the army you can't get it out of books 30 days it too long for them to stay around if our boys started to solider like we want too.
S64.Q97.C_1: Let your noncoms [non-commissioned officers] handle your men, officers handle your noncoms, but give them a free working hand.
S64.Q97.Full: The first three grades are treated more or less like pvts that shouldn't be that is your brains of your outfit. Officers dont know the army you can't get it out of books 30 days it too long for them to stay around if our boys started to solider like we want too. Let your noncoms [non-commissioned officers] handle your men, officers handle your noncoms, but give them a free working hand.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: The only passes granted in this outfit and are a few week-end passes. What we want are class A & B Passes granted so you could at least have some idea whether you could leave camp even for an hour in the evening or not.
S64.Q97.Full: The only passes granted in this outfit and are a few week-end passes. What we want are class A & B Passes granted so you could at least have some idea whether you could leave camp even for an hour in the evening or not.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: 1. We fellows have been in the Service 4 1/2 months and I can't see why they won't give us passes so we can go out when we're off duty. [paragraph] 2. We should be eating out of plates instead of mess kits. [paragraph] 3. All soldiers should have at least one half day a week off because we only have sundays off and sometimes
S64.Q97.C_1: we are in special Detail and its really gets a long white before we go out.
S64.Q97.Full: 1. We fellows have been in the Service 4 1/2 months and I can't see why they won't give us passes so we can go out when we're off duty. [paragraph] 2. We should be eating out of plates instead of mess kits. [paragraph] 3. All soldiers should have at least one half day a week off because we only have sundays off and sometimes we are in special Detail and its really gets a long white before we go out.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: In our outfit the non-coms all get furloughs and the privates were let out. I dont think thats a bit fair. Each battery has a mess hall but they have closed up half of them and are crowding us into the others, making us use mess kits and doing without the food that we should be getting. They give us a ten minute break between classes which turns out to be 2 or 3 minutes.
S64.Q97.Full: In our outfit the non-coms all get furloughs and the privates were let out. I dont think thats a bit fair. Each battery has a mess hall but they have closed up half of them and are crowding us into the others, making us use mess kits and doing without the food that we should be getting. They give us a ten minute break between classes which turns out to be 2 or 3 minutes.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Our pass system is rotten we only get passes 1 or so a month. [space] [paragraph] We would like a furlough once in a while so we could go home & see the family & the reason were fighting for
S64.Q97.C_1: All cooks get pass, all the men get A class passes as when were off duty we should be free. [paragraph] Straiten up our bonds & Insurance & let us eat out of plates.
S64.Q97.Full: Our pass system is rotten we only get passes 1 or so a month. [space] [paragraph] We would like a furlough once in a while so we could go home & see the family & the reason were fighting for All cooks get pass, all the men get A class passes as when were off duty we should be free. [paragraph] Straiten up our bonds & Insurance & let us eat out of plates.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: It seems to me, that some fellows, can get passes + [and] furlough easier than others even if the other boys stay to their best at all times. [paragraph] I think [insertion] the army [/insertion] is to [too ] strict on some things + [and] not strict enough on things seem more important to me.
S64.Q97.Full: It seems to me, that some fellows, can get passes + [and] furlough easier than others even if the other boys stay to their best at all times. [paragraph] I think [insertion] the army [/insertion] is to [too ] strict on some things + [and] not strict enough on things seem more important to me.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Generally the officers are not good instructors. Even subjects they know they do not know how to teach. Results in a [underline] great [/underline] loss of time.
S64.Q97.Full: Generally the officers are not good instructors. Even subjects they know they do not know how to teach. Results in a [underline] great [/underline] loss of time.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: The only thing is that when a person is away from home for many months he should able to get to go back or a furlough for a time. We should have at least 15 day furlough for every 6 months. We do not get this and we should have it. I think that this right and should be made in every camp. The boys would be more contented.
S64.Q97.Full: The only thing is that when a person is away from home for many months he should able to get to go back or a furlough for a time. We should have at least 15 day furlough for every 6 months. We do not get this and we should have it. I think that this right and should be made in every camp. The boys would be more contented.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: If the officers were specialized in some branch of the service when they come out of O.C.S. it would be a little easier on the Non Coms for they have teach them as well as the men.
S64.Q97.Full: If the officers were specialized in some branch of the service when they come out of O.C.S. it would be a little easier on the Non Coms for they have teach them as well as the men.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I have been in the Army [deletion] and [/deletion] going on five mo. and as yet have not gotten more than a week end pass. That goes also for 9/10 of the men in my Btry. [Battery] .
S64.Q97.Full: I have been in the Army [deletion] and [/deletion] going on five mo. and as yet have not gotten more than a week end pass. That goes also for 9/10 of the men in my Btry. [Battery] .

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Any man who holds a commission should have had at least 18 months service as an enlisted man. A man coming out of civilian life goes thru basic then to O.C.S. [Officer Candidate School] cannot possibly know the score on the Army. There is enough enlisted men in this Army who have had plenty of experience to fill the needed quota of officers without dragging ...
S64.Q97.C_1: recruits out after 8 weeks and sending them to O.C.S. [Officer Candidate School] . Non coms [non-commissioned officers] should not be made unless they have had at least six months service. There isn't enough time devoted to the more important things such as target practice and close-order drill. When a man comes into the army he shouldn't have anything but close order for the first two weeks. I have seen innumerable M/Sgts [Master Sergeants] , who cannot do about face. Military police are too smart. Give a guy a brassard [arm sleeve] with M.P. [Military Police] on it and he thinks he owns the whole country. Lets straighten these DEML [Detached Enlisted Mens List] boys out. Why do all the Chinese and Philippines get all the soft jobs at Army Hqtrs [Headquarters] . Politics had gone too far in this army. Lets get back to the old army and get a few officers who can do left face and corporals who can take charge of a police detail.
S64.Q97.Full: Any man who holds a commission should have had at least 18 months service as an enlisted man. A man coming out of civilian life goes thru basic then to O.C.S. [Officer Candidate School] cannot possibly know the score on the Army. There is enough enlisted men in this Army who have had plenty of experience to fill the needed quota of officers without dragging ... recruits out after 8 weeks and sending them to O.C.S. [Officer Candidate School] . Non coms [non-commissioned officers] should not be made unless they have had at least six months service. There isn't enough time devoted to the more important things such as target practice and close-order drill. When a man comes into the army he shouldn't have anything but close order for the first two weeks. I have seen innumerable M/Sgts [Master Sergeants] , who cannot do about face. Military police are too smart. Give a guy a brassard [arm sleeve] with M.P. [Military Police] on it and he thinks he owns the whole country. Lets straighten these DEML [Detached Enlisted Mens List] boys out. Why do all the Chinese and Philippines get all the soft jobs at Army Hqtrs [Headquarters] . Politics had gone too far in this army. Lets get back to the old army and get a few officers who can do left face and corporals who can take charge of a police detail.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: Since coming to this outfit. [7]
S64.Q97.F: In all the outfit I am now a member of is worth the time spent out it. It seems as though things are planned just to keep boys from having any free time. Things arent told us enough in advance to make a good showing. Boys are never allowed to compete in athletics & etc as other units on the post are. Morale has gotten to the place where it is serious. No confidence in officers.
S64.Q97.Full: In all the outfit I am now a member of is worth the time spent out it. It seems as though things are planned just to keep boys from having any free time. Things arent told us enough in advance to make a good showing. Boys are never allowed to compete in athletics & etc as other units on the post are. Morale has gotten to the place where it is serious. No confidence in officers.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: All the things I look forward to upon enter a democratic army have been just disillusions. Such very things that we are fighting for are being denied to soldiers. The worst thing of all is discrimination because of a fellers [fellow's] color, creed or the [underline] part [/underline] of the country he comes from. At first I thought a feller [fellow] who enjoyed outdoors ...
S64.Q97.C_1: life who had some initiative and half way near good service could get along and make out well. But there's too much partial show by the fellers who just suck around the non coms. I always wanted to [unclear] efffane [/unclear] leaders with high ideals but most of our non coms seem to have few morals. We are treated as if we never came from decent homes at all. If a feller got a few more passes and a little more liberty we'd have better soldiers. We've been in the army over 5 mos. and never got a chance to go home once. I wish the war ends soon so I can go home.
S64.Q97.Full: All the things I look forward to upon enter a democratic army have been just disillusions. Such very things that we are fighting for are being denied to soldiers. The worst thing of all is discrimination because of a fellers [fellow's] color, creed or the [underline] part [/underline] of the country he comes from. At first I thought a feller [fellow] who enjoyed outdoors ... life who had some initiative and half way near good service could get along and make out well. But there's too much partial show by the fellers who just suck around the non coms. I always wanted to [unclear] efffane [/unclear] leaders with high ideals but most of our non coms seem to have few morals. We are treated as if we never came from decent homes at all. If a feller got a few more passes and a little more liberty we'd have better soldiers. We've been in the army over 5 mos. and never got a chance to go home once. I wish the war ends soon so I can go home.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Some of the boys could do more on the farm than they can in the army. And some of them that are out should be in the Army. They are taking to many farmers some places an other places. they don't take any. I don't think that's fair. I could do more on the farm then I can do in the army. Know my farm is laying idol. An that dosnt help any.
S64.Q97.Full: Some of the boys could do more on the farm than they can in the army. And some of them that are out should be in the Army. They are taking to many farmers some places an other places. they don't take any. I don't think that's fair. I could do more on the farm then I can do in the army. Know my farm is laying idol. An that dosnt help any.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Yes I have. When I was home, I had a little job but it helped my parents but now I can't. I was the only one home all of my brothers and sisters got married, my father is 62 years old and my mothers 69, and with all the rations going on its kinda tough on my father he makes about 40 a week, and what I send home isn't enough. If the army could arrange to send more money to my family. I mean, put more
S64.Q97.C_1: money on my alotment [allotment] , I take out $22 they take out and the army puts only $15 onto it they should send my family at least $50 a month then I think my parent could get along better.
S64.Q97.Full: Yes I have. When I was home, I had a little job but it helped my parents but now I can't. I was the only one home all of my brothers and sisters got married, my father is 62 years old and my mothers 69, and with all the rations going on its kinda tough on my father he makes about 40 a week, and what I send home isn't enough. If the army could arrange to send more money to my family. I mean, put more money on my alotment [allotment] , I take out $22 they take out and the army puts only $15 onto it they should send my family at least $50 a month then I think my parent could get along better.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: In civilian life I made T.N.T. [Trinitrotoluene] for a powder co. [company] where I had worked for 2 years. On the sideline I raised hogs. I sold 128 head when I came to the army. I think I was doing more good there than I am here in this camp. At least I was producing something that is very ...
S64.Q97.C_1: much needed to carry on. Therefore I think my coming to the army was a very foolish move.
S64.Q97.Full: In civilian life I made T.N.T. [Trinitrotoluene] for a powder co. [company] where I had worked for 2 years. On the sideline I raised hogs. I sold 128 head when I came to the army. I think I was doing more good there than I am here in this camp. At least I was producing something that is very ...  much needed to carry on. Therefore I think my coming to the army was a very foolish move.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: In regards to question 95 about passes and furloughs. The army should allow more passes and furloughs to be granted. The army is made up of personal [personnel] quite young. Often this is their first time away from home and to receive a pass and allowed to go out once in a while keeps him in much better spirits.
S64.Q97.Full: In regards to question 95 about passes and furloughs. The army should allow more passes and furloughs to be granted. The army is made up of personal [personnel] quite young. Often this is their first time away from home and to receive a pass and allowed to go out once in a while keeps him in much better spirits.

S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think that all the fellows in my battalion should get class A passes because they deserve them. We should also get furloughs because not many of us had them except for the emergency furloughs, and I also believe that furloughs would help keep up the morale.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that all the fellows in my battalion should get class A passes because they deserve them. We should also get furloughs because not many of us had them except for the emergency furloughs, and I also believe that furloughs would help keep up the morale.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think when a man is in the army six months he should get a 15 day furlough, at least [unclear] [/unclear] day, so he can see his mother, dad, brother, sweetheart etc. for about a week. These five and seven day furloughs are the [unclear] [/unclear] . It takes some 2 and 3 days to get home then he has got to come back as soon as he ...
S64.Q97.C_1: gets there. We might have a few hours. [paragraph] Every soldier I have talked to wants longer furloughs ten days at the very least or a week besides traveling time. [paragraph] Thats all I have to say.
S64.Q97.Full: I think when a man is in the army six months he should get a 15 day furlough, at least [unclear] [/unclear] day, so he can see his mother, dad, brother, sweetheart etc. for about a week. These five and seven day furloughs are the [unclear] [/unclear] . It takes some 2 and 3 days to get home then he has got to come back as soon as he ...  gets there. We might have a few hours. [paragraph] Every soldier I have talked to wants longer furloughs ten days at the very least or a week besides traveling time. [paragraph] Thats all I have to say.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: 97. If you have any further remarks you would like to make on any subject please write them below as fully as you like. ([paragraph] ) All I know is that we must all work hard together and fight as we have never fought before. After is is over we can go to our own homes in peace. ([paragraph] ) At the present time let the army force have as much liberty as possible, and I am sure we'll all do our very best.
S64.Q97.Full: 97. If you have any further remarks you would like to make on any subject please write them below as fully as you like. ([paragraph] ) All I know is that we must all work hard together and fight as we have never fought before. After is is over we can go to our own homes in peace. ([paragraph] ) At the present time let the army force have as much liberty as possible, and I am sure we'll all do our very best.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I believe the men should get evening passes because it helps to keep up the morale of the men. It would also cut down the number of men that overstay their passes when they do manage to get one. [paragraph]
S64.Q97.Full: I believe the men should get evening passes because it helps to keep up the morale of the men. It would also cut down the number of men that overstay their passes when they do manage to get one. [paragraph]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I believe I should not be in general service, because of a back injury. I wish we had a good Bat Co in 777 because Major Holland is the biggest eight ball in the outfit. We would have the best trained battalion in the country if he would leave. They make the wrong men promotions, because the men they promote let it go to their
S64.Q97.C_1: [unclear] [/unclear] in fact if they would let the non-coms [non-commissioned officers] run the battalion we would be somewhere. The officers don't have the mental capacity of a P.F.C. [private first class] . Every man in the organization will agree. We are not getting enough training because the dopes who run the outfit can only [unclear] think [/unclear] of bivouac when we need other training so badly.
S64.Q97.Full: I believe I should not be in general service, because of a back injury. I wish we had a good Bat Co in 777 because Major Holland is the biggest eight ball in the outfit. We would have the best trained battalion in the country if he would leave. They make the wrong men promotions, because the men they promote let it go to their [unclear] [/unclear] in fact if they would let the non-coms [non-commissioned officers] run the battalion we would be somewhere. The officers don't have the mental capacity of a P.F.C. [private first class] . Every man in the organization will agree. We are not getting enough training because the dopes who run the outfit can only [unclear] think [/unclear] of bivouac when we need other training so badly.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: none at all (furloughs 3 day passes)
S64.Q97.F: I'm sorry to say this but the moral in my out fit is bad. I'm not griping because in a way I like the army. The thing that makes me sore is the other fellows always kicking about something. Its the food one day and the passes & furloughs the next. Sure some day our rations arent the best but
S64.Q97.C_1: no one is going to starve. I will say this however we need more time off for our own personal pleasures this would help bring our moral up I'm sure. That is all I have to say.
S64.Q97.Full: I'm sorry to say this but the moral in my out fit is bad. I'm not griping because in a way I like the army. The thing that makes me sore is the other fellows always kicking about something. Its the food one day and the passes & furloughs the next. Sure some day our rations arent the best but no one is going to starve. I will say this however we need more time off for our own personal pleasures this would help bring our moral up I'm sure. That is all I have to say.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: I haven't been in long enough for a furlough but I don't think we get enght passes
S64.Q97.F: I think that we should have more passes I think they would been more cooperative and would get more done if they could have a short rest once in a whil. I think there should be more volanteer jobs in the army and less of this just going down the lest and checking any more.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that we should have more passes I think they would been more cooperative and would get more done if they could have a short rest once in a whil. I think there should be more volanteer jobs in the army and less of this just going down the lest and checking any more.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M_marginalia: Its tough for a wife and baby to live alone
S64.Q97.F: One of my reasons for believing the Army is ineficient in a lot of ways is the following. It seems about 400 of us old men (1 yr or more training) were sent here in Cadre but instead of using us to win this war we were put in a new outfit on diferent guns and mixed in with recruits and have started basic training again. We take orders from 3 mos. sgts. The 400 men now are very low in morale and
S64.Q97.C_1: most of us who are non coms are being broke because of lack of interest. It seems they have destroyed 400 great soldiers instead of using us for the war efort [effort] . We all were conected [connected] with an alert Btry on the east coast for over 2 years before coming here with no furloughs and very few passes protecting eastern coast defenses. We were thoroughly trained on 90 milimeter [millimeter] guns and 155 mm. and after all that training and schooling we got at the beginning of our army career we are just on 40 mm. which we know nothing about and are darn sure are not more important than the two other guns we spent our army life with. The appalling part of it is there [underline] are [/underline] 90s on this fort and they put recruits on them and we who have used them and fired them numerous times are dicarded [discarded] as replacement men on a different branch of service. This outfit is a training center it seems for young officers and we are used as guinea pigs. Come on war department give us fellows with a lot of service some action or get rid of us altogether. Check up on AAA T.E. in Ft. Sheridan Illinois. What a mess.
S64.Q97.Full: One of my reasons for believing the Army is ineficient in a lot of ways is the following. It seems about 400 of us old men (1 yr or more training) were sent here in Cadre but instead of using us to win this war we were put in a new outfit on diferent guns and mixed in with recruits and have started basic training again. We take orders from 3 mos. sgts. The 400 men now are very low in morale and most of us who are non coms are being broke because of lack of interest. It seems they have destroyed 400 great soldiers instead of using us for the war efort [effort] . We all were conected [connected] with an alert Btry on the east coast for over 2 years before coming here with no furloughs and very few passes protecting eastern coast defenses. We were thoroughly trained on 90 milimeter [millimeter] guns and 155 mm. and after all that training and schooling we got at the beginning of our army career we are just on 40 mm. which we know nothing about and are darn sure are not more important than the two other guns we spent our army life with. The appalling part of it is there [underline] are [/underline] 90s on this fort and they put recruits on them and we who have used them and fired them numerous times are dicarded [discarded] as replacement men on a different branch of service. This outfit is a training center it seems for young officers and we are used as guinea pigs. Come on war department give us fellows with a lot of service some action or get rid of us altogether. Check up on AAA T.E. in Ft. Sheridan Illinois. What a mess.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I haven't been in this camp long enough for a furlough but expect one in a couple of months. [paragraph] My jobs O.K. But at the age of 34 I find it very hard to keep up with the rest of the boys in my outfit. Outside of myself and 3 or 4 others the rest are all from 18 to 22 years old. Thats why I think id be better off on a defence job. [paragraph]
S64.Q97.Full: I haven't been in this camp long enough for a furlough but expect one in a couple of months. [paragraph] My jobs O.K. Thats why I think id be better off on a defence job. [paragraph]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: In civilian life I was making 50 cal machine amo. , by drafting me in to the army they had to stand the expense of training two men. It cost the company I was working for about $500.00 to train me for my job, so bt taking me into the arrmy the company had to spend the money to train a new man for my place while the army had to train me something new too. I think it would save both
S64.Q97.C_1: time and money if they would leave the men in defence plants who were through with their training and take men into the army who was not in a defence plant or some kind of work where it would be necessary to train them for the job.
S64.Q97.Full: In civilian life I was making 50 cal machine amo. , by drafting me in to the army they had to stand the expense of training two men. It cost the company I was working for about $500.00 to train me for my job, so bt taking me into the arrmy the company had to spend the money to train a new man for my place while the army had to train me something new too. I think it would save both time and money if they would leave the men in defence plants who were through with their training and take men into the army who was not in a defence plant or some kind of work where it would be necessary to train them for the job.

S64.Q97.F: I think if a mans wife is close to him or his camp that man should be able to live off the post- because if he don't get to live of [off] the post it only makes a poor soldier out of him- a soldier who don't care what he does. Take it from me - I know - because I'm one of those fellows.
S64.Q97.Full: I think if a mans wife is close to him or his camp that man should be able to live off the post- because if he don't get to live of [off] the post it only makes a poor soldier out of him- a soldier who don't care what he does. document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: The army doesn't give us enough furloughs, and we never get a three day pass, and my wife is expecting a child, and I think a soldier should get a furlough to go home at a time like that. [paragraph] The shows on the forts should show more of these war picture to the fellows, and they could see just about what is happening to the other side,
S64.Q97.C_1: and I think they should show, a few old pictures, the one that cam out in the 1930's because I know I would enjoy them and I think all the other fellows would too. [paragraph] I think that after inspection on Saturdays that the fellows should have the rest of the day off, and I think our weekend passes should be from 18:00 Saturday till 5:45 Monday instead they are from 18:00 Saturday till 23:55 Monday, and I don't see why we couldn't have them till 5:45 Monday morning, because married men whom wifes are living off the post have till 5:45, and they are no better than us. [paragraph] I think they shouldn't send a soilder overseas until he is twenty one [unclear] at haft [/unclear] , because that is the part of his life which is had for fighting and other purposes, and a soilder should have at least one year of training before overseas duty. [paragraph]
S64.Q97.Full: The army doesn't give us enough furloughs, and we never get a three day pass, and my wife is expecting a child, and I think a soldier should get a furlough to go home at a time like that. [paragraph] The shows on the forts should show more of these war picture to the fellows, and they could see just about what is happening to the other side, and I think they should show, a few old pictures, the one that cam out in the 1930's because I know I would enjoy them and I think all the other fellows would too. [paragraph] I think that after inspection on Saturdays that the fellows should have the rest of the day off, and I think our weekend passes should be from 18:00 Saturday till 5:45 Monday instead they are from 18:00 Saturday till 23:55 Monday, and I don't see why we couldn't have them till 5:45 Monday morning, because married men whom wifes are living off the post have till 5:45, and they are no better than us. [paragraph] I think they shouldn't send a soilder overseas until he is twenty one [unclear] at haft [/unclear] , because that is the part of his life which is had for fighting and other purposes, and a soilder should have at least one year of training before overseas duty. [paragraph]

S64.Q97.F: I think a man could be a better soldier if he were to get a furlough more often so he could have something to be looking forward to. I believe we would be more active at our work and at our time off and a three day pass every month with weekends off. and the boys that are going to school should have class A passes for they have to go in the evenings and
S64.Q97.C_1: don't get a chance to get out much

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: The war had made things better as far as jobs and pay goes but because of about everything being rationed the way it is it makes it much harder but it has to be that way or it wouldnt be.
S64.Q97.Full: The war had made things better as far as jobs and pay goes but because of about everything being rationed the way it is it makes it much harder but it has to be that way or it wouldnt be.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Well just like I said before I think I would be much better off working in a defence [defense] plant then being in the armed forces because I think when a soldier reaches thirty years of age he is better off in a defence [defense] plant. When a soldier is from thirty years old or more and when they go on hikes or any thing in that order he can't keep
S64.Q97.C_1: up with the younger soldiers and most of the soldiers from twenty-five years old and up are always complaining about their legs their back and so forth so that's why I think they should be in some kind of a defence plant. and I think that the Government would get more out of them in a defence plant than in the armed forces. and most of them can go right back to their old jobs and continue working. and I think that they will be a lot better off and would help to win the war that much quicker. a soldier is no good to the armed forces if he is always complaining about the aches that he has and going to sick every morning and can't do all the work that he is suppose to do. the armed forces would be better of with out a soldier like that.
S64.Q97.Full: Well just like I said before I think I would be much better off working in a defence [defense] plant then being in the armed forces because I think when a soldier reaches thirty years of age he is better off in a defence [defense] plant. When a soldier is from thirty years old or more and when they go on hikes or any thing in that order he can't keep up with the younger soldiers and most of the soldiers from twenty-five years old and up are always complaining about their legs their back and so forth so that's why I think they should be in some kind of a defence plant. and I think that the Government would get more out of them in a defence plant than in the armed forces. and most of them can go right back to their old jobs and continue working. and I think that they will be a lot better off and would help to win the war that much quicker. a soldier is no good to the armed forces if he is always complaining about the aches that he has and going to sick every morning and can't do all the work that he is suppose to do. the armed forces would be better of with out a soldier like that.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: The hours are too long. We wake up at 5:30 [insertion] am [/insertion] and get off duty 5:30 p.m. [paragraph] The training is a bit too rigorous. [paragraph] The food isn't good, and there is not enough of it. [paragraph] There is too much time spent cleaning [underline] clean [/underline] guns. After all the gun can get only so clear, after that it can become no cleaner. [paragraph] A lot of men could be put to better use
S64.Q97.C_1: in their trades. In my case, I'm a diesel mech. & engr. and here they got me taking care of a dinky little power plant, that reminds me of something for a little kid to play with. I'm a diesel mech. and a damn good one. To me, it is an insult to put me to taking care of that little toy. There are several others in the same shoes as I'm in.
S64.Q97.Full: The hours are too long. We wake up at 5:30 [insertion] am [/insertion] and get off duty 5:30 p.m. [paragraph] The training is a bit too rigorous. [paragraph] The food isn't good, and there is not enough of it. [paragraph] There is too much time spent cleaning [underline] clean [/underline] guns. After all the gun can get only so clear, after that it can become no cleaner. [paragraph] A lot of men could be put to better use in their trades. In my case, I'm a diesel mech. & engr. and here they got me taking care of a dinky little power plant, that reminds me of something for a little kid to play with. I'm a diesel mech. and a damn good one. To me, it is an insult to put me to taking care of that little toy. There are several others in the same shoes as I'm in.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I fully understand why I'm in the Army. Im ready to do anything necessary to end the war. I don't care for Army life at all. But I don't want to go home unless the other fellows can go home too!
S64.Q97.C_1: From the talks I've had with the fellows the most of them feel the same as I do.
S64.Q97.Full: I fully understand why I'm in the Army. Im ready to do anything necessary to end the war. I don't care for Army life at all. But I don't want to go home unless the other fellows can go home too! From the talks I've had with the fellows the most of them feel the same as I do.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: The army has given too much authority to 1st Sergeants or else they take more than they should and usually the poor enlisted men suffer for months and even years until he is caught up with. Non coms in general, as soon as they get their stripes stop bucking and just use their stripes to keep their hands clean. They should be kept on the ball and not allowed to use their authority on
S64.Q97.C_1: privates just to show off or show up their own mean streak of dictatorship.[paragraph] I believe the army could get the same results with only fifty percent of the men in the army if they went about it in an intelligent way.[paragraph] But years of peace has made the army rotten and only through getting intelligent draftees into it has raised it to a first rate fighting outfit. Before the war the army stunk and there was too much politics in it. The regular army men had a very low I.Q [Intelligence Quotient] and was made up of bums and men who couldn't make a go of it in civilian life.
S64.Q97.Full: The army has given too much authority to 1st Sergeants or else they take more than they should and usually the poor enlisted men suffer for months and even years until he is caught up with. Non coms in general, as soon as they get their stripes stop bucking and just use their stripes to keep their hands clean. They should be kept on the ball and not allowed to use their authority on privates just to show off or show up their own mean streak of dictatorship.[paragraph] I believe the army could get the same results with only fifty percent of the men in the army if they went about it in an intelligent way.[paragraph] But years of peace has made the army rotten and only through getting intelligent draftees into it has raised it to a first rate fighting outfit. Before the war the army stunk and there was too much politics in it. The regular army men had a very low I.Q [Intelligence Quotient] and was made up of bums and men who couldn't make a go of it in civilian life.

S64.Q97.C_1: about like some six grad school. The old army might have been alright but I think very little of the new army. It is all a bunch of Bull from start to finish

As for most of the officers and non-commissioned officers they are made up of ninty day wonders and don't care about anyone but their self. And the privilages are about like some six grad school. The old army might have been alright but I think very little of the new army. It is all a bunch of Bull from start to finish

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I'm now a dispatcher, and I am a private filling a T/5's [Technician Fifth Grade] job. Well, I think and I know I could do better in the Army Aircorp. My whole future lies in the aircorp, and that air corp is very good, and if I don't get it I don't think my army life will help me at all. I'm completely discouraged the way they place you in the army. I'm not a type of person to bitch, but I'm set ...
S64.Q97.C_1: on the Army Aircorp and I'm still plugging for my chance to enter that branch as either a cadet or a flight mechanic. I like my outfit, but I know my future happiness lies in that Air Corp so I'm plugging for it.
S64.Q97.Full: I'm now a dispatcher, and I am a private filling a T/5's [Technician Fifth Grade] job. Well, I think and I know I could do better in the Army Aircorp. My whole future lies in the aircorp, and that air corp is very good, and if I don't get it I don't think my army life will help me at all. I'm completely discouraged the way they place you in the army. I'm not a type of person to bitch, but I'm set ... on the Army Aircorp and I'm still plugging for my chance to enter that branch as either a cadet or a flight mechanic. I like my outfit, but I know my future happiness lies in that Air Corp so I'm plugging for it.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I like the army as a whole, but there are too many officers who have their own way of running it. And they spend too much time in debating what you should do and not do. I think most of the reasons for a soldier going AWOL is because of his dislike toward an officer and the lack of interest he shows his men.
S64.Q97.Full: I like the army as a whole, but there are too many officers who have their own way of running it. And they spend too much time in debating what you should do and not do. I think most of the reasons for a soldier going AWOL is because of his dislike toward an officer and the lack of interest he shows his men.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Furloughs: Some men who get transfered don't get to have a furlough. I think a soldier should have one approximately every 6 mo. when in the States. Of course in the field of battle its different. Army: The army isn't what it used to be, officers seem to be too easy. They're made to easy I think privates & non coms who actually seen battle should be made officers not these 90 day wonders or West Point Cadets. How do
S64.Q97.C_1: we know they won't desert us on the field of battle. I also think the U.S. should cut down on the salary or ratings of these so called permanent party soldiers. Making men who will never see battle; captains Major, etc is just a waste of money. [paragraph] Having a baseball team is okay but when what it cost to have transport them from state to state could furnish us with more ammunition for practice and maybe the boys over there with more bulls eyes then I would end it. [paragraph] I think districts should be set up in or near every camp for soldiers to satisfy themselves regarding sex natures. So as not to ruin lives ([underline] of used to be [/underline] ) decent girls who live around army camps.
S64.Q97.Full: Furloughs: Some men who get transfered don't get to have a furlough. I think a soldier should have one approximately every 6 mo. when in the States. Of course in the field of battle its different. Army: The army isn't what it used to be, officers seem to be too easy. They're made to easy I think privates & non coms who actually seen battle should be made officers not these 90 day wonders or West Point Cadets. How do  we know they won't desert us on the field of battle. I also think the U.S. should cut down on the salary or ratings of these so called permanent party soldiers. Making men who will never see battle; captains Major, etc is just a waste of money. [paragraph] Having a baseball team is okay but when what it cost to have transport them from state to state could furnish us with more ammunition for practice and maybe the boys over there with more bulls eyes then I would end it. [paragraph] I think districts should be set up in or near every camp for soldiers to satisfy themselves regarding sex natures. So as not to ruin lives ([underline] of used to be [/underline] ) decent girls who live around army camps.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think that men to old, could do much more share to win the war, working on a defense plant than be trainning with young kids, because the war production is as important to win as the trainning of men, and speaking as my own I feel to old for hard training.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that men to old, could do much more share to win the war, working on a defense plant than be trainning with young kids, because the war production is as important to win as the trainning of men, and speaking as my own I feel to old for hard training.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I as a soldier don't think I am doing any good for my country in the Army. As a farmer all my life I think I could do more [unclear] at home [/unclear] working on a farm and raising food for the men in the service. My eyes are very poor and I would never be good for combat. Where on a farm a fellow don't need good eye sight.
S64.Q97.Full: I as a soldier don't think I am doing any good for my country in the Army. As a farmer all my life I think I could do more [unclear] at home [/unclear] working on a farm and raising food for the men in the service. My eyes are very poor and I would never be good for combat. Where on a farm a fellow don't need good eye sight.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: [insertion] emergency furlough [/insertion]
S64.Q97.F: I have three brothers in the service which leaves my mother, invalid dad and sister at home. It is very hard for my mother to care for my father alone. [paragraph] I have answered many of these questions pertaining to my former outfit, but most of my former outfit have joined this outfit which I have not joined
S64.Q97.C_1: yet, due to the school I am now attending. But I feel sure that my answers are truthful. [paragraph] I can't say that I am satisfied with the furlough I received. I have been in the service 29 months and I received about thirty days.
S64.Q97.Full: I have three brothers in the service which leaves my mother, invalid dad and sister at home. It is very hard for my mother to care for my father alone. [paragraph] I have answered many of these questions pertaining to my former outfit, but most of my former outfit have joined this outfit which I have not joined yet, due to the school I am now attending. But I feel sure that my answers are truthful. [paragraph] I can't say that I am satisfied with the furlough I received. I have been in the service 29 months and I received about thirty days.

S64.Q97.C_1: Compulsory 30 day's furlough time in the year. No exceptions or at least 20 days [space] Men living off the poor should not have to stand [unclear] [/unclear]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I'm at a B&C school. I've watched three classes go out and haven't seen one soldier become a baker. I'm a ass-instructor here, and would like to know why do they send men here to learn if they aren't going to use them. Its throwing away two months of good time that Im sure the army could use elsewhere. I'm not always crying but not one is a baker now.
S64.Q97.Full: I'm at a B&C school. I've watched three classes go out and haven't seen one soldier become a baker. I'm a ass-instructor here, and would like to know why do they send men here to learn if they aren't going to use them. Its throwing away two months of good time that Im sure the army could use elsewhere. I'm not always crying but not one is a baker now.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: My one pet gripe is, that at the platoon I'm at, we are required to work very hard, but are shorted on our time off. When a soldier works hard and does his duty well, that is, if hes not in Battle areas, I'm talking of Continental U.S.) he should get a day off, which is not [unclear] [/unclear] any inspections, or drilling by his
S64.Q97.C_1: day off. If a soldier gets his day off his morale is better & more can be expected. Also more work is expected and less ratings are issued out. Not enough passes or furloughs are granted.
S64.Q97.Full: My one pet gripe is, that at the platoon I'm at, we are required to work very hard, but are shorted on our time off. When a soldier works hard and does his duty well, that is, if hes not in Battle areas, I'm talking of Continental U.S.) he should get a day off, which is not [unclear] [/unclear] any inspections, or drilling by his day off. If a soldier gets his day off his morale is better & more can be expected. Also more work is expected and less ratings are issued out. Not enough passes or furloughs are granted.

Almost all of them could do more on the outside than in the army. [paragraph] [underline] [unclear] [/unclear] [/underline]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Passes. They should give a man a decent pass & that way he would not have to go awol. I don't like getting up early in the morning. Officers - I think some of them should be private they don't know how to even hold a gun.
S64.Q97.Full: Passes. They should give a man a decent pass & that way he would not have to go awol. I don't like getting up early in the morning. Officers - I think some of them should be private they don't know how to even hold a gun.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I feel this way if a soldier is married and is not in a heathy condition he should be out of the army and a lot of boys on the out side who are running around should be in service. Reasons for A.W.O.L. is that a soldier is not treated like a human being. Some people don't want them around.
S64.Q97.C_1: their homes they feel if a soldier drinks he is just a bum. A soldier that is married and has a family should be out of the service and taking the young fellow in who are young and active and not boys who have bad physical conditions. Service Club on post are not called for fellow want to get away from camp and not be stuck on some army camps all the time. alot of food could be a lot better.

Reasons for A.W.O.L. is that a soldier is not treated like a human being. Some people don't want them around. their homes they feel if a soldier drinks he is just a bum. A soldier that is married and has a family should be out of the service and taking the young fellow in who are young and active and not boys who have bad physical conditions. Service Club on post are not called for fellow want to get away from camp and not be stuck on some army camps all the time. alot of food could be a lot better.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: 1) What gets my goat is the lousy cooperation we have between the officers. I think they'd cut each others throats if given a chance. 2) Seems that the officers in the outfit dont know their ass from a hole in the ground. Once when ratings were given out they had a man whose been in the gaurdhouse for the past fifteen days up for a rating.
S64.Q97.C_1: [circle] 3 [/circle] This outfit is a school and I think that students are given way to much liberty as compared with other schools.
S64.Q97.Full: 1) What gets my goat is the lousy cooperation we have between the officers. I think they'd cut each others throats if given a chance. 2) Seems that the officers in the outfit dont know their ass from a hole in the ground. Once when ratings were given out they had a man whose been in the gaurdhouse for the past fifteen days up for a rating. [circle] 3 [/circle] This outfit is a school and I think that students are given way to much liberty as compared with other schools.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Yes I would like to get out of this army and go back home and be next to my wife and help her out. I lost a very good job and was really doing my upmost to make a very important job [unclear] [/unclear] . I work for the war and to help this country win this
S64.Q97.C_1: and been a very lonesome man after I was drafted in the army it really took the heart away from my dear wife and myself. I can do better in civilian life then I could do in the army. I am not a dope and don't like the army its just that they took me at the time my wife needed me we have lots of bills to pay some which I got drafted I left my wife with a lot of Bills and she can't make a go of it even if she get my 50 dollars a month if still don't help She needs me to help her out. She needs me So please help me to any who ever gets to read this I hope he is married man like myself and take interest in my case,
S64.Q97.Full: Yes I would like to get out of this army and go back home and be next to my wife and help her out. I lost a very good job and was really doing my upmost to make a very important job [unclear] [/unclear] . I work for the war and to help this country win this  and been a very lonesome man after I was drafted in the army it really took the heart away from my dear wife and myself. I can do better in civilian life then I could do in the army. I am not a dope and don't like the army its just that they took me at the time my wife needed me we have lots of bills to pay some which I got drafted I left my wife with a lot of Bills and she can't make a go of it even if she get my 50 dollars a month if still don't help She needs me to help her out. She needs me So please help me to any who ever gets to read this I hope he is married man like myself and take interest in my case,

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Personally, I would like to see, not what the soldiers would do or say in combat -- I know what they would, I've soldiered 9 months with thousands, but just what the Big Shots, & small timers who think they are Big Shots, would do. Would they be able to take the strain - or would they crack up their brain - In other words, I'd like to be in charge of a few Desk men who try to run the army, & only in IT 6 months or so.
S64.Q97.Full: Personally, I would like to see, not what the soldiers would do or say in combat -- I know what they would, I've soldiered 9 months with thousands, but just what the Big Shots, & small timers who think they are Big Shots, would do. Would they be able to take the strain - or would they crack up their brain - In other words, I'd like to be in charge of a few Desk men who try to run the army, & only in IT 6 months or so.
