document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q96.M_marginalia: If the men running this army would stop + realize for a while that a soldier has to have a little time to himself there wouldn't be this trouble with men going awol. Most everyone I know that has been awol has been because when he did ask for furlough or pass he was refused. I've been in the army over year + had one three day pass. Other friends of mine have
S64.Q97.F: If the men running this army would stop & realize for a while that a soldier has to have a little time to himself there wouldn't it be this trouble with men going awol [absent without leave] . Most everyone I know that has been awol [absent without leave] has been because when he did ask for furlough or pass he was refused. I've been in the army one year and had one three day pass. Other friends of mine have
S64.Q97.C_1: been in only half that time & some of the workers had three & four 10 day furloughs. Is that fair, I don't think so. There's too much favoring of certain people in this army. If the commanding officer likes a guy he gets all the time off he asks for but if not he don't get as much as a pass. Thats what's happened to me & now I'm in the guard house. Thats what I call very poor supervision.
S64.Q97.Full: If the men running this army would stop & realize for a while that a soldier has to have a little time to himself there wouldn't it be this trouble with men going awol [absent without leave] . Most everyone I know that has been awol [absent without leave] has been because when he did ask for furlough or pass he was refused. I've been in the army one year and had one three day pass. Other friends of mine have been in only half that time & some of the workers had three & four 10 day furloughs. Is that fair, I don't think so. There's too much favoring of certain people in this army. If the commanding officer likes a guy he gets all the time off he asks for but if not he don't get as much as a pass. Thats what's happened to me & now I'm in the guard house. Thats what I call very poor supervision.

S64.Q97.F: I feel that a soldier if he was put in the part he wanted he would do much better. I had my mind all set for the Air Corps and I got the F.A. [Field Artillery] . I was very down hearted and just don't care. I will still fight for U.S.A., but I would much rather be in the Air Corps.
S64.Q97.Full: I feel that a soldier if he was put in the part he wanted he would do much better. I had my mind all set for the Air Corps and I got the F.A. [Field Artillery] . I was very down hearted and just don't care. I will still fight for U.S.A., but I would much rather be in the Air Corps.

S64.Q97.Full: Yes I have a remark, I think the Army should make a secret survey about how soldiers who are confined in our guardhouses & stockades are treated by the M.P's[Military Police] .

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I have no use for the army. I think very little of it. A man cant [sic] even get a transfer to the air corps. They wont [sic] even give him a chance. Then when I go AWOL [Absent Without Official Leave] they treat you like a dog - they even beat the hell out of some of the men for almost nothing.
S64.Q97.Full: I have no use for the army. I think very little of it. A man cant [sic] even get a transfer to the air corps. They wont [sic] even give him a chance. Then when I go AWOL [Absent Without Official Leave] they treat you like a dog - they even beat the hell out of some of the men for almost nothing.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I am a prisoner in Ft. [Fort] Sheridan, Illinois, and I may add that the treatment a prisoner receives here is more like a concentration camp in Germany. If a boy (and very few are) is not a criminal when he enters here he is very likely to be when he emerges to be taken back to his particular camp. Most of the boys & men here have been picked up in Chicago for being AWOL and brought here to wait for transportation to their own
S64.Q97.C_1: outfit. We usually stay here as I understand it from a week to two weeks before being taken back. I have been here for five days during which time I have been punched, forced to go without meals and, as a whole, treated like a murderer. Some of the boys here are only AWOL for one day yet they receive the same treatment. Three days ago an 18 year old lad was put in solitary confinement on bread & water for 7 days - why? Simply because he could not lick his plate clean - as a matter of fact, all he left was a piece of celery - a young boy whose whole life may be changed by that incident. I saw him tonight as he was going for his water and he looked terrible after three days - we are ordered around like rats - there is not ([underline] one decent [/underline] ) non-com in the whole place - they delight in making one uncomfortable - I went without supper tonight for rolling my eyes after standing at attention for thirty minutes - believe you me I did a harder days work than I ever did in civilian life - I'm damned hungry right now - Come down and clean this rotten hole out!!
S64.Q97.Full: I am a prisoner in Ft. [Fort] Sheridan, Illinois, and I may add that the treatment a prisoner receives here is more like a concentration camp in Germany. If a boy (and very few are) is not a criminal when he enters here he is very likely to be when he emerges to be taken back to his particular camp. Most of the boys & men here have been picked up in Chicago for being AWOL and brought here to wait for transportation to their own  outfit. We usually stay here as I understand it from a week to two weeks before being taken back. I have been here for five days during which time I have been punched, forced to go without meals and, as a whole, treated like a murderer. Some of the boys here are only AWOL for one day yet they receive the same treatment. Three days ago an 18 year old lad was put in solitary confinement on bread & water for 7 days - why? Simply because he could not lick his plate clean - as a matter of fact, all he left was a piece of celery - a young boy whose whole life may be changed by that incident. I saw him tonight as he was going for his water and he looked terrible after three days - we are ordered around like rats - there is not ([underline] one decent [/underline] ) non-com in the whole place - they delight in making one uncomfortable - I went without supper tonight for rolling my eyes after standing at attention for thirty minutes - believe you me I did a harder days work than I ever did in civilian life - I'm damned hungry right now - Come down and clean this rotten hole out!!

S64.Q97.F: The lack of well trained Officers causes much [unclear] dest???? [/unclear] [unclear] [/unclear] among men and gives them that don't give a damn mood. I think it also causes a lot of A.W.O.L. The lack of pride in their company & troop, battery, etc. Poor N.C.O's have a lot to contribute to the lack of pride. And I can say
S64.Q97.C_1: that the men feel like this dam place where you rush like hell to get in formation and stand two hours while officers and N.C.O,'s [non-commissioned officers] decide what to do. There is no American who isn't proud of his uniform or the uniform of his superiors but in too many cases the uniform was given to the wrong man.
S64.Q97.Full: The lack of well trained Officers causes much [unclear] dest???? [/unclear] [unclear] [/unclear] among men and gives them that don't give a damn mood. I think it also causes a lot of A.W.O.L. The lack of pride in their company & troop, battery, etc. Poor N.C.O's have a lot to contribute to the lack of pride. And I can say that the men feel like this dam place where you rush like hell to get in formation and stand two hours while officers and N.C.O,'s [non-commissioned officers] decide what to do. There is no American who isn't proud of his uniform or the uniform of his superiors but in too many cases the uniform was given to the wrong man.

S64.Q97.C_1: for all these young boys 18-20 year old a woman cannot do a man job yes some women cant beat the all of them I don't see the United states dont give the boys of that age the tarining [training] and them release them for war work because they can do alot to win this war. If who want them back you all ways know where there are Please dear Sir can't you do something for us. Please Sir and try to do something.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I would like to explain my 13 months in the army. I had 31 days Basic Training, from there I went to west coast and drove a truck for two months, and the rest of the time, I was forced to work as K.P at the officers mess. I think that is very unfair to men and the rest of the boys there, I will write to Washington when I get ready. I think I will do it most
S64.Q97.Full: I would like to explain my 13 months in the army. I had 31 days Basic Training, from there I went to west coast and drove a truck for two months, and the rest of the time, I was forced to work as K.P at the officers mess. I think that is very unfair to men and the rest of the boys there, I will write to Washington when I get ready. I think I will do it most

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page, A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I have been placed in limited service and I am not doing any special kind of work because I am not fitted for active duty and I feel I am taking what I have no right to take and there for I feel that I should give it to some one who needs it and
S64.Q97.C_1: there are a lot of men who need it worse than I do. [paragraph] there are also to many of the [deletion] [/deletion] [unclear] limited [/unclear] service men in the Army who are taking food that is needed by [unclear] combat [/unclear] outfits and the pay also. [paragraph] I feel that I could do more in a war [unclear] [/unclear] but better still on a farm to help win this war.
S64.Q97.C_2: The one remark I have is "that if the trainees were sure of a furlough at the end of their Basic Training they would feel a lot more like doing their training, and I believe would be better soldiers.
S64.Q97.Full: I have been placed in limited service and I am not doing any special kind of work because I am not fitted for active duty and I feel I am taking what I have no right to take and there for I feel that I should give it to some one who needs it and there are a lot of men who need it worse than I do. [paragraph] there are also to many of the [deletion] [/deletion] [unclear] limited [/unclear] service men in the Army who are taking food that is needed by [unclear] combat [/unclear] outfits and the pay also. [paragraph] I feel that I could do more in a war [unclear] [/unclear] but better still on a farm to help win this war. The one remark I have is "that if the trainees were sure of a furlough at the end of their Basic Training they would feel a lot more like doing their training, and I believe would be better soldiers.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: have had my fair share of pass but have not been in long enough for a furlough
S64.Q97.F: The daily scedual could be planned somewhat better for our training so that the fellows can get the minimum amount of sleep. It seems whenever we have to go out on night problems until late at night, around midnight or later the next morning we have to get up an hour or so earlier for some reason or other, leaving only a couple of hours for sleep.
S64.Q97.C_1: They expect you to get the most out the training but it is impossible to get very much when your brain is tired.[paragraph] Another thing is food rations. When you go out and work hard all day, you want three good hearty meals. Most of us do not get enough, they leave the mess hall hungry, and then go down to the P.X. [Post Exchange] and fill up on candy, pop and ice cream which doesn't help them in their training.[paragraph] We should also have a few hours off each night for relaxation and time to write home. Two nights a week to clean barracks is all right, but the other nights they always manage to find something for us to do. It seems like they do it just to keep us from having time to ourselves, because the jobs are small but take lots of time, like cleaning guns and after we have them cleaned they tell us to clean them over again.
S64.Q97.Full: The daily scedual could be planned somewhat better for our training so that the fellows can get the minimum amount of sleep. It seems whenever we have to go out on night problems until late at night, around midnight or later the next morning we have to get up an hour or so earlier for some reason or other, leaving only a couple of hours for sleep. They expect you to get the most out the training but it is impossible to get very much when your brain is tired.[paragraph] Another thing is food rations. When you go out and work hard all day, you want three good hearty meals. Most of us do not get enough, they leave the mess hall hungry, and then go down to the P.X. [Post Exchange] and fill up on candy, pop and ice cream which doesn't help them in their training.[paragraph] We should also have a few hours off each night for relaxation and time to write home. Two nights a week to clean barracks is all right, but the other nights they always manage to find something for us to do. It seems like they do it just to keep us from having time to ourselves, because the jobs are small but take lots of time, like cleaning guns and after we have them cleaned they tell us to clean them over again.

S64.Q97.F: There is one that isn't very important but would make us happy cut out red tape, and give us uniforms that fit.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: When someone is willing to volunteer I think they should at least be given a chance to see if they would fit into what they volunteered for.[paragraph] I think there should be a special branch in the Air Corp where a person wearing glasses that corrects the vision to 20-20 be allowed to ...
S64.Q97.C_1: take up flying - such pilots could be used for cargo planes or other similar instances.
S64.Q97.Full: When someone is willing to volunteer I think they should at least be given a chance to see if they would fit into what they volunteered for.[paragraph] I think there should be a special branch in the Air Corp where a person wearing glasses that corrects the vision to 20-20 be allowed to ... take up flying - such pilots could be used for cargo planes or other similar instances.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think the men in the armed forces should be given more furloughs or even passes over weekends. I might suggest a ten day furlough every four months. [paragraph] More time should be spent on weapons and vehicles. The training they now get is very good, but not enough time is spent in the operation of the above.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the men in the armed forces should be given more furloughs or even passes over weekends. I might suggest a ten day furlough every four months. [paragraph] More time should be spent on weapons and vehicles. The training they now get is very good, but not enough time is spent in the operation of the above.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I think a man should be allowed a furlough after his training period, it is a great morale builder to see the folks again. If one is not giving in my opinion it's very disheartening. I think this the best equipped and will be the best trained army in the world. I don't know but it seems to me if a soldier
S64.Q97.C_1: could train some where near her own state if thats possible he would be a better soldier & work harder.
S64.Q97.Full: I think a man should be allowed a furlough after his training period, it is a great morale builder to see the folks again. If one is not giving in my opinion it's very disheartening. I think this the best equipped and will be the best trained army in the world. I don't know but it seems to me if a soldier could train some where near her own state if thats possible he would be a better soldier & work harder.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: The first sargent puts us on K.P. [kitchen patrol] for the slightest reason.
S64.Q97.F: The Non Coms [non-commissioned officers] & officers should treat the men like man & not pigs. Because the have authority they like to have you know it. This is not only my opinion. The men in my Co. [company] all feel the same.[paragraph] The food should be more plentiful than it has been. The non coms eat till full, we eat what there is [-] no more. What makes an army is privates not officers & non coms. There should be a shake up made considering
S64.Q97.C_1: the amount of food we get. We are supposed to get off every day at 5:00 O'clock. We usually get off at 7 or 9 or sometimes 11 o'clock. Maybe we get off at 5 o'clock once a week. We never get Saturday afternoon off at 12 o'clock we usually get off a 2 or 3 o'clock. Dirty shame. We should have cleaner silverware. The silverware is terrible. The Bed Bugs are no pleasure either. Need I say more. I hope this survey is not over looked. I would like to have these things taken care of.
S64.Q97.Full: The Non Coms [non-commissioned officers] & officers should treat the men like man & not pigs. Because the have authority they like to have you know it. This is not only my opinion. The men in my Co. [company] all feel the same.[paragraph] The food should be more plentiful than it has been. The non coms eat till full, we eat what there is [-] no more. What makes an army is privates not officers & non coms. There should be a shake up made considering  the amount of food we get. We are supposed to get off every day at 5:00 O'clock. We usually get off at 7 or 9 or sometimes 11 o'clock. Maybe we get off at 5 o'clock once a week. We never get Saturday afternoon off at 12 o'clock we usually get off a 2 or 3 o'clock. Dirty shame. We should have cleaner silverware. The silverware is terrible. The Bed Bugs are no pleasure either. Need I say more. I hope this survey is not over looked. I would like to have these things taken care of.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I don't care for Army life, but I was called upon to serve my country, and I will willing do anything I'm told as I feel, no matter how small the thing you do here, it should help the war in some way. I only hope we can win the war in some way. I only hope we can win the war soon and go back to normal living once again.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't care for Army life, but I was called upon to serve my country, and I will willing do anything I'm told as I feel, no matter how small the thing you do here, it should help the war in some way. I only hope we can win the war in some way. I only hope we can win the war soon and go back to normal living once again.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I believe that there is far to little done to make the men conscious of the full meaning of the war. The orientation film "Prelude to War" was excellent as far as it went. But there should be open discussion after each instalment. [paragraph] The developments in the war from day to day are not covered and whenever they are much too superficially. The relative importance of the fighting fronts, a real perspective of the entire
S64.Q97.C_1: war theatre is to my mind sadly barky.. The Chinese destroy a Division, therefore rate a column. We destroy a couple of outposts and you have headlines. Headline psychosis should be corrected by intelligent and complete coverage of the war and all new developments. The segregation of negroes to my way of thinking has been one of hte grave mistakes in the army. The race problem would bave been solved to a great extent by courageous action on the part of the army. After all, men are created equal and if so why the hell the segregation. Note I'm white and from Illinois.
S64.Q97.Full: I believe that there is far to little done to make the men conscious of the full meaning of the war. The orientation film "Prelude to War" was excellent as far as it went. But there should be open discussion after each instalment. [paragraph] The developments in the war from day to day are not covered and whenever they are much too superficially. The relative importance of the fighting fronts, a real perspective of the entire war theatre is to my mind sadly barky.. The Chinese destroy a Division, therefore rate a column. We destroy a couple of outposts and you have headlines. Headline psychosis should be corrected by intelligent and complete coverage of the war and all new developments. The segregation of negroes to my way of thinking has been one of hte grave mistakes in the army. The race problem would bave been solved to a great extent by courageous action on the part of the army. After all, men are created equal and if so why the hell the segregation. Note I'm white and from Illinois.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: As far as punishing the German people we should not, we should punish the leaders of Germany. I don't think the German people would fight if it wasn't for their leaders, who make them do things that they do not want to do. I think after the war which we will win U.S. should set up a peace with our Allis, which will kept the other country from starting wars. Put Germany & Japan under our way of living & rights and kept them
S64.Q97.C_1: from every [ever] starting another war. After this war we should be prepare for any up raising among other countries which we might be drawn into.
S64.Q97.Full: As far as punishing the German people we should not, we should punish the leaders of Germany. I don't think the German people would fight if it wasn't for their leaders, who make them do things that they do not want to do. I think after the war which we will win U.S. should set up a peace with our Allis, which will kept the other country from starting wars. Put Germany & Japan under our way of living & rights and kept them from every [ever] starting another war. After this war we should be prepare for any up raising among other countries which we might be drawn into.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: A man who has children is definitely in worse condition than before the war. If he had been inducted into the armed services and has young children, he has been seriously handicapped financially. It is impossible for a mother with young children to work without neglecting the children, and in most sections of the country, rent is so exorbitant that the allotment provided by the government is not sufficient to provide for even the base
S64.Q97.C_1: necessities of life. To use myself as an example, my wife receives a check of sixty-two dollars ($62) per month from the government of which twenty-two dollars ($22) is deducted from my pay. She has to pay forty dollars ($40) a month for a place to live, which leaves her a sum total of twenty-two dollars ($22) per month with which to clothe and feed both herself and the baby. Naturally, a young baby has to have special food and plenty of milk. Figuring his food bill at the lowest possible estimate (fifty cents(50) per day, that fifty cents (50) being for one quart of milk and three cans of prepared food), food for him alone amounts to fifteen dollars ($15) per month. That brings the sum total down to seven dollars ($7) per month. With that seven dollars ($7) my wife has to feed herself and clothe both herself and the baby. Need I say more?
S64.Q97.Full: A man who has children is definitely in worse condition than before the war. If he had been inducted into the armed services and has young children, he has been seriously handicapped financially. It is impossible for a mother with young children to work without neglecting the children, and in most sections of the country, rent is so exorbitant that the allotment provided by the government is not sufficient to provide for even the base necessities of life. To use myself as an example, my wife receives a check of sixty-two dollars ($62) per month from the government of which twenty-two dollars ($22) is deducted from my pay. She has to pay forty dollars ($40) a month for a place to live, which leaves her a sum total of twenty-two dollars ($22) per month with which to clothe and feed both herself and the baby. Naturally, a young baby has to have special food and plenty of milk. Figuring his food bill at the lowest possible estimate (fifty cents(50) per day, that fifty cents (50) being for one quart of milk and three cans of prepared food), food for him alone amounts to fifteen dollars ($15) per month. That brings the sum total down to seven dollars ($7) per month. With that seven dollars ($7) my wife has to feed herself and clothe both herself and the baby. Need I say more?

S64.Q97.F: I think that there should be a little more added to the soldier mess table. If you go to mess late you never get any butter sugar coffee jelly and often only half of the meal. We should be issued more work clothes and less sun tams.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that there should be a little more added to the soldier mess table. If you go to mess late you never get any butter sugar coffee jelly and often only half of the meal. We should be issued more work clothes and less sun tams.

S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I believe the we could have a regular mail call at noon and night & also not be restricted to barracks so much for such small offenses as in the present. Also I think the army Doctors could take more time to hear what you have to say & not try to disallusion you.
S64.Q97.C_1: 31 - Maybe in some places so far I can not tell. [paragraph] 49- To tell the truth you can not say about only one Country by rank I think there all trying "hardest." [paragraph] 51 - Because there really good in cold weather fighting. [paragraph] 52 - I believe the Germans & Japs are good fighters because of their early training & very strict [unclear] [/unclear] . [paragraph] The Americans are better than very good because they get everything they put into it & they know what there fighting for. [paragraph] 67- all of the time except for a couple guys you find them in every place you go.
S64.Q97.C_2: The only complaint I have to register is a rather trivial but I think if we were issued a couple more suits of fatigue uniforms (Class B) the rest of my outfit would stop complaining almost entirely.
S64.Q97.Full: I believe the we could have a regular mail call at noon and night & also not be restricted to barracks so much for such small offenses as in the present. Also I think the army Doctors could take more time to hear what you have to say & not try to disallusion you. 31 - Maybe in some places so far I can not tell. [paragraph] 49- To tell the truth you can not say about only one Country by rank I think there all trying "hardest." [paragraph] 51 - Because there really good in cold weather fighting. [paragraph] 52 - I believe the Germans & Japs are good fighters because of their early training & very strict [unclear] [/unclear] . [paragraph] The Americans are better than very good because they get everything they put into it & they know what there fighting for. [paragraph] 67- all of the time except for a couple guys you find them in every place you go. The only complaint I have to register is a rather trivial but I think if we were issued a couple more suits of fatigue uniforms (Class B) the rest of my outfit would stop complaining almost entirely.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: The officers seem to act as though they are quite a bit better but for some reason they gripe more than we do after coming in from [unclear] [/unclear] . The thing that disagrees with the greater part of it is we rush like hell just to stand in line and wait for 3 or 4 times as long as we should. We shouldn't wait at all - every thing should be organized sufficiently
S64.Q97.C_1: now so we could get directly to our objective, finish our job, then start preparing for the next one. The officers (to me personally) just think up something in a hurry without preparation then expect the non coms [non-commissioned officers] to act with very little explanation. The food isn't worth feeding to anyone but we eat it any how. We guess that's to be expected, but we're still able to carry on.
S64.Q97.Full: The officers seem to act as though they are quite a bit better but for some reason they gripe more than we do after coming in from [unclear] [/unclear] . The thing that disagrees with the greater part of it is we rush like hell just to stand in line and wait for 3 or 4 times as long as we should. We shouldn't wait at all - every thing should be organized sufficiently  now so we could get directly to our objective, finish our job, then start preparing for the next one. The officers (to me personally) just think up something in a hurry without preparation then expect the non coms [non-commissioned officers] to act with very little explanation. The food isn't worth feeding to anyone but we eat it any how. We guess that's to be expected, but we're still able to carry on.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Question 96. My brother and I were making the living but since we are both in the Armed Services my mother doesn't get as much money for up keep of the house & food since even things is so high. Question 95 Any man that has been in the service as long as 5 month's should have at least 15 days. We are only getting 10 days & this outfit is made up of Texas & Okla boys & it takes 2 days to go & 2 to come back.
S64.Q97.C_1: & they should have at least 10 days at home. There was three of us boys at home until this last year but the Navy has one & the Army the [insertion] other [/insertion] two, my mother is home by herself she is always writing that she is worring [worrying] her self to death, & I thing [think] they should give a boy at least 15 day's at home out of even 5 month's. This is not only speaking for myself but for all the other fellows just like me.
S64.Q97.Full: Question 96. My brother and I were making the living but since we are both in the Armed Services my mother doesn't get as much money for up keep of the house & food since even things is so high. Question 95 Any man that has been in the service as long as 5 month's should have at least 15 days. We are only getting 10 days & this outfit is made up of Texas & Okla boys & it takes 2 days to go & 2 to come back. & they should have at least 10 days at home. There was three of us boys at home until this last year but the Navy has one & the Army the [insertion] other [/insertion] two, my mother is home by herself she is always writing that she is worring [worrying] her self to death, & I thing [think] they should give a boy at least 15 day's at home out of even 5 month's. This is not only speaking for myself but for all the other fellows just like me.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: Older (10 yrs or more) men should not be placed with 18 & 19 yr. old boys for training. It is hard enough for older married men to make the adjustment even to army life but it is still harder when they are with a group so much younger. Older men do not have the "yen" for soldering as the younger men it is harder for them to compete physically.
S64.Q97.C_1: men married over a long period of time (5 yrs or more) before the war should be put in non combatant work. Where they will be kept in U.S. Generally officers & non coms seem to think married men should forget about their families. While in the army. if they want them to do this. why draft married men. Soldiers are treated too much like prisoners (restriction etc.) There is too much drunkness & raciel dissipation among non coms & officers personally I do not feel like following an officer or non comm who is a drunkard. His mental capacities in a matter as serious as this is not up to par. They (officers & non coms) in most cases set the wrong example for the boys coming into the army. The spiritiual side of life is not attended to as much as it should be. Also. Their morale is neglected. Thus causing it to become lower.
S64.Q97.Full: Older (10 yrs or more) men should not be placed with 18 & 19 yr. old boys for training. It is hard enough for older married men to make the adjustment even to army life but it is still harder when they are with a group so much younger. Older men do not have the "yen" for soldering as the younger men it is harder for them to compete physically. men married over a long period of time (5 yrs or more) before the war should be put in non combatant work. Where they will be kept in U.S. Generally officers & non coms seem to think married men should forget about their families. While in the army. if they want them to do this. why draft married men. Soldiers are treated too much like prisoners (restriction etc.) There is too much drunkness & raciel dissipation among non coms & officers personally I do not feel like following an officer or non comm who is a drunkard. His mental capacities in a matter as serious as this is not up to par. They (officers & non coms) in most cases set the wrong example for the boys coming into the army. The spiritiual side of life is not attended to as much as it should be. Also. Their morale is neglected. Thus causing it to become lower.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: During my basic [training] we had to go to classes all day and work details all night. A man that is tired can not learn as he should. Therefore they should have a few men to work the details during the day.
S64.Q97.Full: During my basic [training] we had to go to classes all day and work details all night. A man that is tired can not learn as he should. Therefore they should have a few men to work the details during the day.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I think steps should be taken to determine if a soldier is doing his job better as a soldier than he would if he were a civilian. I think the same thing applies to civilians - a lot of civilians in fact. And if a man has the makings of a soldier, or was meant for one, he should be given every possible chance to get into the branch of service he is best suited for and one that
S64.Q97.C_1: please him most. For after all, if a person is given the job he wants he can always do it the best or better than the one he doesn't like so well.
S64.Q97.Full: I think steps should be taken to determine if a soldier is doing his job better as a soldier than he would if he were a civilian. I think the same thing applies to civilians - a lot of civilians in fact. And if a man has the makings of a soldier, or was meant for one, he should be given every possible chance to get into the branch of service he is best suited for and one that please him most. For after all, if a person is given the job he wants he can always do it the best or better than the one he doesn't like so well.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Not so much work after duty hours.[paragraph] This outfit has had know [no] three day passes, without emergency.[paragraph] We have had to many unnecessary restrictions.
S64.Q97.Full: Not so much work after duty hours.[paragraph] This outfit has had know [no] three day passes, without emergency.[paragraph] We have had to many unnecessary restrictions.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: The Officers of our company should receive extensive training in Army procedure. There should be no partiality shown to enlisted men by officers, due to have known them in civilian life. Company punishment should be abolished. The food should be of a better grade and sufficient to keep the men from complaining
S64.Q97.C_1: Everything possible should be done to stem the desention among the man & officers. Improvements could be made in the medical detachments of this Bn. Grudges in our Company should be eliminated. Military discipline should be enforced more. Ratings should go to the men who deserve them and not to friends and relatives.
S64.Q97.Full: The Officers of our company should receive extensive training in Army procedure. There should be no partiality shown to enlisted men by officers, due to have known them in civilian life. Company punishment should be abolished. The food should be of a better grade and sufficient to keep the men from complaining  Everything possible should be done to stem the desention among the man & officers. Improvements could be made in the medical detachments of this Bn. Grudges in our Company should be eliminated. Military discipline should be enforced more. Ratings should go to the men who deserve them and not to friends and relatives.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I won't like to go across the pond with any of these ninety day wonders that become officers. I don't think the ratings are handed out properly. When you work hard you are not noticed, but if you let up working then you are bawled out. I think our top non-coms should be made to take calathentics [calisthenics] . I understand
S64.Q97.C_1: We should receive a three day pass once a month. I have only received one in the last six months.
S64.Q97.Full: I won't like to go across the pond with any of these ninety day wonders that become officers. I don't think the ratings are handed out properly. When you work hard you are not noticed, but if you let up working then you are bawled out. I think our top non-coms should be made to take calathentics [calisthenics] . I understand  We should receive a three day pass once a month. I have only received one in the last six months.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think that most of the questions in this booklet are a waste of time. The Army should look into some of the companys in the Btn. The morale is low in my company very low.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that most of the questions in this booklet are a waste of time. The Army should look into some of the companys in the Btn. The morale is low in my company very low.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Why has our unit been given only six day furloughs while the same type units from other sections of the country are receiving ten and twelve days?
S64.Q97.Full: Why has our unit been given only six day furloughs while the same type units from other sections of the country are receiving ten and twelve days?

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M_marginalia: wife can't work, buying home etc.
S64.Q97.F: approx 5 yrs of military training before enlistment, and men of less background, (for an example men just out of college never worked with large groups of men before) are generally your section leaders. I believe that more should be done to pick out some EM of experience in handling men
S64.Q97.C_1: and help them to get commisions [commissions] , use more practical men rather than college boys.
S64.Q97.Full: approx 5 yrs of military training before enlistment, and men of less background, (for an example men just out of college never worked with large groups of men before) are generally your section leaders. I believe that more should be done to pick out some EM of experience in handling men and help them to get commisions [commissions] , use more practical men rather than college boys.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: In governing such a large body of men it is very difficult to have everything just right. However in my own company I have noticed something that has turned my liking of army life to hate a a don't care attitude. Our company was formed of a group of [deletion] enlist [/deletion] volunteers from the state of West Virginia which of course is something to be proud of. When they enlisted - they were given ratings. This group of men were not
S64.Q97.C_1: enough in number to complete a whole company or amass others were taken in. These others that I speak of were from different parts of the United States & of course resented the fact that the others were given authority above theirs, when they were older army men. My own example is I think an average of what [unclear] their [/unclear] men had to put up with. I was trained in [unclear] Cadre [/unclear] & was considered a fairly good soldier yet these enlisted men were not going to put a stranger above their friends & they have just taken over the company. If we were a group of common laborers or men of low intelligence I think that they would be justified in doing what they have done. I do as much if not more work than any of them yet I have not the slightest chance or hope of ever making an advancement. We all do the dirty work & extra details that the company has. I have done [unclear] bulk [/unclear] labor since I have been in this company. Even if we don't get any ratings I think that we should get as much chance for making better [unclear] [/unclear] because it takes all of us to make a group function to a satisfactory degree. If the reason could be shown to us why we shouldn't maybe we would be content.

However in my own company I have noticed something that has turned my liking of army life to hate a a don't care attitude. Our company was formed of a group of [deletion] enlist [/deletion] volunteers from the state of West Virginia which of course is something to be proud of. When they enlisted - they were given ratings. This group of men were not  enough in number to complete a whole company or amass others were taken in. These others that I speak of were from different parts of the United States & of course resented the fact that the others were given authority above theirs, when they were older army men. My own example is I think an average of what [unclear] their [/unclear] men had to put up with. I was trained in [unclear] Cadre [/unclear] & was considered a fairly good soldier yet these enlisted men were not going to put a stranger above their friends & they have just taken over the company. If we were a group of common laborers or men of low intelligence I think that they would be justified in doing what they have done. I do as much if not more work than any of them yet I have not the slightest chance or hope of ever making an advancement. We all do the dirty work & extra details that the company has. I have done [unclear] bulk [/unclear] labor since I have been in this company. Even if we don't get any ratings I think that we should get as much chance for making better [unclear] [/unclear] because it takes all of us to make a group function to a satisfactory degree. If the reason could be shown to us why we shouldn't maybe we would be content.

S64.Q97.F: Things concerning the welfare and [unclear] placing [/unclear] of the men should be left more up to the majority of the men [insertion] rather [/insertion] than the discretion of the "top kick" or maybe a certain clique. document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Army life isn't bad, but a few thing's that is occuring in civilian life to day is very disgusting. One man in particular namely John L. Lewis should be in our shoes and then call a strike. To me that is the lowest thing possible. Even worse than a deserter or draft dodger because they have a certain fear & that would endanger more than only them if the real zero hour came. We are fighting to keep peace & contentment but several are stirring up more hatred between ourselves than exist between Germans & Japans & us. [paragraph]
S64.Q97.Full: Army life isn't bad, but a few thing's that is occuring in civilian life to day is very disgusting. One man in particular namely John L. Lewis should be in our shoes and then call a strike. To me that is the lowest thing possible. Even worse than a deserter or draft dodger because they have a certain fear & that would endanger more than only them if the real zero hour came. We are fighting to keep peace & contentment but several are stirring up more hatred between ourselves than exist between Germans & Japans & us. [paragraph]

S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Pass & furlough In the Company I am in as to passes more is giving to closer friends of the C. O. As for the amount of time I been in the Army I deserved a longer furlough but was giving less than I should of received.
S64.Q97.Full: Pass & furlough In the Company I am in as to passes more is giving to closer friends of the C. O. As for the amount of time I been in the Army I deserved a longer furlough but was giving less than I should of received.

S64.Q97.F: They are a few things that could have better attention as sports activities. Otherwise I think the army is OK.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I am perfectly fit physically but I am married and have a baby and now my wife is expecting again. I think I should be given a permanent position or a post so my family can be near. Married men will never make good soldiers as long as they think of their families and have to be away from them.
S64.Q97.C_1: I do not think I am being given a fair chance to show what I can do in the army. I have had two years of college training but I have never had a chance to show it. The first Sgt of my company plays favorites with his friends and the C.O. does not know enough about the men personally to realize what is going on. Suggest change of C.O. and high ranking non-coms. Or better still I would like to be transfered to the Air Corps.
S64.Q97.Full: I am perfectly fit physically but I am married and have a baby and now my wife is expecting again. I think I should be given a permanent position or a post so my family can be near. Married men will never make good soldiers as long as they think of their families and have to be away from them.  I do not think I am being given a fair chance to show what I can do in the army. I have had two years of college training but I have never had a chance to show it. The first Sgt of my company plays favorites with his friends and the C.O. does not know enough about the men personally to realize what is going on. Suggest change of C.O. and high ranking non-coms. Or better still I would like to be transfered to the Air Corps.

S64.Q97.F: I think I am grossly mis classified in the Army. Prior to coming into the Army I was a parts [deletion] [/deletion] and service manager for an auto maker's dealer. I know my job even tho I was no finished mechanic. I come into the Army and go into the C.A.C. OK. I learn to [unclear] plot [/unclear] [unclear] Seacoast [/unclear] Artillery and like it fine. About the time I get worth the room I take up, someone has a brainstorm and I came in Ordnance, I thought because I know
S64.Q97.C_1: [unclear] [/unclear]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I can appreciate the Army as a whole but wonder if Battalion Administration, and Inefficiency are of the same calibre as exists here. There is every evidence of lack of leadership, & organizational ability, petty differences between officers within the Battalion and no cooperation with the Companies is so evident that the men are not getting adequate training, especially the kind to take them into combat. I would feel my chances very slim overseas with the same leadership. - I have been overseas with the [unclear] [/unclear] Service before, and am surprised that investigations are not made more often.
S64.Q97.Full: I can appreciate the Army as a whole but wonder if Battalion Administration, and Inefficiency are of the same calibre as exists here. There is every evidence of lack of leadership, & organizational ability, petty differences between officers within the Battalion and no cooperation with the Companies is so evident that the men are not getting adequate training, especially the kind to take them into combat. I would feel my chances very slim overseas with the same leadership. - I have been overseas with the [unclear] [/unclear] Service before, and am surprised that investigations are not made more often.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: The transportation problem of getting the men who are on passes & leaves should be given considerable attention. It breaks the morale of men to have to wait in lines for hours to get away from the camps to spend a few hours. The Company Commanders should take more personal interest in the men in their companies
S64.Q97.C_1: And on the subject of Non Com ratings, The Commander should see that the best men get the ratings instead of taking the advice of section leaders who can & do have a personal interest in who get the ratings.
S64.Q97.Full: The transportation problem of getting the men who are on passes & leaves should be given considerable attention. It breaks the morale of men to have to wait in lines for hours to get away from the camps to spend a few hours. The Company Commanders should take more personal interest in the men in their companies And on the subject of Non Com ratings, The Commander should see that the best men get the ratings instead of taking the advice of section leaders who can & do have a personal interest in who get the ratings.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Our ratings are all going to Michigan highway workers. [paragraph] The reason is our Officers were almost all employed at the same before the war. Too much politics and favor shown.
S64.Q97.Full: Our ratings are all going to Michigan highway workers. [paragraph] The reason is our Officers were almost all employed at the same before the war. Too much politics and favor shown.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I think that any company in the Army should be free from politics and favoritism, every man regardless of rank or who he was or who he worked for before coming into the Army should be given a fair and equil [equal] chance. The company that I am in at present shows to [too] much favoritism and there is to [too] much politics involved for the companies [company's] own good. If a man comes into the army with a ...
S64.Q97.C_1: rating I think that he should be made to prove that he is worthy of that rating, otherwise I think and believe that every man should come in as a private and them [then] work up. There are men in my Company which I believe couldn't hold their present rating if the truth were actually known and if they were really required to prove that they could hold it. [paragraph] The Army as a whole I believe is fair but there are Companies, I suppose that try to much favoritism and the Army at present is to large for every Company to be watched at all times for such things. [paragraph] As A whole I think that every man should be given a chance to show what he can do on and equil [equal] basis with everyone else
S64.Q97.Full: I think that any company in the Army should be free from politics and favoritism, every man regardless of rank or who he was or who he worked for before coming into the Army should be given a fair and equil [equal] chance. The company that I am in at present shows to [too] much favoritism and there is to [too] much politics involved for the companies [company's] own good. If a man comes into the army with a ... rating I think that he should be made to prove that he is worthy of that rating, otherwise I think and believe that every man should come in as a private and them [then] work up. There are men in my Company which I believe couldn't hold their present rating if the truth were actually known and if they were really required to prove that they could hold it. [paragraph] The Army as a whole I believe is fair but there are Companies, I suppose that try to much favoritism and the Army at present is to large for every Company to be watched at all times for such things. [paragraph] As A whole I think that every man should be given a chance to show what he can do on and equil [equal] basis with everyone else

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I am in the Ordnance Dept. Its an enlisted outfit. I and about 50 other soldiers were put into this company [unclear] as [/unclear] a fillin's. Most of the me [men] know each other before they enlisted. Most of the men went into the army with stripes. Frankly about 2 noncom's know there business. The rest know nothing. I mean every sense of the work [unclear] (nothing) [/unclear] There is very little respect. I should
S64.Q97.C_1: say not respect at all. Its insubordination to say it but I have little respect for them myself. How could you have any respect for your noncoms if they know nothing what so every. They can't drill you, speak to you or teach you. I believe the reason for it is. Never give ratings to enlisted men before they get in to the army. Let them work up from the ranks never put clique into the same company (Friends) Theres where you lose respect & descipline. The captain know quite a few of the men. No doubt theres is favor's which I can't get . That's to be expected. Believe it or not I am the best mop pusher in the Army I've been doing it for the past 2 mo. I can all most make the mop talk to me. Its a little bashful now but in time it will talk. -PS.- I could do wonders with a broom. My job is doing detail work only. It seems to me that you got to take it in the army. Why cry about I could take it.
S64.Q97.Full: I am in the Ordnance Dept. Its an enlisted outfit. I and about 50 other soldiers were put into this company [unclear] as [/unclear] a fillin's. Most of the me [men] know each other before they enlisted. Most of the men went into the army with stripes. Frankly about 2 noncom's know there business. The rest know nothing. I mean every sense of the work [unclear] (nothing) [/unclear] There is very little respect. I should say not respect at all. Its insubordination to say it but I have little respect for them myself. How could you have any respect for your noncoms if they know nothing what so every. They can't drill you, speak to you or teach you. I believe the reason for it is. Never give ratings to enlisted men before they get in to the army. Let them work up from the ranks never put clique into the same company (Friends) Theres where you lose respect & descipline. The captain know quite a few of the men. No doubt theres is favor's which I can't get . That's to be expected. Believe it or not I am the best mop pusher in the Army I've been doing it for the past 2 mo. I can all most make the mop talk to me. Its a little bashful now but in time it will talk. -PS.- I could do wonders with a broom. My job is doing detail work only. It seems to me that you got to take it in the army. Why cry about I could take it.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I'll have been in 6 mo. [months] tomorrow and want my first furlough. We ought to be [underline] guaranteed [/underline] 15 days furlough every six months while we are still in the U.S. [paragraph] Ordnance Companies should have more extensive training to make good seasoned soldiers so we can have half a chance overseas with an old army man in officers rank in every company so we can have the proper respect for the army way of doing things
S64.Q97.C_1: instead of having officers who probably try their best to do things the army way but in the long run make it hard on the boys. They were civilians with us 6 or 7 mo ago, at least a few [deletion] [/deletion] were, and of course need training as well as we do.
S64.Q97.Full: I'll have been in 6 mo. [months] tomorrow and want my first furlough. We ought to be [underline] guaranteed [/underline] 15 days furlough every six months while we are still in the U.S. [paragraph] Ordnance Companies should have more extensive training to make good seasoned soldiers so we can have half a chance overseas with an old army man in officers rank in every company so we can have the proper respect for the army way of doing things instead of having officers who probably try their best to do things the army way but in the long run make it hard on the boys. They were civilians with us 6 or 7 mo ago, at least a few [deletion] [/deletion] were, and of course need training as well as we do.

S64.Q97.Full: No further remarks to make about these questions that are given to us, for we appreciation this in writing this for our country that is going to win the war.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I would much rather be a civilian doing war work. [paragraph] The eats arent so good here they could be a lot better. [paragraph] In 4 1/2 months a person should have at least one ferlough [furlough] . The Army is tougher than it should be.
S64.Q97.Full: I would much rather be a civilian doing war work. [paragraph] The eats arent so good here they could be a lot better. [paragraph] In 4 1/2 months a person should have at least one ferlough [furlough] . The Army is tougher than it should be.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think that the army could have cleaned living and eating quarters. That soldier should have more time for their own need and more freedom at nights and on weekends. If a man living close to home he should be given enough time on weekend to visit home For that the most in every soldiers life is to go home. Everybody should
S64.Q97.C_1: have a furlough at least every three months.[paragraph] A man should be try at differed [different] jobs in the army to see what he suit [is suited] best for.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that the army could have cleaned living and eating quarters. That soldier should have more time for their own need and more freedom at nights and on weekends. If a man living close to home he should be given enough time on weekend to visit home For that the most in every soldiers life is to go home. Everybody should  have a furlough at least every three months.[paragraph] A man should be try at differed [different] jobs in the army to see what he suit [is suited] best for.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Any one going A.W.O.L. hasnt much pride in himself. I would hate to be in combat with soldiers who could not be trusted. I am new in the army but I am well satisfied the question of a furlough doesn't bother me for we may have a week end pass providing we are not on any detail. I think some fellows do not realize the importance of dicipline. Especially in a large body of men for the word dicipline means precission to me without it an army would be a herd
S64.Q97.C_1: OF CATTLE INSTEAD OF A BEAUTIFUL BATTERY BATALLION OR DIV. SQUAD COLUMN OR WHAT HAVE YOU. IT CAN'T BE INFORCED ENOUGH TO HAVE MEN WORK TOGETHER EVEN ON A LARGE GUN WHERE THEY DEPEND ON EACH OTHER ALL OF THE TIME. [paragraph] QUESTIONS #56 ARE SLIGHTLY UNFAIR FOR THE PEOPLE OF OUR ENEMY NATIONS ARE NOT MAD AT US THEY ARE FIGHTING THE SAME AS WE ARE I DID NOT DECLARE THIS WAR SO WHY MAKE THE PEOPLE SUFFER AFTER THE WAR IS OVER THEY ARE ONLY OBEYING ORDERS THE SAME AS US NOT FIGHTING US BECAUSE THEY HAVE A INDIVIDUAL GRUDGE AGAINST THE PEOPLE OF THIS COUNTRY [paragraph] #59 [paragraph] WE CANT JUMP INTO BATTLE WITHOUT FIRST PLANNING IT.
S64.Q97.Full: Any one going A.W.O.L. hasnt much pride in himself. I would hate to be in combat with soldiers who could not be trusted. I am new in the army but I am well satisfied the question of a furlough doesn't bother me for we may have a week end pass providing we are not on any detail. I think some fellows do not realize the importance of dicipline. Especially in a large body of men for the word dicipline means precission to me without it an army would be a herd  OF CATTLE INSTEAD OF A BEAUTIFUL BATTERY BATALLION OR DIV. SQUAD COLUMN OR WHAT HAVE YOU. IT CAN'T BE INFORCED ENOUGH TO HAVE MEN WORK TOGETHER EVEN ON A LARGE GUN WHERE THEY DEPEND ON EACH OTHER ALL OF THE TIME. [paragraph] QUESTIONS #56 ARE SLIGHTLY UNFAIR FOR THE PEOPLE OF OUR ENEMY NATIONS ARE NOT MAD AT US THEY ARE FIGHTING THE SAME AS WE ARE I DID NOT DECLARE THIS WAR SO WHY MAKE THE PEOPLE SUFFER AFTER THE WAR IS OVER THEY ARE ONLY OBEYING ORDERS THE SAME AS US NOT FIGHTING US BECAUSE THEY HAVE A INDIVIDUAL GRUDGE AGAINST THE PEOPLE OF THIS COUNTRY [paragraph] #59 [paragraph] WE CANT JUMP INTO BATTLE WITHOUT FIRST PLANNING IT.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Would like to have a furlough. Don't get enough time off of the week end passes. The food is not so good some times and there is not enough. Some times we are worked to a point of exhaustion.
S64.Q97.Full: Would like to have a furlough. Don't get enough time off of the week end passes. The food is not so good some times and there is not enough. Some times we are worked to a point of exhaustion.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Our Btry is not being treated right in comparison with other Btrys. Such as not getting passes till 6 o'clock early morning. I think if they could give it to one they could give it to all.
S64.Q97.Full: Our Btry is not being treated right in comparison with other Btrys. Such as not getting passes till 6 o'clock early morning. I think if they could give it to one they could give it to all.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: If the army would take time to fit a man to a job to which he is best fitted I think the man himself would be a whole lot more satisfied. The food we get isn't at all what it should be. If a man can not get a furlough he should at least be given a pass that will allow him time enough to see his family.
S64.Q97.C_1: A man should not be put on any duty after his regular duty hours are over, unless he has been found disobeying or being careless about his work.
S64.Q97.Full: If the army would take time to fit a man to a job to which he is best fitted I think the man himself would be a whole lot more satisfied. The food we get isn't at all what it should be. If a man can not get a furlough he should at least be given a pass that will allow him time enough to see his family. A man should not be put on any duty after his regular duty hours are over, unless he has been found disobeying or being careless about his work.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)

S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: The army would be ok if they gilve us week in passes a little oftener and when we did get off they ought to gilve us passes until six oclock
S64.Q97.Full: The army would be ok if they gilve us week in passes a little oftener and when we did get off they ought to gilve us passes until six oclock

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: When I first came into this Army I like it very much, till I started to find out that there are more politics in the Army then on the outside in other words one man dose all the work and the other man who knows some one of high standing in the
S64.Q97.C_1: Army sits and watches When a man gets any power he shouldn't get it because he's given the Top Stg. an apple & shining the [deletion] [/deletion] not [unclear] [/unclear] shoes a man who'll stand up equal to any man is the one who should get it. If you keep making Stgs. men who (such As) pardon the expression) we'll never win this war [space] The Air Corp is an outfit I admire in there you don't find as many of ass suckers, There may be a few in the ground crew but not with fliers [space] In our Outfit the don't care if they work the men all day and night if they think they will get a raise in rank for it. I don't know if my speech will do any good but I tryed anyway.
S64.Q97.Full: When I first came into this Army I like it very much, till I started to find out that there are more politics in the Army then on the outside in other words one man dose all the work and the other man who knows some one of high standing in the Army sits and watches When a man gets any power he shouldn't get it because he's given the Top Stg. an apple & shining the [deletion] [/deletion] not [unclear] [/unclear] shoes a man who'll stand up equal to any man is the one who should get it. If you keep making Stgs. men who (such As) pardon the expression) we'll never win this war [space] The Air Corp is an outfit I admire in there you don't find as many of ass suckers, There may be a few in the ground crew but not with fliers [space] In our Outfit the don't care if they work the men all day and night if they think they will get a raise in rank for it. I don't know if my speech will do any good but I tryed anyway.

S64.Q97.Full: The policy of the Armoured Force refusing to transfer a man to army air corps Technical Training command stinks.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: The army would be much more efficient if so damn much red tape, indecisions & contradictions were cut out. Orders should be transmitted more directly to eliminate it. Some officers should be trained to look at both views if situations too, instead of just their own. Favoritism & "pull" should be eliminated. Soldiers would work better if all were treated equally.
S64.Q97.C_1: 97. (Continued) Continue writing your remarks here. Food should be handled better, that is, less crowding in mess halls and better equipment and room for the personnel to use. The cooks aren't bad cooks, but they don't have the proper facilities to do their best. All weekend passes should be to 6 o'clock Monday morning, & class A passes given out more quickly & often. Furloughs should be every 5 months instead of 6. Soldiers should have some place, & permission, to work after 11 o'clock at night, in order to catch up on so many things that must hang over to the next day to only pile up & never get done. More time is needed before [unclear] reveille [/unclear] in the morning. All work should be fitted into the day as there would be no need for evening details and men could relax. Duty rasters should be made out more in advance, so we could plan more. P. F. C.'s & corporals' should not be exempt to most details. There should be easier access to the chaplain & commanders.
S64.Q97.Full: The army would be much more efficient if so damn much red tape, indecisions & contradictions were cut out. Orders should be transmitted more directly to eliminate it. Some officers should be trained to look at both views if situations too, instead of just their own. Favoritism & "pull" should be eliminated. Soldiers would work better if all were treated equally. 97. (Continued) Continue writing your remarks here. Food should be handled better, that is, less crowding in mess halls and better equipment and room for the personnel to use. The cooks aren't bad cooks, but they don't have the proper facilities to do their best. All weekend passes should be to 6 o'clock Monday morning, & class A passes given out more quickly & often. Furloughs should be every 5 months instead of 6. Soldiers should have some place, & permission, to work after 11 o'clock at night, in order to catch up on so many things that must hang over to the next day to only pile up & never get done. More time is needed before [unclear] reveille [/unclear] in the morning. All work should be fitted into the day as there would be no need for evening details and men could relax. Duty rasters should be made out more in advance, so we could plan more. P. F. C.'s & corporals' should not be exempt to most details. There should be easier access to the chaplain & commanders.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: (1) About the rotten food they feed for mess.[paragraph] (2) To cut out bed check at 23:00. [paragraph] (3) To give more three day passes. [paragraph] (4) To ease up on working after hours and to give more weekend passes to 06:00 Monday morning.
S64.Q97.Full: (1) About the rotten food they feed for mess.[paragraph] (2) To cut out bed check at 23:00. [paragraph] (3) To give more three day passes. [paragraph] (4) To ease up on working after hours and to give more weekend passes to 06:00 Monday morning.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think we should get furloughs oftener than we do. And more to eat most of the time. Don't see why we have to keep our collars buttoned all the time when working.
S64.Q97.Full: I think we should get furloughs oftener than we do. And more to eat most of the time. Don't see why we have to keep our collars buttoned all the time when working.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: The food we get isn't no good. All we have is stew most of the time. Once in a great while we have pork chops or something. If the civilians are giving up what people say they are for the Army, where is it going? I don't think we should work on a week-end either.
S64.Q97.Full: The food we get isn't no good. All we have is stew most of the time. Once in a great while we have pork chops or something. If the civilians are giving up what people say they are for the Army, where is it going? I don't think we should work on a week-end either.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: In our outfit we havent as yet had any passes until 6:00 A.M. Monday mornings or three day passes in the four months I have been in the army.[paragraph] Privates will not receive any Class A passes, I think that is one of the worst ways to harm a soldiers [soldier's] morale.[paragraph] It is a known fact that
S64.Q97.C_1: the food we receive here is not even fair [fit] to eat.
S64.Q97.Full: In our outfit we havent as yet had any passes until 6:00 A.M. Monday mornings or three day passes in the four months I have been in the army.[paragraph] Privates will not receive any Class A passes, I think that is one of the worst ways to harm a soldiers [soldier's] morale.[paragraph] It is a known fact that  the food we receive here is not even fair [fit] to eat.

We [unclear] so [/unclear] [unclear] restricted [/unclear] to the battery area for two month we haven't been getting as many breaks as the rest of the battery's like three day passes. S64.Q97.C_1: The chow is not so good. They do not give us enough passes and the passes are not long enough.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I realize there is a war on and we've got to win. The way we've had to work and have been treated since we've been here makes the fellows feel like they are slaves. [paragraph] We don't mind doing our share but just because our officers are bucking for one more rank and having us get it for them, we don't like it.
S64.Q97.Full: I realize there is a war on and we've got to win. The way we've had to work and have been treated since we've been here makes the fellows feel like they are slaves. [paragraph] We don't mind doing our share but just because our officers are bucking for one more rank and having us get it for them, we don't like it.

S64.Q97.F: Sometimes during the day we do our work, then some times over the week end, when we should get passes they make us work over the weekend and do work that we could have possibly done during the week. As far as furloughs and passes some dutys get them and are [unclear] [/unclear] outfit doesn't get any and we don't think we're being treated very fair about that. Everyone should be treated the same in the army and the fellas will cooperated much better together than they are now.
S64.Q97.C_1: When we do get passes there not long enough for a soldier to really go out have a good time. I'm sure of the fellows here had little longer passes & could go out & have a good time, they wouldnt mind doing??? a little extra work during the week??? [unclear] [/unclear] long??? as you give a soldier a break once in a while you can always depend on him doing his duty & doing it fair & square all the [unclear] [/unclear]

S64.Q97.Full: A question please! Why should Senators, Congressmen and politicians argue over politics now? Their minds should be on subjects of war and not politics.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: When the people came to this country they were white people and I think the white people (if this is going to still be America) should be better than the negro[.] Instead a negro feels larger than white people and gets away with it . They can even get seats for transportation when white people have to stand up or not go at all.
S64.Q97.C_1: an the thing is, the first three grades would get quarters on the post. I can't see why the fourth grade cannot get permission to live from the post long as it doesn't bother his duties. Practaly all units except the medical sec. the fourth grades can obtain permission to go home when they have their familys near the post. That is when they are not required on duty.
S64.Q97.Full: When the people came to this country they were white people and I think the white people (if this is going to still be America) should be better than the negro[.] Instead a negro feels larger than white people and gets away with it . They can even get seats for transportation when white people have to stand up or not go at all. an the thing is, the first three grades would get quarters on the post. I can't see why the fourth grade cannot get permission to live from the post long as it doesn't bother his duties. Practaly all units except the medical sec. the fourth grades can obtain permission to go home when they have their familys near the post. That is when they are not required on duty.
