S64.Q97.F: A lot of times we have officers and noncoms that don't know a thing about what they are doing. Why are they put in? That is the reason that we have trouble. Some guys work hard and don't get any stripe and others just get them for no reason at all.
S64.Q97.Full: A lot of times we have officers and noncoms that don't know a thing about what they are doing. Why are they put in? That is the reason that we have trouble. Some guys work hard and don't get any stripe and others just get them for no reason at all.

S64.Q97.F: I feel that the Commanding officers have to little regards for the enlisted men. Officers pay + allowances allow them to live with their families have their [unclear] cons [/unclear] and all that. But an enlisted man can hardly get 1 three day pass in six months to see his wife and has to spend 40 hrs out of 72 in travel is that right especially where there is no good excuse for not letting a man have furloughs.
S64.Q97.Full: I feel that the Commanding officers have to little regards for the enlisted men. Officers pay + allowances allow them to live with their families have their [unclear] cons [/unclear] and all that. But an enlisted man can hardly get 1 three day pass in six months to see his wife and has to spend 40 hrs out of 72 in travel is that right especially where there is no good excuse for not letting a man have furloughs.

S64.Q97.Full: I want to thank you for griveing [giving] me a chance to express myself in your qustionnear [questionnaire] . Thank you very much.

S64.Q97.F: I really disagree with the Medical Corp and would rather be in something I like. The Medical Corp is a good job for limited service, but for me no, because when I join this Army I wanted to fight for what we enjoy, but as it is I think and mostly everybody else does too.[paragraph] That we got about the rawest deal that was backed only one ...

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: I haven't been on furlough, and passes aren't important to me.
S64.Q97.F: My wife was very sick & needed an operation. I explained it to the special service dept. [department] . They had the operation done at a civilian hospital by a Army Col [colonel] . The operation was a success & she is now getting along fine. I was worried at the time because our family doc [doctor] told me it would have to be done by a specialist. I'm very grateful to the army for their assistance in my time of need. The amount I paid was low & well worth it.
S64.Q97.C_1: I can truthfully say that my wife had the best medical care that could have been given by any civilian hospital or doc anywhere. It has been quite a relief and has helped me be a better soldiers a fellow can't be a good soldier & be worried about home troubles to & the situation I had was very nerve breaking & also spirit breaking. We are both happy now & only wish to see each other once in awhile & I know when the time comes I'll be allowed to go.
S64.Q97.Full: My wife was very sick & needed an operation. I explained it to the special service dept. [department] . They had the operation done at a civilian hospital by a Army Col [colonel] . The operation was a success & she is now getting along fine. I was worried at the time because our family doc [doctor] told me it would have to be done by a specialist. I'm very grateful to the army for their assistance in my time of need. The amount I paid was low & well worth it. I can truthfully say that my wife had the best medical care that could have been given by any civilian hospital or doc anywhere. It has been quite a relief and has helped me be a better soldiers a fellow can't be a good soldier & be worried about home troubles to & the situation I had was very nerve breaking & also spirit breaking. We are both happy now & only wish to see each other once in awhile & I know when the time comes I'll be allowed to go.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I have been trying to serve in a important combat unit for 7 months. I am classified as 1 A and had passed my physical exam and all requirements for the paratraining. When will I be able to transfer.
S64.Q97.Full: I have been trying to serve in a important combat unit for 7 months. I am classified as 1 A and had passed my physical exam and all requirements for the paratraining. When will I be able to transfer.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I do not have any [unclear] [/unclear] remark except I am proud to be American soldier and will do my part to win the war.
S64.Q97.Full: I do not have any [unclear] [/unclear] remark except I am proud to be American soldier and will do my part to win the war.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: When given a chance to express himself a soldier more than likely "bitches". I have a complaint - not against any person or individual outfit - but against a policy sponsored and fostered by the army. [paragraph] The policy which I refer is that of allowing enlisted men to come into the
S64.Q97.C_1: army with ratings. In some cases the greater part of an entire company is composed of such enlisted men with ratings. Such a situation fosters unrest and dissatisfaction among the "base men" or draftees who are placed in the company to fill out the T/O They feel cheated and cannot under the circumstances have any respect for their non coms or for the rank which they hold, since the ratings were given for past experience (civilian) rather than present experience (army) Such a condition in any company does not add to cooperation and efficiency.
S64.Q97.Full: When given a chance to express himself a soldier more than likely "bitches". I have a complaint - not against any person or individual outfit - but against a policy sponsored and fostered by the army. [paragraph] The policy which I refer is that of allowing enlisted men to come into the  army with ratings. In some cases the greater part of an entire company is composed of such enlisted men with ratings. Such a situation fosters unrest and dissatisfaction among the "base men" or draftees who are placed in the company to fill out the T/O They feel cheated and cannot under the circumstances have any respect for their non coms or for the rank which they hold, since the ratings were given for past experience (civilian) rather than present experience (army) Such a condition in any company does not add to cooperation and efficiency.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I don't know about conditions in other branches or outfits in the army but the company I am in is run by a rather poor group of officers who do not care too much about the men but who want to make a name for themselves and considering the men who have left our outfit already and the men who are trying hard to get out
S64.Q97.C_1: it shows that there is something very much wrong. I think that a man who has serve better in some other branch of the service and does no good in the Army he should be given some consideration and if possible be transfered to that branch. My trade has no use in the Army but has every use in the Navy or Coast Guard. I am certain by going to do everything I can to get out of the Army and get into the Navy, therefore helping some in winning the war. I don't think there is enough thought given this matter. It will either be doing something about it or the man will all be trying to get some kind of discharge so they many get into the branch they should like or are best fitted for. That's just common sense I think and I have many men to quote me. [paragraph]
S64.Q97.Full: I don't know about conditions in other branches or outfits in the army but the company I am in is run by a rather poor group of officers who do not care too much about the men but who want to make a name for themselves and considering the men who have left our outfit already and the men who are trying hard to get out it shows that there is something very much wrong. I think that a man who has serve better in some other branch of the service and does no good in the Army he should be given some consideration and if possible be transfered to that branch. My trade has no use in the Army but has every use in the Navy or Coast Guard. I am certain by going to do everything I can to get out of the Army and get into the Navy, therefore helping some in winning the war. I don't think there is enough thought given this matter. It will either be doing something about it or the man will all be trying to get some kind of discharge so they many get into the branch they should like or are best fitted for. That's just common sense I think and I have many men to quote me. [paragraph]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: At the present time I'm in a political outfit many of our noncoms can't even drill a squad. We are just a few drafted men and seem to be tramp over like dirt. I've be turn in for ratings quite a number of times and turn down everytime for no reason at all the fellows
S64.Q97.C_1: and officers are all from the same State and if you aren't from where they come from your just out of luck. I think the matter should be looked into.
S64.Q97.Full: At the present time I'm in a political outfit many of our noncoms can't even drill a squad. We are just a few drafted men and seem to be tramp over like dirt. I've be turn in for ratings quite a number of times and turn down everytime for no reason at all the fellows and officers are all from the same State and if you aren't from where they come from your just out of luck. I think the matter should be looked into.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I would like to be transferred into a trailer outfit or get out of the army on a war job.
S64.Q97.Full: I would like to be transferred into a trailer outfit or get out of the army on a war job.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I volunteered for the army as I want my wife and children to have a good country to live in, but at times I would like very much to see them more often than I do but I can't afford to have them up with me as it is too far for me to go on a pass.
S64.Q97.Full: I volunteered for the army as I want my wife and children to have a good country to live in, but at times I would like very much to see them more often than I do but I can't afford to have them up with me as it is too far for me to go on a pass.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)

S64.Q97.F: Because you can't get every thing you won't to eat and if you can get it, its cost you plenty, this nation surely did stop plenty of traveling, that is by wheeled vehicles. I hope they keep it up any thig to get this war over with

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I have none except that I would like to get over and do my share of fighting. We are just the ballation to do it. Let's get going America for victory, which will soon be ours. [paragraph]
S64.Q97.Full: I have none except that I would like to get over and do my share of fighting. We are just the ballation to do it. Let's get going America for victory, which will soon be ours. [paragraph]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I believe we would have a good army if it were not for the OCS system. The Military Academy at West Point should be increased to several times its size.
S64.Q97.Full: I believe we would have a good army if it were not for the OCS system. The Military Academy at West Point should be increased to several times its size.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I would like to go out in civilian life to serve God and to work at some kind of job that would also help to win this war.
S64.Q97.Full: I would like to go out in civilian life to serve God and to work at some kind of job that would also help to win this war.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I hope, the United Nations will win the War as soon as possible, and free a lot of good living people, so that they may choose their own Government, and be happy to live free.
S64.Q97.Full: I hope, the United Nations will win the War as soon as possible, and free a lot of good living people, so that they may choose their own Government, and be happy to live free.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I believe when a unit is trained to go overseas they should go & not wait in the states doing useless training. That the classification of the men should be much more thoroughly & carefully considered rather than to train a man at the expense of the gov't [government] & then being discharged for some ailment prior to enlistment in
S64.Q97.C_1: the army. Also I believe that the officers that were enlisted men should have a definite time of training instead of being able to apply for a chance at O.C.S. in a period of two or three weeks of basic training + then expecting to know it all. I firmly believe a good officer has a great deal to do with the morale of his men rather than good times. [paragraph] I hope we win this war soon + live in peace + contentment for the remainder of the life of our great Country.
S64.Q97.Full: I believe when a unit is trained to go overseas they should go & not wait in the states doing useless training. That the classification of the men should be much more thoroughly & carefully considered rather than to train a man at the expense of the gov't [government] & then being discharged for some ailment prior to enlistment in  the army. Also I believe that the officers that were enlisted men should have a definite time of training instead of being able to apply for a chance at O.C.S. in a period of two or three weeks of basic training + then expecting to know it all. I firmly believe a good officer has a great deal to do with the morale of his men rather than good times. [paragraph] I hope we win this war soon + live in peace + contentment for the remainder of the life of our great Country.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Leaving my wife has made her seriously ill. I continually worry about her health and welfare. That has been the hardest part of my Army life.
S64.Q97.Full: Leaving my wife has made her seriously ill. I continually worry about her health and welfare. That has been the hardest part of my Army life.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: There have been to many corrupt men on draft boards. To many men defered as of vital war work experience. Poorly trained officers. No consideration of the enlisted men. When physical conditions arise after being inducted into service, give more discharges. Too many men have been inducted with physical handicaps and are not given proper care mostly no consideration at all. Give physical
S64.Q97.C_1: exams every so often and reconsider the men who have been drafted with physical defects. For the benefit of the man, his outfit and his family, give very rigid physical exams before leaving the country. Any man with a physical handicap and will get worse if not placed in the proper part of the army will just help fill the hospitals on foreign soil which are very much needed for fighting casualties. Give more & better physicals oftner.
S64.Q97.Full: There have been to many corrupt men on draft boards. To many men defered as of vital war work experience. Poorly trained officers. No consideration of the enlisted men. When physical conditions arise after being inducted into service, give more discharges. Too many men have been inducted with physical handicaps and are not given proper care mostly no consideration at all. Give physical exams every so often and reconsider the men who have been drafted with physical defects. For the benefit of the man, his outfit and his family, give very rigid physical exams before leaving the country. Any man with a physical handicap and will get worse if not placed in the proper part of the army will just help fill the hospitals on foreign soil which are very much needed for fighting casualties. Give more & better physicals oftner.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I would wish for the army to be operated strictly army - and not strictly politics as I see it run now. Too many favorites of the officers are being pushed ahead regardless of whether they know anything or not. I know of plenty of good men in my outfit that know their business but are still PVT only for the simple reason that they will not or can not play up to their officers. I could put it in stronger language but I don't believe you folks that have to read this would like it - but I do know you understand what I mean.
S64.Q97.Full: I would wish for the army to be operated strictly army - and not strictly politics as I see it run now. Too many favorites of the officers are being pushed ahead regardless of whether they know anything or not. I know of plenty of good men in my outfit that know their business but are still PVT only for the simple reason that they will not or can not play up to their officers. I could put it in stronger language but I don't believe you folks that have to read this would like it - but I do know you understand what I mean.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I feel that I can do more for winning the war, if I was on some war job.
S64.Q97.Full: I feel that I can do more for winning the war, if I was on some war job.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think that we can't fail to be victorious with Roosevelt as our leader and if all the people should have confidence in him, and should some of our elected representatives in Congress stop criticizing him at every move and do all in their power towards the war effort I'm sure we'll win by 1945 or 1946.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that we can't fail to be victorious with Roosevelt as our leader and if all the people should have confidence in him, and should some of our elected representatives in Congress stop criticizing him at every move and do all in their power towards the war effort I'm sure we'll win by 1945 or 1946.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I feel that I am not fit in the branch of service I am in, I would rather be in the [underline] air corp [/underline] . I don't like it at all in the Medical Department.
S64.Q97.Full: I feel that I am not fit in the branch of service I am in, I would rather be in the [underline] air corp [/underline] . I don't like it at all in the Medical Department.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: To let some boys who work at home on fram [farm] and rased food to get back framing [farming] , to have food for suporting all nations.
S64.Q97.Full: To let some boys who work at home on fram [farm] and rased food to get back framing [farming] , to have food for suporting all nations.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: There are a great many rumors concerning men having to stay in the service for more than 6 months after the war. This is lowering to the morale, especially in outfits such as the Med Dept. The men should be assured they will not have to stay in after the war is over.
S64.Q97.C_1: I personally dislike army life very much and I think more consideration should be shown men with families, for this is what Democracy is built on. To continue to tear up homes will certainly be a blow for the very thing we are fighting for.
S64.Q97.Full: There are a great many rumors concerning men having to stay in the service for more than 6 months after the war. This is lowering to the morale, especially in outfits such as the Med Dept. The men should be assured they will not have to stay in after the war is over. I personally dislike army life very much and I think more consideration should be shown men with families, for this is what Democracy is built on. To continue to tear up homes will certainly be a blow for the very thing we are fighting for.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: To have more time off and to get a lot more training, and be a crack outfit when we go into combat instead of rushing us through and to bomb the heck out of Germany Japan and to open up another front in Norway [insertion] [/insertion] or someplace ] and that they should give a soldier a 30 day furlough when he is getting ready to go over seas
S64.Q97.Full: To have more time off and to get a lot more training, and be a crack outfit when we go into combat instead of rushing us through and to bomb the heck out of Germany Japan and to open up another front in Norway [insertion] [/insertion] or someplace ] and that they should give a soldier a 30 day furlough when he is getting ready to go over seas

S64.Q97.Full: Yes, in my outfit the most of the men who are getting stripes are "goldbricks".

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: haven't had a furlough either
S64.Q96.M_marginalia: such a pay
S64.Q97.F: I think the boys in this camp has too much privlige but I am very muchly satisfied with army life & wouldn't take a discharge or wouldn't get out at all if I could be closer to my folks & see them often I wouldn't mind going over & getting this over with I don't mind dying if it will
S64.Q97.C_1: sill let our dear ones have the freedom they have It is worth fighting for [paragraph] I am satisfied + I wish all the other boys felt the same.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the boys in this camp has too much privlige but I am very muchly satisfied with army life & wouldn't take a discharge or wouldn't get out at all if I could be closer to my folks & see them often I wouldn't mind going over & getting this over with I don't mind dying if it will  sill let our dear ones have the freedom they have It is worth fighting for [paragraph] I am satisfied + I wish all the other boys felt the same.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think we should have a way to get to town. It take about 3 hours to get to town after we stand in the bus line. That is the worst part of the army I think.
S64.Q97.Full: I think we should have a way to get to town. It take about 3 hours to get to town after we stand in the bus line. That is the worst part of the army I think.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Personally I dont like the way the army is treating the men around here for the get very little sleep and eats to go on three hours sleep a night is not enough and the eats are awful. Men should be given a chance not like a bunch of rats in a trap to me the army feels like a prison with no time to when I will be out
S64.Q97.C_1: ever since I have been in there I felt as if I have been in Jail personally I think I would do better on the outside because I will never like the army and the way its run. I see men go out of the Army on section eight most of them nuts. Well I can't blame them because its not there fault. No I will never be happy until I am out and trough with this whole lousy thing.
S64.Q97.Full: Personally I dont like the way the army is treating the men around here for the get very little sleep and eats to go on three hours sleep a night is not enough and the eats are awful. Men should be given a chance not like a bunch of rats in a trap to me the army feels like a prison with no time to when I will be out ever since I have been in there I felt as if I have been in Jail personally I think I would do better on the outside because I will never like the army and the way its run. I see men go out of the Army on section eight most of them nuts. Well I can't blame them because its not there fault. No I will never be happy until I am out and trough with this whole lousy thing.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: The food is not as good as it should be and not a nuff [enough] of it. We don't get a nuff time off. They are lots of men on the out side that are not doing any thing to win the war at all. [paragraph] in the outfit I am in all of the officers are trying to get just a step higher and it makes it lots harder on the enlisted men the men dont get a nuff time off
S64.Q97.C_1: in the outfit I am in I don't know about any other outfit when men don't get part of the weekends off it hurts their morale and when men morale is low they shure won't comapite with any one when there morale is down. I like the army very well but the outfit I am in the leaders seem to not know what it is all about they want to much unnesisary work done.
S64.Q97.Full: The food is not as good as it should be and not a nuff [enough] of it. We don't get a nuff time off. They are lots of men on the out side that are not doing any thing to win the war at all. [paragraph] in the outfit I am in all of the officers are trying to get just a step higher and it makes it lots harder on the enlisted men the men dont get a nuff time off  in the outfit I am in I don't know about any other outfit when men don't get part of the weekends off it hurts their morale and when men morale is low they shure won't comapite with any one when there morale is down. I like the army very well but the outfit I am in the leaders seem to not know what it is all about they want to much unnesisary work done.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: It is true that an officer should get courtesy from his men. But when it comes to the food proposition, I do not think he should be given the privilidge to get a better quality food than we. The Army has a large quanity of food but sometimes the quality gets very low.
S64.Q97.C_1: I think that some better way than "a bonus" should be figured out to help the soldiers who are in active duty in this war. I believe they would be more satisfied if some kind of job that they are interested in was made possible for them to get. The way this will be possible is for the Government to start various occupations owned by the Government instead of some "Big Shot". [unclear] [/unclear] this way no certain individual will get all of the profits but each will get his share after the [unclear] [/unclear] have been paid out of the profits other wise we will have thousands of men with nothing to do. This will start such things are robbery, murder and an all around slaughtery of the United States
S64.Q97.Full: It is true that an officer should get courtesy from his men. But when it comes to the food proposition, I do not think he should be given the privilidge to get a better quality food than we. The Army has a large quanity of food but sometimes the quality gets very low. I think that some better way than "a bonus" should be figured out to help the soldiers who are in active duty in this war. I believe they would be more satisfied if some kind of job that they are interested in was made possible for them to get. The way this will be possible is for the Government to start various occupations owned by the Government instead of some "Big Shot". [unclear] [/unclear] this way no certain individual will get all of the profits but each will get his share after the [unclear] [/unclear] have been paid out of the profits other wise we will have thousands of men with nothing to do. This will start such things are robbery, murder and an all around slaughtery of the United States

S64.Q97.F: [unclear] [/unclear]
S64.Q97.C_1: to go again. Married men are Single it is all the same. If you give a soldier the right kinds of a break he will do his best in any job whitch he is asigned to.
S64.Q97.Full: [unclear] [/unclear]  to go again. Married men are Single it is all the same. If you give a soldier the right kinds of a break he will do his best in any job whitch he is asigned to.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I have had one furlough a 7 day one. I think we should have 30 days a year. I think they are to hard on us. Wont let us have time off at night and work from 3 in the morning until 9 or 10 at night we have no time to visit [unclear] [/unclear] [unclear] [/unclear] [unclear] [/unclear] [unclear] [/unclear] and cant be a good soldier like I would like to be.
S64.Q97.Full: I have had one furlough a 7 day one. I think we should have 30 days a year. I think they are to hard on us. Wont let us have time off at night and work from 3 in the morning until 9 or 10 at night we have no time to visit [unclear] [/unclear] [unclear] [/unclear] [unclear] [/unclear] [unclear] [/unclear] and cant be a good soldier like I would like to be.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Officers are given too much authority for being able to rattle off something they learn in books. But most of our officers are lost in the classes & field without their little book. If they would only learn one thing so they could give demonstrations, it would be a lot better than knowing things as they are in the book, and then being lost without it.
S64.Q97.Full: Officers are given too much authority for being able to rattle off something they learn in books. But most of our officers are lost in the classes & field without their little book. If they would only learn one thing so they could give demonstrations, it would be a lot better than knowing things as they are in the book, and then being lost without it.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Too many ratings are given to men who are not qualified but are liked by the C.O. [commanding officer] . [paragraph] In my own case, in the past year I could have done much more for the country working and paying taxes than laying around an army camp. And why are physically unfit men sent over seas (glasses mostly).
S64.Q97.C_1: use soldiers to stop all strikes at once- by force if necessary
S64.Q97.Full: Too many ratings are given to men who are not qualified but are liked by the C.O. [commanding officer] . [paragraph] In my own case, in the past year I could have done much more for the country working and paying taxes than laying around an army camp. And why are physically unfit men sent over seas (glasses mostly). use soldiers to stop all strikes at once- by force if necessary

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I want very much to go into the Air Corps as a navigator. I have applied for a transfer a few months ago. I think my outfit is taking too long in transferring me. I know I can do more for this country and in the Army in that branch of the service.
S64.Q97.Full: I want very much to go into the Air Corps as a navigator. I have applied for a transfer a few months ago. I think my outfit is taking too long in transferring me. I know I can do more for this country and in the Army in that branch of the service.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I don't think that soldiers should work all day on Saturday and sometimes on Sunday. I think there should be more passes issued than there are at the present time. The food could be improved on quite a bit.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't think that soldiers should work all day on Saturday and sometimes on Sunday. I think there should be more passes issued than there are at the present time. The food could be improved on quite a bit.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: not what I was promised. [written after answer 9]
S64.Q97.F: It seems to me that the system that the Army is run on is a little wrong. Everyone doesn't get a fair chance. If the first Sgt. like you, you get the breaks. Thats where the Army is wrong. They shouldn't be any personal feeling stoping any man from trying to make good. I know that, that idea about getting a man discouraged and he will fight better is all wrong. A man will fight better for some one he
S64.Q97.C_1: [insertion] [/insertion]
S64.Q97.Full: It seems to me that the system that the Army is run on is a little wrong. Everyone doesn't get a fair chance. If the first Sgt. like you, you get the breaks. Thats where the Army is wrong. They shouldn't be any personal feeling stoping any man from trying to make good. I know that, that idea about getting a man discouraged and he will fight better is all wrong. A man will fight better for some one he [insertion] [/insertion]

S64.Q97.F: There should be more furloughs issued out.
S64.Q97.Full: There should be more furloughs issued out.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page

S64.Q97.F: Yes, I will say because I like a training that in the future for me things would be larger[?] . Why before the Army take I was working and taking myself changes to get school at night for the same reason for thing that I learn that would make me feel proud. And all of this that I was trying to build up the Army take it away from me. And [unclear] belived [/unclear] that
S64.Q97.C_1: The army will cooperated with me and will help me in a training that I want that if I go to fight in the war it will worth for what I learn to fight.

And all of this that I was trying to build up the Army take it away from me. And [unclear] belived [/unclear] that The army will cooperated with me and will help me in a training that I want that if I go to fight in the war it will worth for what I learn to fight.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think the promotions should be given to the men with the most time if they have the same ability as the man wiht the less time. And there should never be promotions made on how good a friend you are of the higher ranking man. And I think men should be private longer before going
S64.Q97.C_1: [unclear] [/unclear]
S64.Q97.Full: I think the promotions should be given to the men with the most time if they have the same ability as the man wiht the less time. And there should never be promotions made on how good a friend you are of the higher ranking man. And I think men should be private longer before going [unclear] [/unclear]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: We don't get enough time off for rest. We don't get quite enough different food to eat, too much of the same food every day. Not enough clothing so that we can change and keep clean. Too much personal feeling among Non Coms [non-commissioned officers] and privates. The companies are not organized enough.
S64.Q97.C_1: [unclear] [/unclear]
S64.Q97.Full: We don't get enough time off for rest. We don't get quite enough different food to eat, too much of the same food every day. Not enough clothing so that we can change and keep clean. Too much personal feeling among Non Coms [non-commissioned officers] and privates. The companies are not organized enough. [unclear] [/unclear]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: When a fellow foes to the dispensary he has to wait about 4-6 hours before he can get relief. Too many details are picked after duty hours. Soldiers should get a furlough when they are told they would. Instead of being put off and put off until when they get one it is in
S64.Q97.C_1: short they don't enjoy it. It will break down morale and then officers ask why would a boy want to go AWOL [Absent Without Official Leave] . I think inspection is a good thing but we have too many. A lot of time is lost on too many inspections.
S64.Q97.Full: When a fellow foes to the dispensary he has to wait about 4-6 hours before he can get relief. Too many details are picked after duty hours. Soldiers should get a furlough when they are told they would. Instead of being put off and put off until when they get one it is in  short they don't enjoy it. It will break down morale and then officers ask why would a boy want to go AWOL [Absent Without Official Leave] . I think inspection is a good thing but we have too many. A lot of time is lost on too many inspections.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: In our outfit we have intirly [entirely] to [too] many inspections & to much inspecting. I think inspections are necessary but we have to many. In fact you are preparing for inspections half of your time. We should be training instead of being inspected.
S64.Q97.Full: In our outfit we have intirly [entirely] to [too] many inspections & to much inspecting. I think inspections are necessary but we have to many. In fact you are preparing for inspections half of your time. We should be training instead of being inspected.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I think [deletion] on [/deletion] for off duty hours there should be something besides detail work for the boys. Ten minute breaks should be for rest insted of details or jumping to attention in Company area when Co officer passes by. I don't think duty hours should be 16-18 hrs day only in case of emmergency. Soldiers should have week ends off not only for rest but a good soldier needs to relieve
S64.Q97.C_1: [unclear] [/unclear]
S64.Q97.Full: I think [deletion] on [/deletion] for off duty hours there should be something besides detail work for the boys. Ten minute breaks should be for rest insted of details or jumping to attention in Company area when Co officer passes by. I don't think duty hours should be 16-18 hrs day only in case of emmergency. Soldiers should have week ends off not only for rest but a good soldier needs to relieve [unclear] [/unclear]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Other/No answer
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: I have not had a furlough or pass as yet, but it is because we are too busy right now
S64.Q97.F: I believe the Allied nations will win this war soon, because we are fighting like a team and we are correcting the mistakes that were made in the last world war.
S64.Q97.Full: I believe the Allied nations will win this war soon, because we are fighting like a team and we are correcting the mistakes that were made in the last world war.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: If the boys fighting are getting plenty to eat, they should give the boys training a little more to eat.[paragraph] The officers should talk a little better to there [their] men.
S64.Q97.Full: If the boys fighting are getting plenty to eat, they should give the boys training a little more to eat.[paragraph] The officers should talk a little better to there [their] men.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Other/No answer
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: I will when my time comes around [is handwritten below the answers]
S64.Q97.F: The army is ok in ways, but there are very few of us who would not rather be at home, but it is our American duty to [unclear] put out his or her best + put to work in the peace best fitted. [/unclear]
S64.Q97.Full: The army is ok in ways, but there are very few of us who would not rather be at home, but it is our American duty to [unclear] put out his or her best + put to work in the peace best fitted. [/unclear]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M_marginalia: Mother has to work now. Brothers in the Army leave mother feeling sick.
S64.Q97.F: Give the soldiers a chance to see their folks we'll [while] their in the U.S.A. Later they'll might make the trip back. It would mean so much to them when they get over their [there - overseas] They'll feel as if their [they're] fighting for the folks and they'll be anions [anxious] to get back. They'll kill with the thought of every enemy down will bring them closer to home.
S64.Q97.C_1: We're giving our life in order to keep preserve the Bill of rights. It's not a very pleasant thought knowing that you might not come back. [space] I enlisted because I thought as an American did. My future home is in stake. I thought I would be north more in the Army but now I'm wrong. [paragraph] Give a soldier a even break and he'll be a dam lot better than he is to day. Show him right from wrong and not have him guess. [paragraph] This outfit is not even a boy scout outfit. I was better trained in the boy's scouts than these soldiers. I would even call them soldiers. The uniform doesn't make a soldier its what he knows and how he acts. The uniform is like a Key to a city but many abuse this key.
S64.Q97.Full: Give the soldiers a chance to see their folks we'll [while] their in the U.S.A. Later they'll might make the trip back. It would mean so much to them when they get over their [there - overseas] They'll feel as if their [they're] fighting for the folks and they'll be anions [anxious] to get back. They'll kill with the thought of every enemy down will bring them closer to home. We're giving our life in order to keep preserve the Bill of rights. It's not a very pleasant thought knowing that you might not come back. [space] I enlisted because I thought as an American did. My future home is in stake. I thought I would be north more in the Army but now I'm wrong. [paragraph] Give a soldier a even break and he'll be a dam lot better than he is to day. Show him right from wrong and not have him guess. [paragraph] This outfit is not even a boy scout outfit. I was better trained in the boy's scouts than these soldiers. I would even call them soldiers. The uniform doesn't make a soldier its what he knows and how he acts. The uniform is like a Key to a city but many abuse this key.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I think we should have more time for sports. In civilian life, I was a Golf Professionals, and eventually, I want to continue playing the game. None of us have time for sports because we work from daybreak until dark. I feel that it is necessary in a young man's life, or otherwise, it is very hard on his mood. I know because I see it every day.
S64.Q97.Full: I think we should have more time for sports. In civilian life, I was a Golf Professionals, and eventually, I want to continue playing the game. None of us have time for sports because we work from daybreak until dark. I feel that it is necessary in a young man's life, or otherwise, it is very hard on his mood. I know because I see it every day.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: My remarks are get all the 1-A men in and let the 1-B go home because it is just expense to the U.S. Army by keeping them here.
S64.Q97.Full: My remarks are get all the 1-A men in and let the 1-B go home because it is just expense to the U.S. Army by keeping them here.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: As I am located in a station Complement, I notice many fellows physically unfit for military service. Seems to me men with skillful back grounds for defence jobs should be released for the benefit of the country and themselves perhaps, their ability would be more useful outside in
S64.Q97.C_1: civilian life than in the Army. This of course pertains to men on, Limited Service. [paragraph] I do think a job classification should be taken of are Limited Service men. To determine as to where they may be best suited. There work may be of greater importance outside instead of being retained in the Army.
S64.Q97.Full: As I am located in a station Complement, I notice many fellows physically unfit for military service. Seems to me men with skillful back grounds for defence jobs should be released for the benefit of the country and themselves perhaps, their ability would be more useful outside in  civilian life than in the Army. This of course pertains to men on, Limited Service. [paragraph] I do think a job classification should be taken of are Limited Service men. To determine as to where they may be best suited. There work may be of greater importance outside instead of being retained in the Army.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I don't believe that I can do as much in the army to help win the war than I could at home. However, I am in the Medical Corps, and I believe that I would be doing more to help win the war in a combat outfit such as the Air Corps. The fact that I'm in limited service has a big bearing on that however , I believe limited service men should not be in the army in the first place.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't believe that I can do as much in the army to help win the war than I could at home. However, I am in the Medical Corps, and I believe that I would be doing more to help win the war in a combat outfit such as the Air Corps. The fact that I'm in limited service has a big bearing on that however , I believe limited service men should not be in the army in the first place.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Officers are to often put in positions they are not qualified for. I am speaking from experience. We have had two one of which is still with us. He doesn't know enough to get in out of the rain. Always wants to ride around when you have something else more important to do. I think and hope to see the day when such men should take a test before being allowed to enter a
S64.Q97.C_1: branch of service of which they apparently know nothing or even less. The Engineers is know place for an Backwood Sissyfied Officer who thinks he knows it all and doesn't know a darn thing. Non Coms if they stick together ought to be able to get ride of a parasite especially in time of war. This type of Officer is nothing more or less than a desk ornament and draws his money for doing absolutely nothing. [paragraph] A soldier puts his time in for a very small amount of money and inconvience to him but a civilian who works on a army post especially this one does just about as he pleases gets paid for overtime and growls like the devil when he has to put in a few extra hours.
S64.Q97.Full: Officers are to often put in positions they are not qualified for. I am speaking from experience. We have had two one of which is still with us. He doesn't know enough to get in out of the rain. Always wants to ride around when you have something else more important to do. I think and hope to see the day when such men should take a test before being allowed to enter a  branch of service of which they apparently know nothing or even less. The Engineers is know place for an Backwood Sissyfied Officer who thinks he knows it all and doesn't know a darn thing. Non Coms if they stick together ought to be able to get ride of a parasite especially in time of war. This type of Officer is nothing more or less than a desk ornament and draws his money for doing absolutely nothing. [paragraph] A soldier puts his time in for a very small amount of money and inconvience to him but a civilian who works on a army post especially this one does just about as he pleases gets paid for overtime and growls like the devil when he has to put in a few extra hours.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: The reason I answered question #96 is. I am a cripple. I cant take drill or calisentics. And my mother is left alone at home with heart trouble.
S64.Q97.Full: The reason I answered question #96 is. I am a cripple. I cant take drill or calisentics. And my mother is left alone at home with heart trouble.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I think a lot of Limited service men that are farmers should be sent back to farms to raise food cause food is whats going to win this war.
S64.Q97.Full: I think a lot of Limited service men that are farmers should be sent back to farms to raise food cause food is whats going to win this war.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Sir. My questions are express by a soilder who feel that the army is a wonderful service to be in but to be just to our government and service a soilder should be in good health. So far I have spent a long time in three hospitals. I was sent two the second one to be cured or discharge. They
S64.Q97.C_1: not cure me so I was waiting to be discharged there until order came thru to send us to the nearest hospital to our home and discharge us. After all that time and all the doctors I was before it took one that had only been in the service a month to return me to duty. Now I was going thru the second thing that I went in the other hospital. I will haft to back to a hospital I would give my right arm to be cured but I know they can't
S64.Q97.Full: Sir. My questions are express by a soilder who feel that the army is a wonderful service to be in but to be just to our government and service a soilder should be in good health. So far I have spent a long time in three hospitals. I was sent two the second one to be cured or discharge. They not cure me so I was waiting to be discharged there until order came thru to send us to the nearest hospital to our home and discharge us. After all that time and all the doctors I was before it took one that had only been in the service a month to return me to duty. Now I was going thru the second thing that I went in the other hospital. I will haft to back to a hospital I would give my right arm to be cured but I know they can't

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I would like to see the Company Commander give more of their time with his men. My C.O. used his position as a Dictator would rather than an Officer. One would think we were dirt under his feet. It seems to me that some officers keep their present position not because of their ability, but of a "pull" or drag with their superiors. Naturally, I do not expect a [unclear] [/unclear] on this
S64.Q97.C_1: earth but I feel that officer in charge of men can be at least civil and still maintain discipline
S64.Q97.Full: I would like to see the Company Commander give more of their time with his men. My C.O. used his position as a Dictator would rather than an Officer. One would think we were dirt under his feet. It seems to me that some officers keep their present position not because of their ability, but of a "pull" or drag with their superiors. Naturally, I do not expect a [unclear] [/unclear] on this earth but I feel that officer in charge of men can be at least civil and still maintain discipline

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I feel that the men in our outfit could do more at home in defense jobs or be better placed in other branches of the army. Most of us have had little or no army training. Our jobs are mostly just common labor that anyone could do.
S64.Q97.Full: I feel that the men in our outfit could do more at home in defense jobs or be better placed in other branches of the army. Most of us have had little or no army training. Our jobs are mostly just common labor that anyone could do.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Some of our draft boards use their position to induct men without enough consideration of the hardships they cause married men with a family, also covers up with deferments for their friends.
S64.Q97.Full: Some of our draft boards use their position to induct men without enough consideration of the hardships they cause married men with a family, also covers up with deferments for their friends.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Dr should be taken into the army at a good rate of pay but not made officers until they prove they can handle men. [paragraph] No man should work on a ward as a ward boy, 12 hrs a day without extra pay or a least shorter hours. Extra pay about 25.00 per month. I have never worked on a ward in a hospital but I
S64.Q97.C_1: know many men who are working think now and they [underline] hate it [/underline] . It is not fair the Dr's & nurses should help more and not act as if they were so much better than the enlisted man working, should say forced to work, under them. Many of the enlisted men [deletion] some [/deletion] have a better education, lived better & made more money on the outside. When it is over they will do so again. [paragraph] A man should have the right to transfer out of the Medical Corp. Than when they cannot get enough men to work with the Doctors in the hospitals the Doctors will have to give them respect or do the work themselves. [paragraph]
S64.Q97.Full: Dr should be taken into the army at a good rate of pay but not made officers until they prove they can handle men. [paragraph] No man should work on a ward as a ward boy, 12 hrs a day without extra pay or a least shorter hours. Extra pay about 25.00 per month. I have never worked on a ward in a hospital but I  know many men who are working think now and they [underline] hate it [/underline] . It is not fair the Dr's & nurses should help more and not act as if they were so much better than the enlisted man working, should say forced to work, under them. Many of the enlisted men [deletion] some [/deletion] have a better education, lived better & made more money on the outside. When it is over they will do so again. [paragraph] A man should have the right to transfer out of the Medical Corp. Than when they cannot get enough men to work with the Doctors in the hospitals the Doctors will have to give them respect or do the work themselves. [paragraph]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Food is my biggest complaint. I should have said the preparation of food. First of all the cooks are not up to par, don't know their business, can't prepare it properly consequently quite a bit of it goes to waste. Keep feeding the same food when they [unclear] [/unclear] the fellows can't and won't eat it, eventually it all ends in the garbage can,
S64.Q97.C_1: strickly a waste of time and food. I know different messes feed different but in our mess we never get any bakery of any sort. Haven't seen pie in months and the last time we had soup was about six months ago. All in all our food is far below par. [para] Transportation facilities for the boys from camp to town and back are very poor, I believe something could be done to remedy the situation. [para] In my opinion the drafting of women in the army was a mistake. They could have left the 1-B men on the jobs that the girls took over and left the women home.
S64.Q97.Full: Food is my biggest complaint. I should have said the preparation of food. First of all the cooks are not up to par, don't know their business, can't prepare it properly consequently quite a bit of it goes to waste. Keep feeding the same food when they [unclear] [/unclear] the fellows can't and won't eat it, eventually it all ends in the garbage can, strickly a waste of time and food. I know different messes feed different but in our mess we never get any bakery of any sort. Haven't seen pie in months and the last time we had soup was about six months ago. All in all our food is far below par. [para] Transportation facilities for the boys from camp to town and back are very poor, I believe something could be done to remedy the situation. [para] In my opinion the drafting of women in the army was a mistake. They could have left the 1-B men on the jobs that the girls took over and left the women home.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Why yes I do have put more fellows in the arm without dependents even men with wifes, Let the ones go that have wife & children back home. Let them do the war work I'm sure they would put out more work then the fellows thats single and don't give a damn weather they work or not. I could make a nice happy living for my wife + kid if
S64.Q97.C_1: I where home and we would be happy witch where not now. My wife came down to see me in so me all write I never had so much detail in the four months I've been in the Army as I did the 10 day's she was here. I was even ordered to send her home. So that the way a fellow in the army schould be treated I'm asking you. Have you got a wife if your an officer you problie have her with you we can't even get a pass to go see them at night have you got 2 nice little girls at home, I have. I'm home sick four my girls. Then to haft to be in a hell hole like this. And not be able to go see your wife, when she come to see you. See gets here on a Sat. the week end no I can't see here I haft to go out a build a bridge get to see her at [deletion] [/deletion] 700 oclock that night when she gets here 5 in the morning then you ask me.
S64.Q97.Full: Why yes I do have put more fellows in the arm without dependents even men with wifes, Let the ones go that have wife & children back home. Let them do the war work I'm sure they would put out more work then the fellows thats single and don't give a damn weather they work or not. I could make a nice happy living for my wife + kid if I where home and we would be happy witch where not now. S64.Q97.F: I think that the Capitain is not so hot for this Company because all the men are down on him and we have about hafe the Company good workers. And a lot that are not worth the feed the Army gives them. All so we have no decient place to go here. Also when
S64.Q97.C_1: you do get out in time to go to the P.X. the Beer and [unclear] [/unclear] hot here. Also we have to work from 5:30 till 8 oclock an [unclear] [/unclear] close at 9 oclock. I think thay should stay open latter to give us Boys a chance to get our supplys.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that the Capitain is not so hot for this Company because all the men are down on him and we have about hafe the Company good workers. And a lot that are not worth the feed the Army gives them. All so we have no decient place to go here. Also when you do get out in time to go to the P.X. the Beer and [unclear] [/unclear] hot here. Also we have to work from 5:30 till 8 oclock an [unclear] [/unclear] close at 9 oclock. I think thay should stay open latter to give us Boys a chance to get our supplys.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: We are having a 3rd Army test soon and if the Division doesn't pass we don't get furloughs. It isn't fair, we are only human people. Furloughs are ten days for everyone and no traveling time. That isn't fair. I live in Boston. With good connection I can make it in 3 days that is 6 days traveling time out from my furlough, only 4 days at Home. A lot live in Missouri and around Louisiana, and it only takes
S64.Q97.C_1: a day to get home, that leaves them 8 days. I don't think it's fair at all. That is why I'm bitching a lot.[paragraph] The Special Service has nice shows down the Division Bowl. When they do, the 532 Engineers [532nd Engineer Boat and Shore Regiment] are either working, on detail, or out on useless bivouac. I like the Army but they should keep up a soldier's morale or he is no good as a soldier.[paragraph] We don't get any sleep at all between scratching chiggers & heat rashes, we have to get up at 2 or 3 in the morning, take a shower & cool them off. What kind of a dispensary have they if they can't help you out[?] [paragraph] We don't get a damn bit of time off, we work from 6:30 in the morning until 8 or 9 o'clock at night. Saturday & Sunday included. Do you wonder why we are all disgusted and I mean all of us.
S64.Q97.Full: We are having a 3rd Army test soon and if the Division doesn't pass we don't get furloughs. It isn't fair, we are only human people. Furloughs are ten days for everyone and no traveling time. That isn't fair. I live in Boston. With good connection I can make it in 3 days that is 6 days traveling time out from my furlough, only 4 days at Home. A lot live in Missouri and around Louisiana, and it only takes a day to get home, that leaves them 8 days. I don't think it's fair at all. That is why I'm bitching a lot.[paragraph] The Special Service has nice shows down the Division Bowl. When they do, the 532 Engineers [532nd Engineer Boat and Shore Regiment] are either working, on detail, or out on useless bivouac. I like the Army but they should keep up a soldier's morale or he is no good as a soldier.[paragraph] We don't get any sleep at all between scratching chiggers & heat rashes, we have to get up at 2 or 3 in the morning, take a shower & cool them off. What kind of a dispensary have they if they can't help you out[?] [paragraph] We don't get a damn bit of time off, we work from 6:30 in the morning until 8 or 9 o'clock at night. Saturday & Sunday included. Do you wonder why we are all disgusted and I mean all of us.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Things could be seem a lot smoother sometimes, with less confusion . Also furloughs should be given at last once every three months while a man is here training. Morale gets very low when he can't go home once every so often at a set date. There isn't enough time allotted when they do get furloughs. Most soldiers complain about short furloughs, at best twelve days in all cases should be given.
S64.Q97.Full: Things could be seem a lot smoother sometimes, with less confusion . Also furloughs should be given at last once every three months while a man is here training. Morale gets very low when he can't go home once every so often at a set date. There isn't enough time allotted when they do get furloughs. Most soldiers complain about short furloughs, at best twelve days in all cases should be given.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think that this Country is overlooking several propositions which is going to put it behind the eight ball very very much when the war is over and it is also holding itself and its production back in several different categories which I will not mention. But will say a few words on the topic. Waste and ye shall want and I see very very much of it in many many ways and different ways. We have a fine Capable Army. The best on
S64.Q97.C_1: Earth in my Opinion. But there is a lot of dissention and lack of enthusiasm which could be remedied to about 100% better condition and effectiveness, all around. Will not mention this remedy unless asked point blank. But will say give and ye shall receive. And if you give a man all bitter and no sweets. When the time comes for him to do a bit of killing and he feels he has been treated fairly and loves his country because of its freedom of thought and speech and cooperation. And doesn't make saps of its men as Hitler does his we will have the toughest, cooperating machine of Humanity I think is possible to gather together. And taking men from their wives and sending them thousands of miles away create dissention and lack of something to live for all around any way you wish to figure "18 to 60". Men and women both. Take away a Mans "Honey" and he will probably sting or try to ever chance he gets. Mass form of Humanity are one way of wiping out the Army Quickly in case of "Sabotage". Note one thing that caused the downfall of "Rome". Probably the reason
S64.Q97.Full: I think that this Country is overlooking several propositions which is going to put it behind the eight ball very very much when the war is over and it is also holding itself and its production back in several different categories which I will not mention. But will say a few words on the topic. Waste and ye shall want and I see very very much of it in many many ways and different ways. We have a fine Capable Army. The best on  Earth in my Opinion. But there is a lot of dissention and lack of enthusiasm which could be remedied to about 100% better condition and effectiveness, all around. Will not mention this remedy unless asked point blank. But will say give and ye shall receive. And if you give a man all bitter and no sweets. When the time comes for him to do a bit of killing and he feels he has been treated fairly and loves his country because of its freedom of thought and speech and cooperation. And doesn't make saps of its men as Hitler does his we will have the toughest, cooperating machine of Humanity I think is possible to gather together. And taking men from their wives and sending them thousands of miles away create dissention and lack of something to live for all around any way you wish to figure "18 to 60". Men and women both. Take away a Mans "Honey" and he will probably sting or try to ever chance he gets. Mass form of Humanity are one way of wiping out the Army Quickly in case of "Sabotage". Note one thing that caused the downfall of "Rome". Probably the reason

S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: When one comes into the army he is already expected to know too much about it. Some persons [people] who come to the army don't know anything about the different part of an army therefore he does not know what he wants to do. Soldiers from the north should not be sent south to get there [their] training because the climate makes them lazy and
S64.Q97.C_1: It is difficult to learn. Training camps should not be located so far from civilizattion that it is difficult for a solder to get home on furloughs, and the transportation of food and needed articles is very difficult.
S64.Q97.Full: When one comes into the army he is already expected to know too much about it. Some persons [people] who come to the army don't know anything about the different part of an army therefore he does not know what he wants to do. Soldiers from the north should not be sent south to get there [their] training because the climate makes them lazy and It is difficult to learn. Training camps should not be located so far from civilizattion that it is difficult for a solder to get home on furloughs, and the transportation of food and needed articles is very difficult.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Other/No answer
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: Original text: Yes, I have had my fair share of furloughs and passes. Modified text: Yes, I have had my fair share of passes
S64.Q97.F: From my own battalion throughout the eight armored division, it is the most unorganized outfit I have seen. Not only do I feel this way but I have friends who are in different branches in eighth armored division and they feel the same way.
S64.Q97.C_1: 97. (Continued) Continue writing your remarks here. We are supposed to have furloughs in a short time and as far as I know I've never heard of any one getting [unclear] [/unclear] than a fifteen day furlough. We are supposed to get ten day furloughs which is stinko. Many men would only have two or three days [insertion] at [/insertion] home. Why Army cramps are placed so far from a decent place to have a good time, such as a good sized city is more than I know. There should be more time for recreation. Let's hope the war is over in a very sort time and we'll all be happier.
S64.Q97.Full: From my own battalion throughout the eight armored division, it is the most unorganized outfit I have seen. Not only do I feel this way but I have friends who are in different branches in eighth armored division and they feel the same way. 97. (Continued) Continue writing your remarks here. We are supposed to have furloughs in a short time and as far as I know I've never heard of any one getting [unclear] [/unclear] than a fifteen day furlough. We are supposed to get ten day furloughs which is stinko. Many men would only have two or three days [insertion] at [/insertion] home. Why Army cramps are placed so far from a decent place to have a good time, such as a good sized city is more than I know. There should be more time for recreation. Let's hope the war is over in a very sort time and we'll all be happier.

S64.Q97.F: I'm not against being in the Army but I can't get used to the climate as I'm used to a cooler climate and it is to far from house as I can't very well keep my mind on my work, I think that if I was closer to home and see my wife & people I think I could be of a great help to the Army in many way, and that is speaking for most of the married men that are in my Company they all have the same opinion as
S64.Q97.C_1: I have, and speaking about furlough we have been told that if we [unclear] [/unclear] to get furlough we would only get 8 to 10 days as I am a New York & a married man that would'nt be enough time suitable as it takes 5 days traveling time.
S64.Q97.Full: I'm not against being in the Army but I can't get used to the climate as I'm used to a cooler climate and it is to far from house as I can't very well keep my mind on my work, I think that if I was closer to home and see my wife & people I think I could be of a great help to the Army in many way, and that is speaking for most of the married men that are in my Company they all have the same opinion as  I have, and speaking about furlough we have been told that if we [unclear] [/unclear] to get furlough we would only get 8 to 10 days as I am a New York & a married man that would'nt be enough time suitable as it takes 5 days traveling time.

S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I personally think the Army is a great life. It shows one the troubles in life and gets one accustomed to the changes that take place every day. The army has agreed with me thus far and I feel I am gaining experience that will never be gained any other place in the world. [paragraph] As for physical training I think the army has the best. One can be conditioned in the army as he gets the best meals and by far the best physical fitness program known.
S64.Q97.C_1: I do feel that less promised to me would be much better. When Soldiers are promised something & then don't get it their moral is bought to low tied. I feel that no promises are better than many because it teaches a soldier not to expect to much for himself. On the other side the soldier isn't going to get all the things he gets here and he might just as well face the facts now.
S64.Q97.Full: I personally think the Army is a great life. It shows one the troubles in life and gets one accustomed to the changes that take place every day. The army has agreed with me thus far and I feel I am gaining experience that will never be gained any other place in the world. [paragraph] As for physical training I think the army has the best. One can be conditioned in the army as he gets the best meals and by far the best physical fitness program known. I do feel that less promised to me would be much better. When Soldiers are promised something & then don't get it their moral is bought to low tied. I feel that no promises are better than many because it teaches a soldier not to expect to much for himself. On the other side the soldier isn't going to get all the things he gets here and he might just as well face the facts now.

S64.Q97.Full: I believe the Army is run as well as could be expected considering the huge job that has to be done. That's my main reason for not kicking too much - I have [insertion] most [/insertion] always received a square deal.
