S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: In most of the answers offered I fail to find one which represents my opinion. They are too general - And in questions 49-55 -- All we know is what the newspapers tell us - And that is likely to have quite an influence on what we think. I wonder how many army officers - coms and non-coms - are aware that
S64.Q97.C_1: such a thing as psychology exists - is the fact that they have absolute control over their men a reason for ignoring it?
S64.Q97.Full: In most of the answers offered I fail to find one which represents my opinion. They are too general - And in questions 49-55 -- All we know is what the newspapers tell us - And that is likely to have quite an influence on what we think. I wonder how many army officers - coms and non-coms - are aware that such a thing as psychology exists - is the fact that they have absolute control over their men a reason for ignoring it?

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: If they didn't give us so many details and a little more training they would turn out better soldiers They also promise us fuloughs [furloughs] then a couple of days before we are to get them they tell us we can't have it. I think something should be done about it. Thats the reason we had 7 of our men go over the hill.
S64.Q97.Full: If they didn't give us so many details and a little more training they would turn out better soldiers They also promise us fuloughs [furloughs] then a couple of days before we are to get them they tell us we can't have it. I think something should be done about it. Thats the reason we had 7 of our men go over the hill.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: If the army would relieve some of the extra details and settle down to brass tasks it would suit me better. Always on the lookout for a downright dirty detail; to the place where he can't live right. Watching out of the corner of his eye for a Sgt.[sergeant] who generally picks out the men who won't kick. When he finds them, they are sure goners. [paragraph] Not enough attention is given to the duty rooster to see that every man gets his share of duties, those that [underline] have [/underline] to be performed.
S64.Q97.C_1: It seems that every man with stripes or a man with bar thinks he owns the place and really does his stuff to show authority. It may be due to the fact that promotion in the Armored Forces is very slow and possibly entitles a noncom or Lt. to show his authority. I believe if the leaders of a platoon or/also the CO's would enter into the facts of the men's lives in the army, the show would go on a little better than it has. A leader can be hard but still be human. - As long as the leader himself does not have to do the work it is okay. - It may be taken that I am a little on the inferiority side but after all I'm a private and my opinions doesn't count. It's always TS to a private, nobody cares. As for the furloughs, it is a relief to get a pass or a furlough. Everyone of them is appreciated but the position I've been in, there are very few. Maybe a pass from 12:00 noon to 6:00 P.M. the next day but whatever it amounts to, we can't get over 35 miles away from the post. Never the chance to see the sights in a reasonable distance from camp.
S64.Q97.Full: If the army would relieve some of the extra details and settle down to brass tasks it would suit me better. Always on the lookout for a downright dirty detail; to the place where he can't live right. Watching out of the corner of his eye for a Sgt.[sergeant] who generally picks out the men who won't kick. When he finds them, they are sure goners. [paragraph] Not enough attention is given to the duty rooster to see that every man gets his share of duties, those that [underline] have [/underline] to be performed. It seems that every man with stripes or a man with bar thinks he owns the place and really does his stuff to show authority. It may be due to the fact that promotion in the Armored Forces is very slow and possibly entitles a noncom or Lt. to show his authority. I believe if the leaders of a platoon or/also the CO's would enter into the facts of the men's lives in the army, the show would go on a little better than it has. A leader can be hard but still be human. - As long as the leader himself does not have to do the work it is okay. - It may be taken that I am a little on the inferiority side but after all I'm a private and my opinions doesn't count. It's always TS to a private, nobody cares. As for the furloughs, it is a relief to get a pass or a furlough. Everyone of them is appreciated but the position I've been in, there are very few. Maybe a pass from 12:00 noon to 6:00 P.M. the next day but whatever it amounts to, we can't get over 35 miles away from the post. Never the chance to see the sights in a reasonable distance from camp.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: First of all I think they should at least keep their word when they say they would do something. This promising and then not doing it doesn't get very far in my nation. [paragraph] These despensary they have around in camps think that you could walk through
S64.Q97.C_1: the building and when you come out on the other side you would be well. [paragraph] There are some of these officers that don't deserve a first class private stripe but still they are giving orders. This seems to me like a bunch of nonsense. Get some officers to train men that know what they are doing.

S64.Q97.F: We have plenty of food but the cooks waste it and the mess sergeant is [underline] nuts [/underline] he is a theif [thief] and a [underline] JERK [/underline]
S64.Q97.C_1: There is somebody making a lot of money on us. At most camps fellows get all the milk they can drink. Colorado is a good dairy state, wheres our milk. In the morning for breakfast how about seconds on the food [unclear] we [/unclear] like. Why must we have to be dishonest to get enough to eat. The food is definitely lousy. We [unclear] are [/unclear] in the toughest school in the army we work side by side with officers who are getting 4 times the pay we are. We are unassigned, one of our Officers who is supposed to be in charge of us, is supposed to look out for our interests tells us, "You men are unassigned, you are the Bastards of the Air corps, we have our own men assigned to us, we can't look out for you."
S64.Q97.C_2: I work as hard as any man does on this field and I'm sick and tired, [deletion] I [/deletion] everytime I ask for a little more to eat, or for a uniform that fits or for issues I should have but have never gotten, to have sergeants tell me or officers tell me, The fellows over seas [deletion] [/deletion] haven't got it, why should you. We'll get across in plenty of time so until that time comes, how about [insertion] giving us [/insertion] some of the breaks those fellows got when they were in the states. Lets do away with [deletion] some [/deletion] [insertion] all [/insertion] of the 90 day wonders who don't know their asses from holes in the ground. Take the fellows from the ranks, they know what the score is. Put the fellows who should be in school back in [deletion] scholl [/deletion] school, they can do more good there, I could write pages but it won't do any good. [unclear] [/unclear] for this [unclear] [/unclear]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think each man upon completion of his training with due consideration towards his record should receive some kind of furlough or pass to entitle him to spend some time with his family before going overseas. That should apply to men who have good records and are deserving of this furlough. In some cases the morale of the ...
S64.Q97.C_1: is very low and if possible something should be done to boost it. More training in the use of arms. I think a lot of men are still too green after their basic training to be ready for combat. [paragraph]
S64.Q97.Full: I think each man upon completion of his training with due consideration towards his record should receive some kind of furlough or pass to entitle him to spend some time with his family before going overseas. That should apply to men who have good records and are deserving of this furlough. In some cases the morale of the ... is very low and if possible something should be done to boost it. More training in the use of arms. I think a lot of men are still too green after their basic training to be ready for combat. [paragraph]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I would like to be better oriented with world conditions than I now am. All my opinions on the war are ones carried over from civilian life as it is impossible as a trainee to gain more war information to formulate a new one. When entering the Armoured Force I was oriented with the conditions but now all I hear is rumors. I believe classes should be given on major current events. The Newsweek Map is generally 12 days old. When the Air
S64.Q97.C_1: Corps started bombing the Hydroelectric dams in Germany no one in my outfit even heard about it until 1 wk after it was released to the civilian population. [paragraph] I honesty believe most any civilian has more knowledge of world situations than I.
S64.Q97.Full: I would like to be better oriented with world conditions than I now am. All my opinions on the war are ones carried over from civilian life as it is impossible as a trainee to gain more war information to formulate a new one. When entering the Armoured Force I was oriented with the conditions but now all I hear is rumors. I believe classes should be given on major current events. The Newsweek Map is generally 12 days old. When the Air Corps started bombing the Hydroelectric dams in Germany no one in my outfit even heard about it until 1 wk after it was released to the civilian population. [paragraph] I honesty believe most any civilian has more knowledge of world situations than I.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I feel that the men in this camp should have more time to themselves, such as after duty hours off instead of practically a detail every nite so that they may write a few letters and some time for recreation. I think that the reason for so much A.W.O.L. is that the men do not have enough time for recreation or a little pleasure.
S64.Q97.C_1: Also the Army should watch venereal desease [disease] and prostitutes very carefully. [paragraph] The U.S. O. has very good shows for the men but usually only a very small percentage of the men have time to see these shows. [paragraph] There is a small percentage of men that are not putting their heart and soul into the fight and they, in turn, ruin it for the men that are trying. [paragraph] The men of 18 to 20 years of age, most generally do not have the sense of responsibility that is needed for the job they have to do. [paragraph] Due to the chain of command, orders are changed so much that the men are kept in a constant uproar trying to keep up with the orders that are changed so frequently.
S64.Q97.Full: I feel that the men in this camp should have more time to themselves, such as after duty hours off instead of practically a detail every nite so that they may write a few letters and some time for recreation. I think that the reason for so much A.W.O.L. is that the men do not have enough time for recreation or a little pleasure. Also the Army should watch venereal desease [disease] and prostitutes very carefully. [paragraph] The U.S. O. has very good shows for the men but usually only a very small percentage of the men have time to see these shows. [paragraph] There is a small percentage of men that are not putting their heart and soul into the fight and they, in turn, ruin it for the men that are trying. [paragraph] The men of 18 to 20 years of age, most generally do not have the sense of responsibility that is needed for the job they have to do. [paragraph] Due to the chain of command, orders are changed so much that the men are kept in a constant uproar trying to keep up with the orders that are changed so frequently.

S64.Q97.F: It is much to hard to get proper medical attention. We are [unclear] establishing [/unclear] "Hold Guide" to start with these past off as long opportunity. [paragraph] Men are getting put on jobs they do not like while others may be fighting for that same job. [paragraph] I believe we are pushed around to much. Some of us are honestly trying to live [unclear] my [/unclear] to Army suly and still we are treated to [unclear] annual [/unclear] like a fugitive, and that can't be trusted and must be watched.

S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: There is entirely to much time spent having inspections and preparing for inspections. As one recruit put it - ten weeks of inspections and three weeks of basic training! This lost time could be spent doing something much more constructive. The men at this particular post get [underline] very [/underline] [underline] little [/underline] free time. They should have at least one night free and every Sunday free. The ratings are very difficult to get in training camps. Line outfits [unclear] give [/unclear] higher grades or higher ratings to men who are not doing so much as the men obligated to train other men.

This lost time could be spent doing something much more constructive. The men at this particular post get [underline] very [/underline] [underline] little [/underline] free time. They should have at least one night free and every Sunday free. The ratings are very difficult to get in training camps. Line outfits [unclear] give [/unclear] higher grades or higher ratings to men who are not doing so much as the men obligated to train other men.

S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Well I have been in the Army for 6 month and I had no furlough. I would like to go home and see my family they miss me alfully lots. I live 2800 miles away from home. I must have at least 15 day furlough to go home and back to camp.
S64.Q97.Full: Well I have been in the Army for 6 month and I had no furlough. I would like to go home and see my family they miss me alfully lots. I live 2800 miles away from home. I must have at least 15 day furlough to go home and back to camp.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I feel that upon completion of basic training each soldier should be given a 2 week furlough plus traveling time and also before he goes overseas he should be given a furlough the same length of time. [paragraph] I also feel that if a soldier does not like the place he is in he should be given a transfer into what he likes as he would do better in something he likes.
S64.Q97.Full: I feel that upon completion of basic training each soldier should be given a 2 week furlough plus traveling time and also before he goes overseas he should be given a furlough the same length of time. [paragraph] I also feel that if a soldier does not like the place he is in he should be given a transfer into what he likes as he would do better in something he likes.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: We haven't had a furlough or a three day pass, and we were told that we would get both that sure does run down our Morale, furthermore in may never get one before we are sent across. [paragraph] that caused three boys
S64.Q97.C_1: to go AWOL, you can't blame the the boys.
S64.Q97.Full: We haven't had a furlough or a three day pass, and we were told that we would get both that sure does run down our Morale, furthermore in may never get one before we are sent across. [paragraph] that caused three boys to go AWOL, you can't blame the the boys.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: The furlough question above is sort of screwed up to my knowledge. We were first promised a 3 day leave after our first 8 weeks of training. That was cancelled and we were promised a furlough after one basic training and that was called off. We have also been promised several weekend passes and have not received them and it doesn't
S64.Q97.C_1: help a fellows [fellow's] morale to have promise after promise broken especially when it concerns a chance to see your folks once. None of us know exactly when we'll be called for real duty and we are all itching for a chance to get home once before we do go across. This is the worst part of the Army that I have in mind [insertion] and [/insertion] in the breaking of these promises. They talk about going AWOL and these are the things that causes most of it.
S64.Q97.Full: The furlough question above is sort of screwed up to my knowledge. We were first promised a 3 day leave after our first 8 weeks of training. That was cancelled and we were promised a furlough after one basic training and that was called off. We have also been promised several weekend passes and have not received them and it doesn't help a fellows [fellow's] morale to have promise after promise broken especially when it concerns a chance to see your folks once. None of us know exactly when we'll be called for real duty and we are all itching for a chance to get home once before we do go across. This is the worst part of the Army that I have in mind [insertion] and [/insertion] in the breaking of these promises. They talk about going AWOL and these are the things that causes most of it.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think men married before Pearl Harbor and with children should not be in the Army they should have a defense job and help production because there are a lot of single fellows left yet + men married without children.
S64.Q97.Full: I think men married before Pearl Harbor and with children should not be in the Army they should have a defense job and help production because there are a lot of single fellows left yet + men married without children.

S64.Q97.F: College students who volunteer through the enlisted reserves corps and were reclassify as limited service should return to college. They can help this country much more if they are given the opportunity to continue their education again.
S64.Q97.Full: College students who volunteer through the enlisted reserves corps and were reclassify as limited service should return to college. They can help this country much more if they are given the opportunity to continue their education again.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: (1) Most of these questions could be discussed at great length and are exceedingly interesting. The question in my mind is this - What good actually is this survey. Do you, as a governmental agency really find the tabulations of answers of any value? [paragraph] (2) With the supposition that you do find them of value, I think the effort of [underline] finding [/underline] [underline] out [/underline] directly from the ranks, is an excellent thing.
S64.Q97.C_1: I notice your emphasis on the post-war, or post victory actions of the US; also, on the American attitude toward the belligerents. These two factors are of greatest importance. The baffling problems confronting us are so complex, so involved, that it will take some super ingenuity never before seen in history to begin to correlate the diverse trends and forces which compose the problems. America must be the seat of this ingenuity - the guiding nation. She must hold the reins - until the other nations, belligerent and allied can act for themselves. To find [insertion] out [/insertion] the attitudes of the American people - to begin to form this ingenuity now (for it is not inborn) so that a peaceful world order can exist - to know how to gradually tear down the hate and lies thrown up by this century - is the hardest task ahead. I am grateful I had this opportunity to say these words.
S64.Q97.Full: (1) Most of these questions could be discussed at great length and are exceedingly interesting. The question in my mind is this - What good actually is this survey. Do you, as a governmental agency really find the tabulations of answers of any value? [paragraph] (2) With the supposition that you do find them of value, I think the effort of [underline] finding [/underline] [underline] out [/underline] directly from the ranks, is an excellent thing. I notice your emphasis on the post-war, or post victory actions of the US; also, on the American attitude toward the belligerents. These two factors are of greatest importance. The baffling problems confronting us are so complex, so involved, that it will take some super ingenuity never before seen in history to begin to correlate the diverse trends and forces which compose the problems. America must be the seat of this ingenuity - the guiding nation. She must hold the reins - until the other nations, belligerent and allied can act for themselves. To find [insertion] out [/insertion] the attitudes of the American people - to begin to form this ingenuity now (for it is not inborn) so that a peaceful world order can exist - to know how to gradually tear down the hate and lies thrown up by this century - is the hardest task ahead. I am grateful I had this opportunity to say these words.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Well in regards to the most important problem on our hands at the present time is the War. This should be gotten over with as soon as possible in order that we will be able to live under a free Country that is governed by the people and allow us to be united and not under the slavery laws of Germany or Japan. In order to accomplish this we must all do our very best part and crush the Axis & Japanese the sooner the
S64.Q97.C_1: better. However we must have the cooperation of not only the soldiers [deletion] [/deletion] for our Country, but also the Civilians back home, by sacrificing many things for our Country and fighting men such as food, clothing - [unclear] [/unclear] and equipment needed to win the War. At the present time I think we have a well [insertion] trained [/insertion] enough and large enough Army to win the war but the equipment is not quite enough up to standard, but if the war industries keep up the good work as they have been doing I think we will be able to end it by the end of 1945.
S64.Q97.Full: Well in regards to the most important problem on our hands at the present time is the War. This should be gotten over with as soon as possible in order that we will be able to live under a free Country that is governed by the people and allow us to be united and not under the slavery laws of Germany or Japan. In order to accomplish this we must all do our very best part and crush the Axis & Japanese the sooner the better. However we must have the cooperation of not only the soldiers [deletion] [/deletion] for our Country, but also the Civilians back home, by sacrificing many things for our Country and fighting men such as food, clothing - [unclear] [/unclear] and equipment needed to win the War. At the present time I think we have a well [insertion] trained [/insertion] enough and large enough Army to win the war but the equipment is not quite enough up to standard, but if the war industries keep up the good work as they have been doing I think we will be able to end it by the end of 1945.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: so far!
S64.Q97.F: As for one reason - there are two in the army. This puts Mother & Dad into a lot of worrying. Now the 3rd is expected to go - this will make the parents feel worsth [worse] . Because this is the first time we were separted [separated] , but being at a stake like this, I almost certain it is worth it under all cercumstances [circumstances] and I'll do the best I can. I even write home and tell my wife, she's
S64.Q97.C_1: get to be a good trooper to make me become a good fighting, high hoping soldier. [paragraph] I'm sure this is a good policy for all married soldiers to write to thier wifes. [paragraph] I think she is the one who helps a lot to have me to become a good soldier -- I only wish I can show you some of the letters I get, that put me into the spirit of becomming one!
S64.Q97.Full: As for one reason - there are two in the army. This puts Mother & Dad into a lot of worrying. Now the 3rd is expected to go - this will make the parents feel worsth [worse] . Because this is the first time we were separted [separated] , but being at a stake like this, I almost certain it is worth it under all cercumstances [circumstances] and I'll do the best I can. I even write home and tell my wife, she's get to be a good trooper to make me become a good fighting, high hoping soldier. [paragraph] I'm sure this is a good policy for all married soldiers to write to thier wifes. [paragraph] I think she is the one who helps a lot to have me to become a good soldier -- I only wish I can show you some of the letters I get, that put me into the spirit of becomming one!

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Instructors could be better acquainted with the subjects they teach. There are too many of them that are really not capable of doing the things they are trying to put across. A few of them are conscientious and know their job; it puts the whole outfit on the down hill drag.
S64.Q97.Full: Instructors could be better acquainted with the subjects they teach. There are too many of them that are really not capable of doing the things they are trying to put across. A few of them are conscientious and know their job; it puts the whole outfit on the down hill drag.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: The biggest and most important thing to a soldier is the furlough - that is promised to him and is never received. Furloughs are promised for a set date in the future and when that date arrives the furlough is then rejected. I honestly believe it is unfair to mislead soldiers that way. Also soldiers are mislead into enlisting with the
S64.Q97.C_1: agreement that they will be placed where they are best suited, but I for one can sincerely & honestly say that the classification dept. is very inefficient inconsiderate. I believe that 90% of the men I've met and am now with will say the same.
S64.Q97.Full: The biggest and most important thing to a soldier is the furlough - that is promised to him and is never received. Furloughs are promised for a set date in the future and when that date arrives the furlough is then rejected. I honestly believe it is unfair to mislead soldiers that way. Also soldiers are mislead into enlisting with the agreement that they will be placed where they are best suited, but I for one can sincerely & honestly say that the classification dept. is very inefficient inconsiderate. I believe that 90% of the men I've met and am now with will say the same.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I think the moral [morale] of a bona fide married man would be much better if he were allowed to go to his home once a month at least. While this might seem to often to the army the man would have something to look forward to during his training. I know I would feel much better toward the army, in fact at my age believe I could be more useful in war work outside of the army or at least have a job in
S64.Q97.C_1: the Army that was some easier because at my age as I can not take the training needed for a combat soldier like a younger man. [paragraph] I think men over 33 or 35 after several [deletion] [/deletion] [insertion] months [/insertion] of basic training could be put on a reserve list and allowed to return to war work if they had this kind of a job to return to.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the moral [morale] of a bona fide married man would be much better if he were allowed to go to his home once a month at least. While this might seem to often to the army the man would have something to look forward to during his training. I know I would feel much better toward the army, in fact at my age believe I could be more useful in war work outside of the army or at least have a job in  the Army that was some easier because at my age as I can not take the training needed for a combat soldier like a younger man. [paragraph] I think men over 33 or 35 after several [deletion] [/deletion] [insertion] months [/insertion] of basic training could be put on a reserve list and allowed to return to war work if they had this kind of a job to return to.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M_marginalia: Things are a lot better if I could be home.
S64.Q97.F: When will a farm Boy get to go home to his farm work again. Were he can help to win the war by rising more food for his fellow man. All farm Boy should be let out of the army to go home and farm again. [unclear] [/unclear] so far the countries got to have food to eat for their is not [unclear] any [/unclear] farm boy out to do farming
S64.Q97.C_1: any more. I worked on a dairy farm and I was draft in the army. I would go home to work on a farm if I was given a chance to go home again for a farm is very important to have and they got to have men to work on farm. I wish I could get a Section 8 [mentally unfit for service discharge] to go back home again to work for it is more my line of work. I have [unclear] [/unclear] for all of life

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I find no fault with the army in either training, equipment or its treatment of the soldier. The main fault, as I see it, seems to be in placing men in jobs for which they are best [unclear] suited [/unclear] . I have seen innumerable instances of trained men being placed in jobs calling for entirely new training while other men likewise without training being given jobs which call for the type of training which the first man possessed. I know, for example, of an experienced butcher, who is now a gun instructor, while my own butcher has inexperienced cooks who need much training which calls for valuable time and money.
S64.Q97.C_1: I am an accountant experienced on payrolls, taxes and Insurance and also personnel work. I have no hopes of doing this work for the army and yet many men having none of this experience are trained to do this work. _This is a specialized work calling for trained personnel. It would seem apparent that with large numbers of trained men coming into the Armed Forces certain jobs could be filled by these men, rather than by consuming valuable time (which is of the essence in our present emergency) and much of the taxpayers money in training others to do the same thing.
S64.Q97.Full: I find no fault with the army in either training, equipment or its treatment of the soldier. The main fault, as I see it, seems to be in placing men in jobs for which they are best [unclear] suited [/unclear] . I have seen innumerable instances of trained men being placed in jobs calling for entirely new training while other men likewise without training being given jobs which call for the type of training which the first man possessed. I know, for example, of an experienced butcher, who is now a gun instructor, while my own butcher has inexperienced cooks who need much training which calls for valuable time and money. I am an accountant experienced on payrolls, taxes and Insurance and also personnel work. I have no hopes of doing this work for the army and yet many men having none of this experience are trained to do this work. _This is a specialized work calling for trained personnel. It would seem apparent that with large numbers of trained men coming into the Armed Forces certain jobs could be filled by these men, rather than by consuming valuable time (which is of the essence in our present emergency) and much of the taxpayers money in training others to do the same thing.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Well when we came here we were supposed to get a three day pass about a week before the pass General Scott said passes were canceled and we would get a furlough[,] now they say we can't have either as long as we're here. I wish the hell they'd make up they're [sic] mind and not make so many promises that they know they are not able to keep.
S64.Q97.Full: Well when we came here we were supposed to get a three day pass about a week before the pass General Scott said passes were canceled and we would get a furlough[,] now they say we can't have either as long as we're here. I wish the hell they'd make up they're [sic] mind and not make so many promises that they know they are not able to keep.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: I haven't been in long enough for furlough but do get week-end passes.
S64.Q97.F: One of useless things I see in the Army is hurring and then after you get to where you hurried to, you must wait. It does not seem that there is not enough co-operation in Army.
S64.Q97.Full: One of useless things I see in the Army is hurring and then after you get to where you hurried to, you must wait. It does not seem that there is not enough co-operation in Army.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Only thing I can say is that we dont get enough time off from duty.
S64.Q97.Full: Only thing I can say is that we dont get enough time off from duty.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Exactly 3 months ago I handed my application in for transfer to the Air Corps. So far nothing has been done at all to give me any hope of transfer. I have had 3_ years in college including 20 hours of Mathematics. I am physically fit and feel that I should at least get a chance to take my Air Corps test. My sole ambition is to become a Navigator in the Air Corps. I am very well based in Mathematics of all kinds and I feel that talent which I have should
S64.Q97.C_1: not be wasted in driving tanks or being part of an [unclear] Armored [/unclear] infantry.
S64.Q97.Full: Exactly 3 months ago I handed my application in for transfer to the Air Corps. So far nothing has been done at all to give me any hope of transfer. I have had 3_ years in college including 20 hours of Mathematics. I am physically fit and feel that I should at least get a chance to take my Air Corps test. My sole ambition is to become a Navigator in the Air Corps. I am very well based in Mathematics of all kinds and I feel that talent which I have should not be wasted in driving tanks or being part of an [unclear] Armored [/unclear] infantry.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: This is one thing that bothers me quite a bit. Several times I have noticed that the men who get promotions are the ones who the officers like the best or who have a better time than the next guy. I am a very firm believer in giving the guy that deserves the advancement the advancement. Sometimes the guys who don't talk so much are the one's who know the most. I [paragraph]
S64.Q97.C_1: would rather see a man stay a buck private all his life than advance by [insertion] suction [/insertion] with officers. It will be harder on them in the long run since when they go across they may not be capable of holding down their positions and may cause them to lose their lives beside their own.
S64.Q97.Full: This is one thing that bothers me quite a bit. Several times I have noticed that the men who get promotions are the ones who the officers like the best or who have a better time than the next guy. I am a very firm believer in giving the guy that deserves the advancement the advancement. Sometimes the guys who don't talk so much are the one's who know the most. I [paragraph]  would rather see a man stay a buck private all his life than advance by [insertion] suction [/insertion] with officers. It will be harder on them in the long run since when they go across they may not be capable of holding down their positions and may cause them to lose their lives beside their own.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I don't think the classification office in the Army does all in its power to put the right man in the right job.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't think the classification office in the Army does all in its power to put the right man in the right job.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: 97. If you have any further remarks you would like to make on any subject please write them below as fully as you like. War is a killing game we must win. to win we must hold the aces. equipment training, physical strength and the will to win. Every soldier should realize this fact and get on the ball. The civilians too should do their best. We can fight a war half heartedlly([unclear] heartedly[unclear] ) and expect to win. ([Paragraph] ) I like this outfit that I'm
S64.Q97.C_1: in but I was rather disappointed that I didn't get into the med. corps because I plan on becoming a doctor. Before I came into the army I was a [unclear] [/unclear] med. student.
S64.Q97.Full: 97. If you have any further remarks you would like to make on any subject please write them below as fully as you like. War is a killing game we must win. to win we must hold the aces. equipment training, physical strength and the will to win. Every soldier should realize this fact and get on the ball. The civilians too should do their best. We can fight a war half heartedlly([unclear] heartedly[unclear] ) and expect to win. ([Paragraph] ) I like this outfit that I'm in but I was rather disappointed that I didn't get into the med. corps because I plan on becoming a doctor. Before I came into the army I was a [unclear] [/unclear] med. student.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I don't believe that an experienced mechanic in a shipyard or important defense plants is more valuable to the army than the plant or war effort. I've seen a lot of men get killed in shipyards. I believe he's taken more risk than at lot of soldiers I've seen.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't believe that an experienced mechanic in a shipyard or important defense plants is more valuable to the army than the plant or war effort. I've seen a lot of men get killed in shipyards. I believe he's taken more risk than at lot of soldiers I've seen.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page, A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Before entering the Army, I was assured I would be assigned to duty where my education and business experience would be most fully utilized, thus making me most valuable to the war effort. So far, however, this has not been the case. Although my physical condition is fair, I feel that my age is considerably against me in combat duty. Have noticed this in all phases of training in comparison
S64.Q97.C_1: with most of the other men, who are generally 10 years younger on the average. They have responded far better physically to training than I have. However, have been promised reclassification soon, so expect I shall eventually find the spot where I can be of most help which I fully realize must take time [paragraph]
S64.Q97.C_2: #32 - Although I believe the Armored Command is one of the very best outfits to belong to, but you can't make a horse drink just because he followed you to the trough. #33 - If I could achieve the goal I am not shooting for, I would do what ever offered me opportunity, both financially and otherwise. #37 - I have for as long as I can remember been held back from doing the things I wanted to do. [underlined] I hope and pray that this isn't one of those times [/underlined] #64- All of the conquered people will need plenty of postwar help in building up their countries moral [morale] as well as their broken spirit.
S64.Q97.Full: Before entering the Army, I was assured I would be assigned to duty where my education and business experience would be most fully utilized, thus making me most valuable to the war effort. So far, however, this has not been the case. Although my physical condition is fair, I feel that my age is considerably against me in combat duty. Have noticed this in all phases of training in comparison with most of the other men, who are generally 10 years younger on the average. They have responded far better physically to training than I have. However, have been promised reclassification soon, so expect I shall eventually find the spot where I can be of most help which I fully realize must take time [paragraph]  #32 - Although I believe the Armored Command is one of the very best outfits to belong to, but you can't make a horse drink just because he followed you to the trough. #33 - If I could achieve the goal I am not shooting for, I would do what ever offered me opportunity, both financially and otherwise. #37 - I have for as long as I can remember been held back from doing the things I wanted to do. [underlined] I hope and pray that this isn't one of those times [/underlined] #64- All of the conquered people will need plenty of postwar help in building up their countries moral [morale] as well as their broken spirit.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: It seems to me, & all the fellows agree, that the army should issue a better mess kit. These ones we have corrode very easily & can't be properly cleaned afterward. One of the fellows left his mess kit in water while he ran to chow and when he got back it had little spots of corrosion that no amount of rubbing would remove. Could a mess kit be made of plastic or stainless steel or some substance than can be kept clean? I honestly believe that a lot of sickness could be avoided if the soldier had a better mess kit.
S64.Q97.Full: It seems to me, & all the fellows agree, that the army should issue a better mess kit. These ones we have corrode very easily & can't be properly cleaned afterward. One of the fellows left his mess kit in water while he ran to chow and when he got back it had little spots of corrosion that no amount of rubbing would remove. Could a mess kit be made of plastic or stainless steel or some substance than can be kept clean? I honestly believe that a lot of sickness could be avoided if the soldier had a better mess kit.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: This war is not going to be won easily. It will take time and great effort. The Germans had a great advantage, but they are gradually slipping. The Germans are fighters, but the Japanese are tricky rats. They would do anything and everything imaginable. At the present I am not any too happy over my army job. Perhaps this is because I am going through my basic training. This is always the hardest on a persons feelings. Too, I am
S64.Q97.C_1: not very much interested in the armored force. The camp here at Ft. Knox is swell and the officers are fine. My thoughts are higher, up into the sky. I see a great future for aviation and am now waiting to be transferred to the Army Air Corps. I hope to make good there. [paragraph] As you could tell I am only eighteen years of age. I have completed one year of college work, but I feel that my schooling is not doing me much good. I don't feel that I have enough to go into the Army Specialized Training. I want to finish school when the war is over and take up chemical or civil engineering. Sometimes I feel that my army life is a flop. Maybe the best is yet to come. [paragraph] This war is a lot different than the last. It is run more efficient and is being more effective.
S64.Q97.Full: This war is not going to be won easily. It will take time and great effort. The Germans had a great advantage, but they are gradually slipping. The Germans are fighters, but the Japanese are tricky rats. They would do anything and everything imaginable. At the present I am not any too happy over my army job. Perhaps this is because I am going through my basic training. This is always the hardest on a persons feelings. Too, I am not very much interested in the armored force. The camp here at Ft. Knox is swell and the officers are fine. My thoughts are higher, up into the sky. I see a great future for aviation and am now waiting to be transferred to the Army Air Corps. I hope to make good there. [paragraph] As you could tell I am only eighteen years of age. I have completed one year of college work, but I feel that my schooling is not doing me much good. I don't feel that I have enough to go into the Army Specialized Training. I want to finish school when the war is over and take up chemical or civil engineering. Sometimes I feel that my army life is a flop. Maybe the best is yet to come. [paragraph] This war is a lot different than the last. It is run more efficient and is being more effective.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: (96) In a financial way yes. But it played hell with some young peoples futures. But that is what I am fighting for.
S64.Q97.Full: (96) In a financial way yes. But it played hell with some young peoples futures. But that is what I am fighting for.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I feel that our eats could amount to more than they have in the past. I have heard lots of the men "beefing" on the lack of "chow." [paragraph] Also I feel that some of the men that are qualified for advancement aren't getting what they deserve.[paragraph] I feel that there is quite a lot of favorism [favoritism] in the army, by noncoms [non-commissioned officers] to some trainees that they are well acquainted with.
S64.Q97.C_1: I feel that the time that we have to ourselves is too little. I feel that our transportation to town during week ends could be better. What we have is hardly sufficient. If a soldier was offered a furlough say every 3 months he would feel more like doing his work [deletion] more [/deletion] better.
S64.Q97.Full: I feel that our eats could amount to more than they have in the past. I have heard lots of the men "beefing" on the lack of "chow." [paragraph] Also I feel that some of the men that are qualified for advancement aren't getting what they deserve.[paragraph] I feel that there is quite a lot of favorism [favoritism] in the army, by noncoms [non-commissioned officers] to some trainees that they are well acquainted with.  I feel that the time that we have to ourselves is too little. I feel that our transportation to town during week ends could be better. What we have is hardly sufficient. If a soldier was offered a furlough say every 3 months he would feel more like doing his work [deletion] more [/deletion] better.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I know there is little time to train a man, but if he had more time he would get a lot more out of it. He would be a better soldier when a man is rushed all of the time he will never take an interest in it. [paragraph] The money I am getting for my wife and child sure make things hard on them. I had to leave them and what in the hell did they get.
S64.Q97.Full: I know there is little time to train a man, but if he had more time he would get a lot more out of it. He would be a better soldier when a man is rushed all of the time he will never take an interest in it. [paragraph] The money I am getting for my wife and child sure make things hard on them. I had to leave them and what in the hell did they get.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: This remark is not on the army side. But like in our family there is just my mother and two sisters and two brothers beside me and I don't think it was right for all three of us to get drafted, cause at home some difficulties would come up that a woman couldn't do. And that's why I think that a man is needed where there is no father to take care of the women.
S64.Q97.Full: This remark is not on the army side. But like in our family there is just my mother and two sisters and two brothers beside me and I don't think it was right for all three of us to get drafted, cause at home some difficulties would come up that a woman couldn't do. And that's why I think that a man is needed where there is no father to take care of the women.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I think that to many subjects are taught for the time given. Either more time should be given each subject or fewer subjects should be taught. I also think that more battle training should be given during the basic training period.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that to many subjects are taught for the time given. Either more time should be given each subject or fewer subjects should be taught. I also think that more battle training should be given during the basic training period.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I think a soldier should be given a furlough after about 2 months, of 4 days at the last. He also should have a little more free time.
S64.Q97.Full: I think a soldier should be given a furlough after about 2 months, of 4 days at the last. He also should have a little more free time.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: should get a furlough at the end of or training and at the end of or 6 months.
S64.Q97.Full: should get a furlough at the end of or training and at the end of or 6 months.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think the boys in the armed forces go overseas too soon, most of them go over right after basic training. They are not skilled enough to meet experienced soldiers. Also I think everyone should have a fair chance, instead
S64.Q97.C_1: of just the ones who suck around. They are the ones who mostly get what they want. Most everyone should get some sort of schooling, so that when they come out of the army they would have a chance in the world. [paragraph] Younger boys who haven't been away from home untill they came into the army should get more furloughs.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the boys in the armed forces go overseas too soon, most of them go over right after basic training. They are not skilled enough to meet experienced soldiers. Also I think everyone should have a fair chance, instead  of just the ones who suck around. They are the ones who mostly get what they want. Most everyone should get some sort of schooling, so that when they come out of the army they would have a chance in the world. [paragraph] Younger boys who haven't been away from home untill they came into the army should get more furloughs.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: This organization is quite adept at promising things to and for the men - such as passes and furloughs - and then, when the time for granting them comes, they reject the offer. THis was constantly done during our basic training. THis organization, too, seldom
S64.Q97.C_1: Lets the men know what their next move will be - what the next day's training will be, etc - in non tactical situations I can see no reason for such secrecy. I object to classes run by profane instructors - not from the moral standpoint but instructors of that type usually aren't familiar enough with all parts of their subjects. The instructors here often answer the question "why" with a "because I say so" The question "why" is by far the most important - they should treat it as such. I am no moron - and don't like to be instructed as one. Better instructors is the greatest need of this org. Officers and non-coms, here, are too quick tempered with trainees. Their profanity is emphactic [emphatic] - but is [it] ruins moral, hence ruining effciency [efficiency] .
S64.Q97.Full: This organization is quite adept at promising things to and for the men - such as passes and furloughs - and then, when the time for granting them comes, they reject the offer. THis was constantly done during our basic training. THis organization, too, seldom Lets the men know what their next move will be - what the next day's training will be, etc - in non tactical situations I can see no reason for such secrecy. I object to classes run by profane instructors - not from the moral standpoint but instructors of that type usually aren't familiar enough with all parts of their subjects. The instructors here often answer the question "why" with a "because I say so" The question "why" is by far the most important - they should treat it as such. I am no moron - and don't like to be instructed as one. Better instructors is the greatest need of this org. Officers and non-coms, here, are too quick tempered with trainees. Their profanity is emphactic [emphatic] - but is [it] ruins moral, hence ruining effciency [efficiency] .

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)

S64.Q95.M_marginalia: Yes, I have had my fair share of passes
S64.Q97.F: The jobs back home have improved very much but the Rationed on food have cut them quite a lot.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I am a married man and cannot keep my mind in two places at the same time, that is home and here at camp. I would much rather be home with my wife, and doing war work. A soldier has to be alert at all times, and with his mind scatter he cannot be a good soldier. I think the army should keep all married men out of combat service.
S64.Q97.Full: I am a married man and cannot keep my mind in two places at the same time, that is home and here at camp. I would much rather be home with my wife, and doing war work. A soldier has to be alert at all times, and with his mind scatter he cannot be a good soldier. I think the army should keep all married men out of combat service.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Other/No answer
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: 10) We get passes to go short distances but the towns we can go to are full of a lot of no good women.
S64.Q97.F: Passes. I think that passes should be given in the morning and that we should be allowed to go a little farther than we are now allowed. We should have a little fun in week ends because that's the only time we have off. [paragraph] Food. We do not get all the food
S64.Q97.C_1: we should get. We have to get up from the table hungry more than half the time. [paragraph] The Sergeant lets men that work in the camp eat in the mess hall and they pay him. That is food that should be for us. We march and work all day and we can't live on water. [underline] When [/underline] we have time off most of the boys go buy their meals or they would starve. [paragraph] The time we get off here is very little. We get to bed late and up early and we can't stand much of that. All they tell us is come on you big sisies can't you take it? They also call us dirty names that are pretty hard to take concerning your mother and dad back home. I think something should be done about it. Fort Know, Ky.
S64.Q97.Full: Passes. I think that passes should be given in the morning and that we should be allowed to go a little farther than we are now allowed. We should have a little fun in week ends because that's the only time we have off. [paragraph] Food. We do not get all the food  we should get. We have to get up from the table hungry more than half the time. [paragraph] The Sergeant lets men that work in the camp eat in the mess hall and they pay him. That is food that should be for us. We march and work all day and we can't live on water. [underline] When [/underline] we have time off most of the boys go buy their meals or they would starve. [paragraph] The time we get off here is very little. We get to bed late and up early and we can't stand much of that. All they tell us is come on you big sisies can't you take it? They also call us dirty names that are pretty hard to take concerning your mother and dad back home. I think something should be done about it. Fort Know, Ky.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: [Answer 6 had been X'd but has been erased]
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: My particular opinion of the Army in general seems to be that the Army is a place of rushing into a thing. By that I mean getting into condition without giving you the chance to. We don't get enough food to eat. We don't get the proper sleep. Now I played sports all of 'em, and plenty of 'em. To me conditioning is the same even in the army. Yes we drilled to beat all hell hour after. [underline] But [/underline] after all [insertion] the [/insertion] hard
S64.Q97.C_1: work was over. We ate a good meal and was able to get in some sleep at least 7 hrs anyway. That's my only objection to the U S Army. At present anyway.
S64.Q97.Full: My particular opinion of the Army in general seems to be that the Army is a place of rushing into a thing. By that I mean getting into condition without giving you the chance to. We don't get enough food to eat. We don't get the proper sleep. Now I played sports all of 'em, and plenty of 'em. To me conditioning is the same even in the army. Yes we drilled to beat all hell hour after. [underline] But [/underline] after all [insertion] the [/insertion] hard work was over. We ate a good meal and was able to get in some sleep at least 7 hrs anyway. That's my only objection to the U S Army. At present anyway.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: All I say that I hope we win this war and give a good surprise to the Jap Germany and put them under our feet and treat them like they been treating our soldiers that they been captured but we will be pretty soon over the and then it will be over
S64.Q97.C_1: time to fix them and show them not to be going against U.S. and to take Hitlers [unclear] mostly [/unclear] of by land.
S64.Q97.Full: All I say that I hope we win this war and give a good surprise to the Jap Germany and put them under our feet and treat them like they been treating our soldiers that they been captured but we will be pretty soon over the and then it will be over time to fix them and show them not to be going against U.S. and to take Hitlers [unclear] mostly [/unclear] of by land.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I don't think they should promise us furloughs or passes, and when the time comes to issue them, not give us any. We have had two occasions like that and all of our company felt it for weeks.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't think they should promise us furloughs or passes, and when the time comes to issue them, not give us any. We have had two occasions like that and all of our company felt it for weeks.

S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: In my company in the replacement center there are to many corporals as acting platoons Sats. I believe if a soldier has the responsibilities he should also have the rank or grade. Also the required amount of time off or furloughs is one year. Trainees be given their week-ends off instead of confinement in order to keep up their morale.
S64.Q97.Full: In my company in the replacement center there are to many corporals as acting platoons Sats. I believe if a soldier has the responsibilities he should also have the rank or grade. Also the required amount of time off or furloughs is one year. Trainees be given their week-ends off instead of confinement in order to keep up their morale.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Some of my answers are a bit "goofy" I admit - but my platoon is composed of 1/2 college men - some cooperate & some are out only for themselves. I had college R.O.T.C. [Reserve Officers Training Corps] & I'm eligible & have passed the A.S.T.P. [Army Specialized Training Program] Field Examining Board, but as yet I don't know what is going to happen to me!! Although I feel I could do equally well in any branch of the Army, I would like to get settled, preferably in the Air Corps. I like to know what
S64.Q97.C_1: goal post I'm headed for, and not wander around on the 50 yd. line. [paragraph] If I knew what I [deletion] f [/deletion] was going to do in the future, in the Army of course, I certainly would be much happier.
S64.Q97.Full: Some of my answers are a bit "goofy" I admit - but my platoon is composed of 1/2 college men - some cooperate & some are out only for themselves. I had college R.O.T.C. [Reserve Officers Training Corps] & I'm eligible & have passed the A.S.T.P. [Army Specialized Training Program] Field Examining Board, but as yet I don't know what is going to happen to me!! Although I feel I could do equally well in any branch of the Army, I would like to get settled, preferably in the Air Corps. I like to know what goal post I'm headed for, and not wander around on the 50 yd. line. [paragraph] If I knew what I [deletion] f [/deletion] was going to do in the future, in the Army of course, I certainly would be much happier.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Why not have the situation regarding the drafting of fathers made clear and truthfull to all people in our country. Fathers have been drafted and constitute a large part of our army, yet newspapers daily carry front page articles on the delay of drafting fathers untill Sept. or Nov. of 1943. I think a well informed people is more beneficial to a country at all times than a misinformed people.
S64.Q97.Full: Why not have the situation regarding the drafting of fathers made clear and truthfull to all people in our country. Fathers have been drafted and constitute a large part of our army, yet newspapers daily carry front page articles on the delay of drafting fathers untill Sept. or Nov. of 1943. I think a well informed people is more beneficial to a country at all times than a misinformed people.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Sometimes the food is good but most of the time it is very poor & not enough of it. The noncoms [non-commissioned officers] here don't know what is going on most of the time, about all most of them know is how to swear & blow a whistle. They are trying to teach us something that they cant do themselves, they get it out of a book. I have never seen a 2-6-8 radar [SCR-268, the Army's first radar system] in operation & I ...
S64.Q97.C_1: am beginning to think that they can't put [unclear] op [/unclear] in operation, there is always something wrong with something + they never know what to do to overcome it, they read out of a book but they can't fix it. Personaly I think that all of us can get more out of actual experience than out of a book. The noncoms tell us to do things one way today + tomorrow they change their minds + say that we should do it some other way.
S64.Q97.Full: Sometimes the food is good but most of the time it is very poor & not enough of it. The noncoms [non-commissioned officers] here don't know what is going on most of the time, about all most of them know is how to swear & blow a whistle. They are trying to teach us something that they cant do themselves, they get it out of a book. I have never seen a 2-6-8 radar [SCR-268, the Army's first radar system] in operation & I ...  am beginning to think that they can't put [unclear] op [/unclear] in operation, there is always something wrong with something + they never know what to do to overcome it, they read out of a book but they can't fix it. Personaly I think that all of us can get more out of actual experience than out of a book. The noncoms tell us to do things one way today + tomorrow they change their minds + say that we should do it some other way.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs [deletion] or passes [/deletion]
S64.Q97.F: [paragraph] When I came into the Army, I was told I would be given a furlough every six months to go home for a few days, but it seems to have been forgotten. [/paragraph] [paragraph] The Army expects the men to work hard and to do their best, but they seem to forget the promises that were made. [/paragraph] [paragraph] Our Colonel gave us six day furlough but about one out of every
S64.Q97.C_1: fifty could go home. He don't seem to care because he can every week end, as he lives about 150 mines away. [paragraph] The morale is plenty bad in my outfit and the Colonel makes it worse. he said he wants every man to hate his guts and they sure do. [paragraph] . The ratings are given to the men that kiss the officers [underline] ass [/underline] and not to the men that do the work. [paragraph] Any statements I have made will be to to anyone in person by myself at any time. [paragraph] If furloughs aren't given to the men soon there will be plenty of AWOL's [absent without leave] and I will be one of them. [paragraph] If the age of any Colonel was really known he would be home in a chair reading a news paper instead of being a Colonel. I could write for a week on this topic. [marginalia] Our Major didn't know what a bar of G.I. soap was until the cook told the other day. I guess he is considered an officer but not in the mens opinion. [/marginalia]
S64.Q97.Full: [paragraph] When I came into the Army, I was told I would be given a furlough every six months to go home for a few days, but it seems to have been forgotten. [/paragraph] [paragraph] The Army expects the men to work hard and to do their best, but they seem to forget the promises that were made. [/paragraph] [paragraph] Our Colonel gave us six day furlough but about one out of every  fifty could go home. He don't seem to care because he can every week end, as he lives about 150 mines away. [paragraph] The morale is plenty bad in my outfit and the Colonel makes it worse. he said he wants every man to hate his guts and they sure do. [paragraph] . The ratings are given to the men that kiss the officers [underline] ass [/underline] and not to the men that do the work. [paragraph] Any statements I have made will be to to anyone in person by myself at any time. [paragraph] If furloughs aren't given to the men soon there will be plenty of AWOL's [absent without leave] and I will be one of them. [paragraph] If the age of any Colonel was really known he would be home in a chair reading a news paper instead of being a Colonel. I could write for a week on this topic. [marginalia] Our Major didn't know what a bar of G.I. soap was until the cook told the other day. I guess he is considered an officer but not in the mens opinion. [/marginalia]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: In relation to question [unclear] 26 [/unclear] + 90. In the position which I now hold in the army I am doing less toward winning the war than if I still were a civilian in my old job. But if I were put in a position, that I could do something that I know how to do, as a soldier. I would be doing more toward winning the war. [paragraph] If I ask why we do things they either won't say or don't know.
S64.Q97.C_1: How do you think a fellow feels when he is offered a 7 day furlough so that he can travel 3000 miles, visit his family & get back with out being awol. That is what they expect us to do. What a hell of an army.
S64.Q97.Full: In relation to question [unclear] 26 [/unclear] + 90. In the position which I now hold in the army I am doing less toward winning the war than if I still were a civilian in my old job. But if I were put in a position, that I could do something that I know how to do, as a soldier. I would be doing more toward winning the war. [paragraph] If I ask why we do things they either won't say or don't know. How do you think a fellow feels when he is offered a 7 day furlough so that he can travel 3000 miles, visit his family & get back with out being awol. That is what they expect us to do. What a hell of an army.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: There is one thing I don't like about the Air Corps, we keep moving too much.
S64.Q97.Full: There is one thing I don't like about the Air Corps, we keep moving too much.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page

S64.Q97.C_1: your spare time in which you might do something worthwhile or educational. [paragraph] Have more entertainment for soldiers of the Mid West and Central Western States.

[paragraph] Have more entertainment for soldiers of the Mid West and Central Western States.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think that the commanding officers of various organizations should take an interest in seeing that personell that haven't had a furlough and if the applicant is eligible for a furlough, that he should be allowed to visit his friends and family providing the conditions allow. Such as men waiting to attend schools, released from hospitals and awaiting recovery
S64.Q97.C_1: and etc. I think it would be a booster for the Army.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that the commanding officers of various organizations should take an interest in seeing that personell that haven't had a furlough and if the applicant is eligible for a furlough, that he should be allowed to visit his friends and family providing the conditions allow. Such as men waiting to attend schools, released from hospitals and awaiting recovery and etc. I think it would be a booster for the Army.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I came into the Army in 1940, was overseas for two and one half years. I was on the line for this time working on places. The hours we work here are to many no man doe his best working long hours, with about two hours, to write, wash and clean his things. There are to many people doing nothing while the have me work long hours do two mens work to keep ships in the air, and fly 4 hours as Eng. The men are here but not at the right places were they could do some good.
S64.Q97.C_1: I know my work, but being only a s/sgt. [staff sergeant] I take order from men that ask me what I would do. But thats the Army, and I love it at times.
S64.Q97.Full: I came into the Army in 1940, was overseas for two and one half years. I was on the line for this time working on places. The hours we work here are to many no man doe his best working long hours, with about two hours, to write, wash and clean his things. There are to many people doing nothing while the have me work long hours do two mens work to keep ships in the air, and fly 4 hours as Eng. The men are here but not at the right places were they could do some good.  I know my work, but being only a s/sgt. [staff sergeant] I take order from men that ask me what I would do. But thats the Army, and I love it at times.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: Have never enjoyed a furlough - damn it.
S64.Q97.F: To begin with I'm not a chronic fault-finder I endeavor to give any situation a cold-blooded, unbiased scrutiny before arriving at a decision or passing an opinion. [paragraph] I realize that governmental inefficiency, red tape, + waste has always been great, + is becoming increasingly so, [underline] by leaps + bounds [/underline] . Apparently noone knows what to do about that (except possibly to
S64.Q97.C_1: Vote in the Republicans -- compare the records ! However its obvious that there is a stupendous amount of manpower [underline] mal [/underline] -- distribution [distributed] , with a large part coming into the army That would seem to me to make it possible to eliminate or at least alleviate the one petty grievance I have pertaining to my "work" in the Army. That is, the 12 hour stift [shift] . It should because it easily could, be reduced to 8 hours, which has been shown to be a more efficient way of expending labor Conditions outside give every indication that 3 shifts of 8 hours each are more productive, more fruitful, than 2 stretches of 12 hours each. So, why doesn't the army wise up -- we're doing as important a job as the private firm, now, and should do it in as an efficient a way as is possible. [paragraph] If you've read this far, please realize that I've purposely given wholly ( insofar as is humanly possible) unbiased answers slightly on the pessimistic side. And allow therefore,
