document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: About furloughs - they should be made uniform. Some fellows get them all, while others get none. Why should we fellows trained [unclear] [/unclear] in the A.F. be deprived of them. While some fellow with an I.Q. of about 50 is home all the time. We should get the furloughs not them. Also why put fellows from the east out in a desert some where (West). While they send boys who are adapted to this type of life to the big cities. I know its hurt my
S64.Q97.C_1: moral considerability and my buddies too. We feel a great injustice is being done. I know my saying this wont do any good, for this folder is just like anything else in the Army, just a racket, to give some bunk-head, a Tech in Master Sgt. Rting. I';m a true American and wouldn't give up my place in a combat crew for anything. But still ([underline] a fact is a fact. [/underline] )
S64.Q97.Full: About furloughs - they should be made uniform. Some fellows get them all, while others get none. Why should we fellows trained [unclear] [/unclear] in the A.F. be deprived of them. While some fellow with an I.Q. of about 50 is home all the time. We should get the furloughs not them. Also why put fellows from the east out in a desert some where (West). While they send boys who are adapted to this type of life to the big cities. I know its hurt my  moral considerability and my buddies too. We feel a great injustice is being done. I know my saying this wont do any good, for this folder is just like anything else in the Army, just a racket, to give some bunk-head, a Tech in Master Sgt. Rting. I';m a true American and wouldn't give up my place in a combat crew for anything. But still ([underline] a fact is a fact. [/underline] )

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I think that the U.S. is carrying too many burdens in waging the war. It isn't up to us to run the world. Even though we are not a [unclear] dictaship [/unclear] , we may appear such to other countries. I know I don't like anyone else to attempt to tune my affairs. Then too, I think, we have veered away from some of the so-called fundamentals we are to be fighting for. Really, we
S64.Q97.C_1: adopted many policies used by dictatorships. Let's hope they are good and essential. There also is two [too] much policies in the Army. The fellow who gets the promotions isn't always the man who is best qualified. Too much pulling the finger going on. These should be tests given to determine the right person for a promotion - similar to the Navy's policies of rating men. All in all, I think the Army is doing a good job. It is such a tremendous business, that it is difficult to keep some [unclear] disreferencies [/unclear] out. Thank you
S64.Q97.Full: I think that the U.S. is carrying too many burdens in waging the war. It isn't up to us to run the world. Even though we are not a [unclear] dictaship [/unclear] , we may appear such to other countries. I know I don't like anyone else to attempt to tune my affairs. Then too, I think, we have veered away from some of the so-called fundamentals we are to be fighting for. Really, we  adopted many policies used by dictatorships. Let's hope they are good and essential. There also is two [too] much policies in the Army. The fellow who gets the promotions isn't always the man who is best qualified. Too much pulling the finger going on. These should be tests given to determine the right person for a promotion - similar to the Navy's policies of rating men. All in all, I think the Army is doing a good job. It is such a tremendous business, that it is difficult to keep some [unclear] disreferencies [/unclear] out. Thank you

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I am in the Air Force and I have been through technical schools. I am now working on the line. We are instructed to take a good bit of our work to the sub depots. I think we should be taught to do a lot of this work ourselves because when we get overseas we may not have anyone to do the work for us and we will not have the experience that is needed.
S64.Q97.Full: I am in the Air Force and I have been through technical schools. I am now working on the line. We are instructed to take a good bit of our work to the sub depots. I think we should be taught to do a lot of this work ourselves because when we get overseas we may not have anyone to do the work for us and we will not have the experience that is needed.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think the men who are running the Army don't know what they are doing. They are always thinking of something new and 2 days later they change their minds. As far as recreational & entertainment facilities they are okay. The fellows really enjoy the U.S.O. camp shows. The Army Air Corps could do a little better on furloughs. There are some fellows who haven't had a furlough in over a year while others had 2 or 3 in that time. A fellow shouldn't have to brown nose to get time off thats due him.
S64.Q97.C_1: The father draft beats hell out of me. With all the men we have laying around doing nothing & WACS[Womens Army Corps] to relieve men here for combat I don't see why we have to draft fathers. [paragraph] Thank you
S64.Q97.Full: I think the men who are running the Army don't know what they are doing. They are always thinking of something new and 2 days later they change their minds. As far as recreational & entertainment facilities they are okay. The fellows really enjoy the U.S.O. camp shows. The Army Air Corps could do a little better on furloughs. There are some fellows who haven't had a furlough in over a year while others had 2 or 3 in that time. A fellow shouldn't have to brown nose to get time off thats due him.  The father draft beats hell out of me. With all the men we have laying around doing nothing & WACS[Womens Army Corps] to relieve men here for combat I don't see why we have to draft fathers. [paragraph] Thank you

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: As a large business I think the Army is really doing all that is humanly possible to be efficient but I find it is who you know not what you know that gets the promotions in the various places I have been stationed.
S64.Q97.Full: As a large business I think the Army is really doing all that is humanly possible to be efficient but I find it is who you know not what you know that gets the promotions in the various places I have been stationed.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think every man should receive a furlough every 6 months or if impossible at that time he should receive it with next furlough. [paragraph] I think that draft boards used little discretion in the drafting of war workers. [deletion] [/deletion] Too many men are in
S64.Q97.C_1: The Army that could never be worth a fraction to the Army that they could be worth on the production line. There are plenty of fighters in the services in use the equipment that could be produced by the workers who were drafted and aren't of much use to the Army without equipment. We need an Army that is very well supplied, trained rather than a large Army that can't be supplied with equipment but has to be maintained at gov't expense. We can't have everyone in the Army and still have a good one because someone has to be in the production line and I believe the draft is eating the support right out from behind the fighters.
S64.Q97.Full: I think every man should receive a furlough every 6 months or if impossible at that time he should receive it with next furlough. [paragraph] I think that draft boards used little discretion in the drafting of war workers. [deletion] [/deletion] Too many men are in  The Army that could never be worth a fraction to the Army that they could be worth on the production line. There are plenty of fighters in the services in use the equipment that could be produced by the workers who were drafted and aren't of much use to the Army without equipment. We need an Army that is very well supplied, trained rather than a large Army that can't be supplied with equipment but has to be maintained at gov't expense. We can't have everyone in the Army and still have a good one because someone has to be in the production line and I believe the draft is eating the support right out from behind the fighters.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: since I have been in the army
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I am a S/Sgt [Staff Sergeant] and I have been around. When I came back I was disappointed. The soldiers don't have the respect for a non commissioned officer as they did before the war. [paragraph] I like my job in the army but I have a farm that I think I should be on. My job in the army is important but I there's plenty of men that could do it. Some one has to run those farms.
S64.Q97.Full: I am a S/Sgt [Staff Sergeant] and I have been around. When I came back I was disappointed. The soldiers don't have the respect for a non commissioned officer as they did before the war. [paragraph] I like my job in the army but I have a farm that I think I should be on. My job in the army is important but I there's plenty of men that could do it. Some one has to run those farms.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: The people at home think they are having harder in some ways but they are getting along lots better than lots of the people in other countries & the people over there are getting along & not making much fuss about it but the American people are not use to that they want a ...
S64.Q97.C_1: free life. but the American people have got to learn to get a long on lot less of lot things. And it going to take a long time for it to happen and get use to.
S64.Q97.Full: The people at home think they are having harder in some ways but they are getting along lots better than lots of the people in other countries & the people over there are getting along & not making much fuss about it but the American people are not use to that they want a ...  free life. but the American people have got to learn to get a long on lot less of lot things. And it going to take a long time for it to happen and get use to.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: It wouldn't do much good with out any name.
S64.Q97.Full: It wouldn't do much good with out any name.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Many of the army rules seem silly. Also much time is wasted! This is my biggest gripe. I am by no means a continual "bitcher" but feel that the army authorities went into the whole business of setting up an an army, just a little too much without foresight. Too hurried and without proper planning!
S64.Q97.Full: Many of the army rules seem silly. Also much time is wasted! This is my biggest gripe. I am by no means a continual "bitcher" but feel that the army authorities went into the whole business of setting up an an army, just a little too much without foresight. Too hurried and without proper planning!

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Don't think I'm so foolish as to believe what I think ought to happen Germany & Japan will happen. No allied nation would commit such a crime. Nevertheless that is a sure conclusion to the affair.
S64.Q97.Full: Don't think I'm so foolish as to believe what I think ought to happen Germany & Japan will happen. No allied nation would commit such a crime. Nevertheless that is a sure conclusion to the affair.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: None (believe it or not)
S64.Q97.Full: None (believe it or not)

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I believe the service man should not be kept in all week. He is still human, and should have a class A pass to go as he pleases when off duty. A fairer system of furloughs in the AAC is needed. All other branches get better breaks in that line than we do. Regulations prohibiting men from fighter squadron from going to O.C.S. should be relaxed. A more liberal T/O should be made up. No man is going to do his utmost if he feels he can't go beyond a low non com rank because the allowance is full. Give him credit
S64.Q97.C_1: where credit is due. Provide better laundry service and not a gyp outfit as at [unclear] Train Field [/unclear] Wise.
S64.Q97.Full: I believe the service man should not be kept in all week. He is still human, and should have a class A pass to go as he pleases when off duty. A fairer system of furloughs in the AAC is needed. All other branches get better breaks in that line than we do. Regulations prohibiting men from fighter squadron from going to O.C.S. should be relaxed. A more liberal T/O should be made up. No man is going to do his utmost if he feels he can't go beyond a low non com rank because the allowance is full. Give him credit  where credit is due. Provide better laundry service and not a gyp outfit as at [unclear] Train Field [/unclear] Wise.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: The AAF [Army Air Force] paperwork, supposed to have been streamlined is becoming more & more superfluous, duplication of reports by several Hdq [Headquarters] under the same command is a common fault.[paragraph] The AAF is wasting the taxpayers money on personnel rail fares, most AC [Air Corps] men have changed stations at least 5 times in the past year, for proof, look at anyone's SIR or 201 [military personnel file]
S64.Q97.C_1: AR 615-275 should be amended to include travel time for enlisted men's furloughs, length of time to be decided by distance to be travelled.
S64.Q97.Full: The AAF [Army Air Force] paperwork, supposed to have been streamlined is becoming more & more superfluous, duplication of reports by several Hdq [Headquarters] under the same command is a common fault.[paragraph] The AAF is wasting the taxpayers money on personnel rail fares, most AC [Air Corps] men have changed stations at least 5 times in the past year, for proof, look at anyone's SIR or 201 [military personnel file]   AR 615-275 should be amended to include travel time for enlisted men's furloughs, length of time to be decided by distance to be travelled.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: We didn't ask for this war but were [we're] in it and we will certainly win. The army has expanded rapidly and has done a miraculous job. It has its bad points but the good points add up to a higher score. We can lick any nation! I am not over confident in that statement. Each American has been used to ...
S64.Q97.C_1: some little pleasure in life whether its playing with his kids or driving his car or going to his club meeting. [paragraph[ My reason for fighting - so I can hear Dale Cornell who pays a fine trumpet with Sammy Kaye. We will all fight like hell to get ([underline] back [/underline] ) in the regular "routine" of life. [paragraph] Thank you.
S64.Q97.Full: We didn't ask for this war but were [we're] in it and we will certainly win. The army has expanded rapidly and has done a miraculous job. It has its bad points but the good points add up to a higher score. We can lick any nation! I am not over confident in that statement. Each American has been used to ...  some little pleasure in life whether its playing with his kids or driving his car or going to his club meeting. [paragraph[ My reason for fighting - so I can hear Dale Cornell who pays a fine trumpet with Sammy Kaye. We will all fight like hell to get ([underline] back [/underline] ) in the regular "routine" of life. [paragraph] Thank you.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Would like to have Roosevelt tour some of the Army camps, Air Fields, and Naval Stations. I like him.
S64.Q97.Full: Would like to have Roosevelt tour some of the Army camps, Air Fields, and Naval Stations. I like him.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Since I've been in the army I've learned a great deal. The army on the whole is rather poorly run. There are a group of old men in Washington trying to run a war that is fifty years ahead of there times. Look at all the Vital implements of war they turned away as useless. Another example of poor leadership occurred at the beginning of the
S64.Q97.C_1: War. General MacArthur made a Glorious Retreat. How could there be such a thing. A retreat means defeat unless its to ambush the enemy as Gen. Von Hindenburg once did to the Russian Army. ([underline] Mac [/underline] ) didn't do this. He just ran out and left his men to die. [paragraph] Another thing is red tape. To get anything or go any place you have to wait several months before you can usually get some breaks so that you can just put in an application for what you want. Then another period of waiting. Red Tape could easily be done away with. Also, why send fella's so far from home for training. There are too many AWOL's because of that. If I could get home on a 3 day pass once a month I wouldn't need a 15 day furlough and would therefore have more time to work at the field. [paragraph] Also furloughs are to short.
S64.Q97.Full: Since I've been in the army I've learned a great deal. The army on the whole is rather poorly run. There are a group of old men in Washington trying to run a war that is fifty years ahead of there times. Look at all the Vital implements of war they turned away as useless. Another example of poor leadership occurred at the beginning of the War. General MacArthur made a Glorious Retreat. How could there be such a thing. A retreat means defeat unless its to ambush the enemy as Gen. Von Hindenburg once did to the Russian Army. ([underline] Mac [/underline] ) didn't do this. He just ran out and left his men to die. [paragraph] Another thing is red tape. To get anything or go any place you have to wait several months before you can usually get some breaks so that you can just put in an application for what you want. Then another period of waiting. Red Tape could easily be done away with. Also, why send fella's so far from home for training. There are too many AWOL's because of that. If I could get home on a 3 day pass once a month I wouldn't need a 15 day furlough and would therefore have more time to work at the field. [paragraph] Also furloughs are to short.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: We should get our furlough every six months (if in the States).
S64.Q97.Full: We should get our furlough every six months (if in the States).

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I would never volunteer for any service, I have volunteered, and can't get what I wanted. A fellow that gets drafted get more breaks than a volunteer.
S64.Q97.Full: I would never volunteer for any service, I have volunteered, and can't get what I wanted. A fellow that gets drafted get more breaks than a volunteer.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think it is a bunch of baloney for a fella to come back home from overseas duty and then is compelled to go to a camp, usually a month or so, just to fire a rifle so that a permanent record of his actual score is made. It's a waste of time, because a person with experience overseas can help a lot by telling his buddies what to expect and how to be prepared for things across the big pond. Also [,] I believe that it's really
S64.Q97.C_1: a poor policy to have an officer ( 90 day wonders I mean } to have to much authority right off the bat. Naturally as time progresses he'll know more and is expected to do more towards winning the war, but in the meantime they ought to get dry behind the ears. Lot of them don't know a damn thing about what's going on in the world beyond their own city or state and I'm not kidding. I've met some officers that didn't see a field of grass except in the movies.
S64.Q97.Full: I think it is a bunch of baloney for a fella to come back home from overseas duty and then is compelled to go to a camp, usually a month or so, just to fire a rifle so that a permanent record of his actual score is made. It's a waste of time, because a person with experience overseas can help a lot by telling his buddies what to expect and how to be prepared for things across the big pond. Also [,] I believe that it's really a poor policy to have an officer ( 90 day wonders I mean } to have to much authority right off the bat. Naturally as time progresses he'll know more and is expected to do more towards winning the war, but in the meantime they ought to get dry behind the ears. Lot of them don't know a damn thing about what's going on in the world beyond their own city or state and I'm not kidding. I've met some officers that didn't see a field of grass except in the movies.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: There's too many men in the army doing things they don't like when the job they did in civilian life is important to the army. For example one fellow was a welder. He was also a welder in the army till he hit this camp and now he's a cook. His cooking stinks too. My job in civilian life is important in the army but instead they made me a mechanic.
S64.Q97.C_1: on the machine I adjusted. I'm not too mechanically minded and I hate to think what will happen if that machine is damaged in action and I can't fix it. I think the army's nuts in that respect. They could be a little more liberal with passes also.
S64.Q97.Full: There's too many men in the army doing things they don't like when the job they did in civilian life is important to the army. For example one fellow was a welder. He was also a welder in the army till he hit this camp and now he's a cook. His cooking stinks too. My job in civilian life is important in the army but instead they made me a mechanic. on the machine I adjusted. I'm not too mechanically minded and I hate to think what will happen if that machine is damaged in action and I can't fix it. I think the army's nuts in that respect. They could be a little more liberal with passes also.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: Lots of areas are run by old time Army standards - this is 1943 and not 1913 - There should be no such thing as no-com or officer clubs. When on combat duty an officer doesn't look for another officer to help him if in danger - he yells to anyone within sight All soldiers should enjoy same priviledges everywhere. (over)
S64.Q97.C_1: I dont [don't] see why persons with records in pens or jails should be rejected. I'm as tough as any one who served time. -- I did my tricks in pens -- yet it seems I'm behaving. Army could get 40,000 of the toughest ex-cons in country into one area if necessary and it could get 1,000 tougher so called "honest" men to handle them if necessary. This 4F and 3A and 3C business is a bunch of malarkey. Draft all able-body men. Plnety of half-able men would be left to handle war jobs
S64.Q97.Full: Lots of areas are run by old time Army standards - this is 1943 and not 1913 - There should be no such thing as no-com or officer clubs. When on combat duty an officer doesn't look for another officer to help him if in danger - he yells to anyone within sight All soldiers should enjoy same priviledges everywhere. (over) I dont [don't] see why persons with records in pens or jails should be rejected. I'm as tough as any one who served time. -- I did my tricks in pens -- yet it seems I'm behaving. Army could get 40,000 of the toughest ex-cons in country into one area if necessary and it could get 1,000 tougher so called "honest" men to handle them if necessary. This 4F and 3A and 3C business is a bunch of malarkey. Draft all able-body men. Plnety of half-able men would be left to handle war jobs

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: There is a lot of politics used in the Army so far as favors go. Some men are permitted to break regulations left + right while the very next fellow gets a CM for blinking an eyelash in ranks. So far the Army has treated me pretty well except that I couldn't be any further from home + still be in the country. I'll use half my furlough to get home.
S64.Q97.Full: There is a lot of politics used in the Army so far as favors go. Some men are permitted to break regulations left + right while the very next fellow gets a CM for blinking an eyelash in ranks. So far the Army has treated me pretty well except that I couldn't be any further from home + still be in the country. I'll use half my furlough to get home.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: Some of us boys [deletion] [/deletion] were drafted. Of course it caused hardships with our families. They don't complain while other boys folks spend a great deal of money to keep there kids out and a small percent succeed - etc.
S64.Q97.Full: Some of us boys [deletion] [/deletion] were drafted. Of course it caused hardships with our families. They don't complain while other boys folks spend a great deal of money to keep there kids out and a small percent succeed - etc.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Why is it that a soldier has to be so far from home and family before going across. My mind for one would be far more settled and I know I could do better work & have a higher morale if I could see my wife & baby once or twice a month.
S64.Q97.C_1: to be able to see for myself that they are well and happy. Then when the time come for going across, the soldier would feel better about it and wouldn't feel as tho he didn't care whether he came back or not. Being able to see his loved ones helps a soldier more than any other morale lifter could or can ([underline] ever [/underline] ) do.
S64.Q97.Full: Why is it that a soldier has to be so far from home and family before going across. My mind for one would be far more settled and I know I could do better work & have a higher morale if I could see my wife & baby once or twice a month.  to be able to see for myself that they are well and happy. Then when the time come for going across, the soldier would feel better about it and wouldn't feel as tho he didn't care whether he came back or not. Being able to see his loved ones helps a soldier more than any other morale lifter could or can ([underline] ever [/underline] ) do.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Remark on [underlined] Furloughs [/underlined] : [paragraph] Since the soldiers, say in the U.S., are so scattered; I think it only fair to all that they be given traveling time with there furlough. [paragraph] Remark on Dress: [paragraph] The uniform of the officers and enlisted men should be the
S64.Q97.C_1: sauce. Or else regulations prohibliting the wearing of cadet blouses by enlisted men should be revoked. Soldiers like to look neat. and they can't do it in some of the uniforms the Quartermasters throw us.
S64.Q97.Full: Remark on [underlined] Furloughs [/underlined] : [paragraph] Since the soldiers, say in the U.S., are so scattered; I think it only fair to all that they be given traveling time with there furlough. [paragraph] Remark on Dress: [paragraph] The uniform of the officers and enlisted men should be the  sauce. Or else regulations prohibliting the wearing of cadet blouses by enlisted men should be revoked. Soldiers like to look neat. and they can't do it in some of the uniforms the Quartermasters throw us.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: There isn't enough hours in the day to do the things that have to be done in other [unclear] wards [/unclear] . I believe we have to spend too much time on duty. with all the men we have it seems unnecessary to work the few of us who have been here over a yr [year] so much
S64.Q97.Full: There isn't enough hours in the day to do the things that have to be done in other [unclear] wards [/unclear] . I believe we have to spend too much time on duty. with all the men we have it seems unnecessary to work the few of us who have been here over a yr [year] so much

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I think it would be better for each soldier in the army air forces to get a furlough at least one every 6 months.
S64.Q97.Full: I think it would be better for each soldier in the army air forces to get a furlough at least one every 6 months.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: This country + army has a job to do + are doing the job, millions of people are running to gallant heights. The American people are a people of good will. In this picture are many things, any "way [unclear] [/unclear] man" knows them. I am in the Air Force and the air force is
S64.Q97.C_1: keeping them flying. And gallant boys they are riding the Airacobras. They are doing a tough job pretty well. The ground forces have a double function, tech. + soldier that introduces difficulties. This requires a coordinating exec. officer if there are not to be neither "hawk" or "buzzard" any way "orphans". There has been a remarkable de facto adjustment. [paragraph] The N.C.O.s run the army and are its main stay, however the officers should know where the "reins" are, if they don't want cliches to appear. The officers could tell the men they are part of the general picture and functions + more to the general plan even if they seem to be marking time. Our institutions are reflections of men and may they reflect the pursuit of right + good so we can all keep the faith. [In the left margin the words 'point of greatest weakness' are written and circled with an arrow pointing to the the phrase beginning with 'exec. officer' in the first paragraph]
S64.Q97.Full: This country + army has a job to do + are doing the job, millions of people are running to gallant heights. The American people are a people of good will. In this picture are many things, any "way [unclear] [/unclear] man" knows them. I am in the Air Force and the air force is  keeping them flying. And gallant boys they are riding the Airacobras. They are doing a tough job pretty well. The ground forces have a double function, tech. + soldier that introduces difficulties. This requires a coordinating exec. officer if there are not to be neither "hawk" or "buzzard" any way "orphans". There has been a remarkable de facto adjustment. [paragraph] The N.C.O.s run the army and are its main stay, however the officers should know where the "reins" are, if they don't want cliches to appear. The officers could tell the men they are part of the general picture and functions + more to the general plan even if they seem to be marking time. Our institutions are reflections of men and may they reflect the pursuit of right + good so we can all keep the faith. [In the left margin the words 'point of greatest weakness' are written and circled with an arrow pointing to the the phrase beginning with 'exec. officer' in the first paragraph]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: 1 - In order to get a pass you have to kiss everybody ass. And then you may not get one. Most of the noncoms get all the passes. A RuT or P.F.C. does all the work, while the noncoms get the promotions. Some boys been PFC for 5 months and they are very good men. And Some who do a [unclear] better [/unclear] job of brown nosing are P.F.C. one month, and the next month they get to be noncoms. Also some
S64.Q97.C_1: ... of the officers are chicken shit. Most of them don't know a damn thing. But they sure could chew your ass out. They try and tell you how to work on a place when they don't know a damn thing. Some of the officers are swell.. A outfit with some good officers could really go places. A person would really play ball if he knows there is someone with him. Otherwise this Army is O.K. with me.
S64.Q97.Full: 1 - In order to get a pass you have to kiss everybody ass. And then you may not get one. Most of the noncoms get all the passes. A RuT or P.F.C. does all the work, while the noncoms get the promotions. Some boys been PFC for 5 months and they are very good men. And Some who do a [unclear] better [/unclear] job of brown nosing are P.F.C. one month, and the next month they get to be noncoms. Also some ... of the officers are chicken shit. Most of them don't know a damn thing. But they sure could chew your ass out. They try and tell you how to work on a place when they don't know a damn thing. Some of the officers are swell.. A outfit with some good officers could really go places. A person would really play ball if he knows there is someone with him. Otherwise this Army is O.K. with me.

S64.Q97.F: perhaps I take my work too serious, but we are very short of men and all my men work too many long hours. He doesn't want a pass, he wants rest and quite. Give me more good mechanics and men we'll get along O.K.

He doesn't want a pass, he wants rest and quite. Give me more good mechanics and men we'll get along O.K.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I am uncertain as to the origin of this survey - but I believe it an excellent idea. Should have been done long ago - which also explains my feelings of a democracy at war. We are "just getting around" to doing many things which should have been done long ago. This survey, I believe, should have concerned itself a lot more with post-war problems. We are the men who
S64.Q97.C_1: will [unclear] [/unclear] the pattern of life in the world after the war. Our opinions, our voices, will shape our nations course. We shall blunder thru this was because of a [unclear] [/unclear] of material - and a powerful [underline] Air Force [/underline] . God is on the side of the strongest forces.
S64.Q97.Full: I am uncertain as to the origin of this survey - but I believe it an excellent idea. Should have been done long ago - which also explains my feelings of a democracy at war. We are the men who  will [unclear] [/unclear] the pattern of life in the world after the war. Our opinions, our voices, will shape our nations course. We shall blunder thru this was because of a [unclear] [/unclear] of material - and a powerful [underline] Air Force [/underline] . God is on the side of the strongest forces.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Why fight other peoples wars? Would they do the same for us? War is the poorest way of settling arguments. [paragraph] If our government officials had our interests at heart - we surely wouldn't have been so low in equipment. They should have seen or knew (they did) but were too complacent.
S64.Q97.C_1: if we had been better prepared - as we should have been - these countries now fighting wouldnt even risk fighting. Why did we let men like Hitler get so strong? Someone fell down on their jobs and are criminals & traitors to this country - more so then a spy or someone who betrayed a military secret & etc. There is enough of everything in the world, that every one should act a fair share and there shouldnt have to be wars to bring this about. You convince me why I am supposed to be fighting, then possibly I might be a better soldier!
S64.Q97.Full: Why fight other peoples wars? Would they do the same for us? War is the poorest way of settling arguments. [paragraph] If our government officials had our interests at heart - we surely wouldn't have been so low in equipment. They should have seen or knew (they did) but were too complacent. if we had been better prepared - as we should have been - these countries now fighting wouldnt even risk fighting. Why did we let men like Hitler get so strong? Someone fell down on their jobs and are criminals & traitors to this country - more so then a spy or someone who betrayed a military secret & etc. There is enough of everything in the world, that every one should act a fair share and there shouldnt have to be wars to bring this about. You convince me why I am supposed to be fighting, then possibly I might be a better soldier!

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: The one thing that I would like to say is that we don't get furloughs very often most everyone is in at least a year before they get one and when we do get one of 15 days at the longest it takes most of the time to travel to and from our homes. I think it would be a good idea to leave more go home at a time and give a 6 day extention for traveling time. It is
S64.Q97.C_1: only natural for a person to want to see his folks twice a year, as long as he is in this country.
S64.Q97.Full: The one thing that I would like to say is that we don't get furloughs very often most everyone is in at least a year before they get one and when we do get one of 15 days at the longest it takes most of the time to travel to and from our homes. I think it would be a good idea to leave more go home at a time and give a 6 day extention for traveling time. It is only natural for a person to want to see his folks twice a year, as long as he is in this country.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think the army has done a very poor job of placing men in services in which they are best qualified by ability to serve. The classification tests are fine but they are almost wholly disregarded in assigning men to army schools for training. Once a mistake in classification has been made it so practically (over)
S64.Q97.C_1: impossible to correct it by getting re classified. If you have been to an army school it is too bad. Soldiers should be examined more carefully before being sent to schools. They should be allowed to withdraw honourably if they are unfit. [paragraph] I have gone to two technical schools in the Air Corps while I was well qualified as an intelligent NCO, when I came in the army as I have legal standing and have taught 10 years. I am working in an orderly room temporarily. Yesterday they sent us a clerk who was a ([underline] Master [/underline] ) electrician before he got into the army. He doesn't like the office work while I do. I know of hundreds of cases like this.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the army has done a very poor job of placing men in services in which they are best qualified by ability to serve. The classification tests are fine but they are almost wholly disregarded in assigning men to army schools for training. Once a mistake in classification has been made it so practically (over) impossible to correct it by getting re classified. If you have been to an army school it is too bad. Soldiers should be examined more carefully before being sent to schools. They should be allowed to withdraw honourably if they are unfit. [paragraph] I have gone to two technical schools in the Air Corps while I was well qualified as an intelligent NCO, when I came in the army as I have legal standing and have taught 10 years. I am working in an orderly room temporarily. Yesterday they sent us a clerk who was a ([underline] Master [/underline] ) electrician before he got into the army. He doesn't like the office work while I do. I know of hundreds of cases like this.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: There is to much useless paper work in the Army, they stream lined the Army, but they didn't cut any of the paper work at all, more if anything. When you make three identical reports and send it to three different Headquarters under the same command, that is going the long way around. efficiency is the thing we are interested in, not army channels!
S64.Q97.Full: There is to much useless paper work in the Army, they stream lined the Army, but they didn't cut any of the paper work at all, more if anything. When you make three identical reports and send it to three different Headquarters under the same command, that is going the long way around. efficiency is the thing we are interested in, not army channels!

S64.Q97.F: I think that a soldier should get an opportunity to apply for a job which he likes and thinks he can do good in regardless of his AGCT [Army General Classification Test] score[.] He may pick up things that are explained to him more easily.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that a soldier should get an opportunity to apply for a job which he likes and thinks he can do good in regardless of his AGCT [Army General Classification Test] score[.] He may pick up things that are explained to him more easily.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I am in the Air Corp and to my opinion us fellows don't get enough furlough. I am in 6 months and have not had a furlough and I know through our squadron I won't have any for another six. That will make it almost a year. [paragraph] I know fellows in the infantry that were only in
S64.Q97.C_1: for 4 to 5 months and have been home already, I wish something could be done about it. I know how my mother feels not having seen me for so long and as I am in the states yet I'm sure she feels I should of gotten a chance. If I was overseas, naturally that [deletion] what [/deletion] would be impossible, but while I'm in the states I don't see why I couldn't go home before such a long time.
S64.Q97.Full: I am in the Air Corp and to my opinion us fellows don't get enough furlough. I am in 6 months and have not had a furlough and I know through our squadron I won't have any for another six. That will make it almost a year. [paragraph] I know fellows in the infantry that were only in for 4 to 5 months and have been home already, I wish something could be done about it. I know how my mother feels not having seen me for so long and as I am in the states yet I'm sure she feels I should of gotten a chance. If I was overseas, naturally that [deletion] what [/deletion] would be impossible, but while I'm in the states I don't see why I couldn't go home before such a long time.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Regarding furloughs; I think that if a soldier is stationed on the west coast and lives on the east coast, more traveling time should be allowed. In my case, I traveled 10 days and only had 4 days actually home whereas, a soldier stationed near his home has 10 day home and doesn't have to travel but a few hours. This is just my opinion and I believe there are lots of others that will agree with me.
S64.Q97.Full: Regarding furloughs; I think that if a soldier is stationed on the west coast and lives on the east coast, more traveling time should be allowed. In my case, I traveled 10 days and only had 4 days actually home whereas, a soldier stationed near his home has 10 day home and doesn't have to travel but a few hours. This is just my opinion and I believe there are lots of others that will agree with me.

S64.Q97.Full: I think that all first three graders on this post be given Class A passes, other posts do it and a man of the first three grades has a responsibility to assume and will make use of his pass accordingly. document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: Yes I have a few remarks about our passes. They should have a bigger percentage of fellows about them [insertion] than? [/insertion] they do. Also we lower grades half, have, to get up at 4 or 5 O'clock in the morning to sweat but the [unclear] line? [/unclear] for a pass as they only let out 20 of us a day.
S64.Q97.C_1: And the first 3 grades have the seniority over us when it comes to passes. Would much rather sign the day before, cause you never know what might [insertion] [/insertion] up. As it is we are never sure of getting our passes. Very very seldom we ever get an on duty pass. So much for that. Little about our furloughs also. We don't get no traveling time, just our straight 14 days no matter how far we have to. Really and truly think we should get a little traveling time. That is all. Thank you.
S64.Q97.Full: Yes I have a few remarks about our passes. They should have a bigger percentage of fellows about them [insertion] than? [/insertion] they do. Also we lower grades half, have, to get up at 4 or 5 O'clock in the morning to sweat but the [unclear] line? [/unclear] for a pass as they only let out 20 of us a day. And the first 3 grades have the seniority over us when it comes to passes. Would much rather sign the day before, cause you never know what might [insertion] [/insertion] up. As it is we are never sure of getting our passes. Very very seldom we ever get an on duty pass. So much for that. Little about our furloughs also. We don't get no traveling time, just our straight 14 days no matter how far we have to. Really and truly think we should get a little traveling time. That is all. Thank you.

Seeing these men in town with class A passes and one who has been in the service sometime before the
S64.Q97.C_1: War is disgusting.

The navy close by gives there men Class A passes that those with the rank equivalent to the army first three grades. Seeing these men in town with class A passes and one who has been in the service sometime before the War is disgusting.

S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Our sleeping quarters are to overcrowded for the size of the barracks.
S64.Q97.Full: Our sleeping quarters are to overcrowded for the size of the barracks.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: My Pop is making more money but he had to quit farming due to no help. It seems like the farm is very important but what he is doing is helping a lot.
S64.Q97.Full: My Pop is making more money but he had to quit farming due to no help. It seems like the farm is very important but what he is doing is helping a lot.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: Soldier edited 95.9 to read, No, I have not had my fair share of [deletion] either [/deletion] furloughs [deletion] or passes. [/deletion]
S64.Q97.F: There is only one thing I would like to say. I've been in this Army for 7 months now and if I don't get a furlough in 2 more months, I will find out how serious it is to be AWOL. Thank you.
S64.Q97.Full: There is only one thing I would like to say. I've been in this Army for 7 months now and if I don't get a furlough in 2 more months, I will find out how serious it is to be AWOL. Thank you.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I believe I am a good soldier & I like the army a lot. But I believe the army should give out ratings as the navy does. That is by a written & practical test. I am an airborne mechanic so you can see the reason for this. Otherwise I believe I have no complaints.
S64.Q97.Full: I believe I am a good soldier & I like the army a lot. But I believe the army should give out ratings as the navy does. That is by a written & practical test. I am an airborne mechanic so you can see the reason for this. Otherwise I believe I have no complaints.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Why in the hell doesn't the Army see that our Civilian Employers Send the members of the Armed forces. That is; former employees, why don't the employers send them bonus checks, dividends, from group insurance or some time of present. In appreciation for their services in the Army.
S64.Q97.C_1: The food can be better also, lets not try to make food cost at the expense of the soldier. Of course I don't mean wasting food. But lets be more easier on the boys when it comes to food. After all good food is the champion of all morale.
S64.Q97.Full: Why in the hell doesn't the Army see that our Civilian Employers Send the members of the Armed forces. That is; former employees, why don't the employers send them bonus checks, dividends, from group insurance or some time of present. In appreciation for their services in the Army. The food can be better also, lets not try to make food cost at the expense of the soldier. Of course I don't mean wasting food. But lets be more easier on the boys when it comes to food. After all good food is the champion of all morale.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I say a man should be let off his post more than 24 hrs a week. Other camps do, why not this one? It would help build moral. Have some way of getting rid of a brown nose. Not be so strict on uniform. Surtain things are OK but some are going to far.
S64.Q97.Full: I say a man should be let off his post more than 24 hrs a week. Other camps do, why not this one? It would help build moral. Have some way of getting rid of a brown nose. Not be so strict on uniform. Surtain things are OK but some are going to far.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I can see no good reason for the few passes given us- One 24 hour pass each 2 weeks + an occasional off-duty pass. It seems that in a field in continental United States we should be given as many off-duty passes as we ask for. Most of us could do our work better + not feel so much that we are being confined unnecessarily.
S64.Q97.Full: I can see no good reason for the few passes given us- One 24 hour pass each 2 weeks + an occasional off-duty pass. It seems that in a field in continental United States we should be given as many off-duty passes as we ask for. Most of us could do our work better + not feel so much that we are being confined unnecessarily.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: Passes in this Camp are governed entirely diff. from other Stations which I think is unfair.
S64.Q97.F: Since the beginning of the War Polotics [politics] has a lot to do with Race regulations. Commissioned Officers have charge of Non-Coms quarters and are allowing Warrant officers and in one case a civillian [civilian] Quarters on this Post. Since the Quarters are for Non-Coms it should be governed accordingly. Am a M/Sgt and cannot secure a Quarter on Post for this reason (Hamilton Field, California). [paragraph] Also Officers [unclear] formobely [/unclear]
S64.Q97.C_1: 97 cont. working for the United Airlines are try to convert the Army into their channels and they give to much consideration to the civilian Contract carriers operating from this Station and not enough to the Army. Seems as if they were feathering their nest for Post war days.
S64.Q97.Full: Since the beginning of the War Polotics [politics] has a lot to do with Race regulations. Commissioned Officers have charge of Non-Coms quarters and are allowing Warrant officers and in one case a civillian [civilian] Quarters on this Post. Since the Quarters are for Non-Coms it should be governed accordingly. Am a M/Sgt and cannot secure a Quarter on Post for this reason (Hamilton Field, California). [paragraph] Also Officers [unclear] formobely [/unclear]  97 cont. working for the United Airlines are try to convert the Army into their channels and they give to much consideration to the civilian Contract carriers operating from this Station and not enough to the Army. Seems as if they were feathering their nest for Post war days.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: (1) Due to the shifts we work, it would be a great help to have warm meals at night. (2) Furlough are okay, but it don't help anyone when he spents 9 days traveling and of a 14 day furlough. (3) All first three graders M/Sgt T/Sgt S/Sgt should have a Class A pass. (4) Most of the boys should have more schooling in Aircraft mechanics, instead of making mechanics out of welders and sheet metal men.
S64.Q97.Full: (1) Due to the shifts we work, it would be a great help to have warm meals at night. (2) Furlough are okay, but it don't help anyone when he spents 9 days traveling and of a 14 day furlough. (3) All first three graders M/Sgt T/Sgt S/Sgt should have a Class A pass. (4) Most of the boys should have more schooling in Aircraft mechanics, instead of making mechanics out of welders and sheet metal men.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I think the army has been as fair as possible in placing me, and will mean a lot when I go back to civilian life.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the army has been as fair as possible in placing me, and will mean a lot when I go back to civilian life.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Would like to comment on the attitude in the vicinity of this station - most of [deletion] them [/deletion] [insertion] the civilians [/insertion] seem not only faintly interested in the affair and friendships with Soldier, but markedly indifferent and sometimes even hostile. This is a good post and we like it here, but the outside seems rotten. The people seem to be "cry babies", thinking only in terms [deletion] of [/deletion] toward the
S64.Q97.C_1: soldiers of the inconvenience they have been caused. The element of helping the "kid" in uniform to feel at home and not feel like stranger seems never to enter their mind. They can look to the middle west. There they can find a thousand lessons on how to take care of the "boys doing the "dirty work."
S64.Q97.Full: Would like to comment on the attitude in the vicinity of this station - most of [deletion] them [/deletion] [insertion] the civilians [/insertion] seem not only faintly interested in the affair and friendships with Soldier, but markedly indifferent and sometimes even hostile. This is a good post and we like it here, but the outside seems rotten. The people seem to be "cry babies", thinking only in terms [deletion] of [/deletion] toward the  soldiers of the inconvenience they have been caused. The element of helping the "kid" in uniform to feel at home and not feel like stranger seems never to enter their mind. They can look to the middle west. There they can find a thousand lessons on how to take care of the "boys doing the "dirty work."

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Why should the first 3 Ranks not half to take a monthly physical [paragraph] Why can't a Pvt get a married mans pass over the first 3 Grades he was married before Pearl Harbor and those of the first 3 Grades only married after yet get the married mans pass. He should have the same chance when his turn comes
S64.Q97.C_1: Can't see any sense in getting up at 3 A.M. to sign Pass Book at 7 A.M. and then some time be in 3rd in line. [paragraph] Can't see why Furlough has to start at mid nite when you train for the East leaves at 8 P.M.. You just loose 24 Hours on your furlough and that counts when you have to go across the U.S. [paragraph] The Air Corps thinks it's shit don't stink and gets all the Ratings. How about the Dough Boy he does all the dirty work and no credit for it. Let's give the Dough Boys same ratings and not give it all to the Air Corps.
S64.Q97.Full: Why should the first 3 Ranks not half to take a monthly physical [paragraph] Why can't a Pvt get a married mans pass over the first 3 Grades he was married before Pearl Harbor and those of the first 3 Grades only married after yet get the married mans pass. He should have the same chance when his turn comes  Can't see any sense in getting up at 3 A.M. to sign Pass Book at 7 A.M. and then some time be in 3rd in line. [paragraph] Can't see why Furlough has to start at mid nite when you train for the East leaves at 8 P.M.. You just loose 24 Hours on your furlough and that counts when you have to go across the U.S. [paragraph] The Air Corps thinks it's shit don't stink and gets all the Ratings. How about the Dough Boy he does all the dirty work and no credit for it. Let's give the Dough Boys same ratings and not give it all to the Air Corps.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: All the soldiers are of the opinion that they are entitled to Class "A" or off duty passes, that I agree with fully. If married men living off of post are entitled to go home every night and Sundays so are the rest of soldiers. We are all in this together for a common cause so lets stop the distinctions.
S64.Q97.Full: All the soldiers are of the opinion that they are entitled to Class "A" or off duty passes, that I agree with fully. If married men living off of post are entitled to go home every night and Sundays so are the rest of soldiers. We are all in this together for a common cause so lets stop the distinctions.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: There is entirely too much formality & wasted effort in many things and also too much paper work, reports etc.
S64.Q97.Full: There is entirely too much formality & wasted effort in many things and also too much paper work, reports etc.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: The only "gripe" I have against the particular outfit that I am in is that those in command are using politics + petty grievances to obstruct their prime objective. This attitude, consequently, permeates the entire structure down to the newest enlisted men and one gets the [deletion] fell [/deletion] feeling that sometimes he might be doing more for the war effort [deletion] than [/deletion] [deletion] he's [/deletion] [deletion] doing [/deletion] as a civilian.
S64.Q97.C_1: than he is as a soldier. Personally, I'm enjoying a happy career in the Army so my complaint is not a result of personal persecution. My sincere opinion is that the main fault lies in the granting of high commissions in the Army to certain civilians purely because of their private contacts.
S64.Q97.Full: The only "gripe" I have against the particular outfit that I am in is that those in command are using politics + petty grievances to obstruct their prime objective. This attitude, consequently, permeates the entire structure down to the newest enlisted men and one gets the [deletion] fell [/deletion] feeling that sometimes he might be doing more for the war effort [deletion] than [/deletion] [deletion] he's [/deletion] [deletion] doing [/deletion] as a civilian.  than he is as a soldier. Personally, I'm enjoying a happy career in the Army so my complaint is not a result of personal persecution. My sincere opinion is that the main fault lies in the granting of high commissions in the Army to certain civilians purely because of their private contacts.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Would like [deletion] a [/deletion] Class A passes instead of 24 hours
S64.Q97.Full: Would like [deletion] a [/deletion] Class A passes instead of 24 hours

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Why shouldn't the Air Corps get the same amount of furloughs as other branches of the service.
S64.Q97.Full: Why shouldn't the Air Corps get the same amount of furloughs as other branches of the service.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Many camps have married men passes for those who are married and live off of the camp in town , a place closer to camp established for the men and families, would be a little more morale builder as then they would not have to travel 8 and 10 miles back and forth.
S64.Q97.Full: Many camps have married men passes for those who are married and live off of the camp in town , a place closer to camp established for the men and families, would be a little more morale builder as then they would not have to travel 8 and 10 miles back and forth.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: 1. A soldier should be allowed a little more time at home. [paragraph] 2. Cut out over amount of red tape. [paragraph] 3. Lets get this war over so we can return to living a normal life once again.
S64.Q97.Full: 1. A soldier should be allowed a little more time at home. [paragraph] 2. Cut out over amount of red tape. [paragraph] 3. Lets get this war over so we can return to living a normal life once again.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: On the whole I am satisfied with the branch of the army I'm assigned to. In this deportment we hove a similarity to a civilian job as we hove a definite member of [unclear] [/unclear] on duty. We are on a shift basis. In view of that I think personnell should be allowed class "A" passes for off duty hours.
S64.Q97.Full: On the whole I am satisfied with the branch of the army I'm assigned to. In this deportment we hove a similarity to a civilian job as we hove a definite member of [unclear] [/unclear] on duty. We are on a shift basis. In view of that I think personnell should be allowed class "A" passes for off duty hours.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: We should get traveling time with our furloughs. A certain no. [number] of days should be set as a furlough say 10 days no matter where you live and then traveling time should be given. This would insure everybody of spending the same amount of time at home.
S64.Q97.Full: We should get traveling time with our furloughs. A certain no. [number] of days should be set as a furlough say 10 days no matter where you live and then traveling time should be given. This would insure everybody of spending the same amount of time at home.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: The daily pass system which my squadron has to my estimation could be remedied for the convenience of the soldiers in the squadron. In order to apply for a pass a soldier has to get up at 4 o'clock in the morning to ??? out a line.
S64.Q97.Full: The daily pass system which my squadron has to my estimation could be remedied for the convenience of the soldiers in the squadron. In order to apply for a pass a soldier has to get up at 4 o'clock in the morning to ??? out a line.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Give the men working on the line more consideration as to ratings instead of the ones working in the offices. There are entirely too many ratings given to the ones who work in the offices month after month.
S64.Q97.Full: Give the men working on the line more consideration as to ratings instead of the ones working in the offices. There are entirely too many ratings given to the ones who work in the offices month after month.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: What makes an officer especially a "Lt" think he's so much better than an enlisted man - In lot of cases an enlisted man has a higher IQ than the officer but has some defects keeping him from being an officer.
S64.Q97.Full: What makes an officer especially a "Lt" think he's so much better than an enlisted man - In lot of cases an enlisted man has a higher IQ than the officer but has some defects keeping him from being an officer.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Concerning ratings! [space] [paragraph] When I was a Corporal two fellows I have in mind were Privates. Today I am a Buck Sergeant; they are Staff Sergeants. One of them did not finish high school, one did. I am a college graduate. All three of us do our work well! I have been in the Army 15 months; they, less than a year.
S64.Q97.C_1: Other fellows are making Sergeant while I remain one. My department head recommends me every month for promotion. The squadron C. O. does not confirm it. I never had any squadron punishment, thought to be a good soldier. Likedy by and well thought of by the First Sergeant. Why can't a fellow in my circumstances "get ahead?" This matter should be looked into as I feel that the same thing exists else where.
S64.Q97.Full: Concerning ratings! [space] [paragraph] When I was a Corporal two fellows I have in mind were Privates. Today I am a Buck Sergeant; they are Staff Sergeants. One of them did not finish high school, one did. I am a college graduate. All three of us do our work well! I have been in the Army 15 months; they, less than a year.  Other fellows are making Sergeant while I remain one. My department head recommends me every month for promotion. The squadron C. O. does not confirm it. I never had any squadron punishment, thought to be a good soldier. Likedy by and well thought of by the First Sergeant. Why can't a fellow in my circumstances "get ahead?" This matter should be looked into as I feel that the same thing exists else where.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I figure that the army could have a better way of classifying men with skilled trades. [paragraph] And the bigest part of the defense workers it [unclear] hast [/unclear] in the area I am would put more into their work we could step up [deletion] [/deletion] production alot more.
S64.Q97.Full: I figure that the army could have a better way of classifying men with skilled trades. [paragraph] And the bigest part of the defense workers it [unclear] hast [/unclear] in the area I am would put more into their work we could step up [deletion] [/deletion] production alot more.

S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much

S64.Q97.Full: These last 96 questions are not all fitted for an Air Corps man to answer. Think it would be a good idea to have a class "A" pass for all off duty [unclear] ??? [/unclear]
