S64.Q95.M: Other/No answer
S64.Q97.F: I would like that we should have Class A passes.
S64.Q97.Full: I would like that we should have Class A passes.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I would like to see the goverment crack down on some of the labor leaders, there is too many strikes. [paragraph] I would also like to see the goverment get tough with some of the crack-pots it has working for it. [paragraph] The goverment should also tell and keep on tilling the people not to be so dam snug and con-
S64.Q97.C_1: [unclear] ?edind [/unclear] like as if they had the war all sewed up. It's going to be a tough grind and the going is all uphill. And the government should keep on pounding it into them till it gets into their skulls.
S64.Q97.Full: I would like to see the goverment crack down on some of the labor leaders, there is too many strikes. [paragraph] I would also like to see the goverment get tough with some of the crack-pots it has working for it. [paragraph] The goverment should also tell and keep on tilling the people not to be so dam snug and con-  [unclear] ?edind [/unclear] like as if they had the war all sewed up. It's going to be a tough grind and the going is all uphill. And the government should keep on pounding it into them till it gets into their skulls.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: [circle] 1 [/circle] This is not to be the continual gripe of officer versus enlisted man (particularly against 2nd Lts) but it is a suggestion of sorts. Why is it that as soon as a man is given a set of shoulder ornaments, the Army expects him to know all there is to know, about any phase of the army. Of course, it is a great mistake for any officer to agree that, because he is given a particular responsibility, he does know quite a bit about, therefore
S64.Q97.C_1: refuse to accept or ask advice from his men, even "buck privates". It has been said that the reasons are the backbone of the Army. Then, why not give them responsibility - also hold them responsible for acts - equal to that given an officer, providing he is an exceptional man? It should be stressed in Officer Candidate Schools that each man can learn a lot about his new job from the men under him. This is particularly true in the administrative phases of the Army where one can find enlisted doing jobs similar to their former civilian jobs and were experts in that particular sort of thing, having done it for years. In short, give the officers a break! [paragraph] [unclear] a number [/unclear] Another gripe I have is: everyday one sees pictures of [unclear] [/unclear] [unclear] [/unclear] of the women's services going overseas into theaters of operations. Now, why couldn't "limited service" men of good physical health except for a minor defect go also? It will at least remove that "civilians in uniform" feeling from men classified as non-combatants.
S64.Q97.Full: [circle] 1 [/circle] This is not to be the continual gripe of officer versus enlisted man (particularly against 2nd Lts) but it is a suggestion of sorts. Why is it that as soon as a man is given a set of shoulder ornaments, the Army expects him to know all there is to know, about any phase of the army. Of course, it is a great mistake for any officer to agree that, because he is given a particular responsibility, he does know quite a bit about, therefore refuse to accept or ask advice from his men, even "buck privates". It has been said that the reasons are the backbone of the Army. Then, why not give them responsibility - also hold them responsible for acts - equal to that given an officer, providing he is an exceptional man? It should be stressed in Officer Candidate Schools that each man can learn a lot about his new job from the men under him. This is particularly true in the administrative phases of the Army where one can find enlisted doing jobs similar to their former civilian jobs and were experts in that particular sort of thing, having done it for years. In short, give the officers a break! [paragraph] [unclear] a number [/unclear] Another gripe I have is: everyday one sees pictures of [unclear] [/unclear] [unclear] [/unclear] of the women's services going overseas into theaters of operations. Now, why couldn't "limited service" men of good physical health except for a minor defect go also? It will at least remove that "civilians in uniform" feeling from men classified as non-combatants.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Thank you kindly.
S64.Q97.Full: Thank you kindly.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: I feel that some soldiers have too many [unclear] ???- [/unclear]
S64.Q97.F: I don't believe an honest hard working soldier is given full credit.[paragraph] I think a man is trusted better if he is a general rounder [capable of most combat skills] in the army.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't believe an honest hard working soldier is given full credit.[paragraph] I think a man is trusted better if he is a general rounder [capable of most combat skills] in the army.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Some of the excessive strain on transportation could be relieved by discouraging non-essential long distance trips by civilians and soldiers.
S64.Q97.Full: Some of the excessive strain on transportation could be relieved by discouraging non-essential long distance trips by civilians and soldiers.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: It would seem to me that the section of the army which needs most a morale building program is the Limited Service one (only the words have been rescinded). I [underline] don't [/underline] mean by a morale building program movie stars and musical shows. I am a classification specialist and my work is probably the most interesting I could find in the way of limited service jobs but ...
S64.Q97.C_1: despite the fact that I have heard time and time again that I am replacing a General Service man so that he can go out and fight I still feel that my services in this Army are practically useless. A WAAC could do my job. If I can't become an officer (I can't due not to lack of ability buy by reason of the four schools a Limited Service man is allowed to attend being practically closed. I don't see that my work is essential. I can't become an officer and thus make full use of my abilities so I'd rather be a civilian. I'm stagnated here. Most everyone I know who is Limited Service (I repeat again they abolished only the term Limited Service) is very dissatisfied. They all feel their job is useless thing which they usually admit someone has to do but it seems of such little im-portance that they are unhappy doing it.
S64.Q97.Full: It would seem to me that the section of the army which needs most a morale building program is the Limited Service one (only the words have been rescinded). I [underline] don't [/underline] mean by a morale building program movie stars and musical shows. I am a classification specialist and my work is probably the most interesting I could find in the way of limited service jobs but ... despite the fact that I have heard time and time again that I am replacing a General Service man so that he can go out and fight I still feel that my services in this Army are practically useless. A WAAC could do my job. If I can't become an officer (I can't due not to lack of ability buy by reason of the four schools a Limited Service man is allowed to attend being practically closed. I don't see that my work is essential. I can't become an officer and thus make full use of my abilities so I'd rather be a civilian. I'm stagnated here. Most everyone I know who is Limited Service (I repeat again they abolished only the term Limited Service) is very dissatisfied. They all feel their job is useless thing which they usually admit someone has to do but it seems of such little im-portance that they are unhappy doing it.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Well I'm limited service, an I don't like it at all. I would like to go over seas an fight for our good U.S.A.
S64.Q97.Full: Well I'm limited service, an I don't like it at all. I would like to go over seas an fight for our good U.S.A.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: The one thing I think could be improved on more is the system of transfer from one type of outfit to another. That is when the man has the right qualifications. The way things are now it's almost impossible to get transferred.
S64.Q97.Full: The one thing I think could be improved on more is the system of transfer from one type of outfit to another. That is when the man has the right qualifications. The way things are now it's almost impossible to get transferred.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Their is only one thing that gets me and that is "rank pulling". Non-coms can and ought to be able to get things done without threatening or bullying their subordinates. At the induction center more care should be taken when inducting men. I've seen men that should have never been
S64.Q97.C_1: inducted and I've seen others, like myself, who were inducted into limited service and were capable of being general service.
S64.Q97.Full: Their is only one thing that gets me and that is "rank pulling". Non-coms can and ought to be able to get things done without threatening or bullying their subordinates. At the induction center more care should be taken when inducting men. I've seen men that should have never been  inducted and I've seen others, like myself, who were inducted into limited service and were capable of being general service.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I would just like to say that if I had been put in to some outfit where I could keep my mind and hands busy I would probably like the army. As it is at the present I am pulling guard duty day in and day out, in fact, that's all I have done since my entry into the army. I am a fellow who gets very nervous of not having ...
S64.Q97.C_1: anything to do. We pull our duties in six hour shifts - 6 on 6 off 6 on 6 off, which gives plenty of time to walk a post in think about army life. I feel I am qualified for Army Ordance [Ordnance] . I have tried to transfer into that branch for the past 6 months. But just cant seem to get any place. To sum this all up - I feel I am better suited for some other job. secondly I don't think very much of myself as and M.P.
S64.Q97.Full: I would just like to say that if I had been put in to some outfit where I could keep my mind and hands busy I would probably like the army. As it is at the present I am pulling guard duty day in and day out, in fact, that's all I have done since my entry into the army. I am a fellow who gets very nervous of not having ...   anything to do. We pull our duties in six hour shifts - 6 on 6 off 6 on 6 off, which gives plenty of time to walk a post in think about army life. I feel I am qualified for Army Ordance [Ordnance] . I have tried to transfer into that branch for the past 6 months. But just cant seem to get any place. To sum this all up - I feel I am better suited for some other job. secondly I don't think very much of myself as and M.P.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think that the army as a whole is run pretty good. But there are a lot of room for changes. On is to give the enlisted man a better chance to get higher in the army . And other thing is to give out furloughs to the men who need it instead of the suck ass boys usually in an office next to the commanding officer.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that the army as a whole is run pretty good. But there are a lot of room for changes. On is to give the enlisted man a better chance to get higher in the army . And other thing is to give out furloughs to the men who need it instead of the suck ass boys usually in an office next to the commanding officer.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Perhaps some of my answers seem a bit cynical or bitter, but when you have been put in the Army on Limited Service placed first on permanent K.P. , then as a Sports Editor of a newspaper after 90 days in a G.D. kitchen, you begin to wonder what you are worth. I have never felt right about wearing a fighting mans clothes and yet
S64.Q97.C_1: doing absolutely nothing about it. It would seem to me that a man with two years of college, a man who holds a shipfitters helper rating in Civil Service employed in [unclear] [/unclear] battle repair in the Navy Yards, or who is qualified through past experience and education to grasp any type of defense job, would do much better in a war essential civilian job than in a non essential Limited Service Army Job. Is it any wonder the Limited Service morale is low, they must all feel in part the way I do. I am looking forward hopefully to this form 161 in hopes that I may get out of the service and get into an occupation that will benefit me.
S64.Q97.Full: Perhaps some of my answers seem a bit cynical or bitter, but when you have been put in the Army on Limited Service placed first on permanent K.P. , then as a Sports Editor of a newspaper after 90 days in a G.D. kitchen, you begin to wonder what you are worth. I have never felt right about wearing a fighting mans clothes and yet doing absolutely nothing about it. It would seem to me that a man with two years of college, a man who holds a shipfitters helper rating in Civil Service employed in [unclear] [/unclear] battle repair in the Navy Yards, or who is qualified through past experience and education to grasp any type of defense job, would do much better in a war essential civilian job than in a non essential Limited Service Army Job. Is it any wonder the Limited Service morale is low, they must all feel in part the way I do. I am looking forward hopefully to this form 161 in hopes that I may get out of the service and get into an occupation that will benefit me.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes

S64.Q97.F: I don't like being treated like a child, that cannot be trusted out of sight. I believe a man should be taken on his word of honor until he is caught doing wrong then punish him and take away his privileges.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't like being treated like a child, that cannot be trusted out of sight. I believe a man should be taken on his word of honor until he is caught doing wrong then punish him and take away his privileges.

S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I am doing the best I can as a soldier, but its really getting me down with my back and foot, but will stick it out, cause I want to be a good soldier.
S64.Q97.Full: I am doing the best I can as a soldier, but its really getting me down with my back and foot, but will stick it out, cause I want to be a good soldier.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Couldn't the civilian element be kept from working with service men and also over them, it seems wrong to see a person who is paid well leave his job for the day even tho, he has not finished his work - many times he is better paid than a man in uniform but he cannot really
S64.Q97.C_1: care about putting all his effort in a job when he quits cause his day[deletion] s [/deletion] [deletion] work [/deletion] is over I know I feel rotten to see a man leave his work saying he is done just because he will not draw overtime. Many times I've put in extra hours and I don't worry about overtime.
S64.Q97.Full: Couldn't the civilian element be kept from working with service men and also over them, it seems wrong to see a person who is paid well leave his job for the day even tho, he has not finished his work - many times he is better paid than a man in uniform but he cannot really  care about putting all his effort in a job when he quits cause his day[deletion] s [/deletion] [deletion] work [/deletion] is over I know I feel rotten to see a man leave his work saying he is done just because he will not draw overtime. Many times I've put in extra hours and I don't worry about overtime.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)

S64.Q97.Full: In question 19, yes I would change if I could get in the air corps. In question 33, I think I would stay in as long as possible if I could get in the Air Corp.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)

S64.Q97.F: Non coms should not show so much authority. When orders are given they should not be changed without informing the men. [paragraph] On inspection they should keep the rules the same and not change in between days without [deletion] [/deletion] informing the men.
S64.Q97.Full: Non coms should not show so much authority. When orders are given they should not be changed without informing the men. [paragraph] On inspection they should keep the rules the same and not change in between days without [deletion] [/deletion] informing the men.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: When the army gives you a furlough they should give you traveling time both ways + furlough time or else, on a long trip of 2500 miles or over it don't pay to go home + thats where a soldier will go the first thing is home for a visit + those are very few + in between. Another thing: Soldiers should be given preference on trains + all modes of transportation
S64.Q97.C_1: first, then women & children forget men. A soldier should pay half price for anything he buys, a soldier is protecting a civilian and yet he has to pay the same full price and the civilian hasn't as much danger to look forward to. [Paragraph] Give the soldier the first chance in anything and give them an even break in everything. He is your protection --
S64.Q97.Full: When the army gives you a furlough they should give you traveling time both ways + furlough time or else, on a long trip of 2500 miles or over it don't pay to go home + thats where a soldier will go the first thing is home for a visit + those are very few + in between. Another thing: Soldiers should be given preference on trains + all modes of transportation first, then women & children forget men. A soldier should pay half price for anything he buys, a soldier is protecting a civilian and yet he has to pay the same full price and the civilian hasn't as much danger to look forward to. [Paragraph] Give the soldier the first chance in anything and give them an even break in everything. He is your protection --

S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: It hard for me to change to army life from cilivian life + I am married + one child + it hard from me to be away from them so far as I can't seenem + it will be hard for em to get along on 62.00 a month + pay rent + so forth
S64.Q97.Full: It hard for me to change to army life from cilivian life + I am married + one child + it hard from me to be away from them so far as I can't seenem + it will be hard for em to get along on 62.00 a month + pay rent + so forth

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page

S64.Q95.M_marginalia: haven't had any

S64.Q97.C_1: The only thing I have to say is that I wish all the men that are needed to win the war were trained and overseas ready for action. That may include me. I don't care if I do see active I would like to. But I wish things could be wound up quickly so that I could get back home to my family and friends.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Well, the Army should give at least a 3 day pass once a month + [and] a couple of 24 hour passes. That is the only thing I don't like. A pass means you can work a lot better the week after. Even if you work very hard. A pass of a furlough will keep up the moral.
S64.Q97.Full: Well, the Army should give at least a 3 day pass once a month + [and] a couple of 24 hour passes. That is the only thing I don't like. A pass means you can work a lot better the week after. Even if you work very hard. A pass of a furlough will keep up the moral.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Haven't been in the Army long enough to have decided on all questions ask.[paragraph] I don't think married men should be ask to leave this country and fight.
S64.Q97.Full: Haven't been in the Army long enough to have decided on all questions ask.[paragraph] I don't think married men should be ask to leave this country and fight.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I sincerely believe that the discipline could be improved a great deal if [underline] all [/underline] the officers took a more personal interest in the soldier & forgot personal prejudices. However, I don't believe this condition is true throughout the entire service.
S64.Q97.C_1: I believe married men should have class "A" passes when their wives are living near the post. I believe, food, clothing sizes, and general comfort could be improved.
S64.Q97.Full: I sincerely believe that the discipline could be improved a great deal if [underline] all [/underline] the officers took a more personal interest in the soldier & forgot personal prejudices. However, I don't believe this condition is true throughout the entire service.  I believe married men should have class "A" passes when their wives are living near the post. I believe, food, clothing sizes, and general comfort could be improved.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I think a Soldier should git a furlough at least every [unclear] 4 [/unclear] months and he should have more time at home. [paragraph] The Laundry service is Very Poore.
S64.Q97.Full: I think a Soldier should git a furlough at least every [unclear] 4 [/unclear] months and he should have more time at home. [paragraph] The Laundry service is Very Poore.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I need to be out of the Army.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: I am well satisfied with my job, but know service boys in this outfit that ain't. They are on details where as they have worked in stock control for three years I think the [unclear] [/unclear] should not hold personal grudges in rank as they do
S64.Q97.C_1: I also think more could be done for the boys morale. Such as more dances at the service [unclear] [/unclear] , better food, and possibly other functions overall, could be had. The boys also think more passes and furloughs should be given. I also think [deletion] that [/deletion] there should be more ratings given in certain sections, rather then all in other Batteries. I also think they should issue more C.K.C [cotton khaki clothing] uniforms if they expect you to keep clean as you would like to. Also during hot weather to get up earlier and get off earlier.
S64.Q97.Full: I am well satisfied with my job, but know service boys in this outfit that ain't. They are on details where as they have worked in stock control for three years I think the [unclear] [/unclear] should not hold personal grudges in rank as they do  I also think more could be done for the boys morale. Such as more dances at the service [unclear] [/unclear] , better food, and possibly other functions overall, could be had. The boys also think more passes and furloughs should be given. I also think [deletion] that [/deletion] there should be more ratings given in certain sections, rather then all in other Batteries. I also think they should issue more C.K.C [cotton khaki clothing] uniforms if they expect you to keep clean as you would like to. Also during hot weather to get up earlier and get off earlier.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Soldiers should be able to get cloting when needed without wasting and wanting Laundry service should be improved. We don't have enough clothing to have to [unclear] wait [/unclear] three and four weeks.
S64.Q97.Full: Soldiers should be able to get cloting when needed without wasting and wanting Laundry service should be improved. We don't have enough clothing to have to [unclear] wait [/unclear] three and four weeks.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Sir I would like to be transferred to the Navy because I know I can do more because I am highly interested and like it very well. The outfit I am in now I am not interested in at all and I don't care to learn. All I want to be is a sailor. I can do more for my country as a sailor Can you please help me in any way.
S64.Q97.Full: Sir I would like to be transferred to the Navy because I know I can do more because I am highly interested and like it very well. The outfit I am in now I am not interested in at all and I don't care to learn. All I want to be is a sailor. I can do more for my country as a sailor Can you please help me in any way.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Well I feel that if it wasn't for my family I would like the army fine. But my family needs me more at home and I feel I could do more for the war effort at home.
S64.Q97.Full: Well I feel that if it wasn't for my family I would like the army fine. But my family needs me more at home and I feel I could do more for the war effort at home.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: In final comment I don't believe that the men training are getting their share of good equipment for training. If this good equipment is for our troops overseas that's all right but to equip other countries first and us second is very distasteful to me. Undoubtedly I'm wrong about this but will soon know in the future. I believe we should look after ourselves first & always. As long
S64.Q97.C_1: 97 cont. as lend lease and as being given what's holding things back for China's Japan is our greatest enemy & always will be. Smash her now & keep a good eye on Russia from now on.
S64.Q97.Full: In final comment I don't believe that the men training are getting their share of good equipment for training. If this good equipment is for our troops overseas that's all right but to equip other countries first and us second is very distasteful to me. Undoubtedly I'm wrong about this but will soon know in the future. I believe we should look after ourselves first & always. As long 97 cont. as lend lease and as being given what's holding things back for China's Japan is our greatest enemy & always will be. Smash her now & keep a good eye on Russia from now on.

S64.Q97.Full: I would like for this war to soon be over with every one is getting tired of it.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Not enough clothing and because it takes about 2 months to get [unclear] [/unclear] and laundry to get back. Not enough to eat at all while we are in the camp we get poor food to eat.
S64.Q97.Full: Not enough clothing and because it takes about 2 months to get [unclear] [/unclear] and laundry to get back. Not enough to eat at all while we are in the camp we get poor food to eat.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: In our battery we have too many unnecessary rules and they change them every day or so. They should have one set rule and not change so often. The food we get is poor but could be improved - as long as we are not across, I think they should make it as pleasant as possible. - because it will be tough enough when we do go across.
S64.Q97.C_1: I think we should have more passes + more nights off. [paragraph] We work all day - then at night they find something for us to do. Therefore we don't get enough rest. [paragraph] It is O.K. to work 24 hrs a day if it is important - but half what we do is not important. [paragraph] I also think we should be given more dress clothes + fatigues. Half the time when we do get a pass we have no clean clothes because it takes the laundry a week or more to come back.
S64.Q97.Full: In our battery we have too many unnecessary rules and they change them every day or so. They should have one set rule and not change so often. The food we get is poor but could be improved - as long as we are not across, I think they should make it as pleasant as possible. - because it will be tough enough when we do go across.  I think we should have more passes + more nights off. [paragraph] We work all day - then at night they find something for us to do. Therefore we don't get enough rest. [paragraph] It is O.K. to work 24 hrs a day if it is important - but half what we do is not important. [paragraph] I also think we should be given more dress clothes + fatigues. Half the time when we do get a pass we have no clean clothes because it takes the laundry a week or more to come back.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: to many [unclear] [/unclear] rules & indifferencies. One doesn't know from one minute to the next what he is going to do. [paragraph] I had one short furlough in a year of service. I think I should have had more or at least one fairly long one. 5 days a year at home isn't very much when one is supposed to get 30 days a year. How about that?
S64.Q97.Full: to many [unclear] [/unclear] rules & indifferencies. One doesn't know from one minute to the next what he is going to do. [paragraph] I had one short furlough in a year of service. I think I should have had more or at least one fairly long one. 5 days a year at home isn't very much when one is supposed to get 30 days a year. How about that?

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: We do not get enough to eat + it is not prepared well enough. Medics are too dam slow about taking care of a person needing attention. We are punished too much for what someone else does. Too many of the Non Coms do not deserve them + the ones who do deserve them are not getting them.
S64.Q97.Full: We do not get enough to eat + it is not prepared well enough. Medics are too dam slow about taking care of a person needing attention. We are punished too much for what someone else does. Too many of the Non Coms do not deserve them + the ones who do deserve them are not getting them.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I sincerly belive I would make good in the [deletion] G [/deletion] Ground Crew of the Air Corp.
S64.Q97.Full: I sincerly belive I would make good in the [deletion] G [/deletion] Ground Crew of the Air Corp.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Just want to get it over with and get back to my family - but up to that time money couldn't buy me out.
S64.Q97.Full: Just want to get it over with and get back to my family - but up to that time money couldn't buy me out.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Well in this outfit, They don't give a white man a chance to make stripes. There are lot of Spanish who seem to get all the brake. I been in the army 8 months and i work as hard as anyone, But [insertion] I am [/insertion] still a buck private. Some of these mexican can't even read English or write. I just don't get it.
S64.Q97.Full: Well in this outfit, They don't give a white man a chance to make stripes. There are lot of Spanish who seem to get all the brake. I been in the army 8 months and i work as hard as anyone, But [insertion] I am [/insertion] still a buck private. Some of these mexican can't even read English or write. I just don't get it.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Their are boys in my battery that were AWOL and still they get the breaks for the best jobs and after a few weeks stay in [deletion] at [/deletion] camp are up to a rating. There are a few boys that really try to make a rating and they are the ones that never see them. [paragraph] I think for my own sake if they would give some of the boys that had an IQ score more then a 100 should be given
S64.Q97.C_1: the test over in order to see wheather they could make more. If they should make more and are fitted for a [unclear] restain [/unclear] job or suppose to be sent to school in order to make the [deletion] unknown [/deletion] [insertion] best [/insertion] or serve the best for their country.
S64.Q97.Full: Their are boys in my battery that were AWOL and still they get the breaks for the best jobs and after a few weeks stay in [deletion] at [/deletion] camp are up to a rating. There are a few boys that really try to make a rating and they are the ones that never see them. [paragraph] I think for my own sake if they would give some of the boys that had an IQ score more then a 100 should be given the test over in order to see wheather they could make more. If they should make more and are fitted for a [unclear] restain [/unclear] job or suppose to be sent to school in order to make the [deletion] unknown [/deletion] [insertion] best [/insertion] or serve the best for their country.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I could do a lot more good in a war job.
S64.Q97.Full: I could do a lot more good in a war job.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: If the Army would grade a soldier more [unclear] closely [/unclear] and put him when he is best fited [fitted] . Like myself. I can handel heavy equipment, molder, and do blacksmith work. Everybody can't do them. What I am doing now a little 14 year old boy can do it. It would be a great lot better to be where you is best fited [fitted] .
S64.Q97.Full: If the Army would grade a soldier more [unclear] closely [/unclear] and put him when he is best fited [fitted] . Like myself. It would be a great lot better to be where you is best fited [fitted] .

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I think that some of the com and nocom [noncom] officers do not know as much as the privets [privates] and for that reason they should go to school more than the privets.
S64.Q97.Full: I think that some of the com and nocom [noncom] officers do not know as much as the privets [privates] and for that reason they should go to school more than the privets.

S64.Q97.F: My personal opinion of our anti aircraft outfit is that its chicken shit cause we absolutely have no leadership. we have only one officer who is capable of leading us, our men are rugged and tough, and want to fight but our officers are chicken shit. We never have hardly any recreation, our outfit isn't really army, we are not given enough infantry training[.] Our officers never ...
S64.Q97.C_1: [unclear] [/unclear]
S64.Q97.Full: My personal opinion of our anti aircraft outfit is that its chicken shit cause we absolutely have no leadership. we have only one officer who is capable of leading us, our men are rugged and tough, and want to fight but our officers are chicken shit. We never have hardly any recreation, our outfit isn't really army, we are not given enough infantry training[.] Our officers never ...  [unclear] [/unclear]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: Cont 45B - After the war the allies will not need war equipment. So the plants will have to close. So there will be hard times for every one.
S64.Q97.Full: Cont 45B - After the war the allies will not need war equipment. So the plants will have to close. So there will be hard times for every one.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I was told when I entered the Army I would do something similar to my civilian work. I worked in the following trades cabinet maker, steel worker and arc welder and I am not doing anything near like those trades.
S64.Q97.Full: I was told when I entered the Army I would do something similar to my civilian work. I worked in the following trades cabinet maker, steel worker and arc welder and I am not doing anything near like those trades.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: The reason I said I was not proud of this outfit is because I don't understand it very well & when I volunteered fr the army I volunteered for the Air Corps & wasn't even given a chance to show that I could make out there better than I could here because ...
S64.Q97.C_1: I'm more Interested in that than I am this outfit. [space] And we haven't enough time in the Eve. & on Sun [Sunday] to do what you care to do most of the time they give you & extra duty as detail to take care of in your spare time & some of it I don't think is necessary.
S64.Q97.Full: The reason I said I was not proud of this outfit is because I don't understand it very well & when I volunteered fr the army I volunteered for the Air Corps & wasn't even given a chance to show that I could make out there better than I could here because ...  I'm more Interested in that than I am this outfit. [space] And we haven't enough time in the Eve. & on Sun [Sunday] to do what you care to do most of the time they give you & extra duty as detail to take care of in your spare time & some of it I don't think is necessary.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: No other remarks needed.
S64.Q97.Full: No other remarks needed.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Subject: Passes for enlisted men The pass situation at present I believe is not operated correctly. We are only allowed passes as follows: Saturdays 12:30 PM until Sunday 6 AM or Sunday 6 AM until Sunday 11 PM. These passes do not give enough time for a married soldier whose wife is near Camp, besides transportation does not give a soldier too much time to be with his family. Married men should
S64.Q97.C_1: be given week end passes starting from 12:30 PM. Sat until Sunday 11 PM. The only one allowed week ends are non-coms [Non-Commissioned Officer] who have their wives in the near vicinity of Camp. [Paragraph] It would be a great morale builder if this was done, the men when returning would have something to look for, during the week. If these [insertion] day [/insertion] passes will continue they will be eventually a many AWOL due to not giving a soldier enough time to see their family, beside a soldier may have to travel 4 hours to see their family which does not give them much time.
S64.Q97.Full: Subject: Passes for enlisted men The pass situation at present I believe is not operated correctly. We are only allowed passes as follows: Saturdays 12:30 PM until Sunday 6 AM or Sunday 6 AM until Sunday 11 PM. These passes do not give enough time for a married soldier whose wife is near Camp, besides transportation does not give a soldier too much time to be with his family. Married men should be given week end passes starting from 12:30 PM. Sat until Sunday 11 PM. The only one allowed week ends are non-coms [Non-Commissioned Officer] who have their wives in the near vicinity of Camp. [Paragraph] It would be a great morale builder if this was done, the men when returning would have something to look for, during the week. If these [insertion] day [/insertion] passes will continue they will be eventually a many AWOL due to not giving a soldier enough time to see their family, beside a soldier may have to travel 4 hours to see their family which does not give them much time.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Should be more furloughs
S64.Q97.Full: Should be more furloughs

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I think if a person has the qualification to be in some [insertion] other [/insertion] branch of the Army and he wants in it he should be granted the priviledge. Like me I want in the Air Corps. I took extra math in high school so I could get in the Air Corps.
S64.Q97.Full: I think if a person has the qualification to be in some [insertion] other [/insertion] branch of the Army and he wants in it he should be granted the priviledge. Like me I want in the Air Corps. I took extra math in high school so I could get in the Air Corps.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I like the Aircorps very much. The outfit I'm in now does not completely satisfy me and it's almost impossible to get a transfer. We are given the opportunity to go into the paratroops or Cadets. My chances of getting in the Aircorps as a Cadet is almost impossible and I would like a
S64.Q97.C_1: chance at it very much if I failed in that I could at least be a gunner or mechanic in the outfit I think most highly of.
S64.Q97.Full: I like the Aircorps very much. The outfit I'm in now does not completely satisfy me and it's almost impossible to get a transfer. We are given the opportunity to go into the paratroops or Cadets. My chances of getting in the Aircorps as a Cadet is almost impossible and I would like a  chance at it very much if I failed in that I could at least be a gunner or mechanic in the outfit I think most highly of.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I have always been taught in leadership a non com or Commissioned officer should really have leadership ability. I don't believe in this idea of DO AS I SAY NOT AS I DO as far as Offiers are concerned. An officer should be respected and should have the ability to be a real leader too many officers have neither - especially Non. Coms. Cursing and
S64.Q97.C_1: Swearing in giving orders is not to my way of thinking an efficient or a good way to giver orders. Army life for the most part is a good life. One plea most of us have is that in 25 years from now we won't have another war. If we Americans can profit by our last mistake and do a better job toward making a definite and lasting peace_this is what we want. America can't stay secluded away from other countries-we'll have to cooperate this time-a war wrecks most all plans for a future-now lets have a future without plans fore a war.
S64.Q97.Full: I have always been taught in leadership a non com or Commissioned officer should really have leadership ability. I don't believe in this idea of DO AS I SAY NOT AS I DO as far as Offiers are concerned. An officer should be respected and should have the ability to be a real leader too many officers have neither - especially Non. Coms. Cursing and Swearing in giving orders is not to my way of thinking an efficient or a good way to giver orders. Army life for the most part is a good life. One plea most of us have is that in 25 years from now we won't have another war. If we Americans can profit by our last mistake and do a better job toward making a definite and lasting peace_this is what we want. America can't stay secluded away from other countries-we'll have to cooperate this time-a war wrecks most all plans for a future-now lets have a future without plans fore a war.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I have nothing but a few trivial complaints, however I think that a few First Sargents could be a lot more civil to the men.
S64.Q97.Full: I have nothing but a few trivial complaints, however I think that a few First Sargents could be a lot more civil to the men.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: When a soldier in our outfit gets battery punishment I don't think the case is given a fair trial to prove his innocents - it majoraly being the captains or first sargents fault.
S64.Q97.Full: When a soldier in our outfit gets battery punishment I don't think the case is given a fair trial to prove his innocents - it majoraly being the captains or first sargents fault.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: There is a sergeant in our battery which I do not like at all. he calls you any name he feels like, the other day he called a fellow, a goddamn yellow bastard, he is naturally a morale breaker. He is in C btry [Battery]
S64.Q97.Full: There is a sergeant in our battery which I do not like at all. he calls you any name he feels like, the other day he called a fellow, a goddamn yellow bastard, he is naturally a morale breaker. He is in C btry [Battery]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I have been in the army for a good while and I was recently recomended for a T/4 but a fellow who had been in only five weeks got a little hand shaking in and he got the rating now. I think that we should take exams for them for I know I know more about the work and the army in general than he does.
S64.Q97.Full: I have been in the army for a good while and I was recently recomended for a T/4 but a fellow who had been in only five weeks got a little hand shaking in and he got the rating now. I think that we should take exams for them for I know I know more about the work and the army in general than he does.

S64.Q97.F: The Non-Coms Could Treat the men more like soilders than prisinors And they should act as link between officers and E.M. The orders or to unstable, changed to often, to much undecision, to many favorite at the officers, not much change to tell a non-com your side of the story, one non-com to strip happy and over excesises his autharoty. The men
S64.Q97.C_1: Question 97

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Furloughs are to few and far between as far as our outfit is concerned.
S64.Q97.Full: Furloughs are to few and far between as far as our outfit is concerned.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: The nocoms don't seem to know enough about the [deletion] [/deletion] subjects they are required to teach. The [unclear] most [/unclear] seem to have their ratings from pull rather from actual knowledge + service.
S64.Q97.Full: The nocoms don't seem to know enough about the [deletion] [/deletion] subjects they are required to teach. The [unclear] most [/unclear] seem to have their ratings from pull rather from actual knowledge + service.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think we should get a little more time on certain subjects, so we can learn the parts and how they operate. I think we sit around too much and listen to lecture instead of actually working on the equipment.
S64.Q97.Full: I think we should get a little more time on certain subjects, so we can learn the parts and how they operate. I think we sit around too much and listen to lecture instead of actually working on the equipment.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: The army with unfit officer and little respect for enlisted men is rotten. Because we fight for equal right which you don't get in the army so that the hell is the use of fighting
S64.Q97.Full: The army with unfit officer and little respect for enlisted men is rotten. Because we fight for equal right which you don't get in the army so that the hell is the use of fighting

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: It seems to me a fellow who has been in the army over a year like myself, and has not been able to get a furlough isn't quite fair. I've had a perfect record all the time I've been in the service.
S64.Q97.Full: It seems to me a fellow who has been in the army over a year like myself, and has not been able to get a furlough isn't quite fair. I've had a perfect record all the time I've been in the service.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: When a man finishes basic give him a pass whenever he is off duty. Give a man a furlough every six months.
S64.Q97.Full: When a man finishes basic give him a pass whenever he is off duty. Give a man a furlough every six months.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I don't think the army tells a man enough as to his training, how long it's going to be, or where he can expect to go next. It seems to me that we could be informed a little more as to our daily training. I am married and would like to know first about when I can expect a furlough. When I came to this camp it was 3 or 4 days before I knew just where I was supposed to be at certain times of the day. No -
S64.Q97.C_1: one even approved me to let me know that they knew I was there. When a person is on pass I think he should be allowed to come back to camp to sleep at night. This would not dump so many soldiers on the streets that are looking for some place to sleep. I also think a soldier should be given a little more time to himself. We have had time in the day to have classes that were not held till evening. When a soldier is finished for the day he should not be forced to see boxing matches ball games and etc. Most of the fellows would go themselves but forcing them to go makes us dislike them.
S64.Q97.Full: I don't think the army tells a man enough as to his training, how long it's going to be, or where he can expect to go next. It seems to me that we could be informed a little more as to our daily training. I am married and would like to know first about when I can expect a furlough. When I came to this camp it was 3 or 4 days before I knew just where I was supposed to be at certain times of the day. No -   one even approved me to let me know that they knew I was there. When a person is on pass I think he should be allowed to come back to camp to sleep at night. This would not dump so many soldiers on the streets that are looking for some place to sleep. I also think a soldier should be given a little more time to himself. We have had time in the day to have classes that were not held till evening. When a soldier is finished for the day he should not be forced to see boxing matches ball games and etc. Most of the fellows would go themselves but forcing them to go makes us dislike them.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Nothing except the army needs better doctors. They give you a pill for a broken leg and put you on hard labor to cure heart trouble.
S64.Q97.Full: Nothing except the army needs better doctors. They give you a pill for a broken leg and put you on hard labor to cure heart trouble.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: No reason for the men to have pride in their outfit and it is never been brought out by the officers that a man should have pride in his outfit.
S64.Q97.Full: No reason for the men to have pride in their outfit and it is never been brought out by the officers that a man should have pride in his outfit.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I like the army O.K. for I feel it is a war for every one to fight thats able. [paragraph] I get a pass every two or three weeks that as often as I want one. I haven't Been in the army long enough for a furlough But I feel sure I will get one as soon as we finish most of our trainging [training] if I can
S64.Q97.C_1: get one furlough Before going overseas & will Be [unclear] [/unclear] first. Otherwise I won't.
S64.Q97.Full: I like the army O.K. for I feel it is a war for every one to fight thats able. [paragraph] I get a pass every two or three weeks that as often as I want one. I haven't Been in the army long enough for a furlough But I feel sure I will get one as soon as we finish most of our trainging [training] if I can  get one furlough Before going overseas & will Be [unclear] [/unclear] first. Otherwise I won't.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Why don't the army put [deletion] [/deletion] men who are skill trade men in the job they could do best such as this country is so short of tool maker in war time and the army takes tham and trys to make some thing esle out of tham. And for officers trainning a man doesn't always have to have the knowedge out of the books but some more
S64.Q97.C_1: practical experience on things the army usually requires in a days work There are plenty of men who are good men also gentleman and have knowedge of Worldly things who are better off than 19 yr old school boys which it goes to their back when giving command of a group of men. [paragraph] But most important is the army should place man in jobs they are best suited for and [deletion] the [/deletion] take more interest in doing so. [paragraph] And when the man are giving breaks they should las until the time is up. [paragraph] And a man doesn't have to be ship 3100 miles in order for him to be trained. until he is ready to go overseas he should get to see his home once in a while not 1 a year. All in All the higher ups should make more checks on things and less inspections of the Enlisted man, he will be a good soilder if giving a even chance lets win the world.

And for officers trainning a man doesn't always have to have the knowedge out of the books but some more  practical experience on things the army usually requires in a days work There are plenty of men who are good men also gentleman and have knowedge of Worldly things who are better off than 19 yr old school boys which it goes to their back when giving command of a group of men. [paragraph] But most important is the army should place man in jobs they are best suited for and [deletion] the [/deletion] take more interest in doing so. [paragraph] And when the man are giving breaks they should las until the time is up. [paragraph] And a man doesn't have to be ship 3100 miles in order for him to be trained. until he is ready to go overseas he should get to see his home once in a while not 1 a year. document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Sometimes the food is good, and sometimes it is very poor. All the Non-coms in the kitchen know how to do is swear & blow a whistle. And we do not have the proper way of washing our mess. Kits sometimes cold water and no soap, and then the officers give us hell at inspection for not having clean mess kits.
S64.Q97.Full: Sometimes the food is good, and sometimes it is very poor. All the Non-coms in the kitchen know how to do is swear & blow a whistle. And we do not have the proper way of washing our mess. Kits sometimes cold water and no soap, and then the officers give us hell at inspection for not having clean mess kits.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of furloughs but not passes
S64.Q97.F: Regarding knowledge of languages these have not been considered and although I do not want any stripes I intend to give to the Army all my knowledge of the [unclear] former [/unclear] but have had no chance. This is due to a lack of personal checking in records. [paragraph] Many of the non coms have the wrong idea about the war and it
S64.Q97.C_1: should be the duty of the Army to teach them different. [paragraph] Many men still have the old prejudists on the race controversy it is up to the officers to see that they are taught different but only by education in spare time. [paragraph] Again I want to mention if the Army wants to put men on a technical instrument to teach them more of its maintenance instead of nomenclature. [paragraph] The papers for citizenship which are usually quite easily obtained should be speeded up. If a man is willing to die for this country at least let him be a citizen. [underline] ATTENTION [/underline] [is written in the left margin next to the final paragraph.]
S64.Q97.Full: Regarding knowledge of languages these have not been considered and although I do not want any stripes I intend to give to the Army all my knowledge of the [unclear] former [/unclear] but have had no chance. This is due to a lack of personal checking in records. [paragraph] Many of the non coms have the wrong idea about the war and it   should be the duty of the Army to teach them different. [paragraph] Many men still have the old prejudists on the race controversy it is up to the officers to see that they are taught different but only by education in spare time. [paragraph] Again I want to mention if the Army wants to put men on a technical instrument to teach them more of its maintenance instead of nomenclature. [paragraph] The papers for citizenship which are usually quite easily obtained should be speeded up. If a man is willing to die for this country at least let him be a citizen. [underline] ATTENTION [/underline] [is written in the left margin next to the final paragraph.]

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: For my present my wife has no one but what little I can make in the army. She is sickly + is on the road to bring birth to us a sweet baby. Her mother is a widow. While I were home I were helping them on a farm + also I were working in the ship yard too. If you all see fit to put me on a diference job I sure would appreciate it then I could help more to win the
S64.Q97.C_1: want to do more for my people back home - I am not able to make + keep up with the young boys age of 18 to 25 -I will be 33 yrs old Oct. 1 1943 - But I am willing to do my best for the good old u.s.a. if I get killed or loose my life just let it go to win the war -
S64.Q97.Full: For my present my wife has no one but what little I can make in the army. She is sickly + is on the road to bring birth to us a sweet baby. Her mother is a widow. While I were home I were helping them on a farm + also I were working in the ship yard too. If you all see fit to put me on a diference job I sure would appreciate it then I could help more to win the want to do more for my people back home - I am not able to make + keep up with the young boys age of 18 to 25 -I will be 33 yrs old Oct. 1 1943 - But I am willing to do my best for the good old u.s.a. if I get killed or loose my life just let it go to win the war -

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Other/No answer
S64.Q97.F: The food could be a lot better in the Army and also they could give you more of it. Some day we dont have enough to feed a mouse let alone are selfs.
S64.Q97.Full: The food could be a lot better in the Army and also they could give you more of it. Some day we dont have enough to feed a mouse let alone are selfs.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Owing to the siege of the Army now, we do not have officers who have had enough training in Military affairs. Drafting men from civilian life and giving them commissions is the biggest mistake the War Dept has made. Men from the ranks make best officers. [paragraph] There is also far too many civies working on jobs that soldiers could do much cheaper, and by far better. [paragraph] It, in my opinion, is a mistake
S64.Q97.C_1: to leave so many soldiers training in one section of the Country. Why not have them scattered out more, which would be better for every body - civilians and servicemen alike. The only one gaining anything by the present set up is the railroads - they sure do have everything in their favor.
S64.Q97.Full: Owing to the siege of the Army now, we do not have officers who have had enough training in Military affairs. Drafting men from civilian life and giving them commissions is the biggest mistake the War Dept has made. Men from the ranks make best officers. [paragraph] There is also far too many civies working on jobs that soldiers could do much cheaper, and by far better. [paragraph] It, in my opinion, is a mistake to leave so many soldiers training in one section of the Country. Why not have them scattered out more, which would be better for every body - civilians and servicemen alike. The only one gaining anything by the present set up is the railroads - they sure do have everything in their favor.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Nothing more to say, only I will be glad when the war is over. and hope the victory will be for the U.S.A. If not, I don't wan't to live under any German or Japanese rule, only true blooded Americans would not won't to live under them for of goverment. The form of goverment we have -
S64.Q97.C_1: now. is the one I hope we [unclear] [/unclear] . For we Don't want a Dictator or king. We want a free country. Where every [unclear] [/unclear] can have a voice in the way thing are run.
S64.Q97.Full: Nothing more to say, only I will be glad when the war is over. and hope the victory will be for the U.S.A. If not, I don't wan't to live under any German or Japanese rule, only true blooded Americans would not won't to live under them for of goverment. The form of goverment we have -  now. is the one I hope we [unclear] [/unclear] . For we Don't want a Dictator or king. We want a free country. Where every [unclear] [/unclear] can have a voice in the way thing are run.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)

S64.Q97.F: i think [deletion] [/deletion] ever [every] noncom. [non-commissioned officer] should fall out for roll call in the morning also the compay [company] officers. and all those that are on K.P. [Kitchen Patrol] should not fall out for roll call. [paragraph] the men has been very lack [lax] on falling out for by formation we have.

[non-commissioned officer] should fall out for roll call in the morning also the compay [company] officers. and all those that are on K.P. [Kitchen Patrol] should not fall out for roll call. S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I [deletion] [/deletion] don't like the Army - because I am married and have a son 3 1/2 years old. I was a welder for the past five years in civilian like. But I'll [deletion] [/deletion] do my [deletion] just[deletion] best for the duration because its my duty.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: As far as army life is concerned and my job, I like them. But I would like to be a little closer to my home so I could see my family once in awhile [a while] . I have been in the army about 11 months and have only seen my family once. [paragraph] If the C.O. [commanding officer] of our company would do what he says instead of always backing down on his word we would
S64.Q97.C_1: Have a lot better company.
S64.Q97.Full: As far as army life is concerned and my job, I like them. But I would like to be a little closer to my home so I could see my family once in awhile [a while] . I have been in the army about 11 months and have only seen my family once. [paragraph] If the C.O. [commanding officer] of our company would do what he says instead of always backing down on his word we would  Have a lot better company.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: I would like to get out of the Army.
S64.Q97.Full: I would like to get out of the Army.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Everybody [deletion] not [/deletion] no matter who they are non-coms [non-commissioned officers] or privates fall out for roll call. There is one exception and that is ones on special details. Soldiers working in the office supply room and latrines should always fall out for roll call.[paragraph] This is one thing that the officers in our outfit has been very laxed on
S64.Q97.Full: Everybody [deletion] not [/deletion] no matter who they are non-coms [non-commissioned officers] or privates fall out for roll call. There is one exception and that is ones on special details. Soldiers working in the office supply room and latrines should always fall out for roll call.[paragraph] This is one thing that the officers in our outfit has been very laxed on

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: It seems to me that a soldier, at least in my outfit, is not allowed to progress in rank according to ability. The officers in our Co. came from civilian life directly into our outfit. They do not take enough interest in the men personally. It's very disgusting to work hard at your job only to have some one else get the rating just because he "works" his way into it.
S64.Q97.Full: It seems to me that a soldier, at least in my outfit, is not allowed to progress in rank according to ability. The officers in our Co. came from civilian life directly into our outfit. They do not take enough interest in the men personally. It's very disgusting to work hard at your job only to have some one else get the rating just because he "works" his way into it.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: The Army has a lot of, what you might term "suck artists". It probably isn't nice to write about something behind a person's back but I have an opinion of that type of person. A man earns chevrons because he's good at the job, not because he has an uncle for a friend or even Commanding Officer. Too many men have been left out in the cold on account of this. I can't say that I've ever en-
S64.Q97.C_1: countered any such trouble in our company but I have in others I had been in. My motto is & always will be "any man that works hard both for his family & country deserves a break & not those that know" Uncle Jack, the CO of and organization nearby & manage to get transferred to his command. I don't have an ounce of respect for either the EM or the Officer as the case may be.
S64.Q97.Full: The Army has a lot of, what you might term "suck artists". It probably isn't nice to write about something behind a person's back but I have an opinion of that type of person. A man earns chevrons because he's good at the job, not because he has an uncle for a friend or even Commanding Officer. Too many men have been left out in the cold on account of this. I can't say that I've ever en- countered any such trouble in our company but I have in others I had been in. My motto is & always will be "any man that works hard both for his family & country deserves a break & not those that know" Uncle Jack, the CO of and organization nearby & manage to get transferred to his command. I don't have an ounce of respect for either the EM or the Officer as the case may be.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: Some companies have small groups that receive all the favors, known as clicks, while the rest receive very little credit or their work. [paragraph] I think the colored race is being given to much power and after the war is over it will cause race riots as my belief you can't edcate [educate] the average negro.
S64.Q97.Full: Some companies have small groups that receive all the favors, known as clicks, while the rest receive very little credit or their work. [paragraph] I think the colored race is being given to much power and after the war is over it will cause race riots as my belief you can't edcate [educate] the average negro.

S64.Q97.F: Takes to much [deletion] [/deletion] sucksun to get any wheres and Non-Coms don't like to give one a chance and to many clicks if you are in a click you are O.K., otherwise a very cool time. [paragraph] This refers to some outfits.
S64.Q97.Full: Takes to much [deletion] [/deletion] sucksun to get any wheres and Non-Coms don't like to give one a chance and to many clicks if you are in a click you are O.K., otherwise a very cool time. [paragraph] This refers to some outfits.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: [The answer has been amended in that the words "not of" have been lined through and replaced with "no"; and "from this post." has been added to the end of the answer. The resulting answer has thus become "I have had my fair share of passes, but no furloughs from this post."] [Also, the number in the box to the right of the question contains the number 6 instead of the answer number, which is 8]
S64.Q97.F: If the civilian people could understand how rough this life is. After all or most of being used to civilian life. I think they would have more interest in ending the war soon. I don't like a man who hogs a fortune made from war boom.
S64.Q97.Full: If the civilian people could understand how rough this life is. After all or most of being used to civilian life. I think they would have more interest in ending the war soon. I don't like a man who hogs a fortune made from war boom.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: There is one thing that I am sure would help end this War a lot sooner, and that is compel the civilian population to put more effort in their work. A soldier gives up all when he enters the service, while a civilian [underline] (not all) [/underline] cares only for his or her personal gain. This pertains to most of them. (OVER)
S64.Q97.C_1: Another thing that should be done is compel civilian drivers to give lifts to Service men if they have no one in their cars. Please understand that I don't mean to drunken soldiers or such other offenders. But, if they are going any distance at all. Pick up a service-man. [paragraph] Give every man in the Army (excluding commissioned regular Army men) the same amount of pay. If married make allowance for that. In this everyone would feel better. Leadership in ranks is to be considered on highly trained men, should do this regardless of monetary gain, to win the War. [paragraph] Give more men the opportunity to obtain a commission in the Army. Eliminate the outright giving of commissions. [paragraph] Have officers give a little more thought to personal requests than most of them do.
S64.Q97.Full: There is one thing that I am sure would help end this War a lot sooner, and that is compel the civilian population to put more effort in their work. A soldier gives up all when he enters the service, while a civilian [underline] (not all) [/underline] cares only for his or her personal gain. This pertains to most of them. (OVER) Another thing that should be done is compel civilian drivers to give lifts to Service men if they have no one in their cars. Please understand that I don't mean to drunken soldiers or such other offenders. But, if they are going any distance at all. Pick up a service-man. [paragraph] Give every man in the Army (excluding commissioned regular Army men) the same amount of pay. If married make allowance for that. In this everyone would feel better. Leadership in ranks is to be considered on highly trained men, should do this regardless of monetary gain, to win the War. [paragraph] Give more men the opportunity to obtain a commission in the Army. Eliminate the outright giving of commissions. [paragraph] Have officers give a little more thought to personal requests than most of them do.

S64.Q97.C_1: 97 cont. about the Noncoms. Most of them get there rating by work they other part know the right man. About the training you get your need some of it some of it you don't because when you are in war zone you will be in a fox hole on your belly trying to get in one. Of course the chow could be better in some places could use fresh food instead of can good the cans would taste good over ??
