document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: Lets get it over with as soon as possible so we can go home to our love ones.
S64.Q97.Full: Lets get it over with as soon as possible so we can go home to our love ones.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Passes authorized by higher authority should not be cut down by Battalion Commanders or Battery commanders. [paragraph] Desert Training should not be given troops unless they will do desert fighting. Training troops in deserts + sending them to severely cold climates shows lack of intelligent training schedules for different war fronts.
S64.Q97.C_1: 97 cont. Non Coms should be punished the same as privates in regards to AWOL or having trouble with MP's Ratings should be given to those qualified as soon as the show they can handle their job. Waiting until an outfit packs up to go overseas befor getting his rating makes the non com feel he is getting it because they are allowed so many in the battery & not because he is worthy of it.
S64.Q97.Full: Passes authorized by higher authority should not be cut down by Battalion Commanders or Battery commanders. [paragraph] Desert Training should not be given troops unless they will do desert fighting. Training troops in deserts + sending them to severely cold climates shows lack of intelligent training schedules for different war fronts. 97 cont. Non Coms should be punished the same as privates in regards to AWOL or having trouble with MP's Ratings should be given to those qualified as soon as the show they can handle their job. Waiting until an outfit packs up to go overseas befor getting his rating makes the non com feel he is getting it because they are allowed so many in the battery & not because he is worthy of it.

S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: it would make me take a lot more attention to my work if I could go home and see my wife and family I havent seen them since I been in the service I been in going on 11 months I woud like to get and furlous and then go away.
S64.Q97.Full: it would make me take a lot more attention to my work if I could go home and see my wife and family I havent seen them since I been in the service I been in going on 11 months I woud like to get and furlous and then go away.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: It is unfair for various branches of service in the army to get lengthy furloughs, and a number of them at that, while others get a very few if any. A standard rule should be set up so as to make all equal. The Navy can do it, why an't the army. This is one of the main 'gripes' and one of the chief reasons for awol. Remedy this and a cure for awol will result.
S64.Q97.Full: It is unfair for various branches of service in the army to get lengthy furloughs, and a number of them at that, while others get a very few if any. A standard rule should be set up so as to make all equal. The Navy can do it, why an't the army. This is one of the main 'gripes' and one of the chief reasons for awol. Remedy this and a cure for awol will result.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M_marginalia: Things are a lot worse for my wife.
S64.Q97.F: Someone with authority should inspect the individual soldiers for clothing (for fit and appearance). Even if his clothes look allright he doesn't get a proud feeling seeing another soldier "[unclear] outfit [/unclear] ." [paragraph] In order to keep his family ties, especially married men, he should be either given a furlough, [underline] at [/underline] [underline] least [/underline] every 6 months, or a home, job, and
S64.Q97.C_1: transportation should be furnished his wife near his post to enable him to see her occasionally. [paragraph) Officers should try to outdo their men in everything ([underline] including [/underline] ) going without. On manoeuvres I saw an officer drink milk when his men were short of water and on 'C' rations'. Officers also do too much "pleasure driving" in jeeps on manoeuvres. [paragraph] Every defence plant should have one ex-service"man" in every 10 or 15 to see and do something about "slowdowns". Every soldier I know wants to get this over as soon as possible, but he's not so sure everything possible is being done about it.
S64.Q97.Full: Someone with authority should inspect the individual soldiers for clothing (for fit and appearance). Even if his clothes look allright he doesn't get a proud feeling seeing another soldier "[unclear] outfit [/unclear] ." [paragraph] In order to keep his family ties, especially married men, he should be either given a furlough, [underline] at [/underline] [underline] least [/underline] every 6 months, or a home, job, and transportation should be furnished his wife near his post to enable him to see her occasionally. [paragraph) Officers should try to outdo their men in everything ([underline] including [/underline] ) going without. On manoeuvres I saw an officer drink milk when his men were short of water and on 'C' rations'. Officers also do too much "pleasure driving" in jeeps on manoeuvres. [paragraph] Every defence plant should have one ex-service"man" in every 10 or 15 to see and do something about "slowdowns". Every soldier I know wants to get this over as soon as possible, but he's not so sure everything possible is being done about it.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Well this out fit is in bad shape and the Morale is very low. The men should have at least a 1.5 day furlough and the out fit should be moved to some other camp or go over seas or bust it up.
S64.Q97.Full: Well this out fit is in bad shape and the Morale is very low. The men should have at least a 1.5 day furlough and the out fit should be moved to some other camp or go over seas or bust it up.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: Only kick I have if they would give me a furlough every six I could soldier a lot better an like the army much more. With the few furloughs you get you can't blame a man for going AWOL [Absent Without Official Leave] .
S64.Q97.Full: Only kick I have if they would give me a furlough every six I could soldier a lot better an like the army much more. With the few furloughs you get you can't blame a man for going AWOL [Absent Without Official Leave] .

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: My subject is that the army would be all [deletion] [/deletion] right if i could [deletion] [/deletion] get a furlow to go see my people before i go a cross the waters. I wish they could see to it that we would.
S64.Q97.Full: My subject is that the army would be all [deletion] [/deletion] right if i could [deletion] [/deletion] get a furlow to go see my people before i go a cross the waters. I wish they could see to it that we would.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: If only I could see any family and kin [unclear] ????? [/unclear] I would be well satisfy. But the way it been very hard for one and any family. if they would give a soldier a chance to go home every once in a while it will make him feel better and would try to be a better soldier.
S64.Q97.Full: If only I could see any family and kin [unclear] ????? [/unclear] I would be well satisfy. But the way it been very hard for one and any family. if they would give a soldier a chance to go home every once in a while it will make him feel better and would try to be a better soldier.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I have one remark on mass punishment. When one man does some offence why do they insist on leaving him go and punish a hundred men or more for his offence. I think that should be remedied in some way.
S64.Q97.Full: I have one remark on mass punishment. When one man does some offence why do they insist on leaving him go and punish a hundred men or more for his offence. I think that should be remedied in some way.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I think the fact that we can't get any clothes from the quartermaster is a thing that brings down the morale very much. Another thing is no furlough for us to go home.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the fact that we can't get any clothes from the quartermaster is a thing that brings down the morale very much. Another thing is no furlough for us to go home.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: In regards to question 75 - Being a non comm [non commissioned] is no pleasure & we can't ask our Jr. Comm Officers why [underscored twice] as it is rather difficult to answer the enlisted men. [paragraph] Ques 81 - By now I realize it comes down channels & the only one we can blame is top man in our Battalion. I think if he were more closely examined he
S64.Q97.C_1: would prove a failure. Instead he's smart enough to put on a big front for Inspecting Generals. [paragraph] Ques 92. Most of the A.W.O.L.'s have plenty of reason - being: Some men who weren't on the ball have had their furloughs canceled + some who had a furlough didn't have enough time to get home + we only had 6 days flat. I didn't enjoy mine because I couldn't get home. [paragraph] Ques. 96. I want to be a soldier but things at home bother me. My father is trying to keep the farm going by himself which took 3 of us to do - yet we were busy. I feel now that I have completed my training (As much as they intend us to have) I'm more valuable at home, by far, than I am in the Army. I don't think drafting is fair either. My father has 3 sons in Service where other families under the same circumstance have none in most cases.
S64.Q97.Full: In regards to question 75 - Being a non comm [non commissioned] is no pleasure & we can't ask our Jr. Comm Officers why [underscored twice] as it is rather difficult to answer the enlisted men. [paragraph] Ques 81 - By now I realize it comes down channels & the only one we can blame is top man in our Battalion. I think if he were more closely examined he  would prove a failure. Instead he's smart enough to put on a big front for Inspecting Generals. [paragraph] Ques 92. Most of the A.W.O.L.'s have plenty of reason - being: Some men who weren't on the ball have had their furloughs canceled + some who had a furlough didn't have enough time to get home + we only had 6 days flat. I didn't enjoy mine because I couldn't get home. [paragraph] Ques. 96. I want to be a soldier but things at home bother me. My father is trying to keep the farm going by himself which took 3 of us to do - yet we were busy. I feel now that I have completed my training (As much as they intend us to have) I'm more valuable at home, by far, than I am in the Army. I don't think drafting is fair either. My father has 3 sons in Service where other families under the same circumstance have none in most cases.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: The armies of the world are made up of human beings the same as you and I. When conditions become such that it is no longer possible to live as humans. Every one may just as well go all out and live as animals for a while untill they are willing to settle down and let each person have his share of living.
S64.Q97.C_1: 97 cont. as an individual I don't like war. We had a chance to stop all wars with the "League of Nations" But mo the people that we elected into office were so narrow minded they thought only of themselves. But now that we are into it we should make the best of it we can and see this thing through and not make the same mistake again.
S64.Q97.Full: The armies of the world are made up of human beings the same as you and I. When conditions become such that it is no longer possible to live as humans. Every one may just as well go all out and live as animals for a while untill they are willing to settle down and let each person have his share of living. 97 cont. as an individual I don't like war. We had a chance to stop all wars with the "League of Nations" But mo the people that we elected into office were so narrow minded they thought only of themselves. But now that we are into it we should make the best of it we can and see this thing through and not make the same mistake again.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I like the army quirt [quite] well I am staying till the war is over to get some training and see if I can find a job in civilian life when I go back and protect my parent from all evil and so I am staying in this army because it is a good place to stay for a man to learn every [unclear] task [/unclear] of life itself and I am staying.
S64.Q97.C_1: I know this war won't last very long for hitler [Hitler] is soon to be defeated and so is Japan and so thats why I am staying have to learn to defeat the enemy and fight for sweet life [paragraph] For a man has to protect himself from all evil and all enemy.
S64.Q97.Full: I like the army quirt [quite] well I am staying till the war is over to get some training and see if I can find a job in civilian life when I go back and protect my parent from all evil and so I am staying in this army because it is a good place to stay for a man to learn every [unclear] task [/unclear] of life itself and I am staying. I know this war won't last very long for hitler [Hitler] is soon to be defeated and so is Japan and so thats why I am staying have to learn to defeat the enemy and fight for sweet life [paragraph] For a man has to protect himself from all evil and all enemy.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Well I have been in the army nearly 11 mos [months] & I have had only one furlough which was 7 days & that wasn't time for me to go home & see the folks & friends which I would like to see.
S64.Q97.Full: Well I have been in the army nearly 11 mos [months] & I have had only one furlough which was 7 days & that wasn't time for me to go home & see the folks & friends which I would like to see.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q97.F: The war took me as far away from home as possible and to still keep me in the U.S.A. for training, I don't think this is necessary, as it is too hard for to adjust your life to the life of such a change in people, and in climate, i think preliminary training would be much better accomplished if the rookie were kept closer to his nativity.
S64.Q97.Full: The war took me as far away from home as possible and to still keep me in the U.S.A. for training, I don't think this is necessary, as it is too hard for to adjust your life to the life of such a change in people, and in climate, i think preliminary training would be much better accomplished if the rookie were kept closer to his nativity.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: Think the biggest mistake the U.S. Army makes in training corps is making non com's [non-commissioned officers] from the ranks in the Btns [Battalions] . Would be a lot better disciplined if they were [deletion] shipped [/deletion] made up in one outfit and shipped to another.
S64.Q97.Full: Think the biggest mistake the U.S. Army makes in training corps is making non com's [non-commissioned officers] from the ranks in the Btns [Battalions] . Would be a lot better disciplined if they were [deletion] shipped [/deletion] made up in one outfit and shipped to another.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I fully believe that there are a good many men in the service not giving their best and could be of more use in defense work. Men due to age, men of ability that have been taken out of their jobs in civilian work. Farms have been hard put for help due to the drafting of men. There has been a lack of judgement in the choice of army material.
S64.Q97.Full: I fully believe that there are a good many men in the service not giving their best and could be of more use in defense work. Men due to age, men of ability that have been taken out of their jobs in civilian work. Farms have been hard put for help due to the drafting of men. There has been a lack of judgement in the choice of army material.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I would like a furlough as the one I had was only six days. I could not get home in this length of time so I came back to camp at the end of three days.[paragraph] I think every soldier should get the chance to see his folks once or twice a year.
S64.Q97.Full: I would like a furlough as the one I had was only six days. I could not get home in this length of time so I came back to camp at the end of three days.[paragraph] I think every soldier should get the chance to see his folks once or twice a year.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page, A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: I have been in the Army for 9 months and was given a six day leave which was counted as a furlough. My opinion of a furlough was the least of 12 days or fifteen (15). I haven't seen my folks since the day I left for the Army. If morale is to be kept up in our outfit, I believe something should be done now or they will have AWOL's by the
S64.Q97.C_1: Our battalion seems to have a hard time replacing clothing, especially fatigue clothes; some of our boys look plenty ragged.
S64.Q97.Full: I have been in the Army for 9 months and was given a six day leave which was counted as a furlough. My opinion of a furlough was the least of 12 days or fifteen (15). I haven't seen my folks since the day I left for the Army. If morale is to be kept up in our outfit, I believe something should be done now or they will have AWOL's by the  Our battalion seems to have a hard time replacing clothing, especially fatigue clothes; some of our boys look plenty ragged.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think the out fits should be moved around more for we get tired of the same old thing day in and out. [paragraph] I think we should get to go home for two weeks each year if not more. [paragraph] I think a man should be graded for what he knows, not by friendship.
S64.Q97.C_1: I think we should have better dress clothing or some kind of outfit for use in our half tracks. [paragraph] I think we have too many insections [inspections] and should have more time for games while on this side. I think the desert tires men down and don't do much for the equipment.
S64.Q97.Full: I think the out fits should be moved around more for we get tired of the same old thing day in and out. [paragraph] I think we should get to go home for two weeks each year if not more. [paragraph] I think a man should be graded for what he knows, not by friendship. I think we should have better dress clothing or some kind of outfit for use in our half tracks. [paragraph] I think we have too many insections [inspections] and should have more time for games while on this side. I think the desert tires men down and don't do much for the equipment.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q95.M_marginalia: [underline] furloughs [/underline] When I get a furlough I would like to go home.
S64.Q96.M_marginalia: My father left my mother ans sister. I mother and little sister live alone.
S64.Q97.F: I feel the government should have more interest in our folks who we left behind. That is why I am here. I consider my mother and sister worth fighting for. It's useless to make remarks in the Army. I think every soldier should get to spend 3 days at home every 6 months.
S64.Q97.Full: I feel the government should have more interest in our folks who we left behind. That is why I am here. I consider my mother and sister worth fighting for. It's useless to make remarks in the Army. I think every soldier should get to spend 3 days at home every 6 months.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q97.F: The C.O. [Commanding Officer] of Battery D has it in for me. I can't get a pass, never could. He gives me to much extra duty. I have done more K.P. [Kitchen patrol] than any thing else. As long as I have so much K.P. to do I don't want to be a soldier. We can't get furloughs. The C.O. is unfair. He has to many favorites. He tells me I am no good, that I have a warped mind.
S64.Q97.C_1: we don't have but about 30 privates in our battery and they have to do all of the K.P. [kitchen patrol] and Guard.
S64.Q97.Full: The C.O. [Commanding Officer] of Battery D has it in for me. I can't get a pass, never could. He gives me to much extra duty. I have done more K.P. [Kitchen patrol] than any thing else. As long as I have so much K.P. to do I don't want to be a soldier. We can't get furloughs. The C.O. is unfair. He has to many favorites. He tells me I am no good, that I have a warped mind.  we don't have but about 30 privates in our battery and they have to do all of the K.P. [kitchen patrol] and Guard.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I have only had a six day furlough and other outfits in this same camp are getting ten to fifteen days. The commanding officer is very contrary and will not give us the chances that we deserve. I should be given a better chance at studying radio, for I feel that I could make good at it.
S64.Q97.Full: I have only had a six day furlough and other outfits in this same camp are getting ten to fifteen days. The commanding officer is very contrary and will not give us the chances that we deserve. I should be given a better chance at studying radio, for I feel that I could make good at it.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: The army should be able to give the men at least one 15 day furlough every 6 months and all we ever received is one 7 day and we can't even reach home and get back in that small amount of time.
S64.Q97.Full: The army should be able to give the men at least one 15 day furlough every 6 months and all we ever received is one 7 day and we can't even reach home and get back in that small amount of time.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97)
S64.Q95.M: Yes, I have had my fair share of both furloughs and passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q96.M_marginalia: [deletion] [Don't know] [/deletion] have not been home for over a [underline] year [/underline]
S64.Q97.F: The question about, what should we do with Japan - if it were to offer peace - I think Japan should not be giving that chance after what that country did to Pearl Harbor.
S64.Q97.Full: The question about, what should we do with Japan - if it were to offer peace - I think Japan should not be giving that chance after what that country did to Pearl Harbor.

document_type: A document that contains three questions (Q.95, Q.96 and Q.97), A continuation page
S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: I think each man should have a furlough to go home for two weeks every year. And if the could give him more time at home, I think they should give it to him. Because I think it wold make a much better soldier out of him, and give him how to
S64.Q97.C_1: swing about
S64.Q97.Full: I think each man should have a furlough to go home for two weeks every year. And if the could give him more time at home, I think they should give it to him. Because I think it wold make a much better soldier out of him, and give him how to swing about

S64.Q95.M: I have had my fair share of passes but not furloughs
S64.Q97.F: not getting a furlough to go home and having to walk gassed & pulling K.P. with I Cpl. rattings
S64.Q97.Full: not getting a furlough to go home and having to walk gassed & pulling K.P. with I Cpl. rattings

S64.Q95.M: No, I have not had my fair share of either furloughs or passes
S64.Q96.M: Things are a little better, but not much
S64.Q97.F: I think if men of the army had more furloughs they would be a lot better men than they are, there would ([underline] not [/underline] ) be so many awol's; if they would give a man a furlough once in a while to my opinion that is the reason there is so many awol's, if a man keeps his mind on home and cannot go home once in a while he ([underline] will not [/underline] ) pay attention to his work. That is the main reason so many men go awol, also in some batteries over
S64.Q97.C_1: There is [underline] not [/underline] enough promotions being made. The non comes [non-commissioned officers] and the officers pay no attention to the pvts [privates] at all, and the pvt [private] sometimes knows just as much as a segent [sergeant] I think the pvts [privates] of the army deserve more attinion [attention] than they have been getting. I would like to get into the air corps as a airiel [aerial] machine gunner I have been on a machine gun now for 10 months and have not made a rating yet I feel sure I could do much better for our Country if I could get into the air corps as airiel [aerial] machine gunner, just asked the men in the 195th who wants to vollunter [volunteer] into the air corp as airiel [aerial] machine gunner and Ill be in that bunch I can assure you of that.

That is the main reason so many men go awol, also in some batteries over    There is [underline] not [/underline] enough promotions being made. The non comes [non-commissioned officers] and the officers pay no attention to the pvts [privates] at all, and the pvt [private] sometimes knows just as much as a segent [sergeant] I think the pvts [privates] of the army deserve more attinion [attention] than they have been getting. I would like to get into the air corps as a airiel [aerial] machine gunner I have been on a machine gun now for 10 months and have not made a rating yet I feel sure I could do much better for our Country if I could get into the air corps as airiel [aerial] machine gunner, just asked the men in the 195th who wants to vollunter [volunteer] into the air corp as airiel [aerial] machine gunner and Ill be in that bunch I can assure you of that.
